667948106.name: Beautiful, even when in the cold water!
667948106.author: a TripAdvisor user
667948106.reviewBody: The road up was something else, us seniors had body aches for days! But the falls are so pretty and the hike to the top easier than it looked.If you go make sure your guide gives you a mud mask!

664389590.name: Beautiful place must see
664389590.author: a TripAdvisor user
664389590.reviewBody: We did the tour to the Mountains it was one of the unique experiences!! Great visit with the local people as well got to see nature,coffee and mango plantations on the way to the falls.\n

663873339.name: Best tour EVER!
663873339.author: a TripAdvisor user
663873339.reviewBody: We had the great fortune of having ROBERTO SIMI from MAXI TOURS, a passionate, knowledgeable, informative, patient, great driver who went to great lengths to show us his country, his people and of course, THE FALLS!!! LOVED IT

656789684.name: Stunning
656789684.author: a TripAdvisor user
656789684.reviewBody: We travel quite a bit and have seen amazing falls in th USA and abroad. We hired a private driver who took us to the falls. It was a  few pesos more but well worth the trip. It took about 90 minutes to get there. Along the way are beautiful mountain views.  It was 60 pesos each to go in. I had seen photos but as soon as we came upon the first pool I was memorized at the beauty of the water. I got in immediately. It reminded me of our state\'s spring fed rivers. The falls kept going up. Ropes were tied together to assist you. The pools were deep and refreshing. We had it to ourselves outside of one other couple for a hour or so. Awesome. Get a cheap cooler and take along some drinks and snacks. Absolutely must do. Some said the roads were bumpy..not bad at all and I recently had 3 back surgeries. The last 5km were the worse. I can\'t wait to go back. I have tons of pics but you need to see it for yourself.

651135197.name: A Must-Visit in Huatulco, Oaxaca.
651135197.author: a TripAdvisor user
651135197.reviewBody: A unique local experience driving up and hiking up to the Falls with our private tour guide.  You see the life of Mexican locals living in the mountain, the coffee and cocoa plantations, the agave, the cinnamon, papaya, and banana trees. A truly traveller\'s experience, away from the touristy beach resorts. Highly recommended.

649007613.name: Fun and interesting day tour from Huatulco
649007613.author: a TripAdvisor user
649007613.reviewBody: When staying in Huatulco, I highly recommend taking the fun and interesting day tour up to the "cascadas magicas" (magical waterfalls) up in the nearby mountains. Even though the ride can be a bit bumpy on the mostly-gravel road to the falls, it\'s definitely worth it given everything you get to see and do. Our tour included a stop at a road-side venue where locals give a demonstration on making chocolate and mezcal, as well as all sorts of other natural medicinal remedies for every ailment imaginable. We also stopped for a tasty meal at a farm called "La Gloria" which was nice. But the main event for the day is swimming in the turquoise-colored waterfalls and climbing up the rocks to get to each successively higher pool. Thankfully, the rocks are not slick, which makes it much safer than it initially looks. All in all, a very fun day and an inexpensive excursion you should plan to enjoy during your time in the Huatulco area.

646142011.name: A day tour well worth it!
646142011.author: a TripAdvisor user
646142011.reviewBody: Very informative tour guide that gave us so much information.  We loved the waterfalls, hiking & mud facial.  Excellent time had by all.  We were in a small group of 10.

644403736.name: Magic Falls
644403736.author: a TripAdvisor user
644403736.reviewBody: Fantastic excursion.  Get to see a bit of the countryside and the falls and river are great.  Cost was $400 pesos per person and that included transportation and lunch.  Book in town rather than from the hotels as they mark up the price a tremendously.  It is really not that far but the road is rough in places and slow going. Lots of fun swinging on the rope.  \nGreat day.

643607801.name: Waterfall Tour
643607801.author: a TripAdvisor user
643607801.reviewBody: We took a tour with Maxi Tours on January 2nd, 2019.  It was myself and my husband, our kids had no interest, so they stayed back with grandma and grandpa.  This trip was definitely worth it.  There is a long drive to the first set of falls, however we had an excellent tour guide who kept us entertained the entire time.  The falls are breath taking and refreshing to jump in with the hot weather.  I\u2019d recommend this to anyone!  Some of the falls have some difficult climbing areas so I\u2019d be cautious taking younger kids!

642253612.name: Better to hire a local guide
642253612.author: a TripAdvisor user
642253612.reviewBody: Although our guide was local he worked for the tour company and we were traveling with a dozen other people ranging in age. The trip was cool though, we felt a bit rushed, could have stayed a little longer. Pack some beers or beverages of your choice as the tour company only provides 250ml plastic water bottles and there\u2019s nowhere to dispose of them. When we got there there were children selling candy and beer, which I bought because I believe in supporting local entrepreneurs no matter what the age, the beers however were less than cold. We also stopped at the local medicine man which was informative and entertaining, we bought coffee and Mezcal, neither of which were any good. Next time I\u2019d hire a local guide for the same price and skip the coffee

640864830.name: A nice "cool" tour.
640864830.author: a TripAdvisor user
640864830.reviewBody: went with Maxi Tours, Raciel was our guide.  Love how the tours help the communities along the way.  This was one of our favorites.

639828663.name: Nice falls
639828663.author: a TripAdvisor user
639828663.reviewBody: It was a long trip, bad dusty roads. The guide stopped in a little town where they sell organic coffee, chocolate, honey and mescal drinks (they just accept cash). They gave us some tasting. They are really good. Finally we got to the falls. Please bring mosquito repellent (lot of black flies) water shoes and camera. There are many water falls. Each one is pretty. The blue water is cold!! but refreshing because is really hot. There are no restaurants in the area unless you are with a tour (food is included). Food was very nice. There are bathrooms but bring toilet paper juts in case.

638614025.name: Great day trip
638614025.author: a TripAdvisor user
638614025.reviewBody: Worth the trip, will pay 50 pesos each if going on your own. long drive but we found it with Google maps with our rental car

636375728.name: Nothing Spectacular
636375728.author: a TripAdvisor user
636375728.reviewBody: It\'s a hual on a bumpy, dusty, dirt road to get there & not really worth the four hour round trip.  Take insect repellant.  The mosquitos will eat you alive.

636061871.name: BEAUTIFUL
636061871.author: a TripAdvisor user
636061871.reviewBody: The ride to the falls is a bit rough, but full of culture! Once at the falls, our guide took us up and gave us ample time to swim, swing on the rope swing and take pictures. Afterwards, we had a traditional Oaxacan lunch, which was so good. Our guide, Oscar, with West Coast Tours/Amstar, was the best around!

635057768.name: Great time
635057768.author: a TripAdvisor user
635057768.reviewBody:
This is the best activity in this area. It takes really long to go there ~2,5h. I would not recommend to rent car for this activity. Roads are really bad unless you rent jeep!
Water in waterfall isn’t warm, but it is a great time. 
You can go into the small cave in waterfall, which is small, but interesting.
With a tour you also get lunch and it is simple lunch. Nothing special.

This is all day activity.

634896498.name: Wonderful falls, a fun swim and a great lunch!
634896498.author: a TripAdvisor user
634896498.reviewBody: Aida, our lunch host at La Palapa Cascadas Magicas was a very kind host  and she offered a delicious lunch.  She has 3 palapas that she rents out and the one we saw had a gorgeous view of the water.  The room was lovely and her property is amazing.  It would be a great place for a yoga retreat (she is also a yoga teacher)

634464252.name: Highlight of trip to Huatulco
634464252.author: a TripAdvisor user
634464252.reviewBody: Booked a tour with Transat Holidays. It was a windy and slightly terrifying ride up the mountains, but the hike and falls were wonderful and I am so glad we visited.

633016497.name: A major highlight of our stay
633016497.author: a TripAdvisor user
633016497.reviewBody: We stubbornly took our rental car up here rather than a tour, the road is hairy and the signage is non existent but on our third try we got to La Cascadas and was absolutely worth the effort. Chrystal clear refreshing water, breathtaking beauty, my wifes smile made it an unforgettable day for me. I would not attempt during rainy season,we went in March and truly had an unforgettable day

624778925.name: Really cool experience
624778925.author: a TripAdvisor user
624778925.reviewBody: If your into nature and water falls, they are awesome. Long ride to arrive but well worth it.  Of you like adventure and outdoors dont liss this one!!

617099129.name: Wow, don\u2019t miss this excursion!
617099129.author: a TripAdvisor user
617099129.reviewBody: Long rough ride but well worth the ride.  Beautiful Scenery and lots of things to see.  Only thing is you have to be able to walk and cover rough terrain.  I personally have leg problem and it was tough.  The waterfalls ate amazing as well as the rope and fall into water, see pic.  Well worth the long day.

602402223.name: Long trip but rewarding visit
602402223.author: a TripAdvisor user
602402223.reviewBody: It was a lovely rural road deep into the oaxacan tropical forest to find the Copalita River and its magical falls. You will not regret this natural environment and the cool bath as you get to the falls.

584325175.name: a total adventure!
584325175.author: a TripAdvisor user
584325175.reviewBody: OK- so this was a crazy adventure. We didn\'t go on a hired trip, and instead drove our rental car there. We wore the heck out of our tiny economy rental, and looking back- getting a larger car or jeep would have been ideal for this trip (though we saw plenty of tour buses make the journey) the drive itself takes a bit longer than expected because of the roads (which can be scary- some paved, some dirt, lots of severe inclines and sharp turns) but the towns you drive through are very cool and welcoming. Just go slow, and try not to white knuckle it. We ended up picking up a guide from one of the many outposts along the way (you\'ll see guys with lanyards holding up a laminated tour sheet) which was not something we had ever done before!  He was super friendly and helpful he didn\'t speak any English, but clearly worked for the parks department and was super cool and helpful. No bad vibes at all, and he seemed to genuinely care about showing us around. Theodoro knew all of the native flora and fauna, and took us on a truly magical tour of the many waterfalls here, even swimming with us and taking us up the many waterfalls. it was an amazing experience and so worth it. We didn\'t pay him either- only tipped him generously at the end and had a great friend for the day. the water is super cold and refreshing- but you do need water shoes.  (barefoot is ok too- just not as safe as it is pretty slippery). There are 2 bathrooms along the road- both are 5 pesos each and have tour guides waiting.

578847315.name: Refreshing amazing  buts its  a hike wear runners .
578847315.author: a TripAdvisor user
578847315.reviewBody:
We went to a coffee plantation had great fun good food there are washroom and markets to buy gifts and coffee.

It is alot of walking so it's for people in shape. 
If your dealing with pregnancy heart lung issues it may not be the tour for you. 

Clean water cool they stop do you can buy medical dried plants best honey in the world.
Also mezcal like tequilas but organic no chemicals used.
Amazing flavor.

576911140.name: Beautiful Waterfall
576911140.author: a TripAdvisor user
576911140.reviewBody: Whenever we travel we always look for a waterfall and this fall was easy to get to and beautiful.  We had a delicious meal after swimming for a bit.

574753998.name: Beautiful falls, and an AMAZING lunch.
574753998.author: a TripAdvisor user
574753998.reviewBody:
This trip took about 6ish hours and out tour guide Joseph was very honest and said right up front that the drive would take 2.5hrs to get to the falls over some rough roads. We traveled deep into the mountain jungle and made a stop at a road side store where we met a great guy named Rene, we bought some Mezcal and tried some other items that we found very cool.

After a long ride we got to the falls and they were beautiful. After the falls we went to a family owned coffee plantation where I had the best meal hands down in Mexico! We had fire oven roasted pork with rice and black beans, fresh made tortillas, macaroni salad and chicken mole. All I can say is WOW so much flavor just great. Our drink was  hibiscus tea which also was delish. 

Over all I would say If not for the meal and the stop at the road side store I would probably not travel so far to see some falls, but I am glad we went.

573161262.name: Beautiful and Refreshing!
573161262.author: a TripAdvisor user
573161262.reviewBody: The falls are beautiful but the road is quite sketchy going in and out. We had a great time and I think you should experience it but I wouldn\'t recommend doing it on your own- do a tour!

573094144.name: Awesome Experience
573094144.author: a TripAdvisor user
573094144.reviewBody: It is definitely worth going at least once.  The drive up is a bit longer than most tour guides say but if you get a good guide talking all the way it makes the drive seem not as long.  If you go, Please Please stop at that local grocery store and pick up some large bags of dry dog food.  There are so many starving dogs that we saw and our guide said that the people just can\'t afford to feed them.  My heart is still wrenching after seeing so many of these poor starving loyal animals.  We are Seniors and we didn\'t find the walk too bad.  The view of the falls is breathtaking and great spots to take a dip yourself.  Bring water shoes.  Can I just stress one more time to PLEASE bring food for the starving dogs.

572332081.name: Magic Falls is truly magical.
572332081.author: a TripAdvisor user
572332081.reviewBody: It is so worth it going here. Absolutely beautiful. But when you do, you must choose a tour guide that goes out of their way to ensure you enjoy the best experience.  We found one.

570015332.name: Very fun!!
570015332.author: a TripAdvisor user
570015332.reviewBody: Love the water falls . It\'s a good experience .it takes a litter long to get there but it\'s fun to do at least once

568522086.name: Difficult walk
568522086.author: a TripAdvisor user
568522086.reviewBody: The end result is a day out of paradise but it is a long and difficult walk. Be aware. The falls are right out of the movies. And it is a sSfe trip

568511967.name: WILD !  Glad we read Trip Advisor reviews before going.
568511967.author: a TripAdvisor user
568511967.reviewBody: We had a good time because we knew to expect problematic roads and some scary driving.   Everyone was patient on our 8am trek. We met few cars/vans on the way since we left before the tour vans...[pro-tip #1].... also, you\'ll lose cell signal..... so download the google map before you leave....and watch for small signs to reassure yourselves that you are on the right gravel road which is paved in spots and cobblestone in some areas.... we made it from Crucecita to the cascadas in 70 minutes. Back home in 80 min, driving a minivan.  While there we had a blast on the trails and playing in the water... clean!   Our dog loved it too....Mascotas are welcome!   Cost 70 pesos pet person.

568318256.name: Interesting falls, terrible ATV tour
568318256.author: a TripAdvisor user
568318256.reviewBody:
So my wife asked me to hold off on writing this review for a week to see if I would cool down a little and be more calm.  Not so much.

I do want to point out first of all that this excursion is not fun – it is extremely dirty and dusty – so much so that there are points in the drive where you cannot see the ATV in front of you through the dust.  So do not take anything that you care about – sunglasses, clothes, backpack, shoes, etc – the dirt doesn’t come out.  My sunglasses have been ruined – it’s like they’ve been sandblasted.  My backpack had dust inside it, so my cell phone and camera were dusty.

The “road”, “trail”, “path” or whatever they call it up to the falls is dangerous – there are holes, gullies, cuts, construction, animals, no guardrails, 50 metre cliffs, etc.  You do not have an opportunity to take in the scenery because the trail is so dangerous.  And finally, the machinery – the ATVs are poorly cared for – the brakes are suspect, the tires are balding and mechanical pieces were hanging off the bottom and dragging in the dirt beneath two of our 5 ATVs.  Some of them were so old, beaten and mis-used; we could barely go 2 kilometres without having them stall out, so we’d have to stop to pour water over the sensors because they were overheating.

If you are contemplating taking this trip, beware that the instruction is poor or misleading – if you are not very familiar with ATVs, I do not suggest trying it.  The “instructor” – Denis –  talked about snow and ice and bears more than he told us how to use the brakes and throttle or how to drive an ATV.  His long explanation on how to change gears was ridiculous – so much so that those in our group driving with automatic transmissions thought that the rear brake was the gear lever.  The sum total on driving instruction was driving.  He talked about it for 5 or 10 minutes, made us sign a waiver and we got on our machines and left.

On the trip, about 5 kilometers into the drive, my wife, who I was following, braked on a downhill (I saw her brake light come on), and her machine jerked to the left, didn’t slow down (the brake light was on the whole time), and proceeded to drive her off a 60 or 70 foot cliff.  Thankfully, she had the presence of mind to jump off at the last second and she caught the lip of the cliff with her hands or else she would have gone over too.

The second guide and I were able to help her up and alert the others.  They ran back as a tour bus (from the same company, coincidentally), arrived.  The first thing Denis said as he arrived was, “that’s why they shouldn’t allow beginners on this tour.”  Very nice.  With the help of some of the tourists, we were able to push the ATV out from the bottom of the gully, back onto the road.  There was damage to the transmission but my wife wasn’t too keen on continuing the tour anyway.  But Denis’ quick check of the mechanicals determined that the ATV had been perfectly safe and that the cause of the accident was driver error.  (Yes this is sarcasm).  The tour bus driver offered to take my wife the rest of the way to the falls.  At no point was there any medical assistance or supplies offered – they had none.

We finished the tour up and walked to the falls – my wife was in obvious pain and still bleeding, with some pretty significant bruises already appearing.  The bus driver got her a shot of Mescal at the top, that’s it.  She washed herself off in the river.

None of us in our group were too keen on driving back, given how crappy the conditions were and how poorly the machines were maintained, but we didn’t have much choice.  When we arrived at the final checkpoint, I was informed by Denis that my wife’s machine had been picked up and taken to the local ATV dealership.  Given that my wife was on a separate bus, I said that I did not want to deal with that right now and I wanted to see my wife, back at our resort.  I made that quite clear.  Nonetheless, our pick up bus stopped at the dealership where we were met by a Paradiso Huatulo company representative and the company lawyer.  They presented me with a repair quote (interesting that they quoted without having a key to start the machine (Denis had it in his pocket when we arrived)).  It was pretty apparent that they wanted me to pay immediately because the company representative arrived with a credit card machine in her hand and told me how much I had to pay.

When I said no, take me back to the resort, the lawyer threatened to keep me in the country and they all continued to press me to pay.  Eventually they allowed the bus driver to take us to the resort, where the company representative and the lawyer ganged up on me again.  One of my friends had to get the manager of the hotel to intervene and to force them to agree to a meeting the next morning.

The next morning, the lawyer handed both my wife and I an order, signed by the local police, forbidding us from leaving Mexico.  It also indicated that we were to appear in court the next afternoon (we were schedule to leave the next morning).  They brought the same repair quote from the night before – no additional examination of the machine had occurred, so it was obvious that this amount was a complete fabrication.

To make peace and to not have to spend our final day in a legal meeting, after an hour of very heated arguing, I offered to pay half of the quote – that we would accept half of the issue, if they accepted their half.  They said no.  After another ½ hour, we agreed to an amount and I paid, once the rep. was able to come up with the credit card machine.  It took another 10 hours and two visits from the lawyer to come up with the release form, allowing us to leave – he was able to spell our names correctly to keep us in the country, but couldn’t seem to spell them to allow us out.

Overall, this was an absolutely terrible experience.  The injuries, the literal possible death or severe injury to my wife, the legal repercussions and pressure, the trail conditions, the instruction, the equipment were all ghastly.  I frankly could not imagine a worse experience while on holiday.

I hope that I have been clear - DO NOT TAKE THIS TOUR.

566349534.name: Magic Falls (Emerald Falls?)
566349534.author: a TripAdvisor user
566349534.reviewBody: What a beautiful destination!  Little falls become medium falls and culminate into huge falls!  And the water is crystal clear.  Well worth the time spent getting there (about 2-2.5 hours) on the rough roads!

565425595.name: Fun day
565425595.author: a TripAdvisor user
565425595.reviewBody: My husband I took tour with Fabian, spoke English, very interesting tour guide and so very kind. The falls were great to play in, we had a home made taco on way there that was great. If a person is unstable on their feet , there is a little hike to the falls. We also got a clay mask treatment by jacklyn that was fun\n\n

563180987.name: Lots of walking
563180987.author: a TripAdvisor user
563180987.reviewBody: Rough roads and long ride but worth seeing all the scenery.  Fun in the fresh water, just don\'t drink it as so many minerals.  Great lunch and fantastic guides.  If you walking problems, don\'t go as the climb is quite long and hard.  This is a tour so don\'t plan on driving as you\'ll never find the place.

557915236.name: Great day
557915236.author: a TripAdvisor user
557915236.reviewBody: We had a wonderful time visiting the falls with our tour guide Alfonso through Best Huatulco Tours. We stopped and jumped and swam in a few spot along the way up. It was a little more physical demanding than we had originally thought (if you want to go through the caves which I HIGHLY recommend), but well worth it.

556383954.name: Beautiful!
556383954.author: a TripAdvisor user
556383954.reviewBody: Love it there! So magical! The water is crystal clear and it\'s amazing! The drive is long but very interesting to see the villages.

556198835.name: Beauty in Paradise
556198835.author: a TripAdvisor user
556198835.reviewBody: Wonderful day trip to the mountains to see an amazing feat of nature, had a great trip with a local driver with a very reliable 4 x 4 quad cab truck, the road is rough in places but our driver Escobar (Steve)958-109-2828 was cautious and knowlegable about the area .Stopped at a coffee plantation/ co-co bean farm and learned many interesting things. Some drivers may take you there for less but the extra $6 (90 pesos) was well worth it. Plan on an authentic Mexican lunch while at the falls at the family restaurant, food was great.

553230094.name: Great day with Pablo Narvaez
553230094.author: a TripAdvisor user
553230094.reviewBody: Highlight of the Christmas holiday. Trip into the Sierra Madre mountains; stopped at a local farm, picked coffee and cocoa beans; saw how the locals lived and learned about their culture; went to Magic Falls, climbed into the cave behind the waterfalls, went swimming in the crystal clear pools; had an authentic lunch and a return trip down the mountains. Travel time about 1 1/2 hours each way over rough roads and there is a trek to the waterfalls. Just a great day with great guides for a family of six.

552463241.name: Amazing experience
552463241.author: a TripAdvisor user
552463241.reviewBody: We loved it. It was a highlight of our trip to Huatulco. The ride to the fall was long and bumpy but it was absolutely worse it. The water was beautiful and clean, We climbed the fall, swam, enjoyed the beautiful scenery. If we come back to Huatulco we would visit the fall again.

552310381.name: Emerald falls DVD pics
552310381.author: a TripAdvisor user
552310381.reviewBody: Did anyone but DVDs with the pictures? We payed 400 pesos and can\'t view our pics. Very disappointed!

552243594.name: Great Tour with Edgar Escobar
552243594.author: a TripAdvisor user
552243594.reviewBody: We booked a tour to visit the waterfalls with a vendor on the beach who connected us with Edgar Escobar. His English was excellent and he did a great job explaining the local history and what life is like for the locals. I agree with other reviewers that the road was long and bumpy and that the coffee plantation visit wasn\'t my favorite part of the trip, but it is how the locals earn a living and the trip to the waterfalls was worth it. Edgar did a great job guiding us across the more dangerous-looking part of the falls and showing us some cool features inside a cave.  Also, for walking across the falls, I recommend water shoes. People who wore flip flops had to cross barefoot and some the rocks were pretty sharp! If you like a little adventure and don\'t mind a rocky drive in the country, I highly recommend this visit.You can contact Edgar via FB at Huatulco\'s Edgar Escobar.

550646946.name: Trip rating is a solid 2 1/2
550646946.author: a TripAdvisor user
550646946.reviewBody:
We were approached on the beach by Crisanto Carmona about the many tours he could set up. Firstly, I'd like to say that everything Crisanto said was true....but I'm going to fill in the gaps with regard to our "Coffee Plantation and Magic Waterfalls" excursion. 
- The trip is going to take about 6 hours in total. We left our hotel around 10:30 and didn't get back until 5:30. 
- The roads up to the coffee plantation and Magic Waterfalls are some of the worst you can imagine. Logging roads in British Columbia are like paved freeways compared to these. Wouldn't recommend anyone with back problems/mobility issues/problems sitting for a considerable period go on these roads. Our tour guide had to shut off the air conditioning to get enough power in spots to go up the various grades. 
- The coffee plantation is just a store-front operation. Yes there is coffee trees there and some young lads will give you a photo opportunity in exchange for a tip. The whole setup here is to get you to taste/buy mescal, coffee and chocolate. Don't buy coffee in paper bags by the way....only vacuum packed as the air gets in too easily and buy only beans. We bought our coffee and Mescal in Crucecita after shopping around and getting advice.
- On the return trip, we went to the Magic Waterfalls. Until this point, the four of us were thinking we wasted $100CDN and 3 1/2 hours of our life that we'd never get back. They are beautiful and great to swim in and by far the BEST point of the whole excursion!
- The lunch afterward at a local family owned place was also fantastic! Fresh pork and chicken, rice and homemade tortillas and cold drinks. Very tasty and two thumbs up. Will post pictures. 
So in conclusion.... The coffee plantation part of trip 1 out of 5. I've been to coffee plantations and it's misleading to put this store-front setup into that category. Next time I'll do the the Cafe Puma plantation and check it out. The waterfalls 4 out of 5 and the meal was 4 out of 5. We're glad the Waterfalls saved the day, but is sure is a long bumpy, winding and difficult road to get there and when bundled with the "coffee plantation" it took a good chunk out of our day.

550521880.name: Long bumpy journey in and back
550521880.author: a TripAdvisor user
550521880.reviewBody: Almost 2 hours each way but the falls are beautiful.  Hire a cab and driver and go in the morning to avoid the crowds.  This is not for anyone with mobility issues.

550173184.name: Don\'t go if you are lacking a spirit of adventure
550173184.author: a TripAdvisor user
550173184.reviewBody: Had a good day with our guide Enrique.  The drive there was as interesting as the falls to me, but I\'m the type that will spend the whole flight looking out the window too. #geographygeek.  We went to Las Brisas falls first and there were fewer people, that was the only drawback here, lots of folks. One hapless guy did a front fall belly flop from an  8 metre platform much to the concern of everyone, he was out of it for quite a while. Pencil dive, folks! Not that I would at my age. Food was traditional and delicious at the huge restaurant/former coffee plantation above the falls.  Just don\'t drop your mol\u00e8 chicken drumstick on the nice white table cloth like I did.\ud83d\ude33

549068408.name: Long way there and back
549068408.author: a TripAdvisor user
549068408.reviewBody: It was quite tough getting there as the road was really rough, once you were there it was spectacular !!!! Lunch was very good too. Try it once as it was good however it was a really rough road to get there and get back,

547887609.name: Tranquility!
547887609.author: a TripAdvisor user
547887609.reviewBody: The falls and the area are beautiful.  To really enjoy the area we stayed at the cabanas that are in the area.  From this recently opened establishment it is a short walk to the falls and we had them all to ourselves in the morning as the tours don\'t arrive until around noon.  You can likely hire a taxi and stay in one of the three cabanas for what a tour might cost.  We hired a taxi away from our hotel in the Bay Area for much less than what the hotel quoted us.

545393803.name: Great time! Beautiful falls!
545393803.author: a TripAdvisor user
545393803.reviewBody: Absolutely breathtaking how beautiful the Copalita River falls are! Definitely a don\'t miss activity when visiting Huatulco! The driving route there is quite treacherous though!

540398515.name: Long, rough journey to paradise
540398515.author: a TripAdvisor user
540398515.reviewBody: It\'s worth it once you arrive but be prepared for a long, treacherous journey. We had lunch at the coffee plantation and it was exceptional. I felt very safe with our guides Miguel and Roberto. The water at the falls was so amazing, clear and cool.

539795180.name: A very long day, for a nice visit by some small falls.
539795180.author: a TripAdvisor user
539795180.reviewBody: We took this trip for a day during our Hualtuco vacation.  It was a beautiful day, and the temperature in the mountains is a pleasant relief from the HOT seashore.... but the roads are so poor and jarring that I would not strongly recommend this excursion.  The falls are pleasant, and swimming around them is agreeable, but NOT spectacular.  I\u2019m glad I did this trip, but not sure it is worth the trip to getting there.  I spoke to several other people who also travelled to the same destination, but with a different vendor and they had the same impression.\n    Of extra note, we were harshly criticized for putting on bug spray prior to entering the walk in the forest to the falls.  our local driver said that IU bug repellant (recommended by the CDC) spray would be harmful to the environment.\n      My son also caught our bilingual host driver being quite critical of his english speaking passengers when talking to the Mexican visitors in Spanish.  Buyer beware.

520544597.name: Book with Enrique Pinacho
520544597.author: a TripAdvisor user
520544597.reviewBody: We booked a private tour to the falls with Enrique and he timed it out so that there were no tour buses at the falls and we had the entire falls to ourselves. It was incredible. You can see clips in our video on YouTube under "Huatulco Wanderlust 2017" & "It\'s only Huatulco"

519672359.name: Its pretty amazing.
519672359.author: a TripAdvisor user
519672359.reviewBody: You wont regret coming here. The trip going to the falls is a little bit rough and the water is freezing cold! Also wear comfortable shoes and you do some hiking to get to the falls

507422697.name: Cascadas
507422697.author: a TripAdvisor user
507422697.reviewBody: This is an excelente place to visit, very natural places, very good food, nice people, I really recommend this place.

492993077.name: High Light of our Vacation
492993077.author: a TripAdvisor user
492993077.reviewBody: Our guide Enrique Pinacho was absolutely by far the BEST guide we ever did have.  If you plan to go...google him and find his contact info.  You\'ll be so glad you did.

478570373.name: Magic Falls
478570373.author: a TripAdvisor user
478570373.reviewBody: Beautiful.  We were the 2 oldies in our group of 6.  The other 4 did not speak English but were so much fun & understanding.  Even though this excursion is fine for elderly I would qualify it- not for those with health issues such as hip, knee as this could be harder for them as it is a lot of steps all uneven.  My husband had heart surgery and his thighs/hips were a issue . He is stronger now & would do again butttt I would qualify that it could be difficult for those with knees, & hips issues.

473507511.name: Pristine Water
473507511.author: a TripAdvisor user
473507511.reviewBody: The river in the mountains East of Santa Cruz, Huatulco is clear as crystal and we drank the water right from the falls. Cool Clear and Refreshing. It\'s just like I imagine Eden was.

472245288.name: Trip to the falls
472245288.author: a TripAdvisor user
472245288.reviewBody: The trip there and back was 2 hours each way over horrible roads to see pretty falls that many others were looking at and getting into.  The lunch was good.  It took up our entire day and we felt not worth it.

471518595.name: Magic Falls
471518595.author: a TripAdvisor user
471518595.reviewBody: The trip to the falls is bumpy. The falls are beautiful a lot of walking but worth the trip. The guide Danny was great. I lost my glasses in the falls and Danny and the other tour guides tried to find them.  They are great.

471480038.name: Edgar Escobar, great guide.
471480038.author: a TripAdvisor user
471480038.reviewBody: We had a great day with Edgar Escobar, check him out on Facebook.  The falls were amazing, and the Mexican lunch was great, very authentic. It is a very windy, rough road, if you tend to get car sick this would not be a good excursion for you.

470711065.name: Nice all day trip
470711065.author: a TripAdvisor user
470711065.reviewBody: Last year we did the Magic Falls tour. It\'s very nice and relaxing.\nBe ware to bring comfortable shoes for walking and also if u have shoes for walking in the water best.

470400384.name: Just beautiful
470400384.author: a TripAdvisor user
470400384.reviewBody: Beautiful waterfall. Wear comfortable shoes, and the ride there is a tad bumpy so be prepared and about an hour. The guides like to stop here and there, so you might want to bring a little bit of $

470110059.name: This excursion NOT appropriate for families with kids under 5!!!
470110059.author: a TripAdvisor user
470110059.reviewBody:
The Falls were a strong recommendation by our Sunwing Reps; a 'must see'. Having a 9 month old, I approached reps on 3 separate occasions to ask if excursion was appropriate for infants and was told baby would be fine. They explained that it was a 90 minute drive in an air conditioned van to the Falls and when we arrived we would have to walk about 15 minutes to the Falls; although not suitable for a stroller, baby could be carried. I was concerned about the bugs and was told they weren't too bad. Fair enough...I packed my baby harness for the walking part and a mosquito net to drape over baby and off we went. So here is an account of our day....
Left our hotel at 9:00 am and began our drive in a van with air conditioning hitting the driver and first row but noone else (we were at the back). The road (if you can call it that) was so bumpy and windy that you rocked all over the place and out of you seat for the entire duration of the drive. It was so jarring that I had to hold my son's head and neck steady for the entire drive which took....3 1/2 hours in total!!! We made 2 stops enroute to purchase local crafts and coffee/honey etc. Everyone was friendly and welcoming (you should bring a few hundred pesos to support the local communities). We drove through little villages which was very eye opening (didn't see one kid with his head stuck to an iphone :) ) The available washrooms were out in the open and if you go, please remember to bring your own tissues/wipes as no toilet paper provided!!! The driver was from the area and gave an interesting commentary of life on the mountain. We arrived at the Falls at 12:30 pm - 3 1/2 hours since departure!!!!! We were offered bottled water and nothing else. So I put baby in the harness and we headed to the Falls. The walk with baby was do-able. Again, winding and bumpy but ok. We made our first stop (of 3) at what I would describe as a small brook. Spent about 15 minutes there while visitors waded in the water. There was no place to put baby down as the area very rocky.  It was challenging to carry baby into water because the rocks were slippery so I stood at the edge. Then we moved to next area (another 10 minute walk) where there was an opportunity for guests to jump off rocks. My husband and eldest daughter did the 2 story jump, but beware - the water is not very deep and the jump is very close to rocks. Other that a couple of benches, there was no where to put baby down again. Water entry not appropriate when holding a baby due to slippery rocks. W were there for about 20 minutes. The third stop was finally the Falls. The kids could swing on a rope into the water. There were a few more narrow benches to sit on but there were at least 4 groups there so space was at a premium. I had to sit for the third time with baby in lap on a narrow bench. I had thought that once we finally arrived at the Falls there would be an area for visitors to spread out and enjoy the afternoon but not to be the case. The Falls were okay but nothing spectacular. We have waterfalls up north that are comparable. We stayed for about 30 minutes then made our way back for lunch (quite a hike uphill). When we finally sat down for lunch it was 3:00 pm. We were all starving as we hadn't eaten since breakfast. The lunch was really good and there was lots to go around. If you wanted a beer, you had to pay 25 pesos. We returned to the van at 4:00 pm to make our descent down the treacherous mountain and arrived back at our hotel just before 6:00 pm.

By no means so I want to dissuade anyone from going to the Falls but I think the Sunwing Reps should have provided us all with a much better description of what to expect. I never thought we would spend 5 1/2 hours in a bus, or that we would be eating lunch at 3:00 pm or we would only be spending only about 30 minutes at the Falls. I would not have gone with a baby if I had had more information but for some, the excursion may be a great day out. My 12 years old daughter loved the day. I was stressed out holding baby and making sure his head wasn't bouncing around too much. It was a long day, not much to eat until late and not even a complimentary beer!

Would recommend you put sunscreen and bug spray on while at the bus then leave it on the bus. Only take a towel, a bottle of water with you and you should really wear water shoes. Flip flops were the best for walking in the rocky water. Bring lots of snacks with you to eat on the way (as long as you don;t get motion sickness).

Won't do this one again but some may enjoy!

468707136.name: Very beautiful place it is magic
468707136.author: a TripAdvisor user
468707136.reviewBody: It was very nice trip, my husband me were very impressed of how clean the water was and warm never saw this water falls before somewhere else

468669310.name: BEAUTIFUL, MUST SEE ONCE!
468669310.author: a TripAdvisor user
468669310.reviewBody: Good experience, but lots of climbing up and down rocks...so if you have mobility issues, this is not for you.  Once there it was beautiful. We have waterfalls in Canada that are higher and just as nice, but when in Rome!!!

467916001.name: Worth the trip
467916001.author: a TripAdvisor user
467916001.reviewBody: Beautiful falls. Delicious meal. Great stops on the way, a chance to buy local trinkets and mazcal. Worth the days trip.  If you are known to get motion sick, take a gravel for the bus ride.

467864289.name: Beautiful Falls
467864289.author: a TripAdvisor user
467864289.reviewBody: The falls are beautiful, water very clear, very glad we experienced the beauty of this area.  Be prepared for a 2+ hour bumpy, winding mountain ride each way though - a few of us were almost car sick.  Also when we parked, we hiked 20-30 minutes through rugged terrain to reach the falls (not the most accessible tour - we had walking sticks to help climb dirt and rocks).  If you have water shoes, bring them for grip and foot protection.

467567349.name: Falls are okay
467567349.author: a TripAdvisor user
467567349.reviewBody: 2.5 hour trip each way is not worth going to the falls. We have been to too many other falls in Canada to rate this one as worth going to agian. Roads are bad most of the way, can be very narrow. Go to Pluma for coffee instead. Same fantastic views, nice quiet town, places to have a snack or drink and the local Mexicans claim the "best coffee" in the region. 250 pesos for 1 kg of coffee

465688719.name: Beautiful sets of waterfalls in the Forest
465688719.author: a TripAdvisor user
465688719.reviewBody:
We stayed in Huatulco and booked this tour through our Sunwing guide at the hotel. The guide said the drive was 1 hour 20 minutes to the water falls including a stop to shop along the way.  The actual ride included 2 stops: first stop was a washroom break (pay 5 pesos), second stop was at a "shaman's" healing center (he sold coffee, marijuana etc) which was about 20-30 minutes. The ride was not that bad...no one got motion sickness or died, lol....although it was steep. 

When we arrived at the falls: 15 minute hike to the river from the parking area which we were joined by a local professional photographer. We then hiked along the river  and up a few sets of incredibly beautiful falls. A few of less "fit" people had to rest along the way which slowed down our group. TAKE SHOES FOR THE HIKE or WATER SHOES or maybe stay in the parking lot and await the return of your tour group.

At a couple of the water falls, there were ropes to swing from and jump into the pools of crystal clear mountain water. The water was not cold. This was like an "enchanted forest" scene from story books. It was amazing! The photographer captured many candid and posed photos from great angles. He was in the water and climbed the falls ahead of the group to capture fantastic photos.

My wife and I would recommend this tour for the waterfall and nature lovers.

Please remember this is:  1. a ride into the mountains, 2. mountains are steep, 3. Water falls are steep and wet, 4. A hike ...therefore, bring appropriate footwear.

465665286.name: Breathtaking
465665286.author: a TripAdvisor user
465665286.reviewBody: The falls were gorgeous. The water was refreshingly cold. It\'s a long ride on a very bumpy road.  You\'re up a long way. Lunch was incredible -  very authentic Mexican food.

464893817.name: Beautiful string of waterfalls with emerald water
464893817.author: a TripAdvisor user
464893817.reviewBody:
Without a doubt, the waterfalls are beautiful and the hike through the woods to find them is enjoyable.
The steak lunch was also very good.
But before you book this excursion, keep in mind it will be a long and winding 2 hour bumpy ride up the mountain in a passenger van - something my fellow travellers hadn't expected.
On the way up, you will a stop at a traditional naturopath who will be very entertaining.

464740070.name: Well worth the visit
464740070.author: a TripAdvisor user
464740070.reviewBody: We used Nexus tours, our guide was Jairo (Hi Row), he was amazing, it\'s quite the drive to the falls up in the mountains, but it\'s great to see the countryside and the smaller villages, had a great time in the falls, the mud is great for your skin, had a good meal as part of our tour.  Use a tour guide, probably really hard to find, I wouldn\'t take a rental car up there on those roads.  Jairo really made the trip that much better, he\'s a great guide.

464472205.name: Beautiful
464472205.author: a TripAdvisor user
464472205.reviewBody: We did this as part of coffee plantation tour. Was a bit of a drive to get there and is mostly dirt road, but worth it.

464130374.name: Bumpity, Bump, Bump, Bump!!!!
464130374.author: a TripAdvisor user
464130374.reviewBody: The tour staff and tour books tell you this is one of the top sites to see when in Huatulco. Our bus load of tourists found it to be a horrendous drive up the mountain, one was motion sick, one put their back out, we all were sore from hanging on for dear life!!  I would NOT recommend this for anyone, the end is not worth the trip and the time it takes to get there!!

462569060.name: Waterfalls
462569060.author: a TripAdvisor user
462569060.reviewBody: The waterfalls are definitely worth the long ride up the mountain, along the way there is little villages, seeing the way these amazing people live is astonishing. But keep in mind this is there home, the trip walking into the falls is magical and breathtaking.

461283810.name: A long drive but well worth it
461283810.author: a TripAdvisor user
461283810.reviewBody:
We booked a driver for a group of 8 of us to take a trip to Magic Falls. We were told there was road construction which would add some extra time to our trip but that we would still be able to do everything we wanted to. The trip was long and bumpy but the complimentary beers helped out. We stopped for pictures on a bridge over the river and to take pictures of a local kid with an iguana. 
Once we got to the parking lot it was a short walk to the first falls. The water was cool and refreshing and a quick dip up to your shoulders allows your body to adjust from the hot walk to the cool water. We spent a couple hours walking farther and farther upstream to different falls taking pictures along the way. The scenery is beautiful and there are lots of places to take a dip, swing from a rope or have somebody snap your picture. 
Our guide showed us places where we could walk behind the waterfall for a great experience.
The trip home seemed even longer than the trip up and made me remember all the bumps. I would recommend this to anybody that doesn't get car sick or have a bad back as it is a trip of a lifetime.

461000943.name: Day visit
461000943.author: a TripAdvisor user
461000943.reviewBody:
A wonderful day to the beautiful mountains where the falls are located. 
Driven by Taxi driver 'Philip' who is fluently bilingual. Excellent English. 
Better and more reasonable than group tour.  
Only negative was the bumpy dirt road leading to falls but faster in taxi versus van.  
Excellent lunch at top of falls. 
A must do😊.

460965452.name: Waterfalls tour
460965452.author: a TripAdvisor user
460965452.reviewBody: Our guides for this tour were very informative and their humour was infectious. We ended with a mud facial before heading back to our bus and lunch at a nearby town.

460942319.name: Long drive, barely worth it.
460942319.author: a TripAdvisor user
460942319.reviewBody:
I think most of our disappointment in this trip came from false advertising.  Initially Nexus sold it as a 1hour drive, but it took about 2.5hrs of long bumpy roads and frequent stops.  

It was an interesting trip with some things to see along the way such as a few mountain views and a look into rural Oaxaca.  Seeing how the locals lived was eye opening for sure.  

The falls were a little underwhelming, most of them were less than 6 foot falls in a river essentially that was not very deep.  Perhaps we are spoiled in canada where this type of thing is pretty common in the mountains.  A lot of the falls we climbed were a bit treacherous and slippery so if you have mobility issues you might want to just observe.   

The lunch was very good but we didnt eat until after 2pm so you might want to bring a snack.  

Overall likely one of our least favorite excursions in mexico, but it was an experience.

460506999.name: Long, Hot Drive but Worth It.....
460506999.author: a TripAdvisor user
460506999.reviewBody: We hired a private driver to take us to the Magic Falls.  I had read that the road was long however it was a lot longer than I had even imagined.  The road is a windy, dirt, road full of bumps and holes.  It is hot and dry.  Our driver made us stop at two different stops which seemed like stops we HAD to make in order to be able to see the falls.  We had to pay to use the restroom at the first stop.  The second stop was a sort of "witch doctor" stop where we had to listen to a sales pitch in order to pass.  The other part of the drive consisted of us paying a "toll" to travel on a certain part of the road.  Once we arrived at the falls it was approximately a quarter mile walk to the falls.  The falls were amazing and our group had a great time.  The restaurant at the bottom of the falls was some of the most authentic food we have ever eaten.  It is worth the trip just prepare yourself for the long, hot drive and bring plenty of water and pesos.

460053619.name: " a must see"
460053619.author: a TripAdvisor user
460053619.reviewBody: This day trip is full of excellent sights while learning about the locals. The lunch was excellent and the water spectacular.... "You most certainly want to do this"

459845317.name: truly amazing
459845317.author: a TripAdvisor user
459845317.reviewBody: a beautiful spot. the falls are so great to swim around. it is well worth the long drive to get there!

459269058.name: Amazing!
459269058.author: a TripAdvisor user
459269058.reviewBody: We did the tour of magic falls and it was worth every penny and and every second of the trip. It is a fairly long drive to the falls but you do get to see lots of Oaxaca which is beautiful. The road does get fairly rough at times and it\'s tipsy turny but it\'s very nice. Well worth it in the end and would do it again and again! \n

458756157.name: The falls were amazing, very pretty...
458756157.author: a TripAdvisor user
458756157.reviewBody: Spent the afternoon hiking the falls, enjoying the scenery and taking in the beauty of the falls. Great way to spend the day and take lots of beautiful pictures...

458699932.name: WOW!
458699932.author: a TripAdvisor user
458699932.reviewBody: Was an amazing area to see. was fun to go behind the water fall and in the cave! amazing falls for pictures and swinging off the ropes were so much fun! i would advise to take a tour if going, dont rent your own vehicle as the roads are so bad. my family rented our own van to go, and on the way back, a sharp rock on the road popped our tire. the vehicle didnt have the right tools to change it and was almost impossible to do on such small roads. we spend most of the afternoon walking down the mountain to get help as no cell service. the locals in the village were so friendly and amazing, they called a local mechanic who went up on a motorcycle and fixed the vehicle for us before the rental people got there! best people on the planet~! we were also lucky enough to witness a local funeral ceremony and a wedding in the same day!

457754950.name: Beautiful
457754950.author: a TripAdvisor user
457754950.reviewBody: Wonderful trip. The roads up the mountain are extremely rough though. So worth the trip. Bring water shoes and good walking shoes as it\'s quite the hike

457203001.name: Beautiful falls but not worth wasting a whole day for.
457203001.author: a TripAdvisor user
457203001.reviewBody: Left our hotel at 1015 am and did not get back until 7pm. Road up the mountain is dusty ,bumpy and slow. 2 hrs up and two hrs down in a van was not my thing. Falls are gorgeous but would not ever do it again,,, even if it was free.

457021529.name: beautiful falls but 2 hrs on a road that isnt really a road
457021529.author: a TripAdvisor user
457021529.reviewBody: I have no clue on how anyone could say this is a destination one needs to see on a road that is only 4 wheel drive accessable . We drove it to see the falls only to take 2,5 hrs each way and going through a road that is closed due to construction and will be for the month of Fed 2017, I dont care who you are either you hire a HELICOPTER or rent a monster truck, this road will shake you and hang up your auto if you have a car you wont after the ride in or out. beautiul falls dont mean risk your life and that is what this road holds ahead. Till it is set up one doesnt need to go unless you have the right equiptment.\nCARS are not made to climb mountains. Huatulco is beautiful but ttttthis attraction to me is less than worthy to give a possitive review. If you have been there you know what i see from the reviews is  non sence

456803775.name: Long and rough road but worth it in the end!
456803775.author: a TripAdvisor user
456803775.reviewBody:
The drive was one thing but the government is working on a better alternative route and will eventually be up and running soon. 
Having said that you get to see a lot of interesting things. Not sure I would recommend this tour for anyone with a physical disability I.e knee/back/ankle issues. It's an 1.5 hour bumpy drive up and another 1.5 back down and also a bit of a hike to get to the falls. 
Anyone capable of this should go as it is beautiful and refreshing! 
We had great tour guide Francisco who we booked thru a beach vendor by the name of  "Conception". Cheaper then what you'd pay at the resort and Francisco took great care of us!! 
We also had a delicious lunch at the falls and the ladies got to have a mud mask put on by one of the local girls "Blanca". She was so sweet! 
Great tour!! Tip your tour guide! They earn it and rely on it and ours certainly deserved it!!!

456051642.name: Falls are beautiful but to get there is a nightmare
456051642.author: a TripAdvisor user
456051642.reviewBody: We made the trek to the falls with our guide Archie. We booked through Transat. He was very knowledgeable and friendly. We went on 20 passenger bus and it was the bumpiest and windiest road you will ever go on in your life. It takes 2 hours to get there. By the time we got there our backs and butts were so sore from the ride. The falls are beautiful, you can get in the water and walk and swim around. People were also jumping off into the water. You NEED to take water shoes as the rocks in the water are very sharp and uncomfortable for bare feet. I wish we would have known this ahead of time. Lots of walking down to the falls so if you have mobility issues this is not a good tour for you. We stopped at the botanical gardens as well as a market where you could buy things like coffee, honey, chocolate, etc. We had a lovely lunch on the way back, the food and hibiscus water was delicious. Take your camera there are lots of photo ops.

455501134.name: Favourite excursion in Huatulco
455501134.author: a TripAdvisor user
455501134.reviewBody: Full day...but worth it, nice to do something unique to the area. Not busy was 10 of us in a van. Great flora & fauna too. Yes road is bumpy but we felt worth it! Will do it again if we return.

455230939.name: It was very good but is not good for all...
455230939.author: a TripAdvisor user
455230939.reviewBody: Road sucks...parts are paved nicely, other parts very potholey and rough!  Would not recommend for anyone who is not able to withstand being thrown around and bounced in a vehicle for the majority of the ride.  Walk was very long and mostly uphill...my app on phone measured 172 flights of stairs!  It was strenuous and it was very nice to see.   The food was great...our guide was great...our vehicle was great...My husband and I are 70 and in pretty good shape but it was tiring.  Being from CA, we have seen falls before so maybe we did appreciate it as much as we should.

455077091.name: Great Tour to the Magic Falls
455077091.author: a TripAdvisor user
455077091.reviewBody:
This was probably the highlight of my vacation to Huatulco.  These falls are nestled away in the middle of a tropical wonderland.  It takes about an hour on a dirt road to reach your destination but once you arrive it's like paradise.  

The best way to enjoy this adventure is to hire a private guide to take you to this remote utopia.  The major tour companies won't take you to the falls due to the bumpy dirt road.  I hired Huatulco's Edgar Escobar (find him on Facebook) to guide me to this amazing destination.  

The falls are like nothing I've seen before and Edgar was so informative about the local culture and history.  The main waterfall has access to a cave where you can actually walk behind the waterfall and get a very unique view.  There is an area to swim (a little chilli) that offers crystal clear waters. The waterfalls are actually tiered so you can walk through the different levels.

After a refreshing swim, we walked to the restaurant (2 minutes) where we had one of the best lunches I've had on my entire vacation.  Edgar speaks perfect English and is able to explain the various selections on the menu.  I found that very few people speak English in Huatulco so having Edgar as a guide was a huge asset.

After lunch, we went to the coffee plantation where I bought coffee beans, chocolate and honey.  Yum Yum.  You can easily spend 4-6 hours at the waterfall just taking in the natural beauty of the area.  I highly recommend it.  I would also recommend to have a "private" guide take you rather than going with a group.  Huatulco's Edgar Escobar was much cheaper than the local competition and there is no rush to leave.

Pro's  Beautiful Location, Great Food, 
Cons   Bumpy road (I loved it),

454993606.name: Scary drive but worth it
454993606.author: a TripAdvisor user
454993606.reviewBody: We booked a trip with Carlos and he came through as planned. Our driver was excellent; he drove slow and safe! The road there is plain scary - narrow, dirt road that is on the edge of a mountain with no guard rails. It is 51 km from Santa Cruz but took two hours to get there because of the poor road conditions. However, once we got there it was absolutely beautiful!! Glad we went! The falls are amazing and great scenery. The lunch we had was really good too!

454853998.name: Great falls
454853998.author: a TripAdvisor user
454853998.reviewBody: Great falls with a great lunch, but a crappy road with high priced, stops to buy local over priced coffee, Mezcal etc. These falls are not for those with mobility issues.

454756814.name: an adventure in the jungle
454756814.author: a TripAdvisor user
454756814.reviewBody: The beauty of the long drive cannot be over stated, that is if you relax about the bumpy nature and length of the trip up to the falls. This is a great trip for curious minds because our guide,  who was fantastic, was so very knowledgeable about the plants and trees we saw on the way and made a point of stopping on the way to point out fascinating stuff to us. Some in the group just wanted to get on with it, but to us this was the perfect way to enjoy the journey, not just the end game. The falls themselves were absolutely gorgeous. We felt we were in a tarzan movie or something...everything was lush with weird rock formations and these amazing pools of water we were able to swim in. The climb up the various falls was arduous and we really did not think we would be able to make it. We are older people (by far the oldest in our small group), but our guides assured us we could make it and said they would help us and keep us safe, which they did. We felt such a sense of fulfillment that we made the hard climb and enjoyed it immensely. We were not even sore the next day, maybe because swimming in the cold water of the falls was like putting an ice pack on the over-worked muscles. Both guides were amazingly kind and helpful, but Josuay was truly the best!! One recommendation is to bring aqua shoes to prevent slipping on the wet rocks while climbing. We did this and could not have managed without them.

453802723.name: The walk is worth it
453802723.author: a TripAdvisor user
453802723.reviewBody: We took this as part of one of the tours through our hotel. It was very strenuous for the elderly (or people with canes and some walking issues). There are several parts to the falls and swimming was enjoyed.

452017602.name: long drive but fun with our guide
452017602.author: a TripAdvisor user
452017602.reviewBody: People are correct in saying that the road to the waterfalls is long, bumpy and dusty.  I can say that I would have been disappointed in the excursion had it not been for our great guide Pablo Narvaez.  We had great conversations along the way and he also arranged for us to stop at a neat organic farm being run by two brothers that was on the way to the waterfalls.  That was actually the highlight of the day (and maybe even my entire trip to Mexico), with the brothers showing us around, explaining their plants and giving us continuous samples of various limes, lemons and other great fruit.  We actually ended up having a great meal with the family, who were very welcoming and fun to spend time with. (Oh \u2013 and the waterfalls were actually fun too.)  I recommend tracking Pablo down if you want more than to rush back and forth on a dusty, bumpy road for a day.  He can be reached at pablo_rafting@yahoo.com.

451950921.name: Magical Place
451950921.author: a TripAdvisor user
451950921.reviewBody: Arrived by private taxi before the tour buses and enjoyed time by ourselves. Came prepared for the hike and the cave crawl and swimming in the pool(s).  Friendly service.

451935163.name: Great Experince!
451935163.author: a TripAdvisor user
451935163.reviewBody: Loved, Loved, Loved the Magic Falls.  There are three sets of falls to choose from and we ended up at one where you were able to slither through a small opening and walk behind the falls then we jumped off a giant boulder into a a refreshing pool of clear water and played on a rope swing at a small swimming hole further down the falls.  Followed by a delicious local authentic lunch of barbequed chicken, rice and beans.  Yes, the drive there is a bit hairy and takes almost two hours but definitely worth it.  I highly recommend using our driver, Pablo Narvaez.  He speaks excellent English and got us to the falls before all the big tours so we could enjoy them without a huge crowd.  It was also nice that it didn\'t take up the entire day as the organized excursion would.  He can be found under his name, Pablo Narvaez on Facebook or by email at pablo_rafting@yahoo.com or phone/text (958)108-5087 (I think the country code from Canada is 52.

451794258.name: Slippery and beautiful
451794258.author: a TripAdvisor user
451794258.reviewBody:
We rented a car and headed up to the falls. It's a long drive on a super bumpy dusty dirt road. About 1 1/2 hours to the first falls. (We didn't go any further). 

We were not sure what to expect so we brought our own lunch and cold water and beer. Our phone/camera. By the way, no cell service. 

We got to the first falls which was not entirely easy to find. Fortunately we didn't get lost. 

There were a couple of forks in the road without signs. Stay to the right. There are little spots where the locals jump out with flash cards offering to be a guide. 

They charged 70 Pesos per person when you came to a roped area of the road. Which is mandatory. They give you a receipt. 

The first falls was called Las Brisas then Magic Falls apparently was further up the road. 

I would recommend to bring no valuables and wear good shoes to walk the trails. A waterproof pouch for your cash.  

When you go onto the bridge decks be very careful and hold the rope provided. My husband slipped on the bridge and fell and lost his glasses right at the largest falls. Miraculously, after digging around in the water thankfully he found them. 

Bring extra glasses if you have them. He was the driver!  So we were lucky. 

My husband ventured into the hole to get in behind the falls. There were too many people inside so it was not really worth it, especially after he fell! 

We walked back and found the most beautiful little spot to have a picnic, kind of off to the side before the main falls. 

There are a couple of ropes to swing from, we didn't try them but the kids around us did. 

Even though the roads were sketchy, we were so glad we went. It was so beautiful and natural. 

If you don't bring a lunch with you, there are a couple of little places to eat. 

Don't go past the bathrooms! There is one where you park, and one just up by the falls. They look a little questionable too, but there was a sink to wash your hands. 

If you have not gone to the falls I highly recommend it. Wear those water shoes perhaps. Leave valuables at home or in you trunk of your car. Watch your step and carry extra glasses!  It's a long drive back to Huatulco. 

Our picnic was the best part.

448331851.name: Family with teenagers and young kids and older grandparents!
448331851.author: a TripAdvisor user
448331851.reviewBody:
11 of us took the excursion to Magic Falls last Wednesday.  It was absolutely great!  Our Apple Vacations/Amstar rep arranged an 11 passenger van for our day long adventure!  After a 2 hour bumpy trek up the mountains through many small villages, we arrived to our first destination and had Hibiscus water and used beautiful, clean, and large restrooms.  We also tasted coffee.  Our Guide, Ramiro was amazing.  His English was impeccable and he was very knowledgeable about all that we saw in our way up the mountains.  He spoke of all the vegetation, crops, peoples, religions, food, economies, and was a very careful and safe driver.  

We then travelled another 10 minutes and parked.  We each received a walking stick and traveled through the mountain to the first of three spots.  Some of us decided to jump into the cold, clean water.  We stayed for a bit and then went to another Falls area.  More of us jumped in including a five year only from our group.  Then we travelled some more to another Falls where almost all of us except our one 78 year old grandma went in.  Or other grandparents, 78 and 70 all went in.....our teenaged son had a blast climbing and jumping into the water.  There was also a rope swing.  The cold, fresh water was superb.  We received facial mud masks also.  

From there we went back to the van and then back to the plantation.  We had a most delicious meal of pork, chicken mole, rice, beans, cucumbers and hibiscus water and mezcal.  

It was a most thrilling day.

448302052.name: Surprisingly quaint area
448302052.author: a TripAdvisor user
448302052.reviewBody: The falls are not high but are beautiful.  The upper falls the water is deep enough for a good swim, including under the falls.  For the adventure type you can do a high jump into the water on the upper falls and on the middle falls you can do a rope swing jump into the water.  Suggest you go early morning to avoid the rush of people.

448132119.name: Family fun at the falls
448132119.author: a TripAdvisor user
448132119.reviewBody: Excellent food  after the falls, guide very helpful since I did not swim. Make sure to take towels and a change of clothes, rains a lot on the mountain.

446793368.name: Beautiful Falls
446793368.author: a TripAdvisor user
446793368.reviewBody: We originally bought this tour  on line and they did not show they we meet a guy in town and bought the tour from him so check around the prices really vary.  We rode in a new van that seated 12 people or so there was only 6 people Iit was a bumpy road but with the van it seemed to not be to bad

445190871.name: Pretty Falls, long bumpy drive, easy hike in.
445190871.author: a TripAdvisor user
445190871.reviewBody: The drive to the location is quite far.  The falls are worth visiting.  I would not make this trip twice.  Very bumpy roads in to the falls.\nA little rugged hiking up to the falls so you need to be sturdy on your feet.\nMy kids enjoyed it.

444805947.name: Stunning Waterfall
444805947.author: a TripAdvisor user
444805947.reviewBody: What a great day we had visiting the waterfall!  We booked a tour with Luis who owns Mendez Tours and we are so thankful we did.  He was truly a special guy who loves his job and wants to make you happy! We were picked up at 9:00 and did not get home till just before 6:00 so it is a long day, but we had a lot of stops along the way.  We were charged $2,500 pesos, also had to pay $70 peso/adult at the waterfall.  It\'s a long, slow, bumpy ride along a windy dirt road up the mountain.  Beautiful views along the way!  Once at the waterfall it is a good 5 minute hike down a rocky path.  Not easy for those with reduced mobility but still doable.  My mom was with us and has limited mobility and with a lot of help and moving slowly and carefully we got her to the waterfall.  It\'s a beautiful waterfall that you can actually get in behind, great photo opportunities!  There are also pools along the way you can dip into to, one even has a rope swing that my kids enjoyed.\nGreat way to spend the day!

444360235.name: Pablo Narvaez amazing tour guide!
444360235.author: a TripAdvisor user
444360235.reviewBody: We found Pablo Narvaez on Trip advisor and had an amazing experience to Magic Falls!  It is a long bumpy ride, about an hour and a half but Pablo made it go by quickly giving us information and history of all the colonies we passed.  The waterfalls were very impressive and Pablo made sure we got to see it from every possible angle.  We jumped off and did a rope swing into the water as well as climbing through a hole in the rock to a little whirl pool inside!  We had a traditional lunch while there which was delicious, even tried hibiscus water and Mezcal!  It was a wonderful exciting day!  Would highly recommend him!!

444129874.name: Rented a scooter in Huatulco, 2.5hrs later...
444129874.author: a TripAdvisor user
444129874.reviewBody:
The most amazing ride I've done in a long time. Not something anyone should do without dirt bike skills as riding a scooter on bolder strewn, wash out, sandy, dusty switch back ridden single lane path with truck/buses sharing the road. I know the past sentence is a mouthful but hope that you get the point! The ride is absolutely stunning with amazing little villages, roadside stands and people along the way. It's truly authentic rustic Mexican charm. 
After 2-3hrs on scooter( make sure that you have google maps down loaded on a device) getting lost and not minding at all because it's usually a little pueblo with smiling faces everywhere.
Be sure that you are very aware of rear brake only as descents on sandy rocky hill can be treacherous.
The falls and creek are amazing, expect to pay $60peso to park. If Fredrico is at the parking lot PAY for his services and photography. He is extremely knowledgable about local plants and animals and does amazing pics. He is well worth every cent he earns. Even pointed out wild cacao trees. Showed me how to get into a cave behind the falls which I never would have know was there. The place is truly amazing, the water is incredibly clean, clear and refreshing after the dusty trip up.
If you are adventurous and a skilled motorcyclist this is a must do.
I forget the name of the place to rent scooters in Huatulco but most taxi drivers will know.....you maybe don't want to let on that you are taking the scooter to the falls though:-)

444043832.name: Estevan Reyes Jimenez
444043832.author: a TripAdvisor user
444043832.reviewBody: Esteban was the best tour guide I ever got in my life the place is amazing it is a bumpy ride be careful no too eat too much before going. It is s magical place the water is crystal clear jumping from the rope great it really was an excellent option to visit in huatulco thnx to the guide had a great time

443082015.name: Breathtaking
443082015.author: a TripAdvisor user
443082015.reviewBody: This was a great excursion and I highly recommend getting there. It\'s beautiful and to be in Huatulco and miss it would be a shame. Beautiful, gorgeous and refreshing!

441374857.name: Excursions
441374857.author: a TripAdvisor user
441374857.reviewBody:
Falls are great. We climbed up 4 levels and onside caves. Was fun rocks were not slippery.

Our guide was very friendly.

Lunch very tasty.

Drive was long -2.5 hours to get there on bad roads. Views were spectacular.

Not for people with mobility issues.

441107976.name: Beautiful waterfalls
441107976.author: a TripAdvisor user
441107976.reviewBody: This was an amazing sight to see as the waterfalls were beautiful and the water was crystal clear.  However, it was a 2.5 hour drive through the mountains to get to the falls but well worth it.  Quicker coming back as there were no stops on the way back to the hotel.

439816380.name: A trip to the falls, no a trip to hell and back. Glad we got back at all.
439816380.author: a TripAdvisor user
439816380.reviewBody:
I booked this tour at the Dreams resort at one of their excursion desks.
It was pretty much seven hours of driving there on horrible roads. The falls were not that much to see. No one told us to come prepared for. Swimming or climbing the. Falls.
The lunch served was not bad but if we wanted beer we had to buy it.
There was not even any beer in the cooler in our van. The driver scared the crap out of me, very dangerous. I was very happy to get back. Things like this generally do not bother me too much but I was scared with this guy at the wheel.
I went to the excursion desk on my return and seriously tried to get my money back.
Fat chance of that. 
I spent the rest of our time there discouraging anyone who would listen not to go on that one.

438556550.name: Beautiful waterfalls
438556550.author: a TripAdvisor user
438556550.reviewBody: Great place to visit but hard to get, the road is not friendly, you will get car sick, you might forget how difficult it was to get there once you see the magical sightseeing view of the waterfalls but you will remember it on your way back!

437146398.name: Fascinating place
437146398.author: a TripAdvisor user
437146398.reviewBody: Hike up through the waterfalls, swim in the pools and then go for lunch at a former coffee plantation.  A great way to spend the day.

435755327.name: Beautiful Day at the Falls.
435755327.author: a TripAdvisor user
435755327.reviewBody: The drive was pretty long, 2 hours in a large van, but once there, well worth the long drive. The roads were rough because the rainy season had just finished and the back roads hadn\'t been serviced yet. The water was fantastic. Cool and refreshing. Very clear. Were able to swim under the falls and stay under them and look out.

433908996.name: Where was it?
433908996.author: a TripAdvisor user
433908996.reviewBody: We are independent travelers rather than taking tours. I\'m sure the buses found the falls but there were absolutely no signs directing us to the falls and sketchy directions at best. WE never did find it.

433393707.name: A must-do in Huatulco!
433393707.author: a TripAdvisor user
433393707.reviewBody: Absolutely beautiful!  Well worth the long trip to and from over the bumpy roads, especially if you do your tour with Enrique Pinacho, of Huatulco Tours Enrique. Email him at enriquepinachotours@gmail.com.

432515113.name: Magic Waterfalls
432515113.author: a TripAdvisor user
432515113.reviewBody: Highly recommend, cannot miss this beautiful day trip, water is nice & cool, you can go swimming into water caves & swing into water, day trip includes lunch cooked Mexican old-fashioned way, beautiful flowers & mountain nature

432382248.name: AWESOME!!!
432382248.author: a TripAdvisor user
432382248.reviewBody: The Waterfalls tour is a must!!! (Xpert Travel, available in every hotel ir touristic info center). After an accidented 1.5 hours path (with amazing views), you will be welcomed in an Antique Coffee Hacienda. Aromathic strong coffee, tamales and then a small walk (about 10 min long) to get to amazing beautiful clear waterfalls. Swimming, jumping from above the rocks is something to enjoy!  After the fresh adventure, in the Hacienda awaits a Oaxaca typical delicious meal: Mole negro, pork in Tamarindo sauce, rice, black beans, homemade tortillas and Jamaica drinks (also Mezcal, for those adventurous enough \ud83d\ude09). Guides explain perfectly processing and making of Mezcal and Coffe (also in english). ---Caution: be prepared and use  LOTS of repellent, since the mosquitos are ferocious, specially after swimming. The recomendation is to use the one elaborated in Mazunte. Easy to get anywhere around here, cheap, ECO-FRIENDLY, and it helps local economy \ud83d\ude43). Dont be afraid to help yourself with local herbs, chocolate, salty garlic... it is worthy!

428562659.name: Just beautiful
428562659.author: a TripAdvisor user
428562659.reviewBody:
The falls are really nice there are really three ways to get there, 

1. take one of the many tours up there on a bus with a bunch of other people usually about 70 bucks a person 
2. Find a nice can driver pay him likely a 100 bucks and you are all good, however you will have to pay an entrance fee of 4 or 5 bucks per person so for 4 people it becomes quite reasonable 
3. Rent a car and drive up, this is how we often do it, but you must rent a jeep, truck or can, the road is rough and a little car doesn't do that we'll, you can do it just have to dodge a lot of potholes

Up at the top there is a resteraunt for food, booze and water however do bring some bottled water, towels and bathing suit and something to where on your feet that might get wet

428287958.name: Fountain of Youth
428287958.author: a TripAdvisor user
428287958.reviewBody: No need to book a tour. Find a friendly taxi driver in Huatulco and take a picnic for the day or get home made food served through the car window in the villages that lie on the way.
