If you leave early around 6 or 7am you will have the added bonus of being alone. The falls are about 90 minutes drive from Huatulco. with many scenic spots and stops of interest (like coffee growers and restaurants) on the way. It is a tour into the jungle and up the mountains with spectacular views and cool mountain air. There are 3 falls close together but the MAGIC FALLS are the ones to experience. The taxi driver will park the car down the stream and then you will be able to slowly meander the beautiful path up to the source of the cascading falls. On the way there are at least 6 spots where you can easily get into the water and swim and immerse yourself in the restoring energy of this pure and pristine mountain stream. Please, go and find out how amazing life can be and how beautiful this Cascading Waterfall of Nectar really is. It is a truly secret spot to restore your life force and connection with this earth.

426452317.name: loved this tour - long day but worth it
426452317.author: a TripAdvisor user
426452317.reviewBody: This is one of the most beautiful places in Huatulco - you take a van a long way on dirt roads (not the fun part) and then hike about 1/4 mile to the falls - Water is cold - the the waterfalls are GREAT

415952565.name: The majestic magic falls!
415952565.author: a TripAdvisor user
415952565.reviewBody: Amazing place to see, the falls actually concur along a river so I\'m sure there\'s much more to see than what we did but what we saw was beautiful. I read online to hire a private car but didn\'t feel up to arranging one so we did a group tour, which unfortunately left us not seeing as much as I had wanted to and following the schedule of the group. As an avid hiker and waterfall enthusiast I would have loved to do a couple hours of trekking around to see it all. But all in all though a good day and a must do!

412721727.name: Magic Falls info
412721727.author: a TripAdvisor user
412721727.reviewBody: My wife and I did a tour of Magic Falls with Pablo Narvaez. We were going to go with the Dreams guide. But fortunately we discovered Pablo. His personally guided tour with air conditioning is less than the Dreams tour which takes a truck load of people. Pablo took us early so we had the falls all to ourselves. Pablo speaks English and gave us lots of great information and stopped for pictures whenever we wanted him to. Pablo also took us surfing, whitewater rafting, ziplining, horseback riding and other interesting places in Hualtulco during the week we were their. We enjoyed every excursion with him. I highly recommend him for any excursions. His email address is pablo_rafting@yahoo.com

402916717.name: Relaxing, refreshing, and unique
402916717.author: a TripAdvisor user
402916717.reviewBody: What a beautiful event to do in nature. Went with my husband and cousins and we had an absolute blast. Very cool to see the life and villages on the drive up to the falls. Great lunch. Everyone was very happy and pleased.

399740071.name: So Beautiful
399740071.author: a TripAdvisor user
399740071.reviewBody: Hire a taxi to take you , much nicer than a bus full of people. Just be aware that \nThere are 2 stops on the way,and they ask for money to gain entrance . In all\nIt cost 4 of us maybe $20\'usa

397622623.name: Natural beauty and amazing day trip!!
397622623.author: a TripAdvisor user
397622623.reviewBody: We booked this as an excursion with another family, total of 3 kids and 5 adults. A private van picked us up and took us on the 1 & 1/2 hour journey to the Magic Falls. A bit of a bumpy ride, but so with it! Van was stocked with drinks for kids and adults. Once we arrived, to Finca La Gloria, they received us with freshly made coffee and cookies. We had a private guide take us on the 20 minute or so hike to the falls. Not very strenuous hike, since our young boys did it without a complaint. There were multiple natural pools and several waterfalls some taller than others. A must if you visit Huatulco!

391529628.name: Beautiful nature experience
391529628.author: a TripAdvisor user
391529628.reviewBody: Nice refreshing water fall. There\'s many levels that you can jump, there\'s little fish everywhere! Great place to visit.

390860155.name: in family
390860155.author: a TripAdvisor user
390860155.reviewBody: Excellent plance to go and enjoy the nature, a good organic 1st hand mescal and good coffee, the plance is amazing.

389374821.name: Serene and scenic
389374821.author: a TripAdvisor user
389374821.reviewBody: Completely enjoyed this tour!! From the hiking, to the swimming, and the FOOD!! Don\'t skip out on paying extra for the meal!! Worth every dollar spent! Great time!! The water was refreshing! Our tour guides were friendly and helpful. They carried our things from one spot to another while we were in the water.

387603099.name: Amazing place to swim! Super Clean
387603099.author: a TripAdvisor user
387603099.reviewBody: This place was truly amazing, I would recommend Huatulco Tours Enrique, he know all the good spots! He knew where the great pictures where at and he leaded the way because it could be kind of slippery!

386219165.name: Waterfalls great
386219165.author: a TripAdvisor user
386219165.reviewBody: The waterfalls were wonderful. The adults and children both loved it in our group. The water was cold and refreshing which we needed after the 1 1/2hr ride up there. The tour guide was wonderful Frankie but the company was not. Was late leaving by about a hour because they filled the van and had to wait for the people to show up. The meal included was really good and they accommodated my child which is allergic to nuts. The coffee plantation was ok but could of done without and just stayed at the waterfalls since they were so nice.The road up there was a little sketchy but part of the adventure and neat seeing the villages on way up.

377974067.name: Amazing tour
377974067.author: a TripAdvisor user
377974067.reviewBody: Best tour we did during our week stay in Huatulco. Highly recommended. Lunch at the coffee plantation was fabulous!

376490129.name: Worst State To Visit In Mexico
376490129.author: a TripAdvisor user
376490129.reviewBody: Let me start off by saying that the waterfalls are beautiful, the beaches are beautiful. But it is NOT SAFE. I went there a year ago and we got mugged on the dirt road. 5 men in clown masks were pointing a gun at the tourist van. There were about 7 Tourists in it. They tried to open the door to the van but since the door had problems all day they were unable to and with time constraint they ended up letting us go but before doing so we had to give them everything we had through the passenger window. Oaxaca is not a safe state. We definitely were lucky they didn\'t get us out of that van.

372348830.name: Great excursion
372348830.author: a TripAdvisor user
372348830.reviewBody: Took this excursion from our Hotel in Huatulco.  It was fairly inexpensive and was followed by a coffee plantation tour with lunch.  This is a great place to visit but bring pool shoes/aqua socks.  It can be slippery.

370705371.name: Simply Beautiful
370705371.author: a TripAdvisor user
370705371.reviewBody:
What a great day at the falls. Can't remember how many falls we saw but lots of them.
 Went with the Sunwing wing tour. Around $65 US when combined with the snorkel and bays tour so $130 for both. We left from Secrets at 8:50 am with a quick stop at Dreams. Nice clean mini van with very good AC.There were 7 of us. Our guide was with Oscar and he is just an amazing guy.
The ride takes you along a 26km road from the turn off on hwy 200  towards the airport. The first 5km are paved and a few in the middle through some of the villages have been also. The road was freshly graded through the hillside. Not nearly as bad as I expected. This was May.
 We stopped along the way at a couple of villages and to take pictures of the Copalita river. Our ride was just under 2 hours but very leisurely. Oaxaca is one of the poorest states in Mexico and is was very heart warming to see how simple everyone lives.
 We visited 2 main areas of the falls. It was a 10 minute walk to the first one. The second one a little more adventurous but not far. We did not use water shoes but some might want to as some sections are slippery.
 Going through caves and inside a couple of the water falls was so much fun.  We had lots of time to swim and take pictures. The water was so refreshing as it was so hot outside. Tons of shade so no worries.  I would recommend a basic water proof camera to take with you for the best pictures. They have a place to buy drinks, beer and snacks.
 There we not many people and at times we had the falls to ourselves or with only a few others..  
A nice lunch was provided in a private jungle setting with bbq steak and veggies .So good. One has to try the hibiscus juice.
 On the way back we did  lots of coffee, chocolate beans and  Mescal tasting as well as other things and I bought lots of stuff.  Oscar also brought us to his home he is slowly building and met his young family. What a wonderful man.
 We were back at Secrets before 5pm. A truly enjoyable day.

369321822.name: Warm Tropical Swimming Holes
369321822.author: a TripAdvisor user
369321822.reviewBody: Our tour guide Omar (who also leads the Hagia Sophia tour) took us on a day trip up to the Cascadas Magicas. On the journey to the cascades, you get a glimpse of many small communities tucked inside the endless rolling green hills. While the road does get bumpy, it wasn\'t as bad as I thought. Omar led us on short hikes to three cascades where we climbed through small caves,  jumped off mini water falls, and swam below in the warm natural pools. \n\nThere is easy access to the lower pools. If you\'re feeling adventurous and would like to climb up rocks and through small caves to reach the higher pools, I recommend wearing water shoes with great traction since the rocks are super slippery. If you\'re not into swimming, the easy hiking and beautiful flora and fauna will still make the trip worthwhile so don\'t forget to bring your camera!

368755532.name: Great Day
368755532.author: a TripAdvisor user
368755532.reviewBody: This is a must. The hike is easy and the scenery is amazing. Great swimming also.My Wife and I got to know an excellent cab driver that drove and guided us to several places. Magic Falls was one of them. We recommended Edgar Escobar, our driver and guide, to other people we met in the Huatulco area. They could not believe the great service he gave. Edgar speaks perfect English and Spanish which comes in handy when you need a translator. He\'s really kind of like a Guide but a lot cheaper. I would highly recommend Edgar Escobar for all you taxi, tours and any help you need in the Huatulco area. Edgar can be contacted at 1-958-589-2052. Call him in the daytime as he does not get cellular service at his home in the evening. We would just get our hotel front desk to call him.

366586843.name: A great day out at the waterfalls!
366586843.author: a TripAdvisor user
366586843.reviewBody: Enrique picked us up & took us on a wonderful tour of two different waterfalls, one with a small cave you can go through, that takes you out behind the falls. The natural beauty of the areas is stunning. Enrique took us for a delicious lunch at a place that roasts the coffee beans & where you can buy it.\nThe dirt road wasn\'t that bad as it\'s the dry season. Enrique was an excellent & guide, who was concerned with your safely at the falls. He came in with us & helped us. I wouldn\'t hesitate to recommend him!

366420536.name: Long twisty dusty road to get there, but worth it.
366420536.author: a TripAdvisor user
366420536.reviewBody: Just like in the movies, a Tarzan swing over the highest rocks into the lagoon, nice waterfall, secluded area.

366118058.name: Day trip to the falls
366118058.author: a TripAdvisor user
366118058.reviewBody: This is the second trip we booked through Tony Lopez and we were extremely satisfied with his services. It was just the five of us in a modern van with AC and our guide/driver. He spoke English and gave us a brief description of each areas that we visited, stopped when we wanted to take pictures etc. The falls is too beautiful to be described, water and flora is absolutely amazing. The food offered at the "ranch" in the mountains was authentic Mexican cuisine and absolutely delicious. We liked the fact that the trip was not rushed or scheduled in any way and we also got to wear a honey and mud face mask, perfect for skin exfoliation.\nNote: A portion of the trip was bumpy as there is no paved road to get there. If you have severe motion sickness issues or back problems, you may want to check with the tour operator first.

365000040.name: Simply a must do
365000040.author: a TripAdvisor user
365000040.reviewBody: It is a long trip and rough, we went in a taxi, but the end result was fabulous. It is definitely a must do if your in the area.

363488616.name: Beautiful walk
363488616.author: a TripAdvisor user
363488616.reviewBody: The falls were amazing. Make sure you wear water shoes as the rocks are slippery. It was fun cooling off under the falls

360465875.name: Magic Falls and Cascadas Llano Grande are both falls on the same river. The best excursion of the trip.
360465875.author: a TripAdvisor user
360465875.reviewBody:
The difference is the property around Magic Falls is owned by one family and Cascadas Llano Grande is benefiting several families who have formed a cooperative. A wonderful day.  No only did we learn a lot about the communities on the road to the falls but also had fun at the falls and had a delicious meal followed by a hands on explanation of coffee processing.
A few things to know before you go:  It is about a 10 hour day and we did not eat until 3:30 so pack some water and snacks.  Wear your bathing suit but take a change of clothes so you are not sitting in a wet bathing suit after the falls.  Bring water shoes to change into.  The rocks are slippery.  There are rudimentary changing rooms with dirt floors.  Bring extra money for tips, snacks, coffee beans and mud masks.  There were no mosquitos when we were there in March but don't know about other times of the year.  
Pick up for the trip is at your hotel.  We went in a van and there were 10 of us - 8 Mexicans and 2 Canadians (us).  Our guide Juan-Carlos was excellent.  He spoke good English and gave interesting explanations of the country-side as we made our 2 hour trip to the falls.  It is 30 km up a narrow winding dirt road with many pot holes and large rocks.  Some of the route wound its way up treed mountains and some through villages of cement houses. There were also areas of planted cactus and corn as well as coffee trees.  We stopped 1/2 way up the mountain to learn about natural herbal remedies from a flamboyant Spanish speaking man of about 58 who had cures from cervical cancer to arthritis.  We tasted organic honey, mescal and our legs were sprayed with a mixture of marijuana and water apparently to aid circulation.  
On our way up the mountain we passed the entrance to Magic Falls.  The two sights are on the Copalitilla river which I assume is a tributary of the Copalita river - the largest river of the Huatulco area.   
Once the van was parked we had a short walk up and down some hills on a dirt path by the river until we came to the 1st falls.  There was a wooden platform from which one could jump 8 meters into 3 meters of water or continue down the path and wade into the water, up the rocks of the waterfall to jump off around 3 meters of height.  At the second falls there was a rope suspended from a tall tree above the falls.  Once you climbed up the water falls you could swing and land in the pool of water.  Lots of fun for my 12 year-old son.  Both falls were beautiful and under each of them was a small cave.  Once you ventured under the cascading water you were treated to a view of miniature stalactites dripping with water.  At the first falls our faces were covered with a red clay paste that we then washed off at the second falls.
After changing out of wet bathing suit and shoes our group took the path up the hill again to our lunch place where we were fed chicken in mole sauce, favorful pork pieces, black beans, rice and tortillas - cookies for dessert. There was also shots of mescal to taste and a fruit punch drink.  Beer could be had for 25 pesos.  Lunch was followed by an explanation of coffee processing in a shed where the beans were roasted.  There was then opportunity to buy the organic beans, red mud paste and other herbal products produced in the region. Then on to the van and on our way.  We were back at the resort by 7 p.m.  A satisfying and worthwhile outing.

360379276.name: Quite a hike from the Resorts but worth it!
360379276.author: a TripAdvisor user
360379276.reviewBody: We used a service that we found in La Crucecita - very minimal cost and got a REAL Mexican experience.  They did not speak much English but were friendly and accommodating.  Going through rural Mexico was amazing and the falls themselves were great.  Stopped for an authentic Mexican lunch (not an "authentic" Mexican lunch - a REAL Authentic Mexican lunch - remember no one else spoke English)  Great time!

359805243.name: Great activity with teenagers
359805243.author: a TripAdvisor user
359805243.reviewBody: We rented a private van for our group of 4 adults and 5 teenage boys.  The ride up to the falls is about an hour on bumpy roads.  If you have a bad back, this might be quite painful for you.  The falls are a lot of fun. Our guide Omar Iniestra was exceptional; he has lived in Canada for a long time, so if you are Canadian, please try and contact him.  He saw that our group was game for anything, so he took us to a third set of waterfalls that was more challenging; the boys loved it.  His number is 958-101-7657 or masterchef@hotmail.com.  Wear water shoes!

359318668.name: Beautiful
359318668.author: a TripAdvisor user
359318668.reviewBody: 4 couples took and taxi to the falls, nice country drive. Well worth the long drive . Had lunch at one of the local restaurants, saw making of hand made tortia,love people and scenery.

359174619.name: Amazing time swimming in the falls!
359174619.author: a TripAdvisor user
359174619.reviewBody: Enrique Pinacho took us on a wonderful tour to the Magic Falls where we spent a lot of time swimming and sitting under the many falls. We even swam in a cave! We had the most amazing lunch in the mountains with authentic Mexican foods, coffee and Mezcal! Thanks Enrique for a very memorable trip!

359118999.name: One of the highlights of the trip!
359118999.author: a TripAdvisor user
359118999.reviewBody: Soooo much fun!! The trip to the falls is a history lesson in itself. I\'m pretty sure we had the best guide of all. When you get to the falls, get the clay facial. The lunch was incredible. The mole was the best I have ever eaten. Just a great trip! It was interesting that 1/2 of our van spoke only Spanish and we spoke only English...and we bonded! It was wonderful.

359067028.name: Refreshing after a long walk
359067028.author: a TripAdvisor user
359067028.reviewBody: A unique experience walking thru the jungle and coming to a refreshing waterfall. The price was reasonable and the driving distance was to.

357678955.name: Beautiful and a lot of fun
357678955.author: a TripAdvisor user
357678955.reviewBody: We enjoyed this trip especially at magic falls...!!! They gave us such delicious Mole and Tamarind pork, coffe, deserts.  Very safe and they took care about us all the time.

356910954.name: Natures Beauty
356910954.author: a TripAdvisor user
356910954.reviewBody: Visiting the falls in the Sierra Madres was a good day trip. The roads are rough and bumpy climbing the hillsides but you get to see a lot of small towns along the way. It\'s a long day! Took over two hours to drive up. Then another 30 minute walk through the forest stopping at all the smaller fall areas along the way to get to the main fall area. It\'s quite beautiful and very refreshing to swim in the water. Be sure to go into the caves that come out through the falls. The trip we took included a BBQ lunch with some of the local so you won\'t go hungry. The trip back was 1.5 hours because there was no more stops. It\'s a full day but worth the time.

356639074.name: Cool Off & Enjoy Nature
356639074.author: a TripAdvisor user
356639074.reviewBody: I booked at tour to the Magic Falls through my fishing captain.  I was picked up at my hotel as promised in a comfortable air conditioned van.  By the time we left town there were 9 of us ready for adventure.  The drive to the falls is enjoyable going through small communities and enjoying the views of the beautiful Sierra Madre Mountains.  Once we arrived at the falls we cooled off in the cool but comfortable fresh waters of the mountains.  After a couple of hours we enjoyed a wonderful Mexican meal of Chicken Mole and fresh tortillas, refreshing Jamaica flavored water and cold beers.  A great way to spend a Sunday meeting new people and learning more about the area.

355417599.name: Well worth the trip
355417599.author: a TripAdvisor user
355417599.reviewBody: We scheduled a trip to Magic Falls and a smaller water falls and a trip to a coffee plantation through Huatulco Tours Enrique. It was fabulous! Enrique started us at the smaller tour first. It was only Enrique and my wife and I. It was like paradise. Then we had lunch at a coffee plantation and then on to Magic Falls. It is very refreshing to swim in and under the water falls. You can climb behind the falls and wade through the pools and eventually come out the other side. It is a little bit of a hike through the jungle to get here but well worth the trip. Also, the roads leading up to Magic Falls are mostly dirt roads and quite dusty. I am glad we had a private tour car with air conditioning. This was the highlight of our trip to Huatulco this year. Highly recommend it.

355371034.name: Great day at the falls!
355371034.author: a TripAdvisor user
355371034.reviewBody: You can either walk in the water to get to the falls or walk along the path beside the water.  Water shoes would be recommended. If using the rope to go down beside the falls, be very careful as the rocks are slippery and you will get some cuts and bruises. Definitely go in the cave behind the falls. When we were done, a delicious lunch was waiting for us.

355051559.name: Be Sure to Climb Through the Caves and Out Through the Falls
355051559.author: a TripAdvisor user
355051559.reviewBody: Yes it is a long and bumpy mostly dirt road.  I would not want to do this in the rainy season.  There are two main sets of falls, both reached by pleasant, shady and green paths.\nMy first stop was at a place with a sign for \'Doctor\'s Magic Falls\'.  There is parking and food available there.  There is a small entrance fee and a guide will walk you to the largest of the falls where you can crawl through a small opening and emerge through the falls.  There is a second cave-like entrance for a smaller falls, lots of swimming opportunities and a rope swing.\nMy second stop also had a small admission fee, then we were free to stroll along the river with many small pools which look like sculpted travertine.  There is no food available here unless you arrange in advance and they do permit camping.  The only other option for food in the area is a coffee plantation (food is good there but go after the bus tours leave). There is a more natural cave to climb through and several large pools for swimming.  I went during the off-season and there were few other tourists.  I just wish they would improve the road so it would be easier to return.

354896861.name: Nice refreshing getaway!
354896861.author: a TripAdvisor user
354896861.reviewBody: We went there for the day. Had a really nice time! Our tour guide was every friendly. It was a long bumpy ride up and down the mountain but well with the trip. We were served a really nice lunch and go to sample some local liquors and coffee which we could buy to take home. The hike to the waterfall was very neat and of course the natural spring waterfall was spectacular to see and we were able to jump off the rocks and also explore the cave behind the waterfall!! A really nice experience and would recommend it to everyone!

353146070.name: Wonderful experience.
353146070.author: a TripAdvisor user
353146070.reviewBody: We booked this trip through one of the street vendors in La Crucecita and enjoyed the drive into the mountains and through all the villages (the price was almost worth the drive to see how the mountain people live) with our guide Marcos.  Once we parked the van (thankfully it was air conditioned), we had a short climb to the base where there was an outdoor restaurant, washrooms and change rooms.  Once we got into our swim suits and water shoes (a must), Marcos took us up a short path to the waterfalls where we climbed through a small short tunnel to get in behind the falls with his help.  The water was cool and refreshing and there is a lot of water coming over the falls so be careful.  We walked through the falls on the rocks which can be a bit slippery so I was glad for my water shoes.  It was great.  Further down the river are smaller falls with a swimming hole and a swinging rope - great fun.  We then headed back to the base where we were treated to a Mexican lunch cooked over a wood fire - chicken and rice in a mole sauce with black beans - very tasty.  Lunch was included in the cost but the beer was not - not a big deal as it was cheap.  The ride back was just as interesting as the ride in.  Good way to spend the day.

352991314.name: Great day trip!
352991314.author: a TripAdvisor user
352991314.reviewBody:
We booked this tour through our hotel, Quinta Bella.  We were not disappointed. The drive is interesting, down a winding road back into the Sierra Madres. We drove many villages. Had a stop at the coffee plantation, sampled mezcal and had a presentation of the local good for sale.  Funny thing is the girl spoke in Spanish. Could not understand a thing. But enjoyed the process.
The falls are a short hike down a well marked path. Not difficult. The first stop had little cascades with a mini ave that you could swim under. The Magic Falls has ropes you can swing off of but the water is quite shallow. You can walk through behind the waterfall which is lot of fun.  Overall very relaxing. One of the local girls will also apply a mud mask to you face which can be washed off at the Magic Falls..
To end our day, we enjoyed a traditional Oaxacan meal with our group. Very yummy!
We finally got back to our hotel around 630. It is a full day but worth it!

352263731.name: Extended Trip to the falls.
352263731.author: a TripAdvisor user
352263731.reviewBody: We took this trip at the end of January 2016 and bought it from the Hotel we were staying at even though we knew it was 100 pesos less in La Crucecita. The van picked us up in the morning at 9 am and then drove to Secrets and picked up 6 more then we were off up into the mountains on a rough, windy road. The guide was very informative and chatted about different things as we drove. We then had a blow out from the drivers side rear tire and had to stop and change the tire. The guide/driver didn\'t know how to do this and a couple of the guys helped him out and did it for him. The spare tire was pretty much flat and only got us a mile further down the road before it disintegrated as well and we had to wait while they sent another van to get us from the coffee plantation 10 minutes up the road. When we were picked up again by the van I checked out the tires and found that they were 3 different brands and 2 were worn out. So, we were delayed quiet a while and ended up not seeing the Butterfly Place and we went home via a shortcut on a better road and came out on the highway by the airport instead of by the river. The trip to the waterfalls was beautiful and it was nice to see the back country but it went too long with a lot of time waiting. I am happy I did it but I would never do it again.

351621278.name: Visiting Magic Falls
351621278.author: a TripAdvisor user
351621278.reviewBody: We enjoyed our trip to Magic Falls. The day was gorgeous, the falls were beautiful and the water was clear and cool\n

349969582.name: Long and winding road...leads to a treasure
349969582.author: a TripAdvisor user
349969582.reviewBody: The falls themselves were beautiful but it is a very long ride up a bumpy curvy dusty road to get there. (It was 2hours on the mountain road .We booked ours private for 500 pesos each and we traveled in a nice van.  A cab would have been very uncomfortable I think.  Be sure your guide speaks English so he can tell you about the villages, the plants, etc. as that would be helpful and make the trip not as long.

349332070.name: Full day event, so so.
349332070.author: a TripAdvisor user
349332070.reviewBody:
We had 10 people so we organized a private van to take us on an off day. The falls were beautiful. But buyer beware the trip took is almost 2 hours to get there because we stopped at some "medicine man's shop" on the way there. On the way back it was a bit shorter maybe 1.5 hours. I found it was a lot of travel for the amount time we spent at the falls. Make no mistake the falls are so pretty and you can even swim and climb them. Keep in mind out of the 1.5-2 hour drive, 2/3 of it is on a rough gravel road sometimes even on the edge of a cliff. The driver told is (jokingly) we were getting a free Mexican massage! The tour operators gave us a bag of gravel when we booked our trip if that tells you anything. 

FYI: The lunch they provided was great, very tasty!

All in all... the falls were beautiful, but I don't think it's worth the long bumpy trek to get there.

348983485.name: Beautiful
348983485.author: a TripAdvisor user
348983485.reviewBody: It is a bit of a drive and a hike but the reward of the beauty of the falls is well worth it.  The water is cool and refreshing.  Well worth the visit.

348693569.name: Awesome
348693569.author: a TripAdvisor user
348693569.reviewBody: Went on this excursion booked though SunWing at our resort. It was a great day from start to finish.  Our guides Jairo in our group and Ramiro in the other were a lot of fun and provided informative and often humorous information along the way.  The road is rough and slow going but so worth it.  The falls are beautiful and we felt very safe navigating the swim and climb with our guides. The lunch after was plentiful and delicious. I would recommend this excursion but it could be a long day for those who do not actually climb the falls.

348046297.name: Great Falls but a long and bumpy road to get there.
348046297.author: a TripAdvisor user
348046297.reviewBody: My Wife and I booked this trip online, the price was reasonable compared to the same tour offered in the hotel, this is an all day trip and although the stops were interesting the drive there takes about 1 1/2 hours over dusty unpaved roads. On arrival there is a long but pleasant walk following the river until you get to the falls also known as Emerald Falls where you can swim, swing on a rope or walk under or beneath the falls. On the way back we stopped for a very pleasant lunch.

347999029.name: Breathtaking Scenery
347999029.author: a TripAdvisor user
347999029.reviewBody: This tour was amazing and the scenery was breathtaking.The falls were so beautiful--you need to see to believe. Getting to the falls meant travelling on a rough dirt road for over an hour but the reward was well worth it with much to see along the way. We owe our awesome experience to our tour guide, Omar. He spoke excellent English and was so knowledgeable on everything we questioned him about. We highly recommend him. His contact information is 958-100-7732, e-mail omarnavahux@gmail.com. You will not be disappointed with Omar as your guide.

347873142.name: Worth it!
347873142.author: a TripAdvisor user
347873142.reviewBody: This is a must do if you are staying in the Huatulco region. There are 3 different entrances to the falls, all roughly 1.5 hours from town. We only did one location, but next time I would hire my own car and do all 3. The road is fairly rough but well worth it once you arrive. The waterfalls are beautiful with plenty of different pools and caves to swim in.

346898811.name: best excursion ever
346898811.author: a TripAdvisor user
346898811.reviewBody:
first off the tour guide Alex was so amazing. he knows his stuff. the ride on the bus was long but the beer they served on the bus made the time fly by. once you see the falls the long bus ride seems like nothing. The falls are so wonderful we loved climbing behind the falls and relaxing inthe cave. we also jumped off the cliff which was so fun, scary but fun 
the lunch they serve after is all made locally and is really tasty. 
this tour was one of our favorites. 
Alex is the best, thanks for talking us into this tour, we LOVED it

346558770.name: Must See
346558770.author: a TripAdvisor user
346558770.reviewBody: Long drive down a bumpy gravel road,long walk,but well worth it. You don\'t want to miss this experience.

345571435.name: 3 falls one Great Adventure
345571435.author: a TripAdvisor user
345571435.reviewBody:
We went on a different route to the falls , the Zimatan river route and back to the resort taking the San Miguel del Puerto, i am glad I asked our driver to take the different routes , was great to see some different villages and areas . The Zimatan route has much rougher roads , but has a beautiful small town to stop and take some gorgeous pictures , STA . Maria Xadani , was the town , I will post some picts of it . 
There are 3 different gates to the falls , 3 areas , Las Brisas , Magic, Llano Grande . We went to 2 of them , Magic and Las Brisas . If I had to pick one to visit , Las Brisas would be the one , Hands Down ,much easier to walk, more falls to see , and more scenic . I would have been let down ,if we just visited Magic , thinking a lot of the pictures you see posted , saying Magic falls , are actually Las Brisas . The falls you see with a cave near the bottom, is Las Brisas
We went for the lunch at La Gloria , which is a spot where everyone seems to go ,as it is right there ,it is at Llano Grande . I wouldn't rave about the lunch we had , for the group of us ,7 including the driver , the wives don't eat pork , and the gravy the chicken was in was awful, wasn't much of a lunch . We would have been much better off spending the  $1000 pecos at a real authentic restaurant in one of the small villages , where we could pick what we wanted . I must admit , the pork was very good though . At this location , there is a coffee plantation , where you can take the tour . We didn't take it , wanted to get back to the resort . 
The roads to the falls are only very rough , when you get to the falls area , not to bad most of the way . Take some gravol if you have a weak stomach . 
We had a great day out , and it is highly recommended .

345460012.name: Awesome experience, but be prepared for long hike and drive
345460012.author: a TripAdvisor user
345460012.reviewBody: Wear your water shoes!! Be prepared for a long, bumpy ride up the mountain.  The roads are in very rough shape. Also, be prepared for climbing stairs, slopes and slippery rocks while at the falls. However, also be prepared for an amazing waterfall set in a rain forest. It is absolutely stunning to see. The water is crystal clear and wonderful to jump into and swim in. We had a great meal of chicken, rice, beans and fresh tortillas....it was fantastic! Driving through the little villages and seeing the "real" Mexico was an experience I will never forget.

344369954.name: Excellent day trip.
344369954.author: a TripAdvisor user
344369954.reviewBody: Magic Falls are lovely. I thought the best part of the day trip was seeing all the small mountain villages along the way. It is a long drive from the resorts for a fairly short time at the falls but certainly worth it to see it once.

344136516.name: Much more than expected
344136516.author: a TripAdvisor user
344136516.reviewBody: This excursion was more than just a trip to the falls.  We learned so much about the area from our guide, Alex, and enjoyed our hike through the rain forest along the beautiful terrain.

343303986.name: Magic Falls Rock!!!!
343303986.author: a TripAdvisor user
343303986.reviewBody:
Enjoy the ride up to the falls and be prepare to be amazed. 
If you are renting a car and driving up to the falls be prepare for a crazy ride through the mountains of Oaxaca.
When you get there you will very happy you made the trek... 
Don't go if you are afraid to try new things outside the luxury of your 5 start resort. The drive and walk to falls is not for the faint of heart. You need to be adventurous and ready to do something outside the normal tourist things.

342656403.name: Worth every penny!
342656403.author: a TripAdvisor user
342656403.reviewBody: This was a great trip that we took.  I am not usually open to claiming falls as I have a slight fear of water etc.  However I climbed the falls.  Went into the cave and climbed down.  If I had known what I would have had to do - I would have doubted that I could.  But I did.  HOWEVER people should be told about the cave and about going through the falls (the water) to get back down.  This tour involves a lot of walking on unlevel and slightly slippery stones - and would not be for all people .

341538071.name: Magic falls
341538071.author: a TripAdvisor user
341538071.reviewBody: Falls were great and lots of fun.  Got to dive into the river from various heights and swing from a rope.  Great scenery on the drive up but the roads are bad and the drive is about 2 hours  each way.  On the edge of severe drops with no barrier on many occasions.  Not for the faint of heart but falls were great.

338869952.name: Wow!
338869952.author: a TripAdvisor user
338869952.reviewBody: We actually visited two different waterfalls. Our taxi driver, Enrique Pinacho speaks impeccable English and knows where the really good places are. He actually changed out of his uniform and into trunks, etc so that we would know where it was safe and where it wasn\'t. He wanted to give us the fullest experience possible. The falls are gorgeous with lots of caves to visit and ropes to jump from. He did jump from one rope and then told us it wasn\'t safe for us to jump. He said we might get hurt because it just wasn\'t deep enough. I felt really comfortable engaging in all the activities. He even carried our beer cooler! After a few exhausting hours playing in the falls, we went to a place called Finca la Gloria for a late lunch where they were waiting for us and we had unlimited delicious chicken with mole, sumptuous pork, beans, rice etc . All in all a pretty tiring day but definitely well worth the trip. Oh, and I would highly recommend getting a hold of our driver as he was more like a tour guide than a driver!

336977719.name: Great day trip, we had an awesome guide with great english.
336977719.author: a TripAdvisor user
336977719.reviewBody: Ecological sensitive area in the Sierra Madres that was one of the highlights of our trip. We did this trip that included a coffee plantation tour with a traditional home cooked meal. We traveled through many native communities in the mountains and got to learn a lot about the local culture, life styles, economies and architecture. The waters at the falls are as pristine as are the surroundings on the hike in. This trip would not be recommended for those that do not have a minimum hiking stature or stamina.

336719586.name: Awesome day once the ride up is over!
336719586.author: a TripAdvisor user
336719586.reviewBody: First off this is a 9 hour day, so be prepared.  We booked the tour in town for $40 Cad PP, much cheaper than the $75 US the westjet rep at the hotel quoted us, but the company that it was booked with jambed 14 people into a van that should have seated 12. The road is brutal and is not a very comfortable ride.  You forget about it when you arrive at  the falls.  They are absolutely beautiful, pristine clean water and worth the trip.  The lunch at the authentic restaurant was also excellent.  The ride down was just as brutal as coming up but at least our bellies were full!  A definite must do tour, but not sure I would do it a second time.

334723579.name: Off the grid adventures
334723579.author: a TripAdvisor user
334723579.reviewBody: What a wonderful and cool experience!! The ride up was eye opening to see how this culture lives. We visited a coffee plantation and had a meal that I will never forget! Pictures do not do this place justice.

329724504.name: Worth the Drive?
329724504.author: a TripAdvisor user
329724504.reviewBody:
A great adventure. There were 3 locations to choose from. Our driver chose one which was lots of fun with 4 pools and a tall fall. The water was great and we had an hour of fun before a nice lunch.
We started out on a tour that was supposed to only have 7 or 8 people which ended up a full load of 13 people. We complained and got out of the vehicle, The tour owner quickly responded with a  private car and english driver. Of the 1.5 hour drive to the falls one hour was on terrible dirt roads.
I would not take this tour again because of the roads. I would not even take my own vehicle over those roads.
But if you do get to the falls you will have a great time.

327205932.name: A favorite tour of ours in Huatulco
327205932.author: a TripAdvisor user
327205932.reviewBody: My wife and I love going to Magic Waterfalls, and have now been there 3 times. The road to get there is nothing special and is bumpy, windy, and in general disrepair however as previously mentioned in other reviews, you soon forget about the road once you arrive. The walk up along the river is very easy for anyone with very few spots that require climbing. There are lots of nice, peaceful stops along the river for photos and just to stop and rest. The waterfalls themselves are great. These are not towering waterfalls where the water drops 100\' or anything, but they are fun to swim in, and walk up. There is a cave you can climb into and they climb up through the rushing water and out a different location. The cave is only for people that can pull themselves up a steep rock face using a rope, otherwise the rest of the waterfalls are reasonable easy to climb. The river is cool but clear and fresh and fantastic to swim in, once you get used to the water temperature. The walk back to the parking lot is much shorter and downhill most of the way so very easy. The food if you decide to also have lunch there is delicious and authentic Oaxacan so worth having lunch there. Over all a great tour and location. We have met the owner of the water falls and he and his family are great people. We will back for sure. I highly recommend this tour to anyone looking to get off the beach for a half day to do something else.

325981937.name: Amazing!!
325981937.author: a TripAdvisor user
325981937.reviewBody: It was a great experience.  The food was excellent.  The waterfalls are awesome.  Went behind the waterfall through the cave.

325606243.name: Amazing hidden beauty
325606243.author: a TripAdvisor user
325606243.reviewBody: We took a guided tour to the falls and our guide made the trip really enjoyable. The falls were super clean and fresh water!

324423668.name: Much more beautiful than in pictures.
324423668.author: a TripAdvisor user
324423668.reviewBody: We took a tour with a company called Bahias Plus.  They made sure Safety was their top priority.  They were great!

318941305.name: Best experience of my life!
318941305.author: a TripAdvisor user
318941305.reviewBody: Theres a cave under waterf. soo amazing u enter path climb rock to get at the top of the waterfal. The waterfall is soo strong. I couldn\'t open my I eyes to see how to exit on top o waterf so we jus accept massage fr waterfall and lay there

311383048.name: Natural beauty of Oaxaca
311383048.author: a TripAdvisor user
311383048.reviewBody: Nice group of small waterfalls with swimming at each one. There is a restaurant right at the start of the trail that serves traditional food of the region. The mole was to die for. The only down side is the roads to get there. about an 1-1/4 of rough, bumpy roads. When you get there you forget about the roads, really remote jungle. Bring mosquito repellent, they are pretty numerous.

299386311.name: A great nature experience
299386311.author: a TripAdvisor user
299386311.reviewBody: This is a great place to visit for nature lovers since the vegetation and waterfalls are exquisite. The food on most of the guided trips is excellent.

293185342.name: Beautiful views riding up to the water falls!
293185342.author: a TripAdvisor user
293185342.reviewBody: This was my best activity!  Our tour guide did a wonderful job explaining lots of history !  The water falls were beautiful !  Lunch provided was very good!  Overall I loved it !

289852713.name: Finca la Gloria, Magic Falls
289852713.author: a TripAdvisor user
289852713.reviewBody: This was one of my favorite day trips while in Huatulco.  My daughter and a close friend booked the trip through Carmel in Crucecita and it was super affordable.  Jose Luis picked us up at our hotel and we headed out.  He talked and shared things during the entire drive up the mountain.  It was very interesting and we saw animals and learned about the trees along the way.  We were glad we took pills for motion sickness -- long, bumpy ride but soooo worth it.  When you arrive, it\'s breath-taking.  The falls are located on Finca la Gloria -- we saw coffee plants, beautiful flora, local people and then hiked the waterfalls.  It was not difficult as in strenuous, but it took some bravery to crawl through the hole into the cave, and then hike around slippery rocks.  Wear your tennis shoes and don\'t be afraid to get wet!  The pools are very cool and refreshing and we loved jumping off a high rock and swinging on a rope into one of the larger pools.  We were then treated to a delicious, simple meal cooked outside and by the owner.  There were geese, dogs, a duck and chickens roaming.  We stopped at a small shack and had coffee and chocolate on the way back. This trip was truly magical and we were fulfilled and exhausted by the end of the day.  We want to go back.  One of the best days.......ever.

283292576.name: If you get there ..... It\'s worth it
283292576.author: a TripAdvisor user
283292576.reviewBody: The ride is 2 hours ...... No asphalt ! The road is so dangerous And God forbid if it\'s raining.... If you still want to go at least go in SUV.  \n

265939021.name: Loved it!
265939021.author: a TripAdvisor user
265939021.reviewBody: The scenery was fantastic... and the water was beautiful.. loved the swim.. very refreshing. Climbing the falls was a great challenge.

265505106.name: Long ride, but cool refreshing visit
265505106.author: a TripAdvisor user
265505106.reviewBody: Loved the food at the end and the swim in the pool beneath the falls.  Even the trip was ok, but be warned it\'s a windy narrow mountain gravel/dirt road.

263168130.name: Alejandro! Great tour guide
263168130.author: a TripAdvisor user
263168130.reviewBody: Magic falls was such an amazing experience, it was absolutely breath taking. Our tour guide made the tour even better. Absolutely loved it. It\'s physically demanding, wouldn\'t recommend it to older people, or people with complications. If you have the opportunity to go on this tour, do it! You will NOT regret it!!

263066224.name: Pretty waterfalls, Terrible drive
263066224.author: a TripAdvisor user
263066224.reviewBody: If you are coming from Huatulco, the drive up is over 2 hours. (which they told us it was only a "little drive.") Once you head into the jungle, you are also on extremely bumpy roads, with a lot of turns, and no railings. You are essentially driving on a one way dirt path. Although the experience was cool, getting to see how they live the further you go up, i would caution anyone who gets motion sickness. They had water in the van, but when we were about 20 mins away, i ended up getting sick and they had to stop in a village along the way. Again, you are driving for over 2 hours, so bring something to help you if you get sick easily. Once we hiked to the waterfall, it was very beautiful. A little too cold for us, but a good experience. After the waterfall, you head to the village where a family makes you lunch and you get to see a coffee plantation, and how it works. The experience was overall good, but the drive was terrible. Takes a long time, and super bumpy. After about 3 hours up there, you then drive over 2 hours back to Huatulco.

261726475.name: Awesome Day Out
261726475.author: a TripAdvisor user
261726475.reviewBody: The falls are so refreshing and the jumping cliffs and Tarzan rope was a blast. The drive up is alittle bumppy but not as bad as some make it out to be. Totally worth going and getting away for the day. Lush and tropical all year as in the winter months around the coast is dry .

260605162.name: The long, bumpy drive is worth it!  Magical.
260605162.author: a TripAdvisor user
260605162.reviewBody:
We booked our tour through Apple Tours and had Tomas provide our tour for the day - he was passionate, fun and very professional.  He really made a great day for us!  There were enough of us to fill one van, so it became a bit of a private tour which was special.
Everyone talks about how rough the drive is - it really is.  It's 90 minutes + of off pavement driving up steep terrain.  If you get car sick, take some anti-nausea medication.  I did and it really helped.  The best part of the drive, though, is the communities you get to become a small part of as you drive through them.  
Once we reached the top, we were served (great!!) coffee (that you can purchase later after the tour - not pushy, though) and cookies.  Then we drove about 5 minutes further to a parking lot and hiked into the falls.  It is an extremely easy walk, but it is about 20 minutes or so with roots and rocks on the trail.  Once you arrive at the first falls (there are two... and Tomas timed it out so we missed the larger crowds due to the long weekend - thank you Tomas!), you can jump from a large drop (about 30 feet), scale up a rope or simply swim.  It is breathtaking - feels like you're right in a movie.  Great photo ops!  Then, if you want, you can move to the larger second set of falls.  The water is very cold, but not a big deal if you've swam in mountain water before.  If you're lucky, you'll also get a clay facial mask (try it!) and then after washing off, head back down to the main area near the parking lot for lunch.  
Lunch is great - I was impressed.  We had hibiscus juice, tortillas, chicken mole, pork, black beans, cactus salad, homemade hot sauce, rice... so good.  They served jello for dessert which was not my thing, but whatever.  They also serve drinks, but those are extra $ which we didn't mind!  Victoria beer is the best in Mexico!
After lunch we went for a walk around the property, then a quickie tour of the coffee and mescal they make.  The coffee is fantastic (bought a LOT) and the mescal that was surprisingly good (as I'm not really a fan) was the coffee mescal!  
The day was long, but fantastic.  Tomas really made it a great experience!

260269253.name: Unique experience
260269253.author: a TripAdvisor user
260269253.reviewBody: A rough  fairly long ride up the mountain roads to get there but once there a wonderful experience relaxing in the warm waterfalls. We had a good lunch after we spent time in the falls. There is a medium hike to the falls and very basic changing facilities / bathroom in the parking lot area. A great experience if you like nature and a unique experience. We went by private taxi so we were on our own time schedule and could stay as long or as little as we wanted.\n

259587763.name: waterfalls
259587763.author: a TripAdvisor user
259587763.reviewBody: long ruff trip good to see the country glad i did it.water was a little cool but a very nice place the walk to the second falls was very nice

259331427.name: Beautiful
259331427.author: a TripAdvisor user
259331427.reviewBody:
We have been to Huatutlco 5 time and I would go up there on a Tuesday early before all the tour group get up there. It a beautiful place to swim and relax in the rock chairs and drink a cold beer or jump off the swinging rope and have fun. We rent a taxi for the day Tourist Transportation we had a great driver Omar Nave spoke very good english and was very informed about the region. Also he arrange a lunch for us. We went with another couple and at one point we were the only people there it was great. 
Omar Nave 
cell: 958-100-7732
email: ofsbjnonava@yahoo.com

259153618.name: Emerald Falls
259153618.author: a TripAdvisor user
259153618.reviewBody: Emerald Falls, toured with Sunwing and JC as our tour guide who was fabulous.  Very informative.  Long cargo van ride up and down the mountain but the falls themselves were wonderful to see and swim in.  Were treated to a great lunch.

259112356.name: Cascadas Magicas -Well worth the dirt-road journey
259112356.author: a TripAdvisor user
259112356.reviewBody: This review is for Cascadas Magicas. Made this trip on February 27th, 2015 with two vehicles. (Nissan Xterra and stock Chevy Venture minivan with 6 people). Fortunately the road had been graded at some point since the last rainy season -with the exception of the steep final 5 km.  Roads were easily navigable by both vehicles. We drove about 1:45, driving very slowly for comfort and to minimize car-sickness. The road was good, and the scenery along the way interesting. Tip: Honk your horn when crossing the long concrete bridge over the river, and three delightful little boys will come running out to sell home-made tamales and other goodies. AT THE FALLS: be prepared to pay an entrance fee at the falls parking area. Access to the falls is through private land, so the families who own the land charge 60 pesos per adult and 20 pesos per child entrance fee. Right or wrong, that\'s the deal. (Unfortunately we were completely unaware of this, and only had 170 pesos with us -for 5 adults and 4 children. after much discussion the attendant reluctantly took it and wrote us out a receipt). THE FALLS: follow a primitive foot trail along the river and see many cascadas along the way. They claim there are 40. The best ones are at the end, which takes about 10 minutes on foot.  There are ropes to swing off, pools to dive into, a cave with water flowing through it that one can wade through, a cave that goes behind one of the waterfalls, and a little sitting area with a roof for shade.  We were blessed to have the entire place to ourselves all afternoon! Absolutely pristine location, crystal-clear water...we highly recommend making the journey.

258863008.name: Beautiful Park
258863008.author: a TripAdvisor user
258863008.reviewBody: Very nice park! The falls are beautiful with great swimming  below. Some adventurous people jumped from ledges beside and swung from ropes in front of the falls. You can sit under and walk under the falls.  Lots of walking to get to them but nothing anyone can\'t handle. Clear paths and we\'ll kept stairs. Walking sticks available in the parking lot. Very clean park!

256823638.name: Lovely spot; hard to get to!
256823638.author: a TripAdvisor user
256823638.reviewBody: I was all excited about going to see some beautiful waterfalls where you could swim. We were told it was an hours drive on a fairly good gravel road and it would take about an hour. I would advise anyone to seriously think twice before taking this trip. It was a 2 hour drive into the Sierra Madre mountains on a very challenging dirt road that deteriorates as you get further in. This is a ROUGH road. We drove a rental car, absolutely insane!! The tours go in vans and several people I spoke to said it was a very rough ride. I would suggest that this road is really only suitable for 4X4\'s. I can\'t imagine what it would be like in the rainy season! It is also a 2 hour drive back out again. The falls themselves are really a little paradise with multiple locations to swim in crystal clear aquamarine water with lots of butterflies flitting about. If you do decide to make the trip bring money for the entrance fee (I think it was about 100 pesos each) which includes parking and the use of toilets. Also bring food and drink because no vendors were open when we were there. However, I don\'t think it was worth the gruelling drive.

256221052.name: Good day out
256221052.author: a TripAdvisor user
256221052.reviewBody: We took this tour with Fabian from expert tours and had a wonderful day out, yes the road in is not the smoothest but that added to the experience. We were a group of 9 from the Las Brisas  and we have never had a better group{ hi to Phil & Geri, Sonja & Paulo and Fran & Holly}. It was a long tour {we were gone about 10 hours} but a great time was had by all. The falls themselves were a nice refreshing way to spend some time, the Iguana farm and the coffee plantation were ok. We were served a great lunch of mole chicken and a pork dish that was very tasty. All in all it was a good time and we would do the tour again when we return to Huatulco

255630647.name: Refreshing!!
255630647.author: a TripAdvisor user
255630647.reviewBody: We visited these lovely little falls on our tour into the Sierra Madre during our week stay at Secrets. Yes, it is a long dusty trail to get here but it is worth the effort. We went here as part of a tour booked through our hotel and Oscar was our guide. An amazing man who speaks four languages fluently. He took us to an iguana farm and a home where we could learn how corn ( maize) tortillas are made and we sampled them with some fresh cacti!. We then toured a garden with medicinal plants and learned about how indigenous people use them. We arrived at the falls where they are just a short walk away along the river where we saw beautiful colourful butterflies and birds. We swam in the falls where it was sooooo cool and refreshing and my husband made me nervous when he swung off the rocks by the rope. On the way back we stopped for lunch at a picnic area where ladies cooked Mole chicken and rice and beans and we had a nice cold beer!! It was only less than 40 kilometres there and back but it took almost 2 hours to get there on a long windy dirt road through the mountains along the Copalita river. Lots of fun with a great guide, fantastic food, and nice folks!!

255489912.name: Swing and a hit!
255489912.author: a TripAdvisor user
255489912.reviewBody: This was a great little spot to visit! The water was perfect and I loved climbing up behind the waterfall! Ultimately, you climb about 10\' up and then rope-swing out of the waterfall into the pool below. It was so much fun! I know everyone comments on the road and it certainly was rough but I\'d highly recommend enduring the trip to experience this place!

253277178.name: Beautiful place
253277178.author: a TripAdvisor user
253277178.reviewBody: Loved swimming in the crystal clear water in these water falls. It was a bit busy when our tour first arrived but cleared out to just a few people. We enjoyed the mud facial too. Take notice of the sparkles in the water that looks like diamond dust. You\'ll see it in the water on the beaches too. Simply gorgeous! It\'s on the trail leading to the falls too.

252180400.name: Excellent tour
252180400.author: a TripAdvisor user
252180400.reviewBody: We took this tour with XPTravel who provide an 8 hour tour into this beautiful mountain area. They use a comfortable van and our guide Oscar was interesting with lots of information on the area. Our first stop was at a family run botanical garden where we were also able to try our hand at making tortillas. They use an outdoor kitchen fuelled with a brick wood stove. You may decide you do not need a kitchen reno at home when you see the primitive condition of that kitchen. We were later treated to the tortillas before moving on to our next stop, the Iguana sanctuary. After a long bumpy ride past several mountain villages we came to our destination. A pleasant walk brings you to the falls and a chance to cool off in the natural pool. After spending some time at the falls we walked back for a very nice lunch which was included as part of the tour. This tour is an excellent opportunity to see the beautiful Sierra Madre mountain region with it\'s diverse vegetation, the villages and the friendly people who live there. I highly recommend this tour

251551285.name: The Falls
251551285.author: a TripAdvisor user
251551285.reviewBody: On the way to the falls you stop at an area where iguanas are raised and later released, next we stopped at an area that has all kind of medicinal plant which was very interesting, The road to the fall site is extremely rough for over an hour drive. The provided lunch was ok, I personaly would not go back due to the roughness of the road.

251128804.name: Unique experience
251128804.author: a TripAdvisor user
251128804.reviewBody: It is a unique experience as you find yourself in a very primitive and unspoiled place in the beautiful Huatulco rainforest.

250489144.name: Nice clear water!
250489144.author: a TripAdvisor user
250489144.reviewBody: It was a very bumpy ride, but we stopped once at a overlook. We walked down to the river and along it to the falls. Our son and daughter-in-law both swung down from the rocks into the river pool! My wife, daughter and daughter-in-law had mud put on their faces. It is suppose to help their complexion, HaHa!

249517975.name: Magic Falls....magical!
249517975.author: a TripAdvisor user
249517975.reviewBody: This is an incredibly beautiful attraction to go to.  Transat had organized this for us. Be clear with the tour company that takes you what other stops are a part of the waterfall tour.  My younger son enjoyed stopping off at the Iguana refuge (luckily the government has stopped poaching ..it is now illegal).  Here you learn a lot about  Iguana\'s.  It did end up being very interesting but this was not mentioned as part of the tour..some people may be annoyed at stopping along the way especially since it is about 1.5 hour drive already. If you have kids it is very interesting but some people in our group were not enthusiastic that they had to stop.  This trip is worth it especially if you enjoy swimming...the pools are refreshing.  You have to walk into the falls which takes around 10 minutes and then down a walk way area . Pretty simple walk but maybe not great for someone that has difficulty with mobility.  All in all a great outing....in total it took us 7 hours...round trip.

249365043.name: Wow!
249365043.author: a TripAdvisor user
249365043.reviewBody: The water was clear and it was awsome! Very beautiful! It is in the forest and from a short distance from our van, you can enjoy this beauty of nature. I recommend this tour, it was my highlight ;)

248677868.name: Wonderful clear water
248677868.author: a TripAdvisor user
248677868.reviewBody:
It is punishing to get there - over 2 hour drive on rough road (and again to get back) - and a fifteen minute walk to get to the swimming area, but the walk was lovely and cool, beside the rushing waters and dozens of small waterfalls.  And swimming in the clear, cool water and letting the waterfalls massage your shoulders and leaping from the edge into deep pools was absolutely wonderful.  

Our tour also included a very delicious lunch at the farm at the entrance - pork, chicken mole, beans and rice.

We also stopped at a botanical gardens to see medicinal plants.  Put on repellent here.  We were all bitten badly.

We also stopped at an Iguana rescue site where we saw lots of black and green iguanas and got interesting tidbits on their life history.

248169403.name: Worth the scary road trip
248169403.author: a TripAdvisor user
248169403.reviewBody: Okay the road was actually your stereo typical Mexican mountain road. Very long drive and scary but well worth it. If you get car sick then sit in the front seat or front row. We didn\'t have any issues with the bugs as we had the bracelet on to keep them away. Well worth the $6.00. The falls were awesome and our guide was great. The best meal was served to us after our walk to & from the falls. Great experience!

246903192.name: an average water falls
246903192.author: a TripAdvisor user
246903192.reviewBody: very bumpy unsafe road and water falls i saw a lot better than those... very an average experience. since it is kind of Virgin Island the water is crystal clear but i wouldn\'t go there more than once.

246087908.name: Magic Falls
246087908.author: a TripAdvisor user
246087908.reviewBody: It was absolutely beautiful and we had a great tour guide (Alfonzo). The only issue were the bugs - they are very small black flies that give nasty bug bites - we were absolutely covered after our trip. The bug bites were worth it though after seeing the beautiful water falls and swimming in the crystal clear water.

244722917.name: Nice excursion but scary road!
244722917.author: a TripAdvisor user
244722917.reviewBody: This excursion included a stop at an iguana farm and also a medicinal plant farm which were both interesting and the people hospitable.  At the top, a visit to the coffee plantation was enjoyable and the hike to falls (and falls itself) was nice. But the road up the mountain and back is harrowing - rutted, dirt road with hairpin turns, no barriers - takes hour and half to go 17 klms (each way) so that should tell you something.  If you have vertigo, a bad back or fear of heights, don\'t go!  If it wasn\'t for the other 3 stops, just going for the falls would not be worth that dangerous drive.

244672116.name: Amazing views great lunch, great tour guide but no butterfly farm!
244672116.author: a TripAdvisor user
244672116.reviewBody: We loved the fact that we. We\'re going with a local up to magic falls, we booked they Carlos on the street but we\'re given the wrong insight of our trip. He told us with the tour we would not only see the waterfalls swim in them which we did but we were to stop at the butterfly field to experience that and to the coffee plantation to pick and grind our own coffee. Those did not happen. \nWe were charged 1530.pesos each couple and yes we did have a nice meal but then we had to pay an extra 20 each to enter the area extra for a drink. Then we stopped at a coffee plantation to really only buy the product not going to the actual plantation. Carlos also said that everything included as well as the butterfly farm but if we did go the driver said we had to pay more. \nAgain the waterfalls were amazing but we should have not paid so much for only one of 3 things we went to.

244331737.name: Beautiful
244331737.author: a TripAdvisor user
244331737.reviewBody: These falls were so lovely. They are a bit of a drive out of town and if you get motion sick I suggest a pill before the drive. However the drive was so so so worth the beauty of the falls. I will one day take my children there when the are old enough to appreciate the beauty!!

242972987.name: Beautiful
242972987.author: a TripAdvisor user
242972987.reviewBody: Once you get past the drive the time spent at the falls was awesome.  The water and scenery is spectacular and the lunch provided was great.  Better than expected for sure.  Give it a try!

242955346.name: sweeeeet
242955346.author: a TripAdvisor user
242955346.reviewBody: all good worth it ask for OSCAR he loves what he does and knows the falls very well goes back through the rain forest and small towns lots to see and many people workind all over

242935026.name: Wonderful experience
242935026.author: a TripAdvisor user
242935026.reviewBody: This was well worth the price.  The tour guide (Rutirro) went out of his way to make sure we had lots of time at the falls and other stops along the way. We were the only non-Spanish speaking couple on the trip and he translated into English especially for us.  The trip into the jungle is a bit harrowing as it\'s a dirt road for most of the way, so be prepared for a bumpy ride.  But, the experience is well worth enduring the ride.  The falls are beautiful and the authentic Mexican lunch was excellent.  Overall we were very happy that we chose this excursion.  Bye the way, for the best price buy your trip in Crucecita.  There are people around the market square selling excursions for a much better price than you get elsewhere.  In the beginning we were a bit leary because we had to give them a deposit, and were wondering if someone would actually show up at the hotel to pick us up, but we had no reason to worry.  Everything was very well organized and transportation showed up on time for all of the excursions we took.

240777708.name: TOUR GUIDE EXCEPTIONAL!
240777708.author: a TripAdvisor user
240777708.reviewBody: Yesterday we had the best experience of our life with the help of our most capable,safe and knowledgeable tour guide Arturo Martinez who operates in Huatulco. He took  us (a party of 4) in his most comfortable SUV along a bumpy rain ruined road 2 hours into the mountains so we could experience Magic Falls. Magic Falls are breathtaking and well worth the long journey which is not really that far but just a slow ride due to the road conditions at this time(end of rainy season and roads not yet graded). He talked of the flora and fauna and the history of Mexico and the economy and just about anything you wanted to know, he had an answer for. His English is excellent and he guided us to a series of falls that were not all for the feint of heart. It was the best adventure as we rappelled up and over the falls with his guidance to experience a breathtaking beauty that is beyond words. The pools below the falls were crystal clear and a beautiful blue and very comfortable for swimming. We have nothing quite like this in Canada. There were very few tourists so we felt like we had this paradise all to ourselves. He then took us to the Butterfly farm and an old coffee plantation for the most delicious traditional Mexican lunch. We never wanted the day to end. We all highly recommend this guide.

240777142.name: Magic Falls ..Fablous
240777142.author: a TripAdvisor user
240777142.reviewBody: We were a large group and took two vans from our hotel.This is an eight hour day but well worth it. We stopped at the medicine man half way along for talks on natural herbs samples on mescal. You have to walk a fair  way in the rain forrest to the falls then further on to more falls and natural jacquizes. There are stairs and some uneven terrain.this is not for the handicapped or people who can\'t walk stairs.Do take insect repellent  on this trip. After the falls we stopped for a great meal at a coffee plantation with clean flush toilets.Our driver Carlos was great and very informative.\nI would highly recommend his trip 10 out 10 Adventure

240624292.name: Beautiful views
240624292.author: a TripAdvisor user
240624292.reviewBody: Nice little hike and a beautiful waterfalls. Nice stoos long the way and a great lunch at a local eatery. Make sure to wear your bug spray.

240000039.name: Mixed review....I loved it....she didn\'t....
240000039.author: a TripAdvisor user
240000039.reviewBody: I really enjoyed this day trip into the Mexican hillsides.   Lots of local culture to soak in and beautiful valley views.    Plenty of fauna and foliage to experience.   The falls weren\'t amazing but they were worth seeing and diving into the cool water felt amazing in Mexican heat.\n\nMy better half didn\'t enjoy it as much.   The trip took 2.5hours each way and the roads are extremely narrow and bumpy which made her uncomfortable and sick.   This was the opinion of more than one other person who was on the tour with us.   Also....there was a significant amount of bugs so if you are sensitive to getting bitten this might not be the trip for you......

233462185.name: Magical Waterfalls
233462185.author: a TripAdvisor user
233462185.reviewBody: Exactly what it is, we went on the magical falls tour, met the mountain medicine people, hiked to the falls to be greeted with these incredible falls, we swam in the cool clear crystal fresh waters.  Then after the tour we had a beautiful lunch, which was perfect after the nice hike to the waterfalls, it really was a magical experience.

224207275.name: Definitely worth it!
224207275.author: a TripAdvisor user
224207275.reviewBody: This trip was awesome - kids loved it as did we. Bumpy ride was fine, even for toddler.  Coffee plantation was a little disappointing, go to Pluma Hidalgo instead (or in addition).

215935204.name: Magic!!!
215935204.author: a TripAdvisor user
215935204.reviewBody: What a magically place!  Unbelievably gorgeous!  I would definitely go back.  Only sucky thing lots of switch back roads.  If you get motion sickness this may not be an adventure for you:((

214817055.name: Must See!
214817055.author: a TripAdvisor user
214817055.reviewBody: We booked this excursion through Apple vacations at our hotel. It was about $75 per person but this also included the coffee plantation where they fed you lunch, the waterfalls, tour guides who are locals and transportation to and from the waterfalls. On the ride to and from this excursion, you drive through the villages and you really get to see how the people live. This is well worth the money. The terrain is rough riding in the van. The tour guide also provides a cooler with beverages. Take some cash with you. There is a butterfly house at the coffee plantation which costs $4 per person. No one told us is but thankfully someone in our group brought cash. Some locals will also try to sell you a clay facial mask, coffee and tequila at the coffee plantation after the waterfalls. Everything was beautiful and the excursion does take the entire day.

205539655.name: Beautiful!
205539655.author: a TripAdvisor user
205539655.reviewBody: The driver picks you up from your hotel in a big van that fits about 14 people or so.  The worst thing about it is the drive.  It is through a VERY LONG BUMPY RIDE to get there that I even felt sick after 45 minutes of driving through the desert mountains with no paved roads.  The driver was very good at trying to entertain us.  By the time we got to the place to walk to the falls; most of us were more than ready to get out. The nice thing is they give you walking sticks to walk through the forest trail and it is about a half mile walk to the falls. It is beautiful though!  The water is very clear and calm.  You must bring an extra pair of clothes to get in; the water is not deep at all so it is safe for children as well. The guide took us even behind the water fall which was pretty cool and people even jumped off a rope into the water.  There was a local man who was selling red clay and put it on out faces to exfoliate them which was pretty cool.  They have changing rooms for you to change back in your clothes and head back up to the coffe plantation where they serve you a traditional mole lunch.  Absolutely delicious!

205392262.name: pretty neat
205392262.author: a TripAdvisor user
205392262.reviewBody: The drive is a long bumpy ride! LOL\nSome pretty cool sites. There are a couple of different fall locations. I heard the one we went on was a bit smaller, but it was a smaller group and a little more personal/ peacefull!!!! Same thing but different! LOL

202714605.name: Refreshing
202714605.author: a TripAdvisor user
202714605.reviewBody: It\'s an adventure day w/lunch, hiking and swimming.  Must be somewhat in shape to hike/swim the falls.

202274965.name: Great adventure!
202274965.author: a TripAdvisor user
202274965.reviewBody:
Like mentionned in other reviews it is a long and bumpy ride to get there but our tour was well organized.  

1) We started with a stop at a local botanical garden where we saw and leanred about many medicinal plants and then had a chance to do our own torilla and eat it.  
2) We went to visit a iguanario. 
3) Drove to the falls. 
4) The falls themselves are nice but not super impressive.  What makes this excursion great is the guide that takes you into and behind the falls and applies the exfoliating mask. It is magical! 
5) Lunch was delicious. 
6) Drove back. 

Before going on the tour I would have liked to know that several people would guide us through the day. You may want to bring a few pesos extra for tips.   

We left at 8:10 am and returned to the hotel close to 7:00 pm.

202004726.name: Must go!
202004726.author: a TripAdvisor user
202004726.reviewBody: Yes, the ride there stinks but well worth it! The water is crystal clear. My 6 yr old son hiked to falls with no issue.

200934831.name: Great nature
200934831.author: a TripAdvisor user
200934831.reviewBody: This a great place for a day excursion. Crystal clear water, a lot of shade, great swimming. It\'s a long drive over gravel road (so try to get the right transport provider), but it is worth to make this trip. You\'ll also enjoy a great mountain landscape, especially during rainy season.\n\nCompared to Agua Azul in Chiapas (close to Palenque) this is still a little gem. Not commercialized, no vendors, 100% nature. Try to get there on a Tuesday or Wednesday, ideally off season. Then you\'ll be there almost alone.

200616300.name: a botanical gem
200616300.author: a TripAdvisor user
200616300.reviewBody: What a great place! Not to commercial yet so really get a wilderness feel. Excellent meal here cooked over open fire. Cool clean cl;ear water to swim in and lots of local vegetation to study. the one down fall is the 2 plus hour ride over the worst roads I have even been on to get there and back. No kidding "think twice" about this one.

199335722.name: Beautiful
199335722.author: a TripAdvisor user
199335722.reviewBody: Worth the bumpy and long ride. Beautiful falls and clear clean water. We just hired a driver to take or group up. .. No need to do a tour.

197167844.name: Crystal clear water
197167844.author: a TripAdvisor user
197167844.reviewBody: Amazing spot, but getting there sucks. Close to two hours of bumpy dirt roads. Went with a tour group and had clay face masks applied by a local girl. Meal after the falls was super delicious. Worth the bumpy trip!

197089839.name: Wish I brought my waterproof camera
197089839.author: a TripAdvisor user
197089839.reviewBody: We went by private driver up the crazy mountain roads to magic falls. Took two hours, more than a few gasps of fear, amusement and amazement of the views to drive all the way up. \nWe changed into our bathing suits and walked up a pathway to the first set of falls, took about 10 minutes. The water is remarkably clear and refreshing. We were able to simply splash about, jump off an overhanging tree limb, climb to the higher level and jump or dive off the top. So much fun! \nAfter about 30 minutes or so at the first level of falls our guide (and driver) took us the a further five minutes up to the second level of falls. At this level you would walk into the falls using fencing and ropes, and then walk into a small cave and up through the backside of the cave into a further part of the falls. My mom who is 73 did all of this climbing too! Celebrate her! I braved a further section where you could rope swing into the water. Once was enough! but it would so much fun.
