The only thing was I wish I brought my waterproof camera, I would have such great photos of our adventure!

196880541.name: Beautiful falls
196880541.author: a TripAdvisor user
196880541.reviewBody: Rather than going on a tour from our hotel, we opted for a taxi ride to the falls we\u2019d heard so much about.  We\u2019d met Pepe Cervantes the first day (on a short ride) somewhere and asked him if we could hire his taxi service by the hour.  Our thoughts were we could stop as we wished (not possible in a group). So we scheduled a day and pick up time. He is a very nice man, speaks English very well and was able to answer almost every question we asked in English.  And we asked a lot of questions!  We headed for the falls, driving those bumpy back roads we had read about. He described each town and told us about customs and cultures of the area.  He brought us to the falls, where we hiked and waded in the clear water.   We asked to stop a few times, once for the infamous \u201cmedicine man\u201d. It was one of those things you had to see to believe, but left pretty amused.  Since we were reasonably close to Santa Maria, the capital of Oaxaca, we asked if we could add a little time to the day and go there for awhile.  He took us there where we stayed for a short time, just enough to get the feel of the town. It dates back to the 1500\u2019s and was pretty interesting.  It is an old Mexican town, very clean with friendly people. We stopped at a restaurant to grab a quick bite then headed back to Huatulco.  We are happy we chose this way to see the falls.  Pepe was a great driver and guide.

195721330.name: worth the trip
195721330.author: a TripAdvisor user
195721330.reviewBody: Make sure your bring bug spray we all got tons of bites. It\'s a long haul 1.5 hour ride on a bumpy dirt road up to the falls but worth it once you get there. Lunch was very good. It\'s a bit of a hike with walking sticks to the falls

195721020.name: Breathtaking
195721020.author: a TripAdvisor user
195721020.reviewBody: The bus ride was horribly bumpy for about 90 minutes. However, the scenery was gorgeous. The coffee plantation stop was amazing and delicious. The falls are breathtaking, crystal clear, clean(read drinkable) and refreshingly cool. Kids can definitely hike there, but I\'d refrain from bringing small children.

192607707.name: Swimming alone in emerald pools
192607707.author: a TripAdvisor user
192607707.reviewBody: We jumped in the crystal clear pools, climbed the rocks and swung from ropes like Tarzan. There were butterflies and we saw many birds including tropical tanagers, orioles and trogons. Our group of six drove to the falls in a private car. The tour groups were just leaving as we arrived so we had the pools to ourselves all afternoon.The trail is somewhat challenging but not daunting. Since we took our own vehicle (2 of the group live in Mexico) and packed a picnic lunch our trip was inexpensive. We are used to driving in rural Mexico so the roads did not bother us. There were many interesting native plants along the road to the falls.\nIf you go on your own drive across the bridge and take a left, someone from the village will take your entry fee. Continue to the parking lot at the top of the hiking trail. There are walking sticks at the trailhead - take one it will make the walk easier.

191958583.name: Gorgeous
191958583.author: a TripAdvisor user
191958583.reviewBody: Not sure if this is the same as emerald falls but if so, it is a very strenuous excursion. Saint is well worth the effort to get there and the meal is phenomenol but elderly and out of shape people should not attempt

191755749.name: Worth the bumpy ride!
191755749.author: a TripAdvisor user
191755749.reviewBody: Personally, we enjoyed our adventurous journey up and down the mountains to the falls. Although the road was narrow, bumpy and long, being able to see more of how the locals live and the forest was well worth the trip.  Our first stop was to visit a \'medicine man\' and although we do not speak Spanish, others on our tour we bilingual and helped to interpret what was going on. It was entertaining; however Canadian customs would have frowned had we tried to bring back some of the medicinal elixirs being sold.  We also visited a coffee plantation for a quick cup of coffee and cookies. Others in our group did not want to visit the butterflies so we headed to the falls which were awesome. We came away with some great photos. Later, we went back to the plantation for an authentic meal of mole chicken, tamarind pork, black beans, rice and cucumber.  It was delicious. Although this trip might not be for everyone we had a great time and our tour guide \'Luis\' was very entertaining and made sure we felt included as we were the only ones in our van who did not speak Spanish.

190995153.name: Strenuous drive, falls ok, opportunity to see nice butterflies
190995153.author: a TripAdvisor user
190995153.reviewBody: I would give second thoughts to spending time and money for this trip. I would skip most of the stops on the way to the falls. The drive is long, strenuous and steep. The falls are nice, the water is crystal clear and cold, not necessarily everybody\'s cup of tea.... The best part of the trip was the opportunity to see nice butterflies in the area. The guide suggested visiting a butterfly conservatory, but the cost was not included in the trip. We opted to visit it, but why pay more? Had we had the choice we would have gladly skipped other stops on the way to the falls. What we particularly minded on this trip was the fact that the guide specifically asked the tourists to tip various people during the trip. We know that tipping is customary, but we dislike to be asked for it up front so bluntly.... This left us with a very bitter taste....

190983829.name: Magical Magic Falls
190983829.author: a TripAdvisor user
190983829.reviewBody: Had a wonderful trip up to the falls area with a grandson of the plantation owner of the first coffee exporter in the area.  Meal at the resturant at the site was delicious.  Then on to the falls.  FIrst class attraction.  Great trail in to area, interesting wildlife and fauna along the way.  Lots of fun playing in the falls & on swing.  Trip behind the falls & also down the river lots of fun.  Wish we could have stayed longer & enjoyed the area more!

189940193.name: Not worth the drive
189940193.author: a TripAdvisor user
189940193.reviewBody: Our excursion to Magic Falls was somewhat of a disappointment. Fortunately, we had a terrific guide who really made our day very enjoyable. Eduardo, also known as Lalo, is a 25 year old guide full of energy, life and love for his country. We were picked up at 8:20 am and returned at about 5:00. On our way to Magic Falls we visited an iguana farm where we also saw how corn tortillas are made and even participated in making one. We then travelled to a herbology farm to learn how the Huatulcan people use their flora to create medicines for all kinds of aches, pains and illnesses. Finally we headed toward Magic Falls. It is a very long, bumpy and winding drive - not very pleasant for anyone with motion sickness. Unfortunately three of us were feeling very queasy once we got there. As far as the falls, they are very small and being from Canada where fresh water and waterfalls are bountiful and magnificent, Magic Falls was not very impressive. The hike was nice though and we saw some beautiful birds and butterflies along the way. Another negative was how freezing cold the water was. I went in to my knees and couldn\'t stand it for more than 5 min. One of my boys did try the Tarzan rope and enjoyed climbing behind the waterfall despite the cold water. \nLuckily we had some gravol for our return trip, which helped quite a bit. \nA nice day, but would not repeat or recommend this excursion.

188354877.name: Magic Falls location is beautiful
188354877.author: a TripAdvisor user
188354877.reviewBody: The falls are an enjoyable walk through beautiful flora and fauna, swimming in beautiful pools, swinging off a rope into the water, seeing some caves if you don\'t mind getting wet.  We observed the air to be full of butterflies of all sorts of brilliant colours, and the meal at the location was really good!  The downside is the long drive there, over the bumpiest roads one can imagine.  A little van sick on the way there.  Overall worthwhile.

188065065.name: Beautiful
188065065.author: a TripAdvisor user
188065065.reviewBody: Clean water, nice view. Arduos road though. Butterflies and bugs. Can buy coffee and chocolates on the way.

188048990.name: What a wonderful day in the jungle!
188048990.author: a TripAdvisor user
188048990.reviewBody: The Bahias Sur- crew took us up into the mountains with their safari jeep and we passed many small villages before making it to our destination, the Cascadas Magicas and the coffee plantation nearby where we would eat and drink later on. The waterfalls were worthy to see and the food afterwards was delicious as well as the jamaica, mezcal and the coffee. We bought a bottle of Mezcal and shared it on the way back to the hotel with all our fellow friends in the jeep...up to the point that we stopped Felipe our driver to get another bottle in a little shop in the jungle to server our needs. Needless to say, that the way back will be remembered forever as the big Mezcal-party by us.

185222677.name: Unforgettable Experience
185222677.author: a TripAdvisor user
185222677.reviewBody:
This place was like a dream. I've never been in a jungle with a large waterfall where you could not only swim in the prestine cold water that was so clear you could see the bottom, but you could jump off the waterfall as well! We were brought here from Huatulco during our honeymoon and were lucky to have our guide to ourselves as well as a local, Erik, who was so sweet in helping us with our things and helping our clumsy selves wade through the water and showed us some aspects only the locals would know about (as well as applying a mud mask - which I ended up buying because I loved it!) We thoroughly enjoyed the hike and the beautiful surroundings. This is the real deal - you see and feel nature as it should be all around you.

We also got the meal that they offer after the trek (I would HIGHLY recommend it) and the authentic mexican food (cucumber salad, rice, tortillas, jalapeno mole with chicken, pork marinated in tamarind, and black beans) along with their hibiscus tea (Agua de Jamaica) and Oaxacan coffee. I purchased the dried flowers and coffee beans because I don't know the next time I'll be back.

Also, we went to the butterfly center where they had native butterflies (HUNDREDS of them) and a nursery where they were growing and hatching butterflies to help conservation. There was small fee to get in.

Helpful tips: It'd be great if you spoke Spanish as they can speak English, but they are able to tell you more about the place if you speak the language. Make sure to bring extra cash to tip your guides, grab some food, check out other things around the area, and get coffee, tea, and other souvenirs! Out of everything we did on our trip, this was my favorite activity.

185124347.name: Best Resort Excursion We\'ve Been On
185124347.author: a TripAdvisor user
185124347.reviewBody: The road out there is bumpy and windy. But if you\'re sure-footed in slippery situations the destination is absolutely worth the ride. Such a beautiful spot and you travel through beautiful areas to get there.

172097644.name: Long bumpy drive but maybe worth it
172097644.author: a TripAdvisor user
172097644.reviewBody: Nice clear waterfalls with trails . You will see many butterflies including the beautiful Blue Morph ! Awesome to see in nature . Falls are easily assessable  and it is a nice hike . The ride up is along way and can be tiresome .. Takes about 1.5 hours from Crucecita ...

166157467.name: Well worth the long drive!!!
166157467.author: a TripAdvisor user
166157467.reviewBody: We headed out with our guide that was sponsored by amistar and picked up three other groups staying in Santa Cruz. The car ride was very bumpy, I had to focus on the road so I would not get car sick. I have a fairly weak stomach, my husband did not have any problems. After a BREATHTAKING drive we reached the coffee plantation to use the restrooms and headed to the falls. After a very short, very easy down hill hike we reached the falls. It was beautiful!! The water was freezing but it felt amazing and we quickly adjusted. We hung out, swam, used the rope swings, climbed through the inside of the waterfall, and even had a mud facial! It was our favorite excursion so far.

161548882.name: Great way to see the country-side and cool off
161548882.author: a TripAdvisor user
161548882.reviewBody: Nice trip.  Takes a while to get there on really rough dry roads, but you get to see a few towns and the country landscape and foliage.  I would reccomend this for famils or couples.

161297435.name: adventure and workout
161297435.author: a TripAdvisor user
161297435.reviewBody: this location is a few miles from main road---all dirt road--must have vehicle with good clearence, preferably 4 wheel or all wheel drive. Recommend you are physically fit for climbing up and down trail since it is about 100 ft. down from top of trail. There is a small nominal fee for entrance and parking collected by local resident. We have been to this area three times and road seems to get worse over time since it is a climb into mountain area. Location is very secluded, however beautiful also and very refreshing as water is from mountains. Bring everything you need, since there is only a twin outhouse there.

158123563.name: Long Ride
158123563.author: a TripAdvisor user
158123563.reviewBody: The 1 hour and 45 minutes up the side of the mountain on a former mule trail is not worth the trip.  The falls were beautiful and we got to rope swing and jump off the rocks.  The drive was just too scary.  Plus, our van barely had AC.  We had to turn it off at some points just to have enough power to climb some hills.  Our guide started to fall asleep while driving on the way home.  Scary!

156444344.name: Awesome trip!
156444344.author: a TripAdvisor user
156444344.reviewBody: The falls were amazing! Beautiful falls that were so refreshing. Our guide spent as much as time with us as we wanted. You need to be fairly agile to climb some spots though, so be aware of that

154191798.name: Beautiful
154191798.author: a TripAdvisor user
154191798.reviewBody: We hired a cab at the hotel to take us there.  There was 7 of us so we went in a van.  Omar speaks very good English and was never in a hurry.  It is a short walk in the shade to the falls and some very pretty small falls on the walk.  The water was a little cool but refreshing after the walk.  Had an excellent lunch at the coffee plantation after.

151537821.name: Not for the out of shape
151537821.author: a TripAdvisor user
151537821.reviewBody:
This is a long road trip on a montain road ( 3 hours) that ends.at a former coffee plantation.
I was unsure about going due to a back problem but was assured by the guide from the Crown Pacific tour office that it would be fine. On arrival by van, you then have a long hike over uneven steep terrain. It took me 45 min to do and it was torture because of my back pain.
The waterfall and surrounding scenery was beautiful but I was so upset after the long bumpy drive and difficult hike that I could not enjoy it. I was seething at the guide who over sold this trip as "easy and no problem" to us. The water was to cold for me to go under the falls or swim.
There is a very good large plate Mexican meal and beer and tequila after the swim etc.
All could think about was the long uncomfortable trip back that I would have to endure.
This trip was enjoyed by the fit among us but beware of it.

150430585.name: Beautiful
150430585.author: a TripAdvisor user
150430585.reviewBody: it was worth going and I will go there again when I go back \nto Huatulco ,the water falls are really nice and you can go right in them my 4yr.old loved it the water is so refreshing I felt so good when I left there

148732479.name: Awesome!
148732479.author: a TripAdvisor user
148732479.reviewBody: It\'s a bit expensive once you pay a guide, the entrance fee, and buy lunch, but it\'s still very worth it!  Great photo opportunity!

141606940.name: Pretty setting.
141606940.author: a TripAdvisor user
141606940.reviewBody: It seems like it took forever to arrive here ( a couple of hours) but it was very nice.  The water was cold so I didn\'t swim but others didn\'t seem to mind.  Make sure you wear bug spray because I was bitten by little sand fleas all over my legs.  The lunch served here was good.  Take note that there is a good ten-minute hike to get down to the river.

138841616.name: GO!!! No hesitations!
138841616.author: a TripAdvisor user
138841616.reviewBody: Speechless. The most beautiful place I\'ve ever stayed in. The road to this place is long and in bad conditions sometimes but it really worths the trip... you will go up the mountains and you will be breathless, trust me... Hopefully I could share some pics so you may find interesting go there

135254277.name: Bumpy ride. Worth it.
135254277.author: a TripAdvisor user
135254277.reviewBody: We did the Water Fall Excursion, it\'s a 2 hour bumpy and dangerous ride, but we like it.\n\nIt includes the food which it\'s awesome and plentiful, the water is super cold but very clean!  Not much to do but swim in and around water fall. Lots of walking to and from water fall, but we enjoyed it.

134662161.name: Overly hyped like many of the tour activities here....
134662161.author: a TripAdvisor user
134662161.reviewBody:
1.) The tour is a 3 hour bumpy round-trip  journey on a road that I would not recommend to anyone.
2.) The waterfalls are not that high and disappointing once you see them
3.) The mosquitoes will eat you alive all along the trail to get to the waterfalls and not recommended for senior citizens or handicapped persons.
On the upside...its a jungly adventure for nature lovers who like to hike. The " Gloria" coffee plantation is not in operation but a one-room converted rustic museum of what was once there but the plantation named "Pluma Hidalgo"  is the one to see but a bit farther.

130439852.name: Unsafe
130439852.author: a TripAdvisor user
130439852.reviewBody: If you are planning to go on this excursion (Coffee plantation and Waterfalls), BEWARE!  \nThe dangers involved are not explained adequately!  I am an athletic person, but I tried swinging from the rope into the water.  I landed from 6 ft. in the air into water that was only 2 ft. deep.  I seriously injured one of my legs (from knee to foot).  WATCH OUT!\nAlso, the drive caused overheating of the airconditioned van from Apple Tours, and we had to stop on the road. There were also extra charges for extra places the tourguide wanted to take the tour! This trip is a DANGEROUS one!

127820557.name: lovely scenery
127820557.author: a TripAdvisor user
127820557.reviewBody: A day excursion to the coffee plantation and the waterfalls was also a highlight of the holiday plenty of photos and such lovely scenery

126189638.name: long ride but worth it
126189638.author: a TripAdvisor user
126189638.reviewBody: when you finally get to the falls it is great. wish i had more time to stay

125239450.name: So Amazing!!
125239450.author: a TripAdvisor user
125239450.reviewBody: The falls are worth the day trip... pack lotsa water and cool clothes ... dont  forget your swimsuit ...and water camera

124732100.name: Magical Day!!!
124732100.author: a TripAdvisor user
124732100.reviewBody: On our second visit to Huatulco, we went with several other couples to the waterfalls and coffee plantation.  It was a full day (left at 10am back about 4:30pm). Make sure you go to the "big falls and the small plantation" combo.  We were given a choice between that and the "large plantation with the smaller falls".  The falls were beautiful beyond words!!  There is a spot where you can get in and swim.  After your hike up to the falls they will then take you to the tiny plantation where the family also lives and they will prepare you an awesome meal.  The ride up and back was in a comfortable, air conditioned suburban, and it was about `1 1/2 hrs long each way up the mountains.  You will see how and where the local mountain people live.  It is a very bumpy ride, but well worth it.  Tino from Tino\'s sport fishing business lined the whole thing up for us.

124619034.name: The Magic of Magic Falls
124619034.author: a TripAdvisor user
124619034.reviewBody: These falls are small butt absolutely beautiful\' crystal clear water!\nWorth visiting if you don\'t mnd the bumpy 2 hour ride from the closest town. To be to them there is a small hike from the official parking area

124324628.name: A bit crowded on Sundays
124324628.author: a TripAdvisor user
124324628.reviewBody: This is a pleasant day trip, and the walk from the parking up to the falls is cool and green with lots of interesting jungle plants.  The road was a bit of a challege for our Buick sedan, but a vehicle with more clearance should be a bit easier.\n\nSwimming was refreshing.  There are several pools so if the first few are crowded, keep going.   We went on a Sunday and it was quite popular with families doing the Sunday outing.  Everyone had a good time and were good natured, with kids swinging on the rope swings and grannies watching the younger kids.  The resturant at the parking place is not recommended, best bring your own lunch.  We were charged 50 pesos per person at the gate.  The advertising shows people in wheel chairs at the falls but that seems a bit optimistic.

124272654.name: Fantasy water fall swimming!
124272654.author: a TripAdvisor user
124272654.reviewBody: The drive here was a bit daunting, but the trip was well worth it. My only regret is that we didn\'t start earlier, bring a lunch and some beer and spend the whole day. Swimming  under and near the falls is very safe-I\'m an old guy with weak legs, and had no problem getting in and out. Younger folks would enjoy climbing over and behind the rocks.

124080926.name: Worth the ride there.
124080926.author: a TripAdvisor user
124080926.reviewBody: Magic Falls is truly beautiful and a rare place of serenity. We crawled through the small hole behind the falls and took a quick dip in the natural jacuzzi. The water was pretty cold but so refreshing. The authentic Mexican lunch we were served was so delicious and the people so friendly. The only negative thing was the long, drive on the narrow dirt road to get there and  back. It\'s a rough, dirt road, mostly one lane, and often takes you within inches of a thousand foot drop-off. I was worried a few times and did alot of praying! It took nearly 2 hours each way. Also the hole in the mountain of the falls is very small and the small passage to the \'jacuzzi\' is very narrow, so those who are claustrophobic may want to opt out of that part.  All in all, it was a fantastic and unique experience.

122543612.name: Great day and way to see the countryside
122543612.author: a TripAdvisor user
122543612.reviewBody: We (2 adults and 2 kids ages 18 and 20) had a great day  at the falls.  We drove ourselves --there are 2 ways to get there one that is west of Huatulco( head out of Huatulco toward airport  but about 5 minutes before the airport turn right up hill on dirt road (there is a hand scribbled sign that says Cascadas and continue up --ask as you go) and the other route that it is east of huatulco (just about 5 minutes past the military check point on the way to Salina Cruz and before the bridge over the River Z--, follow signs 18 k uphill  and ask as you go, then 8 k more after a left aat the Y) .  We drove both routes.  Make sure you go all the way to the ones nearest Llano Grande (altho you could stop and some others along the way).  This is a well run cooperative where they care about the area and the environment.  There is an entrance fee that is fare and worth it.  We had a great meal at the little restaruant to the right in Llano Grande and then toured the butterfly (mariposa) sanctuary there.  We should support this community that is trying to do the right thing and create jobs and protect the environment.  The falls are great to play in and walk up the river and thru the little caves. Lots of rope swings. Nice guides--we didn\'t use any but they were very nice to us anyway. All very clean.Great day !

122369839.name: Did not like the greeting upon arrival here!
122369839.author: a TripAdvisor user
122369839.reviewBody: A man who barley spoke English followed us around saying he wanted this much money because this was all his private property. Very annoying! We left and went to another waterfall! Would not return!

121834828.name: Definitely beautiful, but...
121834828.author: a TripAdvisor user
121834828.reviewBody:
Our trip to the falls started from Zipolite (about 50 min north of Huatulco by car).  We left at 7:30 in the morning and arrived at the falls at 11:30 - most of that time was spent on  a dirt road driving through the jungle.  We were 6 people in a small car - driver and one  passenger up front, 3 in the back, and one in the hatchback!  Far too long a drive for my 71 year old parents.  Same road back, by the way.  The falls were definitely beautiful, but the unexpected lenght of the drive  (we had been told 2 hours which we thought was long) plus the worry about what we would do if something happened to the car so far from the main road, took away much of the pleasure we should have experienced at seeing the stunning jewel deep in the jungle.  We were fortunate in that we were the only visitors at the falls so that did make it very special.  There is also a bit of a walk from the washroom area up to the falls, this could be challenging for the less mobile elderly members of your group.

The coffee plantation part of the tour was not what we had expected - we did see coffee plants growing in the jungle but we had hoped to see more of the actual process involved and had hoped for a larger scale production; the "drying facilities" we saw were beans spread out in the sun on two grass mats.

We would have enjoyed the trip much more if we had been prepared for the long drive and if we had been travelling in a more appropriate vehicle.

You should see it.  It is very beautiful, but know that the trip may not be well suited for all members of the family.

55433307.name: Wow!
55433307.author: a TripAdvisor user
55433307.reviewBody: Hard to believe you are in Mexico when you visit the Magic Waterfalls and the Coffee Plantation.  Our guide "Oscar with Amstar" was wonderful, and the coffee & lunch from LaGloria were both great.  Yes it is a long day, but we were fortunate to have just 4 of us in the Van, and the chance to get away from the Resort life and to see Donkeys carrying firewood, people doing their laundry in the river and swimming in the falls was a pleasant change and refreshing for us.

23949958.name: Magic Falls (Copalita)
23949958.author: a TripAdvisor user
23949958.reviewBody: We were just in Huatulco in Jan 2009 and took the tour to the "Magic Falls". The trip to the falls was about 2 hrs or more each way in a 12 passenger van which they crammed 13 of us into. It was very cramped and the ride was WAY too long for what you see.  It is not even a very scenic drive as you are basically looking at the same trees all the way there and the road is extremely bumpy and very narrow.  You go to a "coffee plantation" for coffee before the falls, the coffee was great.  Then you drive for approx another 10 min or so and take the hike to the falls.  Its not really a hike but more of a walk and takes about 10 - 15 minutes.   The falls were nice but I didn\'t feel they were that spectacular (I have seen way better), the swim was nice, but again we only got about 20 minutes to swim and then we walked back out and back to the van and off to the coffee plantation for lunch...The lunch was great, we had chicken, pork, blackbeans and rice very yummy.  Then we had our so-called tour of the coffee plantation. They don\'t have a tour guide at the place so your guide in the van conducts the tour for you.  All I can say is that the coffee was great, but spending 4+ hours in a van for it was definitely not worth it in my opinion.  If you are at all prone to car sickness or have back/neck problems this is definitely not the tour for you...

14836236.name: Feb 5/08 trip to the falls
14836236.author: a TripAdvisor user
14836236.reviewBody: We booked this trip threw Signature Vacations at our hotel the Gala. The cost was $65 usd ea. left at 8 am back at 4 pm. we were picked up by a 11 passenger van it had AC. The trip up took about 1 1/2 hours there was one stop for refreshments                  ( included) at Sta. Maria. Next stop was at a coffee plantation for coffee & cookies, Here you can change into swimwear next was a short drive down a rough road to the parking lot for the falls. We were all given walking sticks and hiked single file for about 1.5 kms to the falls. There you can strip down to your swim wear and  get into the water to wade, swim, jump in to a pool , sit under cascades or swing from a rope and drop into the water. some people just sat on the benches and watched. The water was clear and cool but i did not get cold after being in it for about 45 minutes. The hike back from the falls was on a different trail which followed the river. it was very senic . From there we went back to the plantation for a lunch of chicken and rice ( very good)  along with wine and tequlia. After lunch our guide Anna walked us threw the grounds showing us the different trees, plants and a few penned deer. We saw banana, cinnamon (yup cinnamon is tree bark), fruitbread, bamboo and cacao trees and lemongrass. The roasting house for coffee was still in operation and coffee can be bought there.  We were then off for our nonstop trip back to the Gala. The road was gravel, rough in spots and very winding. I had to brace myself the whole way along that gravel road to keep from banging into my neighbor on the seat  three of us shared. I was pooped out by the time we got back and hit the hay early that evening.  The info sheet you get about the trip warns " Not recommended for people with back or neck problems and also road sickness" the motion sickness part is very true. Iam glad we went its worth seeing. have included some pictures of the trip.

671970139.name: Beautiful Beach and Awesome Snorkeling
671970139.author: a TripAdvisor user
671970139.reviewBody: We rented a Taxi for the day at 600 pesos and I bought the driver lunch and a couple of drinks. That is all good cause We were the only ones at one particular beach restaurant at this remote beach. Service was awesome and Coronos were cold. BUT...We let our guard down. We felt like We should buy some food from them as a courtesy. We ordered a prawn and squid dish with rice and salad. 12 hours later it started.....fortunately We were heading home the next day. I was very sick for 12 days and my wife was 7 days. Not fun. BEAUTIFUL Beach but be careful of the food.

664523688.name: Great beach.
664523688.author: a TripAdvisor user
664523688.reviewBody: We day-tripped on a moto from Santa Cruz. We snorkeled, swam, ate lunch, had a few way overpriced margaritas and a pricey less than average lunch, lounged, showered and returned the same day. \nThe natural setting is very nice. If that is what I am rating, I give that a 5. Typical Huatulco restaurants, over-priced seafood prepared without love. Huatulco reminds me of Cuba. It\'s probably the government oppression brought on by Fonatur. It seems like no one really gives a hoot and there is a clear sense of residual anger from the previous resident displacements etc... That said it is mostly friendly, welcoming(bring your $$) and safe. One visit was enough for me to San Augustin.

664213245.name: Snorkelling
664213245.author: a TripAdvisor user
664213245.reviewBody: We took a cab to this beach , about a 45 minute ride, most of it on unpaved and fairly rough road, but you can also boat in. The snorkelling is the best you will find in the area. Wear lots of reef friendly sunscreen and apply often (of course) it\u2019s easy to enjoy yourself so much you lose track of time! Wonderful little reef teeming with fish and other sea life. \nLots of small restaurants along the beach that you can sit at for the day as long as you eat and drink from the moderately high prices menus. Most have both table/chairs and Loungers.

663871670.name: Snorkeling
663871670.author: a TripAdvisor user
663871670.reviewBody: We hired MIGUEL w taxi for day. He was the best driver!!! Stayed with us all day. Again, saw some variety of terrain, went to CHARLIE\'S for the day where we were treated like royalty! Charlie grilled us fresh fish for lunch, looked after our belongings, he and his brother treated us like family! Reasonable prices, safe, happy little paradise that needs to be kept pristine and quiet

663512632.name: nice beach
663512632.author: a TripAdvisor user
663512632.reviewBody: great beach, lots of places to eat, but most places charge you a service fee. They don\'t tell you this until you see your bill

661517301.name: Snorkeling!
661517301.author: a TripAdvisor user
661517301.reviewBody: LOVED this bay! We took a taxi from town, he hung out for the day intil we were ready to return, for 800 pesos. Never seen such a huge school of fish! Literally millions swimming right beneath us. We got to the bay at about 9.30am. Good idea because around 1pm large tourist boats started dropping passengers.

659682655.name: Give them a break
659682655.author: a TripAdvisor user
659682655.reviewBody: This is a nice beach, and several good restos and even a small shower to clean up before the trip home.\nWhat I found out about this place is that the inhabitants are mainly squatters who were thrown off their properties if they lived where someone wanted to build a hotel or golf course. If you go there, make sure to stop off at the fruit market on the way home, and say hello to the turkeys while you\'re there.

659503946.name: Delightful Beach, Rustic Camp Style, and Big City Prices
659503946.author: a TripAdvisor user
659503946.reviewBody: Take the frequent bus from the Camionera Central in Huatulco (direction to Pochutla) hop off at the San August\u00edn exit and hop on to a collectivo (shared taxi) for the lengthy and dusty ride on winding, unpaved roads - 30 pesos or so. \nThe centre of the beach is best for swimming, safe with no tow. A tow can be felt at the extreme ends but the central part is fine even for children. Stay at the El Capi which offers fine and comfortable wood huts on stilts, quiet, soothing waves outside, and a secure and secured compound.  Moses the Manager is helpful and is well experienced in the tourism industry. Just relax. \nGood meals are offered at restos that line the playa at high prices. Maybe the tourist season is just too short. Be prepared and go with cash. Go for the day or overnight, either way it is a good time.  This beach is popular with Mexican families on weekends, few Canadian tourists go to San August\u00edn. Oh yes, simply hire a taxi to take you directly to San August\u00edn for about 300 pesos - easy and convenient too.

659010399.name: Lovely place for lunch
659010399.author: a TripAdvisor user
659010399.reviewBody: Best beach in all of HUX.  Had lunch and food was very good.  Beautiful beach.  Great service.  Will go back next year!

658501882.name: Great food and service
658501882.author: a TripAdvisor user
658501882.reviewBody: I Come here every year, beautiful people and excellent food and handmade gifts. Highly recommended for everyone.

658340186.name: Very nice bay to spent a day or two at.
658340186.author: a TripAdvisor user
658340186.reviewBody: We found this bay one of the best for snorkelling. A lot of fish right off the shore line. Very rough road but worth the drive.

657831027.name: Crystal clear water
657831027.author: a TripAdvisor user
657831027.reviewBody: My first beach experience and won\u2019t be the last .\nLazy day in the surf and sun drinking cheap beer and eating tacos.. sounds rough

657261647.name: Great Beach.  Great Snorkeling.
657261647.author: a TripAdvisor user
657261647.reviewBody: Safe swimming and the best snorkeling in Huatulco.  Good food on the beach also.  There are lots of shady palapas to rest in after your swim.  Go in the am before the tour boats arrive and enjoy this peaceful beach.

657080916.name: A Snorkeling Dream
657080916.author: a TripAdvisor user
657080916.reviewBody: Gorgeous beach with beautiful clear water.  Snorkeling is right from the beach and the coral comes in almost to the beach itself.  Lots of restaurants.  Recommend going  by boat.  The road in isnt great.

656571257.name: Very nice beach
656571257.author: a TripAdvisor user
656571257.reviewBody: Among the five beaches we have visited so far around Huatulco, this is the nicest.  While not ideally flat for walking, the slope is gentle.  It is scenic.  You can walk for about a half mile.  It is not nearly as crowded as Santa Cruz or La Entrega. There are several restaurants, some of which offer basic cabanas for rent.  There is no surf.  The water is clean.  If you snorkel by the rocks a couple of hundred yards offshore you will see schools of fish.  While the variety of fish is not spectacular, it is sufficiently interesting.  It takes about 45 minutes to get there from La Crucecita, depending on how fast your taxi driver is willing to drive the last 13 kilometers of dirt road.  You can also take a bus from the ADO station in town and grab a taxi at the dirt road intersection.  Either way, you can have a taxi driver pick you up at a pre-arranged time.  It\u2019s 400 pesos by taxi one way to or from Chahue.  We were four, so that was the right choice for us.

655103122.name: Love this beach
655103122.author: a TripAdvisor user
655103122.reviewBody: Beautiful..but harder to get to than the other beaches, great snorkelling, friendly vendors.  \nthere are 13 kms of a dirt road that cabbies will take you down to the beach.  The amazing thing is that the cabbies will just wait on the beach to take you back to your hotel.  Our guy waited 5 hours and then took us on his own accord to see some "badgers" but they were coatimundis.  If you have time, check this beach out.

654408426.name: Beautiful
654408426.author: a TripAdvisor user
654408426.reviewBody: Some of the clearest water we have seen in this area. Calm water. Definitely remote . Not very busy and not really over priced.

654198831.name: Awesome snorkelling
654198831.author: a TripAdvisor user
654198831.reviewBody: This was the best spot we snorkelled at. Lots of live reef and crevasses for those fish to hide in. Love how the reef is cordoned off to protect the reef and snorkellers. Didn\u2019t sit on the beach but it looked like a peaceful & beautiful.

653968143.name: Best snorkeling!
653968143.author: a TripAdvisor user
653968143.reviewBody: We took a boat tour of various beaches and San Augustin was the first stopy.  The water was amazingly clear and the coral was incredible but, the best part was seeing the large school of Yellowtail Surgeon fish grazing on the coral.  There must have been a couple hundred.  We got some great underwater photos because of the clarity of the water.  Friends that were with us who had snorkeled on the Great Barrier Reef said they didn\'t see anything like this there.  Great snorkeling!

653544906.name: Fabulous sunrises and sunsets
653544906.author: a TripAdvisor user
653544906.reviewBody: Fabulous sunrises and sunsets,Soft sand clean beaches Lo key Quaint and old time Mexico. San Augustinillo Is tucked in between Mazunte and Zipolite.

653254576.name: Our favourite Huatulco area beach!
653254576.author: a TripAdvisor user
653254576.reviewBody: We always go to this beach a couple of times during our stay in Huatulco! It is so beautiful and has great snorkeling and a wonderful lookout point! Can be accessed by boat or by taxis or a cheaper bus ride from Huatulco to the corner of Santa Maria turn off, then cross the hiway and catch a cab that will take you the rest of the way to the beach. Many great restaurants to choose from there.

652420694.name: Nice beach
652420694.author: a TripAdvisor user
652420694.reviewBody: Went to the beach at San Augustin, about 45 minute ride from La Crucecita by taxi. The beach is very nice, soft golden sand and very long. Lots of restaurants to sit at and enjoy a cold drink and fresh shrimp. The snorkelling is good with black coral close to shore. Just need to be sure to go when the tide level is up a bit or it gets too shallow to swim in some areas.

651896387.name: This place is awesome!
651896387.author: a TripAdvisor user
651896387.reviewBody: I was in this beach last month with friends. We were all astonished by the beauty of the bay and the beach. It brought back to me the memory of first seeing the ocean. A wonderful sensation. I just felt like stripping to my swimming trunks and jumping into the sea! Very welcoming

651562106.name: Lunch at San Augustin
651562106.author: a TripAdvisor user
651562106.reviewBody: We stopped in San Augustin during our tour of the bay\'s / snorkel trip. Looks like there is some good snorkeling right off the beach. We had already snorkeled in another bay  on the way down the coast so we just walked the beach and had lunch.The village is like a fishermans village turned tourist trap with many places to eat and lots of trinkets for sale. We were tendered in from our catamaran and we picked a place to eat , there is so many to pick from ! After a feed of fresh cooked fish we walked the beach from one end to the other , it is a very picturesque little village in a bay. Definitely worth seeing if you are in the area. Next time staying in Huatulco we may take a taxie there and snorkel the reef.

649208040.name: Beautiful
649208040.author: a TripAdvisor user
649208040.reviewBody: most beautiful place in Huatulco , scuba diving here is wicked good, restaurants are very good as well

649008469.name: One of the nicest beaches in the Huatulco area
649008469.author: a TripAdvisor user
649008469.reviewBody: I arrived at San Agustin Beach by boat on one of the "Seven Bays" tours ("Fandango") and thought it was a very nice beach.  It\'s a long, crescent-shaped beach with many beach-side restaurants and opportunities to snorkle, jet-ski, and more. I took a nice long walk to the far east end and enjoyed the sound of the pounding surf, and also walked around the village immediately behind the beach to check things out. All in all, I think it is one of the most picturesque beaches in the Huatulco area and can see why so many of the boats stop here for a few hours. It can also be reached by taxi, and many people come over for the day from Huatulco.

646381431.name: A day of snorkelling
646381431.author: a TripAdvisor user
646381431.reviewBody: We spent the day here and enjoyed ourselves. The snorkelling is decent and puffer fish make me smile........quite a few families of them just as you get to the reef. The road in is quite long and rough, I don\'t recommend it for young kids as some of the adults in our party, who don\'t get car sick, were  having issues with the rocking and bumping. We spent our day at Charly\'s restaurant, decent drinks but make sure you order off the menu and check prices. They tried to rip us off horribly. We should have realized. 4 margaritas, 3 vodka soda and 5 beer......well under a thousand pesos......add a fish (not on the menu) and our bill was $2400. No food item on the menu was over $130 pesos. Then they wanted a tip. We paid the full amount of the bill (amazingly English was no longer spoken during the dispute). As we walked away to get into our cab, I mentioned that I would be reviewing them on trip advisor, suddenly a mistake was made and the owner was so sorry for the overcharge and handed me $500 pesos. To put this beach lunch into perspective.....dinner for two at the highest ranked restaurant in town with 4 drinks, two appies, and two specials of the day...beef tenderloin with organic veggies and a mushroom reduction was $957 pesos with a good tip included. \n\nThe beach is beautiful sand and snorkelling is good.....just be a bit wary and pay your cab for the day to stay.

645360847.name: One of our Favourite Beaches
645360847.author: a TripAdvisor user
645360847.reviewBody: Big bay, and excellent beach and snorkeling.\nThe food is great as well.\nWe usually travel the San Agustin by boat but we have taken a taxi too.

645207151.name: Wonderful snorkeling
645207151.author: a TripAdvisor user
645207151.reviewBody: Accessible by boat or car. About 45mins from Hautulco, the last half on a dirt track. We paid 1000 peso total, from Las Brisas (further than Haultulco)  - the taxi driver waited four hours for us. \nWe arrived by 9 and left at 1. Snorkeled lots. Saw stingray. Best was a tight swirling shoal of \u2018sardines\u2019 with cormorants diving down through them. We watched the birds fishing underwater. Low tide point limits snorkeling a little. Truly magical beach and place. Right end side of beach is where you want to be for snorkeling. Recommended.

643184703.name: A fun beach
643184703.author: a TripAdvisor user
643184703.reviewBody: We drove there in our rental car (a Volkswagen sedan) from Huatulco; about a 45 minute drive. You turn off the main highway onto a dirt road. It\u2019s very bumpy and slow but also very do-able. When you get close you can turn left or right. I suggest turning right because that\u2019s where the best snorkeling is. There will be many different restaurants asking you to park at their place. Pick one, park, stay, eat, and have fun. We thought that we could just park anywhere and figure it out ourselves, but apparently it doesn\u2019t work that way. The place we parked at had excellent food and cold  drinks. Prices were maybe 25% more expensive than in town. There are a lot of activities to do there like tubing and boat rides and snorkeling. As you look out to sea, the snorkeling is on your right. All in all, it was a great day at the beach.

641147294.name: Playa San Augustine
641147294.author: a TripAdvisor user
641147294.reviewBody: Beautiful beach with excellent snorkeling.  Lots of restaurants with shade.  Great for swimming.  Cab ride from Huatulco usually runs about 600 pesos return and the cabbie will stay with you for about 3 hours.  Great beach to walk along.

638388665.name: Amazing Snorkeling
638388665.author: a TripAdvisor user
638388665.reviewBody: Stunning coral reefs here provide an amazing snorkel or dive / swim experience. We visited by boat and snorkelled with thousands of several species of colorful fish and followed a sting ray around for about 20 minutes. Lunch and drinks on the beach as well! You will not be disappointed.

638387513.name: Paradise
638387513.author: a TripAdvisor user
638387513.reviewBody: A very memorable day with my husband. We were swimming with a sting ray literally feet beneath us,  blow fish and massive schools of all different types of fish all around us,  my only regret was bout having an underwater camera with me.

638073467.name: Visit by Land of by Sea !
638073467.author: a TripAdvisor user
638073467.reviewBody:
I went by land. It was a 12 KM drive off the main road.As you are going from town to the airport turn left 
at the airport and then drive down a bumpy dirt road for 12 km. It is an adventure not for the timid.
It reminded me of  the small villages I visited in the South Pacific years ago.Then when you arrive there 
is a huge beach and you will not believe how many restaurants are there. Just swim, sun  eat, drink and enjoy ! !

638017823.name: Harder to get to, but worth the trip
638017823.author: a TripAdvisor user
638017823.reviewBody: As others have written, you can get here by boat, but we drove here.  A few kilometres west of the airport, you leave the main highway down this very bumpy, dusty road.  The car gets very much shaken on the way, even at slow speed.  It takes about 25 minutes of slow, bumpy driving to get to the beach from the highway.  Once there, you find a very wide beach (the longest beach we have seen in the area) which is only about half developed with restaurants, with the eastern half left undeveloped.  There is reasonable snorkelling in the western end.  Probably due to its more secluded location, it is less crowded than surrounding beaches.

636376886.name: Authentic
636376886.author: a TripAdvisor user
636376886.reviewBody: First it\'s only accessed by boat or a two hour cab ride on a dirt road but it\'s worth it.  Make a half day or more trip of it.  Cabs will take you there and wait for you for about $750 pesos.  Cute little beachside open air restaurants with the freshest seafood you\'ve ever had.  They literally bring the seafood straight from the ocean to your plate.  For $750 pesos you can rent a small fishing boat with guide who will give you a personal tour of the area for a couple hours.  Some of the prettiest beaches and rock formations in Mexico.  Not a lot of bi-lingual people.  Charlies Place is a good place to enjoy the day & Charlie can find you a fishing boat.

636190140.name: Go to Charly\'s
636190140.author: a TripAdvisor user
636190140.reviewBody: Spent a day at the bay at Charly\'s restaurant, right on the beach, great food,cold beer, a beautiful view.  Have told friends, when my time is up, put me in a beach chair, a cerveza in my hand and let me pass peacefully in paradise.

634037906.name: Secluded beach
634037906.author: a TripAdvisor user
634037906.reviewBody: Only way to access beach is via boat. There are some vendors where you can get a beach umbrella and chair.  They also have coconuts. The water here is beautiful.

633018443.name: Incredible
633018443.author: a TripAdvisor user
633018443.reviewBody: We have now been to Playa San Augustine 3 or 4 times. It is definitely one of the most beautiful beaches I have ever seen.If you are in Huatulco for anything more than 3-4 days this is a must. Snorkleing to the right side if your facing the water is amazing,beach itself has something for every one from extreme calm to the ends to gentle swells on the rest. Plenty of chairs and umbrellas and great people. Love this beach

632152699.name: Worth the trip
632152699.author: a TripAdvisor user
632152699.reviewBody: We reached this on a boat trip, but you can also access via road. Built up and with plenty of eating and drinking options like La Entrega, the water is crystal clear and there is a huge coral plate with huge numbers of colourful fish. It\u2019s definitely worth incorporating into your itinerary one way or another.

624863480.name: Perfect day
624863480.author: a TripAdvisor user
624863480.reviewBody: Our family took a private charter on a several bay tour and ended up in San Augustin beach.  Absolutely beautiful from the point we entered the bay to when we hit the beach.  Snorkelled the reef that was also beautiful, and ended with a wonderful meal at one of the restaurants on the beach, fresh and delicious.  We even had a local catch fresh oysters for us too.  A must visit while in Huatulco.

624560846.name: Vent out to see the beach but again the road was horrible
624560846.author: a TripAdvisor user
624560846.reviewBody:
Oct was rain as usual. Decided  on a day trip.
Road was 1 hr from the junction
Wash outs all the way
Hope they grade before Canada  shows up in Nov   they have no  clue on road maintenance but it's needed

611961386.name: Best beach to float on the water for hours
611961386.author: a TripAdvisor user
611961386.reviewBody: You can also take a boat around. Service and food was really good. Very friendly people. Would definitely come back.

602548044.name: Amazing Snorkeling and Food!
602548044.author: a TripAdvisor user
602548044.reviewBody: The snorkeling in San Agust\u00edn is amazing! Some days there is a current so it\u2019s exhausting. My 8 year did great it just wore her out but the end of the day. But it\u2019s so worth it! There is a ton of coral and beautiful fish. The food is really good too. They also have the pineapple and coconut drinks. Make sure you bring your GoPro or water proof camera because you will get amazing pictures. Go early like around 10 am and you\u2019ll have the place to yourself.  I would totally go back! One of my favorite memories from our trip.

596498740.name: Very Easy to Spend the Entire Day Here
596498740.author: a TripAdvisor user
596498740.reviewBody: This is one of the bays that is farther up the coast. We arrived by boat. I believe it is a long drive by land. Because most people arrive by sea we found the location not that crowded. Plenty of restaurants to eat at and tons of vendors selling small items as they roam the beach. The water temperature in July was perfect. There is a pretty good under-tow here so just be aware but it is still very safe to swim in the marked \'swimming area\'.

591700742.name: Nice Beach
591700742.author: a TripAdvisor user
591700742.reviewBody: This is the biggest beach of huatulco with a lot of places to eat. We loved the beach ate at charlys place it was good food and cheap only catch they don\'t take credit card and take cash. Use Mexican pesos they take dollars but they exchange it at a much lower rate. Good sea food at charlys place with a variety of drinks. We did the snorkeling which was cheap but they rented the equipment from charlys place. Now do the snorkeling it was amazing but don\'t buy their photos charly brought him to me do the snorkeling but I paid for my photos and never got them. if you buy their photos have them send them to you at the instant, if they tell you theyre going to text them to you BIG NO! otherwise great experience.

590101249.name: Worth the trip
590101249.author: a TripAdvisor user
590101249.reviewBody: We had a driver with SUV take us out to San Augustin. The dirt road is bumpy , we drove slow and took in the beautiful scenery. \nThe ocean was a little rough this day but we swam and relaxed and had lunch at our friends food stand. The beach was pretty much deserted this time of the year.

576061381.name: Wonderful Local Beach Community
576061381.author: a TripAdvisor user
576061381.reviewBody: Playa San Augustin is a welcome change to the busy tourist city of Huatulco!  It is a quaint fishing community with wonderful restaurants serving freshly caught seafood!  Very friendly people, a beautiful beach with great places to snorkel & very low prices!

569786696.name: Beautiful beach
569786696.author: a TripAdvisor user
569786696.reviewBody: Our second trip here.  We did notice a difference in the coral though from 8 years ago.  We noticed a lot of snorklers where very disrespectful of the reef and it is in trouble. We did see some wonderful sea life but it is decline.  Be sure to try and go during high tide to get a better experience and to avoid getting trapped in the coral.   Be sure to go to the la lala.  Wonderful food.  Take a taxi for $300 pesos one way if you have your own snorkel equipment.

568317148.name: Tony Lopez-Lopez Tours Highly Recommended!
568317148.author: a TripAdvisor user
568317148.reviewBody: Tony Lopez and his son Tony Jr, took us on a private boat tour from Barcelo Huatulco up the coast to Play San Augustin and many places in between. We followed a momma humpback whale and her baby for a long time then dove in with nearly 100 dolphins. Best day ever! We snorkelled with Tony Jr and saw the most amazing array of colourful fish including a puffer. Ate guacamole and chips at a great beach restaurant on Playa San Augustin. Tony Lopez offers other tours and we\u2019ll likely join him for another as he was a wonderful guide and an all round great guy.

568193225.name: Playa San Augustin
568193225.author: a TripAdvisor user
568193225.reviewBody: Beautiful beach and great snorkeling on a shelf reef.  Water is very clear with good visibility.  Lots of fish to see.  Take an underwater camera if you have one.\nLots of restaurants along the beach and the beach is long and great for long walks.\nAbout one hour drive from Huatulco.  A little over half of that is on a gravel road.   Cab ride can be found for about 600 pesos return with the driver staying with you there for about three hours.

567740381.name: Beautiful Bay
567740381.author: a TripAdvisor user
567740381.reviewBody: Relaxing, beautiful bay.  GREAT snorkeling too!  The road is a little rough, but it was beautiful.  Lot\'s of little restaurants & huts.

567584258.name: Very Quiet, Good Snorkeling
567584258.author: a TripAdvisor user
567584258.reviewBody: Took a taxi out to San Augustin. last 13 kilometres a bit on the rough side. Dirt road. Would consider doing the boat trip next time. Went on a Tuesday and it was pretty much deserted. Snorkeling good but not as good as last trip, water a little stirred up. Certainly worth a visit

567507106.name: Great Snorkeling
567507106.author: a TripAdvisor user
567507106.reviewBody: We stopped in here on our jet ski tour to do some snorkeling.  Large reef with many beautiful fish.  Lots of beachfront restaurants with fresh seafood.  But not cheap!  Lots of locals constantly trying to sell you their \'handmade\' wares.

567073593.name: Incredible beach!
567073593.author: a TripAdvisor user
567073593.reviewBody: We had the opportunity to go there and have a relaxing time in the beach. Many restaurants, different prices. We went to "Casa de los Abuelos" rest and the prices were a little high but was good. They have hammocks to rest and a lot of shade.

566862549.name: Good for some lazy beach/snorkel time
566862549.author: a TripAdvisor user
566862549.reviewBody: Went here as part of a day long boat trip. Its reachable by car so a little more built up than the bays only accessed by boat. But still not too busy. It\'s nice that you can walk into the water and do some snorkeling. We caught a fish on the way and the captain asked about having the little restaurant cook it for us. But he quietly told us that for him it would cost very little, for us, it would be $250 pesos. TO cook our fish. That\'s crazy. We ended up heading to another bay where they cooked the fish for $120 and it came with rice and salad. But overall, St. Augustine is worth the trip.

566067382.name: Major tourist trap
566067382.author: a TripAdvisor user
566067382.reviewBody: The beach was absolutely lovely.  The Bay is lined with enough restaurants and bars that are not competitive.  Prices are very high.  Bring your own food and negotiate with the collective taxi before you leave the highway because they will rip you off.  Snorkeling is good and the waves are gentle.

565537903.name: Snorkeling for some members of the tour
565537903.author: a TripAdvisor user
565537903.reviewBody: Went on tour of Real Mexico and this was the last stop nice Resturant on the beach yummy shrimp cocktails and shrimp in a hollowed out pineapple with gorgeous cheese sauce . Good service a family place nice beach with not big waves many families with children. Clean warm water. Good washroom facsilites

565356014.name: 7 bay tour
565356014.author: a TripAdvisor user
565356014.reviewBody: Awesome tour with a stop for lunch and swim at this great beach. Ocean was calm and clear. There are many restraunts  to choose with reasonable pricing with drinks. A few vendors selling . Definitely will go back to this bay.

563622194.name: Snorkel and dine
563622194.author: a TripAdvisor user
563622194.reviewBody: San Augustin is such a beautifuk little beach town with great restaurants and facilities.  The water is super clear and the snorkeling is fabulous.  You can go by bus and cab or come by boat - both ways are an adventure on their own.

563425599.name: Excellent snorkeling
563425599.author: a TripAdvisor user
563425599.reviewBody: Of the five beaches we visited this was the best for snorkeling. We went here as part of our day out with "Pulpo" fishing but you could cab here for under 200 pesos from Santa Cruz.

563018015.name: Decent Snorkeling
563018015.author: a TripAdvisor user
563018015.reviewBody: We hired Panga Captain Jose Louis and his boat Banquets for a day of snorkeling and swimming at bays and beaches of our choice. Our final destination was Playa San Augustine. Warm water and a variety of marine life made it an enjoyable experience. It\'s apparent that the reef is well on its way to becoming damaged.

561066079.name: Fantastic snorkelling!!
561066079.author: a TripAdvisor user
561066079.reviewBody: We arrived here by boat, on a full day tour we booked with Huatulco Tours Enrique ( separate review ) for lunch, and some time snorkelling.  I can\'t remember the name of the restaurant we ate at, but it was very good.  The highlight though was the time in the water.  The reef is very close to shore, and you don\'t have to go out very far to see some amazing fish, and gorgeous corals.  Enrique , our guide said this is one his favourite snorkel places in all of Huatulco.

559697261.name: A must
559697261.author: a TripAdvisor user
559697261.reviewBody: A bit of a drive but so worth it.  Long Beach and the most amazing snorkeling, great food, drinks and ppl

558479727.name: Beautiful and awesome beach town
558479727.author: a TripAdvisor user
558479727.reviewBody:
Beautiful beach ideal for fun family time and dogs friendly. Walking distance from Mazunte and Zipolitle and easy access. 
You can rent surf boards right in the beach from the lifeguard kids Javier and Cristian, they were so friendly  got a good deal and good tips from them. (The rentals help funding the beach' lifeguard, literally we saw them pulling a dude out of trouble)
The best was the BOAT TRIP so unexpensive! look for the boat named Yetlanezy or ask for Miguel Hernandez or Lidio.
We saw whales, dolphins, tons of turtles and fish, the tour lasted 2.5 hrs and it was just awesome  Miguel and Lidio are experienced fisherman, the safety of passengers is their main priority and they know all the good spots.
San Agustinillo has good restaurants and trucks drive through in the morning selling fresh fruit our fav was El Pescador, really good arrachera and shrimp. 
Easy access, we drove from Oaxaca city and the road is fine, obviously requires an experienced driver but is not dangerous or complicated, most of drive is all highway, (99%) the town is peaceful and not so touristy. Perfect place just to relax and lay down.

558375964.name: Nice, clean and mostly deserted beach
558375964.author: a TripAdvisor user
558375964.reviewBody: Two sides to this area. One has snorkeling, tourists and outdoor restaurants. The other side,,, nothing but beach. Great spot. Take an umbrella, no shelter here.

557768787.name: Good snorkeling and good food
557768787.author: a TripAdvisor user
557768787.reviewBody: Stopped here for lunch during our boat trip.  Our group had a variety of foods at Mar Y Luz restaurant - fish, shrimp, guacamole, and of course cerveza, lemonade, margaritas, etc.  All good.

554853848.name: Can be dangerous to snorkel or swim!! Will not return to snorkel here.
554853848.author: a TripAdvisor user
554853848.reviewBody: Beautiful bay with coral plates (mostly dead) and lots of different tropical fish to discover. HOWEVER - what the guides books don\'t tell you - the water is so shallow over the coral that as the tides turn you can get trapper beyond the coral. Many people were forced to touch the coral to get over it and back to the beach. Nasty cuts. Go with Entrega or Maguey - same fish safer environment.

553075854.name: Good But Long Way
553075854.author: a TripAdvisor user
553075854.reviewBody: I took taxi to San Augustin.  300 pesos each way and taxi waited. Good thing too because there were no taxis waiting to pick up fares.  Taxi driver took me to palapa restaurant on the beach and they fitted me with snorkel gear for 100 pesos and watched my stuff while I snorkeled. I went this route because I was solo and the boat would have been very expensive by myself. I had read a lot about San Agustin\'s snorkeling on TA and wanted to check it out after having done Entrega the day before. Both bays had the best snorkeling I had seen in Mexico, including Cozumel and Akumal in the Yucatan. I found Entrega to be better.  The coral was more accessible.  Both beaches had a bunch of restaurants and snorkel rental. San Augustin was a long way away from Santa Cruz where I was staying.  Maybe about 45 minute drive. Went back to Entrega the next day.  Still good!

552599933.name: Beautiful water, big waves.
552599933.author: a TripAdvisor user
552599933.reviewBody: We enjoyed people watching, the sand was hot and the waves were a bit too wild for our liking. But we had a few good laughs watching others daring to go in the ocean, and then being shoved out to the shore, like wales. Had a nice cold beer, met some locals selling wood artifacts. They were friendly, not pushy at all. The best thing is the beautiful turquoise ocean.... We loved the thundering sound of waves.

549620219.name: Calm Water
549620219.author: a TripAdvisor user
549620219.reviewBody: We went there and it was beautiful.  Water was calm and I watched the fish swim around my legs. We ate at a restaurant called the hungry shark and the food was excellent.  Thank you \nCarlos!

549062493.name: snorkel trip
549062493.author: a TripAdvisor user
549062493.reviewBody: We booked a snorkel trip through Sunwing to this beach since it had great reviews on trip advisor.  I don\'t know if it was our guide, but the deep water was a bit murky and although there was a lot of coral, we did not see a significant amount more fish than we have seen at other beaches in the area. The guide did not want us snorkeling too close to the shallower areas so maybe there were more fish there?\nThe area around was interesting to see, since you pass by small farms of banana,papaya, pineapple, etc. and see how the local residents live.\nWe had a nice lunch there at a ocean-side cafe- it was quiet and very relaxing.

548944703.name: Beautiful beach
548944703.author: a TripAdvisor user
548944703.reviewBody:
Despite the relatively long journey from La Crucecita (local bus + taxi = well over an hour), this beach was worth the visit! 
Clear waters, few tourists, a strip of beach restaurants where you can chill and enjoy a seafood meal.
Our visit was also blessed with sightings of a couple of spotted eagle rays that were swimming very close to shore!

Tip of the day: if you arrive by taxi, make sure that you book a pick up for your return, because taxis do not reach San Agustin unless they have customers. We didn't book one and got stuck for 1.5 hours, until after sunset. Eventually we asked a local guy to drive us to the main intersection (13Km away) in return for money...

548878071.name: Good but did not live up to its hype
548878071.author: a TripAdvisor user
548878071.reviewBody: San Augustin did not quite live up to its hype. Fair number of restaurants and some distance from Huatulco itself, it did make a decent day trip, however Playa Violin was a lot better than San Augustin and was easier to get to. Only thing was that Playa Violin has no ammenities (bar, toilets) and is supposedly private but still beautiful. San Augustin was good to see but other beaches were superior in my opinion.

546136490.name: Beach outside of time
546136490.author: a TripAdvisor user
546136490.reviewBody: This lovely little bay is the Mexico of 30+ years ago.  Maybe during high season it is not as ideal as during our visits, but nothing more is needed here.  Gorgeous clear, calm bay with nice reef and lots of marine life.  Easy access to hiring a launch to visit some other spots and see marine turtles and dolphins along the way.  We stayed a night in a cabana, and despite (or because of) complete power outage, were able to enjoy that disconnect that is so difficult to achieve in our world. We used our solar light to assist in cooking our meal, then enjoyed a night on the beach free of the outside world.  Woke up and went for long swim with bay to ourselves. May not work for those used to more civilized accommodations, but if you love simplicity this may fill your niche.

545133613.name: Lovely setting
545133613.author: a TripAdvisor user
545133613.reviewBody:
From villablanca it is about a 45 minute taxi ride at 400 pesos each direction.
A part of the journey is down a dirt road passing local dwellings, fruit crops and turkeys and peacocks.
Upon arrival we were led through to a beachside restaurant, LaLa.
The taxi driver did ask first if this would be to our liking, as it was his friend. There was not very many tables occupied as today was Monday. Countless restaurants stretch along the sand with one being much the same as the next. Several beach vendors bearing the usual offerings came by , but were not at all pesky.
The guacamole was fresh and delicious.As beach restaurants with a view go the prices were reasonable.
The water was warm and clear, coral reefs were clise to shore, the sabd course and clean.

544635858.name: Great beach
544635858.author: a TripAdvisor user
544635858.reviewBody: We went to this beach as part of our ATV tour.  We had a one hour stopover which was plenty of time for a beer and snack and swim.  Great snorkelling.

544284653.name: Stopped for lunch
544284653.author: a TripAdvisor user
544284653.reviewBody: Our fishing guide Valentino took us to this beach for lunch during our Bay Tour - we ate at a great little restaurant that had excellent sea food.  The baked half-pineapple filled with cheese and sea food was delicious - as were the margaritas!

543019840.name: Clean , quite beach
543019840.author: a TripAdvisor user
543019840.reviewBody: tucked away beach town, many restaurants, rent snorkel gear, take a boat ride, just hang & drink Coronas!

542873058.name: Part of the bahias tour on Fandango
542873058.author: a TripAdvisor user
542873058.reviewBody: Uh, the beach is nice. The restaurant recommended by the Fandango boat was ok. There are other restaurants but that one seemed to have the cleanest restrooms. Overall I enjoyed my short two hour stay at this beach. Less vendors coming up to you too.

541441620.name: Paradisio!
541441620.author: a TripAdvisor user
541441620.reviewBody: True Mexican beach - very few gringos - hooray!  Warm, calm water and small waves.\nNumerous restaurants line the beach for your pleasure.

541280124.name: A gorgeous place with clear green water
541280124.author: a TripAdvisor user
541280124.reviewBody: This beach is really beautiful, and very good for swimming and snorkeling. The water is very clear, and the beach restaurant we went to was delicious. Strong recommend!

532616309.name: Snorkel trip
532616309.author: a TripAdvisor user
532616309.reviewBody: Shop around, ask questions & you will find the best pricing. We chose a boat excursion because it was a better price for the 3 of us than taking a taxi. We also had e opportunity to snorkel in another bay in addition to Playa San Augustin......which was amazing and big. Unfortunately it rained hard when we landed on San Augustin but it was like we were taking a shower.\nWe had a fabulous day and you won\'t be disappointed if you head to this beach.

516472143.name: Fun!
516472143.author: a TripAdvisor user
516472143.reviewBody: Nice place to enjoy seafood and some cold drinks! I believe this is the beach where you go snorkeling

515538519.name: Beautiful beach, a bit of a drive
515538519.author: a TripAdvisor user
515538519.reviewBody: The beach was beautiful. Our taxi took us to one of the restaurants which is not what we had on mind, so we walked right through and out to the beach and walked all the way to the left where it was just sand, no restaurants. Leo\'s place is the last place to the left. He let us use one of his palapas, his chairs, and we order drinks and waters. Very low key, no pressure.

493276906.name: Great snorkeling and Beach. The ride to get here is the only down side.
493276906.author: a TripAdvisor user
493276906.reviewBody: Taxi or boat to get here. Just past the airport road.Taxi was about 300 peso each way from LaCrucetia. Cement to dirt road to beach. They are working on the road adding more cement. The beach is nice and the restaurants are nice also. snorkeling is great.Water is calm. rocks to the right looks like an island where the boats are is where we saw family of sting rays and schools of fish.

484969669.name: Best beach of all
484969669.author: a TripAdvisor user
484969669.reviewBody: St Augustine is a great beach for swimming and to people watch. This seems to be the best of all beaches in the area. Can be reached by Taxi or of course from the beach with one of the available tours. In particular Pilo Vasquez 9 bay and fish tour. The ATV tour also goes to this beach.

481452875.name: Real Tropical Paradise
481452875.author: a TripAdvisor user
481452875.reviewBody: This beach has everything you want for a beach experience at a low price. Truly a real paradise that not many foreign tourists come to visit. More of a local beach for local residents. Awesome seafood and drinks.

476844662.name: AMAZING reef.
476844662.author: a TripAdvisor user
476844662.reviewBody: Took a quad excursion to San Augustin.  The reef is amazing.  Very busy beach.  I wish we had more time to explore the area.  I will definitely return.

475024353.name: Lost in Paradise
475024353.author: a TripAdvisor user
475024353.reviewBody:
Beautiful beautiful beach . Loved everything about this location. Nice restaurants, excellent customer service.
Remote location do not get discouraged driving there of main road. Paradise will wait at the end of road.
Too many restaurants and beaches to choose from. Food it's great.
Excellent snorkeling area.

474312556.name: Snorkeling.
474312556.author: a TripAdvisor user
474312556.reviewBody: The snorkeling here is amazing. Super little restaurants with amazing food and cocktails. Make sure to bring an underwater camera. So worth the trip.

473708526.name: ATV to Playa San Augstin -- worth the trip
473708526.author: a TripAdvisor user
473708526.reviewBody: Booked an ATV tour with Paraiso Huatulco from just off the airport to Playa San Augustin.  Denis and Antonio were great guides and we had a great time at Playa San Augustin.  \n\nOur first glimpse of the beach was from  the shrine of San Agustin which overlooks the whole bay.  The beach itself is probably the best beach in Huatulco as there are reefs right off shore and great bars and food right on the beach itself.  Great food reasonably priced meals and drinks and nice people (mostly locals).

473692947.name: Great Snorkeling, beach and food!
473692947.author: a TripAdvisor user
473692947.reviewBody: We did a private tour with just our family of four, with Pablo Narvaez.  An excellent way to get to this fantastic beach, with very good snorkeling.  I was a bit surprised at the amount of ocean life, as we have been to some pretty amazing spots for snorkeling:  Belize, Nicaragua, Bahamas, Kauai and Cozumel.  Pablo took us to lunch at El Cape, where they cooked up the fish we caught on the way there!  A quiet, spot at the end of this beautiful beach.  A tour to this great snorkeling spot was made spectacular with Pablo, as the dolphins played alongside our boat, we saw many turtles, even saving one from being tangled in a rope.  A fantastic day!

473506872.name: Great Sea Food with a to-die-for view.
473506872.author: a TripAdvisor user
473506872.reviewBody: We went to Playa San Augustin after a great morning of snorkeling. Eat at the "LaLa" restaurant on it\'s second floor covered eating area with a hammock next to our table. I had the house specialty "Stuffed Pineapple", a half pineapple stuffed with shrimp, octopus and scallops with pineapple chunks and cheese, FANTASTIC. The view of the bay from the second floor is BEATUTIFUL!!!

473053668.name: Best snorkelling in Huatulco, best beach as well...
473053668.author: a TripAdvisor user
473053668.reviewBody:
We made the trip out last Saturday and really enjoyed it.  We ended up eating (and lounging) at a restaurant on the far right (if you're looking out at the water).  This was of course due to our driver having an amigo at the establishment and wanting to park his car there.  Initially we weren't to sure if we liked it as that's where the locals kept their boats.  As the day went on though we were thankful.  Over time the main (centre) beach fills up with hordes of people.  Massive tour boats pull in and unload and swarm the beach.  If you were unlucky enough to have selected one of the restaurants that works with a tour operator you'd likely have people sitting on top of you in short order.  The coral is in really bad shape (we're divers) but we saw all sorts of fish as we snorkelled.

We also walked to the far left of the beach no one was there.  No huts, no people, just water and sand.  That was great!  We even saw a school of rays!

Tips:
- Make sure there are no extra fees at the restaurant up front.  (Eg parking a car...  :| )
- Make sure the menu prices are current.
- We paid a cab driver that we'd used before $700 pesos for the day to drive us out and back.  I hear some pay more, some pay less.

(Can you tell this is where we felt cheated by the restaurant?  Seeing the fish cool fish and enjoying the sun made it worth it anyway.)

472965409.name: Local seafood
472965409.author: a TripAdvisor user
472965409.reviewBody: During a tour of the Huatulco Bahias we stopped at this beach for a couple of hours.  You can enjoy delectable seafood.  I recommend the garlic, butter, or breaded shrimp.  You can also snorkel there if one chooses to.

472781038.name: Good Snorkeling
472781038.author: a TripAdvisor user
472781038.reviewBody: We were staying in Santa Cruz and booked a private tour in a 7 seat Suburban before our arrival for 1600 pesos for the day.  There were 4 of us so did not want to be cramped in a regular sized taxi for the 40 minute one way trip.  \nWe were there on a weekday and the beach was almost empty.  We set up at one of the restaurants in front of the roped off snorkel area and went for a snorkel.  Were no boat tours while we were there so we had the area mostly to ourselves.  Coral areas only a few yards off the beach so easy to snorkel from the beach.  We also snorkeled at playa entrega and playa arrocito and playa san augustin was our favourite snorkel spot of the three playas.  \n

472367957.name: Totally Chill Beach!
472367957.author: a TripAdvisor user
472367957.reviewBody: We drove ourselves to this spot.  Got a table at La Lalas and spent the day snorkeling, eating and taking in the beauty!  Restaurant had a pet parrot that sat on my daughters finger, native folks came but to sell us stuff but we\'re not aggressive AT ALL.  We paid 10 pesos to an older fellow to hold his big tame iguana.  My boys loved that!  Our waiter Jaciel, was the best!

471993767.name: Great day a la playa
471993767.author: a TripAdvisor user
471993767.reviewBody:
Highly recommend! Our 4 th beach so far... 

We took a taxi- 700 from the "Electra" ( scooter electronic shop at the roundabout)   (we figured that was fine -600 +tip as others here post 600, but our hotel says it's 400 one way) . 
Taxi drove us to his "amigos". Which we didn't care about. It was one of the last restos on the beach ( far right) by the local boats.  (there was a100 pesos add-on on our bill- surprise!
