But we think it was parking & thus we didn't care, as our driver stayed there all day waiting for us and parking was in the shade). 

We snorkled multiple times- circled the rock- be a decent swimmer and be experienced diver/ swimmer to go this way( understand depth perception in waves by rocks/ coral) , saw family of rays, some fish we have never seen ( angels on steroids?? Looked like punk rockers either long hair) lots of Dead coral and tour guides walking around on live spots... 
:( But,  lots of tiny spots / holes with beautiful living coral: yellow, purple, blue, orange) 

We walked the length of the beach to escape the crowds ( tour boats with hundreds dominate the middle from 11am- 3pm on a Saturday) . Swam at the deserted section... Wished we brought money during our walk to sit and buy some beers for an hour or two at the last restos after the derelict shacks ( "la ci- something..??"has a blue sign.) As u feel you have escaped from all craziness when at the far far left.  And no tour boats come this way. 

Our food was good ( fresh ocean treats & guacamole) as were our beers at that resto on the far right buuuuut... ASK the prices as of THAT day.  As the menu prices were much cheaper than on our bill. 

 I did mention to our lovely server, politely,  that they would have got a bigger tip if they told us the real price up front (& about the sitting charge or taxi parking charge - whatever it was). But by charging us all these new more expensive prices (we JUST had enough cash with us to cover the surprise....! ) at the end of the day-all they will develop is a "con man" reputation. 

Go...Enjoy!!!

471729830.name: Great for kids
471729830.author: a TripAdvisor user
471729830.reviewBody: Excellent beach for snorkeling and swimming if you are not into bitg waves. The water is clear and shallow with lots if beautiful reefs. You can also eat there some freshly caught seafood.

471510643.name: Nicest beach in the area
471510643.author: a TripAdvisor user
471510643.reviewBody: We boarded "Macho" from the Santa Cruz harbour at 10:00 am for a trip to Playa San Agustin, stopped at a secluded beach on the way for some snorkelling and swimming then went onto San Augustin for lunch and the afternoon. Nice long beach, warm water and good snorkelling. We went on a week day to avoid the crowds. Plenty of seafood restaurants serving fresh fish, octopus and large shrimp. On our return we were treated to a sighting of a whale. Excellent experience.

470390620.name: Beautiful beach
470390620.author: a TripAdvisor user
470390620.reviewBody: The beach is awesome and really beautiful, but unfortunately lined up with about 20 beachside palapa restaurants which, in my opinion, detracted from the natural beauty. I love a good beachside restaurant, but these were empty, basic and not appealing to even an adventurous traveler. I wish at least half of them could be removed.

468408026.name: Private beach (almost)
468408026.author: a TripAdvisor user
468408026.reviewBody: Rented a van with a driver, $350 pesos /hr., drove us to a quiant beach in saint Agustin, lots of info regarding the area, plants, and animals, very interesting.

468273043.name: Beautiful, long beach.
468273043.author: a TripAdvisor user
468273043.reviewBody: Incredible beach, with very good snorkelling. We had a table at Ruby Mar with our group of 9. they were very attentive and their food was good. I had the best

466934484.name: Beautiful beach, shame about the reef
466934484.author: a TripAdvisor user
466934484.reviewBody: Enjoyed an afternoon here, nice views and quiet beach as it\'s \'out of the way\'. Everywhere we went we heard this was the most beautiful beach with the best snorkelling in the region but the reef life is the same as most places in this part of Mexico. As a trained diver I would say the fish life is moderately healthy, however the coral life has been decimated by so many massive tour boats of 70+ people coming in at once, bashing into fragile coral, leaving virtually nothing left. You can see the broken coral littering the sea floor and I only spotted one very small soft coral species. People who don\'t snorkel or dive much will still think it\'s pretty cool, so it\'s worth the trip out there but don\'t expect a "Planet Earth" type experience.

466321724.name: beautiful place for snorkeling
466321724.author: a TripAdvisor user
466321724.reviewBody: with another couple, we hired a boat for a day (C$55 pp); 7 bay tour.  he picked us from our hotel beach.  he also told us we would see turtles/whales/dolphins but unfortunately, there was a storm that day and we only managed to see dolphins.  he tried to troll for fish but it was like riding a roller coasted as the seas were rough.  in the end, we snorkeled several beaches and ended at San Augustin.  our captain recommended Lalala restaurant for food; grilled whole fish with veg/rice & saute calamari with rice/veg 380 pesos.  good food; good servings! since the water was rough, our captain paid for our cab ride back to our hotel.

465904146.name: Beautiful
465904146.author: a TripAdvisor user
465904146.reviewBody: ATV ride to this beach was a blast. The guide was a wealth of knowledge and fun. The tail guide was a sweety too! Fun dusty ride with a beautiful beach destination. Highly recommend this tour!!

465288990.name: Love this place
465288990.author: a TripAdvisor user
465288990.reviewBody:
We went to San Augustin twice during our visit.  Once on a boat tour with a Pilo and the second by taxi.  The boat ride is very nice as we as we can enter the reef from a different direction other than the shore.  The water that day was pretty calm and we saw tons of fish and sea life. The second time we went to Augustin we went by taxi. It is close to the airport then you take a dirt road.  It is a slow, rough ride but doable.  The water was rough that day so you had to chose your snorkelling spot carefully.  However the beach is beautiful and not busy. Very relaxing there!

Both times we ate at the La La Restaurant.  Really good food and service there.  

Playa San Augustin is definitely one of our favourite beaches in Huatulco!

465182450.name: Best beach in Huatulco area
465182450.author: a TripAdvisor user
465182450.reviewBody: In the 6 seasons we\'ve been coming the road in has been incrementally improved but it is still a rough ride - and totally worth the effort. There are some roadside fruit stands about 3/4 of the way in which offer delicious ripe fruit.  Beautiful beach. coral reef with colourful fish a very short swim from shore.  There are many palapa\'s to serve you food and drink.  I can imagine there are times when it is crowded (Christmas or Easter) but usually not many people there.  You can walk up the hill to the point past the chapel and look down over the bay or west toward Coyulla.  Spectacular views.  Take a cab from town, might cost you 500 pesos.

464601081.name: "A Must on your To-Do List"
464601081.author: a TripAdvisor user
464601081.reviewBody: We visited this beach on a bay tour. What a unique experience.  Ate lunch at one of the beach huts (2 lobsters and 6 coronos) CHEAP!!!  Quite a long trip by water but well worth it.  Good to get there early before the big tour boats arrive.

464384553.name: Just beautiful
464384553.author: a TripAdvisor user
464384553.reviewBody: Off the beaten path... literally. Dirt road! Once you get there it is just amazing, the longest beach of all the baias. A few restaurants, palapa style. Snorkeling is the best, Entrega is second best. Not too many people. Get a taxi to bring you... they wait for you even if you stay for hours. Ask for the price, most drivers wanted 600 pesos return, which was roughly $30. from Crucecita or Santa Cruz it takes 45/60 minutes. It\'s a must see especially if you snorkel .

462831974.name: Where is everyone?
462831974.author: a TripAdvisor user
462831974.reviewBody: I would actually rate this beach above average but not very good. We heard that it was the best snorkeling in Huatulco and while it was good for fish - schools of yellowtail- etc. the water was pretty murky for about three quarters of the roped off swimming area. Maybe it was the time of day or tide. There are about fifteen restaurants along the beach so there must be a lot of people that come here sometimes but when we were there the restaurant staff outnumbered the guests.\nIt\'s a good place to hang out for the day.

462072996.name: Lovely beach
462072996.author: a TripAdvisor user
462072996.reviewBody: We went by car to this beach to snorkel the reef, it was beautiful and the guys enjoyed the snorkeling. The beach is beautiful and the people here are very nice and gracious. The food on the beach was also excellent.

460964999.name: Snorkeling paradise
460964999.author: a TripAdvisor user
460964999.reviewBody: This somewhat secluded beach has a wonderful reef for snorkeling and numerous restaurants right on the beach, so you can enjoy the view while enjoying the food.

460784672.name: Beautiful mexico
460784672.author: a TripAdvisor user
460784672.reviewBody: Lazy day swimming and eating under the palapa. Primitive "facilities" at el truncko\nFresh fish prepared simply with cervesas. Great guacamole and pico. \nToo windy today for snorkeling. Swimming was perfect. Nice walking beach.

460357033.name: Good snorkelling off the beach
460357033.author: a TripAdvisor user
460357033.reviewBody: We took a cab  to this beach and were expecting to have to hire a boat to take us snorkeling however there is a coral reef that comes up right into the middle of this beach.  You can rent snorkeling equipment for about 70 pesos per day and take a pick of a restaurant to eat and drink while you spend the afternoon snorkeling.   We were at La La and the staff were very friendly and accommodating and the food was good.  A lot of the coral is dead as invariably people stand on it because it\'s so shallow and I suspect lots of boats went over it at one time.  There was still a pretty good population of smaller fish to see and we saw a couple of puffer fish.  It\'s quite shallow and I think if you wanted to expose younger children to snorkeling this may be a good place to do so as you don\'t have to jump in and out of boats and there\'s not a really strong current.  There\'s really not a lot of snorkeling in the west side of Mexico so I would recommend it if you are in the area and want to do this.

459380578.name: Stop on ATV excursion
459380578.author: a TripAdvisor user
459380578.reviewBody: A beautiful beach with some quaint cantinas selling inexpensive beer and food.  \nWe enjoyed a quick swim and a cold cervesa during our stop here.

458694861.name: wish i could live there!
458694861.author: a TripAdvisor user
458694861.reviewBody: was the best beach we visited. long drive but worth it to spend the day on a beautiful, huge beach with great snorkelling. the bumpy roads keep the big tourist buses away so the beach was mostly empty! loved swinging in a hammock for siesta! perfect version of paradise!

457627732.name: Great genuine Mexican beach
457627732.author: a TripAdvisor user
457627732.reviewBody: Spent a hour at this wonderful beach during an ATV excursion. It was hard to leave. Great swimming and lots of options for lunch and Coronas at 25 pesos each ! The locals here were friendly and the whole beach and facilities offered were a genuine reflection of the perfect Mexican beach IMHO.

456749884.name: Gorgeous, with large rock formations and coral ,
456749884.author: a TripAdvisor user
456749884.reviewBody: Took a water taxi from Santa Cruz to this beach. Approx 1:45 hr on water but totally worth it.. many great restaurants on the beach and a couple markets. Drinks,food and the scenery make for a great day.

456541790.name: Fabulous beach!
456541790.author: a TripAdvisor user
456541790.reviewBody: As part of an ATV tour we stopped at San Augustin beach for a swim and lunch.  What a spectacular beach\ud83d\ude0e.  Pristine water and sand.  Great snorkeling right from shore.  Had a fresh snapper lunch for a great price.  Will definitely return and stay longer next time!

456027385.name: Beautiful beach amazing experience
456027385.author: a TripAdvisor user
456027385.reviewBody: Beautiful beach, definitely worth checking out. I have snorkeled here twice and each time has been amazing.

455500865.name: Great snorkel spot
455500865.author: a TripAdvisor user
455500865.reviewBody: Hired a cab from Secrets to take us there for a couple hours (45 min cab) paid $50 usd for this & cabbie stayed there & waiting for us. We rented gear at Chalos then had drinks there after. Snorkel to the right near rocks is best area

454462386.name: Awesome Beach
454462386.author: a TripAdvisor user
454462386.reviewBody: Fantastic beach with many restaurants and great snorkelling.  It\'s a little further out and has a pretty rough road getting there, but worth the trip.  It\'s about a 40 minute drive.

454399588.name: A great excursion
454399588.author: a TripAdvisor user
454399588.reviewBody: The cab ride was close to an hour with about half of it on a bumpy dirt road but we\'re glad we made the trip. There\'s really good snorkeling here with easy rental if needed. There are plenty of little restaurants serving a variety of affordable options. This place feels off the beaten path and was not crowded the day we were there.

453869844.name: Best Snorkel Spot in Huatulco area
453869844.author: a TripAdvisor user
453869844.reviewBody: This bay is amazing for snorkeling right from the beach with a very large coral reef with all the fish you could ask for ... many types of puffers, schools of surgeons and more.  The coral reef is healthy and pretty.  Great sandy beach as well with lots of washed up coral bits.  This is a place where the locals come and no hotels here.  Only rustic Mexican food and drink places. Only problem is the terrible 13km dirty road you have to take to get here from Hwy 200.  The access road is well signed about 1 km west of the airport entrance.  This is the best place to snorkel for sure.

451952407.name: Best of many great beaches
451952407.author: a TripAdvisor user
451952407.reviewBody: We were there on a quiet day.  The spot/restaurant we picked was about the middle of the bay though not more than 25 people were there all day.  Friendly people.  Great snorkeling off the beach. A tour boat arrived down the beach in the afternoon.  I am glad we instead hired the taxi to take us, and then come back at 5 to pick us up.

451939343.name: Perfect spot for a day trip
451939343.author: a TripAdvisor user
451939343.reviewBody: Its so difficult to pick one beach over another.  Just spend 1/2 -1 day at each.  San Augustin is a great big beach.  We arrived via boat from our hotel and just had a perfect day eating, drinking and resting.  Plenty of activities and snacks to buy.  Snorkeling is a must!

451711332.name: Beautiful place to spend a day swimming and snorkeling!
451711332.author: a TripAdvisor user
451711332.reviewBody: Crystal clear water and gentle waves make this beach one of the most beautiful and enjoyable in Huatulco,

450843963.name: Lunch and Snorkel
450843963.author: a TripAdvisor user
450843963.reviewBody: We enjoyed lunch on the beach with our toes in the sand and then a nice snorkel at this beach.  The water was clear and we saw some neat fish.

450515553.name: Beautiful Out Of The Way Beach
450515553.author: a TripAdvisor user
450515553.reviewBody: We went here and to Pochutla 21Nov16 in a cab. A very picturesque fishing village. My only caution is if you stop to eat or drink as we did, ask for a price list before you order, otherwise you may be in for an expensive surprise.

450080573.name: Great place to snorkel. Very popular Beach.
450080573.author: a TripAdvisor user
450080573.reviewBody: The road to the beach is mostly Dirt road. They are starting to cement the road. Buses go down this road. Lots of restaurants to choose from to sit drink, eat and get out of the sun. The water covers rock in a lot of areas here. Rock/coral is a couple feet under the surface. Best snorkeling is to the right were rock comes out of the water. Deep drop off about 20 to 30 feet. Here we saw a family of sting rays. Tons of fish and coral. I would recommend, especially for snorkeling.

449438156.name: Great day snorkeling
449438156.author: a TripAdvisor user
449438156.reviewBody: What a beach! It was so nice we went twice. The second time we went to Charly\'s which was great. He only takes cash, but we drank Corona\'s for about 25 pesos had lunch and rented snorkel gear for three all for about 1000 peso\'s. What\'s nice is we had a spot at Charly\'s for the day so we could be in and out of the sun as often as we wanted. Plus it was only about 25 steps to the water. Once you\'re in the water there are fish everywhere and within about 10 strokes you can be in some fairly deep water checking out all sorts of puffers and other fish. It was be far the cleanest water of the 5 beaches we checked out.

448702548.name: Beautiful beach, great people watching
448702548.author: a TripAdvisor user
448702548.reviewBody: The ocean has big, strong and beautiful waves. Stay at the edge, unless you are a very good swimmer.\nGreat spot for a nice cold drink while you are watching people walking on the beach, or dipping in the water.  There are hard working people trying to sell you some artifacts, but they are not pushy.\n

448398255.name: Favourite stop this trip!
448398255.author: a TripAdvisor user
448398255.reviewBody: We have visited twice and are considering a third. Our second visit we stayed for the day at Charlys Place. We had a table for the day and were able to do some amazing snorkeling just steps from or table at Charlys Place. Cab fare was $400 pesos each way and our cab driver came back at a pre-arranged time to pick us up. The drive consists of some highway driving and a 13km bumpy dusty dirt road - it is 100% worth it. Some places only accept pesos so bring cash. We felt completely safe leaving our valuables at our table at Charlys Place while we snorkeled as our waiter Jose promised to watch our belongings. This is a must do! :)

448129264.name: The BEST bay in Hautulco
448129264.author: a TripAdvisor user
448129264.reviewBody: We booked a full day fishing trip with Pilo Vasquez, and after catching a bunch of tuna, we stopped at this bay. He brought the fish up to a restaurant and they cooked it up for us. It was EXCELLENT! This is also the best bay for snorkeling. The water is warm and very clear. Lots of different fish and creatures to look at. Pilo went snorkeling with us and brought us a few puffer fish to touch. If I could live at this bay, I would.

447212421.name: Snorkel and Beach Loafing
447212421.author: a TripAdvisor user
447212421.reviewBody: San Augustin beach....wow. 700 pesos return from Playa Chahue (add tip) and worth every single peso. the ride to the San Augustin via taxi is about forty minutes, twenty on the airport highway, twenty down the winding beach road that includes a couple of small farming villages and a market of local goods...oh, and a penned "ostericchhee" (unless the giant bird was earmarked for xmas dinner)...great beach...many of same beach restos as maguey and santa cruz though a bit cheaper...food was great, and great snorkeling off the beach, can rent snorkel gear from number of vendors, walk out and enjoy in the clear water. No boat required (although we also went to San Augustin as part of a private boat charter out of Santa cruz marina and highly recommend)..don\'t let the taxi ride dampen your enthusiasm, step up, make sure your cab has great Mexican music, pack some cold drinks and enjoy a full day at san Augustin!

445991627.name: Amazing beach
445991627.author: a TripAdvisor user
445991627.reviewBody: Beautiful beach, probably the best I have ever seen on the Pacific, crystal clear water, perfect for snorkeling and swimming

445886052.name: Wild and Eciting beach
445886052.author: a TripAdvisor user
445886052.reviewBody: Huatulco has a lot of diferent beaches with clear and clean water. The beach i prefer is Sant Agustin at 40min from Huatulco because of the road you need your own car or with a taxi. This beach havs two diferent face, one with resaturant and calm waters and the one I like wild and strong water, lonly beach with wanderfull energy.

445021409.name: Really chill.
445021409.author: a TripAdvisor user
445021409.reviewBody: Amazing views and crystalclear waters for snorkeling. Many restaurants with sea food and other items.\n

444481825.name: Beautiful hidden gem of a beach!
444481825.author: a TripAdvisor user
444481825.reviewBody:
Fantastic location, a bit out of the way but worth the travel. We took the city bus from La Crucecita then got off where all the taxis wait, took a taxi on quite possibly the dustiest, bumpiest road ever and then paradise. 

The beach is very quiet, lots of little restaurants to park yourself at for the day. Bring little treats (ie dollar store toys) for the little kids.

The beach is very nice, water is calm because its in a bay, and it is worth the walk upto the church. The walk down the beach is hard on the legs because of the sand  - you really sink into it. 

A fantastic location, worth it!

442726247.name: Playa Augustine
442726247.author: a TripAdvisor user
442726247.reviewBody:
Your time here will become one of your memories of Huatulco.  The waters are sparkling and inviting to play, float and snorkel in.
This area becomes ""populated " in the afternoons and during "holidays" with tourists.
The prices in the restaurants is what I would say " stupid prices " and a real shame, because the only shade is in the restaurants.  They want 50 pesos for bottle water and it goes on from there.
The drive there is engaging and you get to see the country side.

442449951.name: Fantastic snorkelling close to shore
442449951.author: a TripAdvisor user
442449951.reviewBody: Good snorkelling and great food on the beach. Return Taxi from Secrets would cost $100.00 US dollars. Well worth it\n

441442440.name: Boat ride to natural aquarium
441442440.author: a TripAdvisor user
441442440.reviewBody: We returned to San Augustine again after  2 years. It had not changed and the snorkelling was as good as the South Pacific. It was like swimming in an aquarium with all the beautiful fish. We had lunch at one of the palapas and were well taken care of by the English speaking staff there and dined on pineapple filled with fish and shrimp. There were only a few vendors selling necklaces but they were not bothersome. The boat trip took us past numerous bays in the national park and it was a day thoroughly enjoyed by all.

441151221.name: Go for the beach & snorkeling, but STAY for the SUNSET
441151221.author: a TripAdvisor user
441151221.reviewBody:
We drove our small rented car out here. The SA road is at km # 236, about 3 minutes north of the airport road. It took us about 40 minutes to drive from Santa Cruz to the beach. The packed dirt road leading west from the highwsy is a little rough with a few large potholes and many topas which required navigation in first gear. There are 2 or 3 small communities along the way which manage traffic speed by curves and topas, and in which pedestrians are mindful of the vehicles passing by. There are lots of kids, particularly in the evenings and on weekends, so it is probably a good idea to keep it slow through these places.  We didn't see any loose  livestock, so it is not likely an issue. Once out at the beach we saw that everything from small buses and medium sized trucks to motorcycles and micro-cars appear to make the trip without issue. We averaged around 30 kph....locals and taxis seem to go about half that speed, perhaps because they own their rides.

The beaches at this location are clean and free of the flotsam and algae/weed issues seen in many other tourist locations. In the bay area and outside of the park, it is crowded with about 40 eateries, all basically constructed, some two stories high. The access ways behind them are crowded with parking and a row or two of accommodations for "locals". There are also basic tourist rental cabinas and rooms here, some with a view. The beach to the west of the point which protects the bay is largely without development as it is too shelved for safe swimming or snorkeling from shore. It is easily accessed by walking a few feet from the main road to SA and affords an excellent view of a classic tropical Pacific sunset.

The bay water was cool to warm and clear and calm. It was easy to get into the water because of the gentle shelf and small waves. The coral was OK and the marine life moderate, though somewhat sparse for a live reef.  When we were there in mid-week, there were less than ten people in the water, so it was uncrowded. Given that there wete about the same amount of people in the 40 restaurants, and that at some point they have to be filled to stay in business, we probably chose the right time of day/week/season to visit SA. I think if this place gets crowded, it is probably a zoo. While this might be annoying for some of us, i expect it is downright destructive for the reefs coral flora and fauna. There are no signs or personnel on the beach to instruct the uninformed not to touch the coral. The result is obvious once one submerges.

So....the hidden gem aspect of San Agustin Bay is not the bay, rather it is the sunset across the headland from the bay. It can be observed over rocky outcrops or from a long, open and undeveloped beach. It was well worth the drive and is something you do not have the opportunity to do on a boat tour. The dusk drive back to the Huatulco tourist zone was,  in my opinion safe if done cautiously.

438555782.name: Amazing beach
438555782.author: a TripAdvisor user
438555782.reviewBody: Great place to visit with local hut beach restaurants, very clean, not a lot of people known about this place! Totally worth it!! Go by boat!

437241779.name: Neat Beach to Check Out
437241779.author: a TripAdvisor user
437241779.reviewBody: We drove to Bahia San Agustin from La Crucecita for a day trip. As soon as we drove up, vendors started trying to pull you into their parking spots to have you eat at their restuarant. We just kept driving to the very end of the beach (turned left once you entered onto the "main" street along the beach), and parked there. I really loved that far end of the beach because there was no one around there. \nWe walked over to the central part of the beach which has all of the restaurants and boats. That area is overrated because again, it\'s all just pushy restaurant owners trying to drag you into their restaurant, or throw you on their boat. However, I will say that the snorkelling is quite fantastic as there is a very large reef just offshore.\nI had read about taking a boat to Playa La India (a boat access only beach nearby), so we got a guy on the beach in San Agustin to take us. We did not know how far away Playa La India was, or how much we should be paying, but we wound up paying $800 pesos for two of us. The beach was very close, and had decent snorkelling. It was a pretty beach, and we stayed for probably an hour or so. But in the end, definitely not worth $800 pesos. I\'d be good with paying half that to get to Playa La India. Otherwise, I would suggest just staying at Bahia San Agustin.

432516403.name: Beautiful Beach
432516403.author: a TripAdvisor user
432516403.reviewBody: The best & biggest bay in Huatulco, huge coral reef great for snorkel, lots of beach palapa  restaurants, great for a day trip since it\'s 1 hr away, local transportation, also good for camping trip

419248571.name: Lunch & Snorkeling Stopover with Pilo
419248571.author: a TripAdvisor user
419248571.reviewBody:
We came to Playa San Augustin while we were on an excursion with Pilo.  We stopped here for snorkeling and for lunch at LaLa Restaurant & Bar.  The snorkeling was not the best I have done in Mexico (I preferred the Caribbean side near Tulum and Xpu Ha much better) but we did get to see some cool things...puffer fish, a giant school of yellow tailed surgeon fish, and a really pretty spotted eagle ray to name a few... so it was a nice snorkel opportunity.  The water was calm and clear. Unfortunately some of the coral has not been very well respected though.  It is apparently one of the best spots to snorkel in the Huatulco area.  While we were there a sailfish fishing competition was taking place so there was lots of activity on the beach.  It seemed like a great family place for the locals to come to.  The sand was coarse with lots of coral and shells.  Very pretty area.  I would definitely go back the next time we are in the area and spend a little more time at this lovely beach.  

Since LaLa Restaurant and Bar doesn't have itself on the Trip Advisor map yet I will say a few things about it here:
Both tour operators that we used while in Huatulco recommended it (Pilo and Huatulco Tours Enrique) We were greeted at the boat and escorted over to the restaurant and seated right on the beach.  We were brought fresh tostadas and salsa and we ordered a Corona and a Pina Colada right away.  Both of us ordered the stuffed pineapple.  It was a creamy, cheesy, shrimp stuffed half of a broiled pineapple and it was AMAZING!!!!  The service was really good and after our meal we were offered a shot of tequila on the house.  After we finished our meal we were escorted back to the boat.  It was a great place to stop for lunch and we would definitely eat there again when we go back.

417481206.name: Beautiful beach and excellent sea food
417481206.author: a TripAdvisor user
417481206.reviewBody: We visited this beach in a ATV tour. The tour is about 4 hours and driving thru small communities, with views such as pineapple and papaya and banana plantations. Once in  the beach, we jumped into the water and snorkel around the coral and its beautiful school of fishes.

416192824.name: Amazing snorkelling
416192824.author: a TripAdvisor user
416192824.reviewBody: The snorkelling here is incredible. Its a good bay for even weak swimmers to snorkel. Clear beautiful water. Plentiful fish. \nWe have been to Huatulco many times and this was our first visit to San Augustin Bay. I cant wait to go back and spend more time! Not to be missed!

390861179.name: Excellent water
390861179.author: a TripAdvisor user
390861179.reviewBody: This is one of the best beys, the water is clear to the point that you can see your legs and fish with out the need of snorkel. Good for kids since the pasific is too dangerous in this area you can be safe.

389242840.name: Our favourite of Huatulco
389242840.author: a TripAdvisor user
389242840.reviewBody: We simply camped a couple of nights there. The owner of the restaurant LALA lent us his tent. The locals here are not pushy, very friendly and easy-going. The beach is stunning, same as the snorkel is. Having spent 1 month in Hautulco, San Augustin is our favorite among all its beaches

384269148.name: Beautiful Clear Beach!
384269148.author: a TripAdvisor user
384269148.reviewBody:
We met Miguel with a boat named Miranda at Playa Arrocito. My wife approached him to ask about going to Playa San Augustin.

Well, Miguel gave us a great offer! He picked the five of us up the next day at Playa Arrocito at 7am, proceeded straight out to sea for 45 minutes for some fishing. After I spent 30 minutes reeling in a 60lb sailfish we then headed back to towards 7 of the bays starting with Playa San Augustin. On the way we saw many sea turtles, even a mating pair. The favorite part for the whole family was spending 20 minutes boating around a Super Pod of dolphins! We stayed at Playa San Augustin for a couple of hours, hanging out at LaLa 's restaurant watching some local kids surf and swimming. Food was good but we thought a bit overpriced for the region. Saw six more bays and the blow hole on the way back to Santa Cruz where he dropped us off at 3pm. Whole trip cost was a fantastic 3000pesos plus tip.
You can reach Juan Miguel at 0449581306541. We texted him through WhatsApp.

381082305.name: Paradise
381082305.author: a TripAdvisor user
381082305.reviewBody: Yes there people wanting to sell their products  but that dies down after 15 mins then just enjoy the food and incredible views ,swimming and snorkeling

376292564.name: Loved it here!
376292564.author: a TripAdvisor user
376292564.reviewBody: We visited San Augustin as part of our private snorkelling tour. Love it!  Fantastic snorkelling with large reef. Quiet here as it is not easily accessible but we\'ll worth the trip.

368757636.name: Amazing Beach
368757636.author: a TripAdvisor user
368757636.reviewBody: This is a must. A nice drive about 45 minutes from Santa Cruz. Great swimming and snorklin.My Wife and I got to know an excellent cab driver that drove and guided us to several places. Playa San Augustine was one of them. We recommended Edgar Escobar, our driver and guide, to other people we met in the Huatulco area. They could not believe the great service he gave. Edgar speaks perfect English and Spanish which comes in handy when you need a translator. He also stayed with us the day and watched our stuff while we hung out on the beach and snorkeled. He\'s really kind of like a Guide but a lot cheaper. I would highly recommend Edgar Escobar for all you taxi, tours and any help you need in the Huatulco area. Edgar can be contacted at 1-958-589-2052. Call him in the daytime as he does not get cellular service at his home in the evening. We would just get our hotel front desk to call him.

367275365.name: Fantastic Beach, with great snorkeling
367275365.author: a TripAdvisor user
367275365.reviewBody: Although its a little out of the way to get there, it is worth the drive.  The beach is amazing and the snorkeling  is fantastic,   the little restaurants will actually park your car under a roof if you stay and eat at their restaurant, lots of hammocks to lay in, its a great way to spend an afternoon.  Be sure to stop at some of the vendors for fresh fruit on the drive in.

365848381.name: San Augustin
365848381.author: a TripAdvisor user
365848381.reviewBody: We loved San Augustin. We paid $80 US which got us a pick up from our resort, then drove us to the atvs. The instructions was very kind and patient. It was a nice ride through the country side. We did stop at a small village where the people were so kind. We then continued our journey to the bay  it was spectacular. Loved.. loved...we ordered food which was so tasty.  Afterwards we then swam and snorkeled. The scenery was spectacular.. what a day..

365263202.name: Average and ok
365263202.author: a TripAdvisor user
365263202.reviewBody: This bay has lots of restaurants,   which I find always a good thing to have around. Good environment, good food, parking available. All ok.

363762007.name: Great place to snorkel
363762007.author: a TripAdvisor user
363762007.reviewBody: Nice calm clear water with an abundance of life. Great place to snorkel. Lota of locals and tourists \n alike.

363209558.name: Beautiful.
363209558.author: a TripAdvisor user
363209558.reviewBody: One of the best beaches I have seen in Mexico. The snorkeling was amazing. We stayed all day at a restaurant called La Casa de los Abuelos, and were very well taken care of. The food was great, and they rented us snorkeling equipment.

358754908.name: Spring break snorkeling stop playing
358754908.author: a TripAdvisor user
358754908.reviewBody: Crowded and dangerous to swimmers but pretty with great reef with many fish.  Shoreline was crowded.  Too hectic to relax.  \n

357681667.name: Quaint beach
357681667.author: a TripAdvisor user
357681667.reviewBody: We travelled by ATV had lunch under the canopy tent restaurants by the beach, the guacamole was the best, beers were cold, beach was great, coral reef was cool

356154737.name: Fantastic beach and restaurant
356154737.author: a TripAdvisor user
356154737.reviewBody: We spent 1/2 day snorkeling and swimming at Playa San Augustin with Huatulco Tours Enrique. Our guide recommended this beautiful beach for snorkeling. It was perfect. Not too rough and very very clear water. Our guide knows the owners of LALA Restaurant and we just parked all of our stuff at one of their beach tables and swam right in front of the restaurant. For lunch the owner brought out a platter of fresh caught sierra fish. We picked a smaller one and they grilled it for us. Whatever sauce they used on the fish, it was delicious. This was really a very relaxing and most enjoyable trip to the best beach in Huatulco.

355168751.name: Such culture
355168751.author: a TripAdvisor user
355168751.reviewBody: Wonderful place to spend the day. Lots of activity and a great way to experience the culture in a beautiful setting.

354691869.name: Great beach to spend the day
354691869.author: a TripAdvisor user
354691869.reviewBody: The beach is fantastic -- warm water, soft sand, and great snorkelling. Restaurants and vendors line the beach and there\'s plenty of boats hanging around, too.

354136248.name: Best of all
354136248.author: a TripAdvisor user
354136248.reviewBody: This is one of the best beaches at huatulco, also you can eat a very good meal there. also you can rent a boat to take you to the most beautifull beaches of huatulco. don\'t forget to visit maguey

353909920.name: Beautiful Beach
353909920.author: a TripAdvisor user
353909920.reviewBody: This was one of the most beautiful beaches I\'ve ever seen.  We book an ATV tour and they brought us to this area, definitely a must see.  Great snorkeling right off the shore and the beach is surrounded by these cute colorful huts full of bars and restaurants.

353137873.name: Authentic Mexican Town
353137873.author: a TripAdvisor user
353137873.reviewBody: Getting dropped of at the town square gives you 4 different directions to go for shopping which is only a 10 minute cab ride from the Tangolunda bay hotels at a cost of 39 pesos or $4.00 USD. Stop in at the OXXO store for a cold drink and snacks to take along with you while shopping throughout the many stores.  Be sure to check out the famous Church with the amazing ceiling painting as well as the indoor shopping market. You are surely to find what you are looking for in there but don\'t be hasty....some give you good deals while others will take advantage of you.

352977563.name: Beautiful!
352977563.author: a TripAdvisor user
352977563.reviewBody: The beach is incredible, beautiful and great for snorkeling because there are coral reefs near by, but the food in the restaurants is overpriced, so be prepared to pay $80 pesos for a guacamole.

352601229.name: Playa San Agustin snorkeling and restaurants
352601229.author: a TripAdvisor user
352601229.reviewBody: Took a taxi  to this Beach from Santa Cruz. Well worth the trip. The snorkelling is absolutley amazing.  Charlie\'s place is where we hung out for the day.  Jose was very attentive and the food was amazing.  Jose spoke excellent English and even helped us secure our taxi ride back at the end of our day.

352192172.name: Prettiest beach in the area....
352192172.author: a TripAdvisor user
352192172.reviewBody: ....wide open and due to the seriously bumpy 13 km one way drive down a dirt road to the beach not much in the way of tourists. Locals charge you to park which is a bit cheesy, but the beach makes it worth it.

351539534.name: Nice Beach
351539534.author: a TripAdvisor user
351539534.reviewBody: I did not find this place that exciting. Actually the beach where there is no restaurants is more beautiful. No one goes there but it is breathtaking. If you go there check it out. It comes up just before you pull into San Augustin. If you go make sure your taxi is air conditioned because the road is long and just sandy.

351277543.name: Our favourite of the bays and beaches!
351277543.author: a TripAdvisor user
351277543.reviewBody: Playa San Augustin is worth the time spent getting out to the furthest of the Huatulco bays. The beach is one of the largest and the snorkelling is the best but it still feels quaint and quiet. I recommend La Lala Restaurant!

350116215.name: Beautiful Beach from the Water
350116215.author: a TripAdvisor user
350116215.reviewBody: We stopped off at Playa San Augustin as the final beach stop of a boat tour to snorkel in the calmer waters, before heading further out to sea.  The beach looked lovely and clean and the beach buildings were interestingly being thatched with palms. The snorkeling was lovely especially for me, as it was my first time and there were lots of different types of fish and corals to see. It was a lovely experience and I will always treasure the hour or so that we spent snorkeling here.

349019229.name: Beautiful!
349019229.author: a TripAdvisor user
349019229.reviewBody:
This was our second time being at San Agustin. 
The road hasn't improved ; however for me it isn't a big deal for the beach is well worth it. 
45 minute drive from Santa Cruz to Agustin 
Cost us 700 pesos

This time we asked to be dropped off close to the tree trunk.

Ate at La Casa del Abuelo where we had lightly bread shrimp. 

Enjoyed a fantastic day on a fantastic beach :)

348961740.name: Nice beach, cold beer.
348961740.author: a TripAdvisor user
348961740.reviewBody: Beautiful beach and ocean, good for a swim. Don\'t remember where we ate at the beach but was very over priced an was simply put awful. Any the beer was cold.

348712069.name: peaceful
348712069.author: a TripAdvisor user
348712069.reviewBody: this is the most peaceful beach near by mazunte. from there it a 15-20 minutes by walking. i recommend it mostly for those who doesn\u00b4t want to feel and play with the waves, it\u00b4s basically a tiny beach behind the rocks that made it feels like a pool

348599049.name: Amazing Water Clarity
348599049.author: a TripAdvisor user
348599049.reviewBody: Came by boat, it was really excellent. Stayed with one of the beach vendors for a few hours. They watched our stuff, we drank and ate there. Very good

347626990.name: Fabulous Beach
347626990.author: a TripAdvisor user
347626990.reviewBody: This is a beautiful beach with lots of food choices.  Go to the restaurant with the Mexican flags and get the grilled pineapple stuffed with seafood.  Wonderful flavor and no tummy issues.

347451289.name: Excellent snorkelling
347451289.author: a TripAdvisor user
347451289.reviewBody: This takes a bit of travelling on 13 km of dirt road from Hwy 200, and there is little accommodation there, but many small restaurants line the beach and the coral  begins right offshore.

347394899.name: Worth the trip...
347394899.author: a TripAdvisor user
347394899.reviewBody: Takes a bit of effort to come here, whether by boat or car, but well worth seeing this wonderful beach. We snorkeled a bit- good for less experienced  folks like me... I am an airman, Not a seaman, so  calm bay was welcome.  The boat ride here was adventurous for me but in the capable hands of "La Chiquita", our boatman, we had a nice trip from Santa Cruz, seeing many sights along the way...a bit over $100 US at this writing.  We enjoyed a good meal at El Casa De mi Abuelo, and spent several hours ag the beach before returning to Santa Cruz. Be advised the boats do not run every say, as the sea conditions and wind dictate whether the harbor is abierto or cerrado. (Open or closed)... so you may wish to book a trip early in your stay and wait for a call from your guide. ENJOY!!

346936196.name: Great beach!
346936196.author: a TripAdvisor user
346936196.reviewBody: A great beach, long stretch of very fine sand.  We arrived by taxi from La Crucecita, yes it is a pretty rough road when you turn off the highway but once on the beach you forget all your cares. We brought our own snorkel gear and when the tide came up we were able to enter the water right in front of the little restaurant we settled at. Beautiful fish swimming amongst the coral. The water was clear and very blue. Later in the day the wind came up and it was great fun watching the waves crash onto the beach. We had a grand time.

345637297.name: Best beach in Huatulco
345637297.author: a TripAdvisor user
345637297.reviewBody:
If you are comming to huatulco PLEASE DONT MISS THIS.
I recommend to get a cab here, notice there is a 40min dirty road.
U will never regret this.
Try this cab driver named Pedro: 971 1501456. He is the best tour guide and very trustfull.
Dont me picky on reataurants here, they are more expensive than the ones in la crucecita. Fried fish is delicious.

345085974.name: Casa Abuelo is THE best!!
345085974.author: a TripAdvisor user
345085974.reviewBody: Lovely beach.. Snorkeling is underwhelming if you are a seasoned snorkeler but very easy to access. We LOVED Casa Abuelo (Grandpa\'s House) where we met Miguel. He\'s awesome. Speaks great English if you are total gringos like us ;)   Lovely roof top patio to eat or plenty of tables, beach chairs and hammocks on the beach. Stay all the way left to get to the place. They r at the end. Beer is cold! Shrimp are hot! Can\'t be beat.

344330705.name: Nice
344330705.author: a TripAdvisor user
344330705.reviewBody: This was by far the nicest beach in Huatulco, Very clean and not a lot of people. The waves were not to rough to swim like some of the beaches. you could take kids here.

343677293.name: Favorite beach
343677293.author: a TripAdvisor user
343677293.reviewBody: Definitely worth the trip to get here. It\'s huge, pristine, clear water, and great snorkeling. Very quiet beach. Also great local seafood available here. Loved visiting here.

343665122.name: Peace & Quiet
343665122.author: a TripAdvisor user
343665122.reviewBody: Visiited San Augustin while vacationing in Huatulco.   Great Snorkeling, Very out of the way so perfect place for R&R

343375234.name: Best snorkelling ever!
343375234.author: a TripAdvisor user
343375234.reviewBody: What a great place to snorkel! We\'ve been at different beaches to snorkel but this was one is for sure at the top of the list. It\'s a bit of a drive from huatulco, but even the drive here is an experience in it self. From the highway #200 it\'s about 35 minutes on dirt road. Taxis will pass you....they are more accustomed to driving it I guess. Some people will take the local buss till the turn off at the highway and the take a taxi to the beach. And again they have amazing food at these little beach restaurants! Fresh fish, red snapper or mahi mahi...\nDare to try Mexican!

342426441.name: Lovely long beach, great for a lunch stop
342426441.author: a TripAdvisor user
342426441.reviewBody: We visited Playa San Augustin for snorkeling and lunch on a day long boat trip from Santa Cruz. Lovely rustic setting in one of the larger beaches in the Huatulco area. Quaint little beach side sea food restaurants, a little pricey when compared to Crucecita. A lovely one day excursion in the area

342351588.name: Great Snorkeling
342351588.author: a TripAdvisor user
342351588.reviewBody: We got here by boat as we heard the road in is long and bumpy.  The snorkeling is fantastic and right off the beach so if you get here you can get out and see things easily.  There are a bunch of little restaurants and a few things to buy but really not much else here.  Lots of local families enjoying the beauty of this beach

341942318.name: Great beach
341942318.author: a TripAdvisor user
341942318.reviewBody: This is a must see place if you are in the Hualtulco area. We came by boat, on a tour of the bays with Tomas. I recommend taking a trip with him, as it was the highlight of our trip. \nThe snorkeling here is great right off the beach. The reef is teeming with fish. I enjoyed puffin\' up the  Puffer fish, and many wonderful colors. The water is very warm so it is easy to lose track of time cruising the coral in the calm waters of this bay. There are lots of places here to sit for a drink and meal, but left all my money out in the boat. There were lots of gringos enjoying the shade and cool drinks and I was told the food was good! It was not busy at all while we were there as it was a week day, so a good time to go.

341543597.name: Great Snorkeling
341543597.author: a TripAdvisor user
341543597.reviewBody: Beautiful beach and great Snorkeling spot.  Clear water.  Lots of restaurants along most of the beach.  Nice sand.  Recommend a cab to this site.  Great spot to swim and have fun along the shore as water increases in depth gradually.  Equipment available on site if you do not have your own.

341042080.name: Long drive, but stunning beach!
341042080.author: a TripAdvisor user
341042080.reviewBody:
It takes about 1h from Huatulco with car, where the last 13km takes about 40min. The roads are really bad.

There are several places to park and sit along the beach. All restaurants are on the east part of the beach, where you can park (at peoples homes) and sit near the beach. Unfortunately there are no place on the sand to lay down since the restaurants end at the water front.
We choose the east part of the beach, where we were alone. Good snorkeling and swimming. Highly recommended!

340509394.name: Seriously overrated
340509394.author: a TripAdvisor user
340509394.reviewBody: I am dumbfounded that this place rates so highly on tripadvisor. I can only attribute that to the low standards of other reviewers. Sorry if I sound like a snob; I\'m really not. My wife and I and our son spend a decent afternoon at one of the many, many, many beachfront restaurants right by the coral reef. I love freediving, and so was happy to get into the water and see what there was. Unfortunately the reef has been so overrun that there are only a few species of fish left (tangs, puffers, damselfish) which is very disappointing. If you want to see MUCH better snorkelling, take one of the smaller boats from Crucecita or Santa Cruz, as we had previously, making this reef a huge disappointment by comparison. PM me, and I\'ll give you some direction.\nThat notwithstanding, the food at the restaurants is generally excellent.

340508768.name: Such A Shame
340508768.author: a TripAdvisor user
340508768.reviewBody: We kept hearing about this great beach with excellent snorkelling. We chose to drive the long distance from Santa Cruz to check it out. There is coral literally from the shore and it\'s all fenced to keep boats out. That\'s a good thing. The bad thing is that this is such entry level snorkelling, it\'s sad. I witnessed people standing in the coral, clearly not knowing to keep off. The fish life is seriously basic compared to so many of the other beaches. Yes, there\'s coral here and yes, there\'s fish. That doesn\'t make it a good beach. In fact, ecologically it\'s an absolute dud. With coral right at the beachline there should be signs posting NOT to stand on the cora and not to touch it. It won\'t be long before this place is an eco disaster.

338184291.name: Great snorkeling from the beach
338184291.author: a TripAdvisor user
338184291.reviewBody: We were staying at the Barcel\u00f3 and for 500 pesos had a taxi take us to San Augustin, wait for us while we snorkeled and had lunch and then returned us to the hotel. You can also arrange for a boat trip there but the drive can be quite interesting particularly the iguana sanctuary. Can be quite busy especially  weekends and Mexican public holidays. For snorkeling the reef starts in spots where the water is little more than waist deep.

336975487.name: Great Public Beach
336975487.author: a TripAdvisor user
336975487.reviewBody: Bring your sandals as the sand can get so hot you can not walk on it. Great snorkeling and equipment is available on the beach for a fee. First place I ever used a flutter board with a clear plastic screen in it, this allowed me to use my glasses to see the fish and coral which there is lots of! As this is a "locals" beach it can get crowded in the afternoon. Great place to eat fresh caught oysters right on the beach. Bring your hand sanitizer, wet ones and some tissues as the bathrooms can be a little undesirable. Enjoy!!

336808342.name: Basic info - wish I\'d have known!
336808342.author: a TripAdvisor user
336808342.reviewBody:
Beach: beautiful! Thin with moderate waves and grainy sand, but definitely less crowded. The water was warm and the snorkeling good.

Road: the road from the highway to the beach is a dirt/gravel road. If you're expecting a smooth paved road you will be disappointed and/or annoyed. During and right after rainy season I expect this road is rutted and miserable. However, they grate and level it so it's a pretty typical dirt road otherwise. 13km from the highway to the beach.

Food: ate at "el playon" and wasn't impressed. Service was very slow and we watched them move people's things off tables in order to seat others at the front even though there were other tables available. My husband's shrimp cocktail was delicious, my chicken plate was fish.

336298485.name: Many restaurants- lots of locals - great food !
336298485.author: a TripAdvisor user
336298485.reviewBody: We drove to the beach and we were a little overwhelmed by the workers wanting us to park and eat at their restaurants, but it was not a problem. I remembered reading a restaurant name on here with "playon" in it so we parked and ate here. The menu was completely in spanish and they were very helpful to us and we had a wonderful meal,

334505972.name: Great for Snorkeling and Relaxing, OK Food, Less than Good Services
334505972.author: a TripAdvisor user
334505972.reviewBody: This playa (beach) has a great coral section for Snorkeling and it is probably the best in Huatulco.  The beach is nice and has some undeveloped parts so you feel like you can get some privacy.  The services on the beach are very, very basic.  No cell, data or wifi.  The restaurants are OK, some better than others and some hit-n-miss flavor and quality of the seafood.  They are primitive and not for the faint of heart.  The bathrooms are even below the restaurants. There are a handful that have built some better bathroom facilities, but don\'t expect much!  Bring toilet paper and you may/may not find a toilet seat.  It is a great place to go for the day if you like to hang out and snorkel.  They have some great prices on catamaran boat trips from Santa Cruz.  Taxis are available, but the ride is rough as it is about 20 mins on a dirt road.  Take a taxi with a/c so you don\'t have to have the window down and eat dust.  I know this review might turn some people off, but seriously you need to visit this beach at least once to snorkel over the coral at least.  You can rough it for a day, and the fish are amazing!

333027295.name: Finally found a good Restaurant on this beach...
333027295.author: a TripAdvisor user
333027295.reviewBody: For many years I have been trying out various restaurants on this beautiful beach with mixed results, finally this year I found "El Play\u00f3n". Located towards the end of restaurant row, it is very relaxed but with friendly and prompt service and the food is great!\nI enjoyed cocktail de camar\u00f3n, ceviche de pescado and a wonderful Huachinango a las brasas (natural and a la talla) all very good and fresh! \nFrom me the best spot on the beach!

331687145.name: An enjoyable day at the beach
331687145.author: a TripAdvisor user
331687145.reviewBody: You may have to travel 30 to 45 minutes to get to this beach, but the trip is worthwhile. Nice sandy beach, lots of space, can swim in the ocean (small breakers only), lots of little restaurants that offer shaded sitting facilities and good seafood.  But cash only, no internet available to operate credit cards. We recommend: Grandpa\'s restaurant (casa del abuelo) at the end of the restaurant line-up.

318960211.name: Wonderful yacht travels to see 7 of the 9  Bays
318960211.author: a TripAdvisor user
318960211.reviewBody: Sailing, Snorklin, swimming, sight seeing was our tour of the San Augustin Bay. The water was soo cooling and refreshing for the hot temp

314451607.name: great day trip
314451607.author: a TripAdvisor user
314451607.reviewBody: beautiful beach with outstanding snorkeling.The day we were there it was very clear and there was a huge school of fish swimming on the reef .The restaurants were very good but the bathroom facilities were a little limited.

308602430.name: Great beach, good snorkeling, plenty of restaurants
308602430.author: a TripAdvisor user
308602430.reviewBody: The beach has plenty of restaurants, so be prepared to be pressured by the owners until you pick one and sit down. Every restaurant serves the same fare, so don\'t be picky. The beach was great fun, and plentiful and many varieties fish to see if you go snorkeling.

308504516.name: Excellent spot to snorkel ... a little more off the beaten path than the other Bays in Huatulco!
308504516.author: a TripAdvisor user
308504516.reviewBody:
Excellent spot to snorkel ... really well preserved tourist destination and a little more off the beaten path than the other bays in Huatulco (down a 13km dirt road)! 

The snorkeling is excellent with large reefs and as long as the weather is OK it is a really nice place to visit ... easy access on cheap flights on Interjet twice daily from Mexico City make very accessible!!!

We went to one of the small palapa restaurants, Elia Carmelita Restaurante, where they allowed us to park our car in under an overhang, gave us great seafood, snorkel equipment for 70 pesos a day and friendly service.

REALLY GOOD OPTION TO GET AWAY FROM THE TOURIST CROWDS.

306089138.name: Fantastic Playa San Augustin
306089138.author: a TripAdvisor user
306089138.reviewBody: We took a taxi with another couple of friends to this beautiful beach. Well worth the travel time and much better than the bus.

299377451.name: A must
299377451.author: a TripAdvisor user
299377451.reviewBody: We spent a whole day at San Agustin beach and it was one of our favorites in Huatulco. You can get here by car. Just turn a couple of miles after the airport and drive for about 20 minutes to the beach. We stayed at La Casa del Abuelo restaurant. They give you comfortable beach chairs, palapas and they offer great service. The beach itself is very nice with great views of the bay. \n

293171167.name: Playa San Augustin
293171167.author: a TripAdvisor user
293171167.reviewBody: This is a beautiful beach with a great area to snorkel.  A "must do". There is a bit of a surf but it wasn\'t bad and it was a good area to swim as well as snorkel. The restaurants are not fancy but the seafood is very good.

278593836.name: Worth the drive
278593836.author: a TripAdvisor user
278593836.reviewBody: It is a beautiful beach.  Our taxi driver takes his family there.  He directed us to El Dorado for the day.  A newer palapa, good food and drink. $500 pesos round trip for the taxi.

273484297.name: Beautiful beach, almost inaccessible
273484297.author: a TripAdvisor user
273484297.reviewBody: Playa San Agustin is located in a beautiful bay about 40 minutes south of Huatulco airport. The 30 minute dirt road is worthwhile. A taxi will take you for about $200 pesos but be careful as what seems to be the norm is drivers will take you to a beach side eatery that will give them a commission. Some of these makeshift eating places are quaint with hammocks but some are quite appalling with no basic standard toilets with running water. And they all seem to have the same prices for food and drinks! Don\'t feel you need to stay where your cab driver took you. Feel free to walk along the beach until you find a place you feel comfortable in. If you\'re into scuba diving there are boat rides to some nearby coral reefs.

272728306.name: Best Beach in the Area
272728306.author: a TripAdvisor user
272728306.reviewBody: This is a large beach with pristine sands and beautiful warm water. There is a bit of a surf but not as rough as other areas and swimming is safe. Out by small islands you can boogey board surf and the snorkeling is pretty good. There are plenty of beachside restaurants that serve fresh seafood. We found everyone in the village to be friendly and couteous. This is, without a doubt, my favourite beach in Mexico.

267793874.name: The place to snorkel.
267793874.author: a TripAdvisor user
267793874.reviewBody: This beach is a few miles off the main road after a bus ride from the greater Huatulco. It is less developed and less crowded, It is one of the best snorkel areas. The restaurants are basis but nice. One way to visit is to take one of the day boat tours which will wind up at San Augustin where you will have the opportunity for lunch.

267574294.name: The most amazing snorkeling beach....great food...& so relaxing!
267574294.author: a TripAdvisor user
267574294.reviewBody: WOW...is all I can say! My husband & I loved this beach so much while we were in Huatulco that we went here twice during our 1 week stay. We traveled via a Panga boat & captain Jorge...I caught a Bonita fish both times as we traveled from Santa Cruz Harbor to Playa San Augustin. Once we arrived via boat our Captain took us to the food hut with all the flags flying. They cleaned & cooked my Bonita for us & all I can say is WOW....this was the best fish I have ever had! The fish was served with rice & veg & tortilla chips & we made fish tacos out of our food. There was so much food that there was enough for our Captain...waiter & some kids that were hanging around the hut. After lunch we snorkeled....& snorkeled & snorkeled again !. The water was so clear...lots of fish & tons of coral. Such a wonderful time the two times that we visited this beautiful beach....already miss the days we had there !

262783307.name: Went snorkeling
262783307.author: a TripAdvisor user
262783307.reviewBody: We arrived by boat with Hurricane Divers and only saw the area from the water.  Would love to visit sometime by land.  Snorkeling was great!

262366205.name: good seafood
262366205.author: a TripAdvisor user
262366205.reviewBody: great shrimp.  they cooked up some tuna we caught. yum awesome coral reef to snorkel - very beautiful\n\n

262005259.name: Fantastic beach and fishing Village.
262005259.author: a TripAdvisor user
262005259.reviewBody: We went here by boat with Tino of Tino\'s Sport Fishing in Santa Cruz and were so impressed had Tino arrange for us to go by vehicle the following day.  We spent the entire day there after an hour car ride from the Dreams resort.  The first portion were on very good paved roads and then a half hour on dirt roads going through fields of pineapples, papaya and a couple of small villages before arriving at the fishing village at San Augustin.  The beach in this beautiful bay is lined with restaurants and the snorkelling over coral right from the beach is good.  The prettiest beach i have seen in the three different parts of Mexico I have been too.

260768766.name: Great snorkelling
260768766.author: a TripAdvisor user
260768766.reviewBody: This is a beautiful beach with great snorkelling (best I\'ve done on the west coast of Mexico).  Lots of places to eat and have a cold beer when you are done, although the prices reflect the popularity of this spot with Mexican and foreign tourists alike.

260601585.name: Fantastic fishing village with an amazing beach and great locals - a must see!
260601585.author: a TripAdvisor user
260601585.reviewBody: We were told about San Augustin by local brothers Tino and Sancho.  Tino arranged for Miguel to pick us up at our resort just outside of La Crucecita, drive us to San Augustin, stay with us all day and drive us back for a VERY reasonable price.  Miguel was amazing!  \nThe area is absolutely stunning and it is SO nice to be off of the resort and experiencing a bit more local flavour.  We went to the restaurant, "La Casa al Abuelo" - we were able to leave all of our things at a table, have our server Alfredo (who is simply fantastic!!!) get us beach chairs, umbrellas, drinks and then come back and serve us for lunch when we were ready.  The beach is quiet and not many tourists are around.  Food was amazing, but the drinks were even better (Coco Loco!!).  The beach is stunning and the water looks like it does on the Mayan.  What a fantastic day!

260585007.name: Amazing snorkeling, and great food
260585007.author: a TripAdvisor user
260585007.reviewBody: We took a panga boat tour of the area around Huatulco, and ended up here for snorkeling and lunch on the beach.  The snorkeling was wonderful.  We saw a massive school of fish our guide called "big eye."   I\'ve never seen such a "cloud" of fish.  A great experience.  We ate lunch at one of the many palapas on the beach...not sure of the name but it was the one with 4 or 5 country flags hanging from it.  I found prices there to be a bit on the high side for the area, but not unexpected given it\'s "touristy" nature.  We spent about 750 pesos for 4 people to have lunch, with a few cervazas.  The food was fine, but the experience of sitting with your feet in the sand, overlooking a view that is out of this world, while having lunch and a beer....well, that is priceless.

260284809.name: Playa San Augustin
260284809.author: a TripAdvisor user
260284809.reviewBody: We visited San Augustin as part of our Jungle ATV tour.  The best beach in Huatulco in my opinion.  Snorkeling is great right from the shore, no need for a tour guide/package to take you out.  Plenty of places to rent snorkel gear and restaurants around.

259867008.name: Schools of Herring so thick couldn\'t see reef below
259867008.author: a TripAdvisor user
259867008.reviewBody: It takes approximately 40 minutes to drive from Bahia Huatulco to Play San Augustin.  Part of the drive is along a dirt road .  Midway down that road is a great fruit stand where you can stock up and look across the street for a couple resident iguanas who live in the big trees.   Once you arrive at the beach you will find many palapa styled  open sided restaurants on the beach from which to choose to set up camp.  They will all be clamoring for your business once you get to the parking lot.   Chose one, order a drink then hit the water for some nice snorkeling what seems to be a healthy reef.  The entry to swim was very easy.  We saw lots of fish and at one point such a dense school of herring between me and the bottom that I was not able to see the reef below me.  After a great snorkel enjoy a delicious seafood lunch and the best Pina Colada I have ever had at the restaurant called San Agustin.

259133362.name: Beautiful beach
259133362.author: a TripAdvisor user
259133362.reviewBody: A great peaceful beach where you can have a great lunch and spend some hours relaxing, many villages where you can stay if you are and adventure traveler who doesn\'t bother about internet and electricity.

258162345.name: Quad tour
258162345.author: a TripAdvisor user
258162345.reviewBody: As part of our quad tour we ended up here at this gorgeous place with a beautiful beach and great snorkelling .\nLots of places to eat or simply enjoy a Corona!

256824376.name: Great spot
256824376.author: a TripAdvisor user
256824376.reviewBody: This is the beach all the locals recommend for snorkelling. It\'s a popular location for local people and the beach is lined with little restaurants. It\'s about a 20 min. drive from the highway on a windy gravel road. The turn-off is about 1 km north of the airport. The various restaurants provide parking. There is a big coral reef here which makes for excellent snorkelling. The water is clear and calm. You can also get here by boat from some of the resorts.

256740664.name: Enjoy an ATV tour, stopping at this gorgeous beach
256740664.author: a TripAdvisor user
256740664.reviewBody: This beach was definitely our favorite while in Huatulco.  We took an ATV tour through Paraiso Huatulco (shout out to our favorite excursion of the week) and it took us to Playa San Augustin for an afternoon of swimming, snorkeling and snacking.  The beach is calm, the snorkeling is great (100 pesos for use of the gear for an hour), and the relaxation level is high.  Make sure you stop here while you\'re in Huatulco!

254742003.name: It\'s the Water
254742003.author: a TripAdvisor user
254742003.reviewBody: It\'s  the best Water we have been in, and this was our second time At the Beach next to the town of Huatulco. Perfect water temperature, Restaurants  with lots of seating  and toilets. We swam, walked around the lovely town, sat in the Town\'s Square, and then swam again. Simply Perfect

254519641.name: Snorkeling heaven
254519641.author: a TripAdvisor user
254519641.reviewBody: Clear water and calm bay makes it great for snorkeling for novices and advanced. Not far from the Marina, easy to get to.

252760846.name: Lovely Beach
252760846.author: a TripAdvisor user
252760846.reviewBody: What a great place to spend the day.  Nice little restaurants line the beach providing plenty of seating.  It was a wonderful experience.

251773270.name: Amazing!
251773270.author: a TripAdvisor user
251773270.reviewBody: The snorkeling was really great - we had a guide who took us around the rocks and we saw lots of interesting fish. The water was warm with nice rolling waves. There were clear areas with no coral where you could just float in the water and enjoy the incredible view.

251351570.name: Good snorkeling
251351570.author: a TripAdvisor user
251351570.reviewBody: We had the place to ourselves when we arrived at 10:30am on a weekday. The water was clear, the snorkeling was very good and the beer was cold, what more can you ask for?

251305746.name: Great food!
251305746.author: a TripAdvisor user
251305746.reviewBody: Small pretty beach, great to chill after a long visit to the other bays. Food is worth the wait and the sea is calm

251004489.name: Other beaches nearby
251004489.author: a TripAdvisor user
251004489.reviewBody: Good restaurants where you can hang out all day for the price of lunch or breakfast and a few drinks and you can leave your stuff while walking the long beach or swimming.

250916825.name: Out of the way beach that was deserted when we went.
250916825.author: a TripAdvisor user
250916825.reviewBody: The are two different beaches here. The first as you drive into the village is large and un occupied. If you go into the village to the boat area there are small restaurants. We stay at the first beach and had it to ourselves. It is about a 25 minute drive from the main road down a dirt road witch may explain the lack of people. No shade here, so bring your own..

250646695.name: specatular snorkeling
250646695.author: a TripAdvisor user
250646695.reviewBody: We hired a panga boat for the day and Manti took us out to this beach.  We snorkeled there saw so many pretty fish, starfish, trumpet fish, puffer fish...on and on.  It was so calm and the visibility was excellent.  On the way back to Santa cruz we say flying manta ray, and whales...what a great day

249779784.name: Gorgeous!
249779784.author: a TripAdvisor user
249779784.reviewBody: Great beach, tons of palapa-style restaurants to choose from.  You can eat at a restaurant and it gives you the use fir the day or you can rent the table (usually about 100 pesos).  They have an area marked off for snorkelling, to protect it from the boats.  The snorkelling was some of the best we found in the area. It\'s a busy area during the holidays but any other time is very quiet and relaxing.

249648539.name: Take the boat there with Tikko
249648539.author: a TripAdvisor user
249648539.reviewBody: Best fish dinner I have ever eaten at Alex\'s restaurant. A very pretty beach with lovely people.  Ask Tikko to show you where to eat.  Red Snapper grilled with garlic and butter. We were all swooning.  Nice beach, at the turn around point after a fabulous boat tour.  Lots of snorkelling along the way.  Tikko cannot do enough to show you his love for the seven bays and the birds, flying fish, whales along the way.  He will show you everything and ensure that you have all the time you need in every silent beach along the way.  A perfect and lovely day and a fabulous meal on a lovely beach.

249426515.name: Paradise...
249426515.author: a TripAdvisor user
249426515.reviewBody: Now this beach might be a bit far from your Tangolunda resort, but it\'s worth the trip. A secluded beach, very few locals drying fish, breath taking views, this is what you\'ll get...

248103813.name: Private beach
248103813.author: a TripAdvisor user
248103813.reviewBody: Sand and beach were gorgeous. Just be award of the tourist companies, they do over charge and you need to ask what exactly does the price includes because they add extra cost along the way.

247421369.name: A must!
247421369.author: a TripAdvisor user
247421369.reviewBody: If you have a car you should go, its a little far away, like  30 minutes on a gravel road. Has no hotels only palapa bars, basic but nice

247097089.name: One of Huatulco\'s many surprises!
247097089.author: a TripAdvisor user
247097089.reviewBody: We went on a 7-Bay tour and came across this beach as part of the tour.  Lot\'s of vendors and large beach area. If we return we definitely will pay a visit to this beach!

246276576.name: good option at Huatulco
246276576.author: a TripAdvisor user
246276576.reviewBody:
Nice beach, it has a lot of people but, its nice to spend at least a day in there, 
It is about 40 min drive from Santa Cruz Huatulco, you will drive through 13km (+-8 miles) in a non pavement road, after 20 km on the regular road.
Is a nice spot for snorkeling, still a lot of fishes and others (octopus I saw one by the rocks),
beach is still clean, try to arrive early and get a place with any restaurant owner and you are done!, 
place, food , and parking for you.

It is long beach, I mean you can walk and enjoy the view, there is another beach separated just by some rocks, you can swim (is 200mts away) and get another view and better and almost alone for you, also you can get there by boat.

The only point I did not like is: the beach is getting dirty, you start to find the "fish coca cola can" , "Ms. plastic bag medussa" and more, we took a lot of wast from the sea and almost collect lot of cans, bags, straws, bottle tops, and more.

Prices are almost the same that in La crucecita, it means that, for a beach are "cheap"

We spend two days with different restaurant, both very good, both offer restrooms, showers, parking and really nice food!

245769994.name: nice beach for sure..
245769994.author: a TripAdvisor user
245769994.reviewBody: take a taxi to the beach as it is about 45 minutes away from town.. the dirt road you drive on is a little tedious if you are on a small motor scooter.. as i found out..

245697928.name: Great snorkeling
245697928.author: a TripAdvisor user
245697928.reviewBody: Great snorkeling. Beautiful beach. Great food, friendly people. IF you eat at a restaurant they will watch your stuff for you. Rather crowded but still nice. Lots of families. Lots of opportunities to book a boat, jet ski, or snorkel tour right on the spot.

241845658.name: Beautiful Snorkeling Beach
241845658.author: a TripAdvisor user
241845658.reviewBody: We travelled there by 7 bay cruise, but you can go by Taxi, but it may be a good idea to have the taxi, either wait for you for your return, or a least set something up for your return, as taxis don\'t regularly sit at this remote location. There are some reefs there, that have an abundance of fish around to see. Water is warm and fairly clear, making snorkeling a lot of fun, even for the first timers. On the  cruise, they even had floats for people to hang onto to make it even easier to enjoy. Cruises offered lifejackets also.

233460860.name: Snorkelling Fun
233460860.author: a TripAdvisor user
233460860.reviewBody: Love is place for snorkeling just off the beach, we saw beautiful fish pink, yellow, purple, blue, stingrays, blowfish, sea spider, and a purple shell fish that expels natural purple color.  So beautiful!

211284439.name: Pure, clean beach
211284439.author: a TripAdvisor user
211284439.reviewBody: Less developed but it\'s getting there. Warm water, we had waves, cooling breeze and lovely day trip. All the water sports you need. Food wasn\'t great but then there weren\'t enough people on the beach to drive up the quality and choices.

205735525.name: Real
205735525.author: a TripAdvisor user
205735525.reviewBody: Want a trip to a real mexican beach with beach bars that is a little off the beaten path......take a taxi here for the afternoon.  Rent a snorkel for 5 bucks and rip around the reef right in front of you.  Decent prices for beer and food......still found prices high for food here but you can sniff out a deal.  An adventure to get to by car as you travel though the local village of san agustin.  A really cool view down the ocean if you climb up to the top of the beach village to a locals house there.  Check it out!  We cabbed there from Crucecita for 20 bucks one way..........$35 is set fare so there is some room for movement.

203387720.name: Beautiful!
203387720.author: a TripAdvisor user
203387720.reviewBody: Such a nice little village. We ate at one of the restaurants and it was so good, real authentic mexican food.

202005348.name: Clean
202005348.author: a TripAdvisor user
202005348.reviewBody: Food is pricey...snorkeling is not impressive...i didnt feel it was safe for my kids to swim in. However it was nice to sit under a palapa and enjoy he scenery.

200535749.name: Best snorkelling
200535749.author: a TripAdvisor user
200535749.reviewBody: Beautiful Bay to relax on or snorkel at. Best way to get there is by  panga boat. Playa San Augustin has some good places to eat at.

199402587.name: Wonderful Snorkelling
199402587.author: a TripAdvisor user
199402587.reviewBody: Lunch at Lala\'s was great. Book a trip with Pilo Vasquez for the full experience!! This had the clearest water we had ever seen.

197205795.name: Nice reefs, but lots of jellyfish!
197205795.author: a TripAdvisor user
197205795.reviewBody: San Augustin was one of the stops offered by the bay tour excursion we selected. Our guides led us to a restaurant where we left our things and we immediately jumped into the water. The bay was clear and teeming with fish of all types. We swam for about 15 minutes before noticing that we were surrounded by jellyfish. Because it was getting so uncomfortable, we got out of the water and went to the restaurant for a marguerita, tortillas and pico de gallo ($350 pesos per couple). Not long after we sat down, beach sellers, some accompanied by children, began streaming in, making it difficult to relax and enjoy this quaint little village. The ba\u00f1os of the restaurant we were at, was probably one of the worst I have seen so far in Mexico. While our experience in San Augustin wasn\'t great, we were told by a local woman that it should be on our to do list while in Huatulco. She said we should see the church (which we did not have time to) and also check out a resturant there (Churros?) operated by a couple of artists who are helping feed the children in the area.

196820912.name: Clean beach, good snorkelling
196820912.author: a TripAdvisor user
196820912.reviewBody: You don\'t necessarily need to snorkel, as the fish are clearly visible and will swim around you close to the beach. Plenty of restaurants and prices aren\'t too bad.

196339098.name: Beautiful spot--especially with an awesome guide!
196339098.author: a TripAdvisor user
