196339098.reviewBody: We were lucky enough to hire Mario Cobos as our fishing/snorkeling guide while we were in Huatulco last week and had an AMAZING adventure that included a stop at San Augustine for wonderful snorkeling and a fabulous authentic meal cooked by Marianna and Mario.  Hands down the best fish I have ever tasted.  If you\'d like an awesome day, email cobosmario@hotmail.com or visit his website www.mariocobos.com.  He\'s the most interesting, thoughtful, and informative tour guide I have ever had the pleasure of meeting (and now we are lucky enough to call him our friend)....best of luck on your adventures in Huatulco!

195720645.name: Meh
195720645.author: a TripAdvisor user
195720645.reviewBody: There are no shady spots. The snorkeling was terrible. The water is dark and all we could see was murky sand. There is a row of restaurants but they were all closed.

195559741.name: Beautiful with the best Margaritas Ever!
195559741.author: a TripAdvisor user
195559741.reviewBody: We stopped here for lunch while on an ATV excursion.  Beach was gorgeous, clean and calm.  As you enter the bay from the main walkway - turn right and the first beach restaurant has the most delicious drinks, fresh caught fish and great food.  Great spot to cool off and enjoy the view!

195391581.name: Nice snorkeling and great lunch!
195391581.author: a TripAdvisor user
195391581.reviewBody: This was our second time to Huatulco and San Augustin in 14 months!  We really like this area and plan to return next year.  (My parents are wintering here.)  We have tried a number of lunch palapas and found the best one today.  You must eat at La Puma, which is about 2/3 of the way down the right strech(from the water), or the far left (from the road entrance).  There Snapper a la plancha con ajo y mantequilla may have been the best we\'ve ever had.  Coupled with the ceveche mixta we were very content.  \nOur visit was enhanced by the nicest bar, bathrooms, and shower on the whole stretch of beach.  \nThis area is well worth the effort to travel to, and La Puma is the restaurant to lunch at!

194576789.name: Jelly fish!!
194576789.author: a TripAdvisor user
194576789.reviewBody: Stopped as part of our private ocean tour with friend.  Swimmers beware!! Great little stop but was stung by jelly fish :(

194007019.name: Simply Amazing
194007019.author: a TripAdvisor user
194007019.reviewBody: I had always planned to go to this bay when I visited Huatulco and I\'m so glad I did. Beautiful beach, incredible breeze, delicious food and we were the only ones walking the beach. Do not miss this place!

193540670.name: Amazingly Beautiful Beach
193540670.author: a TripAdvisor user
193540670.reviewBody: This was by far our favourite beach in Huatulco. Long white sand beach, very clear water, great for swimming and if you like to snorkel....you\'ve come to the right place. We went here three times. Once on a private boat tour and after that, we chose to rent a car and drive out here twice. It is such a beautiful beach and there is so much to see snorkelling. All different colours of bright fish, and we saw an eel. We loved it here. Definately when travelling huatulco beaches.....bring your own snorkel and mask from home cause every beach has some sort of snorkelling so it\'s nice to not have to worry about renting and to have a good set with you. We used our sets everyday while on vacation. Worth the investment. Also go to this beach during the weekdays. One day it was like we were the only ones there. When we went on a Saturday it was packed with lots of boats of snorkelling tours coming in. As well, sometimes when coming into beach towns you get surrounded by Mexicans trying to tell you to come to their restaurant. Just don\'t stop walking....keep trekking to the beach and once you commit to sit down on an area on beach they leave you alone. Last word of advice is bring pesos to the beach restaurants or more remote places with you. Not American money. They will screw you and give you a 1 to 10 exchange rate when banks give you 1 to 13.

193540380.name: awesome
193540380.author: a TripAdvisor user
193540380.reviewBody: fantastic beach, calm, and beautifull, try the snorkel tour is amazing, they have a little island in the middle with lots of beautiful fish..

193488038.name: Interesting place to visit
193488038.author: a TripAdvisor user
193488038.reviewBody: We didn\'t snorkel here, but we stopped in for lunch. It has lots of food options. Great views! Lots of beach vendors and many come right into the restaurant.

192667458.name: Best snorkeling in the area
192667458.author: a TripAdvisor user
192667458.reviewBody: Loved the water and how clear it was - then after you can have lunch at the many beach restaurants.  We went out and toured all the bays with Vaina - he has Pura Vida - he was very reasonable and gave us a great tour

192522778.name: bays tour
192522778.author: a TripAdvisor user
192522778.reviewBody: beautiful beach, great snorkelling.  we visited the bay on the boat tour.  we didn\'t check out any of the restaurants on the beach though.

188835140.name: San Augustin
188835140.author: a TripAdvisor user
188835140.reviewBody: Out of the way and a very beautiful beach, cheap cerveza and a little cantina to eat at . Handcrafted souvenirs for sale by the children that live there and great snorkelling too.

188658734.name: Gorgeous Beach
188658734.author: a TripAdvisor user
188658734.reviewBody: We drove our rental car there from our villa in Huatulco. The dirt road off of hwy 200 was bumpy, dusty and long, but not dangerous. Once there we randomly chose a restaurant/parking spot/palapa after lots of greeting/ selling us by all the competitors. Probably any spot is fine, but we went to the far left. It was quiet once we sat down and ordered food and drinks. The beach is golden, the water is crystal clear and snorkeling off the shore was easy. There are boats coming in close to shore at times that made it a bit less idyllic but otherwise it was beautiful and we spent a great afternoon relaxing, swimming and snorkeling. Some vendors, about 10 in 4 hours but not too aggressive. I would go back.

186752572.name: Great Beach
186752572.author: a TripAdvisor user
186752572.reviewBody: We visited the beach by bus and taxi from La Crucecita total cost for 2 about $8 each way. I really enjoyed the beach and we had a lovely meal at one of the small restaurants.\nAlso went snorkeling there on a 7 bays cruise on the catamaran \nand saw lots of colourful fish. I would recommend it

186453232.name: Coral reef
186453232.author: a TripAdvisor user
186453232.reviewBody: Great place to snorkel, the coral reef is shallow so it is very easy to see the fish, coral and rock formations without having to dive.  Sometimes it can be choppy if the wind is coming from the east.  So check the weather.  Try Charlie\'s place.

186105065.name: Gorgeous Clear Water
186105065.author: a TripAdvisor user
186105065.reviewBody: We were taken here as part of an excursion off a cruise ship. It was organized by another cruise passenger for about 40 of us.  This beach and the boat tour of the bays was the highlight of the excursion.  Our guide Mario and the crew were delightful and served us cervezas and homemade tamales on our ride back to the ship.  Yum.  The beach isn\'t easy to get to, off a long bumpy dirt road but it is a very authentic Mexican experience with lots of tiny restaurants on the sand with palapas to sit under.  And the beach has a gentle break and the clearest water.  We all loved it.

184940928.name: Far, but perhaps the most lovely
184940928.author: a TripAdvisor user
184940928.reviewBody: Of the beaches with facilities, this one seems to be the most lovely.  Easy to swim at, many palapa restaurants to choose from.  You can swim or snorkel from right off the beach...just beautiful for couples, families, solos.

181922232.name: Hire Tiko for this Adventure!
181922232.author: a TripAdvisor user
181922232.reviewBody:
We did a snorkel trip with Tiko at San Agustin Bay, it was perfect! It was a group of 6 and we all enjoyed the trip very much. Tiko caught a Blowfish and other sea creatures for us to take pics with Awesome.
 
San Agustin Bay is perfect to go eat and relax, swimming is great here as well, since the water is very calm. 

We did a fishing trip which was Great, People if you want to go out by Boat and discover all the Bays and do some fun Excursions hire Tiko this guy is awesome, this is our 2nd time in Huatulco and we have really enjoyed traveling to this destination!

Here is Tiko's email: marisol71279@yahoo.com.mx

You can contact me as well if you have any questions regarding this excursion!

180507552.name: BEAUTIFUL!!!
180507552.author: a TripAdvisor user
180507552.reviewBody: The beach is gorgeous and the snorkeling here is the best!\nAlways empty cause you have to drive to it...6+ miles on dirty, dusty roads... or take a water taxi.\nYou got to go!

172094358.name: Beautiful Beach and good snorkeling .
172094358.author: a TripAdvisor user
172094358.reviewBody: Clean clear water and lots of shack style restaurants lining the beach . Good food and cold beer . Views are spectacular ! Water is super clear . Head North past airport till you see the turn off . About 8 miles of dirt road but not rough . Worth it !!

171543579.name: Beatifull beach
171543579.author: a TripAdvisor user
171543579.reviewBody: This is in my opinion the best beach by far in the Huatulco area. It is worth the one hour trip from La Crucecita. If you homthere, try to get a place at La Casa del Abuelo. Is a nice restaurant and it is the last one so it is less crowed. Clean and crystaline waters.

170014241.name: The most Beautiful Bay in the area!
170014241.author: a TripAdvisor user
170014241.reviewBody: This is one of the most beautiful bays in the Mexican Pacific! And it has a great coral reef just a few feet from the shore... The snorkeling is the best in Huatulco! \n\nBut it\'s very crowded in high season, a bunch of locals come here when the children are on vacations... And it also gets two 100 people ferries everyday! So it can get very crowded. So go there on low season, avoid the weekends! Or get there very early and leave past noon.

167148007.name: Ate ride
167148007.author: a TripAdvisor user
167148007.reviewBody: Road a ate to the playa. Beautiful scenery and beaches. San Augustine beach is great swimming and snorkeling.

165322330.name: Gorgeous
165322330.author: a TripAdvisor user
165322330.reviewBody: The beaches are so clean and gorgeous, the Gulf of Mexico is so very gorgeous and inviting.\n\nWonderful for a day trip.

163498732.name: pleasant diversion
163498732.author: a TripAdvisor user
163498732.reviewBody: we stopped for lunch here during a snorkel cruise with Captain Tino. Ate a wonderful lunch with mucho cerveza and margarita;s under a thatched roof on the beach. Were not pestered  by souvenir sellers

163123107.name: Simply wonderful!
163123107.author: a TripAdvisor user
163123107.reviewBody: We went there during rainy season - BEAUTIFUL day. We hired a cab for 500 pesos for the day. He picked us up promptly and waited patiently for us. As well, he spotted Iguanas and stopped to let us take photos. The beach is simply amazing and the bay stunningly beautiful. The snorkeling is excellent and the water bathtub warm.  Of course there are folks trying to sell you necklaces and deep-fried plantains but they are polite and take "no" for an answer. The restaurants look sketchy but the seafood is very fresh and excellent. You do pay a lot for lunch but remember that you are in an isolated area and this is FRESH seafood. it was truly a perfect day. Thank you Enrique from Santa Cruz Sitio Taxi.

161272157.name: another beautiful peaseful bay
161272157.author: a TripAdvisor user
161272157.reviewBody: Relax at another bay accessible by car and boat. My wife and I had our very first homemade tamale made by local native people living here. Absolutely the best, and you must try fritos platans which is fried plantan, simular to a banana.

158483246.name: Fantastic Snorkeling - Best in Huatulco
158483246.author: a TripAdvisor user
158483246.reviewBody: We discovered Playa San Agustin on our last day of a 3 month stay in the Huatulco area - and it was the best snorkeling of the whole area!!  Well worth the 300 peso cab fare to get out there.  You can make a full day of it at this beach - lots of beach palapas where you can get lunch and drinks.  Next time we go, we\'re hitting San Agustin FIRST

157223129.name: Snorkel and swim
157223129.author: a TripAdvisor user
157223129.reviewBody: Really beautiful and large bay. We visited with Roberto (yellowfincatching@yahoo.com.mx) on a bays cruise in mid March. But we found lunch prices to be very high ( $50.USD  for local lobster or red snapper-we had shrimp). Maybe prices are high because the area was so remote. Might be better to eat closer to town and just enjoy extra time to swim and snorkel. Or pack a picnic. Vendors had jewelry and sarongs to sell, but we had not taken enough cash to purchase anything.

156902740.name: Great lunch!
156902740.author: a TripAdvisor user
156902740.reviewBody: We went to Playa San Augustin on a snorkeling trip with Valentino (velentino_fisherman@hotmail.com). After snorkeling and touring the bays, we went to Playa San Augustin. It\'s where the locals eat and play in the sea! Being a holiday weekend, it was crowded with families, but the atmosphere was very fun. We ate at one of the restaurants, had a great meal of 5 shrimp 5 ways. Then we snorkeled a bit. The tide was coming in, so you had to be careful around the reef. We saw lots of beautiful fish.

155297439.name: Beautiful Beach
155297439.author: a TripAdvisor user
155297439.reviewBody: This beach is great for snorkeling and swimming. You can get to it by cab or boat. It is a very beautiful place to just lay around and watch the day go by.

155262940.name: wow
155262940.author: a TripAdvisor user
155262940.reviewBody: stunningly beautiful. I\'d say you must go here but i wish it could stay a secret. the snorkeling was fantastic and the food was great

154192121.name: Snorkeling Day
154192121.author: a TripAdvisor user
154192121.reviewBody: We hired Omar at the hotel (cab driver) and went here for the day.  Omar was on our time and was never in a hurry.  The day was set by what we wanted which was nice.  The water here is very pretty with lots of coral in the water.  Ocean is also very warm.  Saw lots of fish.  Hired a local to do under water pictures for 300 pesos.  Received a disk with over 100 pictures.

153618754.name: BEST snorkeling in Huatulco!
153618754.author: a TripAdvisor user
153618754.reviewBody:
This is a tricky place to get to - it is a full hour drive N from Santa Cruz but only because the last 13 km are a slow, bumpy, sandy road.  Snorkeling in the morning (as in all the locations) is much clearer and yes - the water is a touch cooler!
Having never snorkeled the Pacific before, I was intrigued by the hard coral  and amazed at the sheer size of the schools numbers of small fish in San Augustin!  I snorkeled here the first day and a different beach/bay every day thereafter around Huatulco and this was the benchmark best!

Despite its locale, there are at least 8 beach restaurants and the beer is as cold as it is in town.  Good food was had at all the beaches.

153482609.name: Best snorkelling beach
153482609.author: a TripAdvisor user
153482609.reviewBody: Find a cab that will take you out (about 1/2 hour on paved road, then another 1/2 hour on dirt) and stay the day - around $500 peso. Lots of reefs and good clarity to the water. Plenty of bars and restaurants on the beach.

153460197.name: Best snorkling
153460197.author: a TripAdvisor user
153460197.reviewBody: The snorkling here is fantastic.  We saw lots of fish and even a blowfish.  There are a lot of restaurants on the beach obviously catering to the cruise ship business. Don\'t go there on days when the cruise ship is in Santa Cruz.  The food is mostly seafood and way over priced but part of the experience.  Little kids will try to sell you everything from flip-flops to shells they picked up from the beach and there are alot of them. But if you say no they generally leave you alone.

151945150.name: San Agustin was on our to-do list and we weren\u2019t disappointed.
151945150.author: a TripAdvisor user
151945150.reviewBody:
Right outside our hotel we hired our Taxi driver Kevin for 500 pesos round trip. We left the hotel at 9:30am and returned at 6pm.
 
From Hotel Castillo to San Agustin was a 45 minute to hour drive. Once off the highway, it’s a dirt road and there were times Kevin was going 20km, very rough.

As we approached San Agustin, our driver took us to the last road which is the northern part of the beach, next time we go will request southern part. Although we didnt walk the whole beach, im thinking it could of taken an hour to do so. 

We ate at Charly’s place where we had a lightly breaded fish. Approx cost was 13$ CAD per plate

On our way out, we stopped at the place we were dropped off for a drink. 80 pesos for a Pina Colada.

The beach/coral are beautiful and we will definitely be back.

151838233.name: Quaint area
151838233.author: a TripAdvisor user
151838233.reviewBody: Our 3rd trip here, always beautiful. Good snorkeling. However the prices to have lunch here have skyrocketed, the quality is still very good.

150431226.name: Snorkel fun
150431226.author: a TripAdvisor user
150431226.reviewBody: this is one of the beautfuil bays of Huatulco the water is very calm here and the white sandy beach is beautfuil the snorkeling is great there are lots of restaruants along the beach and a couple of stores so it is great to spend the day there .Is very worth going there

150144958.name: beautiful.
150144958.author: a TripAdvisor user
150144958.reviewBody: We took a boat cruise here.  This is where we stopped to swim and eat.  The restaraunt cleaned and cooked our seven foot sail fish we caught on the way there.  It was fantastic.  There were as excited about the fish as we were I think.  It was done really well!  the beach here is beautiful!

149290384.name: Real Mexico
149290384.author: a TripAdvisor user
149290384.reviewBody: We had a great experience here. After going fishing with Tony Lopez that morning he suggested that we take our Mahi Mahi to his friend Lala and he would cook it for us. So awesome! Lala invited us into his restaurant which was the only one full so you knew he was a good cook. He bought us chips and salsa and 2 delish appetizers(cant say what they were) and ice cold Caronas. He cooked up our fish a couple different ways and it was just awesome! We had a couple more beers and a couple margaritas and relaxed and enjoyed watching the goings on. Lots of locals and fishing boats coming and going. We had our snorkel gear so swam around in the warm calm waters. Lots of different fish. Had a great day!

138841377.name: Paradise on Earth
138841377.author: a TripAdvisor user
138841377.reviewBody: Wow! What a nice place. It was a lonely beach just for us... we were walking along the shore for a mile and enjoying the most beautiful weather ever... it was a soft rain and we ended up at a place where the only people who was enjoying where the 4 of us! Imagine nothing but a piece of paradise only for you for several hours... the time went by so fast. The road that leads you to San Agustin Beach is really bad but you gotta go there when you are in Huatulco

136103617.name: Good snorkeling
136103617.author: a TripAdvisor user
136103617.reviewBody: Really nice coral and fish made for a pleasant couple of hours of snorkeling. Overpriced restaurants. Wish it was easier to get here -- bay tour was annoying.

130274613.name: Great place to hangout
130274613.author: a TripAdvisor user
130274613.reviewBody: This is a great beach, we have been many times. Water can be calm but I have also seen it choppy so be careful when snorkeling as some shallow areas with lots of coral. People are very friendly, Food is good and fresh/right out of water at places I have eaten. Very nice view from the Church area up top.

128600536.name: Worth the drive
128600536.author: a TripAdvisor user
128600536.reviewBody: San Augustin is one of the most beautiful bays I have ever seen.  We hired a taxi for the day ($100) and it was worth the money and the the 1 hour drive.  It is snorkeling paradise (it is like swimming in an aquarium) and the beach bars will let you use their beach furniture in exchange for buying a few beers.  Several organized tours go to San Augustin as well but we opted for doing it ourselves.  If you take a taxi, ask for one with air conditioning.  They are working on the highway and the dust if you had the windows down might get to you!

127164490.name: Good spot, but sort of far away
127164490.author: a TripAdvisor user
127164490.reviewBody: Got sick on the food at one of the restaurants.  I hadn\'t been sick in Mexico for years and years.  Maybe not worth the long boat ride to go twice, but certainly worth seeing at least once.

126875019.name: World class snorkeling
126875019.author: a TripAdvisor user
126875019.reviewBody:
A taxi driver on the way from La Entrega mentioned that San Augustin has bigger reef and excellent snorkeling, and indeed it does. Nearly perfect beach - long, wide and very picturesque. Part of it is occupied by few restaurants where locals live. I took a table at one of them and asked for orange juice, which was squeezed there from fresh oranges and costed me 30 pesos. I came in the morning and was the only one snorkeling - it was fantastic, tons of fish and nice healthy reef. Snorkeling part of the this short movie http://youtu.be/S9JeywQsFRU is done at San Augustin and in parts at La Entrega (which, too has very good - and similar to the one at San Augustin - reef, but is much smaller and busier).

The road to San Augustin was interesting by itself. I took a taxi (it was 300 pesos one way and for another 300 the driver offered to wait for me there and drive me back). It takes about 45-55 minutes from La Crucesita on highway and later on a dirt road. There are few villages and farms on the way where you can buy watermelon or some fruits and even see an ostrich (one farmer keeps it for fun).

If you are into snorkeling - San Augustin is a must-snorkel beach.

126139881.name: dirty beach
126139881.author: a TripAdvisor user
126139881.reviewBody: beach was poor, boats were going out where people were swimming which is an accident waiting to happen.  Water was not very clean.

125998670.name: and time stood still
125998670.author: a TripAdvisor user
125998670.reviewBody: Did you ever want to go back in time? Did you ever want time to stand still? If yes, then Playa San Augustin is for you. By road it is located just west of the airport.You go down an old dirt road that passes by a small village and several fruit farms. The beach is a mile or 2 in length and in some sections it may be 80 or 90 yards wide. The water is many shades of blue and the landscape is dry and rugged. A beautiful coral reef comes within 20 yards of shore and the snorkelling is as good as it gets for this region. The restaurants are huts with thatched roofs. We return to San Augustine each time we are in Huatulco.  On a couple of occasions we were the only non locals on the beach. There is something about having a cold corona,listening to Santana\'s music,looking out over the Pacific and having a fresh red snapper with your feet in the sand....it all fits .This beach is the anti Cancun... Non developed. Go for a day and enjoy how time has stood still.

125680105.name: Still a Favorite Snokelling Adventure.
125680105.author: a TripAdvisor user
125680105.reviewBody: Hire a local at the Marina and discover the bays and sights along the way. Usually a stop at India to snorkel first and then onto Playa San Augustin! Many colorful fish here. Variety of grat local restaurants and very SAFE!!!\nHuatulco Friends

125615295.name: Great beach, good snorkeling
125615295.author: a TripAdvisor user
125615295.reviewBody: Nice place to go for lunch though a bit overpriced compared to town.  Lovely to sit and eat on the beach while the kids snorkelled and played in the water.

125456425.name: Super snorkeling
125456425.author: a TripAdvisor user
125456425.reviewBody: Hard to reach but worth the 1 hour from Huatulco. Taxis available but don\'t like the 8 miles of dirt.

125450315.name: Great Beach
125450315.author: a TripAdvisor user
125450315.reviewBody: We took a taxi to San Augustine Beach, cost was around $250 peso each way, cab driver stayed and waited for us, we stayed for about 5 hours, enjoyed the snorkeling, which was very good, water very clean and clear, drinks on the beach were anywhere from $20-25 peso. I would recommend a trip here during your stay in Huatulco.

125414254.name: beautiful unspoiled beach!
125414254.author: a TripAdvisor user
125414254.reviewBody: was a beautiful secluded spot - breathtaking views - a little difficult to access, but worth the trip!

125238952.name: BEAUTIFUL
125238952.author: a TripAdvisor user
125238952.reviewBody: Perfect getaway from the resort crowds... excellent Beach

125094590.name: Best Beach!
125094590.author: a TripAdvisor user
125094590.reviewBody: There is nothing much that I can say other than this beach is amazing, beautiful snorkeling!

124925695.name: Best snorkelling
124925695.author: a TripAdvisor user
124925695.reviewBody: We took a 9 bay tour on the Macho to San Augustin beach and the bay next to it which was definely the best snorkeling of our trip.  It was totally random that we ended up there as we had no idea what we had signed up for other than a snorkelling cruise.  We got talked into the trip by a guy on the beach - he took a hefty commission but since it was our first visit to Huatulco we had no idea where to go.  We could have booked a tour for less through our hotel but I don\' t know that it went to San Augustin- so make sure that is where you are going!! There is a list of destinations at the Santa Cruz marina and I suspect if you show up by 10am and ask for the one to San Augustin you will be set- its 250 pesos from there.  Snorkle gear is not included but can be rented for a rather exorbitant 100 peso/d at the marina.  And have 5 pesos/pp for the marina fee.   \nThe crew of the Macho don\'t speak any English but were eager to please and kept our cups full of water or soda.  They take you to a restaurant in San Augustin where you can buy lunch. It was very good.  I highly recommend San Augustin for the avid snorkler!

124672704.name: Great snorkling
124672704.author: a TripAdvisor user
124672704.reviewBody: Its was not crowded and there was alot of coral to be swam

123851061.name: Amazing beach!
123851061.author: a TripAdvisor user
123851061.reviewBody: The beach had something for everyone, snorkling, swimming, jet skiing...the list goes on!   Plenty of restaurants lining the beach.   Ceviche and shrimp cocktail were amazing!

123751042.name: Best Beach Experience
123751042.author: a TripAdvisor user
123751042.reviewBody: When going to San Augustin make sure you go to the beach to the right---This area is even more secluded and more beautiful to stay the whole day then taking the left fork in the road.   I\'ve been here numerous times and each time is just as nice as the first.  If you go to Huatulco make sure you take a whole day to stay and enjoy the beach at San Augustin.

122590868.name: Lovely beach
122590868.author: a TripAdvisor user
122590868.reviewBody: Not too far from Huatulco (only about 10 minutes past the airport and then another 20 on a dirt road). Well worth the trip. Lots of palapas and little restaurants to station yourself in. In fact, some people had tents and/or slept in the hammacks overnight under the restaurnat palapas.  Food was fresh and well-prepared.  We went to the far left (as you face the water) just 2 restaurants before the Abuelo restaurant that was pretty large in comparison (but did seem to have an abundance of long lounge chairs).  Two of the kids (age 20 and 18) snorkeled around the rocky little island off shore and saw lots of fish, turtles, etc..  Food and drink prices were fair.

122543602.name: Worth going the distance!
122543602.author: a TripAdvisor user
122543602.reviewBody: San Agustin is an incredibly beautiful beach & is worth either the beautiful boat ride or the bumpy dirt road to get to it. The snorkeling is breathtaking, watch out as some of the fish do get a little frisky & often nibble.  There are a variety of restaurants to choose from,& some that don\u2019t prepare the fish well. It\u2019s a hit & miss. I recommend taking a walk along the shoreline eyeing what people are eating before making a choice of where to stay. The fish is fresh, I recommend asking for the Dorado/Mahi Mahi & it should be white & flakey not brown meat when you dig in. Also try the stuffed seafood pineapple & ensure that it is grilled when it is prepared. Also watch out for sand fleas in the early morning & once the sun starts to set, that\u2019s when they come out & before you know it you can be covered in bites, so take precautions.

122419469.name: Fresh fish on la playa
122419469.author: a TripAdvisor user
122419469.reviewBody: We brought a Mahi we had caught an hour earlier to one of the beachfront restaurants.  They cleaned and cooked the fish with roasted garlic and all the sides you could ask for only 400 pesos.  The freshest fish we had ever eaten.

122163311.name: Clean, beautiful, good snorkeling
122163311.author: a TripAdvisor user
122163311.reviewBody: You have to drive a hard road but the reward is good.  Super clean, great snorkeling, soft sand, beautiful water color.

122038130.name: Great beach!
122038130.author: a TripAdvisor user
122038130.reviewBody: We went to Playa San Augustin twice from La Crucecita and had a great time both trips. We took a taxi to get there and back, which is about a one hour trip from town and cost about $38 round trip. Our taxi driver even waited for us the first time which was a sweet deal for him. On our first trip we hung out at Restaurant Chemeco on the right fork in the road. Our second trip we stayed at Restaurant de los Abuelos on the left fork. Both days we snorkeled and swam and ate good seafood. Prices are high at all the restaurants but you can stay all day and they keep an eye on your things. Snorkeling is okay but there isn\'t a lot to see compared with the Caribbean... but it was still fun. You can rent snorkel gear and life jackets, if needed. Of the two places I preferred Los Abuelos as the view was great, clean bathrooms were across the street and the palapa roof is large and you feel like there\'s lots of space around you. At Chemeco there were lots of banana boat rides going on so you felt like you had to watch out for boats while snorkeling. However, the captains do watch out for snorkelers and I never felt in danger. All in all, this is a wonderful beach and I highly recommend it!

121989130.name: Best Beach
121989130.author: a TripAdvisor user
121989130.reviewBody: This was my favorite beach as it was quieter due to its distance away from the Marinas. It had good facilities and good snorkeling and swimming.

120781601.name: paradise
120781601.author: a TripAdvisor user
120781601.reviewBody: Once you find the dirt road leading you to this beautiful beach location it  is very bumpy and rustic. From main road it\'s 30 minutes. Lovely beach, lots of vendors, restaurants and just gorgeous blue waters, Great to visit for a few hours. We rented a car and drove here but there are excursion as well...enjoy!

115049770.name: wonderful spot
115049770.author: a TripAdvisor user
115049770.reviewBody: Playa San Augustin is worth the extra effort and distance....beautiful, with the offshore islands peppering the bay for pretty photos, plenty of palapas restaurants for food in the shade, some fun people-watching, not as crowded as Entrega but with the lots of good snorkeling right offshore and a wide, long, curved beach for beachcombing. You could easily spend a pleasant day here! Go!

102940383.name: Gotta go once during your stay
102940383.author: a TripAdvisor user
102940383.reviewBody: Second visit to San Agustine.  Took a cab from our hotel -- 600 pesos round trip.  We arranged for the driver to come back for us at the end of the day.  Takes about 1-1/2 hours from La Crucecita, with at least 45 minutes on a dirt road.  The bay is pretty big, with about 30 palapa-style restaurants on it.  We picked where we sat basically by where it was on the beach and the fact that they had lounge chairs.  Snorkeling equipment was 40 pesos; my son had to return his a couple times til he got some that worked.  There is a lot of coral, but also places where the bottom is sandy and you can swim.  Water very clear.  When we were there, there were probably only 25 people on the whole beach.  Very beautiful and relaxing!

672215270.name: Beautiful Beach day
672215270.author: a TripAdvisor user
672215270.reviewBody: Its a great place to spend a beach day. We took a cab from town and then hired a boat back in the evening..We spent the day based at a restaurant on the beach ordering drinks and snack through the day. It was reasonably priced. From there we could swim, snorkel, walk the beach or just chill. Its amazing

671970430.name: Fun Beach
671970430.author: a TripAdvisor user
671970430.reviewBody: A lively fun beach with very good snorkeling. Vendors feed on tourists a bit. Life jacket rentals are expensive and a bit silly. However, their is a good vibe and its fun,

670188859.name: Great Snorkeling!
670188859.author: a TripAdvisor user
670188859.reviewBody: Love this little alcove!  Have been twice on two different trips.  You can just walk straight into the beach and jump in the water and start snorkeling!  Lots of palapa bars and great food.  Taxis are abundant when you want to leave.  I will always return here for a day!

664553618.name: Nice experience for travelers
664553618.author: a TripAdvisor user
664553618.reviewBody: Nice beach area. Some shade trees for a picnic. Calm water for kids to swim and good snorkeling (by Pacific Mexico standards). Typical Huatulco restaurants including average seafood and over-priced margaritas. Nice day trip from Santa Cruz. When in Huatulco, see the bays! Go.

663870290.name: Snorkeling
663870290.author: a TripAdvisor user
663870290.reviewBody: Paradise, safe, beautiful pristine beach, life jackets available we took taxi extremely reasonable rates... left our valuables in restaurant/food area all day with no concerns at all

663513500.name: great snorkeling, but busy beach
663513500.author: a TripAdvisor user
663513500.reviewBody: choice your place carefully on where you sit, all the restaurants offer you free table and chairs until you get the bill, and then they charge you. We ate and drank at Lucy\'s and they had the nerve to charge us for our umbrella, and demand a large tip. Sit somewhere else there are lots of places, just ask what they charge so there will be no surprises. The snorkling is amazing, check out the cave

661287816.name: Amazing beach
661287816.author: a TripAdvisor user
661287816.reviewBody: Very nice experience in snorkeling, peaceful and friendly people attending restaurants, I spend two days, I will be back again.

660819908.name: snorkel and swim
660819908.author: a TripAdvisor user
660819908.reviewBody: We snorkelled there twice and found it very enjoyable.  I do not have much experience but others told me that further  out on  the reef there are some amazing sights.\nThere are many beach restaurants all of which are very interesting.  They do not mind if you use their tables to prepare for snorkelling but it would be very rude not to purchase something to eat or drink. Very quaint place.  Very different from our previous experience.  Very interesting.  It was a short taxi ride from our resort.

659833609.name: Nice brach for swimming and snorkeling
659833609.author: a TripAdvisor user
659833609.reviewBody: This is probably the best beach in Huatulco for swimming and snorkeling. However the restaurants and vendors are quite pushey.  Go to the right side of the beach to avoid this when you get off from the taxi.

657828757.name: One of many beaches to explore
657828757.author: a TripAdvisor user
657828757.reviewBody: Just gotta go beer is cheap views are breathtaking bring sunscreen and stay the day. Only 2$ by cab from La Crucecita

657396287.name: Fun little beach
657396287.author: a TripAdvisor user
657396287.reviewBody: Bring your umbrella or plan on buying something from one of the many restsurants. Fun snorkling for the timid beginner. Taxi here, because we walked and that was a mistske.

657394608.name: Great snorkeling from this Mexican Family Beach.
657394608.author: a TripAdvisor user
657394608.reviewBody: Get away from the mostly anglo beaches and go to this Mostly Mexican families on vacation beach.  A very joyous place with great beverages and food at a very fair price.  Great place to snorkle right from the beach.  Cheap (60 peso) cab ride from Santa Cruz.  Just went their 3 days in a row.

657204213.name: Great little beach escape for a day
657204213.author: a TripAdvisor user
657204213.reviewBody:
My family and I took a short taxi ride to this beach for some snorkeling and to try out the restaurants off the resort.  The beach is located in a natural cove and is very sheltered... so when the waves are too rough elsewhere for snorkeling, La Entrega was perfect.

We were approached by a local tour operator who offered to guide us as first timers while snorkelling and for $15 he took us all around the area and showed us some great stuff...

Food, sun,  beach, calm waters, and great enviornment for a cheap way to get off resort for a day and have a great time

657081072.name: My Favorite Place
657081072.author: a TripAdvisor user
657081072.reviewBody: A wonderful beach with amazing ocean waters.  Clear and clean with fantastic snorkeling.  Usually busy with visitors coming by panga or car, etc. but a fun place to be!  Also lots of restaurants.

656102284.name: Fun Beach, Great Food and Drinks
656102284.author: a TripAdvisor user
656102284.reviewBody: Entrega is a relaxing beach with clear, calm water great for swimming or snorkeling. There are a bunch of palapa restaurants that offered a variety of seafood. Nice place to take a family.

655272354.name: Very crowded
655272354.author: a TripAdvisor user
655272354.reviewBody: This beach is not that long, about a couple hundred meters.  It is very crowded.  Bathers were stacked in the ocean like cordwood.  Tour boats bring in groups of snorkelers. The snorkeling is OK at best...only a beginner would describe it as good.  You can see some fish and very little living coral.  Restaurants line the beach and offer shade.  Definitely not a must-see destination.

655126560.name: Busy and almost no lounge chairs
655126560.author: a TripAdvisor user
655126560.reviewBody: We far preferred Maguey to this beach as the restaurants here did not have lounge chairs. It was very busy, like other beaches, but we just found the vibe was different. Your opinion may differ.

654981539.name: Nice beach - lots of water activities
654981539.author: a TripAdvisor user
654981539.reviewBody: Nice beach, water is clear and snorkeling is not to bad.\nBoats are kept to one side of the beach away from swimmers.\nGets real busy as the boats bring in tours. Lots of restaurants to pick from, can get pretty tight as the restaurants are packed next to each other. But the water makes up for that.

654408546.name: Great Snorkeling
654408546.author: a TripAdvisor user
654408546.reviewBody: Close to Santa Cruz . Perfect little beach and bay. Great food. Can be very busy at times. Caught me off guard the first time I went there . Must have been 25 large tours buses parked on the road out. Didn\'t see them coming in .

653968996.name: Great beach for snorkeling (and cold beer)!
653968996.author: a TripAdvisor user
653968996.reviewBody: We have been to Huatulco several times and always spend a few days down at Playa Entrega.  We usually head to the beach early in the morning and snag a good spot at the front of one of the restaurants.  The water is clear and warm and the snorkeling is amazing along the left side of the bay and just around the first point is a small beach to rest before heading back to the main beach - magical.  There are not too many vendors on the beach and the don\'t harass you like in Puerto Vallarta.  The restaurants have reasonably priced cold beer and good chips and guacamole.  We usually leave by about 2 as it can get a bit busy but it is never crowded.  Great beach!

653434347.name: 8CCD
653434347.author: a TripAdvisor user
653434347.reviewBody: Great for snorkelling and beaching.  The bay is secluded, no waves, clear water and shallow beach.  I highly recommend Playa Entrga!

653084728.name: La Entrega
653084728.author: a TripAdvisor user
653084728.reviewBody: Beautiful beach but not very big. Not a good walking beach but the water is beautiful warm and clear with gentle waves. The day we were there was a holiday so it got busy pretty fast. The palapas are squished in one area, a little too close for comfort. The service in the palapas is slow but that\u2019s not different than anywhere else, poco a poco. One must learn the great art of patience. It costs 70 pesos by cab to get there from the town of la Crucecita. It\u2019s good to go there once but I prefer Santa Cruz closer and only slightly smaller with the same great water.

652994889.name: Excellent Snorkeling
652994889.author: a TripAdvisor user
652994889.reviewBody: This place is actually a very beautiful beach. There are many restaurants there so you\'re able to get a table at this time where they will gladly serve you Beverages and food but you can stay as long as you want. The service was excellent in the guacamole at Lucy\'s was undeniably the best guacamole I\'ve ever had. You can walk right off at the beach and the fish swarm around your feet it is the coolest thing to encounter. Make sure to bring your snorkel gear or the you can ruin it there because you don\'t want to see everything that is there. When we were there they were having a huge party on the beach with live music games and the locals were having a great time as well as us. We are going back to snorkel another day. Must go here if you love the ocean and fish.

652977302.name: Beach next door!
652977302.author: a TripAdvisor user
652977302.reviewBody: This little beach has it all.  Equipment rentals, restaurants, snorkeling, good swimming, short walk to our hotel! Lots of locals and tourist gather here!

652741791.name: Beautiful beach!
652741791.author: a TripAdvisor user
652741791.reviewBody: I\u2019ve been to Playa Entrega many times but always came by panga (boat). We took a taxi from our hotel in Huatulco, 60 pesos. Nice ride to the beach. The entrance to the beach is lovely & very clean. The beach has an amazing history, so check it out. (Hint: la entrega means the delivery) There are many restaurants lining the beach. There are guys doing their best to pull you in! We chose Cielito Lindo cause it was recommended in a tourist magazine called \u2018bite.\u2019 Very good! Drop your gear at a table & head off to the water. They keep an eye on your stuff...but use common sense! You can rent gear on the beach, but since I bring my own, can\u2019t speak to that. The water is warm & clear. The snorkeling area is roped off so boats don\u2019t enter. The reef is really crackling! A good thing! Lots of beautiful fish, some colourful coral. It can get busy when the pangas come in, but they don\u2019t stay too long! And people...no taking a rest by standing on the reef! Let\u2019s do our part to help preserve this beautiful beach.

651139579.name: Great snorkeling
651139579.author: a TripAdvisor user
651139579.reviewBody: We took a 60 peso cab ride fro Santa Cruz to Entrega.  The snorkeling was much better at Entrega than Santa Cruz.  The water was very clear and if you go to the far left of the bay and swim around the point there\u2019s another mini bay with a little cave (at low tide). Many more varieties of fish and clearer water.\nThere are many restaurant/bars at this beach and a place to rent kayaks or snorkel gear. There\u2019s even a little board you can rent with a view finder if you\u2019re not comfortable snorkeling, but still want to check out the fish.

650760911.name: Great Snorkelling
650760911.author: a TripAdvisor user
650760911.reviewBody: We snorkeled in a few different bays around Huatulco the first week of Feb and this was by far the best that we visited. The clearest water I have ever seen.\nWe didn\'t visit any of the restaurants on the shore but there are a number to chose from. The beach was full of locals which is a good indication of what kind of beach it was.

650595169.name: Beautiful beach
650595169.author: a TripAdvisor user
650595169.reviewBody: We\u2019ve visited this beach a couple of times during this week .... the water is crystal clear and very inviting.  Snorkeling is a great way to spend some time and you will be greeted immediately by someone trying to get you to sit at their tables.  As another reviewer noted, they do add a service charge so review your bill.  My only negative comment would be to avoid the red and white checked tables.  Simply the most unappetizing bites we\u2019ve had all trip. Do have your taxi driver stop at the Lighthouse for the view.

649976086.name: Nice place to spend a day
649976086.author: a TripAdvisor user
649976086.reviewBody: Calm clean water to swim or snorkel.  We had a beer and quesadillas. Watch out since the restaurant we ate at added a service charge.

649332454.name: Awesome beach and setting
649332454.author: a TripAdvisor user
649332454.reviewBody: First off the paved road getting there has many pot holes, so many, the sides of the road are more advised- follow the taxi\u2019s if you have your own car. Once at the beach, you will find many restaurants filling the air with delicious smells. Usually a person will greet you and ask if you need an umbrella ( the sun is strong and is a good refuge if needed). The beach itself is covered in soft white sand and has easy entry into the ocean. The beach is impeccably clean with no trash in sight. The family atmosphere is inviting and the thatched covered roofs just make it more exotic. Bring or rent snorkeling gear , cause there\u2019s a plethora of fish to see. Waters are crystal clear and visibility great to the bottom. You can also rent jet ski, take a boat tour of other beaches, but for us this was a favorite. The restaurant will bring drinks to your umbrella and there\u2019s lots of locals offering other dishes and trinkets. Wonderful place not to miss. It\u2019s a very cheap taxi ride from the town ( Hautulco) to get there.

647789244.name: Beach / Snorkelling - great local day trip
647789244.author: a TripAdvisor user
647789244.reviewBody: Excellent place to go for a day at the beach with great snorkelling.  60 peso taxi from Santa Cruz or 100 pesos from Las Brisas resort.  One of the restaurant owners will meet you and you can keep your stuff at their restaurant on the beach under video surveillance.  Mask rental is 50 pesos, or 100 pesos including fins (that you really don\'t need).  Great food and drink at the restaurants.  I\'d say 80% of the folks there where Mexican, so they endorse this beach as well.

647004228.name: Wonderful Snorkelling!
647004228.author: a TripAdvisor user
647004228.reviewBody: An easy beach to get to from La Crucecita with wonderful snorkelling. It\'s a picturesque beach with lots of places to eat and shops to buy floaties for kids -- its quite protected making it a better beach to visit with families and little kids.

646615562.name: Very nice snorkelling; very different from the Carribean
646615562.author: a TripAdvisor user
646615562.reviewBody: Shallow - maybe 20 ft at the deepest area?  Lots of fish to see.  They rent you equipment if you don\'t have any.  Restaurants and toilets on site.

646560319.name: Nice waters close to Barcelo hotels
646560319.author: a TripAdvisor user
646560319.reviewBody: Very nice small  bay but the view and snorkeling  good food at the entrera was fast clean and not $. Only thing bring your own towel chairs and anything else for your comfort

646457943.name: Short MX$60 taxi ride from Santa Cruz Huatulco
646457943.author: a TripAdvisor user
646457943.reviewBody: Lovely sandy beach lined with restaurants and a few beach/gift shops. Snorkeling from the beach is easy and was safe as there was no strong tide/rip when we were there. The coral plates are not far off the beach and we saw slot of fish. Restaurant prices are of course higher than the Santa Cruz marina area but that is to be expected. All in all a good day out at the beach.

646421628.name: Incredible snorkeling
646421628.author: a TripAdvisor user
646421628.reviewBody: Public beach which is very busy on weekends, but great on weekdays. \nFood and drink is reasonable price and quality.

645817896.name: Neat little beach but too packed
645817896.author: a TripAdvisor user
645817896.reviewBody: We tried this beach on Christmas Day. In the morning it wasn\u2019t too busy by the afternoon you couldn\u2019t walk there were so many people there. The snorkeling was really good here. It is a good beach too for kids.

645396727.name: nice, but way too busy
645396727.author: a TripAdvisor user
645396727.reviewBody: We went around the Mexican holiday season. It was incredibly busy! Having said that, we still enjoyed this beach. We never went snorkeling as there was tons of people doing that. Sat at the restaurant had some beers to get a table, chair and umbrella.

645205036.name: Pretty beach and good snorkelling
645205036.author: a TripAdvisor user
645205036.reviewBody: This beach is easily accessible by road and boat and therefore it gets busy. Best time to visit is the first half or the morning. The visibility was great and the snorkelling was good. It gets crowded and noisy by lunchtime.

644406817.name: Great snorkeling but so many people!!
644406817.author: a TripAdvisor user
644406817.reviewBody: We came Jan 3 early in the morning and set up our umbrella and chairs. It was busy on the beach but manageable. Went out to snorkel and had to come back in early because of the jellyfish. It pays to check for the moon phase. A few days after the new moon the jellyfish come in. But there were so many fish to see!! We left early afternoon as it was so crowded on the beach and in the water. We\u2019ve been before and loved it. Don\u2019t recommend going during the holiday season if you can help it unless you are ok with huge crowds. Easy to get to and from by taxi

644174975.name: Our favorite beach
644174975.author: a TripAdvisor user
644174975.reviewBody: This is one of our \u201cgo to\u201d beaches.\nAt Entrega, we can snorkel, swim, float, kayak, stand up board, and paddle boat.  We love the food at the Entrega Restaurant.  There we can sit and relax, and eat and drink great food.

643178863.name: Great Beach
643178863.author: a TripAdvisor user
643178863.reviewBody: Great beach, good for snorkeling get here early the places get very busy, especially on weekends. The food and the service is very good too, take a cab there and have then pick you up 3-4 hours later.

642698208.name: Wonderful snorkeling!
642698208.author: a TripAdvisor user
642698208.reviewBody: You can snorkel right off the beach. You can rent equipment there. Plenty of places to eat too. Great spot.

642221022.name: Wonderful, inexpensive snorkeling experience for beginners
642221022.author: a TripAdvisor user
642221022.reviewBody: While vacationing at the Dreams Huatulco resort, we heard about the wonderful snorkeling on the reef at Playa La Entraga; and we were not disappointed.  It cost us 110 pesos for the 15 minute cab-ride, and since we had our own equipment, our only other expense was a few 30 peso beers on the beach. The reef is quite popular with snorkel training schools, but it is large enough to handle the numbers.  The cove is well sheltered, the water is warm, and the visibility is very good. The beach is broad, flat, and sandy; perfect for families with small children.  We saw a good variety of marine life, including a couple of sea turtles. We spent an entire afternoon at Entraga, had a wonderful time, and it cost no more than 400 pesos ($28 Canadian) between the two of us.

641855496.name: great spot
641855496.author: a TripAdvisor user
641855496.reviewBody: This is a great spot to spend a day. Restaurants, snorkeling, beach, what more do you need?  The beach has powder soft sand unlike the sand at our resort so we really enjoyed it. Would go back for sure.

641314810.name: Sweet spot!
641314810.author: a TripAdvisor user
641314810.reviewBody: First time here this year, won\'t be the last!  loved the small quaint location.  Snorkel or just float in the water.  Restaurants are great, had some good food and cool ones. Hubby rented a life jacket from the shop at the end to snorkel with. Took a cab, the driver took us to the light house at the top first, great views from up there.

640897939.name: Best snorkeling! Easy to rent gear and lockers are available
640897939.author: a TripAdvisor user
640897939.reviewBody: We had such a great experience snorkeling here. The coral is beautiful and there are so many fish. We have our own snorkel gear, but there were dozens of people who had it for rent. On the far left end of the beach we found a place with secure lockers for 50 pesos, which was really nice to not have to worry about leaving stuff on the beach. I think the coolest part was how many people were there snorkeling all together, but when you put your mask in the water, you feel like you have the coral and the fish all to yourself.

639827034.name: Beautiful family beach
639827034.author: a TripAdvisor user
639827034.reviewBody: The beach is beautiful, clean, calm and perfect for kids. You need to rent an umbrella for shade. There are many restaurants with local food. rentals for snorkel equipment (100 pesos) all day, just ask if the locker is included in price. Coral reef is nice. We saw many fish. My daughter enjoyed a lot. When you get back to this beach to the hotel ask the taxi to stop in the view point (mirador). The mirador is nothing fancy is just a spot with a view. Take son pics of the bays. It is breath taking.

639588233.name: Great Family Beach
639588233.author: a TripAdvisor user
639588233.reviewBody:
This beach is easy to get to and Very Popular.. It has everything you want for a fun day at the beach. There is a snorkel rental shop, kayak rental, great restaurants on the beach and local vendors roam the beach selling everything from local souvenirs
to fresh oysters on the half shell. for just a few pesos !  Take a ride on a big Banana 
towed by a speed boat or just relay and enjoy the  beach and work on you tan 
while sipping a cold one ! !

639584140.name: Snorkelling
639584140.author: a TripAdvisor user
639584140.reviewBody: Great place to go snorkelling!! Fabulous reef and an abundance of different fish to see. Go early and spend the day. Best to go early, gets busier later on in the day. Lots of places along the beach to sit, eat and drink \ud83d\udc4d. There is also a place to rent snorkel gear if you don\u2019t have your own.

639264369.name: Like crowds? Chair style shopping? Good Food?
639264369.author: a TripAdvisor user
639264369.reviewBody: If you like crowds, restaurants, chair style shopping - you will love it! It\'s missing music - someone should get some music around here. I loved seeing people playing card and camping out at the restaurants, eating and drinking, without any complaints. Nice to be able to get out of the sun and enjoy some good food and good friend.

638986473.name: Wonderful
638986473.author: a TripAdvisor user
638986473.reviewBody: Perfect beach, great snorkeling, hidden cave to snorkel in. Had a great lunch at one of the beach restaurants. Great day highly recommend this stunning beach.

638614304.name: snorkeling and beautiful beach
638614304.author: a TripAdvisor user
638614304.reviewBody: We enjoyed time in the bar with drinks and snacks and did some snorkeling.\nBeautiful beach and friendly people

638015717.name: Our least favourite beach in Huatulco
638015717.author: a TripAdvisor user
638015717.reviewBody: Tried this one halfway thru our trip.  We found the place to be crowded (much more so than other beaches in the area).  While you typically get a refreshing breeze at other beaches, this one was dead air, which made it uncomfortably hot.  We ended up leaving after an hour, and went to El Maguey instead.

635657798.name: Good snorkeling, a picturesque beach,  and easy to get to
635657798.author: a TripAdvisor user
635657798.reviewBody: We went on a Sunday afternoon and the beach  was very busy; however, there weren\'t many people snorkeling. I was pleasantly surprised at how good the snorkeling was. After we got away form the shore, the water was clear. There were lots of smaller fish, and some maybe a foot long. Some nice coral, too, and a nice pocket beach not too far along the left shore that you can stop at. We had lunch after, and most restaurants had free tables, even though the beach was busy. Not many foreigners there, mostly Mexicans.

635356134.name: Beautiful water
635356134.author: a TripAdvisor user
635356134.reviewBody: If you want to snorkel, this is a great place to go. We got lessons and equipment and then a tour around part of the area. It was amazing.

634277284.name: Wonderful beach and snorkelling.
634277284.author: a TripAdvisor user
634277284.reviewBody: We took a cab to this beautiful beach one morning.  There are a few lockers where you can pay to lock your stuff up.  The snorkelling was amazing and we were the only ones there for quite some time.  We snorkelled our way to a tiny beach and sat there for a while and watched too.  Around noon lots of other boats starting pulling in and it got quite busy.  As with many places in Mexico you either have to pay for toilet paper or bring your own.  We did find a bathroom in one of the restaurants to use as well.  Amazing spot and highly recommend it!

634063114.name: Cruzin the beaches
634063114.author: a TripAdvisor user
634063114.reviewBody: Went on a Saturday mid afternoon not knowing what to expect. Pleasant drive to the beach or short cab ride. Once there parking could be an adventure but hey, you\'re going to a beach. It\'ll be all good soon. Lots of little restaurants,  people getting into whatever they do on a beach. Sitting, swimming, eating, singing, playing games or just sitting in the shade. Loads to watch and look at. Equipment rentals, big water banana rides, fishing and more. A really nice time on a sunny day with a cold beer.

633841333.name: Decent snorkeling
633841333.author: a TripAdvisor user
633841333.reviewBody: We wanted to try snorkeling off of our resort and took a taxi here. It was easy to get to and taxis were waiting after as well. The beach is nice and clearly popular. Fairly big waves but a big roped snorkeling area. It was decent but if you are used to pristine waters then this may be a let down. We did see some cool fish and it was fun, just not crystal clear. Fun to visit for sure and families were enjoying themselves!

633269040.name: Weekdays are quiet and great for snorkeling without bumping into someone.
633269040.author: a TripAdvisor user
633269040.reviewBody:
I've been to this beach multiple times and always try to make my way back whenever i'm in-town. On weekends it can get quite busy making it a little hard to find a place on the beach and having some space out in the water to snorkel. I bring my own snorkeling gear and am unsure if you can rent any there. Standing in the water facing outward, snorkel along the left side where if you are confident with your swimming skills(waves can get a little aggressive in this tight space) and not claustrophobic you will find a cave worth venturing into! Some have a hard time finding it but trust me it's there. Watch for others entering or slowly make your way around the rocks in order to see the entrance. Other than that, lots of fish to see, plantains drizzled with dulce de leche to eat and sun to soak in. Absolutely no worrying on how to get a taxi to there and back. Fairly priced cab ride to the beach and there are always cabs waiting there to take you back. Plenty of restaurants with same pricing who will all try their very best to lure you in. I believe there's even a road side spa you can get a massage at. 
I think paddle boarding could be pulled off here but I did not see anywhere to rent gear. 

A good early morning visit or afternoon hang out spot.

611097036.name: High time
611097036.author: a TripAdvisor user
611097036.reviewBody: It was a beautiful beach but it was high traveling time and very crowded.  We got nice little spot at one of the restaurants and had snacks and drinks.  Overall it was a nice day.

600455144.name: Great snorkeling site.
600455144.author: a TripAdvisor user
600455144.reviewBody: Snorkel along north side of beach.  Has a small cave around rocky area of north side & another small hidden beach around corner.

597179251.name: Snorkeling for children
597179251.author: a TripAdvisor user
597179251.reviewBody: I recomended for little ones.  Hire a guide will put children an a plataforma see thru. View Dish and reef.

597149412.name: Great place to practice snorkel!
597149412.author: a TripAdvisor user
597149412.reviewBody: A great pkace for snorkeling because the water y calm and there is a coral reef with lots of fish. Snorkel gear prices are reasonable.

596413546.name: Great Boat Cruise/Lunch Destination
596413546.author: a TripAdvisor user
596413546.reviewBody: Excellent spot to cruise to and have lunch. Great snorkeling right off the beach, bring your own gear or rent. Local guides will give you a water tour and make sure you tip them. Ask for the cave tour!

591555382.name: Ok beach but great snorkelling
591555382.author: a TripAdvisor user
591555382.reviewBody: Food was so-so, beach is so-so, but snorkelling is fantastic. It is small and crowded. Worth it for snorkelling but not spending the whole day there.

591007296.name: Best time ever
591007296.author: a TripAdvisor user
591007296.reviewBody: This was a great place. When we first pulled in of course everyone was happy to see clients. But we came to have a good time and they showed us one. The first restaurant in line is Juquila or Juquileta. The server Juan kept food and drink coming and watched our stuff when we went on the boat ride (except of course we took cells and purses). The jet ski guy is Ati. He was awesome. We went 2 at a time 2 times. Even the 4 year old loved it. Then we went with Pioquinto in his boat Sports fishing and a little tour. We saw a turtle in the ocean. His boat was La patrona and was painted dark blue on the outside. These were all really great people who took care of us. We will def. come back next vacation

587623518.name: Beautiful beach.
587623518.author: a TripAdvisor user
587623518.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful beaches I\u2019ve seen! The water is pristine and totally calm. No strong waves at all. Basically a natural swimming pool. However, there is not much free shade anywhere. You will have to consume something in one of their restaurants so you can get some shade. Went with my 18 month old and not having easy access to bathroom, clean water, shower, shade was a bit rough. Much better for older kids!

583472759.name: Beach & snorkelling at its best
583472759.author: a TripAdvisor user
583472759.reviewBody: This beach is quiet but the snorkelling is fabulous....especially for beginner enthusiasts. Equipment is available to rent at reasonable prices and several restaurants line the beach. We took a taxi for 60 pesos from Santa Cruz and the driver returned to pick us up at the requested time ( although there are taxis available all day). No need to worry about the taxi fairs.....price is standard rate. You will love your time at this beach. It wa my favourite beach while staying in Santa Cruz.

580516991.name: Beach day
580516991.author: a TripAdvisor user
580516991.reviewBody: Everyone in town gets commission that\u2019s how this town works. We ask the cab driver to take us to a nice beach. He suggests Entrada. - great. We go and he suggests a place to eat and they will rent us snorkel gear etc.  \nWe don\u2019t actually like that restaurant so we go to the far end where this restaurant is alone so that we can eat pressure free. By the way the snorkeling there was outstanding.

577730929.name: Won\'t be disappointed
577730929.author: a TripAdvisor user
577730929.reviewBody: Great beach - easy to enter the water - easy and good snorkeling from the beach - calm - warm - lots of choices to eat - good food

576059749.name: Family Friendly Beach!
576059749.author: a TripAdvisor user
576059749.reviewBody: Playa Entrega is a wonderful beach for the whole family!  Great food, calm water with no waves, amazing snorkeling and even a cave to snorkel into for the more adventurous!

575920513.name: Beach Meal Unreal !
575920513.author: a TripAdvisor user
575920513.reviewBody: One of the Best sea food meals on this beach ...and you sit on the sand (with chairs of course) try the 4 by 4 shrimps and the shrimp pineapple ....delicious

575761598.name: Like being in a Planet Earth Documentary
575761598.author: a TripAdvisor user
575761598.reviewBody:
If you go there splurge on a snorkelling guide at the far end of the beach. It was pretty cheap and provided the  the advantage of being taken to a spot where you are all but guaranteed to see lots of tropical fish.
It was like swimming in an aquarium and the highlight for me was being just an arm's length away from an eight inch long electric blue fish  which had neon lights flashing along its side. Truly a remarkable experience which will make the watching of "Blue Planet" so much more real when it's next on.
No matter what you pay , it's worth it!
Cheers
BillC

570894343.name: Nice Beach
570894343.author: a TripAdvisor user
570894343.reviewBody: 15 min taxi ride from Santa Cruz area (Holiday Inn & Castillo Hotel for 60 pesos.\nKind of touristy but rustic with a few restaraunts & bars. Nice setting and beatiful water and easy to swim for all ages.

570778748.name: great beach, nice view, but STAY AWAY from Restaurante Juquila
570778748.author: a TripAdvisor user
570778748.reviewBody: We had a really nice time here with family -- until we ate an overpriced mediocre meal at Restaurante Juquila, which was a drain on our wallets and did considerable damage to our tummies ($50 for a small plate of mixed seafood items).

568706443.name: Snorkel City
568706443.author: a TripAdvisor user
568706443.reviewBody:
This was my favourite beach while visiting Huatulco. It has great restaurants right on the beach with ample shade and great service. 

I loved to go snorkelling at this beach. So much sea life and coral reef to enjoy and there was never a dull moment while searching for those hard to find sea creatures!

If you want a beach tell your cab driver, “Entrega, Por Favor!” And wait to arrive at this amazing sandy paradise!

568509444.name: sweet beach and eats
568509444.author: a TripAdvisor user
568509444.reviewBody: Enjoyed the easy access beach, especially the roaming kitty cat.   So friendly and healthy.   We also enjoyed a living dog.   Clean.

567911575.name: Nice day visit
567911575.author: a TripAdvisor user
567911575.reviewBody: Of the over 20 beaches we visted in this area, this by far, was the busiest.  It was Sunday, so lots of locals and tourists.  Could barely walk to the water.  But, food was really good and really reasonable.  Great way to spend our last day in the area.  Not sure I\'d return. A little bit to \'busy\' for me.

567306066.name: A great place to spend a day
567306066.author: a TripAdvisor user
567306066.reviewBody: We went snorkeling and saw so many fish! The swimming was great. We got a nice table with umbrellas at one of the first restaurants on the beach. Nice sandy beach with plenty of room to swim. Easy to grab a taxi to go and come back for $60 pesos. Also got a little detour to the two view points. Both were beautiful. We will get back there and see the sunset from the lighthouse!

566930753.name: Beautiful Beach
566930753.author: a TripAdvisor user
566930753.reviewBody: Playa Entrega is incredibly beautiful.  The snorkeling was the best we have experienced.  Atmosphere was great.  I definitely recommend people going.

566518730.name: Snorkling heaven
566518730.author: a TripAdvisor user
566518730.reviewBody: Nice bay to visit, great snorkelling without having to fight waves or swim for hours. Beach can get busy but cheap beer and the restaurant aim to please

566271783.name: Cartel showed up
566271783.author: a TripAdvisor user
566271783.reviewBody: We spent the day at Playa Entregra on a Saturday.  There was a group of 10 adults.  All was good when we arrived, however, it took a turn for the worse later in the day.  Two very well dressed men and their entourage showed up at about 1 pm in a convertible type hummer vehicle with large speakers blasting.  They pulled right on the beach area.  It started with us watching two jet skis out in the water doing stunts and scaring the people swimming right out of the water and just escalated from there.  The entourage moved into the restaurant where we were seated outside.  They had a "band" come in and play for at least 2 hours.  I love music, however, this wasn\'t music.  It was a guitar and a tuba player and just absolutely awful.  I think they were just waiting for someone to complain and we were told to keep our thoughts to ourselves.  After about 2 hours, the guy and his "silicone" girlfriend hopped into the hummer vehicle and proceeded to drive directly onto the beach where vendors were set up and children were playing.  They spun around 3 times blowing sand everywhere and knocking down the vendors\' items.  He then jumped the curb where his vehicle flipped over.  All the Mexican people ran and helped him (Not sure why).  After he left, I asked one of the locals was this cartel and his reply was yes, unfortunately they show up about once a month.  One of the ladies on the beach that was braiding hair just clung onto one of our chairs and was crying profusely.  There was no sign of police anywhere until he had vacated the premises.  I feel so very sorry for the locals who have to put up with this and we were told that cruise ships and tourism was down due to the heavy presence of these losers.  We have been to Huatulco 3 times and I think this will be the last as I felt very intimidated and on edge when they showed up.  Its just so so sad and too bad they don\'t realize when tourism goes down, then so does the economy of the area.  I realize they are everywhere, but so disheartening to see the locals so scared.  I was so very grateful that one of the children out there playing wasn\'t hurt or worse killed.  I\'m not sure what they hope to accomplish by doing this.

565661407.name: A Beach Paradise!
565661407.author: a TripAdvisor user
565661407.reviewBody: We just came back from a Week in Huatulco and spent two full days at Playa Entrega.  What an Amazing Beach with fantastic snorkeling. We went on a Thursday and Sunday morning.  It was very busy on Sunday with all the locals and their families.  I would recommend a weekday visit versus a weekend.  It\'s a short cab ride from Santa Cruz but well worth the visit. The restaurants were all amazing!

564343987.name: Great swimming and snorkeling, laid-back feel
564343987.author: a TripAdvisor user
564343987.reviewBody: A delightful beach known for good snorkeling and swimming.  Water is calm, clear and pleasant. The restaurants are relaxed and offer excellent food, drink and service. You can rent snorkel gear. The cab ride involves about 13 km over a rough dirt road. Two friends and I paid 800 pesos for the round trip. Some people come by boat.

563622286.name: Snorkeling in the cave
563622286.author: a TripAdvisor user
563622286.reviewBody: Playa Entrega is such a great snorkeling spot with a very cool underwater cave that is easy to navigate.  The restaurant and facilities are very nice also.

563238898.name: Playa Entrega
563238898.author: a TripAdvisor user
563238898.reviewBody: This is the best place to eat, drink, snorkel and soak in some sun. The restaurant there completely takes care of all your needs. The snorkel guy comes and rents you gear, the venders (not bothersome) come and share there wares. The experience was wonderful. That was the second time we had visited. The snorkeling was good many colourful fish

563172526.name: Busy, but clean and well organized!
563172526.author: a TripAdvisor user
563172526.reviewBody: We had a very nice day with my friends. The place is full of people, but it is clean the water is like from the magazines and there is everything nearby - food, drinks and shops.

562189241.name: Not much here
562189241.author: a TripAdvisor user
562189241.reviewBody: Snorkeling here was meh. We saw fish but not a lot of variety. Rest of small beach consists of dive shops and little restaurants. Fun for a few hours though!

561916704.name: Crowded
561916704.author: a TripAdvisor user
561916704.reviewBody: Four of us cabbed here from Santa Cruz on a Sunday,  turns out Sundays are crazy busy at this beach. We ended up heading to Maguey bay after about 1.5 hours. Turned out to be a good decision. That said the water and beach were very nice at Entrega. I\'d recommend it during the week unless you like large crowds.

561063386.name: Beautiful beach
561063386.author: a TripAdvisor user
561063386.reviewBody: This is a very busy beach, but nice enough that you can still enjoy your shady chair in one of the many restaurants, or spend time in the water watching the many many fish swim around you! We personally didn\'t snorkel here, but lots were.  You can rent gear right on the beach.  \nThe prices in the restaurants were very comparable, but high.  If you like beer, you\'re in luck... 30 pesos each.  But, if you are like me and enjoy anything but, you\'ll pay about 100 pesos for 1 mixed drink.  We did though see people bring their own coolers / towels etc, and just enjoy the beach without having to buy from one of the restaurants.

561055491.name: Magnificent snorkeling
561055491.author: a TripAdvisor user
561055491.reviewBody: Some of the best snorkeling I have done and I have been to many places in Mexico and the Caribbean. Angels, Butterfly, Damsel, Surgeonfish, Moorish Idols, Trumpetfish, Rainbow fish and the list goes on and on.

560531754.name: Great snorkeling
560531754.author: a TripAdvisor user
560531754.reviewBody: This is a great snorkeling beach close to Santa Cruz. The swimming area is roped off and very large, very safe. Boats and jet skis are kept away from the swimming and snorkeling. We have gone out snorkeling with a dive boat to other bays, but Entrega was as good or better. Come early in the day: most people seem to arrive at one or two pm, though even then there is plenty of room to accommodate. Gear rental is available as are floating toys and a few paddle boats. Highly recommended.

560444032.name: Calm busy beach
560444032.author: a TripAdvisor user
560444032.reviewBody: This is a busy place. Action starts in the parking lot. You will be approached by someone wanting to take you to one of the five restaurants on the sand. As you follow you see the beach and water is sectioned between water craft and swimming. The  east facing bay is sheltered and very calm for swimming and snorkeling. There is equipment rental with snorkel etc and floaties. The restaurants have similar offerings and similar prices. Attached are some 2018 prices. This is a beach suitable for all ages. There are beach bathrooms and showers for a fee and the restaurants have facilities. La Entrega is a 60 Peso taxi ride from Centro.

560440897.name: Nice beach and snorkeling
560440897.author: a TripAdvisor user
560440897.reviewBody: The restaurants were ok some only sell wine by the bottle. Snorkeling was good some nice drop off areas with lots of different fish to view.

559929766.name: Decent Snorkeling
559929766.author: a TripAdvisor user
559929766.reviewBody: We arrived by boat but it would have been just as easy to take a land taxi to get to this nice beach. It was full of locals and lined with restaurants where you could just sit and relax. We came specifically for the snorkeling, and there were plenty of fish to see here. There is a place to rent snorkel gear if you don\'t have it. The water is crystal clear and visibility was excellent on the day we went.  It was a nice little excursion from our resort.

559697194.name: Amazing
559697194.author: a TripAdvisor user
559697194.reviewBody: Long Beach with amazing snorkeling and really felt like we were in true Mexico, mainly locals hanging here

559196619.name: Great beach
559196619.author: a TripAdvisor user
559196619.reviewBody: This is a tranquil beach for snorkling and water sports. Family beach with lots of restaurants or bring ur own lunch and grab a table and chairs. We really enjoyed our day. Arrive by water taxi or land taxi.

558898699.name: Good snorkelling....
558898699.author: a TripAdvisor user
558898699.reviewBody: ....better than our visit last year....we went along the rocks at the very far end of the beach, but this time we also swam out along the buoy line on the right hand side of the beach and saw more big fish.  Was overwhelmingly Mexican families the day we were there which was both excellent and festive.

558682595.name: My Favourite Beach!
558682595.author: a TripAdvisor user
558682595.reviewBody: The water here is so beautiful.  Many restaurants here. Lots of families. My only warning is be careful if you get a table from the restaurants.  We were keeping track of our bill and the man charged us 160 pesos more than we ordered. I didn\u2019t say anything to him but I would not return to his restaurant. Go here and enjoy the beauty of nature.

558334448.name: very nice beach
558334448.author: a TripAdvisor user
558334448.reviewBody: You can get here by taxi  . Lot of Mexican families and wonderfull  swimming . Lots of places to eat and drink .

557956851.name: Nice afternoon
557956851.author: a TripAdvisor user
557956851.reviewBody: Get a table by the beach and you\u2019re set for the day. We rented snorkel gear for $100P/day. The beach has coarse sand and it\u2019s VERY rocky under the water so not great for kids unless they\u2019re into water sports. $70 for a cab from Santa Cruz.

557827592.name: Clear water
557827592.author: a TripAdvisor user
557827592.reviewBody: $3 cab ride from Sant Cruz.  Beautiful beach, lots of restaurants to sit in the shade and have lunch etc.  No problem getting a cab back.

557769315.name: Great Snorkeling
557769315.author: a TripAdvisor user
557769315.reviewBody: We were able to walk to this beach, and did so at least 5 times, during our stay.  The snorkeling is amazing, even just walking in right from the beach.  We always went to Rey del Mar restaurant, were we had a favorite waiter, and the grilled fish filet was excellent.

557641326.name: Fun beach, great snorkelling and people watching!
557641326.author: a TripAdvisor user
