557641326.reviewBody: Our research on the trip advisor forums initially lead us to believe that this may not be a great beach experience due to large crowds...several reviewers gave this beach mediocre reviews because of the overcrowding.  As a result, we held off on going to Entrega for the first several days of our two-week stay in Huatulco.  However, when we eventually went, we were pleasantly surprised.  Yes, the beach is quite busy (especially in the afternoon and on a Saturday). However, the beach is large enough to accommodate the crowds.  We did not feel at all overwhelmed by people and we were able to relax and enjoy the day.  We brought our own beach umbrella and chairs and there were plenty of open spaces on the beach to find a comfortable spot.  There were a lot of Mexican families with children enjoying the beach which was nice - it was a friendly, family-oriented crowd and made for great people-watching!  The water is especially warm and clear at Entrega and the snorkelling is excellent.  There are plenty of restaurant options on the beach.  There are also public washrooms available if you do not use the restaurants (although small fee of 5 pesos to use the public washrooms).  We came back to Entrega again on another day because we enjoyed ourselves so much.

556194627.name: Good snorkelling
556194627.author: a TripAdvisor user
556194627.reviewBody: Very busy with shop owners trying to pull you in but the snorkelling is great with a little reef and a small cave

555739042.name: Beautiful Beach
555739042.author: a TripAdvisor user
555739042.reviewBody: Great beach for snorkeling and for little kids. Also, nice restaurants and great service!\nMake sure you bring your snorkeling equipment. If you don\'t have it they will have some for rent.

554855258.name: Our favorite snorkel spot
554855258.author: a TripAdvisor user
554855258.reviewBody: Playa Entrega is high on the tourist trail for a good reason.It has a long sandy beach, nice areas to snorkel, swim or play in the sand. Restaurants and restrooms. \nThe snorkeling is easy with lots of different fishes to see, some of the bottom is rocky and some of it is old coral plates (not living). The snorkel / swim area is roped of from the skidoo and boats making it pretty safe. Do bring your own gear or rental are available. Easy and inexpensive taxi ride from Tanolunda.

554470885.name: Beautiful beach !
554470885.author: a TripAdvisor user
554470885.reviewBody: A beautiful beach with its amazing colors and fish but many people, I ate pineapple stuffed with shrimp, I do not remember the name of the restaurant but it is the first, this dish is very tasty and I recommend it

553878829.name: Great snorkelling if you go early
553878829.author: a TripAdvisor user
553878829.reviewBody: One of the better places to snorkel right off the beach, on the left side near rocks and reef. However, this place is ridiculously busy - all the tour companies come here to pick up equipment and the beach is packed with boats and swimmers. We came at 9am and had great snorkelling, lots of varieties of fish. But by noon, the water is packed and gets murkier due to all the activity. Bring your own water, as all food and drink here is pretty pricey. And only get shade if you bring it yourself or sit at a restaurant, which are all pricey for what they are. Locker rental available, but if you are only leaving towels and clothes at the beach while you swim or snorkel it should be fine to do without. \nBut don\u2019t let crowds deter you, it is worth a visit. Easy to find a taxi to and from here, and easy walking from the parking lot.

552983344.name: Real Easy To Do
552983344.author: a TripAdvisor user
552983344.reviewBody: Went to Entrega twice.  First went by boat. 800 pesos (less than $42), the posted rate on the rate board at the marina in Santa Cruz.  Pleasant pretty short ride around to the next bay.  Boat dropped me off in the sand and came back when I wanted and picked me up.  Guy met me at beach when boat dropped me off and boat captain said this guy would take care of me.  He took me to snorkel shack and fitted me with gear.  Good mask, ok fins, and cheap snorkel. Worked just fine. They had lockers if you wanted to rent but I just left my stuff in the chair.  They said it would be fine and it was. 100 pesos, less than $6 for all day!  Great snorkeling.  Very calm and huge growths of coral not far from beach. You could just float above coral beds and watch the fish. Lots of color - fish and coral.  Not as much variety as Hawaii but much easier to do and much better than Cozumel.  The second time I went it was by taxi.  Short ride about $10 each way. Plenty of taxis to bring you back.  Taxi dropped off at beach walk and same guy from beach was there to take me to snorkel shack.  This was by far the easier and cheaper route. Water was little more choppy near shore and tide was active.  Still, when I got away from beach activity water was clear and same very good snorkeling experience. If you are traveling with non snorkelers this bay is ideal. Go in the morning and be back and ready to hit it with them before lunch.  They also have these sled like things with built in masks so non swimmers can snorkel and included in the regular rental is a life vest.

552607178.name: Sorry about my rating. We walked down to the beach and we walked right back.
552607178.author: a TripAdvisor user
552607178.reviewBody: We found this too small, to shady and too crowded.\nWe didn:t even stop for a drink because the beach wasn\'t inviting.

550535680.name: Playa Entrega
550535680.author: a TripAdvisor user
550535680.reviewBody: Nice beach with lots of restaurants.  Good snorkeling on the left side of the beach.  Sand is soft and sandy bottom for swimming.  Lots of restaurants for shade.  Don\u2019t need to pay to sit at them.

550300154.name: loved the snorkelling
550300154.author: a TripAdvisor user
550300154.reviewBody: I loved this beach for the snorkelling and little coral reef. We saw a lot of fish. Tony Lopez Lopez took us there and it was a great trip - I thoroughly recommend him!

549209162.name: Nice beach, great snorkeling
549209162.author: a TripAdvisor user
549209162.reviewBody: Lots of restaurants- sadly one ripped off my company today. \nIt\'s a nice beach with lots of locals. Good snorkelling along the rocks.

548760547.name: Lovely local beach
548760547.author: a TripAdvisor user
548760547.reviewBody: Lovely, laid back beach, mostly locals.  Several shaded restaurants side by side.  Really great swimming, snorkeling.  Cab ride is 60 pesos from Villablanca Hotel.  The musician strolling the beach was a comical nightmare.  He stopped by our table; I  requested a Spanish standard.  He played half the tune completely butchering it, then demanded (in a very surly manner) double the pesos I offered, and left, snarling "Gracias" over his shoulder.   A few minutes later he was nodding under a tree.  Truly memorable.  The next musician that showed up was very good.  But yes, the beach...always a must-do when in Huatulco.

548421897.name: great place for lunch
548421897.author: a TripAdvisor user
548421897.reviewBody: Very safe place to stop and eat with beachfront views. Many excursions stop there. Food is safe to eat and the the prawns 4X4 is awesome

548287998.name: Fish fish and more fish
548287998.author: a TripAdvisor user
548287998.reviewBody: We spent a half day there. We took taxi from Santa Cruse for 60 Pesos and a water taxi back for 100 Pesos that is 50 each and well worth the extra. You need to fine Peppi who somewhere in the middle restaurant who took care of everything from the time we got there to when we left including calling for the water taxi. Beer is 30 Pesos and the food was good and reasonable.\nWe went snorkelling right off the beach and it was great. This is where the tours drop you off. But be warned by 1:00 pm it is time to leave as it becomes very busy.

548224196.name: La entegra
548224196.author: a TripAdvisor user
548224196.reviewBody: This is a true gem. Pristine natural beauty. A short cab ride or hike from secrets huatulco resort. Finer sand easy walking. Who would think a beach like this is accessible, virtually free of people, scenic and wonderfully relaxing. Take your camera, swim suit and a towel. If you can hike the hill to cliff lookout its an amazing view above the buzzards.

545836780.name: Nice beach
545836780.author: a TripAdvisor user
545836780.reviewBody: This beach was only 10 min walk from Las Palmas. Beautiful beach with white sand. Did some snorkeling. Lots of locals go here.  There are a few places to eat on the beach, drinks were pricy. We were harassed by beach venders a lot so only stayed for a bit. You do have to leave by 4ish or you will get eaten by bugs.

545764607.name: Will rival some of the best beaches on the planet!
545764607.author: a TripAdvisor user
545764607.reviewBody: You must visit Playa la Entraga - it will leave you breathless with spectacular beach, calm water, 4 - 5 different colours of blue, excellent snorkelling, coral reef, caves etc.

545540049.name: A great beach!
545540049.author: a TripAdvisor user
545540049.reviewBody: Taxi fare from Santa Cruz. 43 Peso (3 dollars) to Playa Entrega. Popular with locals and tourists, you will find lots of places to have a meal, friendly staff and a great swimming/smorkling beach.

545078515.name: Good snorkelling off the beach
545078515.author: a TripAdvisor user
545078515.reviewBody: Typical Mexican beach located close the Santa Cruz.  Palapas offering shade, drinks and food.  Vendors can be a bit over the top but it\'s not a big deal.

544035349.name: Great day away
544035349.author: a TripAdvisor user
544035349.reviewBody: Great place to spend some time snorkeling . A nice beach with great restaurants. The snorkeling is very good. Only a short taxi ride from town or resorts.

544025207.name: Awesome
544025207.author: a TripAdvisor user
544025207.reviewBody: Great for snorkel, quiet beach super clean lovely \nIt\u2019s not expensive, perfect for little kids, family \nThe local people so kind I even made some friends there

542994847.name: Great place to snorkel
542994847.author: a TripAdvisor user
542994847.reviewBody: Spent a few hours at Playa Entrega - great place to snorkel. Easy to get to by cab. Popular spot for the locals and boat tours so go early as it gets really busy in the afternoon!

535662348.name: Best beach
535662348.author: a TripAdvisor user
535662348.reviewBody: Playa Entrega is the better beach close to Crucecita. 10 minutes taxi drive/60 pesos\nMany beach restaurants w different price levels. \nThe beach is ideal for swimming, water is clean. Showers available against payment

535449045.name: Entrega beach
535449045.author: a TripAdvisor user
535449045.reviewBody: It\'s a Nice Beach to practice de snorkeling, the Place is sometimes busy a little crowded. But it\'s amazing place to visit with you family. If you have a chance go and enjoy it are you can take a taxi with Genaro tour guide 9581003973 he can take you different places if you want.

533588136.name: From here to 2 surgeries
533588136.author: a TripAdvisor user
533588136.reviewBody:
The only time I ate out of my Barcelona hotel was on Playa Agus tin after stopping at Playa Entreat. I particularly was on the Macho Ferry. Unlike Puerto Valletta island causes, these people are boring and  plain out to get your money mandatory dump you. There was no pride or appreciation for the tourist that feeds their children.
They promised 7 stops. All vendors do. But you a real stopping over one mile from shore far away from the pcture distance. The narrator is blabbing away as to what we were looking at. We Never stopped anywhere, except in Playa Entrega a miserable 45 minute snorkeling stop, if it rained the night before do not go. They will haunt you down for pictures at $5 EACH. The underwater one also. There isn't  any beer on board. Just semi  cold water and soda. I have paid 100 each or more in excursions. It's the stinginess and predatory practices of all involved.
Now for dessert
In Playa Agus tin the boat has a mafia arrangements and headed us to one restaurant called Lunch you Mar,  I think. We could not set anywhere else, I felt like prisoners to Alcatraz. Here the unintelligent restaurant personnel did not want to accept our dollars!,! They were offended by America money and discounted it 20%!! The vendors are the worst in Mexico. Or planet. 

The restaurant lacked hygiene and I thought that a few germs like the one I intake in street tacos and grounded red worm hamburgers at the star or arches in the US will not kill Me! It almost did. When I got to hotel, II could not hold a beer down. Food barely. There hardly any clean water on the island and you can  touch or smell the germs,
 Since I was on last day of the 6 day trip,  when I got home I had two stoma have infections. One caused my removal of gall bladder. Had temperature of 105 in hospital bed. The other procedure unplugged my Bile sacks and cleaned them.
Yes it's unfair to say that they were the culprit. But the probability are very high. This is 2nd day home, after learning to crawl again to the stool and walk again with a family member in each arm. I thank God For my life and that minus one organ, I can hug my family.

If you want this trip do not eat there, your choice. When they cut my stomach muscles and spliced 4 places in my abdomen, is very traumatic, Just sharing. Eat if you want, the hospitals never turn down money.

533588114.name: Ask for Rafa!
533588114.author: a TripAdvisor user
533588114.reviewBody: I have a 2 years kid and we have our doubts about the snorkeling tour. At the beginning she was scared but Rafa managed to calm her and the end she didn\'t want to go back :)\nBeach is much better for families than the ones in Tangolunda. This one is like a giant pool, with clear and calm water.

524383898.name: If you want authenticity- go somewhere else.
524383898.author: a TripAdvisor user
524383898.reviewBody: Honestly, the fact this beach has such a high ranking on TripAdvisor must mean most people are idiots.   No seriously, if you came to this beach and thought "wow- I really like it here" you should just consider vacationing at Taco Bell in Long Island. \n\nThe amount of hagglers trying to bring you to their restaurant or sell you things here is insane.  We had to leave within minutes.  There are like 1,000 other nice beaches around with good food.  Go to those instead, this place is meant for mouth-breathers.

516472289.name: Fun
516472289.author: a TripAdvisor user
516472289.reviewBody: You can see the reefs as son as your boat comes into this beach there\'s is a lot of colorful fishes here

513730424.name: Great day on beach
513730424.author: a TripAdvisor user
513730424.reviewBody: Spent a fun day here with kids. Rented snorkeling equipment. Lots of restaurants to choose from & sit at a table all day. Great snorkeling, v safe for kids. Restaurant owners all a bit pushy for your business. A real locals beach. Fun to people watch.

504754739.name: Best beach in the Huatulco area
504754739.author: a TripAdvisor user
504754739.reviewBody: After checking out a couple of the other more popular and easily accessible beaches in Huatulco, La Entrega is definitely the best. Just find yourself a nice beachfront palapa restaurant, buy some drinks and enjoy the whole day by the beach.

503599529.name: Nice place
503599529.author: a TripAdvisor user
503599529.reviewBody: Nice beach and a great place to do snorkel, food is at a decent price and some is really good. There was some regular weather but the location of the bay protects you from the waves.

501464035.name: Nice calm bay for an afternoon with the family
501464035.author: a TripAdvisor user
501464035.reviewBody: We stopped at one of the cafes and ordered soft drinks. This secured a table on which to store our belongings while we swam in the calm bay. \nYou can rent snorkel equipment if you like but it looked like the coral was dead or dying. There were a few fish but they were not very plentiful.

494834583.name: Nice beach with great views
494834583.author: a TripAdvisor user
494834583.reviewBody: Entrega beach is about 10 -15 min taxi drive from the town center.  There are places to stop along the way that offer awesome views of the ocean from the cliffiside - consider stopping at the lighthouse - great place for pictures. We went to Entrega beach June 2017 on a weekday in the early evening. There were still quite a few locals there - my understanding this is the "locals" beach. We walked along the beach and noticed the great view of the surrounding bay and the water was clearer here than other beaches we saw (Las Brisas hotel in Tangolunda). Overall we wish we had gone during the day to experience the snorkeling - we were told there is a cave you can snorkel to.

490340628.name: Snorkling
490340628.author: a TripAdvisor user
490340628.reviewBody: Beautifull fish, nice corral reef. Some plastic bags in the water though. But once through this, it was really nice.

489238976.name: Great snorkelling!
489238976.author: a TripAdvisor user
489238976.reviewBody: Crowded beach during peak times... like Mexican Spring Break (; but we loved the calm waters, snorkelling and authentic local experience. Saw a variety of fish to the left where the rock outcropping and coral is. Enjoyed a nice cerveza at one of the many restaurants on the beach.

489171489.name: A wonderful place
489171489.author: a TripAdvisor user
489171489.reviewBody: This is our second visit but the first for our kids. They were able to rent some snorkel gear for a few dollars (about 225 pesos) for three kids. They got great views of corral and fish and loved the experience! Food there at the many beach restaurants has always been tasty and reasonably priced.

486340367.name: Nice boat ride.....snorkelling not so good
486340367.author: a TripAdvisor user
486340367.reviewBody: I took a tour from my cruise expecting some good snorkelling and a nice quiet beach. I was disappointed both times. The reef is in bad shape.....the coral is just brown and looking poor. There are few fish. The beach on the other is full of palm-covered huts selling beer etc. Lots of noise and LOTS of people....mainly locals and families I think. It was a public holiday so perhaps I was unlucky but that made no difference to the state of the reef.

481742981.name: Great for snorkelling
481742981.author: a TripAdvisor user
481742981.reviewBody:
I went here to snorkel and it was really easy: rent some gear from one of the places on the beach (or bring your own), then walk right into the water and start swimming toward the rocks to the left. There are corals close to shore and the water is clear and warm. Saw some colourful fish and took many underwater pictures. There is even a little alcove you can swim into. Just don't swim too close to the coral!

I took a taxi from La Crucecita and it was pretty cheap (forgot how much). Some guys approached me as soon as I arrived, selling "snorkelling tours," but I found these to be unnecessary. Since I was travelling solo, I chose a rental place (on the far left side of the beach) with lockers to stash my clothes for a small extra fee.

I was there on a statutory holiday in Mexico, so the beach was packed, but I was advised by locals that mornings are usually not very busy.

480225727.name: Nice Spot
480225727.author: a TripAdvisor user
480225727.reviewBody: Our group of 14 stopped here as part of a boat tour. We were able to enjoy snorkelling and time in the water. It was early in the day so it was relatively empty. Perfect for relaxing.

477180581.name: A Favorite Spot
477180581.author: a TripAdvisor user
477180581.reviewBody: For a mear 40 pesos from our hotel, Villablanco, we took a taxis ride here a few times to enjoy the beach and snorkel. You can take your out lunch and refreshments or by from many vendors. Loved the beach and the locals and their families.

477124192.name: Too Many Tourists
477124192.author: a TripAdvisor user
477124192.reviewBody: Our mistake, visiting this beach over Easter holidays.  Could not move there were so many people.  Recommend going during off season.

475957886.name: Nice spot, too full, similar to Acapulco day in the beach.
475957886.author: a TripAdvisor user
475957886.reviewBody: The image of the beach would be completely beautiful as long as the tons of restaurants on the sand had at least nice music. Very bad karaoke & the beach can be dirty just because of the amount of people. The history of the beach is in fact outstanding once its name comes from one of the more sad moments of Mexican story where Vicente Guerrero was captured & let to die in that very beach.

475776288.name: Gorgeous setting
475776288.author: a TripAdvisor user
475776288.reviewBody: This beach is amazing for snorkeling, eating and having a fun time. We sat at the front of the Entrega Restaurant and the service was impeccable, the beer was cold and the food excellent, what more could one ask for while in paradise. When visiting Huatulco you must try this spot, it is absolutely breathtaking.\nGo, GO, GO

474332418.name: Snorkelling day
474332418.author: a TripAdvisor user
474332418.reviewBody: Awesome spot!  Calm water and good smirking. Had a wonderful afternoon. Try the shrimp in a half pineapple. To die for!

473673465.name: Nice Beach to Hang and Snorkel
473673465.author: a TripAdvisor user
473673465.reviewBody: We came here as part of a snorkeling excursion with Oaxaca Expediciones.  Go during the week when it is less crowded, and you can reserve a table at one of the restaurants for the whole day.  Snorkeling is fun as the bay is protected from the dramatic Pacific surf, and the fish are plentiful and varied.  Great relaxing way to spend an afternoon or the whole day!

473054184.name: Nice beach ok snorkelling.
473054184.author: a TripAdvisor user
473054184.reviewBody: We spent a day here as our first Huatulco snorkelling location.  We enjoyed it, but we enjoyed San Augustin more.  It\'s easy to get to from down (70 pesos I think?) making it very accessible without a ton of hassle.  \n\nGet there before 10 to avoid some of the crowds and find your spot.

471511453.name: Nice Beach but...
471511453.author: a TripAdvisor user
471511453.reviewBody: Two visits this time around, one on a week day quiet and not crowded and on a weekend which was packed. The snorkelling is not as good and appears to be the result of too many visitors. Packed restaurants offering decent seafood. Easy to get to from Santa Cruz, La Crucecita or the AI resorts.

471510373.name: Enjoyed the day here
471510373.author: a TripAdvisor user
471510373.reviewBody:
Flagged a Taxi (for 60)... Brought us to his good "amigos" place for best service and fresh seafood. *Smirk* We didn't mind as we read the reviews and heard about the chaos. So he drove us to the back door, we walked in, dropped our stuff, no harasement.  snorkled for an hour or so ( i wore a wetsuit top- and i needed it! Chilly!) And it was lovely- all types of fish & sea cucumbers etc!!  .. Back to our table in the middle of the resto chaos  ( name: C-something Lindo - has a lobster for the "C") and ordered ( beer- 30; guacamole-80, small water-15) relaxed... went back for more snorkle-fun but windy and waves picked up by 2pm and visibility was low( not a surprise).  Then Ordered beer &  coconut shrimp (250 maybe) and it was AMAZING- felt like they just caught the shrimped and shredded some coconut and lightly tossed it( I don't like deep fried food). I was surprised as the reviews say the food is bad here. (We didn't order the margaritas as they were 150...At this joint)

There was construction :( so lots of noise. the vendors were not a bother, we just said no gracias with a smile and they left politely.

Same taxi picked us up ( amigo called his amigo) 

Only thing that was sad- they need signs up to educate people about protecting our oceans. Or the tour guides need to educate their customers. There were tons of people standing on the coral with their kids... killing it. Doubt this bay's coral will be there by 2020. Too bad.

470734920.name: great Mexican experience
470734920.author: a TripAdvisor user
470734920.reviewBody: soft sand and clear water that you can see right to the bottom.\nlots of colourful fish. the water is warm and it is calm , good for snorkelling

470024490.name: vendors for everything
470024490.author: a TripAdvisor user
470024490.reviewBody:
We spent the afternoon here yesterday.
The people trying to get you into their restaurant are far more annoying than what I would term the vendors. We were swooped upon immediately when opening the taxi door to lead us to a certain restaurant. All looked to be much the same with umbrellas and chairs and tables, more seating further back under a palapa. roof. Prices are higher here than in town for a similar type of place, but you are paying for the privelege of shade on the beach.
Vendors come by even into the restaurant sellng everything, food included which we found a bit odd but the locals seem to buy from them so it must be what is done. Really quite an entertainment to watch.
The beach is a very fine sand and the water is warm, clear and calm.
The taxi fare from town was 60 pesos, standard rate. A marguerita ranged from 90 to 150 pesos.
Very few shade trees and the beach is quite busy

469874521.name: Cheap food/drinks - great snorkeling from beach.
469874521.author: a TripAdvisor user
469874521.reviewBody: Hung out on this beach a couple days.  $1.50 cab ride to/from La Crucecita.  Many beach restaurants with free chairs/umbrellas if you buy something.  $1 beers , $5 meals.  Great big calm snorkeling area roped off from boats.  Go on weekdays to avoid weekend throngs of locals & tours.

469180996.name: Beach volley vendors
469180996.author: a TripAdvisor user
469180996.reviewBody: Beautiful location and water and only a short walk from the Las Palmas resort in Huatulco. Amenities there were plentiful with some very good food, snorkeling and views abound. Only reason I rated 3 stars was due to the amount of vendors who approached us trying to sell their wares. We were there approximately 4 hours and were approached 53 times by vendors, which only served to lessen our experience. Vendors on the way into/out the area would enhance this side trip immensely. We couldn\'t hold a conversation for more than 10 minutes without being interrupted.

468669587.name: Best beach for going in calm water.
468669587.author: a TripAdvisor user
468669587.reviewBody: Smaller remote beach, lots of vendors, but plenty of beer and food available at reasonable costs. Water was calm and not too deep for kids. Would visit again.

468428346.name: Playa Entrega
468428346.author: a TripAdvisor user
468428346.reviewBody: One of the better locations to snorkel in the bays of Huatulco.  Keep along the rocks on the left side of the bay.  Well protected so usually quite calm.  Lots of fish.  Tons of restaurants along the beach with a variety of seafood and drinks.  Worth the trip if you love to snorkel.

468408355.name: Exploring
468408355.author: a TripAdvisor user
468408355.reviewBody: Nice clean beach, good for snorqueling, great food on the beach.  $70 pesos by taxi, chairs and umbrellas free with purchase of drinks or food.

468118098.name: Calm Waters
468118098.author: a TripAdvisor user
468118098.reviewBody: Nice beach for a day of snorkelling.  It\'s only a 10 minute (60 peso) taxi ride from Santa Cruz Huatulco.   Lots of restaurant selections that include beach umbrellas. Just watch your bill if you choose to eat/drink at one of the restaurants.  We were charged more than the posted menu pricing. Some of these places will include a tip on the bill.\nWater was calm both days we visited.  Visibility in the water was pretty good with a good variety of fish.\nReally busy on Sundays.  Seemed like half of Huatulco was swimming there. Week days are much quieter.

467955134.name: Great snorkeling.
467955134.author: a TripAdvisor user
467955134.reviewBody: The snorkeling was amazing.  Be sure to bring your underwater camera.  The food was mediocre (cannot remember the name of the restaurant).

467893901.name: Seven bay tour stop
467893901.author: a TripAdvisor user
467893901.reviewBody: We stopped here for lunch during the seven bay tour. Nice beach. A few people as it was a Sunday but not over crowded. Food was very good, the place was pre-arranged for the tour. Note, they have a 5 peso fee to use the bathroom facilities so have change. We took the boat back to the marina but some took a taxi from the beach.

467029108.name: Beautiful beach!!
467029108.author: a TripAdvisor user
467029108.reviewBody: This is a beautiful beach a short cab ride away from La Crucecita or Santa Cruz, Huatulco. Snorkelling here is wonderful and there\'s even a cave to explore! Lots of restaurants to choose from and a nice beach to walk on.

466939162.name: Great local beach for swimming and enjoying a beverage
466939162.author: a TripAdvisor user
466939162.reviewBody: The beach where all the locals go! Good for swimming and snorkelling and enjoying food and drinks. Look for Leonardo\'s restaurant- great guy, the best guac on the beach and delicious margs and pina coladas with cinnamon.

466166622.name: Great for kids and snorkelling
466166622.author: a TripAdvisor user
466166622.reviewBody: I went there with my parents, husband and two kids (4 & 6). We had a wonderful day. The kids had a blast in the calm water. My husband enjoyed the snorkelling. Lots to see without having to go too far out. The food was a little more expensive than Santa Cruz and Menguey. Get there early to get a good spot (between 9 & 10).

464109438.name: great snorkeling place close to resorts
464109438.author: a TripAdvisor user
464109438.reviewBody: We got a cab for 100 pesos ( 5 dollars) from our Barcelo resort to a beautiful small bay. Very calm water lots of interesting fish to see just out from the shore.\n You can rent snorkel equipment or do a guided tour ( they take you into a cave too). It can be busy as it s so accessible but that did not bother us. Tour boats are also available. A great place.

464099461.name: Great snorkelling beach
464099461.author: a TripAdvisor user
464099461.reviewBody: We visited playa Entrega with our daughter, son-in-law and two grandchildren and had a very nice time. We were going to snorkel on our own but before we could do so we were approached by Willy who offered to take us for a very reasonable amount. We were glad he did as he showed us where the best snorkelling was. The beach was very nice as was the restaurant. If you get the chance visit Entrega. You won\'t be sorry.

463903254.name: Not  very good food and constant stream of people trying to sell stuff.
463903254.author: a TripAdvisor user
463903254.reviewBody: We stopped here on the 7 bays tour and directed to one restaurant.  I thought the food was expensive,  greasy and not very good. There must have been 12 - 15 people trying to sell us stuff throughout lunch. Crowded with many tourist boats. We were there 2 hours which was way too long.

463896170.name: poplar snorkel spot
463896170.author: a TripAdvisor user
463896170.reviewBody: i went here about 8 years ago and there was only a dive shop and 1 restaurant. Now the dive shop is still there but the entire beach from one end to the other is full a dining. My gues is about 15 small restaurants, all on the sand. Snorkeling is great, a little cloudy water on our visit but a nice variety of fish coral and rock formations. Alot of people there but the area for snorkeling is large so you can still be by yourself to explore

463278229.name: one week holiday
463278229.author: a TripAdvisor user
463278229.reviewBody: We stayed at Park Royal. We traveled by taxi to Playa Entrega for not very many pesos. We thoroughly enjoyed our experience there. We had a lovely lunch on the beach at one of the restaurants. We rented snorkel equipment and loved seeing the fishes

463048423.name: Snorkelling and a great beach
463048423.author: a TripAdvisor user
463048423.reviewBody: We did a 7 bays tour for snorkelling and stopped at Bahia Entrega first. It was the best snorkelling all day and you can get there by car. In fact I recommend taking a taxi there instead of a boat tour. You can rent snorkelling gear and get food and drinks at many restaurants. We didn\'t eat there but it looked and smelled good. \n\nA perfect way to spend the day. Go early though, because lots of locals come later morning and early afternoon.

461537024.name: Great beach for spending a day
461537024.author: a TripAdvisor user
461537024.reviewBody: Good for swimming, snorkeling, eating, drinking and just being a part of the local culture.  Enjoyable to watch the multi-generation families interact with such respect and caring.

460784140.name: Not our favorite
460784140.author: a TripAdvisor user
460784140.reviewBody: Tour boats disgorge hoards of fun seekers after their outings and they disperse to one of the many restaurants, mostly indistinguishable from each other as they all meld together along the beach. About a quarter of the beach is cordoned off for the boats. Not many swim as the sand only goes out a little way then there\'s coral. Beach vendors ply the customers in the restaurants offering jewelry, carvings, knick knacks, trumpet music, guitar music, having your picture taken with an iguana, etc. \nwhen we got out of our taxi we were escorted to a restaurant were we were told we could leave our stuff while we went swimming and they would watch it for us. While nothing went missing there was no-one obviously watching except for the tables of nationals around. Food was unexceptional, drinks were good and the bill grew up really fast.

460055403.name: beautiful beach
460055403.author: a TripAdvisor user
460055403.reviewBody: A nice day trip for anyone. The food and activities are great and you can have a full body massage for around $25 canadian. Beautiful water.

459405809.name: excellent
459405809.author: a TripAdvisor user
459405809.reviewBody: great beach lots of energy,food was great and more than reasonable! Snorkelling was awesome, very accessible, had a great time here!

458897720.name: So beautiful!
458897720.author: a TripAdvisor user
458897720.reviewBody:
Spent a Saturday at La Entraga.  Upon arrival, the beach was very quiet but by noon it was full of tourists and locals enjoying the day.
Lots of activities if you are so inclined....banana boat, snorkelling tours, swimming or just lounging.  Some vendors are set up at the entrace, but no one is bothering you to buy.  A taxi from Santa Cruz was only 60 pesos.
The water is so clear and clean.  
This was our 2nd visit to Entraga and wont' be our last.

458695926.name: Best snorkelling!
458695926.author: a TripAdvisor user
458695926.reviewBody: had many fun days on this beach, swimming with big schools of fish, and following a sea turtle! felt like an underwater oasis! and it was great place to try out my mermaid tail! i think i surprised a few snorkellers! lol

457858199.name: Great Beach!!!  Can and does get busy.
457858199.author: a TripAdvisor user
457858199.reviewBody: Great beach area with good water access and plenty of places to stroll the beach.  Good place to eat right on the beach.

457438090.name: Beautiful beach
457438090.author: a TripAdvisor user
457438090.reviewBody: Went to the "7 beach " boat tour and saw if from the water and wanted to go back  Short cab ride from Huatulco hotels.  Many beach side restaurants, mostly crowded with Mexican tourists.  Taxi driver tried to hustle us into one where he surely got a commission.  We walked out and up the beach to one that was a lot less crowded..  Picked a table in the shade and went snorkeling.  Great visibility in the water and few of the Mexican visitors went far from the beach so we were pretty much along on the rocks to the left of the beach (facing the water) Had lunch after we got back.  No problem getting a taxi back to hotel at cab stand.

456782750.name: Beach
456782750.author: a TripAdvisor user
456782750.reviewBody: $4 cab ride to the beach from the pier. Calm, tranquil Bay, with plenty of colorful fish to see, immediately of the beach (best: left side near rocks).

456540917.name: Short visit to Playa Entrega
456540917.author: a TripAdvisor user
456540917.reviewBody: While staying at Santa Cruz we took a taxi to Playa Entrega one afternoon.   Taxi driver was great.  Stopped at the lighthouse for pictures of the coast.  Arranged a time for a return ride. Beach was very busy.  More or less have to use one of the restaurants as a home base.  Water got deep quite quickly.   Was okay but there are better beaches in the area.

455466097.name: Snorkel Heaven
455466097.author: a TripAdvisor user
455466097.reviewBody: Nice soft sand...lots of places to dine and all let you sit all day under an umbrella if you forgot your beach chair.  Excellent coral reef and snorkelling.

454977511.name: Snorkelers delight.
454977511.author: a TripAdvisor user
454977511.reviewBody: Playa Entertainment is just a 60 pesos taxi ride from town. It offers excellent swimming\nAnd snorkelling.reasonably priced food and drink is also available. There are also\nLockers for your valuables. A worthwhilele day trip.

454810575.name: Way over rated
454810575.author: a TripAdvisor user
454810575.reviewBody: Snorkeling a big disappointment. Beach over crowded. Restaurants high pressure. No beach chairs or umbrellas. Only seating @ restaurant tables. Not worth the effort. Food better @ Santa Cruz harbor.

454461143.name: Good But Busy Beach
454461143.author: a TripAdvisor user
454461143.reviewBody:
This is a very popular beach in the Huatulco area especially with Mexican tourists, which we loved!
Great place to sit on the beach and enjoy some food and drink at one of the many beachfront restaurants.
It is good for snorkeling but Arrocito and Violen are better.
Around the rocks there is a cool little open cave my kids liked as well as another small beach.

454121617.name: Lunch
454121617.author: a TripAdvisor user
454121617.reviewBody: Beach eating slightly expensive for the beach. But they have a captive audience, beer cheap  food very,good.

454032556.name: First snorkelling adventure
454032556.author: a TripAdvisor user
454032556.reviewBody: This bay is great if you are a novice snorkeler. Even locals seem to be learning to snorkel in their life jackets so I didn\'t feel out of place. Great fish to be seen below the blue green ocean. I recommend this beach both for swimming and snorkelling.

453999895.name: Busy But Lovely
453999895.author: a TripAdvisor user
453999895.reviewBody: We stopped here for lunch as part of an ATV excursion. The swimming area is excellent with calm, warm waters...there\'s a snorkeling area as well and you can rent equipment on site. Lots of colorful fish that swim right up to you. There are also several restaurants serving up great food.  We were here on a Sunday and it clearly was a family day for the locals. What fun to see everyone enjoying themselves! There\'s easy access from the parking lot and just quick walk along a paved sidewalk to get directly onto the beach,.

453347826.name: Fun in the Sun
453347826.author: a TripAdvisor user
453347826.reviewBody: Sightseeing the area in Huatulco brought us to this charming busy beach area. Lots of places to eat authentic Mexican food/drinks.

452863824.name: Great beach
452863824.author: a TripAdvisor user
452863824.reviewBody: Must visit.  Great snorkeling. Worth the 60 peso cab ride. Food is a bit pricey in comparison to town but still cheap.

452380603.name: Steps off the boat
452380603.author: a TripAdvisor user
452380603.reviewBody: For cruise travelers very close to port. Very crowded beach with tourists and locals alike. Plenty of shopping nearby. Extremely limited bathroom facilities.

451801595.name: Just keep walking
451801595.author: a TripAdvisor user
451801595.reviewBody: Such a beautiful beach with good snorkelling and lots of activities to try.   \n\nWe were swarmed when getting out of the taxi to come and visit the restaurants.  I am very used to this, but it\'s. It the norm in huatulco.  We had to just sit in the sand for a while just to get our bearings and relax. Other then that this beach is beautiful with about 5 or 6 restaurants.  You can rent snorkel gear here for $75 peso and there are lockers at the very end that you can store your things on.

451343061.name: Easy To Get To For A Different Beach Experience & Novice Snorkelling
451343061.author: a TripAdvisor user
451343061.reviewBody: While staying at the Binniguenda Resort, we took a 1/2 day outing to Entrega Beach, just a 60 peso taxi ride ($4.00 Canadian), short drive away.  This beach, especially on weekdays, is a terrific spot for "beginner snorkelers" as the entry is easy, right off the sandy beach, and the designated swimming/snorkelling area is roped off for the safety of all.  Restaurants will compete for your business, offering beach chairs and tables (your choice of in the shade or out in the sunshine) and staff to watch your personal items while you\'re in the water - just purchase a few Coronas and/or chips & salsa or a full meal from the numerous menus on offer.  Public restrooms are available (5 pesos) and the approx. 200 meter wide sandy beach is ideal for people watching or just hanging out with locals.  Boats are available to tow the children (and adults) on the inflatable  "yellow banana tubes" and the water is calm and visibility generally clear for swimming and snorkelling.  To the left of the bay there are rocky formations where reef fish and whatnot can be enjoyed with little effort.  Of course this is always some trinket on offer as well as clothing, massages and everything associated with the beach including life jackets, inflatable float toys, sunscreen, etc. and mask and fins are rented all day for 75 pesos ($5.00 Canadian).  Enjoy.

450827081.name: Clearest ocean water in the Oaxacan coast.
450827081.author: a TripAdvisor user
450827081.reviewBody: Very calm and safe, great to swim long distance at ease, tons of colorful fish, very pleasant beach.

450568981.name: Playa entegra , ni
450568981.author: a TripAdvisor user
450568981.reviewBody: Nice snorkeling , nice vendors. Little get away with the locals. not far from Barcelo. 10 min. very nice beach, could swim out far\n

450208856.name: Super busy
450208856.author: a TripAdvisor user
450208856.reviewBody: Nice beach! Restaurants have seafood and are all the same set up! Lots of traveling vendors! It\'s more hussle bustle than other places in the area!

450081097.name: One of our favorite beaches to visit
450081097.author: a TripAdvisor user
450081097.reviewBody: Great place to snorkel and relax. Can get very busy. Lots of beach restaurants to chose from. I would recommend.

448397488.name: Wow!!
448397488.author: a TripAdvisor user
448397488.reviewBody: Lots of energy and people. If you like a full beach with lots to do / eat you will like it here. Jeremy took us on a snorkel tour and we had a blast!

448389574.name: Great snokeling
448389574.author: a TripAdvisor user
448389574.reviewBody: Playa Entrega is one of my favorite bays in Huatulco. The snorkeling is good , water is calm and the palapas are great to get out of the sun and get a good bite to eat.

446793890.name: Beautiful cove and beach
446793890.author: a TripAdvisor user
446793890.reviewBody: Get there early and hold your seat  we took a cab there 60 pesos  it was a beautiful day food and drink we picked out one of the restaurant and had ocean front chairs several drinks full lunch it was cheap then we took a water taxi back

445434844.name: Awesome!
445434844.author: a TripAdvisor user
445434844.reviewBody: Beautiful beach, just outside of Santa Cruz.  Very calm waters, sheltered, great for snorkelling.  Just drop a piece of bread and see all the fish that come.  Lots of small restaurants.

445021050.name: Amazing views and great snorkeling.
445021050.author: a TripAdvisor user
445021050.reviewBody:
Mostly locals and not that crowded. 
The palapas are free, just have a drink or something. 
Snorkeling is great with awesome visibility and many fishes.

444538695.name: Nice beach with calmer water
444538695.author: a TripAdvisor user
444538695.reviewBody: Nice beach with many little restaurants and bars along it so there is no problem getting shade or a drink or food.  The water is quite calm and you can rent snorkeling gear, boards with windows in them to lay on and see the fish, sea doos to rent, banana boat, etc.  It is only a few minutes in a cab away from the Barcelo/Dreams resorts area.  The staff at the restaurants will call a cab for you once you are ready to leave.

442717681.name: Snorkeling is great here
442717681.author: a TripAdvisor user
442717681.reviewBody: Great snorkeling, calm and fairly clear. Best left side of beach. Reasonable prices for drinks and food.

439823120.name: Very Good Snorkeling Beach
439823120.author: a TripAdvisor user
439823120.reviewBody: Playa Entrega is a great beach to snorkel from. Very popular with the locals so best bet is to arrive early. Rental snorkeling equipment availabe. You can also rent lockers at the end of the beach. well worth the cab ride

439760557.name: Awesome snorkelling
439760557.author: a TripAdvisor user
439760557.reviewBody: We purchased a private boat tour/snorkelling trip off the beach with Rolando and his son. These guys are the best! Super friendly and super honest...lots of laughs. Toured the beach on the way to the bay where we had about 90 minutes of fabulous snorkelling. After leaving the bay, they took us a little further out into the ocean where we did see a small pod of dolphins and a sea turtle. If your planning to do this, look for Rolando on the beach

437949388.name: Beautiful Beach
437949388.author: a TripAdvisor user
437949388.reviewBody: Good snorkelling in crystal clear water. Beach was quiet but got busier later in day, as was expected since it was a holiday weekend here in Mexico. There were the usual hustlers trying to entice you into their palapas, but that\'s typical most places in Mexico, and they weren\'t overly pushy. Beautiful spot.

437948673.name: Be aware of people trying to rip you off!
437948673.author: a TripAdvisor user
437948673.reviewBody: The beach it\'s self is beautiful but we were ripped of by the restaurant workers over billing us for drinks and umbrella rental!

433739407.name: sun and fun
433739407.author: a TripAdvisor user
433739407.reviewBody: great beach, snokeling, safe, great food,taxi ride away 50pesos not 10minutes.....will go back again in 2017

432275140.name: Crystal clear water
432275140.author: a TripAdvisor user
432275140.reviewBody: Lot of the beaches in Huatualco have large waves, the water hear is super smooth and crystal clear. Bring your snorkeling gear or don\'t and rent them from one of the shops.

429275843.name: Heaven,y gorgeous
429275843.author: a TripAdvisor user
429275843.reviewBody: Great Beach, small bay, good fresh sea food, nice people, clean simple restaurantes, very polit\u00e9 and friendly.

417528446.name: Near town wonderful snorkel place
417528446.author: a TripAdvisor user
417528446.reviewBody: It was a great and nice sorprise having this neat beach so close to the Tangolunda Hotels area. The taxi ride was about 110 pesos, and the water is clear and there is enough fish to wath (even a sardine school passed by).

417301847.name: Best place to snorkel
417301847.author: a TripAdvisor user
417301847.reviewBody: We had a great time at Playa Entrega. The snorkeling here is very good. The beach is fabulous for families with young children. I definitely recommend it for all ages \n\nWe will return here

415036874.name: beautiful
415036874.author: a TripAdvisor user
415036874.reviewBody: the sand is delicious to touch, the beach is like a big pool hehe. very nice and friendly people, DELICIOUS FOOD!

408928845.name: Nice beach but way too crowded
408928845.author: a TripAdvisor user
408928845.reviewBody: The beach seemed nice and we went with friends that had been there many times. They all said it was the most crowded they had ever seen. We ate at the beach and could enjoy the view and sounds of the ocean, at least in between songs. \nThere did not appear to be good places to keep your "stuff" on the beach. Basically what my friends do, they just eat at a particular restaurant and leave all their belongings, cell phones and all, in their chairs and/or table and depend on the workers to watch their stuff. It was more relaxing for me to stay at the table. \nWater and beach seemed clean, people seemed very nice and there is also good snorkeling there.

404614155.name: Great swinmming
404614155.author: a TripAdvisor user
404614155.reviewBody: The clear, blue water is comfortably temperate and super calm, making for excellent swimming conditions :)

403699121.name: Great Snorkel
403699121.author: a TripAdvisor user
403699121.reviewBody: If you want an authentic Mexican beach with great food and great snorkelling this is the one. Easy to get to and a really unique spot.

400836512.name: Very packed and boats near by.
400836512.author: a TripAdvisor user
400836512.reviewBody: We went here because we heard it was the best beach to relax in, I was not a fan of it. There is a lot of people and the boats are just floating around where people are swimming. Not to mention the harassment you get when getting to the beach. There is a lot of people trying to sell scuba tours or different kind of tours, some just take no for an answer and harass to the point where they just annoy you. The water was some what clear, but if you are looking for clear waters like cancun this is not the place.

397605745.name: One of the best beaches in Huatulco!
397605745.author: a TripAdvisor user
397605745.reviewBody: Visited with boys under ten and this was a great visit for them and for the adults. Soft sand, warm water, service under a palapa with finger licking seafood and cold beers were are part of the experience! Loved it all!

391726768.name: beautiful beach
391726768.author: a TripAdvisor user
391726768.reviewBody: This was one of the beaches that I stopped at during a tour of the 9  bahias. We went snorkeling here. There were some pretty cool fish and the guide let us feed some fish and hold some corral. There is a cave that you can go into that has some bats. Be very careful when you are going in and coming out. The tide is very strong so you must be a strong swimmer. You will get knocked around a bit in there if the tide is very strong at the time.

390861692.name: the best public bay
390861692.author: a TripAdvisor user
390861692.reviewBody: This is a public bay but one of the best in water related, the water is clear and calm excellent for family and, since is public do not expect a space for you, but definitive is something to visit and have ex lent restaurants and not really expensive

385665487.name: Snorkeling and beach fun
385665487.author: a TripAdvisor user
385665487.reviewBody:
We spent a few hours at Playa Entrega on our recent trip to Huatulco. The beach is very nice and doesn't have the undertoe that we had at our resort (Dreams). The kids enjoyed swimming and playing. The snorkeling was ok. We saw lots of fish, but not a huge variety. Pretty coral, but you have to work hard not to touch it as it is very shallow in parts. It was our kids first time to snorkel and they did great. A great starter place as the water is calm and you don't have to fight the current too much. 

Tip:  Unless you are planning on eating there, Just take your stuff down to the beach instead of leaving it at a table in one of the restaurants so you don't feel obligated to order a lot of stuff from the menu. Prices seemed a little high since it supposed to be more of a 'locals' hangout.

384570405.name: Beautiful Beach! And Paddle Boards Too!
384570405.author: a TripAdvisor user
384570405.reviewBody:
We arrived late morning on a Monday. Not very busy yet, and our taxi driver dropped us off behind Restaurant La Entrega which avoids the vendor/restaurant guy gauntlet. A few vendors will approach you at the restaurant but mostly leave you alone after they have come by to give their sell. You're in Mexico after all, they are just trying to make a living, be polite and pleasant and you'll receive the same.

Playa Entrega is calm enough to have paddle boards. Facing the water, go to the second shop from the end, ask for the paddle boards, they were not outside. Not sure if they have really caught on here like elsewhere. Our teens had a blast on them.

All the food we ordered was good, great service and they took visa. Prices were higher than in town but typical of most of the beaches. The restrooms at the restaurant were clean.

The restaurant called our taxi for us and he picked us up in back.

384114297.name: Good snorkeling, pushy vendors.
384114297.author: a TripAdvisor user
384114297.reviewBody: Since I love snorkeling and I was told this was the best spot in the area my husband and I visited this place. We came early-ish (9am) and that was a good idea because it was getting busy and hot when we left. On the way to the beach we were approached by at least 5 vendors trying to get us to eat at their restaurant or rent their snorkel gear (we were carrying our own). It is the low season for tourism so I suppose they were desperate for business. The rocky area off the beach has some nice coral and pretty schools of fish and the water is quite calm. It\'s worth a visit if you are in the area. There are no hotels on the beach so you have to take a taxi in (60 pesos from la Crucecita).\nAlso, there are lots of people who try to sell you tours but it\'s not really necessary. You can easily rent a snorkel and mask and enter the water on your own. it\'s clearly marked by bouys and is calm.

383248052.name: Pleasant beach with palapa facilities - OK for swimming - not surfing
383248052.author: a TripAdvisor user
383248052.reviewBody: Beach is not large - but clean and offers low-slope entry to water so little surge and safe for paddlers or weak swimmers. \nFacilites include several palapa restaurants and snorkel rental operation which guides folks in groups over the reefs in the bay.\nWe snacked at Entrega Restaurant recommended by our cab-driver and were satisfied with nachos and guacomole, with fried platanos for dessert.

382316755.name: Good spot to snorkel.
382316755.author: a TripAdvisor user
382316755.reviewBody: I\'ve been to this beach at least 5 times. It\'s only a 10 minutes taxi driver from the Crucecita square.  If you didn\'t bring snorkel gear there is a caba\u00f1a at the far end of the beach where they rent snorkel gear for the day for 50 pesos ($3usd+/-).  They also rent swimming boards with windows.  The vendors can be pushy.  But the reef is great.  Many colorful box fish, puffer fish, and wrens, among other beautiful fish.  The restaurants on the beach are OK, but a little questionable.  This is a great spot for midday fun.

378755380.name: Good snorkeling
378755380.author: a TripAdvisor user
378755380.reviewBody: This beach was very close to Las Palmas Resort where we were staying. I wanted to snorkel as much as possible and had seen that this beach mentioned in other posts about good snorkel locations near Huatulco. It was a perfect spot to go straight in from the water to snorkel. Lots of fish. Good to go early before the crowds hit and before big sea creatures get scared away. Restaurants with plenty of food and alcohol. Snorkel rental available there on beach. Mostly Mexican tourists when we went. Tons of people selling oysters, souvenirs, fruits and seeds, hair braiding, spa treatments and boat rides/tours. That part was really annoying after about the 12th time we were approached to buy something.

366437725.name: Go early!
366437725.author: a TripAdvisor user
366437725.reviewBody: Fantastic place to go snorkeling.  Many places to eat and drink there.  Great place to go and soak up some sun and enjoy the beauty of the area.

366225414.name: World class snorkeling
366225414.author: a TripAdvisor user
366225414.reviewBody: I\'ve snorkeled at many places around the world and this is one of the best I\'ve experienced.  Great visibility, calm waters, lots of varieties and quantities of fish and very colorful coral.  Also a small cave that you can swim into.

365522530.name: Textiles factory a must!!
365522530.author: a TripAdvisor user
365522530.reviewBody: Bought some beautiful tablecloths, napkins and placemats at awesome prices.  We also got to watch the guys at work on the looms.  Really cool to watch.

364737786.name: snorkeling and shrimp
364737786.author: a TripAdvisor user
364737786.reviewBody: good snorkeling and very good shrimp on the beach dosnt get much better than this great service and  awesome setting

364483151.name: Good for a visit and grab some food
364483151.author: a TripAdvisor user
364483151.reviewBody: Not lots of parking, good maybe 10 restaurants, not many space in the water for a busy day, good service around.

363311993.name: Terrific Snorkelling Right off the Beach
363311993.author: a TripAdvisor user
363311993.reviewBody: This beach is the most popular in the region so it can be crowded however it is worth it. There are lots of beach restaurants that will watch your stuff while you are swimming if you order from them. The beach is sandy and clean and a short swim away is a lovely reef with a huge variety of fish. There are no currents so it\'s a safe, lovely snorkell. Take the 80 peso taxi ride as there is very limited parking. For the history buffs, the War of Independence hero, Vicente Guerrero, was betrayed and captured by the Spanish, hence the name of the beach. He was later hung near Oaxaca City.

361337780.name: Food and Fun.
361337780.author: a TripAdvisor user
361337780.reviewBody:
We were on a private boat tour and our guide Tony Lopez brought us here to snorkel and to have lunch 

The snorkelling is on the left hand side of the beach abdwasvery decent. Lots of colourful coral and decent fish. After an hour of snorkelling we dried off and at one of the many restaurants on the beach.  Food was good and the beers were cold. The food was more expensive than I thought it should be but no complaints as you are eating on the beach with a stunning view of theocracy and bay. 

The swimming is very good as the bay is calm. It's an awesome spot. I can see it getting crowded on weekends.

359187786.name: Beautiful beach, super snorkeling
359187786.author: a TripAdvisor user
359187786.reviewBody: Quiet beautiful beach on a weekday with crystal clear water. Snorkeling is great just wading out from the beach.  The reef is full of colorful fish and I got some great photos because of the clean shallow water. There are restaurants along the beach and a public bathroom and a place to rent snorkel gear if you don\'t have your own.

359120955.name: Snorkeling was amazing
359120955.author: a TripAdvisor user
359120955.reviewBody: Spent a day on this beautiful beach. I loved that there were so many local families there. Made it feel less tourist and more local. Water was amazingly blue, food and service were excellent...what an awesome place.

357780106.name: Very nice swimming beach
357780106.author: a TripAdvisor user
357780106.reviewBody: We thoroughly enjoyed this lovely calm beach, great for swimming and snorkeling.  downside is it gets extremely crowded  on weekends.  Lots of locals and families.  Reef was pretty dead, but it was fun to swim around and check out what remained.

357593314.name: Very busy beach
357593314.author: a TripAdvisor user
357593314.reviewBody: We went to this beach during the week on a excursion and had a fabulous time. Not many people on the beach however on the weekend there seemed to be a population explosion with the locals. Great beach, good food.

356523409.name: Fun beach
356523409.author: a TripAdvisor user
356523409.reviewBody: This is a nice, sheltered beach. Lots going on but it is completely "mobbed out" at the weekends with "locals." Which speaks for the appeal of the beach!\nGreat beach for snorkelling. The reef around 100 yards offshore is dead. However their are plenty of fish to see. The restaurants will let you park your stuff their and take shade if you eat. Worth visiting.

356221360.name: Nice little beach
356221360.author: a TripAdvisor user
356221360.reviewBody:
Great spot go early and lock in a deal to go snorkelling or boat tour on the various bays in the area. 

I got my son and I a guided 1hr snorkelling your for $300 pesos that included all the gear and the guide.
We could use the gear for a couple hours afterwards too which was great.

See Alberto at La Entrega restaurant and grab a Table and relax. Order some drinks and beers and food and don't worry they take credit cards which helps.

A boat tour should cost about $600 pesos that's what I was able to get it down to but I was there early before everyone arrived and was much more enjoyable.

Great for little children and plenty of room.

Enjoy!

355658099.name: Calm Beach
355658099.author: a TripAdvisor user
355658099.reviewBody: This is a  public beach with calm clear water, corral reefs good  for snorkelling. There are local restaurants with ok washrooms We arranged for our taxi to drop us off and retrieve us after 3 hours, our driver arranged for a a beach front restaurant so we were not pursued by restaurant reps and locals offering snorkelling excursions as we had our own equipment. We ordered the usual guacamole, salsa, bottled water and beer.  Clean beach and clear water, not too busy when we arrived though it got very busy later in the afternoon prior to us leaving. Go early to enjoy the beach without the crowd. On your way back  from La Entrega we stopped at a  lookout point with a lighthouse that offers a spectacular view of the Santa Cruz bay. \n\n

355621968.name: This surely was a beautiful beach some time ago, but has lost enchantment.
355621968.author: a TripAdvisor user
355621968.reviewBody: La Entrega is one of the blue chips of the Huatulco area. It\'s always good to go for a fair beach experience. However the hard coral reef about a 100 feet of the shore is basically dead - and it has been that way probably a decade or so. Still if you are into snorkelling, this is a good beach to start off and you will definitely get to see fishes. \nThe restaurants are typical and haven\'t changed since I\'ve first visited the beach 15 years ago. That doesn\'t mean that they are bad, but for the prices they charge they should consider improving or changing the menu (physically and the dishes), cutlery, plates, cups etc. . I find it not very appealing when the plastic layer peels of a plate. Waiters like to add the tip to the bill, which is for you to decide if you pay that extra money if you are not happy with the service. The earlier you get there, the clearer the water will be.

355427400.name: Great Beach
355427400.author: a TripAdvisor user
355427400.reviewBody: Great snorkeling, beach, local restaurants and sun with cervasses.\nArrive around 930am, and watch everyone else show up, even the locals,,,

354804162.name: Lovely hidden beach with great snorkeling!
354804162.author: a TripAdvisor user
354804162.reviewBody: This is a fabulous public beach with calm, if not placid water and corral reefs which lends to great snorkeling. There are no hotels here, but plenty of restaurants with washrooms, but no wifi--so this is a perfect place to disconnect for a while. If you take a taxi, I suggest asking your driver to retrieve you at a specified time later in the day; he may even make you a deal since you\'re giving him two fares. Once you arrive, expect to be hounded by restaurant reps and fellows offering snorkeling excursions, but don\'t be intimidated. Pick the one who is friendliest to you because you\'ll want a restaurant with a canopy where you can relax and set down your belongings. Our guy said (and was true to his promise) that the does not charge rent for his space and offers safety and security while you\'re his guest. If you step away to the beach, he keeps an eye on your stuff--again he was true to his word. All he asked is that we order a little food/beverage and a little tip which was a small price to pay as he not only oriented us to the beach and its offerings, but gave us a secure private corner and hooked us up with a snorkeling guide and someone else who rents the equipment. Our guide charged $200 pesos and took us out into the water, showed us and taught us about different fishes; he even took us into a cavern which was really, really cool. The beach and the water are very clean. Once you\'ve swum or walked out on the beach, enjoy a drink or some lunch at your table, but do expect vendors to come around with jewelry and other assorted artwork. Some of their goods are very nice, but do not hesitate to barter. You may even propose half of their initial prices and be surprised with the bargain to be attained, especially if you buy a quantity of goods. On your way to or from La Entrega, there are a couple of look-out points. Make sure you ask your driver to take you to El Bufadero which is a beach geyser of sorts--which you will not see unless you\'re in a boat in the water. Although you will not see the geyser, this lookout point has a lighthouse and offers a spectacular view of the sunset if you can make it around that time. If you\'re going or coming from La Entrega, most drivers will not mind stopping here for a moment while you take a few pictures. Enjoy!

354601332.name: Beautiful beach with Excellent Snorkelling
354601332.author: a TripAdvisor user
354601332.reviewBody:
I didnt visit any of the other beaches in the Huatulco area so I cannot make comparisons but we found Playa Entraga very enjoyable. Its only 5 minutes and 60 Pesos from the cetre of Santa Cruz. The beach is not large but easily accomodates even weekend crowds without it getting too cramped. The snorkelling area is well roped off from the boating area. Fish can be viewed almost from the shoreline but become much more prolific and colorful as your approach the reef which is just a few swimming srokes from shore. The rocks on the north side of the bay accomodate a lot of fish also but the waves there can be a bit treacherous for the less robust swimmer.  The coral is quite healthy throughout the reef area .
Once you approach the beach area you will be quickly enlisted to sit at one of the many beach restaurants. This generally includes a table, as many chairs as you need, and an umbrella. For short stays , the price of a few drinks is probably all you will be charged. We stayed for 5 hours or more on each visit and had to pay a "cover charge" of about 100 pesos.It wasnt made apparent up front but was a small price to pay for the day at such a nice beach.
Police patrol the beach and proide a good sense of securtty for you and your belongings.
Drinks at the beach run about $2 for beer and fresh juices. Lunch selections of fresh seafood run from $10 to $20 generally.
There were infrequest souvenir sellers but they were pleasant, almost shy, and never persistent.
We came on a Sunday when the beach was mostly populated by local folk. Generally these were families with small children who were very well behved, and it added very positively to our exerience. 
Taxis are readily available for the return trips to the hotel and no one ever tried to charge more than the proper rate.

354421932.name: Fun place to spend an afternoon!!
354421932.author: a TripAdvisor user
354421932.reviewBody: We had a great time here snorkeling, eating, and drinking!  Our taxi driver brought us to his friends restaurant.  There are a bunch of different restaurants with tables that you can sit at as long as you order something.  All of our stuff seemed safe, though we didn\'t bring much.  We were able to rent snorkeling equipment and go out and enjoyed seeing all the fish in the coral reefs.  You can hire a guide if you want.  Lots of fun!

354186809.name: Best Shrimp Ever!!
354186809.author: a TripAdvisor user
354186809.reviewBody: Really enjoyed our day trip to Play la entrega.  We swam, drank Coronas and had amazing Shrimp platter - 4x4 which has 4 flavours of shrimp and they were fantastic!

353415841.name: ... great time and food was excellent
353415841.author: a TripAdvisor user
353415841.reviewBody: we rented snorkeling equipment and went out a few times around the coastline. Food and drinks were excellent. Highly recommend this place.

353117115.name: walked a thousand beaches and then found this place, paradise
353117115.author: a TripAdvisor user
353117115.reviewBody: spend the cab fare, worth the trip. sit under the restaurant shade for the price of a couple of drinks and lunch. nice snorkling

352916221.name: A day on the beach
352916221.author: a TripAdvisor user
352916221.reviewBody: Anyone who has been here knows how it starts, we were looked after the usual way, good service, cold beer and the food was well prepared. No complaints.

352749226.name: Super clear waters.
352749226.author: a TripAdvisor user
352749226.reviewBody: Great for snorkeling. Lost of multicolored fish. Locals will rent snorkeling equipment, bote rides and other activities. Literally no waves, good for sbildren to swim in.

352411520.name: Piece of Paradise
352411520.author: a TripAdvisor user
352411520.reviewBody:
Fabulous place to spend the day....
Safe...clean beach....
Ice cold Cervasa..
Served with a Smile and  Excellent food..

352192874.name: Best snorkelling of the trip....
352192874.author: a TripAdvisor user
352192874.reviewBody: ....go to your very far left and follow the rock line around to the smaller much more private beach....lots of fishies!  We were there on a weekend so that could have explained all the crowds.

351861260.name: great!
351861260.author: a TripAdvisor user
351861260.reviewBody: Great snorkeling, water was warm.  Sailing with Blade & Fele with Huatulco Sailing Company was amazing.

351351181.name: Great snorkeling
351351181.author: a TripAdvisor user
351351181.reviewBody: Don\'t miss the cave... look for it in the rocks on the left side of the beach when you snorkel toward the hidden cove.  A fun experience.  We saw huge schools of fish in the coral. Best snorkelling near Huatulco

350880400.name: Good place to snorkel, but busy on the weekends!
350880400.author: a TripAdvisor user
350880400.reviewBody: Entrega is a nice spot for snorkelling. Stow your things in one of the beachfront restaurants, and go for a swim/snorkel. The beach is sheltered, so unless the wind is from the East, it\'s generally very calm here. All of the beach front restaurants have the same basic menu, and all have cold drinks. We go to Restaurant Entrega to see Pepe, who has become a good friend over the years.

350844430.name: Beautiful beach...great snorkeling!
350844430.author: a TripAdvisor user
350844430.reviewBody: Great way to spend the day at Playa Entrega!  Turquoise water, gentle waves, lot of fish!  Restaurants line the beach. Love spending the weekend there with the locals.  Snorkel along the rocky shoreline and out over the huge coral heads.  Snorkel guides available if you want.  Musicians stroll the restaurants, vendors show their wares, a real taste of Mexico. Very relaxing!

350626468.name: Great Day Trip
350626468.author: a TripAdvisor user
350626468.reviewBody: We have visited La Entrega several times. Restaurant La Entrega is our favorite. Jose is a wonderful server. Beer is cold and the food good.\n\nWonderful snorkeling. Rental equipment and guides available.

350572981.name: Fun snorkling
350572981.author: a TripAdvisor user
350572981.reviewBody: When the winds have picked up and you need a calm shore this the place to go. From where you arrive head left as the further you go the calmer the waters are and the snorkeling is better. We sat at the Entrega restaurant but only drank so can\'t comment on the food.

350501234.name: Nice Beach, many tourists
350501234.author: a TripAdvisor user
350501234.reviewBody: It is very busy with lots of tourists, beach was nice until wind came up & we were sandblasted .Plenty of chairs & places to hang out, venders with icecream, food etc. Was nice but prefer quieter beach.

349705771.name: swin, sun, snorkel, & restos
349705771.author: a TripAdvisor user
349705771.reviewBody: Playa Entrega is close to Santa Cruz and easily accessible by Taxi.  The beach flat and water is calm, its very popular and good for all ages.  Plant your self at one of the many restos and use that as home base and you have clean bathroom facilities.  You can rent snorkeling equipment 70-75 pesos at the beach for entire day, and book a guide for 45min for approx. 140 pesos. There is plenty to see right off shore without a guide as the reef is right there with tons of fish.   Somedays there is boating opportunities, banana boats, kayak rides....  best part is that they are sectioned off from the swimmers.  Restos focus mostly on seafood and fish but feel free to purchase snacks from the beach vendors: flan, nuts, platans, ice cream, fresh oysters, etc.  We tried both Bogarts  & La Gloria restos a few times and booth are on par with each other ( I doubt if any of the restos vary much).  No Sun beds like at Mayguey but still very enjoyable.\n\n

349685802.name: Great place to chill for the day or snorkel. .
349685802.author: a TripAdvisor user
349685802.reviewBody: We spent 5 hours just sitting at one of the local restaurants. . Beer was 25 pesos and cold on a sunny day. . Snorkeling was fine..  not over exciting.. great place to escape an all inclusive. .

349538203.name: Snorkeling
349538203.author: a TripAdvisor user
349538203.reviewBody: We had a great afternoon snorkeling and visiting on the beautiful beach. People were friendly and I felt safe!

349434705.name: Great spot for snorkelling and ocean swimming
349434705.author: a TripAdvisor user
349434705.reviewBody:
Visited here for the day in early February.   Plenty of restaurants anxious for your money and willing to give you chairs for the day.  No beach chairs though.

The octopus and conch were excellent and Corona to wash it down for only 25 pesos.

Whole coconuts in the shell are also available and great for quenching your thirst that is unavoidable from the hot sun and salty air.  Wonderful place wish we had found it earlier on in our stay instead of the last day!

349195870.name: Crystal Clear
349195870.author: a TripAdvisor user
349195870.reviewBody: We were delighted with our visit to Playa La Entrega.  The water was crystal clear for snorkeling; we saw many different fish and even a turtle.  The beach was clean and gentle enough for children.  The people at the palappa restaurant we sat at were great about arranging tables and umbrellas for shade.  The parking lot seemed much better than the arrangements at Playa La Maguey.

348983955.name: Great beach
348983955.author: a TripAdvisor user
348983955.reviewBody: We visited Playa Entrega for the snorkeling.  This was the first beach that we visited and were intrigued by the restaurants that are lined up on the beach.  Basically, you buy a couple of drinks and some food, and the restaurant provides you with a table, chairs and umbrella for the day.  The snorkeling was good.

348935724.name: Skip the tour and snorkel here all day.
348935724.author: a TripAdvisor user
348935724.reviewBody: This is a great beach for all ages.  The sand and beach are clean and when we were there full of both tourists and locals enjoying the great beach and weather.  There are a number of cantina type restaurants on the beach.  There will be one the you will find and enjoy.  We had great food, and drinks with attentive service for our entire visit.  You can rent snorkel equipment and PFD if required.  I always pack my own along with a snorkel vest so I don\'t have to work to hard and can just float to rest while out for a snorkel.  The snorkeling is decent here.  Lots of coral and various types of fish to see.  The water is quite clear and it is easy to make your way around the bay to check out the marine life.  At the far end of the snorkel area there is a cave that is cool to check out and there is also a nice sand beach the you can rest on and catch some sun.  If you want to snorkel, skip the tour of the bays, jump in a cab for under 100 peso and spend the day at Playa La Entrega.  You won\'t be disappointed.

348548647.name: great little beach.
348548647.author: a TripAdvisor user
348548647.reviewBody: Took a $5 cab from town. It was a great day at the beach. Ate at one of the beach restaurants and hung out in the sand and sun. Did little snorkelling but water got a little too rough for me.

348334230.name: The best
348334230.author: a TripAdvisor user
348334230.reviewBody: This place has the best snorkling in all the bays 10 min taxi 54 peso from Hualtuco can get snacks and beer,washroom and snorkling gears all here spend the whole day if you wish it was so beautiful there\nWriting this just makes me want to go back right now!!!!!!!!

348064961.name: Love this Beach
348064961.author: a TripAdvisor user
348064961.reviewBody: Playa Entrega is a wonderful beach for all ages.  The snorkelling is fantastic with two very accessible reefs.  The water is very clear and the sand is soft and clean.  Many kids having fun building castles in the sand.  The water is calm enough for floatie toys, noodles, paddle boating, swimming and jumping in waves or just standing in the water. For the most part the water is pretty calm but there are some "windy" days but not a lot.  There are many restaurants to sit at and a places to rent snorkelling gear and life jackets.

347464183.name: Beautiful, But Pricey
347464183.author: a TripAdvisor user
347464183.reviewBody: Entrega is a beautiful beach area, that is very popular as it is easy to access. Quite often is very busy, and the restaurants are more expensive than other beaches

347439925.name: Restaurants and more restaurants
347439925.author: a TripAdvisor user
347439925.reviewBody: We stopped here for lunch and a bit of shopping.  There are guys with menus that approach you the second you get out of the taxi but they are respectful and if you just say No Gracios they will move on.  The little shopping they had here was not as good as La Crucecita but they may that we just didn\'t go far enough or explore very much.  It is nice to eat right on the beach but we didn\'t find this bay very clear or as clean as Tangolunda Bay.

347358819.name: BEAUTIFUL BEACH!
347358819.author: a TripAdvisor user
347358819.reviewBody: This is a beach located at five minutes by car or taxi from Huatulco.  You can also get to it by boat, it will take you about ten minutes.  I think this is the most beautiful beach of the zone.  The water is calmed with no waves, so makes it ideal for families with kids.  Water is crystal clear and turquoise color too.  No fee for entrance.  It has some rustic ranch shops with food to grab a bite, ideal for lunch.

347217760.name: Day at the beach
347217760.author: a TripAdvisor user
347217760.reviewBody: Take a cab from La Crucecita or your hotel...our hotel provided us towels.  Many restaurants to choose from...and waiters approach you as you enter area.  Choose the restaurant called La Entrega...mid way on the beach...plaid table cloths.  Garlic Fish delicious...stay at beach as long as you want.  Snorkel gear for rent at end of beach.  Nice swimming beach.

346711407.name: Sun,food,swimming
346711407.author: a TripAdvisor user
