346711407.reviewBody: This beach had 4 or 5 restaurants that you can go to and eat pretty  what you want at a fair price. Water sports we\'re available too. And the ocean was great for swimming

345163979.name: Amazing Snorkelling!
345163979.author: a TripAdvisor user
345163979.reviewBody: We stayed nearby in a small local hotel (Castillo) and spent time here snorkeling - loved it. Current is very strong - we are good swimmers but still got life vests (and a locker) from a beach vendor. Lots of fish life to see. Better than the snorkeling we did on a BAYS BOAT TOUR of the area!

344866479.name: Great place for beginner snorkelers.
344866479.author: a TripAdvisor user
344866479.reviewBody: The waves are low here so very easy to swim and snorkel here. You can rent equipment here or bring you own. If you rent or buy something in the restaurants they will watch your stuff for you. Seem to be  very honest.

343083874.name: Beautiful Beach, great snorkeling.
343083874.author: a TripAdvisor user
343083874.reviewBody: Stopped by for a couple of drinks at the beach, great service, a little pricey but overall great. Snorkeled last year and it was truly amazing.

342450824.name: Awesome morning beach
342450824.author: a TripAdvisor user
342450824.reviewBody: Before the crowds and the world wakes up on a calm morning this is an excellent swimming and snorkeling beach. Then have a cerveza or snack at one of the many beach palapas.

342328531.name: Beautiful beach for swimming and snorkeling
342328531.author: a TripAdvisor user
342328531.reviewBody: There are several local restaurants with umbrellas on the beach. Most restaurants prepare the food so it may take a while to get it. However, the whole purpose is to have fun in the beach. They have snorkeling services which you can get the equipment at your table. They also have boats departing from this beach to do a tour of the nine different bays. You can share the boat which is pretty affordable or rent it for private use. \n

342231247.name: Fun Spot to Hang Out with Locals
342231247.author: a TripAdvisor user
342231247.reviewBody: Playa Entrega was within walking distance of Las Palmas and we spend two days just hanging out on the beach. The water is quite calm and it\'s possible to walk out quite a ways from the beach. We did not snorkel, but everyone said it was amazing. You could rent complete snorkeling equipment for 75 pesos. Even wading in the shallow water brought a number of colorful fish right up to you. \nThere are a number of restaurants that border the beach. The staff can be very aggressive getting you to head to their establishment. You can sit in their chairs for an entire afternoon as long as you buy drinks/food occasionally. We were surprised by the number of people who left all of their possession at their tables while they went into the water. We talked to one of the waiters and he explained that part of their duty was to watch over your stuff while you are gone. Food was so so, but it was a great place to hang out. The beach is definitely PG, not nearly as risque as Tulum. Lots of families, lots of kids, but overall a great spot.

341964215.name: Not worth the stop
341964215.author: a TripAdvisor user
341964215.reviewBody: We did a boat tour of the bays. Stopped at 2 of them, 1 for snorkelling and entrega for lunch at our expense

341955958.name: Nice snorkelling
341955958.author: a TripAdvisor user
341955958.reviewBody: Snorkelling and privacy on the beach until about 2:00 pm and then quiet. We didn\'t go on the weekend and I bet it\'s busier then

341330455.name: Busy snorkeling but local favourite
341330455.author: a TripAdvisor user
341330455.reviewBody: Great little local food joints on the beach. Saw many canadians enjoying the beach along side the locals. You are able go take a taxi right to the entrance and a very short distance from resort area.

340763701.name: So perfect
340763701.author: a TripAdvisor user
340763701.reviewBody: We stopped in the bay on our bays tour and it was breath taking! So much to see and a very relaxing beach just make sure to you go early as it tends to fill up throughout the day. We were lucky to be the first small boat in and it was almost empty until it was time to leave.

340543265.name: Swim with the fish
340543265.author: a TripAdvisor user
340543265.reviewBody: Best snorkeling beach ! Lots of beach front restaurants on a protected bay beautiful views ! A must visit , A great place to spend the day !

340498792.name: Nice swimming Beach
340498792.author: a TripAdvisor user
340498792.reviewBody: Spent the day at this beach, had a lovely day.  Restaurants you can sit in the shade and spend the entire day if you wish.

339973867.name: Nice Beach & Snorkeling beach
339973867.author: a TripAdvisor user
339973867.reviewBody: Nice picture postcard beach, sand and has some decent snorkeling. You can rent snorkel gear for reasonable prices. No problem finding tables to sit at to eat. In fact too many tables and places to eat and vendors almost hound you to sit at their place is the main downfall (but typical of all local beaches). We like Playa Santa Cruz just as well and lot closer to our place. Same basics, but snorkeling bit less exciting. Nice though, lot quieter the day we were there. Nearby is small town center to walk around, buy water, etc. at local convenience stores, shops, and bonus a coffee shop right in the middle not far from beach at all. Coffee shop in middle of quaint small park and is below the small pavilion band stage. Nice.

337108138.name: Good for something nice and close to the city
337108138.author: a TripAdvisor user
337108138.reviewBody: The beach is nice but small relative to the amount of commercial activities it offers - lots of beach restaurants with plastic chairs and tables under a tent / tarps (very cramped) as well as sea doos, banana boat and chartered boats and other water activities.  I liked it because the beach was close to the city but it\'s very cramped esp during the holiday season - there was literally no room to even stand in the water without bumping into someone in the water.  While I understand it was the holiday season, I can still see that this beach being a bit too busy for my liking given the restaurants, vendors and water activities.

337057941.name: Good snorkeling! Rocky beach.
337057941.author: a TripAdvisor user
337057941.reviewBody:
The snorkeling here was good! We saw lots of different kinds of fish as the area to snorkel is large. 

The beach is small and can be crowded. Once in the water there are a lot of rocks/dead coral that make it hard to relax while standing in the water.

We ate at the "Bufadero" and our food was good and the service quick and friendly. Nothing was overly impressive but we were content.

For swimming, we would not return here. For snorkeling we recommend it!

335040512.name: Restaurants 4.5, Beach 3, Snorkel 3, Lots of Vendors
335040512.author: a TripAdvisor user
335040512.reviewBody:
The restaurants here are nicer than many of the other beaches, outside the upscale hotel areas. Many have nice large covered areas and things to eee like parrots, etc.

The beach is ok, it has some algae and can be crowded and cloudy at times.  The snorkel area along the rocky side is good, but not great.  They have banana rides, wave runners, other aquatic toys for rent.  The vendors are in your face a lot so be prepared to say No alot..or Yes if you want to try everything.

The walk down from parking to the beach could be a concern for the physically challenged...although I did see the locals carry a lady down in a chair, which was nice.

332173624.name: "Great Place to Snorkel"
332173624.author: a TripAdvisor user
332173624.reviewBody: When in Huatulco----try to take a boat tour or taxi to Playa Entrega. It is located near the marina and has beach restaurants and washroom facilities. The coral reef is loaded with fish. Many of the bay tour guides make a stope here.

330404103.name: Great swimming beach
330404103.author: a TripAdvisor user
330404103.reviewBody: Warm, calm waters.  Great for swimming and snorkeling.  Was there on a weekend so quite crowded with local families.

330177893.name: Felt like a fresh bone in a pack of dogs!
330177893.author: a TripAdvisor user
330177893.reviewBody: We took the taxi here from Crucecita ( 50 pesos).  From the time I opened the taxi door, I had no less than 4 people talking to us about where to sit.  Kept telling them, our first visit, wanted to walk around and see what all was there first.  When we hit the sand, it got worse.  No less than 6 people at us at once.  I hate that, and am very used to it, but usually when you say No Gracious, they go away, not here.\nNo loungers here at all.  The said it was because people were leaving cigarette butts and trash behind and it was floating back to the water, and the Government was worried about the coral reef.  Who knows.  Beautiful water and very very crowded.

329595470.name: Nice beach in to Snorkel
329595470.author: a TripAdvisor user
329595470.reviewBody: Lots of locals, a few authentic restaurants and you can rent snorkel gear. The cost is $150 pesos for 2 people.

329445785.name: Awesome
329445785.author: a TripAdvisor user
329445785.reviewBody: This bay is good for swimming and snorkeling. The restaurant at the far end takes visa/mastercard. This Bay also has lockers and rentals for snorkeling and sells beach toys. Food is good. Water is clear, I will  have to update pictures as I took many underwater.

328899676.name: Nice beach
328899676.author: a TripAdvisor user
328899676.reviewBody: Went fishing out of this beach and had a fun time.  The water is beautiful blue.  Went to another beach too and rode a bananna boat ride to playa Entrega and back.

326554321.name: Beautiful snorkeling !
326554321.author: a TripAdvisor user
326554321.reviewBody: Go early in the morning. Calm waters. Fantastic snorkeling. Friendly people all around. Do take the guide. Worth it.

324741220.name: Fun Beach!
324741220.author: a TripAdvisor user
324741220.reviewBody: Playa Entrega was a great beach for a swim and some delicious micheladas.  My hunsband and I really enjoyed our half day spent there.  The food was not the best we had in Huatulco but it was good.  The restaurant we ate at was able to give us a table at the very front by the beach and we could leave our things there while we swam.  It was a wonderful time sipping on some micheladas and enjoying the relaxing view!

318934213.name: Best seafood platter!
318934213.author: a TripAdvisor user
318934213.reviewBody: Beautiful beache; waters clear blue and cool. Perfect for the hot temps...yummy food, superb service!

314450133.name: Fabulous beach
314450133.author: a TripAdvisor user
314450133.reviewBody: This is a wonderful place to go on the Nine bay tour great beach and very good snorkling,very calm and easy place to swim.

314403160.name: Nice snorkeling but not aisolated beach
314403160.author: a TripAdvisor user
314403160.reviewBody: Very nice beach and snorkeling experience...but too many people offering services, restaurants, etc..

310578797.name: Snorkeling
310578797.author: a TripAdvisor user
310578797.reviewBody: Awesome snorkeling.......good restaurants. Very safe as the area is roped off, lost of fish and coral to see.

308603721.name: Good Beach, Great Snorkeling
308603721.author: a TripAdvisor user
308603721.reviewBody: Each Bay in Huatulco has it\'s pros and cons. This one had a great beach, plenty of restaurants, but I was most impressed by the great snorkeling. Plenty of fish and coral to see.

307303924.name: Very Nice Beach
307303924.author: a TripAdvisor user
307303924.reviewBody: It was an inexpensive taxi ride from our hotel, and we met friends at one of the beach side restaurants.  The beach itself is nice, sand is a bit coarse.  It was busy, but not super crowded.  There was a steady stream of people selling things, but they were not persistent.  We brought our own snorkel gear, but it is also available to rent.  The water was very clear and warm.  There were lots of small brown jellyfish in the water near shore, so we did have to be very careful swimming out; made me kind of nervous.  The coral was nice, lots of colourful fish.

303662023.name: Busy bay
303662023.author: a TripAdvisor user
303662023.reviewBody: The beach was busy and full of sale people. However, once you are in the water it is an amazing world waiting for you. It is a shame that tourist do not look after this wonderful place.

301908560.name: Calm, family friendly snorkeling beach.
301908560.author: a TripAdvisor user
301908560.reviewBody: Very family friendly beach with calm waters. There are lots of covered tables where you can sit for the day. You are expected to consume food and drinks there. It\'s worth it for sure since you can use their bathrooms and they can keep watch of your things (though you shouldn\'t trust them to be able to do a thorough job with all the people that will be walking by). Upon parking, ignore the men trying to get you to sit at their restaurant. You won\'t need their direction and they will try to work in a fee, directly or as a suggested amount on your restaurant bill. There is good snorkeling nearby and you can rent the gear if you need. There are several watercraft ride options from the beach as well. You have to arrive by taxi, a short and inexpensive ride in from La Crucecita or your hotel.

297413671.name: Nice day spent on the beach !
297413671.author: a TripAdvisor user
297413671.reviewBody: We had a great day at this Beach ! Was a short taxi drive from our hotel .  Enjoyed cocktails at one of the beach restaurants .

295468786.name: This is a great beach.
295468786.author: a TripAdvisor user
295468786.reviewBody: I arrived on my scooter and was escorted by a representative of a Bogart restaurant to a parking spot right by the restaurant. I enjoyed having a covered place top relax when I want floating in the clear waters. It\'s a fun place to spend the day.

292155093.name: Best snorkeling in Huatulco
292155093.author: a TripAdvisor user
292155093.reviewBody: We went snorkeling in several other bays, but most were poor visibility. Entrega seemed like a super crowded beach and at first glance seemed like a zoo, however, when you put your snorkel on and swam out to the coral, it was a whole \'nother world. The visibility was crystal clear and went on forever. The crowds seemed to stay within 10 feet from shore, so it wasn\'t crowded at all over the reefs. More fish there than I had seen in all of the other bays combined. Well worth fighting the crowds to see. I was out there for 2 hours and still didn\'t see everything.

289954804.name: lovely little snorkel spot
289954804.author: a TripAdvisor user
289954804.reviewBody: beautiful snorkeling.  a cheap cab ride from the resorts or you can take an intimate (<12ppl) excursion by boat

286937181.name: this bay looks like a huge pool
286937181.author: a TripAdvisor user
286937181.reviewBody: water is warm, no waves at all, 1 to 1.5 meter deep, relly incredible,\nthere are some restaurants, wher you can eat by the shore, bring your scuba diving equipment, mosquito repellent, towels, the sand is very hot, need to wear sandals

286764453.name: Beautiful
286764453.author: a TripAdvisor user
286764453.reviewBody: the beach is really pretty, it is very crowded and there are hundreds of vendors that are always selling you stuff. Be aware that as soon as you get out of vehicle the restaurant owners will try to get you to go to their restaurant and will say its free to sit with them with no obligation, but if you don\'t order food, they will charge you a fee for using the chairs.

286230736.name: Head to La Entrega
286230736.author: a TripAdvisor user
286230736.reviewBody: Great beach, have food and drinks at the Entrega  Restaurant, right in the middle on the beach. Cold beer, fresh seafood, and a busy beach, yet very manageable

280991557.name: Really nice beach.
280991557.author: a TripAdvisor user
280991557.reviewBody: This was my favorite beach for snorkeling and beach restaurants of the 36+ beaches in Huatulco. There is a nice reef with a good variety of sea life. The usual snorkel equipment rental is available as well as some of the rides and rentals.

280489368.name: Snorkeling in LA ENTREGA
280489368.author: a TripAdvisor user
280489368.reviewBody: This small bay is beautiful, it\'s has clear water and corral reef perfect for snorkeling. I had a great time here. Most importantly, this bay has history. Former Mexican President {Vicente Ram\u00f3n Guerrero Salda\u00f1a (Tixtla, Guerrero; 9 de agosto de 1782 - Cuil\u00e1pam, Oaxaca; 14 de febrero de 1831) fue un pol\u00edtico y militar mexicano, militante y jefe de la insurgencia en la etapa de Resistencia (1816-1821) de la guerra de Independencia de M\u00e9xico.} he was a key player for the Mexican Independence. He was betrayed and set up in exchange for 50k pesos. He was then turned over to his enemies at this bay. La ENTREGA translates to THE DELIVERY.

278594086.name: Busy beach
278594086.author: a TripAdvisor user
278594086.reviewBody: This was one of our beach repeats. Busy and still plenty of places to sit. Water is great.  Good snorkeling

273217640.name: Great for chilling at the beach and snorkeling
273217640.author: a TripAdvisor user
273217640.reviewBody: Spent a day at this beach went by boat but apparently you can also drive there somehow is the best beach to do snorkeling if you are learning the snorkeling area is safe no boats go in and the coral reef is really big can find all sorts of colourful fishes there\'s also a hidden underwater cave quite dangerous if you not a good swimmer. Totally worth it will definitely come back!

273083647.name: La Playa Entraga
273083647.author: a TripAdvisor user
273083647.reviewBody: A bit smelly, great place to snorkel though. Highly recommend Willy. Food was mediocre at best. I hear St. Augustine beach was much nicer.

272800552.name: Great Bay...
272800552.author: a TripAdvisor user
272800552.reviewBody: Went here for the day off a cruise ship.  Loved it.  Found a beach bar,  and they \'pushed\' a bit the food and drink. But enjoyed ourselves and did buy drinks and lunch.  Some of us did some snorkelling, rented from a local.  And they did see fish.  Lovely day out, would go here again.

267034003.name: Nice beach
267034003.author: a TripAdvisor user
267034003.reviewBody: Cheap to get to from Barcelo hotel and you can snorkel right from the beach and it is nice and easy if you want to get away from your hotel for a couple hours.

265524837.name: Fun snorkel tour - just the basics
265524837.author: a TripAdvisor user
265524837.reviewBody:
We booked a Speedy Snorkle tour via our Sunwing rep at the resort and enjoyed out day out.  We weren't a large group which was perfect for things not taking too long to get ready and snorkeling.  We were driven in an open air vehicle, no seat belts which was not something we were happy with especially with other vehicles passing on blind turns and hills around us and one large truck almost kissing the side of our vehicle when coming the opposite way towards us but taking up most of the road on a turn.  

The snorkeling is at a large public are in which much of the beach is taken up by restaurants, stores and others wanting and selling things.  The beach is also popular for locals and travellers alike.  

The equipment was in good shape and they had an area to lock your items up while in the water.  

The guide led is a round the reef area and pointed out the local fish.  We were in the water a good 90 minutes and saw quite a lot of fish.  It is sad to note however it is a dying reef, very brown, broken and bits of garbage strewn around.  The guide was very good about educating those in the group about using biodegradable sun lotions when going in the water and cleaning up after yourself.

263303431.name: Great Snorkelling!
263303431.author: a TripAdvisor user
263303431.reviewBody: From the Barcelo or Dreams you can take a $90 peso cab  Approx $9.00 CAD or $8.00 USD (one way) to Playa La Entrega and try out the snorkelling.  Beautiful reef right off the beach and the fish were amazing!  If you buy a couple beers and lunch you can store your gear at a table at one of many great restaurants.  You don\'t need to pay for a guided tour if you want to go snorkelling on a budget!

262783548.name: had fun
262783548.author: a TripAdvisor user
262783548.reviewBody: We spent a few hours here and went swimming only.  Didn\'t snorkel.  Beautiful warm water.  HOT!!!  So we had to go into the water numerous times.  The only thing I missed was lounge chairs and palaces.  Loved the authentic Mexican feel!

262487400.name: Snorkel site
262487400.author: a TripAdvisor user
262487400.reviewBody: Very good site for snorkelling. Went with Nexus Speedy Snorkel tour 1/2 day snorkelling tour. Guide was great and led us to great locations in the bay to view various species of fish.

262366286.name: packed restaurants - but snorkelling good
262366286.author: a TripAdvisor user
262366286.reviewBody: packed restaurants side by side, but lots of shade to watch familiy playing in the surf - but snorkelling good and able to rent stuff. 50 peso back to Santa Cruz

261139676.name: Crowded but an easy place to reach for snorkeling
261139676.author: a TripAdvisor user
261139676.reviewBody: The top of the beach is lined with restaurants side by side, but they are friendly places with reasonable food and drinks.\nBest if you take your own snorkeling gear as what\'s available for rent, while OK price-wise - isn\'t the greatest equipment

260284448.name: Entrega
260284448.author: a TripAdvisor user
260284448.reviewBody: Nice small calm beach to swim and snorkel.  The water is nice and clean.  You will get swarm by locals trying to sell something once you step out of the taxi.  5 pesos to use the bathroom or shower.  I didn\'t eat there but there are plenty of restaurants and places to rent snorkel gear.  We went on a week day so the beach was not crowded.\nBeware of the thimble size yellow jelly fish in the water.  I got rashes on my arms and legs shortly after snorkeling and swimming in Playa Entrega.  If you see tiny yellow jellyfishes get out of the water.  They won\'t stink you right away but the rash developed later on the day.

260271232.name: Great snorkling, lots of restaurants on the beach
260271232.author: a TripAdvisor user
260271232.reviewBody: A local beach that can get extremely  busy on the weekends because of the snorkling . Go mid week and not on holidays for the best experience. There is a bit of high pressure sales when you first arrive as many of the bay tours do leave from this location, plus people wanting you to eat at their resturant. This area is frequented By many people because it has a gentle surf which makes it more appealing to families. It is a place where it is great to watch families just having a great time on a  hot day. For a small fee you can have a Luke warm outside shower to rinse yourself off after a day at the beach ( it is to the back left area just before you enter the row of restaurants ) not fancy but wet and not salty

259641958.name: nice beach for snorkeling
259641958.author: a TripAdvisor user
259641958.reviewBody: This beach is a bit hidden and not so easy to find, but it\'s worth it. I went snorkling in the warm and clear water and saw many fish.

259607473.name: great spot
259607473.author: a TripAdvisor user
259607473.reviewBody: We stopped at this beach for snorkelling, which was great. I wish we would have spent more time here, beautiful spot and seemed to be favoured by locals. There were restaurants and lockers. Didn\'t see a vendor at all. Really liked it here and next time will make a day at this beach.

259074092.name: Beautiful
259074092.author: a TripAdvisor user
259074092.reviewBody: If you survive the cab right  be happy. Our cab driver went 65 miles around winding curves. We went yesterday and there was a drop off. You had to climb a ledge to get out of the water. The restaurant we ate in (they are all the same)was a rip off. You have to really watch your bills. We ended up just sitting on the beach and enjoying the colors. You have to pay to use the bath room.

258482214.name: Awesome snorkeling
258482214.author: a TripAdvisor user
258482214.reviewBody: We loved this little gem,went once on our own, went back the second time and got a guide. It was awesome we seen hundreds of fish and real nice coloured coral.  Loved this place good snack food and great people.

257921766.name: Great snorkelling
257921766.author: a TripAdvisor user
257921766.reviewBody: Make sure you check out the cave/tunnel past the point on the left side of the beach but not quite as far as the next beach. Snorkel around the colourful coral and you\'ll find it.

257899489.name: Great for snorkeling
257899489.author: a TripAdvisor user
257899489.reviewBody: We snorkeled at this beach and tried paddle boarding for the first time. I liked the variety of fish to see when snorkeling. Easy access on sandy beach.\nI didn\'t like to be bothered by folks selling stuff and also by people wanting you to eat at their restaurant. They can be very persistent. I like to chose a place on my own. Someone named "dog" recommended the restaurant called "la entrega"

257762811.name: Snorkeling fun!
257762811.author: a TripAdvisor user
257762811.reviewBody: We visited this bay while on the Morena with Captain Juan and my daughter got to go snorkeling via glass bottom floatie. She had a wonderful time. The water was so clear and a boy from the beach pulled her on her floatie. He would dive down and bring up sea urchins, foam coral, and blowfish and let her hold them. It was a great experience!

257573766.name: Snorkelling fun
257573766.author: a TripAdvisor user
257573766.reviewBody: Swam with a bunch of harmless baby jelly fish. Very clear water. Plenty of fish variety. There\'s a secret cave and plenty of tasty beachside drinks!

257315897.name: Nice beach for snorkling
257315897.author: a TripAdvisor user
257315897.reviewBody: Nice beach to snorkel and there are restaurants to set up base at! Ocean is pretty calm and sand is fine to medium.

256983568.name: Snorkeling
256983568.author: a TripAdvisor user
256983568.reviewBody: Our guide Pablo brought us to this beach. Snorkeling was easily accessible, ending with lunch and drinks on the beach.

256093923.name: great beach
256093923.author: a TripAdvisor user
256093923.reviewBody: this is a great place to spend a day .. lots of restaurants to eat at and great snorkelling everywhere..  50 pesos to get there by taxi and 70 to come back.. still a great deal.

255280401.name: Good Snorkeling
255280401.author: a TripAdvisor user
255280401.reviewBody: I spent about an hour at Playa Entrega which was part of a larger tour of the Bays of Huatulco.  The main focus of my time there (about an hour) was to snorkel on the reef that covers a relatively large area of the playa.  The snorkeling was great.  It is a sheltered beach, so even though it was a rough day out on the Pacific, it was very calm.  There were large schools of fish of varying color and size feeding off of the reef.  An amazing array of marine life.  Our guide (also snorkeling) captured a puffer fish and invited us to hold it (underwater, of course).  My initial reaction was "no thank you", but he was pretty persistent.  I\'m glad I finally took him up on the offer.  It added to the experience.  \n\nThere are also food and drink vendors on the beach.  I did not go there, but some from our group did, and said that it was fairly pricey.  Perhaps the advantage of a captive crowd.

254375503.name: Nice beach that you can get there by taxi!
254375503.author: a TripAdvisor user
254375503.reviewBody: Nice scenic drive to La Entraga! Our taxi driver stopped at the top of the hill so we can take an aerial picture of the beach! Food was great and the beer was very cold! Definitely going back!

254194044.name: Norwegian Cruise
254194044.author: a TripAdvisor user
254194044.reviewBody:
Takes your breathe away....

Great little hidden beach only vendors from restaurants there waiting to wait on YOU

Swim, snorkel, sail or whatever you wish

Little tip I learned, ask for the menu (physically) so you can see the prices. They'll attempt to tell you the menu and leave out the price. Pretty pricey....beware.... Tourist trap

253502836.name: Great vibe
253502836.author: a TripAdvisor user
253502836.reviewBody: We spent a happy day here. Snorkelled - the reef is stressed.  But we saw many fish and a large manta ray. Lucy\'s restaurant looked after us well and we enjoyed the Hawaiian fish dish.

253207245.name: Small but beautiful
253207245.author: a TripAdvisor user
253207245.reviewBody: Playa Entrega is a lovely small beach with some great little restaurants and good snorkeling.  Beautiful beach.

252762233.name: Fabulous Beach
252762233.author: a TripAdvisor user
252762233.reviewBody: Very popular beach.  Lots of restaurants line the beach providing seating during the day.  Really enjoyed our day there.

252459235.name: Great beach for snorkelling
252459235.author: a TripAdvisor user
252459235.reviewBody: This is a great beach for snorkelling as the reef comes in very close to shore, so you just need to swim I guess 50-100 metres to get to the best spots. Lots of colorful fish to see, we went almost every day. Sheltered so easy for children to snorkel too. The beach is lined with restaurant shacks selling basic fish dishes (about 120 pesos, US$10 for a main). One negative is that you can feel a bit harrassed arriving as the waiters try to get you to their restaurants. Weekends can be busy too, weekdays less so. If you don\'t want to eat you can also leave your stuff at a table at one of the shacks to be looked after while you snorkel, in return for a tip (maybe 30 pesos or so). At the far end of the beach (away from the car parks) the guys offer guided snorkelling trips including diving down to emerge into an underground cave (I didn\'t try this though). They washed my facemask in soap and bleach to avoid misting up and wouldn\'t accept any tip! The beach is very well cared for and no fishing is allowed as it is protected. The beach is a short taxi ride from the main hotel area (about 50 pesos I think) and a bit further from the town centre.

252273464.name: Snorkeling
252273464.author: a TripAdvisor user
252273464.reviewBody: Went to beach by boat this year and went snorkeling while the guys sat and had a few cold ones on the beach.  The water is warm and clear and there is an abundance of fish.

252001838.name: Great snorkelling
252001838.author: a TripAdvisor user
252001838.reviewBody: This is the best beach in the area to snorkel. Very calm waves, great palapas, good equipment to rent, beach sellers are very polite.

249779983.name: Pretty
249779983.author: a TripAdvisor user
249779983.reviewBody: Very busy.  We were there on a holiday so it was packed.  Lots of restaurants to choose from but a little harder to have a table right on the beach.  They\'re set up more for eating and then finding a spot for your gear on the sand.  It was windy and the waves were larger so it was a little harder to float or snorkel.

249517443.name: Beautiful beach but be careful of the tourist trap.
249517443.author: a TripAdvisor user
249517443.reviewBody: We were brought here to go for lunch which we did do but our boys enjoyed jumping through the waves that pounded down onto the sand more so.  As beautiful as the beach is and location it is a bit of a tourist trap.  We think our guide from Transat must have been getting a percentage/ cut with whatever the restaurant made off of us.  I ordered a pina colada  and it was suggested I buy it in the  pinapple...shell...why not? We\'re in Mexico...kinda fun....our two boys did the same.  I didn\'t even think of looking at the price...They ended up being $16! Each.  We walked out of the restaurant for 5 of us paying $160 for lunch. I was NOT impressed with Transat for setting this tour up and felt we got scammed.  If you want to go here bring a box lunch which the all inclusive will set up for you ....$10 each.  Much cheaper! (so you can enjoy more of the beach).  Tip * when going on any tour be very specific with them.  If they are taking you on the "Seven Bay tour" in Huatulco to go snorkeling are you actually going to snorkel in the seven bays? No!..but they make you think that you are.  They will bring you snorkeling but their main focus feels like it is to get you to these more touristy places. Just be clever and know exactly what you are getting.  Don\'t get sucked into going for lunch! Bring your own so you can enjoy the beautiful beaches that Huatulco offers with your family.

248658890.name: Snorklers Paradise
248658890.author: a TripAdvisor user
248658890.reviewBody: Wonderful Cove for Snorkeling. A wide variety of sea-life (Rays, Fish, Turtles and many more).\nThe white sandy beach is beautiful, although watch the tide, the eastern end comes in high!\nThe restaurants are a little pricey compared to town, bring a picnic and enjoy.

248388694.name: A busy bay of bounty
248388694.author: a TripAdvisor user
248388694.reviewBody: We took a taxi ride from Santa Cruz to lookouts above the bay, then down to the restaurants that line the whole centre of the bay. You can drink and eat, as well rent snorkel equipment as you relax. The bay has good swimming and would be perfect snorkeling for beginners, on each side of the bay along the rocky shoreline. You can get there by taxi or boat from the marina in town. This is a busier bay, complete with merchants, but a nice half-day excursion.

247477180.name: Lovely beach but
247477180.author: a TripAdvisor user
247477180.reviewBody: Playa Entrega is a nice small beach, but it is overcrowded with palapas. We got hassled beyond reason. \nThere are no sun loungers, and because the beach is quite narrow the crowded palapas leave very little free sand. If you want to lay in the sun and read, don\'t bother, go to Maguey or Chahue.

246543133.name: Great Snorkeling from shore
246543133.author: a TripAdvisor user
246543133.reviewBody:
We walked to Playa Entegra from the Hotel Castillo one morning. It mapped out to about 5km and took us about an hour. Nice walk, lots of shade along the side of the road. Many butterflies and small lizards scurrying around for entertainment.
There are also many restaraunt/bar "owners" scurrying around once you reach the beach. A little annoying but they are just making a living and once you select your spot they will leave you be. We were early enough to find a little palm tree at the edge of the bar, the folks from inside set us up a table and chairs and brought us cold beer, life is good. The wife enjoyed the use of the "bathroom". A bit rustic, but functional.
The snorkeling is on a large plate reef on the left hand side of the beach. It is in a area roped off from boat traffic, you can't miss it. There is lots to see as soon as you enter the water, but the further out you go the more fish there are. Had some diablo shrimp and a quesedillo after snorkeling, not bad, not great, but the beer was still cold, all was good.
Lots of taxis waiting for the return trip (45 pesos), another awesome day in paradise!!

246517951.name: Great snorkelling!
246517951.author: a TripAdvisor user
246517951.reviewBody: Enjoyed taking my rental scooter to this beach with my gear.  Water was very clear and loads of different fish.  Be sure to make it out to the "lover\'s cove" the locals call it, a bay in the rocks you can only snorkel under to get there.

245837035.name: Excellent snorkling
245837035.author: a TripAdvisor user
245837035.reviewBody: As you look out to the ocean, the left hand side. Swim past the groups of snorkelers, you\'re still not far from shore. Lots of fish and colourful coral, the water gets bathtub warm around the corner, water nice and calm.

245697982.name: Great snorkeling.
245697982.author: a TripAdvisor user
245697982.reviewBody: Large beautiful fish. Be advised the reef itself is dead so don\'t be expecting large corals but the fish were amazing. Great restaurants and friendly people. Beautiful.

244722608.name: Spectacular snorkeling
244722608.author: a TripAdvisor user
244722608.reviewBody: Lots of locals selling yummy treats and fun souvenirs. Good food on the beach and many fish in the water!

244673299.name: Great beCh for swimming and snorkelling
244673299.author: a TripAdvisor user
244673299.reviewBody:
We walked to this beach from our condo , not long just uphill so not great for ones who don't do a lot of walking. As soon as we arrived to the beach area we were approached by a number of vendors but when we said not right now they did back off. 
Very safe to leave your towels and go in for. A swim and snorkel. Close to the coral a number of different species of fish were seen. The water that day was a bit cooler so had to be on the lookout for jellyfish. None that day but you knew they were out 
We then ran into. A Great boater  who had his own boat huatulco 2000 his name was Jose I asked him what he would charge for a tour of the bays for 6 people 60.00 total for 3 hours. 
We took the boat ride and it was amazing , we went to a number of the bay's , snorkeled and swam and even one of the men had a chance to catch a fish!  I strongly recommend looking for him and say Linda said to ask for him.

244578374.name: Right next to cruise pier
244578374.author: a TripAdvisor user
244578374.reviewBody: this reminds me of Caribbean beaches. Their is nice fine light colored sand with nice amenities surrounding to get drink or food. Popular with Mexican vacationers, but not easily accessible by plane.

243010227.name: Peace and Love.
243010227.author: a TripAdvisor user
243010227.reviewBody: Relax and enjoy sun breaze and sand. :)  Water temperature just great, can have hours of snorkle and swimming  you will have to explore with your guide.

241887088.name: Watch out
241887088.author: a TripAdvisor user
241887088.reviewBody: Beautiful bay for snorkeling and swimming.  Be careful of the waiters and beach workers, they will over charge you.

241793441.name: Busy small beach with several restaurants
241793441.author: a TripAdvisor user
241793441.reviewBody: We stopped by Playa Entrega and was immediately guided to a table at a restaurant that the taxi driver walked us to. The beach was very narrow and busy; tons of families and kids playing in the water. Off aways there was some surfers and boogie boarders. This was the shortest beach that we went to in Huatulco. Didn\'t do any snorkeling but our friends hadn\'t been overly impressed.

241406989.name: Great place for a break
241406989.author: a TripAdvisor user
241406989.reviewBody: Entrega has some nice little restaurants, a little pricey, but the water and the beach is fabulous, great snorkleing, 10 dollars to rent fins, mask and snorkel, you can get there by cab, by boat or easy if you have a car.

241334636.name: Sweet Beach
241334636.author: a TripAdvisor user
241334636.reviewBody: This is a very nice beach that is easy to get to from Santa Cruz. If you are a walker, you can walk there or take a taxi. There are palapa style restaurants on the beach where you can stop and enjoy a cold drink and something to eat.  Be aware though that there are quite a few people trying to steer you to some of these eateries on the beach. Check the menus for prices and ask if there is a service charge for sitting there. You can snorkel here and the water is wonderfully calm , clean and warm!

238192539.name: Excellent for swimming, snorkling, and eating!
238192539.author: a TripAdvisor user
238192539.reviewBody: This is about 20 minutes from Huatulco by taxi. A hotel taxi there and back cost us 350 pesos. I am sure we could have walked to the street and found a better deal. Once there, you have to leave your stuff with one of the restaurants - as there is no public area with beach umbrellas. But we left our stuff there and even handed our camera and other stuff to meseros, and all we had to do was to eat there. The food was very good and it was not expensive (same as in town). \nThe beach was excellent for swimming. We were there on a Thursday in low season and it was still busy in the afternoon. We arrived early to have the place to ourselves for a couple of hours in the morning. Kids loved swimming there and it was their first time snorling in the ocean. There were tons of fish there, right close to the shore, but we saw the best and the most slightly far from the shore (you can\'t miss it with all the snorkles there) in the left hand corner.\nIt\'s a great place to spend a day - as you can\'t really swim at most other beaches in Huatulco.

232454982.name: Perfect place to do snorkel
232454982.author: a TripAdvisor user
232454982.reviewBody: This is a very calm bay and here is where most of the Bay Tours park for practicing the snorkel, this is a very nice experience and you can see a lot of colorful fishes. Most of the equipment is provided by the tour company. It is worthwhile the experience.

221524764.name: Excellent beach!!
221524764.author: a TripAdvisor user
221524764.reviewBody: This is a great beach for swimming, specially for young children. You can practice snorkeling and enjoy a very relaxing atmosphere.  They have restrooms and showers nearby the entrance and they only charge you $10 pesos to use them.

220732107.name: Only if you want to snorkel
220732107.author: a TripAdvisor user
220732107.reviewBody: This is the beach to go to if you desire snorkeling, otherwise we preferred the nearby beach of Santa Cruz.  First, parking is free at Entrega, but people tried to trick us into paying 20 pesos for it.  It is a very crowded beach and worst for us was that none of the restaurants had internet.  They also over charged... One pitcher of lemon aid 120 pesos!  Compare to 60-80 at Santa Cruz.  Also more sellers will pester you here than at Santa Cruz.

214431499.name: Great snorkeling and swimming beach
214431499.author: a TripAdvisor user
214431499.reviewBody: We took a taxi here from Secrets and went on a week day.  It was still a little crowded but not too bad.  I heard it does get pretty packed on the weekends.  There are lots of little tables and restaurants.  We bought a drink from one of the restaurants and they let us use a table and kept an eye on our belongings. It was mostly local families at the beach.  It\'s great because facing the beach the right side and the closer portion of the beach are great for swimming and sandy bottom.  Facing the left near the cliffs is an amazing reef.  It was a little crowded when a tour group arrived but after that my husband and myself were some of the only ones out snorkeling.  I swam with a spotted eagle ray for awhile and there were times that we were just surrounded by huge schools of fish.  If you like to snorkel or even if you just want a nice beach to go to for the day, def. check this out.  Go early or on weekdays to avoid the huge crowds.

212854556.name: Crowded beach
212854556.author: a TripAdvisor user
212854556.reviewBody: Went during July.  Very crowded.  Looked like it could a pleasant place, but at the time we visited could not find an open space on the beach... nor could we easily make our way into the water.  Boys did try to snorkle, seemed promising, but gave up with all the people about.

209643262.name: Great for snorkeling
209643262.author: a TripAdvisor user
209643262.reviewBody: We visited other bay\'s first but this was the best. Waves are calm for swimming. You rent equipment and a guide right there and you start seeing fish practically since you step into the water. It had been raining so the beach and water had some debris washed ashore but water was still very clear to see various types of fishes and the reefs

205824248.name: worth snorkeling at
205824248.author: a TripAdvisor user
205824248.reviewBody: everything. nice sand, people, food, site, fish life. Sad that the reef is dying though, so brown. This playa is easy to get to with a taxi. No tour is required

203451217.name: Great swimming!
203451217.author: a TripAdvisor user
203451217.reviewBody: The ocean was far too dangerous to swim in during the entire week we were at our resort in Tangalunda. So we took a taxi and spent the day at La Entrega. We got there by 1130 so got a table and umbrella close to the water. HINT: Go to the far end of the beach, there is a bit of a wall built up to stop the water lapping in if the waves are high. We enjoyed Coronas and Victoria beer for $2.50. Lunch is still expensive at average $14 per entre but its a full plate.\nWe enjoyed our day swimming and watching the Mexican families. We didn\'t snorkel because the water was rough. I`ll definitely return on my next visit to Huatulco.

203387805.name: Snorkel central!
203387805.author: a TripAdvisor user
203387805.reviewBody: We fed the fish while we went snorkelling in the bay. Clear, blue water to swim in and you can rent boats and sea-doos as well.

200536027.name: Great Beach
200536027.author: a TripAdvisor user
200536027.reviewBody: Playa Entrega has some great places to eat.  The bay is beautiful and has some good snorkeling. Always be sure to ask before you sit down if they charge for their tables, chairs or umbrella. Some charge and some do not.

200262763.name: beautifull beach
200262763.author: a TripAdvisor user
200262763.reviewBody: for swimming,nice and calm, and some restaurant with fresh seafood.far from the town but no to much.

200031735.name: Great snorkelling
200031735.author: a TripAdvisor user
200031735.reviewBody: What we liked about this area was the beautiful snorkelling - many fish and nice coral, as well as a small cave you can swim into. The downside to this beach was the large amout of local trying to get our business.  This is common for any beach or market area, so you kind of get used to it, but it is a bit overwhelming at times.

199801250.name: Great Beach for Kids
199801250.author: a TripAdvisor user
199801250.reviewBody: If you don\'t want to deal with waves, bring your kids here. You will get the hard sell when you arrive, but ignore it and continue on to the beach. It\'s usually crowded, but the bonus is the snorkeling. Swim out the left hand side as you face the ocean, there are usually lots of fish to be seen. Makes for a great family beach outing.

198794092.name: Truly magnificent Mexican Beach with so much Character!!!
198794092.author: a TripAdvisor user
198794092.reviewBody: We were on a 48 ft.Sail Boat in October 2013 when we Anchored in the bay. We were 2 couples enjoying a wonderful sail and the took part in snorkelling which was terrific. We swam ashore to enjoy the beach and the choices for waterfront restaurants was very good and we thouroughly enjoyed our chosen one for lunch where the seafood was scrumptious. It was not very crowded when we were there but when we came back another time by car it was quite crowded so our first visit was the best but it is an experience to be cherished at any time. Michaek J Mahoney & Alma Rosa Enriquez Zepeda

197513381.name: Best snorkelling in the Huatulco area
197513381.author: a TripAdvisor user
197513381.reviewBody: We took two different dive and snorkel excursions on this trip and this beach had the best water quality for snorkelling. It also has turtles for the divers. We swam on the north side (on the right as you face the beach) of the bay where the coral is vibrant and the fish are plentiful. There\'s also a cave along the rocks that you can swim into (too shallow for divers). We didn\'t venture to the beach. We did go to playa el violin on the same trip but it was much too rough to see anything with the churn.  It was an afternoon visit to both beaches.

197167556.name: Snorkeling
197167556.author: a TripAdvisor user
197167556.reviewBody: Rented snorkeling gear for only about $5/person, lockers available while out in the water. Beautiful coral reef. Gorgeous beach. Several restaurants to choose from. Beer only about $2.50/bottle. Delicious fresh fish and seafood.

196880953.name: Beautiful beach with everything you need
196880953.author: a TripAdvisor user
196880953.reviewBody: This was a lovely beach somewhat close to our hotel, so a quick cab ride.  There are plenty of places to sit at one of the local beach restaurants in the shade or in the sun-your choice.  You can rent snorkel gear for about $5 for the day and can go on your own or hire a snorkel guide.  It\'s a clean beach with nice people.  They watched our bags while we snorkeled and called our cab driver when we were ready to leave.  We much enjoyed it here.

196628973.name: Great snorkelling but busy beach.
196628973.author: a TripAdvisor user
196628973.reviewBody: We took a cab from Santa Cruz for under $60 pesos but when you get there, be ready for the crowds and the onslaught of restaurant operators. We picked the first person who approached us, left our things at the table and went swimming. We had an incredible snorkelling experience. Entrega Bay abounds with sea life of all sizes and shapes. We saw a school of fish numbering in the thousands, pipe fish, manta rays and more. It was amazing. There were thousands of tiny jellyfishes, but they did not seem to sting. The restaurant (first on the beach) serves nice margueritas and freshly make tortillas and guacamole.

196471000.name: Snorkling beach at Entrega
196471000.author: a TripAdvisor user
196471000.reviewBody: We took a safe, reliable taxi to Le Entrega Beach just down from Huatulco. There were jelly fish, small ones, but they stung, so we didn\'t do much snorkling. We took our own equipment with us but there are rentals there. Lots of stuff to rent...boats, floating \'toys\', etc. Had nice lunch and drink at one of the restaurants and it was good but expensive. Make sure you ask the whole price and dicker with them or you\'ll be surprised. Vultures (the birds) on the each too. The ocean was cold further out, the locals said, so the jellyfish moved in closer to shore so couldn\'t snorkel much. Used a floaty thingee with a hole for your face to look into the water/reefs and that worked well without getting jelly fish stings.

196011188.name: Great snorkelling
196011188.author: a TripAdvisor user
196011188.reviewBody:
If you're looking for a great place to snorkel, this is it! The water is generally very calm, and clear, the beach is huge, especially at low tide, and there is much to see! After snorkelling, you can relax at any of the dozen or so restaurants that line the beach. You can also take a ride on the banana boat, if you choose! You can also rent snorkel gear, and new this year, paddle boards!

The best snorkelling is right along the rocky cliffs at the north side of the bay. Take a camera!
There are lots of vendors that walk the beach selling everything from book marks to jewelry, to "fresh" oysters. Shower facilities also available for a minimal charge.

Avoid going on the weekends, and especially Saturdays, as the beach fills up with local families, and is VERY crowded. The tourists have the beach to themselves the rest of the week.

Always a fun spot to spend an afternoon! Lots of taxis available day and night.

195962454.name: Busy Beach, Very Good Food, & Snorkeling
195962454.author: a TripAdvisor user
195962454.reviewBody:
Avoid the guys who hassle you when you arrive--they are looking to earn "referral" fees by dragging you along to specific places. Some are quite insistent, so be prepared to say no thanks and still be pestered.

After reading some reviews ahead of time, we went to Nivel Mar. The food was very good (shrimp diablo was delicious, but do NOT eat the little bell peppers unless you want flaming lips!!!) Prices seemed a little high for food, but the quality was worth it.

Snorkeling was better than I expected--saw lots of interesting fish even though the beach was fairly busy and there were lots of people thrashing around with snorkel gear.

Close to town--short cab ride. We'd go again, likely early on a weekday.

195800811.name: Super fun for a day at the beach!
195800811.author: a TripAdvisor user
195800811.reviewBody: Good snorkeling from beach. Calm water for swimming. Lots of restaurants to eat and drink. Get there early to beat the excursion boats dropping people off. If you want to lay out on beach, bring your own blanket to towel as lounger chairs are not available.

195737946.name: Love love love it here
195737946.author: a TripAdvisor user
195737946.reviewBody: My favourite beach, great snorkeling, swimming, tanning and just hanging out having beers and relaxing. The water is perfect, calm and simply amazing.

195342290.name: OK snorkeling
195342290.author: a TripAdvisor user
195342290.reviewBody: The first time we came here it was their "family day" and there was a huge celebration and lots of games being played by the locals.  We found this beach a bit dirty, and I don\'t think I would go back a third time.

194675562.name: great beach when quiet
194675562.author: a TripAdvisor user
194675562.reviewBody: This is a great beach if you are in the area of Santa Cruz and the marina there. It\'s about a 55 peso ride in a cab if you like the overland route from Santa Cruz or take a boat out there. Either way bring snorkel gear and explore on the left side of the bay. There are usually lots of fish and a bit of decent coral. Food, drinks and taxis are available on the beach. There are Mexicans who roam the beach with fresh fish, huge oysters and  lots of fruit and snacks so you\'ll never go hungry or thirsty.

194632705.name: Best Snorkeling
194632705.author: a TripAdvisor user
194632705.reviewBody: This bay has very many fish in it.  You can see everything from just floating on the top of the water-snorkeling,

194329348.name: Michelle Pammenter Young - Another great beach
194329348.author: a TripAdvisor user
194329348.reviewBody: Playa Entrega is a little closer to town than Maguey Bay and a little smaller, but still a nice place to spend the day.  The water is lovely (although a few times a year there may be Jelly Fish).  Bring your snorkel and mask because there is a lot to see about 100 feet from the shore.\n\nGood restaurants and a nice relaxing spot.  Worth a day trip.

193545061.name: Very Nice Beach
193545061.author: a TripAdvisor user
193545061.reviewBody: This beach had nice white sand and great snorkelling. Only thing was it was a bit too busy for us. The beach was packed with families with kids. Although it was a really nice beach, there are far better beaches like San Augistin, And Maguey that I would go to before this one. San Augistin is big and even when there are lots of people it isn\'t as noticeable and at maguey families and kids are all to the left so it isn\'t so packed and nosy.

192563500.name: Great experience
192563500.author: a TripAdvisor user
192563500.reviewBody: We went by taxi, it was $10 each way from our resort.  We hired guide from the beach to take us snorkeling.  He was very good, sorry I don\'t remember his name.  He charged $5 each and $20 for his services.  He spent quite a bit of time with us, finding fish and letting everyone in the group hold them and take pictures, he then took us into a cave and explained about the tides and bats that live in the cave.  Overall it was a great experience and I would recommend it to anyone who likes to snorkel. We didn\'t get a chance to eat at the restaurants but the owners were very friendly and not pushy, Next time I go I would go with a smaller group and make time for dinner.

192523887.name: Entrega Beach
192523887.author: a TripAdvisor user
192523887.reviewBody: A lot of the boat tours stop here to pick up rental gear.  we always have our own.  we have been to this bay the past two years on different tours.  great snorkelling.  we never ate at the restaurants, we just ordered a couple of Cervezas after some snorkelling.  Hard liquor is anywhere from 55-80 pesos.  In my opinion a little high for Mexico.  It is what it is.  \n\nit is very close to the Hotels, when we come back next year we will go on our own for  a few hours.

192403628.name: Great Snorkeling
192403628.author: a TripAdvisor user
192403628.reviewBody: Very close to Santa Cruz Bay and wonderful snorkeling.  Hire someone that knows the waters and have them take you into the beautiful cave.  You can rent equipment and find someone experienced in the area right on the beach.

191958924.name: Be careful not to damage the corals!
191958924.author: a TripAdvisor user
191958924.reviewBody: Close to Sta Cruz - walking distance about 30 min easy walk or a short cab ride. If you rent snorkling gear - go directly to the renters - don\'t deal with middlemen like Carkos  (aka Grasshopper) - they overprice the rent. Better still, bring your own!

190782657.name: What a fabulous beach!
190782657.author: a TripAdvisor user
190782657.reviewBody: Took a taxi there from Santa Cruz and had a fabulous time!  Was pretty busy with a lot of locals, but we loved that.  When I\'m in Mexico I want to be around Mexicans not Canadians.  Highlight of the day by far was renting the boogy boards ($5.00).  Kids would lay on them and I would take them out.  The cool thing was that there was a piece of glass near the head rest area so the kids could see all the fish.  All I heard was "Dad, did you see that?"  It was so cool for the kids to see all the marine life.  I was exhausted as I was probably out there for over 3 hours with the kids taking turns.  Lots of restaurants right on the beach.  Will definitely go back when we visit Huatulco again.

190603596.name: Beautiful beach
190603596.author: a TripAdvisor user
190603596.reviewBody: We took a cab from Santa Cruz to this beach (very affordable - around $5.00). Our cab driver radioed ahead to his friend at one of the restaurants & we were greeted at the beach with an offer of a table to leave our towels at in exchange for buying a few drinks. It was very busy, but we enjoyed the lovely views and did some snorkelling and swimming. This beach is very popular with the locals, but is well worth the trip. We also stopped at a lookout on the way there (at the suggestion of our cab driver) & took in a great view of the ocean- we just wished we had brought our camera!

189941563.name: Ahhh-amazing beach and beer
189941563.author: a TripAdvisor user
189941563.reviewBody: It was very busy in Huatulco when we arrived and this beach was a much needed reprieve from the crowds. It was still bustling with locals but not crawling like ants as in Santa Cruze. The beer was cold, the beach Sandy and calm, my 6 1/2 year old son had a great time cruising in and out of the water. The snorkelling looked to be fantastic. We ended up booking a boat cruise of the beaches and bays for tomorrow from a fellow who was running a water taxi. Highly recommend this beach!

188894426.name: Great snorkeling and beer
188894426.author: a TripAdvisor user
188894426.reviewBody: We had a wonderful time snorkeling with our guide, Carlos. The waters, though not as clear as in spring or summer because of northern currents, were clear and warm, and the variety of aquatic life made the experience well worth the twenty bucks or so that we spent. Just be careful of coral reefs at low tide (though this does permit you access to an amazing cave). Even non-swimmers can enjoy this tour, as life jackets and boogie boards are used by the guide to provide everyone a great experience (including photos with blowfish, starfish, sea urchin, etc.).

188493102.name: A must do beach!
188493102.author: a TripAdvisor user
188493102.reviewBody: A short cab ride $ 570 peso  or if you like walk down to the marina and take a panga ( boat) ride for $250 peso . Once u arrive at the playa ( beach) one of the local\'s with escort you to a table with a umbrella  which is needed because it gets very hot . Cold  beers ,drinks and food are available at a reasonable  cost.The beach is lovely beautiful view ! We brought our own snorkling gear  but you can rent everthing thier .No. More that six into the water waist deep you all ready see fish  a little hint grab bananas from your resort  the fish go crazy over them. The water is calm great for swimming and snorkelling . Be sure to bring an underwater camera we did . Lots of fish to be seen !! We felt very safe leaving our belongings at the tables where we were seated.

187929995.name: Fishing village
187929995.author: a TripAdvisor user
187929995.reviewBody: We took a boat to get here.  It\'s a bit touristy but worth seeing.  Remember to barter before to buy food or drink.  The snorkelling in the protected harbour is suppose to be the best for calm water and types of fish in the reef.

187823468.name: awesome inexpensive snorkeling
187823468.author: a TripAdvisor user
187823468.reviewBody:
We rented snorkels and flippers for $50 pesos each and enjoyed checking out the reefs and cave. Reef was good with plenty of fish.
We ate on the beach and the food was decent, but a touch pricey based on Huatulco prices. All things considered still very inexpensive though.
There are ladies selling fresh oysters along the beach which looked incredible. Unfortunately we have shellfish allergies.
The guys at the restaurants are pretty eager to get your business and were really trying to get you to take a seat.

187103890.name: Pay attention to your bill
187103890.author: a TripAdvisor user
187103890.reviewBody: Lovley beach with coral not far from shore.Lots of fish .We sat at a beach resteraunt all day long drinking beers,and eating chips and salsa,but the the waiter served some imaginary beers to us ,but what can you do?that being said he was only out by 10 bucks in his faver,and the tip was already on the bill,something we didn\'t know,until we asked what the mystery entry was.So enjoy the beach but pay attention.

186216113.name: Easy snorkle
186216113.author: a TripAdvisor user
186216113.reviewBody: Close to hotel by cab, secluded feel, lots of fish and large coral shelf, easy beach access and restaurants, 10 peso shower, etc.

186008156.name: Go Early
186008156.author: a TripAdvisor user
186008156.reviewBody: Fantastic snorkeling! Go before noon to beat the crowds on weekends. All the restaurants are decent with Bogarts being my favorite

184940787.name: Everything for the Family
184940787.author: a TripAdvisor user
184940787.reviewBody: Go in the morning, before the wind comes up and makes the water near the shore a bit less clear.  Beautiful for swimming, romping with the children, relaxing, and snorkeling.  Lined with palapa restaurants that will let you leave your belongings right at a table while you are on the sand.    Go there by car, taxi, or panga...or walk!  Wonderful beach and scenery!

184388380.name: GERALD & RACHEL ESCAMILLA
184388380.author: a TripAdvisor user
184388380.reviewBody: La entrega is a swimming and snorkling playa that is awesome.  The waters are so clear and clean its like swimming in a pool. Of course there is a few waves. If your vacationing with a family or couple this playa is beautiful and perfect.  Lots of restaurants that offer fried and grilled \nseafood , soup, snacks, alcoholic and regular drinks.  We could live here!!!!!!!!!\nWe pack our snorkling gear, catch a cab and head on out to the beautiful la entrega playa.

180983859.name: A lovely beach
180983859.author: a TripAdvisor user
180983859.reviewBody: A great beach to visit. We went snorkelling with a local guide. A very nice experience. The only thing to watch for is the  restaurants, they can be pricy for what the offer. A lot of locals use this beach so it makes it nice to see the children swimming and fishing around the rocks.

176243871.name: Gorgeous
176243871.author: a TripAdvisor user
176243871.reviewBody: We spent a few hours snorkeling and hanging out here. The people were so kind. The beach was calm and beautiful.  When snorkeling the life vest is optional, but you should definitely take one because the current swimming back the 100 yards off shore was quite strong.

175768766.name: Lovely for snorkeling
175768766.author: a TripAdvisor user
175768766.reviewBody: It was great to snorkel in the reef, very good for beginners. You can bring easily your own equipment, no need for "tours" that locals offer. We went fishing that morning, caught a huge dorado and they grilled it in a local palapa for a very decent price

172094817.name: Nice bay but Scam artists galore !!
172094817.author: a TripAdvisor user
172094817.reviewBody: Stopped briefly but you have to go through all the hucksters and  con artists . One couple with a rope trying to pry 20 pesos from people to go see a free beach ? really , that is sad . Then upon arrival at the parking lots , more opportunists awaiting .. \nThere are so many nice beaches with less hassles . Crowded and rank with opportunists , sorry not our style .. \n

165784764.name: good snorkeling
165784764.author: a TripAdvisor user
165784764.reviewBody: calm water, lots of places to relax on the beach.  beverages and some food available with shaded tables.  not far from town with some site seeing opportunities along the way.

158066455.name: Snorkelling=Awesome
158066455.author: a TripAdvisor user
158066455.reviewBody: This beach was gorgeous, not too busy, and a great place for a snorkel, a swim or just a place to lie in the sun and read a book. We weren\'t inundated with people selling us the usual stuff on the beach and the place was mostly peopled by Mexicans enjoying their beautiful natural paradise. Soft sand, warm, clear water made for perfect days.

157491937.name: Calm and Clear
157491937.author: a TripAdvisor user
157491937.reviewBody: Entrega is beautiful!  Go to Bogarts Restaurant.\nThe week before and after Easter Sunday are always super super crowded with people from Mexico City and all others from any inland city...stay away if possible those 2 weeks!\nAny other time the beach is empty and several times during my 6 weeks in Huatulco I was the only person snorkeling there.

155297882.name: Another must see beach
155297882.author: a TripAdvisor user
155297882.reviewBody: Great time, great snorkeling. Only cost 3.00 by cab to get to. Some really good places to eat as well.  The one thing I didn\'t like is everyone trying to get your business as soon as you get out of the cab.

153637911.name: Swimming with the Mexicanos
153637911.author: a TripAdvisor user
153637911.reviewBody: We have been to Playa San Augustin, Playa Chahue and Playa Maguey.  I am sure each person has their own favorite.  Playa Entrega is very close, actually in Santa Cruz.  We did walk there but don\'t really suggest it unless it is early in the a.m.  About a mile and half hike.  We went on a Sunday, and enjoyed ourselves thoroughly...we did not take advantage of the restaurants with umbrellas but brought a picnic and camped under one of the several trees there with all the Mexican families.  It was great fun, the water was perfect and we bought some roasted peanuts with chili, lime and salt from one the the wandering vendors.  Also saw fresh oysters and cerviche going by..yum.\nUnder our tree was a wonderful and comic group of people.  \nI am sure a weekday is quite different.  It did not seem crowded just lots of fun.

149698636.name: Close to town and great for swimming
149698636.author: a TripAdvisor user
149698636.reviewBody: 54 pesos to entrega from La Crucecita.  Restaurant lined beach, many of the resorts around the area offer trips to this beach, so it is always populated sometimes over populated, but all in all, it is a nice beach and safe to swim.

147898018.name: Excellente
147898018.author: a TripAdvisor user
147898018.reviewBody: Great place to snorkel!  Lots to see!  Everything you need on the beach, food, water, supplies and cocktails...and no admission to get in.

145734054.name: Good Snorkeling!
145734054.author: a TripAdvisor user
145734054.reviewBody: Ate at Bogarts on the beach.\nSnorkeling was great\nWater calm...a good place for the beginner snorkler.

141607205.name: Good place if you don\'t know how to swim
141607205.author: a TripAdvisor user
141607205.reviewBody: I don\'t know how to swim, but the water here is very calm so I can go in up to my waist and watch all of the fish.  This is a very good spot to snorkel.  In fact, they rent masks and fins on the beach.

135585770.name: too crowded
135585770.author: a TripAdvisor user
135585770.reviewBody: on the upside, this beach has plent of restaurants with covered seating open to the public. the water is nice and not too rough. problem is that by noon it is seriously crowded.

134176788.name: Great Place to Spend the Day!
134176788.author: a TripAdvisor user
134176788.reviewBody: Perfect place to rent Jet Skies and swim, Bay is calm and is great to snorkel as well. Plenty of places to eat and drink too. Food is a little over-priced but I highly recommend it.

129471685.name: Great place to snorkel!
129471685.author: a TripAdvisor user
129471685.reviewBody:
We've been coming to Huatulco every February for the past six years, and fortunately we discovered Playa Entrega the very first year. Entrega has become a favorite spot for us to snorkel, with the sheltered bay providing calm and warm water!

The cab ride from our hotel (Las Brisas) is about 100 pesos, and takes about 15 minutes to get there. On arrival, we are greeted by a throng of locals trying to get us to go to their restaurant on the beach. There are about 8 or 9 restaurants lined up along the beach with no space in between. Past the restaurants, there is a place to rent snorkel equipment, and also lockers to keep your valuables safe.

We politely navigate past the welcoming committee, and head towards the restaurants. We typically look for a restaurant where the staff speak decent english, and we ask if we can have a table for the afternoon! The staff have ALWAYS given us a great table, and watch our belongings while we snorkel for a couple of hours. Never had a problem! After we're done, we dry off and go back to the restaurant for lunch, where they are eager to bring us drinks and a menu! Most of the menus are the same here, and the food is good. No matter what restaurant you go to, they bring you crisp taco chips, and salsa. Guacamole costs extra. I highly recommend the garlic butter fish fillets or fajitas. Everything is prepared fresh, to order, and doesn't take very long!

The snorkelling at Entrega is excellent! There is a huge reef area just off the beach, and it's protected from water traffice by a line of buoys. There are lots of colorful fish to be seen here. To the north side of the bay, there is a "bat cave", which is a small cave in the side of the cliffs, and it's only accessible by water. It's a popular attraction, so you may have to wait your turn to get inside. I highly recommend a decent underwater camera ( we use Lumix TS3 ) as well as a small envelope of soda crackers to take along and attract small fish. If you peel open the crackers, you'll get about 20 mins of enjoyment out of it, as the cracker mush slowly oozes out!

While you sit in the restaurant, or on the beach, you'll get frequent visits from local merchants, selling everything from sea shells, to jewelry, to raw oysters on the half-shell. Never tried the oysters, but much of the other stuff is alot cheaper than you'd pay in shops in town. So if you see something you like, negotiate a price and buy it!

A typical afternoon at Entrega will last about 3-4 hrs, depending on how long we snorkel. There are plenty of cabs waiting to take you back to your hotel. Make sure you're dry and brush off any sand from your feet, as the cabbies take great care to keep their cars clean.

If you don't mind crowds, the weekends at Entrega are quite busy with lots of locals enjoying the beach. Many of the snorkelling tours offered at the resorts use this reef to snorkel at. We prefer to go during the off-peak hours during the weekdays when the cruise ships are NOT in. No matter what time you go, you'll meet lots of friendly people, and have a great time! 

Also available here: Jet Skis and Banana boat rides!

We can't wait till next year!

661222185.name: Ultimate personalized service
661222185.author: a TripAdvisor user
661222185.reviewBody: I have been diving over 20 years in many countries and the personalized service we received from these guys was the best ever.   To start, they are not employees of a big company.  They are the company.  Smaller boat for small groups.  They are passionate about the ocean and diving and it shows.  We had a first time diver that they took amazing care of and yet didnt make the rest of us feel like we were being baby sat.  We even had our 6 year old come along and so they brought their 4 year old to play with her on the beach with Carlos while we dove with the dive master.  Amazing service.  Dont expect carribean quality visibility or  sea life but it was still very good and lots of variety.  I would dive with these guys again any time.

657643551.name: Super dives
657643551.author: a TripAdvisor user
657643551.reviewBody: Carlos was excellent dive master. His background as an environmental engineer made the dive both interesting and educational. I will book with them again.

639252437.name: Very helpful
639252437.author: a TripAdvisor user
639252437.reviewBody: Didn\'t get a chance to go diving but they were very helpful in suggesting things for us to do with our few hours in Huatulco.

632650885.name: Excellent Excellent Experience
632650885.author: a TripAdvisor user
632650885.reviewBody:
I can not say enough great things about my experience diving with Buceo Scuba Huatulco! My wife dove once and I did 2, 2 tank dives. Carlos and Virgilio were excellent to work with. They pick you up and dropped you off at your resort after each 2 tank dive. Carlos and Virgilio were always making sure your experience was up to your expectations. Buceo scuba are great stewards of the ocean. I personally saw Carlos picking up random plastic cups, straws, etc. we came across. The waters of Huatulco are extremely clean and I think that is because dive masters like Carlos and Virgilio. If you want a great diving experience please look them up.    

While diving Carlos was always pointing out all the different types of water life. The amount of waterlife in Huatulco is amazing. During the dives Carlos took video clips of the dive that he made available to you after the dives if you emailed him.   

After each dive they provided water, soda, and fruit to keep you hydraded.

553629593.name: Cancelled
553629593.author: a TripAdvisor user
553629593.reviewBody: Book weeks in advance. Got an e mail 5 days before scheduled trip canceled due to weather... not sure what weather showing sunny and in the 90s all week. Very disappointed

545579243.name: Secret spot!
545579243.author: a TripAdvisor user
545579243.reviewBody: Excellent dive operators and dive sites! Our Sunwing rep said this is the ONLY company he recommends to visitors, and we can see why. Very friendly, professional and easy going. Excellent quality and like new dive gear, they picked us up from the resort and took back to their shop for orientation. We went out in a small dive boat with just 3 of us divers and 2 dive masters, and 1 crew who stayed on the boat. They had fresh fruit and pop/water for us post dive to help with healthy sugars. Dive sites were amazing! Reefs are in very good shape, very healthy. Lots of different underwater life, including sea snakes, plenty of puffer fish and other colourful varieties. Highlight was definitely a very private bay where Rays come to mate. We had to have seen literally almost a hundred rays under the sand and swimming around. Very memorable! \nThey event took a tonne of photos and videos with a gopro and a underwater camera and sent to us for free! Great value company.

539446949.name: Gorgeous Bay
539446949.author: a TripAdvisor user
539446949.reviewBody: One of the best things about Huatulco Bay is that it\u2019s not busy. You can go to the beach or fish. Change Bay is also beautiful.

538623122.name: Super clean beaches and town!
538623122.author: a TripAdvisor user
538623122.reviewBody: A small town with wonderful beaches. I was nicely surprised with the cleanness of the town. Great visit!!!

530525547.name: Beautiful beach with calm waters and view of the entire bay
530525547.author: a TripAdvisor user
530525547.reviewBody: Lovely place to walk or dine. Easy access to many restaurants and light shopping. Clear waters and easy to get to.

522575732.name: Nature at its best!
522575732.author: a TripAdvisor user
522575732.reviewBody: Beautiful, Clean, Astonishing. That is Huatulco. I was really, really surprised to find that it is still kind of virgin. The beaches are amazingly clean and the locals are very friendly and helpful. Next time you plan a trip to any beach in Mexico, consider Huatulco. You can go to the local hotels or to the all-inclusive hotels. You won\'t be disappointed!

522460795.name: Beautiful location
522460795.author: a TripAdvisor user
522460795.reviewBody: Quieter and a nice change from the other West and East coast resorts.Expensive golf course next to the hotels..

516472507.name: Fun
516472507.author: a TripAdvisor user
516472507.reviewBody: Was the first time we went to the beach you are offered mezcal at every place you sit to eat they say it\'s so you don\'t get an upset stomach with the food you\'ll eat

507420938.name: Bays
507420938.author: a TripAdvisor user
507420938.reviewBody: Great beaches, lots of activities to do, excelente locations, very clean beaches, lots of transportation available.

500099967.name: Fishing with pulpo
500099967.author: a TripAdvisor user
500099967.reviewBody: The best fishing and ocean tour in Huatulco hands down was patient totally caters to whatever you want knows huatulco very well we booked all our tours in huatulco thru him you need to go to nobody else will visit him again in December!!

500083437.name: Nice boat trip
500083437.author: a TripAdvisor user
500083437.reviewBody: It was nice to go out in the boat. If you do it be sure to do the snorkeling, that was the best part. If your group is big is better to hire a private trip with the guys at the beach. The hotel packages are the same but more expensive.

488321283.name: Off the beaten path
488321283.author: a TripAdvisor user
488321283.reviewBody: If you\'re tired of the tourist crowd Huatulco is the place to go. It is still a very busy and bustling place but is filled more by locals and weekend visitors than western tourists and partiers.

487495116.name: Wonderful beach!
487495116.author: a TripAdvisor user
487495116.reviewBody: This is where the Mexicans go to get away from the tourists while on holidays or vacations. Nice little town with wonderful beaches and lot of food or drink on-site options. We would have loved to have stayed longer than just 1 day here. Safe and friendly place to visit.

485351196.name: Sea, Sun, Mountains, Town
485351196.author: a TripAdvisor user
485351196.reviewBody: This is the kind of place you seek for a pleasant sun-soaked vacation. There are actually several beaches in the area. The town is handy for meals or drinks. We discovered Huatulco when our cruise ship stopped here. What a great find. We only stayed for a day, but I could see coming back for longer. Being Easter vacation, the beach was crowded. i also liked the little two-passenger motorized vehicles that can whisk you through the town. I wore my Panama Hat to protect my balding head from the sun. I don\'t really get into the water, but I like the sea air, the lapping of the waves, and the whole setting.

483551522.name: Beautiful Bay
