It was a perfect day and Roberto was an excellent guide.  He spoke excellent English as he had spent a number of years in California.  He knew the history of the area and offered much insight as to our surroundings in and out of the water.  We will definitely be looking him up again.

242019436.name: 7 bay tour with Roberto of Yellow Fin - Remarkable!
242019436.author: a TripAdvisor user
242019436.reviewBody:
We met Roberto Hernandez on the beach at Dreams Resort.  We immediately felt like we could trust him as he seemed honest and likeable.  The resorts will tell you not to go through the locals on the beach as they will rip you off.  This is so you will book through the tour company at the resort.  
We decided to go with Roberto.  We booked him on a private tour as we didn't want to go with a bunch of other tourists. He picked us up and brought us to the marina in Santa Cruz.  We went out on is panga and felt completely safe.  The boat was well cared for and the driver of the boat knew exactly how to handle the swells of the ocean so we weren't scared or nervous at all.  
We saw dolphins and sea turtles and took the tour of the bays.  We stopped at St Augustin and did some snorkeling.  Best we've seen in Mexico.  Roberto actually swam with us and showed us various things.  He swam down and brought up different fish for us to hold and "pet", including puffer fish.  Amazing.  
He was well stocked with beer and water which we enjoyed throughout the day.  I would definitely recommend him.  He was also wayyy cheaper than going through the resort.

241612944.name: ultimate Huatulco experience with "Coco"
241612944.author: a TripAdvisor user
241612944.reviewBody: ...as we thought it can\'t get any better we headed out in the pacific with local fishermen Jorge aka "Coco". He knows his waters and where to sniff out the biggest fish as mahimahi, dolphins and turtles, etc. We had a great day and awesome expericence on his little boat, he caught fish and cooked lunch for us - this was an absolut highlight! You\'ll find Coco on Bahia Santa Cruz but opposite the big terminal - off to the left side where the small boats are parked. A vacation to Huatulco is only complete when spending a day with Captain Coco. Many thanks again to make our trip so special. The Austrian-German-Girls ;-)

241396771.name: private boat charter
241396771.author: a TripAdvisor user
241396771.reviewBody: visited 5 bays, 2 snorkelling spots and lunch on a beach ...great day.  we were on the Cucharacha..Alehandro was our guide and he was fantastic

241119626.name: the best place to be: for me
241119626.author: a TripAdvisor user
241119626.reviewBody:
this perfect holiday spot is SAFE, CLEAN, FRIENDLY, MEXICAN
sun never stops, food is cheap and plentiful, snorkeling quite nice
we have been going here for years and in january of 2015, taking 18 people again
used to go to las brisas, a very nice resort, but now just stay at costillo in the down town
love sitting on our balcony and watching the locals, renting scooters and checking out the bays and fishing is thrilling when you for get the rods and admire the dolphins and whales!!!
have been to many places in mexico, this one exceeds every other location if you are looking for quiet, friendly and relaxing
check it out!!

239008508.name: Eddie is awesome
239008508.author: a TripAdvisor user
239008508.reviewBody: Huatulco is the best kept secret on the pacific coast and you can\'t pass on a bay tour to see all the unspoiled beaches and incredible sea life. I can\'t even begin to describe some of the awesome experiences we have had out on the ocean.  We suggest you rent a private panga from one of the local vendors who sell trips on the beach.  Eduardo Valle Garcia is a young man we have dealt with for several years. His boat is called Mantarraya II.  He is absolutely  amazing and full of enthusiasm about what he does.   Goes above and beyond to make sure you are satisfied.  We have highly recommended him to everyone we have met and they all have agreed that Eddie (as we call him) made their vacation complete.  He can be contacted at his e-mail eduardovalle300@yahoo.com or you can find him on the beach between Barcelo and Dreams.

238783096.name: too good
238783096.author: a TripAdvisor user
238783096.reviewBody: I have loved everything about Huatulco. I believe I have found my paradise here on earth, Huatulco, warm water in November, wonderful people, and so much more.\nI have loved staying here at Hotel Villa Blanca, and would highly recommend it to any one traveling to Huatulco, the management; the staff and service are beyond compare. Room prices are just great; you can\u2019t go wrong staying here. A five star recommendation from me.\n

238551031.name: Day trip with Coco
238551031.author: a TripAdvisor user
238551031.reviewBody: Going back to Hualtuco for a 3rd time and plan on using Coco as our tour guide.  Both experiences so far with Coco have been excellent with trips to Puerto Escondido, Zipolite, and boat tour.  Back to Hualtuco next week and looking forward to seeing you again Jorge, my friend.  Looking forward to a boat tour of the bays and some fishing!!  Joel & Pat

238374520.name: Better when the ships are not docked.
238374520.author: a TripAdvisor user
238374520.reviewBody: Came down here the same day a huge ship arrived. The place has a clockwork feel for tourists, all singing all dancing \'authentic\' performers and vendors. I preferred when there was not many people around, when there was a much better, laid back feel. Bays are beautiful, and nice at dusk when the lights of the bars are twinkling.

237139776.name: Beautiful Beach
237139776.author: a TripAdvisor user
237139776.reviewBody: What amazing beaches here.  Fantastic sand and the water so clear and warm you want to stay in all day.

235158111.name: Interjet airline from Mexico city
235158111.author: a TripAdvisor user
235158111.reviewBody: I wanted to share an experience on our flight to Huatulco recently through Mexico City. We flew down through toronto into Mexico city and then connected with Interjet. Our departure from TO was delayed over an hour which made our connection really tight. Upon arrival into MEX, we cleared customs, gathered our luggage (4 larger pieces), then grabbed a porter with a cart and told him we have 30 mins to make our connection. So we ran across terminal 1 to interjet. They had closed the flight but our porter explained that we were connecting from Canada and really needed to get to Huatulco. They made a few calls on their radios then said ok, but we have to run. So checked our bags, grabbed boarding passes and through security to our gate. We made it and the gate knew we were coming so it all worked out, and all of our luggage made it too. We have flown interjet now about 4 times and we are always impressed with their service. It is still nice to know that an airline cares about its passengers. Hats off to interjet and we appreciate the extra effort. Just another reason we love mexico, everyone wants to help and is extremely polite. Well done interjet, you have two very impressed customers.

234009232.name: Huatulco private tour
234009232.author: a TripAdvisor user
234009232.reviewBody:
Arturo Martinez,

The best tour certified guide who is a former biologist himself. Never seen someone who's very passionate about his job before.  He explained to us about the archeological side in Oaxaca.  He bring us for mazcal testing. Mazcal is a kind of agave can only be find in Oaxaca. Also, hand woowen bedsheets,  rugs with exclusively high quality. Thank you Arturo.
Arturomartinez16@hotmail.com

232242949.name: wonderful
232242949.author: a TripAdvisor user
232242949.reviewBody: only one day of storms that kept us from enjoying the sites of the bay. It was the rainy season so one day out of seven, it was wonderful week.

228385895.name: Bay Boat trip withTony Lopes Lopes
228385895.author: a TripAdvisor user
228385895.reviewBody: We took a private boat tour with Tony Lopes Lopes "yellow hat" and he was the best tour guide we have ever had!! We had a great time and felt very safe! We saw all the bays and the dolphins, could have snorkelled  but opted to not too! We heard from others that Tony Lopes Lopes was the best boat guide prior to our departing Canada and had we known it would have been such a great experience we would have gone a second time but we ran out of time!!! He is in front of Dreams!

226530744.name: Marisol-Tours Teko is the best
226530744.author: a TripAdvisor user
226530744.reviewBody: Me and my wife visited Huatulco in July 2014 and found a recommendation on here for Teko and decided to contact him for a private tour of the bays. He came and picked us from the hotel. Teko has a good size boat. We started with a general tour of the bay. Then we went fishing. We went deep into the bay to watch dolphins , sea turtles and sharks. We stopped at St.Augustine bay for lunch. It\'s quite an interesting place because everything is on the sand. Coincidentally, the best food we had in Huatulco was at this bay. We also swam with the villagers in San Augustine while waiting for our food. After lunch we went snorkeling.  The water was very clear and it was an exciting activity. The tour lasted the entire day and I will do it again in a heartbeat. Teko and his nephew were excellent guides and made sure we enjoyed our tour of the bays.

223626605.name: Beautiful Beach
223626605.author: a TripAdvisor user
223626605.reviewBody: The water in Huatulco is absolutely beautiful. I would say it is better than the caribbean. The reason being is that it is warm very clean (no seaweed) and no jellyfish.  When you go into the ocean you can see the bottom. A big plus is that there are also waves so it is really fun

212845297.name: very nice
212845297.author: a TripAdvisor user
212845297.reviewBody: I liked the bay but sand in Huatulco is very coarse. Not the fine white sand, like the Caribbean. It had an orange hue to it. Water was calm enough to safely swim and snorkel and we saw quite a few varieties of tropical fish. Saw a whale in the bay one day. Gorgeous Rocky views on the shoreline. It was beautiful. I would love to return.

200712930.name: Coco is a keeper!
200712930.author: a TripAdvisor user
200712930.reviewBody: We met Coco on the beach. He was polite, honest and friendly. He told us what we wanted to hear and offered us his services.His rates are not to high and very appropriate for the service provided.  Time was not on our side so we were unable to enjoy a day with Coco but certainly felt confident enough to ask for his business card so that we can look him up on our next visit. we look forward to a great fishing trip next time in Huatulco and Coco will be our man!

200492345.name: It was OK
200492345.author: a TripAdvisor user
200492345.reviewBody: Scenery beautiful, but boat(and group) too big.\nSnorkel area  they took us to was very rough, maybe it was just that day.\nWould have been nice to have lunch included.

195822600.name: paradise
195822600.author: a TripAdvisor user
195822600.reviewBody: Just a beautiful, peaceful part of Mexico.  Clean, uncrowded, with wonderful staff and comfortable accommodations!  Transportation to nearby villages is efficient and affordable. Food is very good, although I would prefer later serving hours for restaurants and bars for the evenings when you chose to stay on the hotel grounds.

195810540.name: Must-see
195810540.author: a TripAdvisor user
195810540.reviewBody: The 7 bays excursion is a must-see, it\'s beautiful and a great way to discover the area. Private tours in small boats will allow you to do some fishing, which is exhilarating!

194632332.name: Beautiful
194632332.author: a TripAdvisor user
194632332.reviewBody: Took our 1st tour boat (yacht) this year. We enjoyed the scenery, the history told to us about the park land we passed. We even saw Orca\'s and humpback whales. Even a mother humpback and her calf...It was a beautiful day...

194582471.name: beautiful beaches/ crystal clear waters with superb snorkelling
194582471.author: a TripAdvisor user
194582471.reviewBody: cobosmario@hotmail.com.  the best excursion EVER.  Very personalized and private.  Spent 8 hours with hem fishing and snorkeling and visiting the beaches with flour soft sand!

194576693.name: Wonderful view
194576693.author: a TripAdvisor user
194576693.reviewBody: Second visit to this region. Would come back again.  Took private tour off the beach again this trip. Great tour on the ocean

194188998.name: Nice beach
194188998.author: a TripAdvisor user
194188998.reviewBody: The beach was nice for walking as long as you were walking close to the water and not up higher as the slope was awkward to walk on

193363346.name: Rent a boat on the beach
193363346.author: a TripAdvisor user
193363346.reviewBody:
While staying at SECRETS in January, [the dry winter season] we were on the coarse sandy beach, enjoying the steady 90 degrees with no clouds weather...[110 degrees, rain and bugs in the summer time, along with a LOT of rain] when we were approached by CANDIDO, a very nice beach vendor [and we found them all to be nice] offering us a cruise on a local "panga" with a local boat "captain".
$75.00 each...he didn't care if it was Canadian or American
There were 4 of us on the boat, piloted ny Noel.  Water supplied.  Cerveza supplied.  Covered boat.  Room for more people, but they'll go with just a few.  About 3 1/2 hours total, with a ride out into the very calm [that day] ocean, where Noel spotted a few whales that we got to within 50 feet of, a nice 30 inch sea turtle basking on the surface, and then on to a public beach, where the locals run a bunch of restaurants and tourist facilities [of course] and are only too happy to take you to them, where washrooms are easily available.  We didn't stay to purchase anything, and got no hassle at all for doing that.  Stayed on the beach for an hour, people watching, and swimming in the protected bay.
Back on the boat for a nice cruise into all of the bays on the way back to SECRETS, with Noel explaining the buildings and bays to us.  Some of the bays not available by car...
A very nice interlude at a wonderful area of Mexico, where safety was the absolute least of our concerns.
I'm thinking about doing something a little different next year, and going back again, rather than finding a new place, which is our norm.

193354730.name: gorgeous beaches
193354730.author: a TripAdvisor user
193354730.reviewBody: calm water so the kids could play in the waves.  beautiful sand.  plentiful sea life for snorkeling.  climate is perfect.  Hot.

192582783.name: gorgeous
192582783.author: a TripAdvisor user
192582783.reviewBody: The bay has spectacular views and beautiful landscapes all around the tour we took.........................................................

191590346.name: Hertz rental Huatulco-BEWARE
191590346.author: a TripAdvisor user
191590346.reviewBody: We rented a vehicle from Hertz with 606 km on it in Jan 2014 in Huatulco. After reviewing the vehicle we found no damage on the car. On return 2 weeks later the attendant had us look under the front spoiler and said these 2 dings were new damage. We were charged $80.00 value in pesos. They wanted us to fill out accident report but we refused to do this. We were also charged extra for mileage (used it 580 km). Another customer at the counter also disputed vehicle damage! I have rented Hertz for years and even last year in Huatulco with no problems until now. Next customer will get charged so look under the spoiler and take photos!

190601935.name: Bay Tour with Teko on the Marisol
190601935.author: a TripAdvisor user
190601935.reviewBody: Our family of 5 just returned from a wonderful week in Huatulco. The highliight of our trip was the day we spent on Teko\'s boat. We saw some of the most beautiful beaches imaginable, as well as dolphins & sea turtles. We also snorkelled at several different bays & felt completely safe with Naul leading the way. \nTeko was a wonderful tour guide as well as an expert navigator. There is a bathroom on his boat, a canopy for shade & lots of icy cold beer, water & pop. \nWe got Teko\'s name from my dad, who goes to Huatulco every winter & has gotten to know Teko & his family. He always looks forward to his days of deep-sea fishing on the marisol.

190507618.name: Perfect get away
190507618.author: a TripAdvisor user
190507618.reviewBody: It is a perfect, quiet, get away. The best is to get a small boat "lancha" rented for the day and escape in the early morning towards the remote beaches only accessible by boat. It is a little paradise, where snorkling is even accessible from the beaches !  \n\nYou can then return on more accessible beaches for a late lunch.

189218595.name: Magnifico Marisol!!  Dolphins, Sea Turtles and so much more!
189218595.author: a TripAdvisor user
189218595.reviewBody:
The Bays of Huatulco are amazing and should not be missed.  If you want to have a fantastic day of snorkeling, sightseeing, unspoiled beaches only accessible by boat, book with Teko on his 30' yacht, the Marisol.

I am always skeptical to book tours through a beach vendor, but after several conversations with Teko, I felt confident he would show us an exceptional time and put down a deposit.  The next morning as promised, a clean & air conditioned Suburban was waiting for us to take us to the Marina.

I was extremely impressed with the cleanliness of the yacht, everything was in great working order and the beer was cold.

Teko took us closely along the coastline to a nearby bay where he fitted us for snorkel equipment.  My 3 year old son was delighted with Teko's suggestion to rent a "Manta Ray".  This was a small boat shaped like a Ray that he could either sit or kneel on with a large viewing pothole to view all of the coral and fish.  It was fantastic for kids!!!

We toured through all of the bays, the water was very calm.  We stopped for a snorkel and had the bay to ourselves.   It was an all age adventure tour, my 60 year old father, 3 and 7 year old sons, my husband and I were delighted with the calm waters, beautiful coral and hundreds of colorful fish.  Teko's cousin Naul toured us around the reef and would dive down and brought us a starfish and a Blowfish for a closer look. 

After snorkeling, we toured on to San Augustin for a fresh seafood lunch.  The beachfront restaurant was good other than a trip to the outhouse was a definite reminder we were in Mexico. I would advise using the bathroom on the boat.

The kids and Granny were tiring out after 6 hrs. of fun and sun so we decided to head back and venture into deeper waters to troll (also does fishing adventures) My mom was concerned of getting sea sick, but even she did fine .  Teko did and amazing job navigating and pointing out close to a hundred dolphins and 3 sea turtles. It was super fun for all ages!

 I have to say Teko did such an amazing job.  I am always reluctant to recommend beach vendors, but do not be afraid to book Marisol!!

He was fantasTEKO!!!

188697564.name: For nature lovers
188697564.author: a TripAdvisor user
188697564.reviewBody: The Bays of Huatulco is a lovely area that the Mexican government has created for tourism yet it is not over run with tourists which made it an ideal get away for us. While there is a selection of modern resorts there is a sense of peace and seclusion created by the natural topography of the area. It is still small and intimate feeling unlike some of Mexico\'s more commercialized area. The excursions and tours offered in the area are more eco friendly. Touring ancient ruins, coffee plantations, ATV tours through a National park complete with small village and abandoned banana plantation, snorkelling and scuba diving amongst the many coral reefs. The area is very tourist friendly and we felt extremely safe and comfortable during our numerous outings from our resort. I\'d definitely recommend this as a destination for people preferring to be a little off the beaten path.

187958144.name: Wonderful beach
187958144.author: a TripAdvisor user
187958144.reviewBody: A lovely quiet place. Frierndly locals, nice bars and wonderful weather. We loved it here. hopefully it will stay unspoilt.

187461770.name: Paradise
187461770.author: a TripAdvisor user
187461770.reviewBody: Best beaches and snorkeling of the pacific Don\u00b4t miss taking a private tour with Pilo Vazquez to visit the bays...worth every penny!

186785297.name: What Mexico should be!
186785297.author: a TripAdvisor user
186785297.reviewBody: Best part of Mexico! Clean, quiet, just the locals going about their day. No Starbucks or Mcdonalds!! And that\'s a good thing!

185444773.name: good for price
185444773.author: a TripAdvisor user
185444773.reviewBody: very beautiful place, one a bit rough but everything was clean could have more places to eat but that will come with time. People here are very polite and cant do enough for you......

185208719.name: MOTOR SCOOTER RENTALS IN HUATULCO
185208719.author: a TripAdvisor user
185208719.reviewBody: Motor scooters are a great and fun way to get around Huautulco.  To visit the beaches, el centro and stores.  There are very few rental businesses in Huatulco. Jerry\u2019s in La Crucecita  is one.  He only rents good Japanese motos, Yamaha, Suzuki, and Kymco a good moto from Taiwan. He Does Not rent the inferior Italika. I have rented from Jerry on many occasions. This year we agreed I would buy one of his used scooters. One in good condition, low miles and with a 30 day warranty. I had a Mexican friend handle the purchase. When he received the used Kymco it was in very bad condition.  The following were broken or did not work:  mirrors, speedometer, odometer, horn, not tuned up, dirty engine.  It cost me $ 200.00 to repair it and I paid over $ 300.00 then what it was worth. That is what 3 other mechanics told me. Jerry acts like he is your friend but he is business practices are bad. Be careful, there are other legitimate rentals in Huatulco. I have documents, texts and receipts to support this.

180837259.name: Awaiting our return
180837259.author: a TripAdvisor user
180837259.reviewBody: Susan and I are awaiting our return to Tangolunda Bay 2 November. We will arrive on the "Day of the Dead". This is truly something to behold! After seeing all the gifts to the departed, life will settle down to a most relaxing time. We look forward to the ambiance of Oaxacan Mexico. Huatulco gives one a chance to experience Mexico at its finest. LaCrucecita and Santa Cruz are short taxi rides away and offer great shopping and eating experiences. One can dine at a small family business or go more formal. A trip to Santa Maria Huatulco and Pluma Hildago are also recommended. If golf is desired, a great course is available. Perhaps the best about the area, one can be as busy or laid back as one desires!

171235437.name: Really away from Mexico City
171235437.author: a TripAdvisor user
171235437.reviewBody: I travel with my family in law to Huatulco by car. I was an amazing boring and scaring travel. It doesn\'t exist a highway to arrive to Huatulco. All roads have thousand of curves. It\'s a very dangerous way. I\'ll travel next time by airplane.

169027235.name: Beautiful bay, Huatulco has 9 such bays. Each bay has it\'s own great view.
169027235.author: a TripAdvisor user
169027235.reviewBody: Gorgeous Resort, gorgeous community. The small towns and the lush green mountains getting there are a plus. Even the mountains form a great backdrop for the airport.

166318082.name: Breath-taking beauty
166318082.author: a TripAdvisor user
166318082.reviewBody: Just amazing, you could just stare at it for hours on end.  The majesty of the sea, the intense waves, nature at it\'s most perfect.

166271541.name: Beautiful
166271541.author: a TripAdvisor user
166271541.reviewBody: One of the best beaches. Very relaxing, amazing. Peaceful, calm. Truly paradise. Great for couples, and families. If one is looking for a party scene, please look elsewhere. This is not the place.

161726275.name: Beautiful!
161726275.author: a TripAdvisor user
161726275.reviewBody: Wonderful little paradise!  Very clean, locals are incredibly friendly.  We caught a cab to take us to the beach for a couple of hours, price started at $30 and ended at $10 for a round trip.  We said the time we would liked to be picked up and he was right on time, as and added treat on the way back to the port he gave us a fully guided tour along with picture taking stops!  What a great day in a beautiful place.

160450970.name: Wild and natural - a real Mexican gem
160450970.author: a TripAdvisor user
160450970.reviewBody: Nine huge bays over some 25km of coast, some with rolling surf, others with still waters, most with golden sand, what\'s not to like in Huatulco? It is a little remote for the travellers looking for a varied diet of Mexican culture - hard to combine in a short time with the archaeological side or the old colonial side of Mexico - but for clean and clear waters it is hard to beat. The infrastructure of Huatulco was put in place by the government tourism arm, FONATUR, so it is relatively modern - much more modern than Cancun, FONATUR\'s best known project. This is Mexico with drinking water from the tap, internet, shady pavements, sidewalks that are wheelchair and stroller friendly, a bus and taxi service, an active little marina and fishing, restaurants and bars, hotels for all pockets, local and hotel operated spas - even a golf course -  AND wild, untamed forests just behind the beautiful sandy beaches.

158722298.name: Another New Adventure
158722298.author: a TripAdvisor user
158722298.reviewBody: This was my fourth winter spending time in Huatulco and every year the experience is a new adventure that seems to get better and better if that is even possible.  It is great to return to see people and refresh friendships that have been made in previous years, at the hotel, in the restaurants and out in the community.\nI took 2 separate fishing trips with Crisanto on the New Adventure and always enjoy the time on the water with him and his assistant.  This year was the year for dolphin adventures, as I have never seen as many in prior trips.  While the lines were out on the back of the boat we drove for miles with the dolphins along the boat.  The highlight of my first full day in paradise was getting to experience the adventure of bringing in the fabulous sailfish that I have been waiting for.  The fight was tough and it challenged me like never before.  With the coaching of my captain and David the first mate at the video camera, I have experienced the thrill of catch and release with a fish that Crisanto estimated to be about 35 kg.  Snorkeling in San Augustine Bay is always on the \u201cTo Do List\u201d as the large schools of fish are always easy to find.  A short hike up to the church on the hill gives you an amazing view of the bay.  Next trip to Huatulco I hope to add the Marlin to my list of Dorado, Bonita, and Sailfish.

157711903.name: Great Beach Spot
157711903.author: a TripAdvisor user
157711903.reviewBody: Arrived at Huatulco Bay as one of our stops on a snorkeling trip.  Gorgeous mile long beach deserted on one side and populated with beachside restaurants and local touristy shops on the other.  The water is calm, clear and the nicest beach we saw on our trip.    The restaurant we ate at had awesome margaritas, deicious guacamole and lunches.  The establishments and facilities are rustic but felt comfortable here.  The beach cove provides a very gentle surf and a softer sand than most Pacific coast beaches.  The snorkeling right off the beach isn\'t that good, some fish, but told if you swim out to the rock outcroppings there\'s more to see.  Gypsy artists of folk singers and stilts performer entertained everyone from the beach.\nHad a wonderful afternoon here and would definitely return.

157306194.name: Yellow Fin boat tour -Roberto
157306194.author: a TripAdvisor user
157306194.reviewBody: I would highly recommend taking Roberto\'s boat tour of the secluded beaches and snorkeling. His boat is the Yellow Fin. He speaks good English and has good knowledge about the ocean. We had a fabulous tour; he found the dolphins, we saw 37 sea turtles, sail fish, beautiful beaches and we did some snorkeling.  His son, William, was with us that day, William is a very nice young man, he is very helpful.  Keep up on your English classes William!

157043992.name: Good bay for tourists and kids
157043992.author: a TripAdvisor user
157043992.reviewBody: Good bay for turists and kids to visit. It is a safe place. The cruise ships visit here. No problem with gangs or thieves.

154911270.name: Great place to relax
154911270.author: a TripAdvisor user
154911270.reviewBody: This is a little piece of Heaven it\'s quite and clean and warm,and Safe. It is the best beach locations we have been too some of them we were the only people there.

153562719.name: One of the most tranquil & nicest beaches in Mexico
153562719.author: a TripAdvisor user
153562719.reviewBody: Beautiful beach, people are really nice, food is excellent. Nice shops! I would go back. and stay there longer one day was not enough to savor this beautiful place.

152104112.name: great snorkling
152104112.author: a TripAdvisor user
152104112.reviewBody: Great times snorkeling. Never needed flippers, calm waters. Got to see 2 stingrays, lots of variety of fish and purple coral...

151508896.name: Beautiful place
151508896.author: a TripAdvisor user
151508896.reviewBody: Saw porpoises and dolphins . Great scenery. Boat trip had a good meal and drinks. Snorkeling site and beach stop were the highlight of the trio.

151120884.name: Holiday
151120884.author: a TripAdvisor user
151120884.reviewBody: I enjoyed Huatulco very much, apart from the Hotel La Isla.I would reccomend the Hotel Santa Cruz which was more cenral and excellent value for money. They also have a beach restaurant and bar which are very good.

150862522.name: Beautiful beaches
150862522.author: a TripAdvisor user
150862522.reviewBody: Had a great time here! Beautiful clear water and clean beaches, excellent snorkelling! Weather was great!

149820085.name: Snorkelling
149820085.author: a TripAdvisor user
149820085.reviewBody: I got to hold a blow fish and our tour guide was fantastic and gave us the best experience in snorkelling

148538673.name: Fishing is excellent
148538673.author: a TripAdvisor user
148538673.reviewBody: My wife and I went fishing with Crisanto on Dec.28 and had a great day. The sea had been quite rough for the past several days but then calmed right down. We caught one sailfish, about 60-70 lbs. we didn\'t weigh it as we took and few pics and released it. Had another sailfish on but lost it, and had a black marlin chase our bait for 10 minutes but wouldn\'t take the bait. Just another fantastic day on the water with Crisanto and David in "New Adventure". A small panga boat but really comfortable for spending the day fishing. Lots of dolphins and turtles as usual. We were out about 12 miles but they have been having a lot of luck closer to shore as well. We have done fishing tours and bay tours with Crisanto for 5 years now and highly recommend him if you want to spend a day on water, either fishing or a bay tour. Great guys that speak very good English and won\'t leave you thirsty. Thanks Crisanto for another great day.

148274338.name: Pretty spot
148274338.author: a TripAdvisor user
148274338.reviewBody: Not beach people, but it got cold in Oaxaca, so we headed for the beach to warm up. Hired a wonderful bird guide through the hotel. Had a very successful morning. Hired a small boat to take us to other bays along the coast for snorkeling. Guide was good. Price was affordable. Ate Pina Relleno (pineapple stuffed with seafood. FAB!)  for the first time. If we need a "beach experience" again, would return.

148176388.name: Barcelo Resort
148176388.author: a TripAdvisor user
148176388.reviewBody: Beautiful area, lush and tropical, fabulous beaches, very safe area. WE can\'t wait to be able to go back

147897655.name: beautiful
147897655.author: a TripAdvisor user
147897655.reviewBody: So  friendly and safe.  Treated so kindly.  Lots to see.  Snorkeling was excellent.  Time is not important here!

147870663.name: Yellow Fin
147870663.author: a TripAdvisor user
147870663.reviewBody: We visited Huatulco, Mexico in Feb.  of 2012. A group of 8 did a full day excersion including snorkling and a little fishing. Our guide Roberto was amazing. It was a great choice going with a local as opposed to a giant guided tour because he showed us things that we never would have seen without an experienced guide. He was even kind enough to share with others who were not part of our excersion what he had found. We went to nemerous different spots that each had there own unique life, which again is not likely on a \'hotel size\' tour. The day of snorkling was great for all of us. The next day the 3 guys from our group went out fishing with Roberto. We cought fish near the shore in the early morning and then went out far in the afternoon. We landed a huge MahiMahi which we then had the chef at our resort cook, along with some of the other fish we had cought. The experience was great and it was a pleasure spending a day and learning from someone who knows so much about the ocean.\n\nBasically, I was nervous about going on an excersion with someone that we had met on the beach, but the experience was unforgettable and I would recommend him to anyone. Part of our group has been visiting Huatulco for years and they are always excited to see Roberto.

147494547.name: good safe beach
147494547.author: a TripAdvisor user
147494547.reviewBody: good swimming and snorkeling. tides are much quieter than Ixtapa\nand Los Cabos. Reasonable workout to walk

145966223.name: huatulco endearing place
145966223.author: a TripAdvisor user
145966223.reviewBody: i had opportunitty to visit places of Europe and huatulco showed me the warmth of yours people. impressed me the clean beaches, security and tranquility place. snorkel is the most beautiful experience. all bays are beautiful was a amazing experience, is highly recommended

142903888.name: If you are visiting by cruise ship
142903888.author: a TripAdvisor user
142903888.reviewBody: Visited Huatulco by cruise ship (NCL Jewel) as part of Mexico/Panama trip.  Best beach and only a very short walk from the pier.  Take a beach table/umbrella from the restaurants on the sand.  No charge.  Cold beers are brought to you and if it gets too hot a swim in the safe bathing area is recommended.  There are the usual beach activities; jet skis, banana boat, etc.  Prices are pretty reasonable.  Touristy shops very close and there are plenty of cheap and good restaurants.  Did not go into town which was some distance away by taxi, as we had everyting we needed at the beach and we were only there for the whole ay.\nWould like to go back for a longer visit.\nAs regards security there were armed navy and police regularly patrolling hte are.  No sign of any disturbances and locals said nothing ever happens.

140526336.name: Fabulous vacation place, Huatulco, Mexico
140526336.author: a TripAdvisor user
140526336.reviewBody: Great swimming, sun-bathing, friendly people, great food. We\'re going back this October, 2012. Went last year, same month, and had a ball! So much to do, so not their high-season, so great the Mexican hospitality!

140299261.name: Beautiful sights
140299261.author: a TripAdvisor user
140299261.reviewBody: A recent turist attraction to Southern Mexico, the bays of Huatulco offer fantastic views and relaxing boat sightseeing.  The area was discoverd for tourism less than 30 years ago and is filled with hotels and multiple water sport.  A tour of Las Crucecitas gives you a full Mexican experience.

135391809.name: nice bays
135391809.author: a TripAdvisor user
135391809.reviewBody: There are many bays in Huatulco each with its special style. It is nice to visit a few of them, Playa Entrega is beautiful, and good for Swimming and Snorkeling...Here everything is much for laid back then in Cancun/Riviera Maya.

134659619.name: Its a small tourist destination but by far one of the safest in southern Mexico.
134659619.author: a TripAdvisor user
134659619.reviewBody: If you prefer small, quiet and non-comercialized vacation places, than Huatulco is the place for you.

132171365.name: do the 7 bays tours..beautiful
132171365.author: a TripAdvisor user
132171365.reviewBody: really no complaints and i would return tomorrow..\ndont be afraid to venture off the property..

131978403.name: breathtaking
131978403.author: a TripAdvisor user
131978403.reviewBody: An amazing eco conscientious mountainous experience

131479214.name: Highly patrolled safe area where as a woman I was comfortable- no cat calls, offers of drugs or sexual advances made.
131479214.author: a TripAdvisor user
131479214.reviewBody: I have made many trips to northern Mexico and two others to southern Mexico mainly because my spouse enjoyed the areas. As a female, I never felt respected or safe near the male population I encountered in Baja, Mazatlan, or Cancun. Even in bulky clothing and a baseball cap, I endured lewed remarks and looks when out in public. I refused to continue traveling to Mexico and went elsewhere for a decade. \nThis year we had the opportunity to go to Secrets Huatulco. I decided to give this very southern Pacific Coast side of Mexico a try mainly because we wanted to dive in it\'s nine protected bays.\nIt was a great decision. Santa Cruz Beach area was covered with police and federal patrol. People were polite and friendly. I did not get followed, or harassed and my husband did not get offered drugs one time which is a first. It was a quiet, safe, relaxing atmosphere and I hope to return one day. The people in this region helped change my mind about spending my hard earned money in Mexico.

128562751.name: Beautiful location and guaranteed hot weather
128562751.author: a TripAdvisor user
128562751.reviewBody: Excellent holiday, a few hiccups along the way but with time the resort should be a must. The hotel itself is contemporary and well appointed.

127819863.name: lovely Hautulco
127819863.author: a TripAdvisor user
127819863.reviewBody: The sun the clean beaches, the prices of food and drink and the people

127266664.name: Beauitful area
127266664.author: a TripAdvisor user
127266664.reviewBody: The sun always shines and it is always hot and very safe

127212349.name: Awesome place to be!
127212349.author: a TripAdvisor user
127212349.reviewBody: Small ocean village town! MUST GO!!!! If you really want to get away this is the place to go to!!

127189819.name: Very Nice Area
127189819.author: a TripAdvisor user
127189819.reviewBody: This area is a hidden gem that has not been discovered yet by many vacationers!

127096403.name: Absolutely beautiful!
127096403.author: a TripAdvisor user
127096403.reviewBody: Incredible views and beaches, although beware of some areas with undertows. Check the flags every morning.

126948745.name: When I return to Huatulco, its like coming home again
126948745.author: a TripAdvisor user
126948745.reviewBody: I just returned from my 3rd trip to Huatulco and the experience is never disappointing.  People ask me if I plan on trying somewhere new and one day maybe, but for the immediate future Huatulco is a keeper.  The weather is guaranteed hot, hot, hot.  The food is always great, but the people and the experiences of the area are what draws me back.  Snorkeling in beautiful bays is always an amazing experience, it becomes an addiction and the fishing and experience of boating on the ocean with friends and skilled fishermen is always a highlight of my trip.  I have been deep sea fishing for three years with Crisanto and his assistant Enrique and have never been disappointed.  His boat is the Blue Marlin and is top notch, it is very clean, well maintained and safe.  When the waters gets rough it is never a challenge for this captain to handle.  This year I fished twice and caught Mahi Mahi and Bonita, but the sailfish was too elusive.  We were on our way back to the marina from a day of fishing and snorkeling at Cacaluta Bay when they spotted the sailfish near the surface.  I have never seen two more determined fishermen as they tried to lure the fish to the hook.  We circled many times in an effort for the catch.  It was an amazing experience even though we came out without the big one.  I always have the pleasure to see turtles, sting rays and other sea life to add to the adventures of the great pacific ocean, plus the amazing view of the beautiful Sierra Madre.  Thank you again to the many amazing friends I have made in the area for a wonderful vacation memory.  See you next year.

126612035.name: 2012 winter vacation at the Dreams
126612035.author: a TripAdvisor user
126612035.reviewBody: The hotel was very nice, the people were great, the rooms were clean and the food was excelent.

126550968.name: Bay Tour
126550968.author: a TripAdvisor user
126550968.reviewBody: disliked, not information privided on tour as to bay info.

126463854.name: The Coast
126463854.author: a TripAdvisor user
126463854.reviewBody: A nice place to have some sun and swimming but too touristy.  This is a government run resort made for tourism.

126463779.name: Have fun getting wet.
126463779.author: a TripAdvisor user
126463779.reviewBody: The water had nice color to it, was clear enough to snorkel and had colored fish and sting rays easily seen.  The bay was mostly calm however it dropped off quickly.  The sand was always clean.

125457555.name: Great Vacation
125457555.author: a TripAdvisor user
125457555.reviewBody: Weather was awesome 30-32 everyday,very safe, very friendly people..........

125455823.name: Fun in the Sun
125455823.author: a TripAdvisor user
125455823.reviewBody: Liked it all no complaints here great tours and awesome beaches and people

125300198.name: Be sure to visit Hagia Sophia
125300198.author: a TripAdvisor user
125300198.reviewBody: This is a botanical garden run by Romero who has a big, enthusiastic dream.  We truly enjoyed sharing his vision and loved the waterfall swim at the end of hot tour.

125238908.name: 9 Bay tour is a MUST!!
125238908.author: a TripAdvisor user
125238908.reviewBody: make sure to go with a Beach Entepenaur and NOT a Resort Tour.... You will have a MUCH Better Expierience with the Locals.

125198168.name: bay touring and snorkling
125198168.author: a TripAdvisor user
125198168.reviewBody: we had a three hour tour of the bays and did some snorkling with a wonderful young guide (Tino Herndazes) he speaks very good english, and is very willing to please.very trust worthy and friendly,my wife didn\'t like the motion or we would have been out there longer...

124618910.name: Nine Bays
124618910.author: a TripAdvisor user
124618910.reviewBody: There are actually nine beautiful bays in Huatulco.\nWorth a boat ride, which will usuall include, dolphin sightings!

124233610.name: Beautiful Hautulco
124233610.author: a TripAdvisor user
124233610.reviewBody: The bay was beautiful, clean, calm and relaxed and in that time of the year there were not many people, which is what we liked. The actual town was clean and a nice variety of souvenir shops. The townsfolk were very friendly.

124122804.name: Not very welcoming.
124122804.author: a TripAdvisor user
124122804.reviewBody: We visited Huatulco for the day off a cruise ship, we use cruises to scope out future vacations spots. l heard that Huatulco is one of the fastest growing spots in Mexico. We caught the water taxi to Playa Santa Cruz beach. Beware of the restaurants on the beach, they lure you in with promises of a free table and drink which we found was a con when other tourists broke out in an arguement about being charged to sit down at a palapa. They left and we joined them when they started badgering us for money as well. The beach is rocky in a lot of places and l saw a few people come out of the water with scrapes after being dashed on the rocks by the waves. ln the centre of the beach is a section where its has no rocks and is safe to enter. Caught  a taxi back to Huatulco for $5US and perused the stores and markets, again l like to be left alone to shop but l always get hounded, l must have ATM written on my forehead. As soon as one store keeper imformed me that l\'m a rich tourist and its my duty to leave money in Huatulco, l knew it was time to leave. lf l ever return to Huatulco it will be in an all inclusive resort where l can just chill out for a while.

124074831.name: postscript on Hualtuco.
124074831.author: a TripAdvisor user
124074831.reviewBody: Well;, mainly, it is not overtouristed, beaches are prime, powdery, prices for food and drinks are very low.

123995604.name: Huatulco is a beautiful place to visit!
123995604.author: a TripAdvisor user
123995604.reviewBody: We recently spent a day in Huatulco with our Panama Canal cruise.  It is a newer, clean city being developed as a new resort community and great pains have been taken to do it really nice.  There are 9 bays with great sand beaches and  many beautiful sites.  Our tour guide, Armando, was very knowledgable about the area and took us to several stunning outlooks.  When we said we would like to relax on a nice beach, he took us to Cameno Real Resort, a very beautiful resort with a perfect beach and enormous pool with cabanas and comfortable padded lounge chairs.  He got us in for free, and we were able to buy some drinks and food.  It was a perfect day!  Then Armando came back right at the appointed time to get us back to our ship - all for a very reasonable price!  Thank you Armando!  " <armandormzgtz@hotmail.com>

123451259.name: Fishing Trip With Rudy
123451259.author: a TripAdvisor user
123451259.reviewBody: We just got back from our first trip to Huatulco. During our trip we went out fishing. We booked an all day trip on the beach with Rudy Navarrete. He can be found on the beach by the Barcelo Resort. On the morning we went out, Rudy was prompt and had everything ready to go. It didn\'t take long before we came upon a school of Yellowfin Tuna however we couldn\'t find any takers. We then went out four miles where my wife caught a nice Mahi Mahi.  While out we saw many Dolphin including a large school of Spinner Dolphins. They put on quite the show. We also saw a Whale. We lost two more Mahi Mahi before catching one more along with many Bonita. Rudy and his mate Philipe were always working hard and made sure they always kept the bait in the water. After fishing for eight hours, Rudy even asked if we wanted to fish longer. We fished for another hour with no extra charge. Not only did we end up feeling like we had a great guide but we felt like we made a new friend. Rudy went out of his way every day of our trip to say Hi and talk to us. We will be sure to book a fishing trip with Rudy  the next time were in Huatulco.

123264813.name: most beautiful place on earth
123264813.author: a TripAdvisor user
123264813.reviewBody: looking for a  great vacation but think you are tired of mexico you need to try this place. Nice climate,safe,good people.Dreams hotel was great no wrist bands or restrictions on what you can do or go. Town very close by $4.00 by taxi shops across from hotels for those shoppers.Will be going back as soon as we can.

122850564.name: Huatulco 1st out of states experience!
122850564.author: a TripAdvisor user
122850564.reviewBody: The weather was wonderful every day!! The food was great and so were the drinks! Also the people who lived/worked at resorts/restaurants were the kindest folks!

122490232.name: Hot, Safe, Beautiful & Peaceful
122490232.author: a TripAdvisor user
122490232.reviewBody: Loved the friendly people and the cute town.  Lacked English Speakers.

122226623.name: El mejor clima para vacacional
122226623.author: a TripAdvisor user
122226623.reviewBody: Pasamos Navidad en el nuevo hotel Secrets Huatulco y el clima fue m\u00e1s que extraordinario.\nEl hotel tiene unas instalaciones incre\u00edbles y la comida es excelente, no dejen de visitar el Spa que ofrece una de las mejores vistas del hotel y de la bah\u00eda.\nEsperamos poder regresar muy muy pronto!

122162336.name: #1 Tour Guide in Huatulco
122162336.author: a TripAdvisor user
122162336.reviewBody: We recently visited Huatulco and went on a tour with Arturo Martinez. We travelled with him into the mountains and coffee growing areas. We thouroughly enjoyed the day. Arturo\'s command of english and overall knowledge was excellent. His vehicle was comfortable and he was a very cautious driver. He was very courteous and attentive to our needs throughout the day. Overall, it was a fun, enjoyable and educational day. We highly recommend Arturo to anyone interested in touring in Huatulco.

122087391.name: Great vacation
122087391.author: a TripAdvisor user
122087391.reviewBody: Huatulco was an amazing place to visit. The weather food, ocean and the  hotel we stayed at were great. A trip worth taking with the family or alone.

121963872.name: The Best Tourguide
121963872.author: a TripAdvisor user
121963872.reviewBody: I have been to Huatulco quite a few times and was lucky enough to find a driver who I like so much that I will now not use anyone else.  His name is Armando Ramirez (armandormzgtz@hotmail.com).  The first time I used him I requested a driver from the hotel and they sent him.  By the time we make it to town I told him I wanted his card as he was the safest driver I had had, he had a nice clean Surburban and he could speak English.   Since that time I let him know when I am flying in and he is always waiting at the baggage claim area.  He takes me where ever I need to go and has good tours available also.\nI would highly recommend Armando.  I see other comments from people who have used Armando and they are also very happy with his service.

121944747.name: Lots of bars and restaurants
121944747.author: a TripAdvisor user
121944747.reviewBody: Huatulco bay is beautiful with lots of bars and restaurants. I went on a tour of Huatulco, organised by our cruise ship which was nothing very special. The best part of the visit was relaxing on the beach after the tour with all my colleagues and friends. We ordered lots of food and beer and the cocktails were huge and very moreish. It is a safe place to swim and bathe, as well as a great place to hire out jet skis etc. I\'d love to go back to Huatulco Bay.

121829243.name: Roberto was awesome
121829243.author: a TripAdvisor user
121829243.reviewBody: We have been to Huatulco 5 times now and  would like to say you can\'t go wrong with  a boat tour with Roberto on Yellow Fin.  He goes where you ask him, snorkels with the group as a guide, and is very knowledgeable of the area.Yellow Fin is a spotlessly clean Panga with canopy and he picks you up right off the beach in Tangolunda Bay. The boat has a new Yamaha engine that is super quiet and reliable, I have one here at home. He speaks great English and is truly a nice guy.

121814762.name: Bay cruise
121814762.author: a TripAdvisor user
121814762.reviewBody: We decided to spend a day on the ocean.  We were approached at the beach of our hotel by a gentleman name Tino Hernandez.  He is the captain of the boat the "Snook".   Tino arranged our transportation to the docks.  We were shown to a clean, well maintained covered boat.  Tino took us to a quiet bay to snorkel.  He made sure I was comfortable with the gear, as I had never enjoyed this experience before.   Tino brought us a puffer fish.  He had us feel it\'s slimy tail.  He then had us cup our hands and he placed the fish in our hands cautioning us to keep it under water.  He then brought us a sea horse.  As I held the sea horse it wrapped it\'s tail around my wrist.  I wish I had spent the money for the underwater camera because I\'m would have loved to have seen the expression on my face.  It was awesome!  We then spent some time out on the ocean, fishing and looking for sea turtles and dolphins.  When our time was over, Tino arranged our transportation back to our resort.

120831416.name: relax in paradise
120831416.author: a TripAdvisor user
120831416.reviewBody: very laid back, exceptional service and great people

120648014.name: Huatulco, a true gem!!!!
120648014.author: a TripAdvisor user
120648014.reviewBody:
This was my 5th trip to Huatulco, if you go once, you'll go back, I promise!
I've been there with family, friends, for my wedding and this time I went back for some quiet time with one of my best friends.
Neither of us are big into clubbing so Huatulco was perfect, delicious food, beautiful beaches and warm people.
We took the 9 bays tour with Mr. Primitivo Lopez and it was THE BEST tour I've ever taken... It was a little bit expensive, given the fact that it was a private tour for 2 people but it was totally worth it.
Primitivo really knows how to make you feel safe but still having fun. Before we even left the pier we saw stingrays, then we spotted dolphins -something not that common apparently- various turtles, when we were snorkeling at Cacaluta Beach he got some conch that we ate later at La India beach (I don't think I've ever eaten anything that fresh).  Not a single soul there -except for a couple vendors that come when the big boats bring more people, so they sell drinks but once they leave, nothing-. I felt like in those Corona commercials, just you & the beach.
So if you are planning what to do in your next visit to Huatulco, you know what to do... 
I don't have this number right now, but as soon as I get I'll post. You can also find him on La Crucecita, there are always people trying to sell you tours, just ask about him.

120624696.name: Villa Sol y Mar is paradise!
120624696.author: a TripAdvisor user
120624696.reviewBody: Best place in Huatulco to spend your vacation.\nWe have looked and there is nowhere that comes close to this home and the people that will take care of you there.

119642323.name: Arturo Martinez, travel guide
119642323.author: a TripAdvisor user
119642323.reviewBody: I\'d recommend Arturo Martinez as a travel guide in Huatulco. Six of us hired him for a brief tour of the arera when our ship was in pposrt. He offered an up-to-date, comfortable vehicle. he spoke excellent English. In addition, his knowledge of the area and is willingness to respond to travellers\' interests are imressive. He\'s an excellent alternative to the survey tours offered by cruise ships.

119520922.name: Great Beaches, Beautiful Coastline, No Hassle Tour Guide/Driver
119520922.author: a TripAdvisor user
119520922.reviewBody:
This was our first visit to Huatulco and it is now one of our favorite places in Mexico.   Over the last fifteen years, we've vacationed in many of Mexico's prime destinations.  Huatulco has a magnificent rugged coastline with 9 beautiful bays that are sprinkled with 36 pristine beaches.  Some of the bays/beaches are only accessible by boat.  We visited many of the bays and beaches on foot, by boat and by car.  
We highly recommend Huatulco for travelers who are looking for natural beauty, great beach experiences, water sports, snorkeling, fishing, and friendly locals in a very laid back, authentic Mexican community.  Whether you are a first time or experienced traveler to Mexico a few other things may be on your mind as you plan your trip, namely safety and aggressive vendors (famous in Cancun and Cabo). 

Safety - as with any international travel you always have to be aware of what is happening around you and take necessary precautions.  Beyond that, we felt completely safe in Huatulco.  There is a Naval Base in the area, so there is a regular presence of military and police personnel.  People are friendly and respectful of your personal space.  We spent a lot of time in La Crucecita and Santa Cruz (morning, noon and night) and we did not encounter any threatening person or situation for the entire 2 weeks we were there. 

No Hassle  - one of our least favorite aspects of Mexico travel is the persistent, sometimes overly aggressive vendors at airports, cruise ports, markets and beaches.  Huatulco was a welcome relief from that. Most of the vendors we encountered accepted “No Gracias” and moved on.  Exceptions were at the restaurants at Playa Entrega and Playa Santa Cruz.  The best bet is to pick one quick and tell the rest no, because essentially all of the restaurants are the same.   Another strategy that worked great for us was to pre-arrange tours and a driver.    Prior to our vacation we were referred to an excellent tour guide/driver who speaks English well, drives an air-conditioned recent model year SUV and has strong knowledge of the area.  Armando does not work for a timeshare or other behind the scenes company.  He was primarily interested in ensuring we were comfortable and had a good time in Huatulco.   He is very flexible and adept at tour planning WITHOUT the hassle.   We had good times with Armando as he helped us with a Seven Bay Tour (awesome day with Captain Isidro on the boat Paty), a day at Barro de la Cruz (also great), airport transportation, and even our first trip to the grocery store (Super Che).  Armando is very reasonably priced and we highly recommend him. You can contact Armando Ramirez at armandormzgtz@hotmail.com.

118887872.name: Beautiful, friendly and safe
118887872.author: a TripAdvisor user
118887872.reviewBody: We enjoyed the area very much and look forward to returning

117622229.name: We loved it and would experience it again and recommend it to anyone!
117622229.author: a TripAdvisor user
117622229.reviewBody:
Awesome Experience and would go there again- Dreams Resorts is the way to visit

We caught an 80 pd Swordfish and Valentino that brings the boat gave us a wonderful experience!  He was knowledgeable, friendly and helpful.  Thaks Valentino!!!!

Staff at resort where wonderful and food sunshine fun great too!

Beautiful place!!!!

116574516.name: Yacht Marisol 7 Bay Tour- Ask for TIKO``EXCELLENT``
116574516.author: a TripAdvisor user
116574516.reviewBody:
We just arrived from Dreams Huatulco last night and I just couldn't wait to write about our experience with this gentleman. We met TIKO on the beach very quite guy, a couple at the Resort had recommend us to him so I game him a call and we met him outside our resort.  After discussing the price to Tour the 7 Bays we booked with him, gave him a deposit and I was a little worried I must say!

People please book with this guy, he sent a van to pick us up the next day at 1pm we choose the time also he asked us what brand of beer we liked.  Let me add he was the best price I found for what we wanted to do in Huatulco.  My wife was so scared about getting Sea Sick well let me add Tiko has a 30ft by 10ft Yacht brand new and kept very clean, so she never got sick, plus Tiko knows his boat, smooth sailing!!!

By the way he named his Yacht after his daughter (MARISOL), he played english music, took us snorkeling we did PAY $5 dollars because we had a guy by the name of Celso (PERSONAL GUIDE),  so awesome he caught a Blow Fish and Fishing Star just an out of this world experience. Tiko knows everything about Huatulco and as you arrive at each bay  he will explain the history of it.  I ask him if i can dive from his 2nd floor platform he pulled over at a safe deep place and said Jesus you may jump/dive do whatever you like!!

The Yacht does have a restroom, which was a big plus for my snobby wife and sister!!
We ate at one of the bays food was just ok , and Tiko waited for us not once did he pressure us to hurry up.  He does great fishing trips as well, he showed us lots of pics even took us on mini fishing trip he has all professional gear on board.  I will post pictures very soon.. People you will be approached by dozens of vendors trying to sell you an excursion please book with this guy he is awesome..  I will provide my e-mail should anyone have any questions=jespinoza@cityofwebster.com
Tiko's info will be provided as well....

107578908.name: Huatulco Dreams and fishing with Jorge (Coco Boat)-best day ever !!!
107578908.author: a TripAdvisor user
107578908.reviewBody: We returned May 3/11. from1 week in Huatulco and this was the nicest resort type area we have ever been.....easily. What a Paradise this beautiful place is !! After being flight delayed from Calgary and arriving 12 hours late- once we were in our room we forgot all that and realized all the positives we read about Huatulco were true.....and  then some !!\nAfter reading about some of the food reviews we were a bit apprehensive but we enjoyed all we tried thoroughly and there was always something good ! we only tried the Seaside Grill and the Seafood a-la-cartes otherwise it was buffet or room service.That was a great bonus (free room Service) if you had an extended late afternoon "siesta" and didnt feel like getting fancied up for dinner.....order in....Great !! On Sunday we had the highlight of our trip when we went fishing with a very nice gentleman who had approached us on the beach at Dreams.....Jorge (pronounced Horhay) Valdovinos . He picked us up promptly at the agreed time on Sunday morning and a short drive later we were at his boat COCO and on our way ! Very nice,clean 33 Ft. boat with canopy for shade if you wanted.We were gone less then an hour when we were seeing turtles,pristine beaches not accessable by car, and catching fish ! We also saw a huge Blue Whale,natural faces in rock cliffs, a blow hole on Shore etc. !! Before we returned to Dreams Resort 4 hours after we left, my wife and I had caught 17 MahiMahi and 2 Bonita Tuna !! And seen things we will never forget and the friendly,professional captain and fish finding abilities of Jorge made for an unforgetable experience !! We talked to other people who had gone on other boats with only 4 fish so i think he is a skilled fish finder...lol...another day we made an excursion to LaCrucicita which was also very fun and only a 30 peso taxi ride each way...also the restaurant across the street from Dreams found the NHL play-off games for us !! Awesome!!Beautiful resort,great people,food ,weather and beaches !!! Can\'t wait to go back next year or maybe this fall !! Highly recommended !! Steve And Lori,Calgary.

102695823.name: Great fishing----Great time
102695823.author: a TripAdvisor user
102695823.reviewBody: Have been traveling to Huatulco for years and have used the services of Rudy many times.  His fishing equipment is top self.  He basically will offer two different trips. One more of a fun family type fun fishing trip.  This enables you to get out on the water sight see and catch what he calls small game. It\'s fun and you see a lot, shorter trip and don\'t go out too far. The second trip is more intensive takes you out much further from shore after Marlin and Sailfish. This trip is longer and a bit more expensive. I used his services again on my last trip in March 2011 and it was well worth it . Left Dreams at 7am and boated this wonderful Sailfish at 9:20am. Rudy also encourages catch and release of Bill-fish. He works the beaches at Dreams and Barcelo. He can also be reached at 044 958 585 9114. Most of the guys are good but for some reason we developed a good friendship and understanding. \nP.S. They sell box lunches for a Premium at Dreams. Eat a good breakfast at 7am and order room service the night before wrap it refrigerate it and take fishing the next day. Also empty your mini fridge for beverages. Make sure you tell Rudy to bring ice.

98914161.name: Huatulco a piece of heaven for fishing and people
98914161.author: a TripAdvisor user
98914161.reviewBody: I have been to Huatulco twice now and have stayed at the Dreams Resort, the fishing is great if you go with the ite guide, thatguide is Raymond, to find Raymond ask the security staff at the beach for "EVERYONE KNOWS RAYMOND" they will know exactly who you they need to get, Raymond makes the fishing experience much more than just a boat ride, he becomes your friend and shares stories of his life in Mexico, I can not say enough about Huatulco and the people there, the staff and food and rooms are great, I have travel thru alot of Mexico and the carribean and will make my way back to Huatulco as this place makes you feel at home... Enjoy your time in Huatulco and tell RAYMOND that DAVID from Canada says HI, and you will see that you are a person to him not just a customer cause he will remember you as he does me...

88964942.name: Most Amazing Vacation Ever !!!
88964942.author: a TripAdvisor user
88964942.reviewBody: We went to Haultulco ,Mexico for one week from Nov 23-30/2010  we were relaxing on the beach one day and this man walked up to us and asked us if we wanted to book a fishing trip with him ... we said no cause the hotel rep advised againest it ... but we looked at his pictures anyway and read some of the reviews and recommendation Rudy had received from other tourist and before we knew it my sister in law and I were booking a fishing trip for our husbands for 5 AM the next morning ... when the guys got back the next day they told us that not only did Rudy come through for the guys on the fishing end of it ... they also saw all kinds of Dolphins and sea turtles and they were only 12 miles away from the shore line .... everything Rudy said they would catch and see they did ... we were all so impressed by this honest kind hearted and friendly fella we decided to book another trip the next day .... this time we went out at 8 AM and within 10 minutes of being on the water we caught 4 fish and we were only 4 miles out ... the guys caught 10 fish the day before as well ... and the other boats on the water were so surprised that our group was having such good luck ... but Rudy knows his fish and he knows how to read the water his knowledge made out 2 day fishing experience one we will remember FOREVER ... oh and I have never been on water I can\'t swim infact I am terrified of water ... but I wanted the experience so bad I thought I would try it and Rudy \'s  \nlittle boat was so smooth and he was so careful and thoughtful ... to ensure I had a good experience it was so amazing ... Rudy is such a soft spoken kind guy I would recommend him to anyone with or without water or fishing experience ... I myself caught two fish with Rudy guiding me on how to do it ... we caught BONITA\'S , SPANISH MACKERAL AND MAWHEE ( 30 LB ) in fact we were there for one week and our brother in law and his wife stayed for an extra week and they went out with Rudy again it cost us 200.00 US for the boat for 4 hrs and that\'s it ... no hidden cost and no fish limit . The hotel reps advise against this type of booking cause you have no protection if anything happens out there and also because they want the tourist money for themselves ... but hey we all have to make a living right ... and Im not saying that all these guys on the beach are like Rudy ... but I can asure Rudy is the real deal ... and when asking for him your suppose to say your looking for RUDY WITH THE STRIP ... he has a patch of hair from the bottom of his chin up to his lip and they call that a strip .... anyway we stayed at the Barcelo Hotel which I would also recommend ... Book your next Huatulco fishing trip with Rudy with the Strip and don\'t be alarmed by his small boat like I was ... the boat is safe and it\'s not the boat that will help get your catch of the day it\'s Rudy\'s knowledge of the water and the fish .... Have fun with Rudy with the Strip ....Can can book all kinds of tours with Rudy !!!

87296821.name: Choosing a Scuba Shop
87296821.author: a TripAdvisor user
87296821.reviewBody:
I listen to a lot of people who complain about the cost of diving in the area.  So you go out and shop around.  Remember buyer beware.  Most dive guides are good or excellent, I don't want to slam someones personal character or abilities. All the dive guides or instructors I know in the area are, very good.  It is the total service you get that concerns me.  The quality of the dive is important, but I also want to know that I will be looked after in the event of an emergency.
There are a few scuba shops in the area and not are equal in the quality of services they provide.  Here are a few things to consider when selecting your dive operator.
Will the shop let you look at their compressor.  Some dive operators don't follow proper standards to ensure high quality air.  Some shops never do the required air test.
Do dive the dive boats have the appropriate safety equipment on board such as emergency radios, emergency Oxygen and first aid equipment?  This equipment is expensive to obtain, and some smaller operators cannot afford to obtain them.  
What shape and condition is the rental equipment?  You may book a trip from a kiosk and arrive at the boat only to find that the equipment is old and tattered.
You will find that most shops offer dives at a similar price, but you may find some that are a lot cheaper.  Ask your self why this is the case.  Ask the provider some of the questions above.  Be safe and enjoy your dives.

LBJ

56937340.name: Adventure Plus
56937340.author: a TripAdvisor user
56937340.reviewBody: I\'ve been to Huatulco twice and each time I\'ve experienced fabulous adventur experiences with the people of Rancho Tangolunda.  When booking your adventure tour make sure you ask for Rancho Tangolunda Tours.  I\'ve enjoyed horse back  riding and the ATV\'s.  Each tour has been spectacular !  I\'ve yet to try the rapids and repelling but they are next on my list.  For exciting adventure visit Rancho Tangolunda.

56720992.name: Fishing with Rudy in Huatulco
56720992.author: a TripAdvisor user
56720992.reviewBody: Me and my wife Brigitte went fishing with Rudy from the Dreams resort in Huatulco.We caught 10 Bonitas and 1 Marlin.Rudy worked hard at finding the fish and we did quite well considering that no one else was catching much.Rudy has a great personality and made the entire trip fun and successful.My name is Leo Badiou from Winnipeg,Manitoba and I highly recommend Rudy for fishing or snorkelling or whatever.You can contact Rudy at Cel.[--] or E-mail: [--]

56050347.name: Roberto Hernandez Vazquez,
56050347.author: a TripAdvisor user
56050347.reviewBody:
Hello 
We returned from our Huatulco vacation on  5 February 2010. Once again the weather the people and the accommodations has made this a place we want to return to. This being our third time in this area we didn't do to much in the way of canned tours, we did and have for the last three years gone out snorkeling and casting with Roberto Hernandez Vazquez. He has become a familiar face and Roberto has given us comfortable and safe excursions.  Roberto has given my camera a great work out, we have had the great fortune on what I like to call those" National Geographic" moments.  Ask for him on the beach.
This is the stuff you just never forget.
Lindsay and Lori (Bambi)

55433982.name: shopping is great close to your resort
55433982.author: a TripAdvisor user
55433982.reviewBody: We found that the shopping directly outside our resort had a great deal to offer.  Prices were comparable to town and the two Zapotec Weavers (the Ruiz brothers) did great work at an incredible price.  It\'s a nice way to pass a couple of hours too!

27276308.name: Our favorite trip in Huatulco
27276308.author: a TripAdvisor user
27276308.reviewBody:
We recently returned from our 6th visit to Huatulco. Having done all of the popular tours over the years we were looking for something differant to do this year. We have always stayed at the Gala resort which is now the "Dreams" resort. We have always booked our trip through Apple Vacations which is the U.S. tour operator similar to Canada's Signature Vacations. Both of these operators have desks at the hotels on Tangalunga Bay. They both strongly recommend booking any day tours through them. They both stress the safety and rip-off issue. Through the years our tours have been booked through Apple. Although the tours were interesting we felt that the price was higher than necessary and that the tours were always crowded. We have also had issues when tipping was asked for. This year we wanted to see the "real" Mexico. We wanted to take a day trip to see the small villages, ports and the people along with any other points of interest. We decided to do this on our own after several people had said that there were a number of English speaking cab drivers willing to do this. Our problem was that we were doing this with another couple and those cabs are small! I continued to talk with people around the resort and really wasn't comfortable with the cab idea. Finally I met Luis Coca who ran a small concierge service in the plaza across the street from Dreams and the Barcello. After talking with him for 10 minutes in some detail he had planned a trip for us in a comfortable Chevy Suburban. I might add that Luis's English was flawless and he was easy to speak to. Iwas still a bit uneasy however. I "checked him out with the concierge service at Dreams and found Luis to be highly recommended! He actually had been the manager there for the concierge service before he decided to go out on his own. That was enough for us and we booked the trip for $150.00 for the whole day. We met Arturo Martinez our driver at 9am sharp the next day. He then proceded to show us the sites. We visited a crocadile farm, turtle research center, some pristine beaches and several small villages among other things. We didn't get back until 6 that evening. Arturo also speaks very good English and is very intelligent and extreamly personable. He was able to answer all of our questions as well as giving us vast knowlege of the area. He never left our side and was willing to do anything that we ask of him. If you are looking to do something differant and with a fare price I highly recommend talking with Luis Coca (tel. [--]) or visiting him across the street from Dreams. I also recommend that you ask for Arturo (tel. [--]) In addition to the tour that we took there are many others and Luis is certainly willing to customize a trip that fits your needs! You won't be sorry.

                                      Dave Davis,
                                      Montgomery, Illinois

672901722.name: Beautiful Picturesque Beach & Bay. Clean & Safe. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
672901722.author: a TripAdvisor user
672901722.reviewBody: We loved our visit here to Santa Cruz Bay and the area. In the center of the bay is the cruise ship dock. From the ship, it is about a 150 yard walk to the police/customs security gate. Pedi-taxi\'s are available for $1 p/p and worth it. The security here is pretty tight and comforting. The beach offers nice calm warm waters with no surf and has loads of restaurants, loungers and umbrellas. Behind the beach are many local shops, jewelry stores, beautiful open air Catholic church (must see), tour boat marina and local square. Like a Cabo 40 years ago.\n\nBOTTOM LINE: We really enjoyed our day stay here in the area. Be sure to visit the neighboring town of La Cruceita by $3 taxi to visit the church in the main square and shops. Off the beaten path, go see the Santa Cruz old cemetery up above the town. Very interesting to see the monuments to their dead. Would love to come back and stay here longer next time. Lots to do and see. Hotels range from dirt cheap 2 star to 5 star luxury all-inclusive resorts to meet any budget. MY RATING: 9/10.

666086833.name: Fun ;ocal beach
666086833.author: a TripAdvisor user
666086833.reviewBody: A great little beach right in town.  Good for swimming, no large swells or undertows.  Great to see all the Mexican families enjoying it with the tourists.  Excellent beach bars.  We especially liked Ve el Mar.

664858565.name: Cruise ship stop
664858565.author: a TripAdvisor user
664858565.reviewBody:
The dock for our stop in Huatulco is located at Santa Cruz. This small town has restaurants, marina, shops, a plaza, a beach and is the starting point for excursions inland.
The beach is nice, but some might find it on the smallish side. 
Near Santa Cruz is the town of La Crucecita which is a shot taxi ride away......I was told that you can even walk there.
For those cruisers that don't want to do an excursion but do want to go on shore for a few hours, this is an ideal place to do it.

664618087.name: Lacking palapas and loungers
664618087.author: a TripAdvisor user
664618087.reviewBody: Would not spend any time on this beach. Although protected it has no palapas for shade. If you want shade you pay a restaurant for a table and chair and a drink or food. Not my idea of a day at the beach in +32 temps! Good restaurants on the area are the only saving grace.

664275159.name: Condo visit
664275159.author: a TripAdvisor user
664275159.reviewBody: We went into Santa Cruz a few times during our stay in Huatulco.  We visited the shops around the marina and a condo for future rental.  The condo is situated overlooking the marina, very nice!!

663872083.name: Pretending we\'re cruising
663872083.author: a TripAdvisor user
663872083.reviewBody: Once more, cheap taxi, no guide, great little town with several hotels. Great restaurants, great market... The day we went the Volendam was in Port.

663514629.name: Busy, Busy, Busy
663514629.author: a TripAdvisor user
663514629.reviewBody: The ocean was nice, but not very good for snorkling, lots of local families which made it fun. They add a service charge to your food and drink.

662540473.name: Beautiful area
662540473.author: a TripAdvisor user
662540473.reviewBody: Lots of boats docked this is where most of the boat tours will depart from. Be sure to get some liquor bottles or beer at any of the small stores nearby before you get on the boat for your tour. We saw some whales on our tour of 9 different bays.

661688246.name: Relaxing beach day without spending a lot on a cruise excursion.
661688246.author: a TripAdvisor user
661688246.reviewBody: We walked off our cruise ship and literally walked onto the beach.  It was a lovely beach. Lots of tables and chairs in the shade.  We had one of the best pina coladas ever...mad with amaretto instead of rum.  Delicious and perfect on a hot, sunny day.  We watched another cruise ship leave from the beach. We enjoyed homemade guacamole and a great quesadilla.  The only draw back for me, was the beach front has a number of restaurants and no clear delineation from one to another.  Menus and prices vary. The exchange rate was not clear.  My first time swimming on the pacific coast. A great experience.

659866060.name: Many shops, sights and great people.
659866060.author: a TripAdvisor user
659866060.reviewBody: Went thru this area many times during our stay. Great place with many things to do. The people are great and many speak english. Just a great place to see and sit on the beach and enjoy the sun.

659685971.name: Meh!
659685971.author: a TripAdvisor user
659685971.reviewBody: Pretty and picturesque, but not much of a beach.  More of a docking area for both large and small watercraft.

659027123.name: The Short Cut to Santa Cruz Bay from Crucecita
659027123.author: a TripAdvisor user
659027123.reviewBody: Rather than taking a cab from La Crucecita there is a short cut walk over the hills separating the two locations. Begin your walk from La Crucecita at the local government office known as Delegacion de Transito del Estado or just use Google Maps for Camino A Santa Cruz or Corredor Turistico Las Crucecitas.
