The walk to Santa Cruz from here is about 1.75 km. Two thirds is uphill and the remainder downhill into Santa Cruz. There are numerous shade trees on the way up and back, but be aware that the heat of the day is extremely hot on the cement walkway and make sure you have an adequate supply of water with you. All in all an adventure and you can experience a real Mexican walk in the heat.

657025133.name: Quiet
657025133.author: a TripAdvisor user
657025133.reviewBody: Quiet area. marina to walk about great beach to swim. Hardly anyone there. Great number of places to eat and drink at.

654848700.name: Great swimming and people watching beach.
654848700.author: a TripAdvisor user
654848700.reviewBody: There are always lots of tourists around this beach. Lots of excellent restaurants for food and drink. Very inexpensive . The beach has an easy approach into the ocean so that makes it greet for swimming.

653053957.name: Amazing Day!
653053957.author: a TripAdvisor user
653053957.reviewBody: We took the chance to go on this excursion. Much better price than hotel offerings.  Valentino and his nephew took us and another couple we met   We caught Bonita fish, saw tons of dolphin, about a dozen sea turtles and went snorkeling off several coves.  The nephew swam with us, diving super far down and bringing up sea snails \ud83d\udc0c!  We never saw the crowded boats going into the open cave of pink rock.  This was an awesome personal day.  Would highly recommend!\nButch & Monique, St. Charles MO

652977794.name: Dinner out!
652977794.author: a TripAdvisor user
652977794.reviewBody: Evening restaurants by the sea!  How bad can it be!  Enjoyed the ambiance of the evening here! Nice to see the port full of fishing boats, color and people!

651135654.name: Kind of Dead in the Evening.
651135654.author: a TripAdvisor user
651135654.reviewBody: We were surprised many restaurants by the bay and the beach close early at night. Not much life by the bay at night.

651031765.name: Friendly beach
651031765.author: a TripAdvisor user
651031765.reviewBody: Nice beach with great vendors for food and drinks. Short walk from cruise ships and local hotels. Good spot for young kids to swim.

650179939.name: Fun walk
650179939.author: a TripAdvisor user
650179939.reviewBody:
Nice weather and beautiful views, friendly people, the small town had celebrations and bazaar, it was lively. Nice place to go for a stroll visit the park, go to town visit the church, and do some shopping. The paleteria (Ice cream shop, near the town church was amazing)
Great location to get some Mexican vanilla at the market nearby, all kind of Chiles and Jamaica dry flowers for teas and aguas.
Best place for shopping silver is “The silver nugget” owners are very honest and fair with pricing, they will accommodate your needs like sizing of jewellery, I highly recommended the owner Mr. Atilano Cintora and his wife were amazing

650157414.name: Cruise to Santa Cruz
650157414.author: a TripAdvisor user
650157414.reviewBody: This is the perfect place for people watching and one of the funnest daytime experiences in Huatulco. If you want to get off resort and have some laughs and meet some great people this is the place. A mix of nationals on holiday, out of country tourists, locals, vendors and open air restaurants. Grab a beachside table and watch the cruise ships come in. We had a delightful afternoon with a couple from Cornwall England on an around the world cruise. The beach and water are both great, get the sunscreen on and a cerveza in hand. Go local in Santa Cruz.

649941594.name: A fun day
649941594.author: a TripAdvisor user
649941594.reviewBody: We visited the marina a few different times.  Always fun.  One time we went specifically to see the cruise ship docked.  Other times on catamaran excursions to the bays or just to shop and explore. The people are super friendly.  The merchants are not overly pushy and there is almost no begging.  A peaceful and enjoyable time.\n

649892623.name: Do not go on Cruise Ship day
649892623.author: a TripAdvisor user
649892623.reviewBody: Nice little beach, however the restaraunt vendors are like pirahnas...pretty crowded on cruise ship days

649219864.name: Beautiful beach for a dip
649219864.author: a TripAdvisor user
649219864.reviewBody: This beach is great not usually too crowded. Lots of tables and chairs, lots of restaurants as well.

649137365.name: Beautiful beach
649137365.author: a TripAdvisor user
649137365.reviewBody: Beautiful busy beach.  Lots of restaurants ocean front. The water is calm and great for swimming.  Also some shops around the beach.  Saturday has a local market.  Lots of things to enjoy and all within walking distance.

649013397.name: Fun place to walk around and grab a bite to eat
649013397.author: a TripAdvisor user
649013397.reviewBody: Although I stayed on nearby Playa Chahue (about a 12 minute walk), I enjoyed walking around Santa Cruz Bay on several occasions during my 3-day stay in the Huatulco area. The marina is where the 5- and 7-bay excursions depart from, and there\'s a lot to see and do just walking around the 4-block radius--including the cruise ship port, the beach with several beach-side restaurants, a lovely chapel, and a park with a gazebo and lots of live music in the evenings. I suppose in some respects Santa Cruz Bay is pretty touristy because of the cruise ship port, but in reality, there\'s only one ship in port weekly (Holland America), so it\'s not really "overrun" by tourists as some reviews make it out ot be. At this point, the ship is in every Tuesday, and I thought it was fun to see the ship in port and experience the vibe of the area when it was buzzing with cruise ship day trippers as well as when they were gone and things quieted down. There are several good restaurants either on the beach or around the plaza for dining al fresco, and the overall ambiance of the area makes for some nice strolls.

648989615.name: Santa Cruz Bay, Huatulco
648989615.author: a TripAdvisor user
648989615.reviewBody: Santa Cruz Bay is just one of the many bays in the Huatulco area.  It is the site of a cruise ship dock.  A number of smaller hotels are located here along with restaurants, both on the beach and nearby.  Close to the larger Mexican village of La Crucecita.  A pleasant place to stay and visit.  Swimming is good.  Snorkeling along the rocks, but vision can be impaired when a cruise ship churns the water!

648222738.name: Beach Day
648222738.author: a TripAdvisor user
648222738.reviewBody: We had a relaxing day on the sand in Santa Cruze, a good knowledgeable waitress, cold beverages, a tasty snack what more could one ask for? We spent around 6 hours there and will repeat it next week.

647789131.name: Beautiful spot
647789131.author: a TripAdvisor user
647789131.reviewBody: Nice little town to visit to buy souvenirs to eat or just relax in the small Beach. The Holiday Inn is a beautiful little Boutique Hotel in Santa Cruz. Extremely safe to walk and tour the entire Bay

646970748.name: Not a favorite in area
646970748.author: a TripAdvisor user
646970748.reviewBody: Close and convenient to most hotels in area, but more crowded and not as clean. I would taxi to beach out of Santa Cruz for better beach experience.

645842245.name: Neat place
645842245.author: a TripAdvisor user
645842245.reviewBody: It was very busy during the holidays but there are a lot of shops and restaurants around here. Our 7 bay boat trip was out of here.

645429958.name: Beautiful bay
645429958.author: a TripAdvisor user
645429958.reviewBody:
Our cruise ship stopped here and the bay/town was so beautiful on the way in and out.  

Town was very clean and quiet.  We visited here on a Saturday and they had an organic farmers market in the grass park area.  

Quiet and not crowded and lots of shops and restaurants.

Lots of beautiful places around this area.

645402508.name: busy
645402508.author: a TripAdvisor user
645402508.reviewBody: We were there a few times, mostly due that it was our hotel beach club. \nMostly it was too busy and during New Years time it was dirty, as was the water. Lots of shops and restaurants

643617212.name: Turtles in the Marina!
643617212.author: a TripAdvisor user
643617212.reviewBody: We hired a private boat to take us on a tour of the bays and to do some snorkeling.  Our guide picked us up at our resort and took us to the bay.  You have to get a ticket to get by the guards which our captain got for us.  There are washroom facilities inside the gate but BEWARE! there are no toilet seats - normal for mexico and no toilet paper either, best go beforehand.  We got to our boat and cruised out of the bay, there were no cruise ships in that day so it was quite quiet and enjoyable.  There are places to swim etc but we were only passing through.  We saw three turtles in the bay which was pretty cool.  It is quite small but has lots of boats and on a cruise ship day I would expect it to be very busy.  Nice area.

642509077.name: Hard pass
642509077.author: a TripAdvisor user
642509077.reviewBody: This place is a nightmare.  Tourist trap packed with people, cruise ships, overpriced restaurants, and people bothering you to buy stuff on the beach. I\'m surprised it\'s so highly rated - likely because it dumps cruisers here for the day.  If you can, go elsewhere, there are much better beaches in the area.  We walked to check it out and immediately turned around.

641355063.name: Walk around
641355063.author: a TripAdvisor user
641355063.reviewBody: This is a lovely little town to walk around and catch a boat to go out on an excursion. The little church has the most serene feeling too it and if you can find a local to ask the history of the are, do it. \nOur only issue was the never ending constant bombardment of people trying g to sell us stuff and to come into stores. It was what made us cut our trip there short.

641154699.name: Great Little Bay
641154699.author: a TripAdvisor user
641154699.reviewBody: Great little bay with a nice beach, Marina, restaurants, shopping and the cruise ship dock.  Most fishing trips start at the marina as well as the bays of Huatulco tours.  They cost $350 pesos per person at the pier.  A lot more if you book through the hotels or tour guides.  \nLots of shade on the beach in restaurants or under umbrellas.  Great beach for swimming with sandy bottom and no drop offs.  \nA great place to spend the day.

639269495.name: dirty
639269495.author: a TripAdvisor user
639269495.reviewBody: this beach is gross. lots of boats, oil and debris in the water and on top of that it is crowded because it is the easiest to get to

639194084.name: The main beach area
639194084.author: a TripAdvisor user
639194084.reviewBody: This is the main beach area in Huatulco. Lots of restaurants and shops. The beach area is small but sufficient for the number of people who are usually there.

638911447.name: A Nice place to Wander
638911447.author: a TripAdvisor user
638911447.reviewBody: This is a nice place to wander around and look at the shops, have a coffee, watch the boats and just sit at the beach.

638074747.name: This is Where You Will Find Everything    !
638074747.author: a TripAdvisor user
638074747.reviewBody:
Boats will take you fishing, boats will take you  diving and snorkeling , boats will take you ti see the turtles
and the dolphins and the whales,and boats will take you to see the 32 beaches  in the 9 Bays of Huatulco.
Then you can shop till you drop and eat till you burst ! There on Saturdays there is a farmers market near by.
After that you can go to the beach and swim or check out the tourists getting off the cruise ships that  stop
there on a regular bases.

637735550.name: Good for the price
637735550.author: a TripAdvisor user
637735550.reviewBody: Nice boat ride past the bays. Decent snorkeling at the one beach were you stop. As most excursions, always bring those extra pesos for tips and unexpected expenses. You need pay 100 pesos for an umbrella and two chairs on the one beach as you spend over an hour there, or you will have no escape from the hot sun. Good excursion for a fairly cheap price. Only complaint is it was to long of a lunch stop at the one beach. A one hour stop would have been suffice. All in all, nice way to spend the day, and only 350-400 pesos a person.

637449781.name: Cruise ship dock
637449781.author: a TripAdvisor user
637449781.reviewBody: Along with cruises comes high pressure sales. If you like that vibe you will like this beach. Lots of restaurants.

636732400.name: Roberto from Yellow Fin was AMAZING!
636732400.author: a TripAdvisor user
636732400.reviewBody: We had the BEST day with Roberto from Yellow Fin.  We booked with him on the beach in front of Dreams.  He picked us up at our resort and took us the short drive to Santa Cruz marina.  We saw 100\'s of dolphins (jumping right beside the boat), sea turtles, caught a mahi-mahi fish (he sent us with some to have cooked up at resort) and snorkelled.  Roberto worked hard to make sure we all enjoyed ourselves.  I\'ve never been on a better boat tour.  We can\'t wait to book with him again next year!

636377231.name: Cute Little Fishing Village
636377231.author: a TripAdvisor user
636377231.reviewBody: The bay and the water are absolutely beautiful.  It\'s like a step back in time to an authentic fishing village.  Little beachside restaurants are open air & have the freshest seafood on earth.  Litterally straight from the ocean to your plate.

635923696.name: Great beach.
635923696.author: a TripAdvisor user
635923696.reviewBody: Smaller beach area, but very quiet when we were there. Downfall is when the cruise ships come in as it stirs up the water.

635059595.name: Nice to swim
635059595.author: a TripAdvisor user
635059595.reviewBody: It is nice to swim beach and children can play in the water here, however those plastic chairs of all restourants makes this beach looking cheap.\nIt is not cheap to eat in those restourants!\nMany locals around.

634954934.name: Deep sea fishing with yellowfin roberto
634954934.author: a TripAdvisor user
634954934.reviewBody: 6 times with roberto yellowfin, a must to do when visiting huatulco! He is the greates man to go with! Very realable, experienced, safe..you will see tortles,dolphins,catch tuna,salefish,mahi mahi..he is passionate about his job and realy take care of you!! Also doing the bay tour and snorkling.you will not regret

632974015.name: A two day adventure
632974015.author: a TripAdvisor user
632974015.reviewBody: Started of on a pleasant walk on a Sunday afternoon. Just watching the sights. Lots of families, couples and groups of all sizes. Playing on the beach or at the restaurants. Musicians of varying types wandering around. Mariachi, drummers, buskers. Lots to look at. Then it seems I found the guys. I started watching this young man shuck oysters. I have always loved them back home in Canada and listening to folks say they were always concerned with freshness at the beach. Well Antonio was still wet from when he was diving for them. So I ordered a dozen and while he was shucking away, met Isreal, a waiter of a restaurant very close. A Mazing! Had so much fun I brought a friend the next day. Before the food went and had a paddle board lesson and got pretty toasty and then time for some pints and a snack. We did one round of oysters and then had the scallops. Next level! Oooo the red sauce... Best time at the beach ever. This was a nice change from the regular sit down at the restaurants.  Good there too!

631677069.name: To wander met people and get helpful places to wander around for seeing everything in Santa Cruz
631677069.author: a TripAdvisor user
631677069.reviewBody: Enjoy boat cruise, of the different bays with beautiful beaches and meeting people from fishermen to waiters easy people with great polite talking for us all

608494087.name: Quaint marina town
608494087.author: a TripAdvisor user
608494087.reviewBody: Love Santa Cruz, nice marina town, lots of little stores to explore and shopping spots.   They have restaurants on the beach and tons of fishing and sightseeing vessels.   I also see quite a few new condo\'s that have been built.   Pretty cool to check out.

604223954.name: Pretty beach, but no parasols!
604223954.author: a TripAdvisor user
604223954.reviewBody: The beach itself is perfect for swimming and the water is beautiful. The sand is quite fine and the beach can be busy. We bought a parasol to use for shade, however, we were asked to take it down due to spoiling the view. Due to the intensity of the sun we left the beach and went home.

599883643.name: Nice day trip
599883643.author: a TripAdvisor user
599883643.reviewBody: Spent the day snorkeling, shopping and having a bite to eat. really enjoyed our day here after being on the boat for a few hours.

582033354.name: Nice port of call !
582033354.author: a TripAdvisor user
582033354.reviewBody: Our ship was docked right beside the village and we decided to discover this scenic port on our own . At the end of the Santa Cruz Bay , less than 300 meters (1/4 mile) , we found a lot of small shops , many restaurants and a beautiful little church ! The local people were very friendly and the cold beer was delicious !

579495087.name: PANAMA CANAL CRUISE PORT
579495087.author: a TripAdvisor user
579495087.reviewBody: We thoroughly enjoyed our day ar this lovely port and nearby town of La Crucetia.  This whole area of Mexico is one stunning beach after another.  When one disembarks there will be taxi drivers offering you a ride into town for $5. Continue walking 30 or so yards and you\'ll find drivers who will take you for $1.50. On cruise days there are stalls near the ship selling souvenirs and there are restaurants, but I urge you to go into the small, charming, and very authentic town for a while.  It\'s very walkable and non-touristy.

573350714.name: Pretty beach close to Cruise Ship Port
573350714.author: a TripAdvisor user
573350714.reviewBody: I came here for a day on the HA Maasdam ship.  I didn\'t get off right away.  When I did I found a driver that offered a private tour for 3-4 hours for $40.  He took me to numerous spots for photos - a light house, views of the bays, and shopping downtown.  It was very low key and low stress.  I\'ve been to Mexico many, many times.  I did find a nice woven leather belt for my husband for $20.  The tour driver let me use his cell phone to call my husband in the US.  We talked for 10 minutes or so and he did not even charge me!  Pleasant afternoon.  Wait till after the crowds get off the cruise ship and get a better deal for what you want to do.

570789993.name: Cute Little Marina Town
570789993.author: a TripAdvisor user
570789993.reviewBody: This little town is very quaint with a church that has a legend about a man with a cross that saves the people.  It\'s very picturesque and the local people are super friendly.

570607041.name: Day trip
570607041.author: a TripAdvisor user
570607041.reviewBody: Quick visit to Santa Cruz from the Secrets in Huatulco.   Found it very clean and frien my place to shop.  Thanks for a great memory.

570147135.name: Beautiful Bay-Pushy Sales People
570147135.author: a TripAdvisor user
570147135.reviewBody: The Bay was very pretty but extremely crowded the day we went. The shops were very pushy, we ended up totally avoiding the shopping area because of it. If you want to shop go to La Crucecita.

569719180.name: Favourite beach for lunch & cervasa
569719180.author: a TripAdvisor user
569719180.reviewBody: Caulderon is our favourite waiter on the beach.  We met him 3 years ago and he was fantastic and he is still there and still fanatastic.  He tried hard to teach us Spanish.... we failed!

568676927.name: Friendly and great views
568676927.author: a TripAdvisor user
568676927.reviewBody: All participating restos and beach bars provide great and friendly service.\nGreat views of the bay & marina!\nPalapas and umbrellas galore.

568544743.name: Ok
568544743.author: a TripAdvisor user
568544743.reviewBody: A bit busy. Lots of street sellers which make it less relaxing. Nice beach otherwise. Santa Cruz is a nice area.

568308108.name: Busy! Colorful! Fun!
568308108.author: a TripAdvisor user
568308108.reviewBody: Access to day trips by boat, fun shopping, restaurants and nightlife. We booked boat trip that included port access fee. On cruise ship days port fees are waived. Don\'t shop at the market on cruise ship days, as prices rise!

568047763.name: Fun place to visit and shop.  Lots to do!
568047763.author: a TripAdvisor user
568047763.reviewBody: Cruise ships stop here but not always so make sure you arrive when ships have departed.  Fun shops, lots of touristy tingle/tunnle to buy.  Many places to eat from casual to fine dining.

566872368.name: Good swimming beach
566872368.author: a TripAdvisor user
566872368.reviewBody: This area is home to the cruise ship terminal, sport fishing, marine tours etc. so it\'s pretty busy. The beach and beach clubs are great. There are several good restaurants, and Niko\'s coffee bar. The Saturday market is great!

565356379.name: Beach Santa cruz
565356379.author: a TripAdvisor user
565356379.reviewBody: Was there every day for a week. Calm waters  clear a.nd clean for swimming or for children playing. Not  that long of a beach but still very nice. Within  a 10 minute walking distance  from our hotel. The marina is a 5 minute walk  and the markets are also close to walk  if you want a change . Restraunt along beach also. It\'s a busy beach.

563988416.name: Beaches in Santa Cruz
563988416.author: a TripAdvisor user
563988416.reviewBody: January is a great month to travel to huatulco.  Weather is so beautiful. Beaches are beautiful.  The people there are the greatest.   Was a great vacation and I would go back at the toss of a dime.

563426762.name: Very commercial
563426762.author: a TripAdvisor user
563426762.reviewBody: This is one of the most touristy areas in town. The water is pretty dirty in this bay so the vision is poor. We visited it twice as our beach club was located there. Ok for a beer and some pictures.

562661508.name: Nice little marina
562661508.author: a TripAdvisor user
562661508.reviewBody: The beach is pretty small but the marina is quite extensive given the size of the bay.  Lovely place to walk around with lots of nice cafes.

562573913.name: Wow seedoos 7 bay tour
562573913.author: a TripAdvisor user
562573913.reviewBody: Great excursion..we say a blue whale and BEAUTIFUL beaches great snorkling at the end of the tour.  \ud83d\ude0a

561759331.name: Great People watching
561759331.author: a TripAdvisor user
561759331.reviewBody: The bay in Santa Cruz has a fun length of beach which offers a number of small beachside restaurants with on beach seating and even lounge chairs to work on your tan.  You have have a snack or enjoy a lunch and take in the sights and sounds of the beach.  Maybe there\'ll even be a cruise ship on the dock!

561023509.name: Too congested
561023509.author: a TripAdvisor user
561023509.reviewBody: Been there twice, really not sure of the attraction. Certainly not a highlight of our tour around Huatulco.

560542716.name: Very quaint town with lots of restaurants
560542716.author: a TripAdvisor user
560542716.reviewBody: Very quaint with good restaurants, lots of feral cats, please feed them while you are visiting. The beach is decent but not very clea, there is a lot of litter, please help clean up the beach and not leave your refuse behind.

560542249.name: Quaint Little Marina
560542249.author: a TripAdvisor user
560542249.reviewBody: Love this little marina. We went to a restaurant called  Vel Maar. There were vendors walking up to us while up on the beach offering to sell us stuff. There was a wedding going on next-door in the open air church. There were locals playing on the beach while we ate our dinner.  It was a lovely authentic Mexican experience!

560123193.name: Quick morning trip
560123193.author: a TripAdvisor user
560123193.reviewBody: We went to see the port and a cruise ship was in . Only recommendation don\'t go when ships are in port , as some of the travellers who get off the ship can be quite rude .\nQuaint town with a fair size market.

559764219.name: Great Relaxing Area/Shopping
559764219.author: a TripAdvisor user
559764219.reviewBody: We went there for some shopping.  Once we finished, we wandered over to the beach area.  Many restaurants in the shade with great food & drinks.  The beach was clean and the water clear.

559298127.name: Excellent beach
559298127.author: a TripAdvisor user
559298127.reviewBody: My wife and me spent most of our 2 weeks in the bay. Great restaurants at great prices. If you buy something you can get a table on the beach for the day at no extra cost.

558585221.name: Just so beautiful
558585221.author: a TripAdvisor user
558585221.reviewBody: This was the bay we left from for our day tour. When your tour leaves from here there is a record of the boat leaving as well as the number of people on board. Traveling with a young child, this was important to us

558380895.name: Great beach ... and shopping and restaurants and...
558380895.author: a TripAdvisor user
558380895.reviewBody: Best beach we visited - always swimmable with fine sand and small crowds. Even on cruise ship day, the restaurants and shops were not over full. Church on Sunday so lots of shops are closed. Have a drink on the beach at night and let the ocean waves lap at your feet.

557827377.name: Lovely swimming beach
557827377.author: a TripAdvisor user
557827377.reviewBody: Lovely swimming beach within walking distance of all the Santa Cruz hotels.  Not the clearest water.  Lots of restaurants and bars to rent umbrellas and chairs from.

557790744.name: An early get away
557790744.author: a TripAdvisor user
557790744.reviewBody: Great area, restaurants, bars, coffee shops, shopping, nice beach and tours and rentals of all kinds to boot.

557002590.name: Just OK
557002590.author: a TripAdvisor user
557002590.reviewBody: We visited to check out the beach and organic market. Organic market very cool and worth checking out. The bay itself is not very appealing compared to other beaches we have been to in Huatulco. We also found the shops/ restaurants very pushy in this area compared to any other area we have visited in Huatulco. We love huatulco and one day likely will give Santa Cruz another chance but definitely not in a hurry\ud83d\ude0a for first timers go to la bocana and get a mud bath instead, much better experience!

552742007.name: Busy full service spot, nice beach
552742007.author: a TripAdvisor user
552742007.reviewBody: The area has many activities and shops/markets to peruse and great bars/restaurants, gets a bit overloaded when the cruise ships come in.

551525080.name: Santa Cruz visit
551525080.author: a TripAdvisor user
551525080.reviewBody: If you are staying close by definitely worth a walk through and check out the beach and shops.  Also not a bad idea to exchange CND to pesos at the scotia bank as gave us about 8 cents more on the dollar vs the resort, remember your passport if exchanging money.

548763272.name: Jellyfish
548763272.author: a TripAdvisor user
548763272.reviewBody: We were shuttled out there from our hotel to the "Beach Club," but when I was stung by jellyfish, we turned around and shuttled right back to the hotel pool.\n\nThere was a giant US Coastguard ship docked, so it killed the buzz a bit by blocking the view.

547262042.name: I love Santa Cruz
547262042.author: a TripAdvisor user
547262042.reviewBody: This little town is very quaint and charming. It does not feel like hustle & bustle. There are lots of shops and restaurants to choose from. I love it.

545818786.name: Warm water - nice sand beach
545818786.author: a TripAdvisor user
545818786.reviewBody: Very nice area, beaches are clean.  Several shops and restaurants along the beach.  Small fishing village feel to the area and not far from inland hotels & city.

545765317.name: Incredible Views!
545765317.author: a TripAdvisor user
545765317.reviewBody: This another must visit little town with an organic market, huge assortment of restaurants and great photo opps. We loved the lunch & beers at Mar Y Luz - quaint little shack on the beach (reminded me of Goa)

545639096.name: Nice small town on the coast
545639096.author: a TripAdvisor user
545639096.reviewBody: No doubt what was once a charming fishing village, has now transformed into tourism destination. Lots of restaurants, bars and shops. Thank goodness the day we were there, there was no cruise ship visiting as the place would have been completely overrun by passengers from the ship. \nWorth visiting, if you want to take a break from your Resort, in our case, about CA$4.00 taxi ride (one way) from Las Brisas Resort where we were staying.

545547796.name: Warm, clean water
545547796.author: a TripAdvisor user
545547796.reviewBody: The Bay is a great place to spend a day swimming, lounging in beach chairs or enjoying a meal. Restaurants have designated "beach caf\u00e9" space and take great care to make sure your every need is met.

544654098.name: come market day
544654098.author: a TripAdvisor user
544654098.reviewBody:
There is not much happening here like in nearby Crucecita, but market day in the town square adds a lot to the interest, only every second Saturday.
When cruise ships arrive the place is in action, otherwise limited to bay cruises and mostly empty restaurants.
There are some local hotels and Castillo and Holiday Inn. A few small stores surround the market.
Cafe Huatulco in the centre of the square has excellent coffee and a good place to watch the world go by.

544487936.name: Shops, Marina, Restaurants and a Beach!
544487936.author: a TripAdvisor user
544487936.reviewBody: As we stayed at the Binniguenda, this bay was an easy 10 minute walk from the resort. This is one of the nine beautiful bays in the Huatulco area. It has the most amenities in my opinion. There are restaurants, a little church, little market, marina, cruise ship pier, small beach, and nightclub. There is a little square with the best coffee as well. It is worth checking out. Taxis are easily accessible.

544100341.name: Calm waters
544100341.author: a TripAdvisor user
544100341.reviewBody: The beach has lots of activity with many restaurants, street entertainment and safe waters. Cruise ships dock here

543254775.name: Developed
543254775.author: a TripAdvisor user
543254775.reviewBody:
This is the most heavily developed of Huatulco's beaches and is the most heavily used. The plus side of this is that it has the most amenities; restaurants, bars (and their bathrooms) souvenir stores, etc. The negative is lots of people, including the vendors and hawkers who stalk the sands. To be fair, most of them are pretty laid back compared to other parts of Mexico and will leave you alone if you ask.

The beach itself is sheltered, and good for swimming. However it's bisected by the cruise ship pier, which is kind of an eyesore. It's good for kids and families. When we were there, there were a couple of days of "mal aqua", a jellyfish infestation that causes stinging and welts. You might want to inquire before you go in.

Anywhere else this would be a very good or even excellent beach but compared to the other magnificent beaches along Huatulco's coast, it only comes up as average.

543020103.name: Get your boat ride here
543020103.author: a TripAdvisor user
543020103.reviewBody: Clean, beautiful bay,this is where most people pickup a boat ride for the day or just a couple of hours to go on the 7 Bays tour.

542046759.name: Quite Beach
542046759.author: a TripAdvisor user
542046759.reviewBody: Nice quite beach, busier on weekends with locals which is nice. Lots of places to eat and you can walk into the water with no worries. Swimming and snorkling then enjoy the sun.

540251808.name: Cute Bay
540251808.author: a TripAdvisor user
540251808.reviewBody: Santa Cruz Bay isn\u2019t too far from Huatulco and worth the motorbike or taxi into \u201ctown.\u201d We visited and had a nice walk around.

540242803.name: If you like surfing book at caf\u00e9 surf
540242803.author: a TripAdvisor user
540242803.reviewBody: We booked a surf trip for 8 friends. Odi picked us up right on time and took us to Barra De La Cruz for a great morning of surfing. For around 1500peso a per person it was amazing trip at a great price.

540075392.name: Pretty
540075392.author: a TripAdvisor user
540075392.reviewBody: Our cruise ship docked here and I was a bit wary.  Lovely dancers greeting you and right behind them guys with guns!  Not sure what that is all about so we stayed close to the ship.  Had a stroll around the town, ate some lunch (great nachos and icy cold beer) and headed back.

539220758.name: Yuck!
539220758.author: a TripAdvisor user
539220758.reviewBody: A bay where the cruise ships come in.  Yucky for swimming. The water was murky.  This is one of those cruise ship villages.

513806642.name: Just another Bay!
513806642.author: a TripAdvisor user
513806642.reviewBody: Stopped here for a quick walk around... Nothing special.  We were on a golf outing, and took a tour of the local community.

513476683.name: Beautiful area
513476683.author: a TripAdvisor user
513476683.reviewBody: Very pretty to wonder around. Lots of restaurants and bars. Small beach. We would walk down in the morning from our hotel and see the cruise ships dock. This was the first time we have seen 3 ships in a row over a weekend.

498013925.name: Nice beach
498013925.author: a TripAdvisor user
498013925.reviewBody: Nice beach to relax, eat, and play in the water, we had a great time, food was ok, they provided showers, and everything you need to enjoy the beach.

486720863.name: A place i could live
486720863.author: a TripAdvisor user
486720863.reviewBody: Beautiful. The town is so welcoming to tourists.  You feel so safe and at home.   Definitely a must see if you visit Huatulco.   Very clean and lots to see.

483550871.name: Lovely bay, clean and tropical
483550871.author: a TripAdvisor user
483550871.reviewBody: This is a lovely bay when we stopped via cruise boat.  The open church is lovely to sit and reflect.  Vendor market/shops are laid back and reasonable prices.  The small boat harbour, lack of road traffic, beach right off the dock make this a lovely port of call to sit on the many many great beaches near by or even the one right off the ship.

481307895.name: Lovely
481307895.author: a TripAdvisor user
481307895.reviewBody:
Lovely area and harbor 

Lots of food and great fresh margaritas 

I will say that children sabotage the environment though .

It's full of children making noise

477178574.name: Close to our Hotel
477178574.author: a TripAdvisor user
477178574.reviewBody: Villablanca\'s beach club is on this bay. A small bay but very quiet and relaxing. Suitable for swimming and some snorkelling. Food and drinks available from a number of locations.

475694569.name: Deep sea fishing.
475694569.author: a TripAdvisor user
475694569.reviewBody: Went deep sea fishing but unfortunately we got skunked \u2639\ufe0f. However we saw a massive pod of dolphins which swam with the boat. The dolphins appeared to be smaller (could be teenagers) which performed for us. \n\nThe bay is beautiful with so many lovely homes surrounding it. The shops and bars around the bay are all so lovely.

473505777.name: Great Diving on the edges of this bay.
473505777.author: a TripAdvisor user
473505777.reviewBody: A Canadian buddy of mine and I snorkeled the North side of this bay around the bend to the Mexican Coast Guard base.  Remember you are not allowed on the base property. One of the few beaches that is not public.

473047731.name: Enjoyable afternoon
473047731.author: a TripAdvisor user
473047731.reviewBody:
We spent 2 days here- great little bay to relax at a table in the chaos of others... Grab a table for shade, order what you like during the day- no extra charge to stay. Some places have lounge chairs but they are for specific hotels. You can sit anywhere anywhere on the beach, but the only free shade from a few trees to the far right when facing the water. 

Church is incredible, right on the beach. Restaurants are similar in prices. Certain places offer discounts with specific hotels ( they tell u with you wrist band) but the drinks are usually weaker... 

Absolute chaos on the weekends- but we loved seeing the family atmosphere, the cultural differences are such a great reminder of the definition of true family.

Water is calm & clear and beach is family friendly. Many lifejackets for those that can't swim and many people seem to learn here ( no- to -few waves).

Vendors galore- but all are kind and leave if you politely decline.

471995900.name: Nice place to hang out for a day
471995900.author: a TripAdvisor user
471995900.reviewBody: The ocean side bars are friendly and in line with other Pacific beach bars.  The merchants are friendly and try to be helpful. They definitely are not a pushy as in other resort cities.  It is very clean and safe

471424707.name: Seven Bay Tour
471424707.author: a TripAdvisor user
471424707.reviewBody: Booked a tour through our hotel rep and we thoroughly loved it!  We sailed with mostly Mexican tourists on a large double decker boat, stopping at a remote snorkeling spot only accessible by boat.

468410721.name: Beautiful
468410721.author: a TripAdvisor user
468410721.reviewBody: Santa Cruz is a very beautiful area with lots of sight seeing locations. I would concider purchasing a condo there as I feel so safe and "at home"

468080809.name: "Cafe Huatulco"
468080809.author: a TripAdvisor user
468080809.reviewBody: I suggest to visit "Cafe Huatulco" located at Santa Cruz\'s square , at the Kiosk. Great Coffee, so so service and high prices, but the genuine Oaxaca ambiance is equal to none

467957222.name: A trip of the 5 bays of Huatulco with Roberto
467957222.author: a TripAdvisor user
467957222.reviewBody: 4 of us boarded a 20 ft. Run about and toured the 5 bays with Roberto.  A very knowledgable boat man and a very calm operator.  We we seen leather back turtles and ended up in a pod od about 200 dolphins.  Awesome!  Something we never experienced.  Well worth the money.

467947209.name: bay tours leave from here
467947209.author: a TripAdvisor user
467947209.reviewBody: There is a small beach near the cruise ship dock\nPlenty of beach restaurants with large seating capacity\nA unique beach front church where you can see the bay from the pews

467318135.name: not much to do other than rent a boat
467318135.author: a TripAdvisor user
467318135.reviewBody: really not a heck of a lot to do.  the market was mostly junk, did not see much local artisan work, other than in the jewelers and the prices they asked was astronomical

466318394.name: Nice Marina and great place to visit
466318394.author: a TripAdvisor user
466318394.reviewBody: One of the stops on the bay tour very clean and it has a small market that has a little something for everyone

465951719.name: Central Marina for boats in Huatulco area
465951719.author: a TripAdvisor user
465951719.reviewBody: We were taking a private boat excursion and were told to meet at the Santa Cruz Marina.  Our cab driver didn\'t speak English, and he tried to drop us off at a gate that was locked.  I believe it was for boat owners.  We had a difficult time explaining that we needed to go to a more public area, but finally he drove us a couple of blocks over to the public entrance.  We had to pay 5 pesos to enter the marina and then found our boat.  The boats have to take turns at the main dock to pick up customers, so they may not pull up to the dock until the time that they have arranged for pick-up.  It is a picturesque little marina.  If you need a taxi to go back to your hotel, there is a stand outside the marina gates to the right.  The cab ride from the Huatulco hotel zone was 43 pesos.

465211097.name: Waste of Time
465211097.author: a TripAdvisor user
465211097.reviewBody:
First impression: dirty

The palapas (restaurants) invaded the area and there are people aggresively inviting you to seat and try their food. The truth is that the shrimp and fish they offer come in most of the cases from farms and not from the Oaxaca's sea. Give a look to the restrooms and kitchen before ordering. 

The beach could be ok for swimming. But take as reference that the time I visited it was low season and still it was full of people. I will rather recommend taking a taxi to Tangolunda's public beach. That's a clean beach and far from over populated. 

We stayed there less than 15 min and still felt it was a waste lt time.

465171877.name: THE WINNER
465171877.author: a TripAdvisor user
465171877.reviewBody:
the winner

This is the best of all the beaches you visit
The sea is warm, calm not many waves, many restaurants,
Baths, showers, singers, vendors, delicious food
Very funny, you do not want to leave when you're there,
The people are very friendly it's worth it
IS A MEXICAN PARADISE

464890836.name: Bustling cruise ship port
464890836.author: a TripAdvisor user
464890836.reviewBody: Businesses and their employees in this area are geared toward the many cruise ship passengers who disembark at the port.\nFrankly, I found the vendors in the marketplace to be very un-Mexican, meaning they were rude, unfriendly and charged ridiculously high prices for goods.

464614169.name: Plenty to do......
464614169.author: a TripAdvisor user
464614169.reviewBody: Plenty of activity. Nice beach. Shops, bars, restaurants all very reasonable. Pleasant way to spend the day.

464131035.name: Clean and Safe
464131035.author: a TripAdvisor user
464131035.reviewBody: Spent only a short amount of time there, boarded a catamaran to do a bay tour and then return. Appeared clean and safe.

464126317.name: Afternoon trip
464126317.author: a TripAdvisor user
464126317.reviewBody: We did a short trip into this area to check out some condos to rent in a future trip . Was a very nice area with lots of little shops and places to eat. Harbour area was nice and not far from beach .deffinetly going to talk to a friend who stays in harbour area about this

463896716.name: Beach dining
463896716.author: a TripAdvisor user
463896716.reviewBody: There are a few restaurants right on the beach, serving all day. Fun dinner or just for a cocktail, i would definitely visit everytime I am in the area.

463475090.name: Appealing and tourist friendly
463475090.author: a TripAdvisor user
463475090.reviewBody: Was nice to be by the beach. Huatulco is very hot and the breezes off the beach were fabulous. People, food, bars shopping all good

463198421.name: Fished with Tico and snorkled with Edgar
463198421.author: a TripAdvisor user
463198421.reviewBody: We took taxi to this area and took large pontoon type party boat to snorkle and eat. Fishing with Tico was very successful! Great spot to shop and eat and enjoy the people

463058488.name: nice town to visit
463058488.author: a TripAdvisor user
463058488.reviewBody: we went into Santa Cruz to book a tour and because it was siesta time the office was closed so we wandered around the market and had a snack and drinks at one of the beach front restaurants. once we booked our tour we walked through the tourist corridor to La Crucecita. Felt safe at all times.

462356119.name: Fishing trip
462356119.author: a TripAdvisor user
462356119.reviewBody: Reserved the Sea Bird for some sport fishing while visiting the Santa Cruz Marina Feb 13th. This trip was awesome ! We were escorted out to sea by a pod of dolphins, saw around 100 sea turtles, a sailfish, mana ray, a seal (very strange for there) and a large Marlin doing an aerial dance across the water (at least 15 jumps) and caught one of the famous Huatulco giant Dorado \nThe boys Jamie, Luis and Benjamin were excellent hosts with lots of tricks for the slow bite day. \nI highly recommend a visit to this Marina area for a beachfront breakfast/lunch or just a cold beverage enjoying the breeze over the beach. There is ample shopping and the beach has your typical rental activities, banana boats, paddle boats,jet ski\'s and the like.

462322410.name: Day trip
462322410.author: a TripAdvisor user
462322410.reviewBody: We walked from la Crucecita to Santa Cruz bay. They have just completed the walkway and it is a beautiful walk but hot. Can\'t wait to see what they will be adding in the years to come. Apparently shops will be added eventually

462131674.name: Beautiful beach
462131674.author: a TripAdvisor user
462131674.reviewBody: Quaint town can connect to la Crucecita via walkway approx 15-20 min walk best done in early morning due to heat. Lots of boating excursions can be taken from here

462124749.name: Lovely Bay
462124749.author: a TripAdvisor user
462124749.reviewBody: Very nice beach, water is not too rough, locals love it there.  Very clean.  You are able to use the chairs and umbrellas on the beach, you only have to purchase a beer or two.

462008436.name: Good afternoon stroll.
462008436.author: a TripAdvisor user
462008436.reviewBody: Lots of history, so be sure to try and obtain a tour guide or a tour of the downtown area. Make sure to visit the church!

461750379.name: Cruise ship area
461750379.author: a TripAdvisor user
461750379.reviewBody: This little town has a beautiful sand beach with restaurants, shops and bars. They are very aggressive in this area but still a great place to visit

461440272.name: Touristy
461440272.author: a TripAdvisor user
461440272.reviewBody: Fun place to stop for a quick drink and take some pretty neat photos but it is quite expensive as far as food and souvenirs.

461291097.name: Filled by locals
461291097.author: a TripAdvisor user
461291097.reviewBody: It isnt a bad thing by any means but we were the only tourists there and didn\'t find any room for comforting beach time. The amount of people chasing you to sit at their restaurant can be frustrating but if your well travelled you will know how to deal with it. You want to be here when the cruise ships come in, very cool however prices skyrocket.

461186026.name: Yellow Fin Boat Tour
461186026.author: a TripAdvisor user
461186026.reviewBody: We were so lucky to come across Roberto of Yellow Fin.  He is such a great guy, so fairly priced, and knows the waters so well.  We saw a humpback whale in the first 20 min of our ride.  We went on to sail through a school of 200 dolphins that were racing us - it was such a thrill.  We saw manta rays and sailfish jump of of the water.  He had refreshments on board, and took us to the outskirts of an amazing snorkeling reef, where Roberto showed us how to do everything and let us touch a pufferfish that he grabbed with his hands.  There was another group around us, but they we being watched closely and Roberto checked on us, but gave us space.  On the way back we stopped at on of the bays with the beachside restaurants for lunch - fresh catch.  That was really great.  In total, we were out for about 4-5 hours and I couldn\'t recommend this enough.  Roberto is funny and interesting and a great guide.

461174753.name: Frozen Margueritas on the Beach
461174753.author: a TripAdvisor user
461174753.reviewBody: This small town offers shopping, dining and relaxation.  Situated on the beach, it offers natural beauty with an authentic Mexican hospitality.  There is shopping, a Scotia Bank, and restaurants/bars.  Each restaurant has its own section of tables on the sand.  My husband and I took a table closest to the water.  We had HUGE frozen margueritas.  We ate tortilla chips, salsa and guacamole.  There were occasional Mexican musicians, performing on the beach for guests.  The view is spectacular and we had a very relaxing couple of hours.

459757188.name: Very Nice area
459757188.author: a TripAdvisor user
459757188.reviewBody: Scenic Small town Mexico, We went out on a boat for a private tour  some fishing, dolphin watching and snorkeling!

459321958.name: Easy to access
459321958.author: a TripAdvisor user
459321958.reviewBody: You pay 5 pesos to visit and use toilets showers.  Really nice walkway.  Pontoon boats are available rent to go fishing, whale watching , snorkeling  we had great time on such a boat viewing whales.

459273519.name: Quaint
459273519.author: a TripAdvisor user
459273519.reviewBody: This is a modernised port, upgraded for cruise ships and local boat tour operators. The town is very authentic Mexican with small hotels restaurants and, of course, the local tourist market. There is a framers market 3rd Saturday of every month which is well worth the visit. The beach is fabulous and not polluted due to separation from the port entrance.

458904605.name: Fun!
458904605.author: a TripAdvisor user
458904605.reviewBody: Spent a late afternoon watching a cruise ship leave port.  It was a Saturday so the beach was busy, lots of tourists and Mexican families.  Last year, our beach club for the Binniguenda hotel was on this beach, and we enjoyed swimming there, very tranquil water compared to Chahue Baie.

458327696.name: Lazy day at Santa Cruz
458327696.author: a TripAdvisor user
458327696.reviewBody: Huatulco was one of the ports at which our ship docked for one day during a recent cruise. There is a beach immediately adjacent to the pier, but the only view is of the cruise ship!\nWe went to the tourist information kiosk and they recommended that we took a taxi (7 UD$) to a local beach near Santa Cruz. This was a beach that was frequented by "locals", and had a good selection of restaurants on the sandy beach. The water was very clear and was ideal for snorkelling.\nUpon our return to Huatulco, we managed to get free wifi with good reception in a bar whilst drinking a margarita in a huge blue glass!

457146324.name: Fishing with Hector
457146324.author: a TripAdvisor user
457146324.reviewBody: This was our second time in Santa Cruz which is a beautiful little town with great restaurants.  On both trips my brother in law and I fished with a young man named Hector. Hector is a very personable young man that\'s just getting started in the fishing charter business. but do not let his rookie status scare you away......having grown up in the area and on the water, Hector knows his fish and how to find them!!  On both charters with him he put us on fish and we did well.   He recently bought a very nice used center console boat ( 18-20 ft) with a 115 hp Yamaha and electronics (radio, fish finder, etc). His tackle could stand to be upgraded but it is serviceable. His English is not very good but we managed to communicate just fine. And his prices are probably half of what everyone else in the area charges. \nBeing a newcomer to the business, he doesn\'t have a name for his business yet, or a website. To find Hector, go to the marina in Santa Cruz and ask around for Hector. His boat is named "She\'ll B Rite". His phone number is 958-106-3929. \nSo if your in the area and want a good day fishing at a very reasonable price, check out Hector. You\'ll be helping out a young man that deserves this opportunity.

457093377.name: Santa Cruz
457093377.author: a TripAdvisor user
457093377.reviewBody: We came here for our day on the boat with Tico. The cruise ship was in for the day . Lots of people around. Lots of shops and restaurants to chose from. A quick cab ride from our resort got us here in 5-10 minutes.

456750682.name: Love Santa Cruz
456750682.author: a TripAdvisor user
456750682.reviewBody: We walk from our hotel to Santa Cruz, maybe 15 min.. great restaurants  on the beach and gorgeous at night. Lots of markets to go to ..

455924222.name: Excursions
455924222.author: a TripAdvisor user
455924222.reviewBody: Most of our excursions left from here. Very clean and beautiful. don\'t be afraid to wonder the town. Avoid if a cruise ship is in. Not may I understand

455258573.name: Great beach, excellent service from Calderon!
455258573.author: a TripAdvisor user
455258573.reviewBody: We often go to Santa Cruz beach to enjoy the water as it is usually very calm and warm, and not too busy, depending on the day. We have a waiter who always looks after us very well, ask for Calderon. His English isn\'t great but he understands it better than speaking it and we always enjoy his service with a smile! He gets us the best table he can and gets an umbrella and if you want loungers he can often arrange those too. The drinks are reasonable and you can sit as long as you like as long as you keep ordering. The view over the dock (where cruise ships come in at times) is nice and you will have vendors and entertainers throughout your day.

455251653.name: fishing
455251653.author: a TripAdvisor user
455251653.reviewBody: public marina with many local fishing boats, well maintained. and close to the hotel zone. 450 peso cab ride

454403147.name: Nice beach.
454403147.author: a TripAdvisor user
454403147.reviewBody: Nice beach.  Can be busy at times but there is always a place can be found to have a good time.  Calm water.

454367082.name: Decent Beach
454367082.author: a TripAdvisor user
454367082.reviewBody: Can get tour of the \'bays of Huatulco\' from here - recommend small boat as they will take you onto pristine beaches, for walking or snorkelling.

454079516.name: nice beach
454079516.author: a TripAdvisor user
454079516.reviewBody: lots of restaurants with very aggressive sales staff that chase you down, as if they were on commission. \n

453706163.name: Fishing village
453706163.author: a TripAdvisor user
453706163.reviewBody: We visited Santa Cruz for an afternoon, seems to be a fishing town, people wonderful, the cruise ships stop here so best to go on a off day.

453592779.name: Interesting spot
453592779.author: a TripAdvisor user
453592779.reviewBody: This area was formerly land and was dug out to create a harbor. They have tour ships arrive in the cove weekly which provides money for the local people.

453049860.name: Yellow Fin Fishing Trip with Roberto
453049860.author: a TripAdvisor user
453049860.reviewBody: great day of fishing and snorkeling. Roberto took me and my daughter fishing  and we caught 7 Tuna. he worked very hard. then he took us on a guided snorkelling tour which was amazing. His Panga boat was very sea worthy and we were always safe.\nwill definitely be going with him again.

452394756.name: Town trip to shop
452394756.author: a TripAdvisor user
452394756.reviewBody: We zipped in for a day.  Good deals, easy bartering.  HOT with no ocean breeze.  Taxi\'s are pretty cheap so its worth it.

450314324.name: Beautiful bay
450314324.author: a TripAdvisor user
450314324.reviewBody: Visit the Marina.  It was lovely to see. Saturdays seem to be the popular day to visit.  Local crafts are everywhere!  \n

450082366.name: Beach was nice.
450082366.author: a TripAdvisor user
450082366.reviewBody: The beach was nice. Here the cruise ships dock. Marina for boats for the excursions. The beach can get busy. A couple of beach restaurants here.

449393781.name: Great Shopping
449393781.author: a TripAdvisor user
449393781.reviewBody: We went shopping an Santa Cruz and had lunch on the beach at one of the quaint restaurants. Beautiful beach area.

448542478.name: Lovely little Town
448542478.author: a TripAdvisor user
448542478.reviewBody: We went to Santa Cruz for a couple of hours one afternoon.  We enjoyed our time there, we walked around the marina, went to the beautiful church and watched the prizes being given out for the fishing derby.  The town sits right on the bay so the beach was right there.  The cruise ships also comre into this bay and one was at the pier the day we were there.  We felt very safe to walk about and enjoyed the local festivities.

448129773.name: Great clean beach
448129773.author: a TripAdvisor user
448129773.reviewBody: The cruise ships dock at this beach, so it can be quite busy. As you walk closer to the beach, be prepared to be bombarded by locals wanting you to come to their restaurant. Lots of palapas, which are shaded areas to sit under. Beautiful clean and calm water, and a great place to swim. There are many merchants selling trinkets and touristy items. This is also the marina where we boarded for our day out fishing.

447936657.name: Nice beach close to cruise ship port
447936657.author: a TripAdvisor user
447936657.reviewBody: I was very pleasantly surprised by the beach located within steps of the cruise ship dock. The beach was very clean. The water crystal clear. There is a wide variety of restaurant/ cantinas offering fresh fish and local fare. These restaurants offer complementary chairs and umbrellas with a purchase. There was also a local square, marina,  small church and shops ...\n basically something for everyone close to the ship.\n

447250250.name: Swimming Beach
447250250.author: a TripAdvisor user
447250250.reviewBody: Gorgeous swimming beach, with easy access into the ocean without a large surf. Beachside bars and cafes line the beach. Nice warm Pacific ocean. Swim with the tropical fish.

447205225.name: Great place
447205225.author: a TripAdvisor user
447205225.reviewBody:
I think the best way to
Do it is to get a meal at any of the restaurants and with that comes a chair in the sand or under a "palapa" with lots of shade the beach has an area where you can swim and it is literally like a pool no hard waves of any type and you can easily enjoy the ocean water (very suitable for children) vendors don't bug too much and the best part is that you can bargain a day trip to
All the beaches (some of them
Virgin) and also on the same trip
You can stop and snorkel your experience will depend on the guide that you hire ours was amazing we got to hold blow fish different types sea stars, sea cucumber we saw turtles, dolphins, the sunrise many different type of colorful fish so far I think this was the best trip I had ever had it was prober just my wife and I and the guide it was amazing.

446794453.name: Nice beach lots of chairs
446794453.author: a TripAdvisor user
446794453.reviewBody: Get there early and hold your seat  we could walk yo this beach it was a beautiful day food and drink we picked out one of the restaurant and had ocean front chairs several drinks full lunch it was cheap Our last day we got there for breakfast and stayed till almost sundown. we meet several Canadians they were all real nice

446317154.name: Glass Clear Water
446317154.author: a TripAdvisor user
446317154.reviewBody: Nice little town with good number of restaurants along the little bay. Not much room to swim but the water in this area is very clear and refreshing. We were in this area in Xmas and could swim comfortably.

446103277.name: One of two nice little towns
446103277.author: a TripAdvisor user
446103277.reviewBody: Santa Cruz is the stop in Huatulco for the cruise ships heading through the Panama canal. The town is very clean and has a wonderful square with a souveneir mall just along its edge. The marina also serves as a take off point for the 7 bay cruise tours and water taxis to the various pristine beaches in the area for a day of snorkeling and other beach activities. One of the highlights of my visit to this town was the discovery of a recently completed walkway between Santa Cruz and La Crucecita. The wide , clean, cemented and beautifully landscaped walkway(about 1/2 mile long) between these towns makes for a great diversion from the commercial enterprises of the area. La Crucecita, the town on the inland side of the walkway, is larger with a more local population. The town is extremely clean and also has a very safe feel. There are lots of restaurants, bars and shops as well as a couple of loom shops where the goods sold are made onsite. The town boasts a beautiful church on the edge of the well kept and active town square. If you are in the area this walk is a must do, if you can. The walk is set up so that one day it will be lined with commercial ventures but right now it is just a gorgeous path between the 2 towns. I will also mention that there were police stationed on either end of the walkway to ensure stollers safety.

445191244.name: Lots of shops to browse, beach is not great.
445191244.author: a TripAdvisor user
445191244.reviewBody: This is a great place to rent kayaks and kayak over to the snorkel area.  Lots of bars on the beach.  Very commercial, not a great place for swimming.

444715234.name: cool place
444715234.author: a TripAdvisor user
444715234.reviewBody: Nice bay with a lot of character and cool shops and nice people..you will love it just hang around for a while and see a true mexican town

444497154.name: Great way to Spend an Afternoon by the Water
444497154.author: a TripAdvisor user
444497154.reviewBody: Exciting Port and very very  busy when the Cruise ships come in ,on the quieter days it nice to hang out at one the Beach restaurants and enjoy a cold beverages and good food .\nThe Land Sharks (sales people)  became to a bit  of an annoyance, but overall a good place to visit and book boat tours

443365770.name: Beautiful Marina
443365770.author: a TripAdvisor user
443365770.reviewBody: Just spent a short time on the water in the marina but found it very scenic. Lots of various sized vessels and beautiful real estate to look at.

438873457.name: Nice beach and amenities!
438873457.author: a TripAdvisor user
438873457.reviewBody: This is a very nice beach with inviting water for swimming or just treading water for a little exercise.  The majority of people are local Mexicans with a smattering of Canadians and people off the cruise ships when docked.  I had dinner 4 nites at Dona Celia\'s which has a nice menu and reasonable prices.  You just have to watch your bill like a hawk because they like to sneak in some higher prices and/or the tip.\n\nThere are a few other restaurants and some shopping opportunities but best of all this is a very laid back place with not many vendors on the beach or buying pressure on tourists.

437937923.name: A Beach with Activities
437937923.author: a TripAdvisor user
437937923.reviewBody: This beach has options for water sports. You can ride the banana behind a panga, paddle board, kayak, snorkel and swim. There are many restaurants on the beach which is nice if you want some shade to sit under and enjoy the bay\'s activities.

432518285.name: Main beach beautiful
432518285.author: a TripAdvisor user
432518285.reviewBody: Lots of Beach palapa Restaurants, great food, nice people and service, you can see cruise ships come in, lots of boat rides available for tours and fishing, water activities, also only beach with night time activities. Make sure you only buy from people with Tourism ID on!

432122626.name: Very Nice Mexican Port
432122626.author: a TripAdvisor user
432122626.reviewBody: We stopped here on our cruise and our first time here. It was lovely. A short walking distance from the pier there was a small shopping/restaurant area. The shops were very nice and selling some different things then other places in Mexico. There was just enough area to stroll. Also there were plenty of taxis and folks offering tours. We took a taxi to La Crucecita which was definitely with it. Would love to come back to this port.

415951488.name: The beach of my dreams
415951488.author: a TripAdvisor user
415951488.reviewBody: Amazingly beautiful beach with torquoise water, nice and warm but still refreshing! Local restaurants line the beach and the staff can be a bit persistent trying to get you to come have a bite/drink it was really nice to be able to enjoy such a gorgeous beach and experience a local vibe all at the same time

410081617.name: "Great day in Huatuico Mexico"
410081617.author: a TripAdvisor user
410081617.reviewBody: We had a great day at Santa Cruz Bay relaxing on the beautiful beach with beautiful clean turquoise water great  little restaurants right on the beach... delicious food great drinks we had lots of fun with the locals that were hanging out at the restaurant on the beach so friendly... lots of little shops walking distance... the marina is very pretty too... just a perfect day to relax and have some fun!!! enjoy my friends ;-)

407493725.name: Clean little bay with amenities
407493725.author: a TripAdvisor user
407493725.reviewBody: We left this bay for a snorkeling and sightseeing tour.  Good sized well maintained marina with washrooms for use.  As you drive out of the bay you are met with towering cliffs on either side dotted by beautiful houses, condos and the like.  Id recommend an afternoon here even just to have drinks and chill.

402917517.name: Locals and boats- beautiful
402917517.author: a TripAdvisor user
402917517.reviewBody: The Marina, shops, and beaches were beautiful. We met a great guy who ended up taking us out on his boat for drinks, touring the beaches, fishing, and snorkeling, all for an extremely reasonable price. It was only 10 minutes walking away from our hotel and I loved the environment and ambiance. Very beautiful!

391177894.name: Dinner and walk in the plaza
391177894.author: a TripAdvisor user
391177894.reviewBody: This area you can find excellent food from Oaxaca, sea food, tacos, mole, trompo tacos, fried ice cream and they have a mercado where you can find typical anesthesia and good present for family.

390577869.name: Worth a quick look see but youll see it anyway if you book any boat tours
390577869.author: a TripAdvisor user
390577869.reviewBody: We left from here one morning on a fishing excursion. And then we returned a few days later because Huatulco was having a big sail fish competition and we wanted to see what people were catching when they came in. The area is nice. A cute outdoor chapel, a covered market for trinket shopping, some shops and restaurants and of course, the docks. It was super busy when we went because of the competition so we didn\'t hang out too long. I\'d say stop by here if you are in the area anyway or if you need to do souvenir shopping. Otherwise don\'t bother travelling all the way there to take a look. Not much to see if you aren\'t into little skiff boats and dead fish. But it seems to be a central spot for the area so its likely there will be a lot of activity at the Santa Cruz Bay.

374805367.name: Shopping, Beach, Restaurants
374805367.author: a TripAdvisor user
374805367.reviewBody: Huatulco is a beautiful area and Santa Cruz Bay is where you will dock if you arrive on a cruise ship. There is plenty of shopping right off the dock, some restaurants and beach access. You can also hire a boat off this dock to go sightseeing, snorkeling or fishing. A tour of the 7 (actually 9) bays of Huatulco is a great way to spend your day.\n\nThere is an ATM at a bank about 2 blocks from the dock, but it only gives pesos.

367011391.name: Fresh seafood on the beach...
367011391.author: a TripAdvisor user
367011391.reviewBody: After some shopping and an awesome cup of coffee. We took a seat in the shade to cool off and discuss lunch plans. As we sat a gentleman approached us and offered us a menu to look over. After a quick look he escorted us to a table on the beach for a wonderful lunch full of delicious seafood treats and cold cervezas. Lunch was spectacular.

366420246.name: Interesting to walk around
366420246.author: a TripAdvisor user
366420246.reviewBody: Do a bit of trinket shopping, but it\'s not a must-see part of this area. The various boat tours depart from here.

366147372.name: too busy
366147372.author: a TripAdvisor user
366147372.reviewBody: Too many small restaurants on the beach with waiters ready to pounce! We were approached at least 30 times for food, tours, markets, silver prices. All still high, never mind when the cruise ships come in!

365749866.name: Great shopping, interesting shrine
365749866.author: a TripAdvisor user
365749866.reviewBody: My wife and I scootered over from the Barcelo Huatulco Beach hotel several times. There is a covered market with lots of stalls just off the main street in front of the marina. I wandered over to the waterfront while my wife carefully explored every stall, and I discovered the "Chapel of the Holy Cross of Huatulco" and how the town came to get its name. Too long a tale to repeat here (including a 1587 visit by genuine pirate Thomas Cavendish), but absolutely worth seeing.  Meanwhile my wife found some excellent silver jewelry (Taxco quality) at a reasonable price, so we both had a good day!

365694379.name: Jet skiing
365694379.author: a TripAdvisor user
365694379.reviewBody: We went jet skiing here and swam with the locals. I only paid $25.00 US for 1 hour, they  were willing to negotiate prices. Everyone was so kind and helpful. They had a nice little flea market about 2 blocks away from the beach and I feel like prices were reasonable, they didn\'t overprice items and try to scam me like other places in Mexico

364269324.name: Goid for mariners
364269324.author: a TripAdvisor user
364269324.reviewBody: Has a good marina for trips to other beaches and viewpoints. Very busy on Easter holidays but worth seeing and the open air church by the beach was great.  Beaches were loaded with fun seeking holiday makers.

363657750.name: Popular, mixed crowd, lots of restaurants
363657750.author: a TripAdvisor user
363657750.reviewBody: Visited here last month (Mar. 2016) for 2 weeks. Fun to visit and hang out with friends. Lots of restaurants and vendors; a bit disappointing as a beach - waters not very clean. Not quiet enough to appreciate the natural side of it. But fun if you like crowd watching.

363514084.name: Jessymar Restaurant vulture preys on visitors to Santa Cruz Bay
363514084.author: a TripAdvisor user
363514084.reviewBody: Beware of Dario who intercepts you far away from the beach and stays with you until you give up and sit down at Jessymar restaurant. We were thirsty from walking so stopped for drinks only. Dario then became our waiter. The menu did not include any listing of drinks, either alcoholic or non alcoholic. The bill came jotted on a random piece of paper. Our simple limonadas cost 3 times the normal price. There were four of us and we were in such shock at the prices that we didn\'t check the math, not realizing until after we had paid, (stupidly still including a tip - American habits are hard to break), and walked away. Then I realized he had disguised a hidden service charge by adding incorrectly, NOT by indicating it as a line item. We\'ve lived in Mexico for 4 years, traveling to many different places in this wonderful country. NEVER have we felt completely bamboozled and ripped off, until now.

363073402.name: Enjoyable Day Trip
363073402.author: a TripAdvisor user
363073402.reviewBody: Visited Santa Cruz Bay during a day trip in March 2016 and loved it. Recommend stopping, enjoying the site and taking some photos. The cooling breezes were most welcome.

360708484.name: Picturesque
360708484.author: a TripAdvisor user
360708484.reviewBody: we went to Santa Cruz on evening during Easter break and it was very crowed and busy due to the holiday. Seeing the aerial photos of the town, I had imagined something completely different than what I experienced but we had a fun time in town checking out the market and buying some nice souvenirs.  I truly thank our taxi driver that day, he took us on a little tour around Santa Cruz to the lookout points and some of the scenery was spectacular!

360142336.name: HAPPENING PLACE
360142336.author: a TripAdvisor user
360142336.reviewBody: Lovely historic church must be seen - directly on the beach\nMarket had a very local flavour and we bought some delicious honey and coffee from local growers to bring home.

359676378.name: 600 lb. marlin
359676378.author: a TripAdvisor user
359676378.reviewBody: Unbelievable fish brought into Santa Cruz marina by Roberto aboard his panga "Yellow Fin" on March 11/16

359157236.name: Busy Bay but still beautiful!
359157236.author: a TripAdvisor user
359157236.reviewBody: Santa Cruz bay is used by the occasional cruise ship as well as as a beach club for several hotels that are not waterfront. It has many restaurants with fantastic ocean front seating areas which are fun to visit. It can be busy when there is a cruise ship in along with the beach club users. There is no seating provided for non club members so bring your own. It is very easy to access behind the marina for anyone staying off resort and has a nice shaded courtyard between the street front and beach area. A small shopping mall next to the marina has everything you can find in La Crucecita without all the walking. The shop keepers are eager to make deals. Also a wood fired pizza restaurant on the main street next to shopping means you can do it all within a very short distance - beach fun, shopping and dining!

359120301.name: The place to \'stop and relax\' during vacation
359120301.author: a TripAdvisor user
359120301.reviewBody: I loved this small, intimate beach. The food in the local restaurants was amazing...the cerviche was exceptional. The first drink I had was a bit light so I requested \'stronger\' and got my wish!! The little shops are wonderful and the shopkeepers were so nice. I\'ll be back. Be sure to visit the church.

357924187.name: Sadly disappointing
357924187.author: a TripAdvisor user
357924187.reviewBody: Being a cruise ship port I expected so much more from this small town in Huatulco.  We stayed in Chauhua one mile away and walked here several times.  the walk is very enjoyable until you get to the town, then it is very dirty and you are constantly being asked to go on tours or come into a shop.  This town has tons of small shope selling the same stuff you see everywhere, rugs, clothes, bathing suits, nothing unique or original.  There are several restaurants on the beach, all of which do not look overly clean.  We ate at the Vie d Mar and got sick after having fish and guacamole.  The beach is a very pretty crescent moon shape but is not as clean as it should be and is usually crowded with local families and lots of kids because the water is calm.  Go to one of the other bays, you will enjoy it much more.

357595771.name: Cruise ship port
357595771.author: a TripAdvisor user
357595771.reviewBody: We didn\'t spend much time in this area except to get off our boat and take a taxi . Busy  little port when the ships come in according to our guide. There are many condos in this area and shops.

357088807.name: Nice Bay
357088807.author: a TripAdvisor user
357088807.reviewBody: We left here on our 7 bay tour and returned 6 hrs. later.  Picturesque, however did not stay longer than to wait for the van to return to Las Brisas.  There\'s an interesting in completed hotel on one side of the bay.  Apparently the 2008 market crash stopped this hotel in mid construction.  Cruise ships stop here and the cruisers find this place interesting.  I don\'t know why.  It\'s one of those mandatory stops on the vacation.  Tick it off and you\'re gone.

356175397.name: Great to see Cruise ships!!
356175397.author: a TripAdvisor user
356175397.reviewBody: Great to see cruise ships come in and dock.  Always really busy around here when the tours come in.  Lots of fun.

355720915.name: Peaceful and quiet
355720915.author: a TripAdvisor user
355720915.reviewBody: Santa Cruz is a laid back quiet port with a very good beach, safe for swimming and ok snorkelling. Plenty of excursions to other beaches and charter fishing available for budgets of all sizes. Numerous local  shops for souvenirs  and seafood restaurants to eat and drink. 2 cruise ships docked here during our stay in Feb.   did not cause any crowding or change in behaviours. Check out the local church right on the beach, do so on a Sunday afternoon mass. The beach does get busy on weekends but that gives you an excellent opportunity to enjoy the area with the people that live and work in Mexico. Very safe to walk around and enjoy the area.

354906678.name: Very nice quiet beach
354906678.author: a TripAdvisor user
354906678.reviewBody: Me and my husband spent a few days on that beach. Very nice beach. Great to swim at. Water was fairly shallow and sand was very nice on the feet. Many nice places to sit and have a bite to eat also some nice drinks. Staff was friendly and very helpful. There were beach chairs that we were able to use while getting some sun! All in all a nice experience!!

354530309.name: fishing trip
354530309.author: a TripAdvisor user
354530309.reviewBody: started our fishing trip here, there was a really nice beach/restaurant area off this bay where we got snorkel sets.

352604425.name: Hot hot hot but good
352604425.author: a TripAdvisor user
352604425.reviewBody: A friendly beach where an umbrella waits and a cold beer goes down oh so well.  There are shops and many restaurants to choose from.  The cruise ships land here so don\'t expect bargain prices on everything but good natured bargaining is always welcome. Definitely try some shrimp here as they have many ways to prepare a tasty shore lunch or main meal if required.  Feel free to walk around as the locals are very helpful.

352584505.name: Excellent Sport Fishing
352584505.author: a TripAdvisor user
352584505.reviewBody:
A day of fishing in Santa Cruz. .. excellent Captain Eddy... Eduardo Ulisses and Lolo first mate....
We saw Tortugas. . Dolphins. ..Manta Ray...
Marlin. ..Caught Mahi Mahi....
Eddy is a VERY KNOWLEDGEABLE Captain for being so young.We watched him following his Papa on the beaches for the past 12 yrs...
Don't miss out on a Bay tour or Fishing excursion. 
Wonderful memories made.

352193266.name: Pretty little town....
352193266.author: a TripAdvisor user
352193266.reviewBody: ...nice marina/church/square.\nFull of Cnd. expats.  Beach just so so.  Resto choices on and off the beach.

351324389.name: Another side trip to take
351324389.author: a TripAdvisor user
351324389.reviewBody: Small town on the bay. Public beach. Good shopping and a nice restaurant right on the beach. There is a historical church on the water as well.

350926082.name: Saturday Market
350926082.author: a TripAdvisor user
350926082.reviewBody: We took a taxi from Las Brisas  on a Saturday {40 peso\'s } to experience the local market, It is a nice little town with some shops and restaurants close to the beach and marina. The Saturday farmers market was very interesting to see with lots of local produce for sale. We enjoyed our time there and would return next time we are in Huatulco. If you go plan on around 1-1 1/2 hours to spend there.

350400193.name: Cool Area
350400193.author: a TripAdvisor user
350400193.reviewBody: Only went Marina. There are some shops and businesses. There is a beach. It\'s a cool little area.  We chose to shop at Cruceciata. More shops and locals advised us it would be better shopping.

349687895.name: It\'s cute..
349687895.author: a TripAdvisor user
349687895.reviewBody: Probably not the best beach area in the area but with the shops and walking  distance makes it a great place to chill.. we preferred Entraga and Maguey more but you can walk to Santa Cruz from hotel zone...

349538468.name: Went to the market!
349538468.author: a TripAdvisor user
349538468.reviewBody: Went shopping and then down to the beach for a drink. Saw some local children playing. Everyone was very friendly. Met lots of Canadians at the beach!

349433458.name: Nice spot to walk along the beach
349433458.author: a TripAdvisor user
349433458.reviewBody:
We're staying in Huatulco first week of Feb.  Walked into Santa Cruz usually on our way back late afternoon from the beach club of La Isla.
