Lots to see and do shops, restaurants, marina and a great coffee place in the square.  The birds make a huge amounted noise at dusk but it is surprisingly relaxing. 

Big market for souvenirs and t shirts and some high end places catering to
 the cruise ships when they are in town.

349424980.name: Ocean is warmer than the pool
349424980.author: a TripAdvisor user
349424980.reviewBody: You could swim here all day.  We saw flying fish and several large pelicans.  Sand is soft with no rocks.  Restaurants 100 yards away.  Not crowded.  This place is paradise.

348855667.name: Great place to grab sun and food
348855667.author: a TripAdvisor user
348855667.reviewBody: We just returned from Santa Cruz, We had no cruse ship in the week we were there. We loved the location in town and there was a place to grab food and drinks at a very reasonable rate. Enjoy as we will be back.

348687567.name: Safe swimming beach!
348687567.author: a TripAdvisor user
348687567.reviewBody: This beach has calm waves and the cruise ships dock here once or twice a week. Lots of restaurants and shopping at the beach, Also a carnival for kids while we were there. All the locals come to swim but I found out that the deep sand in the shade is full of Sand Fleas...Beware!!

348328666.name: Neat to visit
348328666.author: a TripAdvisor user
348328666.reviewBody: This costal town is worth a visit. It is typical beach town with restaurants on the sand. It\'s expensive (as there is a cruise ship port). You should be prepared to barter in the market. Last time I was there it seemed to close down early (just after sunset).

347125691.name: Interesting harbour and landing point for cruise ships.
347125691.author: a TripAdvisor user
347125691.reviewBody: To enter the harbour proper perhaps to go on a 7 bay tour you are charged 5 pesos, the main attraction would be the nearby open air market and the local shops and stalls selling crafts and the usual tourist goods. There are a large range of boats in the harbour ranging from catamarans used for taking out tourists to pangas and  sports fishing boats. There is also a relatively new dock built especially for visiting cruise ships.

346899401.name: great time in Santa Cruz
346899401.author: a TripAdvisor user
346899401.reviewBody: wonderful town , great restauants, our favorite was LA CREMA pizza shop, sooooo good. \ngreat shopping, except when the cruise ships come in then there are alot of people in the bay and it gets busy. \nthe locals are amazing, and the town is clean and safe.

346219614.name: Left out of Marina on a fishing excursion was clean and nice.
346219614.author: a TripAdvisor user
346219614.reviewBody: Nice little town done some shopping and sightseeing. People was very nice. We went on Monday for the Farmers Market. Was a good trip offered by apple vacations

346210848.name: Beautiful
346210848.author: a TripAdvisor user
346210848.reviewBody: Stayed the day at santa cruz, did shopping and just sat and had a few drinks, the staff at the beach are crazy, they run after taxi trying to get them to go to there restaurant, we got let out on the main street

345687805.name: Small tourist town
345687805.author: a TripAdvisor user
345687805.reviewBody: Great place to visit, friendly people and safe area. Avoid cruise ship day is all. Nice beach area where all the restaurants are on the beach.  Has crafts and specialty shops and a small town square and market easy to walk around as it is small. Also has a church worth a look !

345567413.name: Just OK
345567413.author: a TripAdvisor user
345567413.reviewBody: This beach is just average compared to others in the area.  It is easy to reach by taxi or collective from Cruecita.  There are numerous casual restaurants for a meal or snacks and several have beach chairs for your use.  The food served is good but not great.\nThere is little opportunity for shade and a large pier for cruise ships cuts the bay in half.  The surf is quite gentle and swimming is easy but snorkeling not so interesting.

344334732.name: Nice Town
344334732.author: a TripAdvisor user
344334732.reviewBody: Cruise ships dock here for a quick visit.  There is a marina where you can book a boat for a fishing adventure.  There are a few bars and restaurants on the beach.  Lots of local shops selling touristy things.

343427111.name: Town tour
343427111.author: a TripAdvisor user
343427111.reviewBody: Great place to sample local cuisine, crafts and specialty shops. Safe environment and can easily be explored on foot. Locals are very helpful and not overly demanding of your attention/support. \nNot overly commercialized.

342701061.name: Picturesque
342701061.author: a TripAdvisor user
342701061.reviewBody: A quint little port, developed as acquire ship port. Lots of local shops and boats for hire for all kinds of activities. Saturday organic farmers market in the town square was good.

342327600.name: Very small beach with ok restaurants
342327600.author: a TripAdvisor user
342327600.reviewBody: The beach is crowded and the restaurants are local so be prepared for a hit or miss. \nIt\'s good for a one day stay and then continue the exploration to the rest of the beaches.  I personally liked better "Playa La Entrega"\n

342231474.name: Watching the Cruise Ships Come In
342231474.author: a TripAdvisor user
342231474.reviewBody: Santa Cruz Bay contains a dock for both cruise ships and the Mexican navy. We visited a couple of times for meals. There isn\'t a lot to do in the area. Most of the shopping is geared toward tourists who come in on the infrequent cruise stops.

341991030.name: Clean and Friendly
341991030.author: a TripAdvisor user
341991030.reviewBody: We paid about 40 pesos for a taxi from Dreams to Santa Cruz. It is quiet, clean, safe and friendly. There is a small shopping market. Shop owners are willing to barter a little, though they don\'t overprice their stuff to begin with. We made sure to go on a day when there was no cruise ship in town though, as we had heard there is a price inflation for cruise ship visitors. Nice beach and lots of food.

340792819.name: Nice little town
340792819.author: a TripAdvisor user
340792819.reviewBody: Quaint little bay with friendly people, scenic views, lovely beach with good swimming, great food.  I loved this little town.  Could easily walk to it from the Binneguenda Hotel.\n

340764204.name: Cruise ship dock and harbor
340764204.author: a TripAdvisor user
340764204.reviewBody: We met our boat here and it is a very nice and very clean marina. Lots of boats for hire and some pretty incredible views. Lots of restaurants in the area as well as some hotels. Make sure to take a walk through the area while in huatulco.

340703410.name: Nice Small Beach
340703410.author: a TripAdvisor user
340703410.reviewBody: We rented a condo overlooking this beach. This is where the cruise ships come in. I was worried it would make things extremely busy with all the extra people, but it didn\'t seem to matter. We would eat at the "El Huayacan" Restaurant and Bar and we always asked for Jose Calderon as our waiter. He never made us feel like we had to buy anything to enjoy a day at his tables under the umbrellas. He was a very thoughtful waiter. The food at the restaurant was very good and the beers were cold!

339711182.name: Picturesque Bay Beach
339711182.author: a TripAdvisor user
339711182.reviewBody: Typical of the area, seemed very calm and protected bay / beach. It is fairly small and has way too many food vendors, actually restaurants with tables and shade that extend way out on the beach. No loungers for rental, so you have to sit at a restaurant and at least buy a few beers to sit in shade and have a chair. I don\'t know why they set up so many tables, 3/4 empty and not have enough smarts to rent out loungers with umbrella\'s - would probably bring in more tourists and money for drinks and snacks in that we would stay longer. Santa Cruz beach seems is about like Engraga beach, maybe snorkeling bit better there though. Nice clean water, calm, and safe area. Lots of locals on holidays / week ends. Restaurant waiters do get a bit annoying trying to get you to sit at their place. Trouble is if you let them, they sit you and you maybe want another table or area which is not their place. So just walk along the beach and ignore them until you see the table / area you like before committing to their pitch. Ugh. Otherwise, great area.

339686816.name: hanging out
339686816.author: a TripAdvisor user
339686816.reviewBody: Great beach.  lots of chairs.  right beside the marina.  go dolphin watching.  we went and had about 100 dolphins swim beside our boat for about an hour.  saw giant turtles having sex.

337827655.name: Valentino,  Sail Fish Boat Tour
337827655.author: a TripAdvisor user
337827655.reviewBody: We hired Valentino just off the beach, he owns the Sail Fish boat.\nHe took us for a tour of 5 bays, and one gentleman caught a fish. He took us into Santa Cruz to snorkel and swim, it was beautiful there. I would recommend you to call Valentino. Thanks for awesome day.\n

336990720.name: Local Marina tour and shopping.
336990720.author: a TripAdvisor user
336990720.reviewBody: This area has a public beach with local dinning along with a Military Post and Marina where the Cruz Ships dock. If you are looking for local sport fishing or just ocean site seeing this is the place to go. I suggest that you get a boat that has GPS and Radio contact with the marina. Prices are up for negotiation but can range from $400./day & up depending on the size of boat and the duration of the trip. In our 8 outings combined here we enjoyed catches of Marlin, Yellow Fin Tuna, Benito, Barracuda and Maui Maui. Our guides have always been accommodating, friendly and new the areas and the fish well. Most speak fairly good English. Beware if the deal seems to be to good to be true and make sure you make the deal with the captain of the boat, not some 3rd party commissioned salesman looking for a deposit.

336529085.name: Perfect for our 1st day!
336529085.author: a TripAdvisor user
336529085.reviewBody: We arrived mid-day to the beach which was walking distance from where we were staying. It\'s a small beach and there were lots of people but it didn\'t feel crowded. There are many restaurants with umbrellas, tables, and chairs. There were no rentable lounge chairs at this beach. They have banana boats, giant water cycles, and vendors.

335035161.name: Crowded beach
335035161.author: a TripAdvisor user
335035161.reviewBody: Cheap place to visit during a long winter. Loaded with Canadians. Very economical if you can get a cheap flight. We are going back next month as flight from Baltimore is only $280. for Roundtrip tickets.

334335560.name: Beautiful panorama
334335560.author: a TripAdvisor user
334335560.reviewBody: What a wonderful place to visit. The views are amazing. The panorama is breathtaking. There are several boat excursions you can take from here and the little town of Santa Cruz that is nestled in the bay has wonderful Mexican charm. By boat or by land this area is so worth the visit.

333707024.name: Beautiful setting but be aware.
333707024.author: a TripAdvisor user
333707024.reviewBody: Very pretty little town situated in a bay with a small marina.  But be aware of restaurant vultures who track you down and promise the moon...but deliver terrible service, highly priced bad food.  And to make things worse...they added a service charge.  By far the worst meal we had on our holiday.  Stay away from Jessymar, even if they offer you free drinks.

333118537.name: Candlelight supper on the Beach
333118537.author: a TripAdvisor user
333118537.reviewBody: When we were in Huatulco, we walked down to Santa Cruz Bay and browsed in the little shops. Twice we stopped for supper, and we had a wonderful experience. Music in the background, candles on the table, waves lapping on the shore, and a good variety of Mexican foods--what more could one ask for?

332255772.name: Beautiful Mexican Bay
332255772.author: a TripAdvisor user
332255772.reviewBody: An amazing location in Mexico.  People are friendly, felt safe for walking during the evening.  Terrific small quaint restaurants, with such fair pricing.  The weather is/was HOT, and of course no rain.   Can\'t wait to return!

332113741.name: Clean little community
332113741.author: a TripAdvisor user
332113741.reviewBody: We went to this area from our resort to go to their market that is put on by organic farmers in the area.  It is only on 2 times a month and we were fortunate to be there for this.  We got to see cacao plants, taste the chocolate made from the cacao seeds.  Tasted the liquid that comes out of the seeds...sweet much like a honey.  They were also selling coffee and honey.  Home made lotions.\n\nThe area is very clean.  The bay looked nice.  This is where cruise ships come in during cruising season.

332058125.name: 7 Bays Tour Snorkeling
332058125.author: a TripAdvisor user
332058125.reviewBody: Highly recommend, my husband,two kids,father and sister took this tour and went snorkeling for the day. We all had a blast and was so glad that we went!

330241873.name: great for eating and relaxing
330241873.author: a TripAdvisor user
330241873.reviewBody: great little bay where the local restaurants serve up incredible food at awesome prices, good place to catch a fishing boat to take a fun booze cruise

329831017.name: nice place
329831017.author: a TripAdvisor user
329831017.reviewBody: Great little place... spent the day here swimming drinking and eating. Did a bit of shopping. Good to get off the resort and stroll through the town.

329446031.name: My favorite bay
329446031.author: a TripAdvisor user
329446031.reviewBody: This bay has everything. You can shop, swim, snorkel, jet ski, ride the banana and eat wonderful food. You can also have WiFi.

321389579.name: Great beach & food
321389579.author: a TripAdvisor user
321389579.reviewBody:
Santa Cruz is very nice & charming. This is where the ships dock so it gets very busy when a ship is in. The first time we went to Santa Cruz a ship was in from Holland & it was very busy. Second time we visit there was no ship & it was nicely quite. 

As for the food....be careful of the pushy waiters who try to get you to go to there restaurant as soon as you step foot out of the cab.  We got a recommendation from our hotel to eat at Ve el Mar & it was excellent. The restaurant is on the other side of the church & away from all the pushy waiters from the other restaurants. The food was great at Ve el Mar. They also had good music playing that wasn't obnoxiously loud. I will definitely go back to Ve el Mar. 

There is also the cutest coffee shop called the Huatulco Cafe decorated with papél picado. 

Overall we had a great time in Santa Cruz!

320735033.name: Great seafood restaurants
320735033.author: a TripAdvisor user
320735033.reviewBody: This little town is right next to La Crucecita, so very close to the big resorts of Huatulco.  You have to try one of the many seafood restaurants - some are right on the beach.

303542118.name: Nice day out
303542118.author: a TripAdvisor user
303542118.reviewBody: A fun excursion off resort, we enjoyed short hike and walking the boardwalk, getting ice cream treats for a kind old man vendor.

292673366.name: We had a great time and enjoyed Santa Cruz a lot!
292673366.author: a TripAdvisor user
292673366.reviewBody: I Loved the people, the shopping the food.  Thats where you can find handmade Table Cloths, runners etc., by the people who make them right in front of you.  The Moscal was terrific too!

278596471.name: Day two, beach two
278596471.author: a TripAdvisor user
278596471.reviewBody: It rained and felt good!  A smallish busy beach.  I missed out on the shopping there.  Good happy hour deals.

267793009.name: Nice Beach
267793009.author: a TripAdvisor user
267793009.reviewBody: This bay/beach is located in the Santa Cruz portion of the Huatulco area. Great for swimming. Because the cruise ship dock is here, there are good restaurants and lots of gift shops in the area. Not for snorkeling and sometimes it tends to be less clean because of the dock and the marina.

267577382.name: Loved this little town & the beautiful bay views!
267577382.author: a TripAdvisor user
267577382.reviewBody: This little town of Santa Cruz Bay is beautiful ! So clean....and great places to eat right on the beach! My husband & I would travel by taxi every night to Santa Cruz just to have dinner right on the beach. We would have our  little tootsies wiggling in the sand as we had our beverage of choice  & dined on some fabulous food. I had fish or shrimp every night we were there & I was in seventh heaven! When the cruise ships are in port you have a great view of the ship (s) too.

267351794.name: Nice little tourist town
267351794.author: a TripAdvisor user
267351794.reviewBody: Cruise ships come here so there are a lot of tourist stores and not the best deals. For the best deals walk away from the town center. when things start to look a bit run down start shopping. It is safe and far better deals

266506120.name: Nice lunch in Santa Cruz
266506120.author: a TripAdvisor user
266506120.reviewBody: We had a great seafood lunch at a great little restaurant right on the beach/port.  The floor was sand!  Now that is rustic! ;)  Prices were ok (a bit pricey, but to be expected, as many cruise ships drop anchor at this port) and the seafood selection great.  Everyone in our party of 6 was very satisfied with their meal and the ambience.

263686684.name: Nice beach
263686684.author: a TripAdvisor user
263686684.reviewBody: This was one of the best beaches for swimming we came across during our trip in regards to the ocean waves. The beach is just a short walk from the Marina and I\'m glad we\'d decided to walk that way by chance! We had a few beers here and were sad we\'d not decided to put our swim suits on before heading to the Marina. The cruise ships dock here but I heard they only come every few weeks. We enjoyed our day here and hope to visit it again next trip!

261729386.name: Boat left from here
261729386.author: a TripAdvisor user
261729386.reviewBody: Nice marina and shops a small central park as well. There were shops and restuarants that seemed to cater to tourist mostly but good place to venture out into. I\'d rather tour around here than downtown as we seemed to have better luck with food and gift ideas.

258160699.name: Relaxing
258160699.author: a TripAdvisor user
258160699.reviewBody: Great get away for mature adults. Very relaxing and quite, safe, and lots of choices. Rent a car or Scooter and tour around.

258156646.name: The cruise ships come in to port for a couple of hours
258156646.author: a TripAdvisor user
258156646.reviewBody: San cruz has a festival on Fridays and they also have a large amount of venders to shop from. They have the sunset cruise on a sail boat at night  You can also go fishing from Santa Cruz.

257892690.name: Lots of vendors
257892690.author: a TripAdvisor user
257892690.reviewBody: Nice beach but lots of vendors that hound you as you walk by their stores. Cruise ships come in here so that is neat to see .

257317018.name: Santa Cruz is a great beach with all comforts
257317018.author: a TripAdvisor user
257317018.reviewBody: Santa Cruz has a ton of restaurants and seating available, along with a market and shops for anything you would need. The water is nice and there is some good snorkeling along the rocks. This is where the cruise ships dock every now and then.

256984773.name: Shopping
256984773.author: a TripAdvisor user
256984773.reviewBody: Walked around the square, checked out the jewelers, marina, beach.  Spent a wonderful afternoon with Jesus and Jose .

255199404.name: Very mexican
255199404.author: a TripAdvisor user
255199404.reviewBody: Little harbour for boats, nice to shop and walk around.Visit Juanita\'s Cafe, Canadian lady owner, lovely food, has small library you can pick up some books. Just lovely.

255107088.name: Santa Cruz
255107088.author: a TripAdvisor user
255107088.reviewBody: US Coast Guard ship fumes.\n\nAggressive hecklers will be picking at your heals when you get out of the tax a block away.

254686266.name: best local beach
254686266.author: a TripAdvisor user
254686266.reviewBody: great south facing beach, open cabana\'s, clean, good for kids, drinks and food galore, worth a visit for sure

252762730.name: Really Nice
252762730.author: a TripAdvisor user
252762730.reviewBody: Probably the most modern of the bays in Huatulco.  Nice shops to enjoy and great restaurants.  We took a ride around the bay on a small boat which was very enjoyable.

252296146.name: Out door dining
252296146.author: a TripAdvisor user
252296146.reviewBody: smaller area, great outdoor eateries, fresh fish, mexican style menus, very friendly people, english spoken most places.

251581775.name: Santa Cruz Bay
251581775.author: a TripAdvisor user
251581775.reviewBody: This is a sweet little place to visit.  Very relaxed.  Make sure you eat at the beach.   The atmosphere is great, and although we just had a drink and some guacamole, it was simply divine.  A "must see" when you go to Huatulco.

250077743.name: Beware of extremely overpriced beachfront restaurants and agressive promoters
250077743.author: a TripAdvisor user
250077743.reviewBody: This pretty setting is ruined by price gouging and promoters that chase you down the street. Stay away.

249625704.name: Santa Cruz Marina
249625704.author: a TripAdvisor user
249625704.reviewBody: The Marina is very large, lots of shopping and restaurants.  Everyone wants you to buy now and pay later.  The restaurants are a little pricy.

249476791.name: nice beach
249476791.author: a TripAdvisor user
249476791.reviewBody: I hope I have the right place this is where the cruise ship is docked and is near the naval base. we felt very safe hear I had the mango ice cream wife had the frozen pineapple fantastic you right in with the locals

248659621.name: Swimmers Beach
248659621.author: a TripAdvisor user
248659621.reviewBody: Great beach to just relax and read a book. Jump in the water and swim the bouy lines. Or mingle while sipping your favorite drink. A variety of food at the restaurants with reasonable pricing. If Frida\'s Taco truck is in the square!!! Highly recommend the Cactus Tacos on the beach!!!

248366486.name: great people
248366486.author: a TripAdvisor user
248366486.reviewBody: spent a lot of time at Santa Cruz beach - was 3 min walk from our condo. very friendly people, good restaurants. swimming was good.

246533979.name: Hanging with the locals
246533979.author: a TripAdvisor user
246533979.reviewBody: Beautiful local\'s beach. A couple of minutes walk from our hotel(Castillo). Nice spot for an evening walk in the soft sand and warm surf. I went down a couple of mornings early for a swim and snorkel. If you hang over to the right (facing the water) there is some smaller corals and lots of rocks to attract fish. I ran into hundreds of small puffer fish there. Also lots of nice purple sea sponges. Grab a coffee after, chill and watch the local families enjoy life!!

246253286.name: Surfing
246253286.author: a TripAdvisor user
246253286.reviewBody: Went surfing to Barre Santa Cruz.  Gorgeous beach.  No one was there! Thanks to Cafe Surf for taking us there surfing.

245975364.name: Overused, too many restaurants
245975364.author: a TripAdvisor user
245975364.reviewBody: Had many people trying to sell us things. I felt like I was being hounded by them, almost intrusive attitudes. Didn\'t stay very long at all.

245698108.name: One of our favorites
245698108.author: a TripAdvisor user
245698108.reviewBody: Santa Cruz was one of our favorite ways to spend the day wandering the shops, beaches and restaurants. We found that the vendors were less pushy than La Crucecita. 5 minute cab ride from Las Brisas.

244872784.name: Santa cruz
244872784.author: a TripAdvisor user
244872784.reviewBody:
We are staying in Santa cruz very clean friendly community .  The activitys here seem to be nonstop however it is a busy time of year.
If you want heat look no further (it is sooo hot here) the only reason we would not stay a full six months.
The ocean is serene, emerald green and the sand is clay white we love the beach.
There has been three incidents of stingrays stinging that I am aware of within the past week so shuffle those feet when you enter the waters to scare them off.  I'm thinking that's a pretty high ratio for one person  to hear keep safe.

244589058.name: Very pretty and pleasant.
244589058.author: a TripAdvisor user
244589058.reviewBody: we stopped for a drink at the el Huayacan Restaurant which just off the beach. Very pretty with good margarita and Corona Beer. Perfect finish to a long day of walking around 2 towns. They take Visa and have good Wifi.

244556995.name: Santa Cruz Bay
244556995.author: a TripAdvisor user
244556995.reviewBody: This is the perfect place if you are looking for a little get away from your resort.  We did a little shopping, and then had a few drinks by the ocean.  Very safe, and all the people were very friendly

244284565.name: Well, a typical Commercial beach
244284565.author: a TripAdvisor user
244284565.reviewBody:
OK, the little beach is OK, We just wanted to go for a swim.
The restaurants and business people make this beach a bit of a pill.
I can do without being badgered to buy stuff every minute of my stay.

243284826.name: Excellent fishing - Chica Mala
243284826.author: a TripAdvisor user
243284826.reviewBody: Have the experience of a lifetime, deep sea fishing! A memory that will make you come back and go again! Contact Jaime Santos - his boat is the "chica mala"  just go to the Marina and ask for him...

243251009.name: A Beautiful Place To Visit
243251009.author: a TripAdvisor user
243251009.reviewBody: Our cruise ship docked here for the day and we took advantage of the little village to do some shopping and enjoy some food at a restaurant on the Bay.  it was a very special experience.  We wanted to rent a jet ski but, decided to just relax in the shade on the beach and then stroll the village.  The locals don\'t bother you too much once you get away from the dock.

241478161.name: Lovely bay
241478161.author: a TripAdvisor user
241478161.reviewBody: We rented a jet ski and toured thiS bay and the neighboring one!  Pretty, tranquilo place off season.

240320713.name: Rent a boat and spend some time
240320713.author: a TripAdvisor user
240320713.reviewBody: You can rent a boat for a minimum of 4 hours in the marina in Santa Cruz Bay, and ask the skipper to take you to all of the small Bahias that make Huatulco special. Talk to the skipper before you agree and make sure he understands that you want to travel from bay to bay. You can snorkle in each bay, wander the beach, or he will let you fish off the boat. Later in the afternoon, they will take you to one of the small restaurants that are in the smaller bahias that surround Huatulco. You can negotiate the price, and it\'s best to reserve the boat the day before your trip.

237140583.name: Tourist Bay
237140583.author: a TripAdvisor user
237140583.reviewBody: This is where the cruise ships come in and disgorge their clients to sample the local beaches and restaurants.  You can also hire a fishing boat by the hour.  Bay was a little disappointing, a lot of touristy shops all selling the same thing and the restaurants were not very interesting.  Some of the beaches are lovely though.  We went when it was very quiet, in the hight season it must be very crowded.

214713140.name: Came here with Holland America Cruiseline!
214713140.author: a TripAdvisor user
214713140.reviewBody: We tendered in from our ship that was docked in Bahia Santa Cruz!!!!! Such an unspoiled delight! The people are so wonderful and the town is so charming! A lot of resorts and time shares along the coast that we saw when we took a tour of the island! We will be back.

213519493.name: Santa Cruz Bay, Huatulco from a cruise ship
213519493.author: a TripAdvisor user
213519493.reviewBody: I was in Huatulco on a 38 night cruise from LA to Copenhagen on the Norwegian Star, and we had just visited other Mexican ports of Cabo San Lucas and Puerta Vallerta. Santa Cruz Bay is quite different as it\'s totally unspoilt at this point in time. The cantinas, bars and grills along the beach are welcoming and the food smells and taste delicious. There are quite a few tourist shops selling souvenirs, clothes, jewellery etc as well as a general store where you can top up on essentials. Most bars seem to have wifi but be patient as it\'s slow and takes a while to connect. The best thing to do is to ask someone who is connected, for the password they used as I wasn\'t able to get online - I\'d been given the wrong password by one letter! Cabs are available by the inner harbour to take you to La Crucecita, the nearest town. The bay is also a great place for a swim before heading back to the ship.

210340455.name: Just a general observation.....
210340455.author: a TripAdvisor user
210340455.reviewBody: Our cruise ship docked in Bahia Santa Cruz for only a few hours but the bus tour we took covered a large section of the coastline.  Just about everything has a clean, fresh look about it and the dozen or so resorts we passed looked inviting.  The main highway is modern and scenic.  No big crowds or traffic.  If I were return to Mexico for a beach vacation I would choose the Huatulco coast.

207966820.name: A waterfront for cruise ships and a lovely beach
207966820.author: a TripAdvisor user
207966820.reviewBody: This cruise ship harbour fills to overflowing when the cruise ships come in. The beach here is broad and beautiful and the little, open-air beachside church is an interesting and contemplative space. Beach side cantinas, grills and seafood restaurants, small cafes over the open square, a great coffee shop in the park and and lot of little open air stalls selling tourist paraphenalia make up Santa Cruz. The surrounding developments are mostly condos and hotels.

205824911.name: Great place for a visit and shopping
205824911.author: a TripAdvisor user
205824911.reviewBody: Nice little place. Freidnly poeple, all stores are close together, good barganing and great selection. We were there during a fishing derby, and attended the fiesta marking it\'s end. Very happy people. Nice place to visit, short taxi ride from Barcelo or Dreams resorts. About 50 pesos one way

204042177.name: Quaint little town
204042177.author: a TripAdvisor user
204042177.reviewBody: Had an awesome lunch on the beach, watched the cruise ship come in - neat town but vendors are a little more aggressive then La Crucecita, I guess because they hound the cruise ship patrons, it\'s just a tiny bit more expensive here than La Crucecita but still worth the visit.

203645535.name: Awesome chance to see some boats
203645535.author: a TripAdvisor user
203645535.reviewBody: We went here to hop on our boat to go fishing. You get to see the dock where the big cruise ships come in and it is HUGE! The locals are very friendly as well.

202247915.name: nice spot
202247915.author: a TripAdvisor user
202247915.reviewBody: this is where the smaller cruise ships come in. one of our stops on our fishing/snorkelling/boat tour with Eddy. There is a walking trail into La Crucecita or it is a 5 min cab ride.

200825578.name: Great Bay
200825578.author: a TripAdvisor user
200825578.reviewBody: Beautiful place to visit...whether it is the beach, or walking along the dock and visiting the quaint shops.  Great spot, great scenery!!

200536448.name: Nice Bay to Swim in
200536448.author: a TripAdvisor user
200536448.reviewBody: Another nice Bay to swim in. Not a bay to snorkel in. Do not go when the Cruise ships are in, it gets very busy and the prices go up.

200387864.name: Snorkeling Excursion
200387864.author: a TripAdvisor user
200387864.reviewBody: We got on our boat from Santa Cruz bay.  It was great as we did see Dolphins, 3 Grey whales and a turtle on our ride to the beaches to snorkel.  Snorkel equipment was good but no flippers. So if you like snorkelling bring your own.

199928622.name: A lovely little town
199928622.author: a TripAdvisor user
199928622.reviewBody: We visited Santa Cruz in March. It is a nice little town, with many hotels and condos. There are lots of places to eat, and you can charter boat tours from here much more cheaply than you can at your hotel. The is some high-end silver shopping, as well as a large flea market for souvenirs. Santa Cruz has a nice little beach. Remember, you won\'t be able to bargain when a cruise ship is in the local dock, but otherwise the bargaining begins! There is a lovely little treed park with a nice coffee shop in the middle so you can enjoy coffee or breakfast, etc under the trees listening to the birds. Very relaxing.

197191209.name: Nice beach, too many vendors
197191209.author: a TripAdvisor user
197191209.reviewBody: This was a very nice beach area but we were hassled by beach vendors/restaurant owners the entire time. When we finally picked a spot to stop and have a drink, the people peddling their wares even bothered us in the restaurant A9lthough it was on the beach, it would have been nice to be left alone)

197163891.name: okay beach, not the beast available
197163891.author: a TripAdvisor user
197163891.reviewBody: This is a cool beach for an afternoon- many restaurants available to eat/drink. It simply doesn\'t compare to others in the area though. I had one negative experience with the tourist centre on the beach here... I was having an allergic reaction to the sea water and was rapidly breaking out in hives and went panicking into the tourist centre where showers are 5 peso (like 45cents). My husband was on the beach with our cash and the lady at the counter had zero compassion- I got a cold "no" to using the shower after pleading that I would come right back with the money if she would just let me rinse off the salt water. I felt initially very angry about this, but one has to realize this is poor place and the public health expectations just aren\'t the same as at home. Thankfully a restaurant owner observed what was happening and quickly provided me with a pale of water.... left me with quite a poor impression of the tourist centre.

196473699.name: Santa Cruz Bay the place to go
196473699.author: a TripAdvisor user
196473699.reviewBody: Liked the location, short walk from Binniguenda Hotel where we were staying. Our beach \'club\' was located there. Felt safe walking even at dark. Beach has a half dozen restaurants with good food and drinks. During the day our Binni beach club had free drinks for us and at night it became a beach restaurant with better drinks and great food. I had the shrimp and it was awesome. A bit pricey but worth it. The locals swim at this beach and it looked nice for swimming. The big dock is there just over from the swimming beach so was neat to see the cruise ship come in. A few nicer shops for the cruise ships just over from the beach and restaurants. Met nice people from Chicago who live there in a condo. You aren\'t bugged by people trying to sell stuff; they are nice and not bothersome at all. Lots to see if you want to just sit with a beer at one of the tables/restaurants. Don\'t forget to buy a latte (or other fancy) coffee at the town square just behind the beach area. Great coffee and music there. Great service.

196326608.name: A nice stroll
196326608.author: a TripAdvisor user
196326608.reviewBody: After walking into La Crucetia centre and back we stopped off at the beach to have a swim before rejoining out ship.  There are many souvenir shops and restaurants in this area to enjoy if you do not want to wander too far away from the terminal.  The beach offered beach umbrellas etc. and it was a good area to watch all the boating activity.

196128492.name: not much to do
196128492.author: a TripAdvisor user
196128492.reviewBody: Had some beer at the beach front bar- near the Port- beer was expensive and no one was at the restaurant- pretty boring

195897401.name: Tons of shops!
195897401.author: a TripAdvisor user
195897401.reviewBody: Great place to visit. Tons of shopping to do and you have to check out Mamma mia\'s for their thin crust pizza. Very good! Nice beach bar. Also! Find the tequila store! great place to find the right kind of tequila! you could taste test all day there so don\'t go there on a empty stomach! lol. Found some smooth agave tequila and some delicious mango liqueur! Try them!!

195342536.name: Boats
195342536.author: a TripAdvisor user
195342536.reviewBody: Santa Cruz is much like La Crucecita, only its on the water.  The big marina is here and this is where we caught the boat that we rented for the day.  The cruise ships also dock here, so  prices at the shops are a bit more expensive.

194860591.name: Very pretty.
194860591.author: a TripAdvisor user
194860591.reviewBody: We only spend an afternoon here but it was very beautiful and most of the people spoke english.  They were very helpful and so proud of their town.

194758087.name: Enjoyed the ambiance
194758087.author: a TripAdvisor user
194758087.reviewBody: We had lunch and supper a couple of nights at the various restaurants on Santa Cruz Bay. We enjoyed the view and the activity as we ate.

193901252.name: Small town - expensive prices!
193901252.author: a TripAdvisor user
193901252.reviewBody: We have travelled extensively through Mexico. Cruise ship was in the day we went to Santa Cruz.  Items in shops were ridiculously expensive - more so than any other cruise ship port. Items for which we paid $100 pesos in Puerto Vallarta were $450 in Santa Cruz. Restaurant staff tried to convince us to return after 4 p.m. as the cruise ship would be gone and then they would have "special" prices.  The town was clean with potential for growth. Had a nice meal at Los Arcos - neat, clean bistro-like restaurant down a side street!

193761488.name: Great shopping
193761488.author: a TripAdvisor user
193761488.reviewBody: We spent the early morning in Santa Cruz to do some site seeing and shopping.  We had been to La Crucecita for shopping, so much of the shops were comparable.  In Santa Cruz the people were more open to bartering and the selection of jewellery was more diverse.  There were a number of restaurants to eat, a beach and many opportunities for rentals - jet ski\'s, kayaks, scooters, etc....\n\nGreat people, nice harbour and excellent shopping.  There is a lot of opportunity to purchase property in Santa Cruz as well if you\'re interested!  Make sure not to go to Santa Cruz on a cruise ship day as the price may be elevated.

193488590.name: Lots to see
193488590.author: a TripAdvisor user
193488590.reviewBody: We didn\'t stick around here long. We docked our boat here for the 7 bays and snorkeling tour, I would\'ve liked to check it out more.

192509130.name: Busy on cruise ship days
192509130.author: a TripAdvisor user
192509130.reviewBody: Very friendly,very busy on cruise ship days.Shops are fun, seafood was fresh, drinks,beach is busy,fishing tours leave from here.We used Yellow Fin,was super,safe and caught 2 fish.

192403900.name: Great Food and Always Calm Waters
192403900.author: a TripAdvisor user
192403900.reviewBody: Santa Cruz Bay is where all the cruise ships dock.  Since it is completely surrounded by rock, it is always quite calm and good swimming compared to some of the other bays when there is a breeze.  Have eaten at several good restaurants and the locals are always very pleasant and willing to help.  They even remember you from year to year!  Always spend time here as it is within walking distance to the hotel.

191959143.name: very serene
191959143.author: a TripAdvisor user
191959143.reviewBody: plenty of beach chairs, water is warm and calm. very relaxing. lots of locals on weekend - not a lot of vendors and they leave if you politely say no. walking distance to shops and public plaza.

191174997.name: Marina
191174997.author: a TripAdvisor user
191174997.reviewBody: We toured through the town of Santa Cruz and then up on to the hill to look down on their marina.  Beautiful view, even though no cruise ships were there at the time.

190625539.name: Beautiful small Mexican town with the best pizza(Oro Nero)
190625539.author: a TripAdvisor user
190625539.reviewBody: A beautiful Mexican town with a small market where one can barter for all your holiday souvenirs!! Small beach -ample beach front restaurants! We found the perfect pizza restaurant -just off the beach, upstairs above the shops. It is new (opened approx. 4months ago) -spacious and clean! \nPizzas are cooked to order in a traditional clay oven - delicious!! Easily equals "La Crema" restaurant in the larger town of La Cruceitita. But not as busy and it has a better view! Staff were very friendly and accommodating! Our party consisted of 4 adults and 4 children (all under the age of 9) and everyone left feeling full and happy!

190602727.name: Binneugenda beach club at Santa Cruz
190602727.author: a TripAdvisor user
190602727.reviewBody: We spent several days at this beach & we were very impressed by the clear water & beautiful views. Unfortunately, there is a lot of sea-doo activity & boat operators trying to sell banana boat rides. We were there over Christmas, so it was probably much busier than usual, but the boat fumes did become pretty noxious after awhile.

189790317.name: busy beach
189790317.author: a TripAdvisor user
189790317.reviewBody: nice beach but no bathrooms to many seadoo rentals ect smells like motorboat oil but there is 9 other beachs to choose from.

188893723.name: Picturesque and Placid
188893723.author: a TripAdvisor user
188893723.reviewBody: We spent four days in a condo above this lovely bay. The waters are calm, with a couple of really nice beaches, and an expansive dock from which one can take reasonably priced tours of the other bays in the area or purchase freshly caught fish. Taxis only charge about 2 dollars to take you to anywhere in the beautiful and very clean town, and the wonderful restaurants, shops and night spots round out the wonderful experience.

188007902.name: Port
188007902.author: a TripAdvisor user
188007902.reviewBody: Quaint, good market, geared towards catering to the cruise ships, church at the port is interesting open concept facing the water - lots of fishing and recreational boats.

187979679.name: Calm waters
187979679.author: a TripAdvisor user
187979679.reviewBody: One of the calmer beaches of Huatulco. A few tourist priced restaurants, the marina, some night spots on the sand and an extensive tourist market. A few times a week you can catch a giant cruise ship docking as well.

187959877.name: Lovely
187959877.author: a TripAdvisor user
187959877.reviewBody: A fine place to relax in the hot sunshine. Excellent bars within a few meters of the beach. Plenty of small places to buy souvenirs from friendly locals. Such a relaxing place - did not want to leave.

187930101.name: sand beach
187930101.author: a TripAdvisor user
187930101.reviewBody: Very touristy.  The sand is soft on the feet.  We didn\'t like all the people selling you stuff or wanting you to come to their restaurant for food n drink.

186919437.name: Nice relaxed area
186919437.author: a TripAdvisor user
186919437.reviewBody: We really enjoyed taking a short cab ride to Santa Cruz Bay and visiting the uncrowded shops.  The merchants were friendly.  It does help to know some spanish - more than just "a little".  We also enjoyed dinner on the beach.  it was very relaxing.

181962699.name: This Australian fell in love with this place at first sight!
181962699.author: a TripAdvisor user
181962699.reviewBody: To be honest, when our cruise ship glided in to the modern and well-protected wharf I thought I was in the Italian Riviera, with luxury condos tumbling down the steep hillside to the crystal clear waters of the Bay. But then I saw the golden sand of the two beaches either side of the wharf, the immaculately clean concrete-covered streets, the many boutiques and the unmistakeable Spanish architecture and I knew that this was, quite definitely, authentically Mexican. The locals were friendly, not importuning (except for some enthusiastic would-be guides) and happily accepted our "Non Gracias" to their entreaty to look inside their shop/restaurant. The beautiful Church of the Holy Cross was serene, located right on the sand, open to the outside and with the simplest of altars and a notable lack of ornamentation which added to the serenity it invoked. The shops offerred the usual panoply of T-shirts, embroidered skirts, black Oaxacan pottery and silver jewellery, wooden carvings and alcohol. The restaurants all appeared to be clean and offerred a great array of fresh seafoods with drop-dead gorgeous views over the Bahia de Santa Cruz ("Holy Cross Bay"). It was a delight to be there, and so centrally located to all the resorts stretching up and down the Bahias de Huatulco region.

175095292.name: Shops, restaurants on the beach, markets and more
175095292.author: a TripAdvisor user
175095292.reviewBody: This is where the cruse ships dock and sometimes the shop owners can get a bit more aggressive. But it has a nice market with shops, shops along the street, there are lots of restaurants along the beach where you can sit in the sand and have a meal and a cold beer. The Marina is also here where most of the fishing tours leave from, you can also find a fishing boat here and book your own fishing or site seeing trip of the bays which is considerable cheaper then booking from your hotel or a travel place. \nHave a great vacation and if the shop owners are too aggressive go to La Crucecita  it is actually only about a 20 minute walk so get the exercise ... Adios

172097249.name: Very nice marina /beach/restaurant area .
172097249.author: a TripAdvisor user
172097249.reviewBody: Beautiful Santa Cruz , area with hotels , restaurants , music , marina and great to stroll through . Nice restaurants that are literally 20 feet from the water . Great swimming too . bring the family and friends and enjoy some shade and swim time . Love this area very much .

169348478.name: Restaurants
169348478.author: a TripAdvisor user
169348478.reviewBody: Eating here can be a bit of a tourist trap because of the prices. That being said, there isn\'t a single hotel Restaurant that can compare to the quality of the seafood here.  Dona Celia is wonderful, run by 3 generations of ladies who will cook your seafood anyway you want it.  The beach is very nice and clean, not nearly as crowded as la Entrega.  Very nice shopping also.

163123483.name: Tourist trap
163123483.author: a TripAdvisor user
163123483.reviewBody: This is where the cruise ship comes in and where the tour boats depart from. If you want shopping, go to La Crucecita; if you want swimming or snorkeling, go to San Augustin or Bahia Maguey. I can\'t comment on the food at the Santa Cruz restaurants but I can say their buskers are pushy. Please don\'t judge Huatulco on Santa Cruz - take the 25 peso taxi ride to the Zocalo at La Crucecita and dine at the many Trip Advisor recommended restaurants there.

161284011.name: largest marina and cruise ship stop
161284011.author: a TripAdvisor user
161284011.reviewBody: This bay has the only ocean draft deep enough to accommodate the huge crusie ships. We actually saw the Queen Mary II. The ship was at least 13 stories above sea level. Many of these ships come up from the Panama Canal. There are many restuarants, boutique shops, and tours available here. in the center of the park is Cafe Huatulco. Try some of the coffee, offered with a light menu. Here you will find a historical religion altar with a rich history located just off the water. There are many festivals with unique spectacular events during the Lenten season which brings all the people together fron the entire region with native ethnic local food, crafts, and shows/dances.

160982595.name: Barely any waves in this bay. Perfect for the timid
160982595.author: a TripAdvisor user
160982595.reviewBody: This bay is close to the Market and is very sheltered so the water is quite calm.  Snorkeling Ok. but better to go to Entrega

160452527.name: Pity about the cruise liners...
160452527.author: a TripAdvisor user
160452527.reviewBody: This would be the safest beach on the coast if it were not for the cruise ships - and they have chosen it because it is a safe bay! So, the small and very popular beach is usually crowded - especially in the evenings and at weekends when locals swell the ranks. It is safe swimming even for the smallest of visitors but it is not always the cleanest. However, even if you don\'t swim here, with its restaurant and caf\u00e9 tables on the beach, and the usually calm air at dusk, it is a good place to hang out and enjoy people watching of a Mexican evening.

160298190.name: Beautiful Santa Cruz Beach
160298190.author: a TripAdvisor user
160298190.reviewBody: Good safe swimming.  Go when the cruise ships are not in. Do not pay extra for beach loungers. You will be pounced on when you arrive but when you have made your mind up which bar/beach you will sit at you will be left alone

158722520.name: Always worth a visit
158722520.author: a TripAdvisor user
158722520.reviewBody: I stay in the Santa Cruz area for a reason:  close to a wonderful beach, fabulous food and shopping.  The bay is always calm and great for snorkeling, the restaurants welcoming and they always remember you from past years.  I don\'t know how they do it, but they don\'t forget you.  Plenty of sun and umbrellas available for all.  One of the only beaches that I have seen with a church on the shoreline. Beautiful place to spend an hour or the whole day.  Santa Cruz will not disappoint you.

158161170.name: Pretty marina and public beach
158161170.author: a TripAdvisor user
158161170.reviewBody: Great shopping from little vendor kiosks to a few up-scale ladies boutiques.    Easy taxi fare from hotel zone... must visit!

158069258.name: Good place to chill out
158069258.author: a TripAdvisor user
158069258.reviewBody: We found a spot at the far end of the beach and spent a very relaxing day. This can be a very busy location, and the different vendors tend to mob you as you enter through the square. We avoided the hassle completely by walking in a block past the main entrance where the Sta. Cruz chapel is located. \nThe Dona Celia restaurant is at the rightmost end of the beach, and serves amazing seafood and cold beer. Very clean washrooms too.

156904845.name: Don\'t go when the cruise ships come in
156904845.author: a TripAdvisor user
156904845.reviewBody: Santa Cruz is a cruise ship port. The cruise ship visits have declined greatly over the past few years and the local shops are really hurting. As a result I found the vendors very aggressive. I didn\'t  enjoy being chased down the street by the vendors. If you do go when the cruise ships are in port, it can get crowded and the prices go up.

155881954.name: Condos
155881954.author: a TripAdvisor user
155881954.reviewBody: We went to go see a condo in Santa Cruz. Then we walked into town. The shopping was great and having a beer in the park was wonderful!!

153460701.name: Very Touristy
153460701.author: a TripAdvisor user
153460701.reviewBody: Santa Cruz was built specifically to cater to the cruise ship industry. The bay is beautiful and the town is very clean but is predominately set up as a marina and shopping mall.  You can buy almost anything in the outdoor mall and the prices were average.  We went later in the day and they were more willing to barter to get a sale before closing their shops.  It got a very nice table cloth.  There are taxis at the marina waiting to take you anywhere you want to go but make sure you set a price before getting in.

153145122.name: A fun little city
153145122.author: a TripAdvisor user
153145122.reviewBody: Santa Cruz has a very nice marina. Good place to hire a local fishing boat and guide. Nice silver shops and many many sourvenir shops and restaurants. Get\'s very crowded when the cruise ships are in dock.

152731454.name: Luna Azul Sunset Cruise
152731454.author: a TripAdvisor user
152731454.reviewBody: Adeline and his first mate took my group of 6 out for a wonderful sunset cruise. We headed up the north coast so we saw a couple of secluded bays and a beautiful sunset. We deliberated about taking this excursion for 6 days and finally on the last night, the concerns (banos) were all addressed and we jumped off the fence. Everyone was very glad we did. My "terrified of water" fellow traveler is the one that supplied the pictures and urged me to write this review. I have trouble with motion sickness usually so remained sober, but not sick. Just a very lovely time with good friends.

152347142.name: Where the Cruise Ships Come In
152347142.author: a TripAdvisor user
152347142.reviewBody: I was hesitant to swim in this bay due to the number of boats, and the fact that the cruise ships dock here. I suspect there\'s probably a lot of boat fuel in the water. But the beach is nice, and there are upscale shops and restaurants, again because of the cruise ships. There\'s a small park for shade, and a Scotiabank on the main street if you need an ATM.

152103986.name: Big waves
152103986.author: a TripAdvisor user
152103986.reviewBody: not great for little kids as the wave pull you out and if you can stay up well you get tossed a bit. but it was nice, great food

151960593.name: Great way to spend a day or even a few hours
151960593.author: a TripAdvisor user
151960593.reviewBody:
Santa Cruz is known for being the port for cruise ships. When the ships come in there is a possibility of price hikes. This year the ship came in on Friday.

Located in Santa Cruz is a public beach and marina with calm water. You will also find restaurants, shops, markets, a beautiful church, Scotia Bank and in the middle of the square is ‘Café Huatulco’ who serves an awesome cup of coffee- Americano.

Always feel welcomed and safe.

150434327.name: Go Here First
150434327.author: a TripAdvisor user
150434327.reviewBody: The shopping here is the best for sand toys for the kids\nand boogybords ,bathingsuits , wraps and things like that .\nNext time I will be going here first  to buy that kind of suff for my vaction

150181934.name: Nice beach, restaurants
150181934.author: a TripAdvisor user
150181934.reviewBody: Santa Cruz has a nice public beach and a ton of decent restaurants.  Wonderful way to wile away a day.  Best time to visit is when the cruise ship is not in port.  Shops are geared to a free spending cruise ship crowd, many have their price is USD.

148797633.name: Great spot
148797633.author: a TripAdvisor user
148797633.reviewBody: Great spot to walk to from Villa Blanca Hotel - lots of restaurants and shops, friendly people. Prices seemed cheaper here than in Crucecita, all in all worth a visit or two.

148535110.name: Worth a visit
148535110.author: a TripAdvisor user
148535110.reviewBody: The bay was beautiful with tons of market shopping right outside the entrance to the bay. You can rent scooters and other boat cruised and excursions right there.

141606181.name: Great place for family and kids
141606181.author: a TripAdvisor user
141606181.reviewBody: Calm water with no waves. Friendly people at the restaurants there. Nice place to have a drink and enjoy the view.

136046270.name: 1st day
136046270.author: a TripAdvisor user
136046270.reviewBody: Went here, ordered the ceviche. It comes with complimentary chips. Beautiful. At first, they wanted me to go to the cobana, but I insisted on sitting at a table on the sand. Don\'t know why? Misunderstanding? Plenty of tables on the beach, never OVERCROWDED. Just the right amount of people. Safe.

135391737.name: Nice bay
135391737.author: a TripAdvisor user
135391737.reviewBody: Lovely bay with few nice shops, restaurants and bars, still quite quiet. Cruise ship pier is a bit of a shame...

128979553.name: Visit
128979553.author: a TripAdvisor user
128979553.reviewBody: We didn\'t stop too long because there was too many people hasslng us so we didn\'t stop to have a look around.  This was the only place this happened to us on our trip.

128524386.name: Shopping
128524386.author: a TripAdvisor user
128524386.reviewBody: Santa Cruz Bay is beautiful and worth the visit.  Beware that if you enter any of the "Bonita" line stores you will encounter some high pressure shopping!  We had to be very firm in telling some store owners "No" and they still followed us around from store to store.

127820367.name: clean and lovely bars and restaurants
127820367.author: a TripAdvisor user
127820367.reviewBody: Spent o most of our time on this beach.  The restaurants on the beach were wonderful and the quality of the food very good especially the oysters from the fisherman so fresh

127164371.name: good for a 1/2 day
127164371.author: a TripAdvisor user
127164371.reviewBody: not a good spot to swim, but nice to shop and look at the boats.

126331217.name: Sta Cruz
126331217.author: a TripAdvisor user
126331217.reviewBody: Beautiful beach lined with restaurants well back from the water.  Very calm, child-friendly bay.

125414822.name: Make sure to find the market!
125414822.author: a TripAdvisor user
125414822.reviewBody: Nice little area with some nice shops & beachside restaurants

125239185.name: Very Quaint
125239185.author: a TripAdvisor user
125239185.reviewBody: Excellent Seafood restaurants on the beach. Small shops and friendly people.

124898368.name: Nice safe town
124898368.author: a TripAdvisor user
124898368.reviewBody: Santa Cruz had lots of shops, some were cruise ship oriented (sombreros and t-shirts) but some were real nice.  I was shocked at how friendly everyone was.  Ate at a restaurant with tables on the sand and the food was the best local Mexican I have ever had, and the Margaritas weren\'t too bad either.  If you go to Huatulco Bay stop at the marina at Santa Cruz and spend some time there.

124672989.name: VERY QUIET
124672989.author: a TripAdvisor user
124672989.reviewBody: We went down there acouple of times too quiet for our liking

124272501.name: Convenient spot for cruisers to book their own tours!
124272501.author: a TripAdvisor user
124272501.reviewBody: I like this area as you can hire your own boat directly for a tour of the many secluded bays where some of the nicest beaches and snorkeling spots are located, and you can do that without going through the cruise ship. You can tailor your boat trips to a few hours  at one or two spots, or spend the day going from place to place. We had lunch at one of the restaurants facing the beach and food and prices were very reasonable.

123797716.name: Great Location
123797716.author: a TripAdvisor user
123797716.reviewBody: Santa Cruz is the place to go for your souvenirs.  They had a nice flea market where you can find all your typical Mexican wares. Be sure to barter!\nThere are many restaurants along the pier. Be sure to check out Frenta al Mar and ask for Carlos (Mi Amigo!), and order one of his famous Mojito\'s...you won\'t be disappointed !\nThe shops along the Marina are more expensive as they mostly cater to the cruise ships when they are in.

123745258.name: bays tour with Pilo
123745258.author: a TripAdvisor user
123745258.reviewBody: travelled throught the marina, alot of commercial fishing vessels, private, tour boats, naval ships.  this is where we met our guide to go on the bays tour.  no cruise ships were docked the day we went.  want to see one of those up close.  Great snorkelling, whales, sea turtles, dolphins, beaches.  have to day a day of fishing with him on my return next year.

123556644.name: calm water and a show when the crewships arrives
123556644.author: a TripAdvisor user
123556644.reviewBody: check the video to have a 360 degrees look of this wonderfull bay\nhttp://youtu.be/aqxh-jsKumU

118033282.name: Santa Cruz, another gem!
118033282.author: a TripAdvisor user
118033282.reviewBody: We spent some time in Santa Cruz. This little village of course has a main square, we went to the store, bought some adult beverages, sat on a bench in the park and people watched. You will have a lot of touts trying to get you to come to the restaurants on the bay. We found that if we were firm, but polite they would not continue to bother us. We did end up going to one of the restaurants right on the bay, sat under an umbrella for several hours, the food was good, the beer was cold and there was a nice breeze. The marina is very clean, you do have to pay 5 pesos to go out to the docks. There is shopping, there are stores for grocery as well as beer and wine. I would imagine during cruise ship season this town would get quite crowded and busy busy busy!! We loved the atmosphere in general.

8117399.name: new residence
8117399.author: a TripAdvisor user
8117399.reviewBody: we\'ve been to huatulco 3 times now.every thing about the place is to our liking.the village of santa cruz has an old mexico charm the people are incrediable.we liked it so much we have purchased a house there and are planning to spend as much time as possiable there\n

671562737.name: a day at the beach
671562737.author: a TripAdvisor user
671562737.reviewBody: at the close of the vacation is is nice to go to a desolate beach....by boat...and sink your heals in the sand and enjoy the sound of the ocean and drink a beer! this is a great bay to snorkel or just listen to traveling mariachis!

670140240.name: Some good places to eat
670140240.author: a TripAdvisor user
670140240.reviewBody: we stopped here during a tour we were on. interesting beach. some small shops and restaurants. not a very expensive place so its worth a look.

667729812.name: Beach
667729812.author: a TripAdvisor user
667729812.reviewBody: Beautiful swimming beach very clean and secluded. A perfect way to spend a very warm day playing in the water.

666097756.name: Green water, great sand and good beers!
666097756.author: a TripAdvisor user
666097756.reviewBody:
El Costano was the restaurant we picked to call home on this beach, Esperanza was a great server and always kept our drinks topped up, their menu is an amazing stay of fish and sea food that won’t disappoint!  water is calm and clear, good snorkeling and lots of other bars and restaurants to choose from!

For the two of us all day with drinks and food was $85 Canadian but we had plenty to drink and eat, the red snapper is bbq’d and is amazing!

This was our most favourite beach of all of them in Huatulco, best sand and close to the water from our chase loungers!

663514247.name: NINO HE IS THE MAN
663514247.author: a TripAdvisor user
663514247.reviewBody: Go see Nino, he is at the bottom of the long steps down, turn right and ask for him, very honest guy, and will keep you in drinks and food with a lovely place right on the beach. The snorkling is amazing, the left side is quieter than the left but both are worth checking out

660820997.name: meal stop and look around.
660820997.author: a TripAdvisor user
660820997.reviewBody: Very interesting beach and restaurant.  The food we had was very good.  extras included tortilla and amazing guacamole.  Family oriented beach and facilities.

660162874.name: Beautiful and Relaxing Bay
660162874.author: a TripAdvisor user
660162874.reviewBody: This is one of the Huatulco Bays. Huatulco is a non a typicall town because all the residential areas, Hotels, restaurants and atractions are spread arround and near to principal bays such as: Santa Rosa, Chehue, La Entrega, Tangolunda and so on. There are some other small bays with some, few or none infraestructure at all such is El Maguey Bay, el Arrocillo and some others. El Maguey is special because it has some restaurants, restrooms and there is a small road to get almost to the beach that is available through some starirs. It is a good place to snorkel and swim and take a couple of beers, coconuts and seefood. You can spend part or full day at the beach. And visit the other Bays during your stay

659498547.name: Great relaxing day!
659498547.author: a TripAdvisor user
659498547.reviewBody:
Had a nice day at Maguey Beach!

pros:
- easy to get to, about a  10 minute taxi ride - 70 pesos from Villablanca in Santa Cruz

- met Nino from La Costino upon our arrival. The reviews about him and his beach restaurant are accurate; very kind man who ensured we had good beach loungers , umbrella , table and drinks and food throughout the day.  We enjoyed the breaded fried shrimp and French fries!  He brought our bill at the end of the afternoon along with shots of liqueur to thanks us. Nice!

- water was a bit rougher here than Santa Cruz but fun none the less.  Enjoyed body surfing the big waves. Do swim out a bit from shore about 3-4 metres to avoid the rougher churn as waves crash into shore. 

- lots of options for food - there are at least 8 restaurants on the beach

- good vendors on the beach. I bought a nice crocheted purse- fully lined, with good zipper for about $12. 

- super easy return, there are cabs lined up waiting to take tourists back to hotels. 

- met a little dog who came and sat in the shade by mylounger. He enjoyed a long drink of water, some potato chips and was content to just lay beside my chair and enjoy my company. I’m a dog lover who was really missing my dog so this was a nice unexpected part of the beach day!

Cons:

- there is a very strong smell of garbage when you arrive in the parking lot. It was quite overwhelming and almost made us want to turn around and leave!  I realize it’s hot but one would think they might find a way to minimize this. 

- the complaints about the stairs (3 flights) to walk down to the beach are valid.  Going down was not so bad but coming back up at the end of the day when you are hot and tired was not so fun.  Beside the stairs there is a ramp but t honestly, if one were having mobility issues, I think this beach would likely be challenging. Perhaps there is another way down but I didn’t see any. 

- the surf was a bit rough. And the undertow could be strong at times. While this is a beautiful beach, if I had young children, I would likely take them somewhere calmer - like the beach at Santa Cruz.

657829165.name: Go for the food
657829165.author: a TripAdvisor user
657829165.reviewBody: So many small restaurants to choose from, go and make the day of it, the weather is always perfect .\nTake the short cab ride and drop yourself in the sand for the day

657065776.name: Snorkelling is best to the right
657065776.author: a TripAdvisor user
657065776.reviewBody: This is a very popular beach and was very busy the day we were there.  Lots of Mexicans, apparently from Mexico City.  That made the traditional snorkel area very busy.  We tried that area, which is to the left and has the easiest entry point.  It was quite good.  However, the roped off snorkel area to the right as you look out onto the water is much better.  There are very few people snorkeling there and it is definitely clearer and a greater variety of fish.  Well worth the walk.

657013677.name: Fantastic Beach
657013677.author: a TripAdvisor user
657013677.reviewBody: I met friends at Maguey Bay for the day.  The beach is fantastic.  Nice clear water and lots of restaurants.  It cost is 110.00 pesos to go there from Barcelo

656866557.name: Nice early
656866557.author: a TripAdvisor user
656866557.reviewBody: This is a scenic, fairly flat beach that makes for a very nice visit if you get there by 10:00 and leave by 1:30.  Around noon, the tour boats and buses arrive and it turns into a crowded Disneyland kind of scene.  There is decent snorkeling along the rocks on the left side of the bay, but better snorkeling along the rocks on the right side of the bay.  The further out you go, the better the visibility, and the more living coral you will see.  If you snorkel early, you may have the place to yourself.  After noon, you will be snorkeling with hordes of people brought in by boats that anchor nearby.  There are plenty of restaurants along the beach.  It is a 70 peso taxi ride from Chahue.

656676437.name: Great Beach
656676437.author: a TripAdvisor user
656676437.reviewBody: This has become our favourite beach in the Huatulco area. Easy to get to, great soft sand and beautiful clear water. There is some good snorkelling as well and many restaurants to choose from. We like Las Hamacas restaurant and the shrimp is fresh and delicious.

655907087.name: Boat Trip
655907087.author: a TripAdvisor user
655907087.reviewBody: This was a stop on a snorkelling tour.  I have been twice and both times we were channelled into a restaurant pre selected by tour operator.  Food was good on both occasions. Swam on the beach and I would say it was fun,  Kids loved it.

654621713.name: Another bay to to far away.
654621713.author: a TripAdvisor user
654621713.reviewBody: Ended up here as part of our 5 bay tour. Nice size, lots of restaurants . Majority of the tour boats end up so it can be busy . Really did not feel crowded . The hitman for the restaurants that they send after you to come to their restaurant can be intimidating for some. Nothing for an old salt like me. Really no complaints. Must not miss since it is so close.

654426640.name: dirty beach, tourist trap
654426640.author: a TripAdvisor user
654426640.reviewBody: Lured to this place as a beautiful beach with great swimming. But it\u2019s the lunch stop, and you are instructed to use the restaurant associated with your tour company, cannot try a different place. It\u2019s a tourist trap, the beach is bland & filthy compared to other beaches. \nAlso have pesos or you will be gouged in exchange. Argument with restaurant staff over this, their asking rate was overly ridiculous (they wanted to charge 14 peso to US$, at resort it\u2019s around 18 to 19). We got it to around 16, and left no tips.

653992560.name: Day trip snorkeling and lunch
653992560.author: a TripAdvisor user
653992560.reviewBody: After being railroaded into \u201c my place\u201d with free chairs and umbrella  and wifi (La Govioto) our waiter explained chairs and umbrella were free as long as we purchaced drinks and food from his place. This is pretty much a standard practice, no problem.  We ordered up fresh orange juice and got comfortable. He came by and asked if we were ready to order food? We advised him a little later as it was only 10:30 am. We did a 30-40 minute snorkel and returned to our chairs and again we were confronted with \u201care you ready to order food?\u201d To which the wife replied in Spanish a little bit later. Around noon we did ask for a menu and a couple of cervaza. They took forever to arrive and were almost air temperature. When it came time to place a food order he was nowhere to be found. Over the next hour we observed him escorting in many families of locals and seating them at his place, complete with mostly their own beverages etc. Our meal and next round of drinks again took forever,while the locals were smart and ordered off the beach vendors. When our drinks were done we ordered a couple more that never did arrive. Finally asked got the bill and guess what,it took 25 minutes to arrive too.  Not usually one to complain but I never have felt so ignored like this before.

653805765.name: Beautiful
653805765.author: a TripAdvisor user
653805765.reviewBody: My husband and I visited here yesterday. We really enjoyed ourselves. We arrived early before the crowds and met Tony who took his to his restaurant down on the end of the beach. He took excellent care of us. Yes he made sure anything we wanted or needed was taken care of. He sat with us and visited which was nice as not many locals can speak fluent English. This beach is absolutely beautiful. We arrived early so it felt like we had the whole Beach to ourselves. There were several fishing boats available to take you anywhere you wanted to go. After about maybe an hour several boat started arriving with many people. The restaurants became very busy and the beach also became very busy we hung around until mid-afternoon and then when the crowds arrived we left. I would definitely recommend this beach it has an amazing Sandy Bottom and there is snorkeling there as well. Don\'t forget to bring your snorkel gear but no worries they have some there that you can rent if you forget. One of my favorite beaches here in Huachuca. I definitely recommend this place..

653765881.name: A bay for swimming
653765881.author: a TripAdvisor user
653765881.reviewBody: We have been to 10 of the beaches in Huatulco now and Ithink Maguey is the best for swimming so far. The sandy beach takes 10 minutes to walk from end to end. The water is clear and especially calm fora Pacific beach. The beach is also shallow for the first 50 feet or so so the water is warmer than some of the nearby beaches. There is no debris so the beach is very clean. We saw lots of people snorkeling on the sides of the bay.\nMaguey is lined with beach clubs where chairs umbrellas and food are available. We took our own towels and laid on the beach but had meals in two different clubs. I would describe the food as pub grub, and it was fine.\nOne possible drawback. You have to access the beach from the parking lot via a steep ramp or four flights of stairs.

653247899.name: Beach Day
653247899.author: a TripAdvisor user
653247899.reviewBody: Great beach with many food and bev options - lots of people selling stuff on beach but they are polite and move on when you say no thanks.

652078115.name: Great beach day!
652078115.author: a TripAdvisor user
652078115.reviewBody: The water was beautiful  and the beach was clean! Very nice plave and reasonable prices for a few drinks! We would highly recommend a day here!

651905660.name: Nice beach
651905660.author: a TripAdvisor user
651905660.reviewBody: We stopped here on a recent visit/ boat ride \nWaters are warm a bit deep but clear absolutely loved it.... go have fun swim in the ocean

650806348.name: Las Hamacas
650806348.author: a TripAdvisor user
650806348.reviewBody:
Playa Maguey is the beach to go to in Huatulco. People from 1 to 99 can enjoy this beach with many restaurants, calm beach on one side and frolicking waves on the other. Snorkelling on reefs on either side with no boat traffic over the reefs and the best beach to search for shells.

On the left the beach can get crowded as the tide comes in yet on the right is Las Hamacas with a more tranquil atmosphere. This family owned business has seating for many, beach loungers with tables and table clothes and a outstanding staff ready to serve you in either Spanish or English.

Food is outstanding and well priced and have tried all the shrimp dishes at all the beaches in Huatulco and the quality and selection can’t be beat here. Try the shrimp tacos or the coconut shrimp and you won’t be disappointed! Ruben, Tanita and all the staff ensure your every need is met.

The adventurous can walk from town or take a short six minute taxi ride. Wifi is available at Las Hamacacs and taxis available at the end of your day.

650397313.name: Visit without a tour
650397313.author: a TripAdvisor user
650397313.reviewBody: A kind gentleman from one of the resorts offered to take us to Maguey on his day off. It was a short drive on a decent road. You walk down from the road thru a community of people who work at the many palapas on the beach. We were escorted to a shady beachfront restaurant and introduced to the manager,Martin. At 1000 there was literally no one on the beach. Quiet,clean and beautiful with chrystal clear water and excellent snorkelling. By 2 pm there had to be at least 2000 people on the beach,3 or 4 catamarans and several different sources of very loud music. We returned the following week to the Tagalunda restaurant at 0900 to  find a repeat of the same pristine scene... again total cacophony by 2 pm. Highly recommend a morning visit.Service was excellent. The food better than average, reasonably priced. Beautiful. Felt  very safe.

650220070.name: Worth a return visit
650220070.author: a TripAdvisor user
650220070.reviewBody: We visited this spot in March 2018 and just had to return in January 2019.  The bay is beautiful and the food was amazing. Fresh seafood, spicey salsa, crisp tortillas and cold drinks.  Mix that with great views, warm sunshine and what else could you ask for. Sit with you feet in the sand and enjoy your stay.

649969892.name: Great beach but don\'t eat the food.
649969892.author: a TripAdvisor user
649969892.reviewBody: Nice walking beach but wonder with all those boats in the water why no one has ever been killed or hurt.

649380049.name: Beautiful
649380049.author: a TripAdvisor user
649380049.reviewBody: We stopped for a visit and for lunch as part of a seven bay tour in Huatulco. Maguey Bay was beautiful - the sand was soft and fine, the water colour gorgeous and excellent restaurants right at the beach.  Great place to sit and star at the view.

648835876.name: Maguey Beach
648835876.author: a TripAdvisor user
648835876.reviewBody: This is a popular local beach with palapa style restaurants along the length of it.  The best time to be there is from 9.00 am until about noon.  Then it starts to fill up.  The restaurants welcome you to sit under their shaded areas, use their chairs, with the obvious expectation that you purchase snacks and drinks.  It was a short taxi ride from our hotel at very reasonable price.  Well worth the visit.  Good place to snorkel along the rocks.

647811622.name: Beautiful beach
647811622.author: a TripAdvisor user
647811622.reviewBody: Lovely beach to spend the day. Lots of restaurants lots of chairs. However, expect to pay more at the restaurants on the beach and take bug spray!\n

646970400.name: Solid beach
646970400.author: a TripAdvisor user
646970400.reviewBody: About 4 km, $70 pesos, from Santa Cruz. Nice sidewalk if you choose to walk-we did. Beautiful beach with many Mexican restaurants lining beach. Snorkeling, water sports available. You may water taxi from Santa Cruz for $100 p/person. As in most beaches you will have people trying to lure you to their property to sit. Most beach restaurants offer free chairs and shade if you buy drink and/or food. Feel free to decline and find place of your liking.

645841934.name: Nice beach can be busy
645841934.author: a TripAdvisor user
645841934.reviewBody: This is a nice beach to spend the day at. It is not busy in the morning but gets very busy in the afternoon during the holidays.

643908264.name: DINO Tours, Huatulco, Mexico
643908264.author: a TripAdvisor user
643908264.reviewBody: We booked our snorkeling tour right off the beach in front of our hotel with Dino Tours.  We had an awesome day.  No bus rides from hotel to hotel, straight off the beach at 9 am and we spent all day traveling the 9 bays, snorkeling and swimming, returning about 3:30.  Dino\'s nephew Jose was driving the Boat, Dino was helping us in and out, holding our bags, cameras, taking pictures, etc.  His wife made a great lunch with fresh shrimp, guacamole and tostatdas.  They provided water and a lot of cerveza for us!  Great time had by all.  Saw turtles swimming by the boat.  Too rough that day for the dolphins, but we enjoyed the day immensely.  Only the three of us in the boat along with Dino and Jose.  The cost was half of what the travel reps were charging and then we were able to divide that by 3.  Very affordable and a full day of sun and water fun.  Dino was an awesome host.
