642822394.name: Had a nice relaxing time
642822394.author: a TripAdvisor user
642822394.reviewBody:
Our first time at Maguey. People mentioned the steps down to the beach. We didn't find there to be too many of them.

The restaurants have more space than those at La Entrega. That was really nice.
It wasn't overly busy when we got there as we were fairly early in the day. Got more crowded as time went on. To be expected.

We were in the second restaurant from the right. Staff were very accommodating to getting the type of beer that we like and seating us where we would like to be.
There is a 5 peso fee for the common bathrooms. The restaurant provided it to us whenever they noticed one of us heading there. 

Lots of construction going on in the area right now so parking lot is smaller than usual and crowded. Didn't really impact us because we took a van. 

We snorkelled on the right side of the bay. Had to swim quite a ways out to start seeing a variety. We felt that the variety wasn't as good as we had seen in the past at La Entrega. But a few days later we visited that playa and found that there was no where near the variety and volume there either that we had seen in the past.
Apparently it is calmer if you snorkel on the left side of the bay.
We did have one of 3 of us stung by a jelly fish tho she said it wasn't particularly painful or lingering.

We would definitely go here again if in Huatulco.

641849325.name: Great Stop for Snorkeling and Food
641849325.author: a TripAdvisor user
641849325.reviewBody: A group of 4 of us rented a panga for the day to tour the bays and snorkel and this was one of our stops. we snorkeled along the one side and then went in for lunch.  Of course the boat driver has a partnership with one of the restaurants so that is where you go! The menu had no English at all so was pretty confusing as it was a very extensive listing.  We told our server we wanted shrimp but had no idea what we were going to get.  We ordered drinks, guys had beer and the girls ordered margaritas but unfortunately with the communication we did not get so settled for water lol it was very hot out so was probably a better choice anyway.  It took about 20 minutes for our order to come and in the meantime i think we had at least 8 vendors come by with their wares or with massages and hair braiding.  It does get a little tiring after awhile but you just say no thanks and they carry on.  It was pretty quiet that day so the restaurants were all pretty empty but it was early so it probably got busier as the day wore on.  When our shrimp came we all were a little surprised because it came arranged in a glass sitting in a carved orange with rice and lettuce around the plate. should have taken a photo! the shrimp were all intact complete with eyes, feelers etc so it took awhile to eat our meal. It was delicious but a slow process.  After we ate we headed back out on the boat for more beaches.  would recommend for sure

641475811.name: Best food ever!
641475811.author: a TripAdvisor user
641475811.reviewBody: We went on a tour to a few bays and stopped at Manguay Bay for lunch. They served the best guacamole with the best salsa ever. My husband enjoyed the shrimp platter with 4 different preparations of shrimp. I absolutely loved the shrimp baked with cheese in a pineapple. This was the highlight of our trip!

641152686.name: Maguey Beach
641152686.author: a TripAdvisor user
641152686.reviewBody: Great beach with good swimming and restaurants.  Snorkelling along both shores of the bay but sometimes have gotten some a few stings from jellyfish on the shoreline to the right side of the beach.  No biggie.  Have seen some nice rays and a guitar shark when snorkelling there.  Is a 70 pesos cab ride from downtown.  Fairly steep stairs to get down to the beach so if you have mobility challenges, that could be a bit of an issue.  Great beach to spend a day at enjoying the sun and sand.  Lots of shade in the restaurants or under umbrellas they will set up for you.

639269683.name: too many boats
639269683.author: a TripAdvisor user
639269683.reviewBody: if i was coming in by boat, i might like it more, but it was obnoxious how many boats were parked in the bay obscuring the view and making for unsafe swimming.

638388195.name: Beautiful beach..
638388195.author: a TripAdvisor user
638388195.reviewBody: Very secluded and great for snorkeling. Easy access by boat, roads to the area are just being finished.

638018409.name: Our favourite beach
638018409.author: a TripAdvisor user
638018409.reviewBody: Ended up here for three days over a week.  Smaller beach that tended to be less crowded than others.  Reasonable selection of restaurants lining the beach.

637881557.name: Go to El Zarape - also has boat tours if you ask
637881557.author: a TripAdvisor user
637881557.reviewBody: Like many beach areas in the Huatulco Bay area, there is a row of restaurants where you can enjoy a tasty bite to eat.  Check out Restaurant El Zarape... it\'s kinda in the middle.  There, you will find excellent service and great food AND ask for Angel.  He can also provide you with a boat tour - whether you want to go fishing or just tour the various bays and do some snorkelling.  He\'s absolutely lovely, and flexible to your needs/wishes.  I arranged a few hours on his boat and enjoyed some fishing (even caught a small tuna), enjoyed some pods of dolphins, stopped to look at some sea turtles, and then toured some of the lesser known areas and found a deserted beach area to swim and snorkel.  He picked me up in my hotel in Santa Cruz, brought all the equipment and really made it a fantastic, personalized experience at an extremely reasonable price.  Thanks Angel!  You made my trip to Huatulco truly memorable :)

637450284.name: Now here is a beauty
637450284.author: a TripAdvisor user
637450284.reviewBody: As soon as you get here you are surrounded by people trying to get you to their restaurant. Pick one person and go with them because they are relentless. Take lots of change as they say they cannot give you change, and so it\'s a huge tip. Best local beach though.

636062222.name: Hidden Gem
636062222.author: a TripAdvisor user
636062222.reviewBody: We stopped here on our tour of the bays and so happy that we did! There are a couple little restaurants that serve traditional food. You can enjoy a drink on the beach or your kids can play in the crystal clear and calm water. Maguey Bay is definitely some place to visit!

635923833.name: Nice Beach and food
635923833.author: a TripAdvisor user
635923833.reviewBody: can get very busy. Awesome massages at the beach for cheap. Water can fire up with some pretty good waves, but I have been there when the water is like glass.

634037573.name: Beautiful beach!
634037573.author: a TripAdvisor user
634037573.reviewBody: Water looks green from afar but it is very clean, calm, and clear. Several restaurants to select from to hang out, drink and eat.

632652700.name: Beautiful Bay
632652700.author: a TripAdvisor user
632652700.reviewBody: The Bay of Maguey is beautiful. The reason for our visit was to dive the bay. The water is super clear, the coral is healthy and there was tons of water life to see. The water wasn\'t deep somewhere around 25 feet on the deep side.

632153669.name: Average given its sureoundings
632153669.author: a TripAdvisor user
632153669.reviewBody: There are some stunning bays along the coast from Conejos to San Agustin, the best of which can only be accessed by boat. Maguey is not one of them. Sure - in another context it would be stunning, it\u2019s just that it\u2019s surrounded by such pristine beauty that amongst the Bahias de Huatulco it comes up a little short. Not unpleasant - but prioritise other options such as La India, Cacaluta and San Agustin if you have the time.

631739969.name: I wanted to go to Maguey Bay after a local talked about the place and wanted to go there . The beach is beautiful
631739969.author: a TripAdvisor user
631739969.reviewBody: The people from tourists to locals all great people, Nice place to talk to people met locals who wanted to go to great places . The beach restaurants all good and fair price through out . Staff are fun to talk to friendly in General to help you with direction, from tables to bathrooms ha ha

623800642.name: Fun in the sun!
623800642.author: a TripAdvisor user
623800642.reviewBody: Every time the hubby and I are in Huatulco we make sure that we make it down to the Maguey Bay. The water is excellent and very clean. The waves are very calm and perfect for children and folks who aren\'t super experienced swimmers. The restaurant El Camaron Gigante is the best place to eat, all the food is freshly prepared. There are plenty of areas to relax and catch some sun. I recommend that you visit this bay.

616793275.name: Crowded...
616793275.author: a TripAdvisor user
616793275.reviewBody: This seems to be the beach that all the bay tours stop at during their touch. It\'s very crowded. The boats come right into shore and the waters seems dirty.  There are restaurants where you can get food and drinks.  We did eat at a place on the beach but I don\'t know the name of it.

611109536.name: Great  Place to Visit
611109536.author: a TripAdvisor user
611109536.reviewBody: Been there twice.  Great place to spend  the day  swimming, eating and relaxing.  Very popular\nSuggest going during the week and not on weekends if possible.

602400102.name: Crowded
602400102.author: a TripAdvisor user
602400102.reviewBody: It\u2019s an amazing place, only if you are on a sociological investigation trip as it is incredibly crowded. Although you will truly see a real mexican beach and real mexican seafood restaurants.

600458021.name: Excellent for swimming & just relaxing on the beach.
600458021.author: a TripAdvisor user
600458021.reviewBody: Water is always warm & inviting.  Taxi ride is 70 pesos & taxis are always available.  Have to walk down several steps then through the back sides of the several restaurants along the beach.  Unless you have a favorite place, someone will always be at your taxi awaiting to guide you to their choice of place. They anticipate tipping for the guidance.  You can leave your belongings at your table & they will watch it for you.  Note, if someone has guided you to a specific restaurant that you don\'t feel comfortable with, don\'t feel obligated to stay.  Move on, get comfy, relax & enjoy!

596524221.name: Nice beach
596524221.author: a TripAdvisor user
596524221.reviewBody: Maguey bay is a beautiful place to visit. It offers many restaurants that are offering up the same type of cuisine. The waves at the bay are small and it makes it very kid friendly. We made it there by way of a bay tour. I would suggest taking a local private boat, our tour was close to 8 hrs, on a private boat you can cut down the time and see more of the bays.

578595039.name: Amazing food .
578595039.author: a TripAdvisor user
578595039.reviewBody: Went to eat the food  after a bay tour was great the people selling things at your table is really not to bad got magos with pepper and fresh oysters .\nWas a great time .

576064690.name: Great Local Beach
576064690.author: a TripAdvisor user
576064690.reviewBody: Good local beach for swimming.  Lacks some of the restaurants & activities that other beaches offer, the walk to it is hard & the waves can be pretty rough...

572283007.name: crowded
572283007.author: a TripAdvisor user
572283007.reviewBody: Steep climb down to a Small beach area. Area is full of  restaurants along the beach. Water was Rough along the open beach area. Our least favorite beach in the area.

572282780.name: Average beach experience, terrible National park experience
572282780.author: a TripAdvisor user
572282780.reviewBody: So taken by itself, Maguey Bay is sort of a necessary evil which does have its good side.   A bunch of generally overpriced restaurants on a crowded beach.   The beach itself is mediocre, or maybe worse in comparison to some of the fantastic lovely bays nearby.  \nHere\'s my problem:  this is inside Huatulco National Park.   Everywhere you go around here drivers, tour guides pitch the eco-friendliness of the area.   Here is a beach that has a considerable amount of trash, the expected fumes from all the boats parked in the water loading and unloading people, and vendors pulling oysters out of the bay to cook and sell on the beach.   It\'s hard to extol the virtues of the Park and then show up  here.    \nIf you have the option, go anywhere else in the National Park but skip Maguey.

571031097.name: very nice experience
571031097.author: a TripAdvisor user
571031097.reviewBody: This is an intimate beach on the bay (but not overly cozy like playa arrocito, which hardly qualifies as a beach), features nice food, colorful (in the best sense) people (including the first female mariachi i\'ve ever seen strolling the beach or anyplace else). We had some of the best fish during this trip at one of the eateries scrunched together here -- it is pricey, but it was plentiful and tasty.  And the water was nice for little ones, without too strong a tide pull. Highly recommend this place (but as with anywhere here, beware of people who try to scam you for dollars as soon a s you get out of your taxi -- just say \'no\' again and again until they leave you alone).

570147645.name: Our Boat Trip Stopped Here- Beautiful Water
570147645.author: a TripAdvisor user
570147645.reviewBody: Boat stopped here for a few hours for swimming and lunch. Beach chairs are free with the purchase of beer and food.

569099593.name: Beach day
569099593.author: a TripAdvisor user
569099593.reviewBody: Beautiful beach easy to get in and out of the water, very busy beach, restaurant were pleasant and helpful, asked for coconut prawns that weren\u2019t on the menu but got us some and were delicious. Bucket of beer on ice.

567975363.name: Beautiful beach
567975363.author: a TripAdvisor user
567975363.reviewBody: Lots to do, many restaurants.  We arrived during a very crowded day but still enjoyed everything.  LIttle shops also where you can purchase tingle tunnle.

566973325.name: Lunch on jetskis
566973325.author: a TripAdvisor user
566973325.reviewBody: Great place to stop for lunch when you\'re out cruising the bays. Food was good & beer was cold. Lots of people watching.

565888367.name: Very crowded and busy bay
565888367.author: a TripAdvisor user
565888367.reviewBody: Maguey bay was a stop on a boat tour we took. We arrived at the bay around 230PM. It was very, very crowded with other tours. There are a few restaurants and souvenir shops along the beach. We had lunch at one of the restaurants and sat there for awhile waiting for 430PM when we were brought back to the boat. We had a short walk along the beach but it is far too busy to be relaxing.

565356056.name: Way too busy...
565356056.author: a TripAdvisor user
565356056.reviewBody: It would be a nice place to swim but WAY too crowded, too many restaurants and people.  Overdeveloped!  A Shame

564752958.name: Pretty beach w lots of restaurants
564752958.author: a TripAdvisor user
564752958.reviewBody: This is a beautiful beach.  However, you are accosted by staff from many restaurants wanting you to come to their restaurant.  I went to the beach for the sun, sea, and sand - not for a restaurant.  The bay was busy - tour boats, water taxis, private boats.  The beach is easy to get to by taxi - and the taxi drivers definitely try to rip you off if you look like a non-Spanish speaking tourist.  Be prepared to stand firm on your price.

563719123.name: Pretty Spot
563719123.author: a TripAdvisor user
563719123.reviewBody:
I like it better than nearby La Entrega. The restaurants are steps closer to the sea although many steps from the parking lot. There are about 15 restaurants and I suppose they all offer similar things at similar prices. Most have bathrooms and showers. There are public bathrooms and showers for a small fee as well. 

We chose lunch at Langosta Maguey on a taxi driver's recommendation. Beer was 30 Pesos and breaded fish filet 150. That compared to 17 Peso beers and 100 Peso fish at the wilder Boca Vieja. There is a price for location. This is a fine sand, calm water south facing bay. There are private beaches without any development on either side but they require a hike or a boat. Thinking of boats, they start arriving around 1pm and the entire beach changes from sleepy to active. The boatloads fill selected restaurants for a couple of hours and then all is quiet again. Some restaurants take credit cards and at least one has WiFi.

This might be my favourite easily accessible beach to park myself in a restaurant chair or lounge for a calm water swim day. Why? San Agustin and Boca Vieja are too far for regular visits and the more compact La Entrega can be very crowded. I suppose Maguey crowds up on weekends too.

563622415.name: Beautiful Bay
563622415.author: a TripAdvisor user
563622415.reviewBody: We have visited Maguey several times each year for the past 11 years.  The water is usually very calm and the facilities are good.

563427448.name: A good option for the weekend
563427448.author: a TripAdvisor user
563427448.reviewBody: The beach at this bay is relatively the same as Entraga but because the water gets very deep very quickly it is not as good for swimming or vision. This is a great option when the more popular beaches are busy.

563390622.name: Stopped for Cold Coronas and a swim
563390622.author: a TripAdvisor user
563390622.reviewBody: Beautiful inlet water crystal clear. This was one of our stops while we were out with DINO\'s tours. Had a cold beer and a nice swim. Friendly people white sand just so pretty! worth a stop.

563196763.name: Great Place for Authentic Food
563196763.author: a TripAdvisor user
563196763.reviewBody: Several restaurants, not sure of name but it about in the middle.  Great food, but remember to take lots of pesos as not cheap.  Avoid washrooms is only drawback, scary!!!

562006802.name: Awesome bay!
562006802.author: a TripAdvisor user
562006802.reviewBody: We were docked with a cruise ship in Huatulco and when we got off we noticed the beauty of this place immediately. It was clean and new so we asked a tour person to take us to one of their bays for a swim. He brought us to Miguey Bay where we swam at a lovely beach, snorkeling was very good and there was many areas at the beach to eat their local food which was delicious. Don\u2019t pay in US dollars because we paid double the amount for the beer than the people who paid in pesos. This town or city is a diamond in the rough. Just beautiful. They have like 7 bays and 29 beaches. Great place in Mexico.

560441552.name: good snorkleing
560441552.author: a TripAdvisor user
560441552.reviewBody: Good bay for snorkeling. Clam clear waters and a lot of different fish to view. Some nice drop off areas and rocks for the fish it hide.

559271634.name: Spent many days here
559271634.author: a TripAdvisor user
559271634.reviewBody: A great beach with plenty of drink and food choices. Restaurants won\u2019t pressure you to only support them. If you want a quiet days at the beach this is a great choice.

559091645.name: El Costeno
559091645.author: a TripAdvisor user
559091645.reviewBody: This is a gringo place at best. Nino was useless as a waiter..he only catered to large groups. Today was the 5th time we have gone there. Each time we tipped far more than our bill. The norm was at least 3 times the bill. It\'s not the money that I am ranting about...it\'s about el Costeno thinking they have the gringos in their pocket. Next time I am looking for a new place. If I want to eat with the Jimmy Buffet crowd I will find a Margaritaville.\n

558683076.name: Nice
558683076.author: a TripAdvisor user
558683076.reviewBody: This beach is nice but I found the water to be a bit rough. I wasn\u2019t comfortable in the water.  Go visit the restaurant La Casa Del Abuelo.  They are very kind and it\u2019s a great menu!

558585738.name: Beautiful Location
558585738.author: a TripAdvisor user
558585738.reviewBody: We only stopped here for a short time as part of our boat tour, but definitly a place that can be visited later on by taxi. Very quaint and peacful. There is an area designated for swimming or snorkeling only, no boats.

558379502.name: Fun day in the waves
558379502.author: a TripAdvisor user
558379502.reviewBody: Great spot for wave jumping and a seafood meal. Reasonably priced. Take a cab or arrive by boat. Try the pineapple stuffed with shrimp or a huge cocktail served in a coconut.

557828322.name: My favourte
557828322.author: a TripAdvisor user
557828322.reviewBody: Best snorkelling bay that we found.  So clear.  Would return in a minute!  Arrived by boat.  We all jumped off and swam to shore.  Amazing warm water.

557612465.name: Great food and huge portions
557612465.author: a TripAdvisor user
557612465.reviewBody: Beautiful visit to maguey bay an a snorkeling excursion food was excellent and prices reasonable. Just be prepared to pay to use the washroom facilities. It is however only 5 pesos

556194799.name: Nice beach
556194799.author: a TripAdvisor user
556194799.reviewBody: Nice beach and decent snorkelling but very busy with pushy restaurant owners. But cheap beer is a plus!

554854513.name: Conditions change with the weather - great when calm
554854513.author: a TripAdvisor user
554854513.reviewBody: Our group loved snorkeling around Maguey. Lots of different fishes to find among the rocks along the bay. We went to the left. Nice restaurants, ba\u00f1os, and parking. Taxis are available. \nHOWEVER: the 1st time was like snorkeling in a big lake it was so calm. The next time a storm was at sea and it was too rough with waves to snorkel safely. So do check the weather and pick accordingly. Recommend for families as the sandy beach is long and shallow.

553231199.name: beach and reef
553231199.author: a TripAdvisor user
553231199.reviewBody: Good day on the water with Tino and Tonio; saw many dolphins and turtles. Maguey Bay has a great beach, not overcrowded by the larger tourist boats. Reef offshore is in protected water and many colorful fish in the coral. Take your own food and drink. No services but restaurants are located in nearby bays.

552710301.name: Beautiful bay
552710301.author: a TripAdvisor user
552710301.reviewBody: We explored many of the beaches in Huatulco and although Maguey was not our favorite beach (only due to how busy it was), it is a fabulous bay with everything you need. We walked to the edge of the bay away from the restaurants and found some shade under the cliff on the edge of the jungle. Our small children played in a soft waves and my partner and I took turns snorkeling along the rocky coast. We saw all sorts of beautiful tropical fish.

551775208.name: Nice beach is you like to be sourrounded by restaurants
551775208.author: a TripAdvisor user
551775208.reviewBody: Beach is beautiful, but too many restaurant promoting their dishes at the beach, too noisy. Parking is difficult as promoters will insist to dine at their restaurant. Beach is clean, but the showers and restrooms are not. Too many boats with their engines on gives the beach a smell of gas. I won\u2019t come back to maguey having La India and Organo (virgin beaches) nearby.

551353646.name: For sure a quieter beach
551353646.author: a TripAdvisor user
551353646.reviewBody: After visiting Entrega, this beach was definitely quieter and less busy. Perhaps it only seemed quieter because it is a larger beach but it was nice not having wall to wall people around you when you come out of the water. It was very calm and great for snorkelling but there are also a lot of tour boats and jet skiing at this bay. We liked it, but we ended up spending another day at Entrega rather than here.

550535243.name: Great Beach with great restaurants
550535243.author: a TripAdvisor user
550535243.reviewBody: Been there several times in the past month.  Pretty good snorkeling and lots of covered seating.  Great place to swim with sandy bottom and nice waves to bounce in.  Restaurants specialize in seafood and it is pretty good.  Food prices a little higher than they should be but what the hell.

549581478.name: Day at the beach & massage
549581478.author: a TripAdvisor user
549581478.reviewBody: This is one of our favourite beach in the area. We find a few tables at one of the restaurants, have a few drinks, shrimp cocktails with guacamole and chips. Everything is reasonably priced. You can snorkel here or just relax. Restaurants are shaded and there is enough space between tables to walk, so even when it\u2019s full it\u2019s not overcrowded.\nMy husband and I also had massage (1 hour for 250 pesos each). Very professional, relaxing and I especially like the essential oils they used at the beginning. \nPublic bathroom are not free- 5 pesos!

548996535.name: Very commercial
548996535.author: a TripAdvisor user
548996535.reviewBody: We stopped here as part of a tour for lunch and its a nice beach but it seems like its a pit stop to get money out of tourists. I cannot comment on all the restaurants but the one we stopped at was not great and we had a lot of people trying to sell things to us. Saying that it is a nice beach just not to our taste.

548442908.name: Day on the beach - fresh seafood
548442908.author: a TripAdvisor user
548442908.reviewBody: Our friend met us in the parking lot, walked us down to the restaurant area, gave us a table, as well as an umbrella and two beach lounge chairs for a decent price. He was attentive the whole day. We were never pressured, but ordered a good seafood lunch and enjoyed the spot. He watched our stuff when we went swimming. Arranged for snorkeling, which we did. Good experience.

548225637.name: Snorkeling
548225637.author: a TripAdvisor user
548225637.reviewBody: Small but nice snorkeling with plenty of fish coral and sheltered end of bay. Maguey bay is a tour operators destination. Food at beach resturaunt was above expectation and fairly priced. Tends to be buisy at mid day. A good half day visit by cab with a short hike to beach or book a bays tour that has snorkeling. More suited to the holiday snorkeler that only hours a fee times year. If winf comes up your in for a wild boat ride back.

546135399.name: Still lovely
546135399.author: a TripAdvisor user
546135399.reviewBody: We returned here this visit to swim over to Playa Organo againand just enjoy his little bay. Lots of fish to see while snorkeling, sweet atmosphere, not too crowded at least in early December.  One of the reasons to come to Huatulco--friendly, beautiful, clean beaches such as this.

546126651.name: Walked to this Beach!
546126651.author: a TripAdvisor user
546126651.reviewBody: We walked to this Beach from Villa Blanca hotel. It took 1 hour & 15 minutes on lovely, wide,  nicely landscaped sidewalks. If you start out in the morning, it is shady nearly all the way. The beach was clean, has shade on either end if you don\'t want to "purchase shade". The snorkeling is very good. There are plenty of restaurants with tables, and umbrellas. It is a very pretty cove. The tour companies come in about 2pm.\nGreat  swimming. You can also buy a shower for 7 pesos after swimming.\nTaxis are readily available for ride back to town if you don\'t want to walk back.

545648139.name: Great spot for relaxing and some authentic food
545648139.author: a TripAdvisor user
545648139.reviewBody: Maguey Bay is about 15-20 minutes from town.  We arrived here by boat after a fishing trip.  If you want great local food at very prices, this is the place to go.  \np.s. it cost 5 peso to use the washroom.

545548361.name: Magay beach
545548361.author: a TripAdvisor user
545548361.reviewBody: We stopped during a 7 bay tour and enjoyed lunch and a swim. A great place to people watch.  The water is clean, warm and there are great services for activities (snorkling etc) plus lots of choices for a meal.

543885031.name: Maguey Beach
543885031.author: a TripAdvisor user
543885031.reviewBody: Found this beach by accident, a fairly long walk down and could use a clean up, the Beach was nice and lots to see. We arrived on a Mexican holiday so busy with families. All good and would recommend.

543395245.name: Snorkelling
543395245.author: a TripAdvisor user
543395245.reviewBody:
Took a taxi from Santa Cruz to Maguey Bay.  60 pesos and approx 10 minute drive.  To get to the beach there is 30 to 40 stair steps down to the beach.  So if mobility is an issue, Entrega Bay would be preferable.
We snorkeled both sides of the bay.  When looking from the beach out to the ocean, we preferred the snorkeling on the left side of the bay.  Saw the usual fish but also a couple of 3 foot water snakes (they stayed away from us and we stayed away from them) and a large (football size) hermit type crab.  
On the other side, we did see a a couple of rays.  
For me, preferred the snorkeling at Entrega (slightly better clarity, more variety of fish/coral) but Maguey is a good spot to go for a change.   We went on a weekday and had the beach almost all to ourselves.

540448145.name: Another Gorgeous Bay
540448145.author: a TripAdvisor user
540448145.reviewBody: The title is not sarcasm. Maguey Bay is gorgeous. Pack sunscreen, take some food with you, and set up for the day. If you\u2019re in the ocean, take some fish food friendly nibbles to feed the fish. You\u2019ll get swarmed and it\u2019s a fun experience.

539219928.name: House Reef
539219928.author: a TripAdvisor user
539219928.reviewBody: This seems to be the best house reef in Huatulco.  The reef is healthy.  On the beach you can rent snorkeling gear.  There are restaurants and umbrellas with chairs to rent.

519672009.name: You will love this beach
519672009.author: a TripAdvisor user
519672009.reviewBody: The water is so calm and clear. They have a line of restaurants to choose. You get to eat and have a great view!

519085687.name: 5 star beach, shameful tourist service
519085687.author: a TripAdvisor user
519085687.reviewBody: Beautiful beach taking 5 points only to itself, scenery, very calm waves, clean beach and all but you can mostly can get there only by boat and the people who take you the on the tours tell you only where you can eat. Its ofcourse very fresh seafood but its not high cuisine nor a 5 star service or sitting, and they charge you like if is. My family and I went there 26 years ago and they tell, as I was very young back then, that these places where as fresh and good as they are right now but they were also extrenly cheap. I don\'t think they should keep on being underpaid but they should not abuse because of the matter that you cannot eat else where close at your choice of food and price preference. Anyway, I recomend the visit 100%, just don\'t be dissappointed by those factors.

494896465.name: Snorkel, food, relax
494896465.author: a TripAdvisor user
494896465.reviewBody: charted a boat to get to Maguey Bay.  Did some great snorkeling.  our boat guide went in the water with us and led us around.  attracted fish to us....amazing variety of colourful fish etc.  We had Marlin on the beach which was very good.  all very close to shore.  very relaxing and weather was great every day we were in Huatulco(Spring Break -March) walked up and down the beach a few times. they served bottled drinks so felt good about what we drank as we were off resort. We stopped on a deserted beach on the way to Maguey and hung out there for an hour.  water a bit choppy, super calm the bays.  but always close to a shore.

494394870.name: A very cool place to spend a day
494394870.author: a TripAdvisor user
494394870.reviewBody: We ended up here on a snorkeling tour. We had everything included, but if you travel here on your own, I\'ve heard that it\'s very affordable and a nice way to spend a day at the beach. You can rent chairs and umbrellas and the restaurant staff will keep food and beverages coming. There were lots of foreign tourists here but also lots of Mexicans on vacation. A few people selling things came to us on the beach but a simple "no" was good enough. We didn\'t feel harassed at all. My husband snorkeled here and said the fish were pretty amazing.

492561710.name: Be Aware
492561710.author: a TripAdvisor user
492561710.reviewBody: We were strong armed into eating at Cammaro Gigante (sp?) restaurant as part of the 7 Bay Tour.  It is an outdoor restaurant that had so many people that we were tripping over everyone and the bathrooms were beyond disgusting.  Someone washed their little baby in the womens "area" sink.  I was baffled.  They also use whatever conversion rate for US dollars that they want and charged us for things we didn\'t buy (for example, we had 2 cokes at 20 pesos each and were charged for 2 beers at 30 pesos each and then they billed at 16 pesos per US Dollar versus the going rate of 18).  Also, don\'t leave anything unattended.  There are some beach dogs that can get into anything you leave and we saw someone stop by our stuff and look around until he noticed me watching and then walked away.  Just - Be Aware

477184316.name: Great beach lots of local families
477184316.author: a TripAdvisor user
477184316.reviewBody: Little further by taxi, around 50 - 60 pesos from Santa Cruz. Great beach for swimming and snorkelling. A real favourite for the local families, especially on weekends. Lots of choice for food and drink.

476845214.name: Great snorkelling
476845214.author: a TripAdvisor user
476845214.reviewBody: Spent an hour at Maguey Bay on a boat excursion.  The snorkeling was very good.  Managed to catch a glimpse of a large sting ray.  Worth the trip!

473507203.name: Rented snorkle equipment here.
473507203.author: a TripAdvisor user
473507203.reviewBody: Our boat captain stopped here to pick up some fins for one of our party for our morning of snorkeling. Good price and they delivered the equipment right to our boat.

472380163.name: Great snorkeling beach.  Food was good but was over-priced.
472380163.author: a TripAdvisor user
472380163.reviewBody: Great beach for snorkeling.  The restaurant we wet to for lunch had great shrimp dishes./  Large portions but pricey.

471740597.name: One of my favorite beaches
471740597.author: a TripAdvisor user
471740597.reviewBody: Playa Maguey has become one of my favorite beaches.  Clear water, a little bit of a wave, not crowded if you don\'t go on the weekend.  I don\'t like being hustled the second I step out of the cab, but if you say where you are going, they leave you alone.  El Costeno (to the right as you are coming down the path) is our favorite place.  We\'ve had fish for lunch, very good.  Good margaritas.  Just a note, 2 years ago this restaurant was one of the only restaurants with lounge chairs and then they only had 4.  Now they have dozens and so do most of the restaurants on the beach.  I bet i counted 30+ lounges on the beach.

469392260.name: Dove here twice. Loved it
469392260.author: a TripAdvisor user
469392260.reviewBody: Beautiful reef here.  Accessible by beach or boat.  No current at all. Areas are all buoyed off so you are in no danger of boats running you over\n\nTons of life.  Quick trip out of town.  Take drinks and food with you.  Prepare to spend the day.  Take an umbrella if you have access to one.

468408855.name: Another beautiful bay in Huatulco
468408855.author: a TripAdvisor user
468408855.reviewBody: Lots of small and medium size crafts come here with turists for lunch, is nice, but could get busy, still free umbrellas and long chairs with purchase of food or drinks.

467955385.name: Crystal clear water
467955385.author: a TripAdvisor user
467955385.reviewBody: Snorkeling was great! We took an excursion from Las Brisas.  Miguel was our guide and was fantastic!!! Lots of fish to see.

467516859.name: Crowded
467516859.author: a TripAdvisor user
467516859.reviewBody: Nice beach but way too crowded for me. We took a cab there and when we arrived there were three locals opening our door only to hound us. "Come to my restaurant, it\'s nice, it\'s quiet"...... We arrived around 10:30 and by noon it was packed full of boats - literally right in front of us.....yes, I love the smell of exhaust. And of course music and birds all around you. This is no place to relax!

466308301.name: Great beach, excellent restaurant
466308301.author: a TripAdvisor user
466308301.reviewBody: Visited El Zarape Restaurant on Maguey beach on 3/09/2017. Greeted by the owner Abel Ortega as we arrived by taxi. Led us down the stairs to his place. Spent 4 wonderful hours there. Had drinks, great food and fine conversation with Abel. He is very proud to fly the US flag over his restaurant. We will be back next year. Gracias Abel.

466246736.name: Great way to spend a day
466246736.author: a TripAdvisor user
466246736.reviewBody: We visited Maguey during a boat tour. Lovely beach with nice sand, calm water to swim and play in, and reasonably priced food/drink. If we had more time, we would have definitely gone back. Travelling with children ages 4 & 6.

465647500.name: Favourite beach in area for lounging/walking
465647500.author: a TripAdvisor user
465647500.reviewBody:
We are attempting to visit as many of the wonderful Huatulco beaches as possible during our month long vacation here. Spent a day at Maguey Beach. It was wonderful. A kilometre of beautiful sand to walk upon and several great restaurants. We always pack our own little "sun tent" so we can set up far from the crowds for quietness.  This beach provided a very large private area away from the hustle and bustle of the nearby restaurants, which was perfect. No one bothered us at all. 
This is an extremely clean beach. 
Cab fare was 70 pesos from town. 
Snorkelling was better at other nearby beaches, but regardless, this might have been our favourite beach to spend the day at.

465170081.name: Beautiful beach
465170081.author: a TripAdvisor user
465170081.reviewBody: Very nice beach, small but beautiful, and you  have a lot of choices  at restaurants\nwe tried EL CAMARON GIGANTE  the food was delicious  !!!!\nFriendly Staff. Definitely we come back soon

464855413.name: great beach for swimming
464855413.author: a TripAdvisor user
464855413.reviewBody: The food and sand is amazing here.  Tour boats are constantly coming in.  Great opportunity to tan and swim.

464646284.name: Fun bay to visist on our 7 bay tour
464646284.author: a TripAdvisor user
464646284.reviewBody:
fun experience while snorkeling the 7 bay tour.
Restaurants and some bartering to be done.
A little area to swim and snorkel from.
Bathrooms available for $5 peso

464623542.name: Great for a day visit
464623542.author: a TripAdvisor user
464623542.reviewBody:
We took a cab from our resort to visit the beach for the day.  This is a must visit if you are looking for a great massage on the beach for a great price!

You arrive in a parking lot at the top of the hill and then walk down a bunch of concrete steps to the beach/restaurants.  It seems like there is a rotation as to which restaurant you are taken to.  You basically "set-up shop" at one of the restaurants for the day.  In exchange for your patronage, you get to use their chairs and they usually get you an umbrella.  There are public restrooms located near the stairs.

There are many beach vendors selling their wares...a simply "no gracias" and they move on.  If you are looking for coffee, local trinkets, swimsuit cover-ups, etc you can barter for good prices.

Make sure to get yourself a massage on the beach with Ocean Spa.  They are located at the far end of the beach opposite from the end where you enter.  My husband and I got wonderful 50 minute Ocean side beach massages "Oceana Especiales" for $550 pesos from the husband and wife team from Ocean Spa.  Friendly and awesome!

Our friends also enjoyed snorkeling on both sides of the bay...said they saw a variety of fish including puffer fish, an eel and other colorful varieties.

When you are ready to head back go back up the steps and there are cabs waiting to take you back to where you need to go.

Enjoy!

464328709.name: Beautiful
464328709.author: a TripAdvisor user
464328709.reviewBody: Great beach nice little restaurants. A bit more crowded on the weekends with the locals. If you are in Crucecita or Santa Cruz the beach is just a taxi ride away. Playa Entrega is closer.

463085384.name: Amazing!
463085384.author: a TripAdvisor user
463085384.reviewBody: We ate at the main restaurant .. the far left facing the beach. Highly recommend the 4x4 shrimp and the shrimp served in a pineapple. Great service!

462924767.name: Restaurant stop when doing day cruises.
462924767.author: a TripAdvisor user
462924767.reviewBody: Authentic foods,  bring cash not credit cards.  Try the shrimp in pineapple    2 can share it   Need pesos to use toilet as the area is somewhat secluded.  Nice stop

462343982.name: Drivers BEWARE of The LOBOS!
462343982.author: a TripAdvisor user
462343982.reviewBody: We arrived at the parking area which is high above the bay with a limited view below. There were several \'locals\' hanging around guiding cars to parking spots along the road. Most of these guys are affiliated with the restaurants on the beach below and encourage you to patronize their businesses. After parking & walking down to the beach we realized we were at this same beach several days ago during a boat tour. We quickly turned around & decided to try another beach. Upon arrival at our car one of the men demanded a tip for \'watching\' our car (we were gone for maybe 5 minutes!) My husband told him no-this is a public area but then the man got nasty & demanding about getting a tip. My husband said no-way and we drove off to Playa Entraga and had a good time. He was wearing a white polo shirt with a restaurant name in brown lettering on his upper left side of the his shirt.

461438409.name: Stopped for lunch
461438409.author: a TripAdvisor user
461438409.reviewBody: Great little spot with food and shopping options. Seems to be quite a bit of boat traffic. Lots to see if your just sitting on the beach. There are better places to go swimming with less traffic.

461021885.name: Best Bay for us
461021885.author: a TripAdvisor user
461021885.reviewBody: We didn\'t make it to all the bays in Huatulco (we were only there for a week) but from Las Brisas to San Augistin this was the the perfect one for us. There are about fifteen restaurants some with Banos, some without but there are public one\'s, It\'s not as busy as La Entrega unless a cruise ship is in town then it gets a little busy but there\'s lots of empty beach. Snorkeling on both sides is OK. This is close enough to town we could go every day but far enough that most people don\'t go there.

460557760.name: Loved Maguey Bay...AND the massages from Ocean Spa
460557760.author: a TripAdvisor user
460557760.reviewBody: I loved the bay , the restaurants, the prices and the BEST massages I have ever had at Ocean Spa beside Restaurant FloraMar at end of bay!  Sebastian was my therapist.  He and his wife, Griselda operate a great outdoor massage retreat.  \nTele: 9581285158

458748941.name: Loved this beach!
458748941.author: a TripAdvisor user
458748941.reviewBody: This was the first beach we saw and I loved how colourful it is! There is beautiful fish to see and swim with but watch out for the small jelly fish later in the day! \nAdvise: go see Angel at Maguey restaurant for his amazing pi\u00f1a coladas ! I\'ll be back for sure!

458383466.name: Wonderful place
458383466.author: a TripAdvisor user
458383466.reviewBody: Small beach with restaurants, shower, restroom, taxi station close to it, and a safe area for swimming.\nThe water was clear and warm. Wonderfull for the family.\nIt is a place to spend the day.

457204699.name: Very large beach with lots to explore
457204699.author: a TripAdvisor user
457204699.reviewBody: Easy to spend a day at this beach. Lots of restaurants and shade. Shore is very big and you can go into the calm waters or waters with fun waves. One of our favourites to go to. Water taxi from Santa Cruz is fun or call a cab to take you.

457173786.name: great beach for playing in the water
457173786.author: a TripAdvisor user
457173786.reviewBody: This is my favorite beach for playing in the water, Two differnt people offering wonderful massages on the beach. Lots of restaurants to choos e from - pay attention to what your are ordering so you are not surprised by the bill at the end of your stay.

456195694.name: Snorkelling
456195694.author: a TripAdvisor user
456195694.reviewBody: Great snorkelling. Water may be a little rough some days. Beach is great. Large variety of fish. Long walk down stairs to the beach so be ready for the walk back up.

452903491.name: Wonderful day
452903491.author: a TripAdvisor user
452903491.reviewBody: Took a cab from La Crucecita to Magey  cheap easy and quick.  Spent the day there swimming, snorkeling, people watching, walking the beach and snoozing.  Arrived at about 11 a.m. and took a table at the farthest end of the beach from the entrance.  By 1 p.m. the beach was full - primarily with nationals - very few US or Canadian tourists there if any.  Many tour groups arrive and go all day long by boat. Fabulous people watching, okay snorkeling out towards the rocks,.  A great day away from the resorts and with Mexican families as they vacation - highly recommend.

452866890.name: Beautiful beach
452866890.author: a TripAdvisor user
452866890.reviewBody: A must to visit.  There is snorkeling and food available.  Some vendors approach you but they leave when declined.  Food was good at the restaurants we tried.  Price is right.

452814695.name: Tourist trap with crappy food.
452814695.author: a TripAdvisor user
452814695.reviewBody: Other beaches just as nice...all the boat tours come here and so the food at the beach is mediocre to poor.  Other nicer beaches with better places to eat/drink.

450081799.name: This is a very nice beach.
450081799.author: a TripAdvisor user
450081799.reviewBody: I enjoyed the beach here. The snorkeling was ok. Tons of fish to the left of the beach near the the end of the beach. This place can also get very busy.

449733561.name: Nice cove but distractions galore!
449733561.author: a TripAdvisor user
449733561.reviewBody: Really like the Bahia and the restaurants BUT vendors walking through the restaurant while you eat was not great. I\'m usually pretty tolerant but this was not pleasant.\nRecommend walking to the far restaurants when you tour boat drops you off for a little more tranquility!

446963462.name: Beaches in the area
446963462.author: a TripAdvisor user
446963462.reviewBody:
Keep visiting this beach to see if it can give us a better feeling when we are there for the day but it hasn't yet. 
There are constant tourist boats pulling in and out with their loads of people either getting in or out of the bay.
There is the hassle of the owners in the restaurants trying to get you to seek their shade and outrageous pricey food n drinks.
The walk to and from the beach is just manageable.
Just can't put the finger on it ..... but ....really cannot recommend this beach.

446794068.name: Nice relaaxing day trip
446794068.author: a TripAdvisor user
446794068.reviewBody: Get there early and hold your seat  we took a cab there 60 pesos  it was a beautiful day food and drink we picked out one of the restaurant and had ocean front chairs several drinks full lunch it was cheap then we took a water taxi back

445435208.name: Magnificent Maguey!
445435208.author: a TripAdvisor user
445435208.reviewBody: Such a beautiful beach.  Powdery, soft, hard packed sand... very different from Tangolunda Bay.  Several small restaurants to choose from.  Incredibly clear water!  Definitely worth a visit!

443837179.name: beach
443837179.author: a TripAdvisor user
443837179.reviewBody: Spent a day at this beach.Beach was very nice but quite busy but i enjoy that.We sat at the el zarape beach club an it was very good had couple buckets of beer an the hawaiian shrimp which were bacon wrapped an done in a pineapple crazy good.i found the sand very nice an the water very nice for snorkelling

443247205.name: Great place, but too dirty and too crowded
443247205.author: a TripAdvisor user
443247205.reviewBody: Possibly the most commercial beach in huatulco, full of restaurants and people selling you stuff, had to be very hard with them to let us have some time, we went there later in the day so it wasn\'t as crowded but still it was full of average families and snorkel tours, snorkel was good but watch out, there are jellyfish in there too, not a bad experience but not good either, beach was very dirty and there were lots of kids.

443189623.name: Nice stop for lunch
443189623.author: a TripAdvisor user
443189623.reviewBody: We stopped here on our tour after snorkeling at Organo.  It was quite busy but we just had lunch in a beach restaurant with thatched roof and sand floor.  It was nice to be out of the sun, and lunch was yummy.  We shared shrimp in a cheese sauce in a half pineapple and had some great guacamole and pico de gallo (fresh salsa) with chips.

438892094.name: Too popular!
438892094.author: a TripAdvisor user
438892094.reviewBody: We visited this beach, expecting it to be quiet, since it was a few kilometres from Santa Cruz. When we arrived, the usual touts tried to herd us to their particular palapas, but that was expected. What we didn\'t anticipate was the hordes of tourists, primarily Mexicans, getting dropped off by both buses and boats of all sizes! It became insanely busy and we simply left. Having said this, if you can find a quiet time, the beach is beautiful.

438595972.name: Such a nice Bay
438595972.author: a TripAdvisor user
438595972.reviewBody: We went there with an excursion and had lunch at the El Coste\u00f1o restaurant.\nThe beach is perfect and very good for snorkel with coral reefs

437937507.name: Calm and Inviting Waters
437937507.author: a TripAdvisor user
437937507.reviewBody: This is a great beach for families as the wave action is gentle and it doesn\'t drop off immediately. Restaurants on the beach are good as well.

435883482.name: Great place to spend an afternoon
435883482.author: a TripAdvisor user
435883482.reviewBody: Nice place to stop for lunch! We ate lunch and was very good. Beach is beautiful and water was calmer in the bay  Wish I could remember the restaurant name but ordered the 4x4 shrimp and it was great!

435399415.name: The best shirmp EVER!!!
435399415.author: a TripAdvisor user
435399415.reviewBody: We were here with the bays excursion of the Bahias company. Part of the group went snorqueling and the rest were taken to the Coste\u00f1o restaurant were I had the best 4x4 shrimp I have ever had. Big and cheap, cooked to perfection. I highly recommend the food here. Also the bay itself is good, clean water, good for kids to swim. One of the highlights to our Huatulco trip.

432456633.name: Beautiful beach
432456633.author: a TripAdvisor user
432456633.reviewBody: We went on a collective boat. You can snorkel or go the beach. I recommend the later as the view is incredible. You can rent an umbrella at the beach and drink coconut water. Simply delicious. The beach is clean and the water clear. Great place to spend at least a couple of hours. You can also arrive by car.

432406031.name: Fresh food, good snorkeling
432406031.author: a TripAdvisor user
432406031.reviewBody: We went to Maguey on our snorkeling trip and you have some nice reefs. The best part is that the beach is very calm the locals call it the local large pool. You also have many great restaurants on the beach with good fresh food and drinks.The only issue like everywhere in Mexico is the amount of vendors. Maguey was my favorite place to visit. During the week is very quiet.

429415599.name: Good service, small relaxing bay, f\u00e1rm atmosphere, quiet, fresh sea food, nice experience with locales.
429415599.author: a TripAdvisor user
429415599.reviewBody: Good experience, not expensive, Relaxed, friendly, great hammocks, very nice people.\nVisit with an open heart and mind.

428561748.name: Again one of the stunning bays of huatulco
428561748.author: a TripAdvisor user
428561748.reviewBody: We often come here for a beautiful beach visit, the water as always in the area is warm, the sand beautiful, and still very little crowds, you will find the bay generally not very busy just nice and relaxing

425391743.name: Not so bad...
425391743.author: a TripAdvisor user
425391743.reviewBody: Expensive restaurants, they don\'t have any option for those who are vegetarian. However the beach is really nice, the sand is quite soft and the sea is calm.

389241769.name: crowded and dirty
389241769.author: a TripAdvisor user
389241769.reviewBody: The bay itself is beautiful, water is rather calm and good for the little onces and the snorkel is good BUT... during the weekends and high season it\'s far too crowded, the palapas (restaurants) receive huge groups from the cruises and boats that are loud and leaving all the rubbish around. nobody cares that at the end of the day all this rubbish goes to the ocean. Especially the restaurant staff and owners do not care about the place at all! As soon as you arrive you will have locals selling you anything. In particular, convincing you to snorkel with a high and rough sea - no visibility at all - is outrageous. My family and me spent few weeks in Huatulco, many times in Magey - every time was worse...

373512304.name: Paying to use the wash room thumbs down!
373512304.author: a TripAdvisor user
373512304.reviewBody: View was lovely. Snorkelling was rough. Food was expensive and mediocre. Being harassed by people selling things all no the beach -bad.

366464755.name: Lunch!
366464755.author: a TripAdvisor user
366464755.reviewBody: Stopped here on our tour with Pilo for lunch. He took us to a resturant that  cooked our tuna we caught.   Best tuna I ever had, wonderfully perpared.  Great beach and had time time do some swimming.\n\n

365729158.name: Beautiful but crowded
365729158.author: a TripAdvisor user
365729158.reviewBody: The beach is beautiful but I found it too crowded, too much restaurants and people trying to sell you anything and everything! This is the only place where there are restaurants for tours stop for lunch so go figure.

360543307.name: Loved the lunch!
360543307.author: a TripAdvisor user
360543307.reviewBody: Stopped here for lunch on the Paradise Found tour. We were given each a couple of small taquitos/ wraps and a glass of pineapple juice complimentary by the restaurant just to wet the appetite. Felt a little obligated to buy lunch. We ordered the fish tacos for our son and my wife and I shared the shrimp stuffed pineapple... it\'s called Pina Rejena(although it\'s probably not spelled that way, hahaha). So glad we did! My God was that ever decadent!! Pricey but delicious, you only live once. Support the economy, hahaha!!!

358223607.name: Amazing! Clear water
358223607.author: a TripAdvisor user
358223607.reviewBody: Beautiful beach, crystal clear water great places to eat!! I recommend this beach for sure!! You can also rent snorkel gear and it\'s a great spot for it as well!

357781079.name: Beautiful beach
357781079.author: a TripAdvisor user
357781079.reviewBody: Loved coming here  to this lovely long beach.  downside is when you arrive you are swarmed bylocal young men trying to guide you to the restaurant of their choice as they get commissions for people they bring in.  At the restaurants you can get a table to keep your stuff at while you swim and get lunch if so desired.  Downside was that you enter from the backs of the restaurants from the parking lot and it really looks dirty and the kitchens look like they lack full sanitation, so we did not order food.  People in the restaurants are very friendly and are just trying to earn a living, so go ahead, come here, rent a chair and enjoy.  Water was calm and clean and it was quiet on the morning.

357450991.name: Calm and Quiet Beach
357450991.author: a TripAdvisor user
357450991.reviewBody: Quiet beach until 1 pm when it got very busy. Calm waters at one end and in front of our beach bar. Reasonably priced beverages and snacks. Go mid week and early to avoid crowds.

357080088.name: Very Hot Sand
357080088.author: a TripAdvisor user
357080088.reviewBody: \nThis beach was where we were taken for lunch on the 7 bay tour.  Every tour boat stops here for food and drink and you\'d think it would be inexpensive but you\'d be wrong.  The prices here are as high as the resorts and you\'d best bring 600 - 700 pesos ( for 2 people ) with you if you wand food and drinks.  The beach sand here is too hot to stand on if you don\'t want your feet burned off.  There are no public palapas so you have to go to one of the restaurants to use their chairs once you\'ve eaten.  Nice views here but this is one attraction you can avoid.

356450612.name: Too crowded
356450612.author: a TripAdvisor user
356450612.reviewBody: By far my least favorite bay in Huatulco.  Too many people and extremely touristy.  Boat traffic is too dense for either swimming or snorkeling.  Don\'t waste your time here and visit either India or San Augustin instead.

355427644.name: Another great beach
355427644.author: a TripAdvisor user
355427644.reviewBody: You can never go wrong going to these beaches....great snorkeling, sun and relaxation...see you next year

354299815.name: Nice Bay...
354299815.author: a TripAdvisor user
354299815.reviewBody: We have visited Bahia Maguey as well as La Entrega and if you were not sure where you were...you could be at either.  Maguey is much bigger and you have to go out further to snorkel, more places to eat and sit and more farther away.  But a great way to pend the day!  Loved it.

352681156.name: Fun Beach!
352681156.author: a TripAdvisor user
352681156.reviewBody: We always enjoy our time at Maguey - we\'ve been there several times over our visits to the area.  When you get out of the taxi beware that restaurant owners will be waiting for you and very anxious for your business.  If you want to be able to make a choice, tell them that - otherwise you will be directly ushered to their restaurant.  Mind you - we\'ve found all of them are good and they have great service.  Out last time there we had our own personal tent put up so we would have shade...  I can\'t remember the name of the place, but they were excellent - great service!  It you like to swim in the ocean, beware of strong tides!  It\'s calmest at the far end of the beach so you may want to check that out.  Lots of locals so fun to be in the midst of local culture!

351558541.name: Cool beach area
351558541.author: a TripAdvisor user
351558541.reviewBody: We went here on an excursion of the bay\'s. We had lunch at the restaurant that our tour guide took us to. Carlos was our captain. Meal was good but pricey. You could pack a lunch if you wanted. You need to pay 10 pesos for the washroom. Take your own toilet paper. \nLots of locals and tourists. Just a neat little spot. We went early in the day. (Noon) Just as we were leaving the big double decker catamaran pulled up so we were glad we were leaving!

351351447.name: Nice beach
351351447.author: a TripAdvisor user
351351447.reviewBody: A nice beach but not our favourite. However, lots of sand, cold beer and friendly people.  Worth the cab ride.

350888447.name: Exelent day at the beach.
350888447.author: a TripAdvisor user
350888447.reviewBody: Ignore the greeters in the parking lot that will try to take you to their restaurant.  Tell them you are meeting friends and walk past them down to the beach. Choose a reasaurant that has louge chairs, they will be fighting for your business down there as well.  Left side (south end) of beach is always calm for family swimming, right (North end) side has more surf and less children.

350500142.name: My Favorite of Three we Visited
350500142.author: a TripAdvisor user
350500142.reviewBody: Nice sheltered area , mostly friendly local people, very few tourists & none that were whinny or complaining. Snorkel or flutter board available. Sat in chairs lounges about 3/4 way down beach, had a couple drinks, no charge for use of chairs.  Loved the vibe!

349686970.name: Hidden Gem...
349686970.author: a TripAdvisor user
349686970.reviewBody: I shouldn\'t tell others but.. we loved this little beach  I think we all felt this was our fave Lil place .. mostly locals but still relaxing and enjoyable.. great place to kill an afternoon and escape the massive all inclusive hotels.. we will be back here for sure.. one of our highlights of Huatulco

348932889.name: Great place to spend an afternoon.
348932889.author: a TripAdvisor user
348932889.reviewBody: This was to be our last stop on our Bay and snorkeling tour that we booked with Capitan Gilberto.  We toured our way over and when we stopped here to eat lunch the water became very rough so we didn\'t ride back on the boat.  We spent a number of hours at Maguey Bay.   The beach is clean and the sand is beautiful.  There are many cantina style restaurants offering some great local fare, mostly seafood and always a cold beer or drink available.  Since we were no longer on a timetable with the boat all the ladies in our group took advantage of the Ocean Spa and thoroughly enjoyed a massage on the beach.  We didn\'t take in any snorkelling, but many were out in the water enjoying.  This is a stopping spot for all the tour catamarans that work in the area so it can get quite busy over the lunch time of the day.\n\nBeautiful beach and worth the visit.  Easy access by either boat or vehicle.

348697699.name: Lovely beach!
348697699.author: a TripAdvisor user
348697699.reviewBody: We stopped here as part of a catamaran tour. The snorkelling was great. Obviously this is a popular beach for the locals and it\'s easy to see why.  It\'s a large clean beach with many restaurants.  It was a fun stop on our tour and I think it would be a place to return for a beach day next time

348560322.name: So nice we went twice
348560322.author: a TripAdvisor user
348560322.reviewBody: If you go stop at Hugo\'s. Great service and good food. You can stay under his shaded area all day and he supplied loungers and umbrellas. The beach there is perfect. Spent the whole day in the water

348176587.name: best beach, live like a local
348176587.author: a TripAdvisor user
348176587.reviewBody: We have visited several beaches: Entrega, Santa Cruz, Tangolunda, Arrocito and by far Maguey is our favorite. We liked it best as its very swimmable, clean, not over crowded, soft sand and beautiful.  We take a taxi there for 66 pesos one way, and full taxi stand awaits you at the end of the day.  There is 3 flights of nice concrete stairs to the beach (easy to walk).  The waiters wait at the top as taxis approach to entice you to there spot.  You can tell them you aren\'t eating and they leave you alone, or go to El COSTENOS and ask for NINO he is great. At ANY resto on the beach you will find tons of fish, shrimp, octopus but limited choices on other stuff.  So pack a snack if you have a picky eater.  When you dine and drink at the restos on the beach the table is yours for as long as you want it and many set up free sun beds for you.  When at Maguey and looking at the beach I suggest you go for the restos on the right as later in the day (depending on tide) the restos on the far left get washed out by the tide around 3;30pm.  The vendors on the beach aren\'t too plentiful and very friendly.  I strongly recommend you try some of the beach vendor foods: peanuts, flan and cheese cake, fried plantans with condensed sweet milk, etc... all safe to eat, delicious and cheap.  The funny part is the Mexican restaurants are Ok with you purchasing and consuming those foods as they don\'t sell them. You can get floaties and snorkel equipment at the far end of the beach to buy or rent, and a massage shack near Costenos (they also have outside showers for 7 pesos). There is almost no boat traffic at Playa Maguey which is great for snorkeling.  We got our best collection of beach shells at Maguey as well.

347628596.name: Great to Snorkel/Dive
347628596.author: a TripAdvisor user
347628596.reviewBody: Beautiful bay with some good snorkeling and diving.  We did not eat here, but there are places to do just that.

347359112.name: NICE FOR A WHOLE DAY
347359112.author: a TripAdvisor user
347359112.reviewBody: Located at ten minutes by car or taxi from Huatulco.  This is a beach where a lot of buses with tourists arrive to spend the whole day.   There are some ranch restaurants to have lunch.  The sand is yellowish and the waves are medium high.  No fee for entrance.

347122785.name: Lunch under a Palapa
347122785.author: a TripAdvisor user
347122785.reviewBody: We stopped here for lunch following a boat trip up the coast on a catamaran leaving from Santa Cruz, we visited a total of 7 bays and stopped to snorkel at one bay before leaving for Maguey bay where we had lunch. There are lots of restaurants to choose from all offering similar menus. The restaurants can be reached by either land or boat. On the return to Santa Cruz we also spotted a gray whale.

346559352.name: site sseing
346559352.author: a TripAdvisor user
346559352.reviewBody: people beach is nice and clean please don\'t stop and eat at the "serape restaurant"" the one that has the 3 flags on top they are a bunch of thief\'s if paying  in us dollars they grab your dollar to 13 pesos to a dollar please take pesos...other than that beach and view is beautiful....

343373190.name: Great little bay!
343373190.author: a TripAdvisor user
343373190.reviewBody: Was our first time to explore this bay, and it\'s for sure a treasure! It\'s a great beach for swimming, but snorkelling is only so so. Great little restaurants, most offer lounge chairs too.\nYes you can snorkel along the stones at the side, but not a whole lot to see. There is a long walk way down from where you park or get dropped off by taxi, but a nice stone walk way. We watched the locals unload a truck of beer, one wheel barrow at a time..\n

342447366.name: Wonderful
342447366.author: a TripAdvisor user
342447366.reviewBody: while on the Amstar snorkel/bay boat tour, we stopped for lunch at one of the several eating places in the bay.. We were entertained by local musicians while eating. Sharon said the chicken fingers were the best she\'s eaten. Water was warm and clear. Excellent for snorkeling.

342402188.name: Large bay with less restaurants than Playa Entrega.
342402188.author: a TripAdvisor user
342402188.reviewBody:
This bay is pretty large and you need to ensure you are able to climb stairs because  cars don't get directly to the beach. I thought this was a bit inconvenient. 

The restaurants are local and they serve fresh food. It looks like this bay is more to serve local tourists and mostly nationals rather than foreigners. 

It's nice that there is a taxi station so you can go back to town at any time you are ready rather than have the restaurant calling a taxi.

340760423.name: Amazing!
340760423.author: a TripAdvisor user
340760423.reviewBody: We stopped here on our 7 bays cruise for around 2 hours. Lots of restaurants and the calmest water we seen in the area. Bring some coins as they require $5 pesos to use the washroom. The views are something pictures can not explain. If you have a chance make sure to come here.

338868480.name: Swin, snorkel and sun!
338868480.author: a TripAdvisor user
338868480.reviewBody: Great experience for swim and snorkel. It\'s a security place. "El coste\u00f1o" restaurant it\'s very delicious and the people was a gentle. I recommended booking or take a tour.

337834510.name: Nice day at the beach
337834510.author: a TripAdvisor user
337834510.reviewBody:
Umbrellas and beach loungers on request at La Costeno restaurant at the far (to the right as you face the water) end of the beach. You can pretty much ignore all the guys wanting to get you into the other places if you wish. This starts as soon as you get out of the cab, and they are persistent, but they can be politely waived off. I can't compare the restaurants, only report on a good experience with this one. Food is excellent and reasonably priced. Try the pulpo a la diabla and the house mescal. The mescal is served in a small snifter, and they are generous with their free-pour.  

The ocean swell was up a bit so there was some body surfing in the waves. All along the right side of the bay there is coral reef with lots of life. I'm guessing the visibility would have been better with calmer seas. On both sides of the bay, the shoreline is protected from boat traffic by a line of floats.

We were grateful to be at that end of the beach as the tour boats came in and brought many many many more people ashore what was an already busy place. 
It's 66 pesos for a cab from Crucecita, and that is the best way to get there. Don't bother prebooking a cab for the return, as I have found that to be less reliable than just showing up and taking the next one, and there are LOTS to be had. There is virtually NO parking at the beach access, and you have to walk down about 100 stairs to get to the beach level.

337831753.name: Very Nice Beach
337831753.author: a TripAdvisor user
337831753.reviewBody: I didn\'t expect to be accosted by so many people trying to get me to come to their restaurant. They started even before we got out of the taxi. This is probably why I only gave it a four star. That said, we read the previous tripadvisor reviews and did in fact find La Coste\u00f1o, which was just to the right of the main path. We asked for loungers and our waiter immediately brought two loungers and an umbrella. We did tip him 200 pesos for his efforts and when we ordered beer, he even brought us a small table. We never felt obligated to order more, but we did! Lunch was lovely, fresh fish. We played in the waves for what seemed like hours and had a ton of fun. I would highly recommend this place to anyone.

337408266.name: Best beach experience in Huatulco!
337408266.author: a TripAdvisor user
337408266.reviewBody: Of the 5 beaches we\'ve visited so far, this one was our favorite. Maybe the crowd was less because it was a Monday, maybe not. The bay has a part with smooth, almost waveless beach and a part with fun waves that get bigger as the day goes on. The smoother side is where the snorkeling is as well as banana boats, jet skis, and boat tours. We went to El Coste\u00f1o because that side of the beach, with the bigger waves, had a lot less people and they were one of 2 places I could see with chaise loungers. The food and service there was great!

336314874.name: This would be paradise if it wasn\'t for the jet skis
336314874.author: a TripAdvisor user
336314874.reviewBody: Our main attraction is the warm clean ocean and the quality of swimming, and for this Maguey beach was the best. The far end, in the shade of the rocks, was rarely crowded, and the beach was overall very clean. Busy restaurants and persistent salespeople we can easily overlook - that\'s not a deal-maker or -breaker for us. But when a very brazen jet ski crossed the buoy line - twice - into the swimming/snorkeling area, it was a bit too much. Admittedly it was a very busy time, Christmas week, but there really is no excuse for such behaviour. I just hope it doesn\'t take a tragedy like the one in Jamaica for the business owners and/or government to take this more seriously.

335801905.name: Sand, Gentle surf, and Seafood
335801905.author: a TripAdvisor user
335801905.reviewBody:
Our group arrived in a tour, after snorkelling in the National Reserve. We were hungry for seafood and taken to a place on the right hand side of the beach, facing out to sea. We swam at the beach and with a young child enjoyed the gentleness of the waves, the easy entry to the water, and the crystal clear blue ocean.

We had fresh fish and seafood. All the restaurants would do the same. It was a mixed  platter for four, but left six of us very satisfied. Don't forget the fresh cocoanut or the coco loco, same thing but spiked. Delicious!

 Possible to get to Maguey by taxi, but maybe more fun to take a boat. Public boats leave from the Marina at Santa Cruz.Worth the trip to try some of the other pristine Bays of Hualtulco.

325986382.name: Boat tour
325986382.author: a TripAdvisor user
325986382.reviewBody: We stopped here after snorkeling at another beach on the bay tour.  The food was very good but a little overpriced.  Beach was beautiful but very crowed.

325604875.name: Safe swimming
325604875.author: a TripAdvisor user
325604875.reviewBody: We arrived early in the morning on a Sunday and it was pretty quiet, but during the day More people arrived by boat. Anyway it never felt crowded. Food there it\'s great and in some places you can pay with card. You can rent snorkel gear and kayaks. The water was super clear and warm, no waves.

324424041.name: Best place to spend you day at the beach with some great food and Cervezas
324424041.author: a TripAdvisor user
324424041.reviewBody: Great place to do some snorkeling and eat some great food.  We made our reservation with a company called Bahias Plus.

321710901.name: El Costeno is the place to be
321710901.author: a TripAdvisor user
321710901.reviewBody: A quiet and friendly place right on the beach.  Good food, dependable with service to match.  No rip off for gringos and they will even set up a beach umbrella with nice padded chairs upon request.  The best salsa and house mezcal you could ask for.  The beach is very pretty and if you arrive early, you can sit all day and watch the boats come ashore with the touristas for excellent people watching. Ask for Neno, he will do you right.

320984928.name: A perfect beach for a perfect day
320984928.author: a TripAdvisor user
320984928.reviewBody: Maguey beach has everything we look for in a beach: a lovely setting on a beautiful bay, good swimming and snorkeling, and a variety of palapa restaurants serving seafood and drinks that also offer beach umbrellas with adjustable reclining chairs. We chose to hang out at El Coste\u00f1o, just to the right of the sidewalk leading from the stairs, and were pleased with the prices, quality and friendliness of servers, especially to a couple of gringos who don\'t speak much Spanish. Also, they didn\'t try to hustle us into their restaurant as others did, nor did they haste us when we didn\'t order much for most of the morning. This was the third beach we\'d visited in Huatulco, an it was the first to have all of the essential characteristics of a vacation beach.

308605206.name: Plenty of restaurants. wonderful snorkeling
308605206.author: a TripAdvisor user
308605206.reviewBody: Huatulco is known for it\'s many beautiful bays. If you have time, be sure to try and visit them all. Like almost all of the other bays, this one had plenty of restaurants, a wide sandy beach, and great snorkeling. Plenty of fish to see.

307540135.name: Very sad to see tons of garbage behind restaurants
307540135.author: a TripAdvisor user
307540135.reviewBody: The restaurants are accumulating tons of garbage behind them. It is disgusting and sad to see all that garbage before entering the beach. The beach is great for kids for swimming since it is very calm and it is possible to see a lot of marine fauna.

301617380.name: Crowded beach with a lot of overpriced restaurants
301617380.author: a TripAdvisor user
301617380.reviewBody: Maguey bay has a beatiful and peaceful beach, which just happened to be crowded the day of our visit.\n\nWhat i didn\'t like was the amount of restaurants with overpriced menus; All them were really simple sea food restaurants with what i assume was good quality food, but the prices in some of those just made no sense, they wanted to charge you way to much for just a simple shrimp cocktail

293005899.name: Love this beach!
293005899.author: a TripAdvisor user
293005899.reviewBody: We really enjoy going to this beach as there is a lot of activity to watch. The beach to the left is where many of the locals hang out; the beach in the middle and to the right is more for tourists. if you eat and/or drink at any of the restaurants, they will provide you with chairs and a beach umbrella. Just be sure to get costs of everything up front. Sometimes they will try to charge you for the chair and umbrella, but not if you tell them before hand that you won\'t pay extra for them, and that you do intend to eat there. A lot of vendors, but not so many that it was annoying. I bought a few items as they were so reasonably priced. Looking forward to going back!

282691593.name: Nice view and nothing but restaurants here.
282691593.author: a TripAdvisor user
282691593.reviewBody: Definitely worth visiting for the day!  Nothing but restaurants here that shut down in the evening time.  There are no shops; however, there are a handful of beach vendors.  Nice place to swim, sunbathe, eat, and enjoy the scenery.

279848506.name: Beautiful however not relaxing and expensive food
279848506.author: a TripAdvisor user
279848506.reviewBody: The beach is so clear and amazing to swim in. We had lunch at a little restaurant. The food was ok and they screwed us with the price we could not verify prices because they had no menus! So beware!! Also there are lots of venders so its difficult to enjoy yourself when everyones trying to sell you something.

278594790.name: One of our favorites
278594790.author: a TripAdvisor user
278594790.reviewBody: Very popular beach and is large enough to accommodate the people.  Antonio\'s to the far right.  Pescador Restaurant.  Good everything.

277916429.name: Excellent foof and beautiful view!
277916429.author: a TripAdvisor user
277916429.reviewBody: Nice place to eat, relax and spend a good time beside the beach. Very clean beach with a warm and calm sea. The restaurants in the area are very good with a reasonable prices.

273632383.name: A good day trip for snorkeling
273632383.author: a TripAdvisor user
273632383.reviewBody: The day we went, the weather turned and we had solid rain for an hour, HOWEVER, the restaurant we took refuge under was clean, dry and had excellent service, although the prices were breathtakingly expensive.  We went for the snorkeling, and it was pretty good over by the rocks.  Easy to catch a 60p taxi from anywhere in Huatulco.

273217893.name: Nice beach to chill
273217893.author: a TripAdvisor user
273217893.reviewBody: Nice bay with beach and rocks, some restaurants on the beach to enjoy a nice cold beer and some seafood.

263147947.name: Too crowded
263147947.author: a TripAdvisor user
263147947.reviewBody: Too many people the water is dirty by the oil of so many boats and wave runners.... Look for another beach...I do not recomend it..

262185795.name: Good food but overpriced
262185795.author: a TripAdvisor user
262185795.reviewBody: Our snorkel tour through Apple at Dreams hotel stopped at this bay for lunch.  Our captain directed us to one of the restaurants.  The first clue that it was a tourist rip-off was the menu in dollars with the least expensive meal at $15...  We knew and we still ordered lunch.  The lunch turned out to be very good, my husband had a whole fish Pescado Diablo, I had Garlic Shrimp.  I\'m sure our captain or the tour was getting a kick back, so not happy about that, but at least the food was good.

260732349.name: Lovely little open air restaurants
260732349.author: a TripAdvisor user
