260732349.reviewBody: This was our last stop on the 7 bays tour.  We liked it because - first the food was excellent.  And secondly we were told that even though this bay is part of the national park, the owners of the restaurants had been grandfathered in when the park was formed.  So no indigenous people were displaced unlike our own country.

259606923.name: not so great lunch
259606923.author: a TripAdvisor user
259606923.reviewBody: We visited this bay on a days boat tour of the 9 Huatulco bays. The bay and beach itself was lovely. Our boat driver brought us here for a lunch stop and we were definitely pressured to eat at a spot on the right hand end of the beach (as you approach from the water). I suppose we could have walked away but didn\'t. The server and presumably owner of this establishment, Angel, was giving us the hard sell to order a whole fish and when we didn\'t you could tell he wasn\'t happy. We were just looking for some snacks and ordered ceviche, it was terrible and tasted like canned tuna with some flavourless tomato thrown in.  We ordered our children virgin pi\u00f1a coladas and they were 3 times the price of a beer. You had to pay to use the washroom and afterward I felt I would have preferred to find a cactus instead! The vendors were relentless here and we really didn\'t feel like hanging around because of it. Too bad as its a lovely spot. Earlier in the day we stopped at Playa Entrega for snorkelling and I would have preferred to have stayed there for lunch, next time I will!

258273931.name: Stopped in for lunch
258273931.author: a TripAdvisor user
258273931.reviewBody: While on a snorkelling trip we stopped at Maguey Bay for lunch. Super expensive!\nBathroom break comes at a cost.

258124856.name: The best fish I have ever had at Eduardos restaurant right on the beach.
258124856.author: a TripAdvisor user
258124856.reviewBody: Loved that the owner came and sat with us- we had hired a boat for the day, and the boat owner- Gilberto took us to this little restaurant.  Beer was ice cold- fish excellent and lots of delicious fresh guacamole.

258121069.name: Beautiful Swimming beach
258121069.author: a TripAdvisor user
258121069.reviewBody: Nice beach, lots of restaurants and activities, but the food and drink prices were very expensive, check the prices before you order drinks!!

257688331.name: Nice calm beach
257688331.author: a TripAdvisor user
257688331.reviewBody: Maguey Bay was our second stop for lunch on our Sea and Sand tour. We ate at El Pescador and could order anything we wanted. There was fresh fish, lobster, stuffed pineapple, and it was kind of a hard choice when I did not want to be too full. The beer was not that cold and the vendors were constantly trying to sell you things, but I would rather they not do that when I am trying to eat. The service was good though and we had complimentary mezcal when finished. We had to stay til 4:30 so all of us went back into the water. The beach was calm and ocean clear. My only regret is that I did not snorkel again there.

257316411.name: Visit while it is still there!
257316411.author: a TripAdvisor user
257316411.reviewBody: Maguey Bay has great restaurants and a very nice beach - visit it before the whole bay gets turned into a mega resort, and gets ruined! Thanks RIU Resorts for taking the bay over from hardworking and friendly locals. Its a shame

256748720.name: Beautiful
256748720.author: a TripAdvisor user
256748720.reviewBody:
Whether you wish to hang out with people or be by yourself, this is a beach that has it all.

Several restaurants, ski doo/snorkel rentals plus various other activities and one can watch locals catch mussels. 

One day while there, we go to watch the Cruise ship leave.

256068911.name: Nice relaxing beach
256068911.author: a TripAdvisor user
256068911.reviewBody: Spent the day here on a recent vacation to Huatulco. It was a recommended beach, laid in the sun and relaxed not many people were here on a weekday. Boats coming and going and snorkeling available. Looks to have restaurants. Vendors selling their items as well. Not a too far cab ride from town. Nice paved road to travel on past the resorts.

254664372.name: lunch stop
254664372.author: a TripAdvisor user
254664372.reviewBody: Food was good and lovely location spoiled by an onslaught of persistent salespeople.  I appreciate that they need to put food on their table but this was overwhelming.

253377940.name: Scuba!
253377940.author: a TripAdvisor user
253377940.reviewBody: This is a great bay to dive in. Reasonable visibility 15 to 20 feet when I was there. Cooler current in the bay and some surge to deal with. Lots of sea life to look at. Rays and Stonefish.

253207493.name: Another lovely beach
253207493.author: a TripAdvisor user
253207493.reviewBody: Another great little beach with great seafood restaurants - had some of the best fish tacos anywhere.  The waves were a little rough but once you got past them, you could bob along forever.  Water was the perfect temperature.

250645123.name: best day ever
250645123.author: a TripAdvisor user
250645123.reviewBody: Took a taxi here and spent the day in front of El Zarape Restaurant and Felix took care of us, putting our chaise lounge chairs out with an umbrella and a little table.  Buckets of cold beer, the best margueritas, fresh fish baked in the clay oven.  We swam and sunbathed, people watched for about 4 hours....so much fun that we spent 2 more days visiting this beach on our vacation.

249647500.name: busy beach, just after New Year, but lovely
249647500.author: a TripAdvisor user
249647500.reviewBody: Very pretty cove and some good places to eat.  I spent the day in a hammock, with no pressure to do anything but relax and enjoy my day.  Really nice afternoon.

249508462.name: Wall to wall seafood
249508462.author: a TripAdvisor user
249508462.reviewBody: Definitely a destination for dining, sun and sand. Whether you arrive by a bays tour boat or taxi you will find a nice beach and an overwhelming assortment of seafood restaurants. Worth going.

249426201.name: You cannot get fresher seafood
249426201.author: a TripAdvisor user
249426201.reviewBody: Now for a different experience, have a swim and then lunch at Maguey, you wont regret it. The restaurants are mostly all owned by local families and believe me, they want you back for more, so they won\'t poison you !!! The cheapest cervesa around. Catch your own fish and have them cook it for you. They have wood fire stoves and they know how to use them !!!

248367044.name: 2nd favourite beach
248367044.author: a TripAdvisor user
248367044.reviewBody: Spent 5 hours on Christmas day at Maguey. Absolutely amazing beach, waves, surf! great food.....wish we had more time to go back!

247477347.name: Our favourite beach in Huatulco
247477347.author: a TripAdvisor user
247477347.reviewBody: A very nice small bay with a good depth of sand. Plenty of watersports, but there was very little hassle. Go to Nivel Mar, and outstanding beach bar.

238161472.name: Calm little bay
238161472.author: a TripAdvisor user
238161472.reviewBody: We went there as a part of a tour by boat but I asked if you can reach the bay by car, and the answer was yes. \nThis is a small beach wtih a calm blue sea. I didn\u00b4t snorkel there but I saw a few people doing it. The seafood was great, I had 8 huge shrimps that were prepared in different ways.\nOverall, it was a very good place to spend a few hours at.

233980543.name: Nice little beach
233980543.author: a TripAdvisor user
233980543.reviewBody: A little pricey for where it was.  The group had a fish plate but the food was very good a little different from what you normally get.  If you don\'t like fish this is not the place for you,  Snorkeling was good we saw several schools of fish and a sea spider and sea urchins

233810177.name: Must Have Lunch Here One Day
233810177.author: a TripAdvisor user
233810177.reviewBody: Such a cool bay lined up with restaurants in the sand. Great place to sit back and have a few beers and some great seafood.

233548302.name: Great seafood
233548302.author: a TripAdvisor user
233548302.reviewBody: Brick oven baked pineapple filled with shrimp with cheese on top.  Must go eat at the restaurant second from left when facing restaurants, it was the best.

213352162.name: The best Huatulco has to offer
213352162.author: a TripAdvisor user
213352162.reviewBody: Maguey is the nicest beach in Huatulco.  Go early, grab a seat at El Costeno, have a few drinks, walk the nice long beach, go for a swim, and watch the tour boats come in an un-load the folks doing the seven bay tours.  A great place for people watching, sun, and good food/drinks.  Enjoy, we have made this an annual event for the past 13 years.

208121145.name: Beautiful
208121145.author: a TripAdvisor user
208121145.reviewBody: Incredibly beautiful beach. Secluded with nice scenery. Water was wonderful. Cantina was cute but there are lots of fire ants around.

200825033.name: Busy Spot
200825033.author: a TripAdvisor user
200825033.reviewBody: We stopped by Maguey Beach for lunch one day....it is a very busy beach, but very beautiful as well.  Lots of vendors on the beach, lots of places to eat.  A unique experience.  Beautiful water - looks so green.

200617549.name: Local treasure
200617549.author: a TripAdvisor user
200617549.reviewBody: Nice clean sheltered bay. good for swim and snorkel plus has lots of restaurants to dine in. popular with locals but not a lot of tourists here. If you want the Mexican feel this is the place thumbs ups!

200536087.name: Another Great Bay
200536087.author: a TripAdvisor user
200536087.reviewBody: Be sure to go to Nival del Mar, the food is really good here.  The Bay is beautiful and calm and is a great place to snorkel.

200363441.name: Pleasant lunch experience
200363441.author: a TripAdvisor user
200363441.reviewBody: Our snorkeling tour guide brought us here for lunch - unepectedly - but we had a nice afternoon.  He suggested one restaurant that would cook the fish we had caught while on the way to our snorkeling site.  We asked that they cook it the way they thought best and it came back beautifully grilled in a very nice sauce.  that plus several drinks and tip came to US$45 for two, which we thought was a bargain.  \n\nOverall, the place looked very laid-back and comfy.

197168938.name: Lunch stop
197168938.author: a TripAdvisor user
197168938.reviewBody: We stopped here with our 7 bays and snorkeling tour for lunch. Food was excellent, beach was as well. We had tacos. The owner of the restaurant we went to had a golden retriever puppy that was a delight to play with. A few lounge chairs were available at the edge of the restaurant on the beach. Enjoyed swimming here.

196498831.name: Beautiful beach; Easy snorkeling
196498831.author: a TripAdvisor user
196498831.reviewBody: Our boat tour on Miguel Avalos\' \'Minino\'\' took us to the beautiful Maguey Bay.  The water was perfect for snorkeling. It was very easy to swim along the rocky reef on the left side (looking from the beach).  Lots of colorful fish.  Perfect day.

195962056.name: OK Beach and Food
195962056.author: a TripAdvisor user
195962056.reviewBody:
Spent a day here. Beach was nice but smaller than expected. It's not far from town, so a short cab ride, but also means more crowded than others.

Swimming was fine, but not much here to see for snorkeling, although the water was stirred up and somewhat murky the day we went, so might be better on calmer, less crowded days.

We weren't allowed to use our own beach umbrella unless we moved away from the food businesses, so we just sat at a table (second place in) and ordered beers and food from time to time. Prices and food were OK. Wife liked the guacamole. Fish tacos were OK, but likely would try something else next time.

195895996.name: Great Beach
195895996.author: a TripAdvisor user
195895996.reviewBody: A must for a beach day. Nice sand and relaxing. Be sure to sit at a Palada that has customers so you know the food will be fresh. Staff are very accommodating and friendly. They will even set you up with a table and umbrella on the beach and serve you all day.

195810288.name: Fun lunch spot
195810288.author: a TripAdvisor user
195810288.reviewBody: Stopped at Maguey during a day trip on a boat, it\'s quite lively but not rowdy. Try the stuffed pineapple - it\'s surprisingly delicious!

195720828.author: a TripAdvisor user
195720828.reviewBody: Be careful if your tour stops here for lunch. Shop around and don\'t go where the tour tells you to. Food ranges from $15 to $35 American for 1 person not including drinks. No kids menu available. \n\nYou MUST pay 50 cents or 5 pesos if you have to use the bathroom.

194837277.name: Nice swimming, nothing amazing
194837277.author: a TripAdvisor user
194837277.reviewBody: Swimming was very nice and refreshing and the snorkeling was good-- just right off the beach! A beautiful area. The downside is when you first enter the parking lot, workers from the various restaurants are there to show you the way down... And start seating you to eat. We ended up leaving our bags at the restaurant while we swam, and came back and ordered some ceviche just to be polite. The ceviche was very good, so definitely worth it.

194758370.name: Enjoyed the day
194758370.author: a TripAdvisor user
194758370.reviewBody: We spent the day at this beach Snorkeled. Sat at one of the numerous beach restaurants . Bought a beer and lunch and could use the chairs all day. Very nice people. Felt safe . Would go back

194329115.name: Michelle Pammenter Young - Spend a day relaxing at Maguey Bay
194329115.author: a TripAdvisor user
194329115.reviewBody:
During our recent trip to Huatulco we spent three of our seven days enjoying the local beaches (not including our days enjoying the beach at Secrets Resort and Spa).  Twice we went to Bahia de Maguey (Maguey Bay), once by private boat, you can read about that here, and once the four of us took a taxi there.

Wade and I were very excited to show Michele and Phil Maguey Bay as we had been there last year and it was the highlight of our trip.  You must read my review of Maguey Bay from last year, it’s amazing what a difference a year can make.

One of the things we had told Michele and Phil was how beautiful and calm this beach was, how many amazing fish there were to see and how great the little restaurants were.  I was so excited for them to see this place and for us to all be spending the day there.  So I can tell you I was shocked as I walked through the restaurants to the beach to find that the waves were 10-12 feet high and thundering onto the beach.  The once flat sand was now steeply curved down into the water, causing churning and undertow as the waves hit the beach.

At first I was very disappointed.  I had come here to spend the day swimming and these waves looked intimidating.  We took a few moments to walk along the beach and choose the restaurant spot where we would spend the day.  It’s really important if you come to Maguey Bay to come early enough to get one of the front beach spots at the restaurants, then you will not only have a table and dining chairs, but you will be lucky enough to get beach lounging chairs as well.

Today we chose El Zarape Restaurante to make our home for the next four and a half hours.  We sat, ordered a few beer and contemplated the ocean.  I could tell already that we would not be able to see any of the beautiful fish I had seen before with these large waves, and I was hoping the waves would eventually cease so I could swim.  Don’t get me wrong, I love wave swimming, and did a lot of it on Big Beach in Maui, however these waves looked mighty intimidating.

Then Wade and Phil decided to take a chance and go in.  Michele and I watched them anxiously and within no time they were past the break of the waves having a great time.  Once we saw that we knew we had to give it a try, so after I had been fortified from my first beer of the day I decided to brave the waves.  I walked down the steep beach, into the ocean, waited for a wave to break and then on the next one, dove right through it and viola, I was behind the break of the waves and the water was wonderful.  Very warm, very clean, and salty enough for us to be very buoyant.

Suddenly, the day took on an entirely new direction.  We had come here to enjoy some relaxing swimming and snorkelling, now we were wave jumping and getting a fantastic workout swimming in the huge waves.  At one point we did walk to the far end of the beach where the fish are normally prolific however the visibility was bad and there was nothing to be seen.  It’s strange how much the ocean can change, from an idyllic snorkelling spot last year, the beach became a wave riders paradise this year.

For the full review please go to: http://beachesandbubbles.com/i-just-love-beaches-a-second-look-at-maguey-bay/

To read last year's review of Maguey Bay you can click here: http://beachesandbubbles.com/maguey-bay-huatulco-mexico-beach-rating-5-05-0/

193541651.name: Fun place to Swim if you like playing in the waves!!
193541651.author: a TripAdvisor user
193541651.reviewBody: We had a blast playing in the waves here. My boyfriend and I are 30 and 26 and we probably looked like 10 year olds spending hours and hours body surfing huge waves and diving under the waves and laughing at people not timing their exit back onto the beach and being taken out by waves. Lol. The left side of the beach is calm enough for kids and families and the middle where we were was fun for big kids. The right side had some pretty big waves that guys were body surfing on, that were a bit too big for me. So we stayed in the middle. Lots of awesome little restaurants for drinks and good seafood too. Definately worth a visit.

192897169.name: Lunch
192897169.author: a TripAdvisor user
192897169.reviewBody: We stopped at Maguey Bay during our boat tour of the 9 bays . I had read about a particular restaurant there owned by Alfredo \u2026called Nivel Mar. It\'s an amazing place, great atmosphere, great staff and awesome food!

192523338.name: Maguey Bay
192523338.author: a TripAdvisor user
192523338.reviewBody: we stopped here for lunch when we did the boat bays tours.  if you are going to eat or drink at any of the restaurants, pay with pesos, we learned our first here year, they only give you 10 pesos on the dollar and it is very expensive. They want to up sell you a fancy drink for up to 150 pesos. Cervezas are reasonably priced.  The food prices are high.\n\nit is a beautiful beach area. Most of the boat tours stop here.

192508496.name: loved this bay
192508496.author: a TripAdvisor user
192508496.reviewBody: The bay was great for swimming,snorkling and people watching! Lots of locals,needed my spanish dictionary here.The weather in this region was flawless.Food was good even though we guessed at the menu.

191725945.name: great food and souvenirs
191725945.author: a TripAdvisor user
191725945.reviewBody: The boat backed up to the beach and then helped us down steps (very convenient) so we could walk up to the restaurant.  You did not even need to bring your shoes.  \nFood was good even the habanero hot sauce.

190988090.name: Maguey Bay
190988090.author: a TripAdvisor user
190988090.reviewBody: Warm sun, refreshing water, interesting sites below and above water - a great place to visit!  We enjoyed our day here!

188612322.name: A great place to visit!!
188612322.author: a TripAdvisor user
188612322.reviewBody: This place was like heaven on earth. Very pristine and clean. The water and beaches were perfect!!! The food and people in the area were also great!!

188095952.name: Beautiful Beach With Several Bars and Restaurants
188095952.author: a TripAdvisor user
188095952.reviewBody: We arrived by boat, a private charter, which took us to five bays. We shared a lunch platter consisting of shrimp prepared  in four different ways, and enjoyed a cool beverage. We had a table to ourselves outside the patio on the sand. Service was good, the sun was hot, and scenery quite exotic. Mountains surround this small bay. We invited Luis, our tour guide, to join us to each his lunch. Our trip with Luis was arranged by Sunwing at the Barcelo, but it was not the group tour which offers seven bays.

187980394.name: Very popular spot
187980394.author: a TripAdvisor user
187980394.reviewBody: This is the cove the tour boats want you to see. Accessible by land or sea, the beach has over a dozen places to eat and drink or you can walk to the end of the beach for some privacy. There\'s the typical beach vendor, but they aren\'t pushy and a simple "no gracias" and they\'ll walk on. It\'s not a great beach for swimming unless you\'re a strong swimmer as it drops of quickly and the waves have quit an undertow. Most visit as part of the 7 cove tours, but you can cab there on the cheap. Lots of locals too, if you like that sort of thing.

187575478.name: Nice beach, delicious food, great swimming in waves
187575478.author: a TripAdvisor user
187575478.reviewBody: We arrived to the beach by taxi (66 pesos from Hotel Villa Blanca). Short trip down the stairs and you are on the beach. One spot for snorkelling, not a lot but ok for newbies. We ate in El Pescador, service was great, started with few beers and Huacoco (Coco liqueur with Rum in a coconut), later had Pineapple Shrimp - very delicious!\nBest time to visit before 2 pm, lots of catamaran arriving after that.

180984340.name: Another gem of a beach
180984340.author: a TripAdvisor user
180984340.reviewBody: The beach is great, specially when the seas are calm. Be careful when the waves are crashing. the undertow can be string. A fun place to visit and so some surfing.

161592164.name: Another beautiful bay
161592164.author: a TripAdvisor user
161592164.reviewBody: great snorkeling with restuarants. Can be crowded on weekends, and there are many vendors that sell various items. Quieter during week and more room to relax.\n

160299170.name: Beautiful safe beach
160299170.author: a TripAdvisor user
160299170.reviewBody: We swam and the water was perfect.  It was well worth the cab ride to get there.  This is the beach with the steps at the back.  Of course there were waiters trying to get you to their own bars but once setttled it was very relaxing.

155897119.name: awesome beach
155897119.author: a TripAdvisor user
155897119.reviewBody: This place had a good beach. We ate good food here for lunch. I would go back to this beach again. It is a good spot for fresh fish. Most places in Huatulco have very good fish though.

153642227.name: great local beach
153642227.author: a TripAdvisor user
153642227.reviewBody: Want to see how the local folks enjoy their private time away from the everyday humdrum of stress/work? Come to this beach on the weekend. The Mexican folks who come to this beach are some of the most pleasant,and courteous folks you\'ll ever meet. They enjoy their family time immensely and this beach is no exception. With eateries up and down the bay, cab service available most of the time and prices that will keep you coming back; you\'ll want to make a date to visit Maguey Bay while you\'re in Huatulco.

151303724.name: Beautiful and Busy Beach
151303724.author: a TripAdvisor user
151303724.reviewBody: Lots of action at this beach if you are not looking for solitude. Banana boat rides and big waves.Lots of restaurant choices. Check your bill and know that a 10% tip is added to the bill.

149396247.name: Stairs
149396247.author: a TripAdvisor user
149396247.reviewBody: My husband couldn\'t do the stairs. Well he could go down but didn\'t think he\'d make it back up so we didn\'t get to see it

149209013.name: Once you are passed the vendors and make it down the steps
149209013.author: a TripAdvisor user
149209013.reviewBody: Maguey is my favorite beach. The water is always clear and there are many fish. The bay makes swimming easy and there is usual if ever? an undertow. You do have to rent your chairs, umbrella and if you want mask and fins.

147897859.name: A hidden secret
147897859.author: a TripAdvisor user
147897859.reviewBody: Fresh fish and seafood cooked in an outdoor oven!  What more could  you ask for?  of course great drinks and the beach!

146447067.name: Great Beach
146447067.author: a TripAdvisor user
146447067.reviewBody: We really enjoyed the beach at Maguey, we spend 2 full days there during our week in Huatulco, cab will cost you $65 peso from town each way. The water is very clean, with a great sandy bottom, at this beach you can get a full lounge chair at many of the restaurants who will watch your stuff while you are swimming, they just look for you to buy a few drinks during your say there. We had a nice fresh fish lunch on the beach, it was a little pricey, but was very good. We went during the week on one of the days which was not very busy the other day we went was Sunday which was a lot more busy. Overall we enjoyed the beach very much.

143324479.name: Gorgeous - except for all the tacky restaurants lining the shore
143324479.author: a TripAdvisor user
143324479.reviewBody: First saw Maguay from a sea-doo. A few days later we took a cab back for a swim, and stayed for lunch. Food was just ok, and the cheek-by-jowl restaurants on the beach detracted from this breathstoppingly beautiful bay.

137005880.name: Too many people!
137005880.author: a TripAdvisor user
137005880.reviewBody: All the touristy boats take a ton of people to this beach to eat.\nThe prices are quite expensive for the services they offer.\nI don\'t think I would go again...

128636493.name: Snorkeling at Maguey
128636493.author: a TripAdvisor user
128636493.reviewBody: As you arrive on the beach snorkel the left side...follow the shore by the rocks.  A good snorkel...not the best...but a 7 out of 10.  I bring my own gear but you can rent for for 40 pesos at the beach.  Have fun!!!

127820462.name: lovely beach
127820462.author: a TripAdvisor user
127820462.reviewBody: Only spent one day here but it was a lovely beach very busy but that was part of the enjoyment

127164581.name: Great swimming
127164581.author: a TripAdvisor user
127164581.reviewBody: If you like to get in the water, this is a good place.  There is a bit of a trek getting to and from the beach, but definitely worth it!

126139797.name: disappointed in this beach too commercialised
126139797.author: a TripAdvisor user
126139797.reviewBody: Nice sandy beach, just a little too commercialised for me

125239105.name: BEAUTIFUL
125239105.author: a TripAdvisor user
125239105.reviewBody: Excellent place for swimming and snorkelling.\nAnother BEAUTIFUL beach.

124925979.name: pea soup, expensive
124925979.author: a TripAdvisor user
124925979.reviewBody: the day we went to Maguey bay you could barely see your hand in front of your face.  There is only one small patch of coral off on the left side of the beach.  The water on the left was fairly clear but the rest of the bay was full of gunk. \nWe were surprised by the 100 peso "umbrella fee" when we got our bill at the restaurant we parked at- we were dragged in by the owner from the parking lot and he most certainly did not mention any extra fees.  I don\'t recall the name of the restaurant but it\'s in the middle. Be sure to ask about additional fees before you sit!  I much preferred La Entrega.

123624900.name: A little expensive
123624900.author: a TripAdvisor user
123624900.reviewBody: The food was a little expensive here, but it was beautiful!

122894900.name: Good spot, great snorkelling
122894900.author: a TripAdvisor user
122894900.reviewBody: Maguey is at its best at 8am. Get up early, catch a cab and swim in the glassy waters before the tourists come along and churn up the sea and raise the prices. The snorkelling is awesome the further out you go. Watch out for the prices. Maguey is getting more and more expensive and the vendors are taking advantage of, especially, cruise ship visitors.

122474351.name: Busy beach
122474351.author: a TripAdvisor user
122474351.reviewBody: Was extremely crowded during the holiday week in December.

121283810.name: Great snorkelling
121283810.author: a TripAdvisor user
121283810.reviewBody:
Playa Maguey is one of the widest beaches. The beach can be calm or it can have very high surf- totally depends on the winds and tides (as anywhere). If arriving by car, you have to walk down several flights of stairs to get to the beach. And then, what a view!

Snorkelling at Maguey is even better than at Entrega. The rocks on the far side - away from the restaurants - have fantastic variety of fish. And, just off the beach we saw 4 stingrays. The water was also crystal clear on the first day we went. 

It's just a lot of work to get to and from Maguey because we had a young child. With just adults, it would be fine. It is only a 15 mins drive from La Crucecita, less from Santa Cruz.

120504053.name: Beautiful clear, calm waters
120504053.author: a TripAdvisor user
120504053.reviewBody:
We arrived on this beach while on one of the tours to see the bays of Huatulco, and out of all of the beaches we visited on our trip, this was the most beautiful.
The restaurants are your usual mexican coastal fayre, selling a vast array of seafood, which while wasnt great for us as vegetarians, the bay itself was tranquil and beautiful.

If you want to swim when youre in Huatulco, this was the clearest and calmest beach we could find, people do snorkelling here, and the waves are almost invisible compared to those of Chahue or Tangolunda

120361218.name: El Costeno, really good!!
120361218.author: a TripAdvisor user
120361218.reviewBody: We came here twice, both we had lunch and even though it was very slow season and hardly any people the service and the food were very good. Our waiter super attentive and the beach one of the most beautiful ones. We had our car so the access was not a problem at all, and the taxi from the hotel cost $50 pesos. I am sure everybody will enjoy it, a variety of restaurant and nice to relax and swim around.

118033469.name: Maguey Bay, come, eat, relax!
118033469.author: a TripAdvisor user
118033469.reviewBody:
Trip Advisor shows Maguey bay 90+ miles from city center, It is nowhere near 90 miles, 10 miles maybe!

Anyway, we spent several hours here at the Ay Caray restaurant, we had them prepare some fish we had caught on the boat ride over as well as ordered several other entrees.

Again, nice to sit with your feet in the sand, enjoying the nice ocean breeze. There are "public" bano's on the beach, however you must pay 5 or 10 peso to use them, that being said, they are attended and very clean!

Maguey is a beautiful bay!

40028700.name: One of the best bays ih HUX
40028700.author: a TripAdvisor user
40028700.reviewBody: Featuring beach restaurants with seafood  specials, this is one of the most popular beaches in huatulco.  The best  for swming , with water sports such jetskis, banana boat, and a small coral reef on the left hand side. About 15 minutes from the hotel zone by taxi and 45 minute boat ride.

672898362.name: Little Known Quiet Public Beach but Not Recommended For Swimming
672898362.author: a TripAdvisor user
672898362.reviewBody: This is a pretty cool beach for photos but not your typical layout in the sun beach. The water is not your typical clear turquoise blue water one expect in Mexico beaches and the surf is a bigger here also so it is not again great for swimming. The beach area is very good at dusk for photo taking of the ocean and rocks around the cove.\n\nBOTTOM LINE: There are much nicer beaches between here and Santa Cruz for sunning and swimming. I\'d say pass on this one unless you are here only to shoot photos. MY RATING: 6/10.

666368736.name: Deserted beach, great waves, prefect afternoon
666368736.author: a TripAdvisor user
666368736.reviewBody: The waves here are supposed the be \'beginner\' waves in which case I may need \'pre-beginner\' waves! The beach was, as is the case with many of the beaches in Huatulco, amazing. We spent the afternoon attempting to boogie board (about $7 for the day for the rental, the price is negotiable depending on demand) We were all exhausted by the end of the day. There are a couple od restaurants with decent food and drinks where you can watch the brave or dumb in your group challenge the waves.

665280460.name: A LATE AFTERNOON WITH AMAZING FRIENDS
665280460.author: a TripAdvisor user
665280460.reviewBody: LA BOCANA  spent the late afternoon with amazing friends, enjoyed a drink at the little restaurant and bar at the east side, then off with barefeet, carmeras, and walked east along the ocean.\nfound a beautiful decayed starfish washed up as well as a  washed up porckupine fish,, amazing to see the quills, as well as we walked to where the coppalita river runs into the ocean,, people swimming, fishing and enjoying the evening of sunset.\na beautiful place to go about 4, not to warm , just beautiful....

662107020.name: Skip This One
662107020.author: a TripAdvisor user
662107020.reviewBody: This beach is nowhere near as nice as other beaches in the area.  Nor is the water.  There are larger waves so it is basically only good for surfing.  I would definitely recommend other beaches if you want to just lay on the beach and go in the water.

659961535.name: afternoon visit in January
659961535.author: a TripAdvisor user
659961535.reviewBody: spectacular beach, surf sounds, many pelicans and other sea birds to watch,great for a walk down the beach for reall great photos, 2 small beach cantinas ,very casual and laid back, friendly people reasonable prices .we took a taxi from Tangolunda area ,cost 80 pesos .excellent value.

658302938.name: Wide open, enchanted, very underutilized beach, great for surfing.
658302938.author: a TripAdvisor user
658302938.reviewBody: This is not your average swim beach as the waves are quite high and there is a strong undertow. There is alot of room with very few occupants on the beach. A great beach to spend a romantic afternoon or evening. There are two restuaraunts and a store not far off the beach and the beach is well known for getting a mud bath from the local medicinal mud (for a fee). This is where the Copilita River flows into the Ocean from the mountians. I recomend that you bring your own umbrella, beach blanket and or chairs as you wish as there is no protection from the sun and it is very warm.

657956578.name: Peaceful Quiet Beach
657956578.author: a TripAdvisor user
657956578.reviewBody: One of my favourite beaches while we stayed in Huatulco. Fresh sea air, no one on the beach.. so peaceful, clean, quiet and not crowded. (actually, there was NO ONE there when we went!) Take a beach chair and umbrella and spend the day. There\'s a couple of restaurants nearby..

657831158.name: Quiet aNd in disturbed beach
657831158.author: a TripAdvisor user
657831158.reviewBody: I walked for 2 hours by myself and saw maybe 5 people the whole time, felt like I was on survivor!\nFound the river and walked in the reed with lost of birds

657384822.name: Scenic Beach- Uncrowded
657384822.author: a TripAdvisor user
657384822.reviewBody: Surf Sand Rocks & Seabirds- Oh and don\'t forget the BREEZE!  Hi Surf can make this place challenging for swimming so BEWARE.  Great place for a walk on the beach and/or lunch under a shady palapa.  Check out Los Gueros for the BEST fish tacos- flaky fresh fish in a light crunchy batter served with the finest chipoltle mayo ever!

657080727.name: A Wonderful Beach to spend an afternoon
657080727.author: a TripAdvisor user
657080727.reviewBody: This is not a good swimming beach - more for surfing or boogie boards but is a long beautiful beach.  Great for long walks.  10-15 min. takes you to where the river enters the ocean.  Great spot.  Also has 2 restaurants where you access the beach.

655810922.name: Patience
655810922.author: a TripAdvisor user
655810922.reviewBody: As an earlier review pointed out, the restaurant on the left would be and has been the place of choice. However, on a more recent visit(last month) the food is still good but it took almost an hour to reach the table. Only two other small groups there. So, be patient and enjoy the beach.

655599116.name: Good walking beach
655599116.author: a TripAdvisor user
655599116.reviewBody: This is a long, fairly scenic beach with few visitors, especially compared to other nearby beaches like Santa Cruz and La Entrega.  It is a good beach for walking. After 30 minutes of walking you come to a lagoon with a seagoing outlet you can wade across and keep walking.  There is steady surf that is good for boogie boarding, surfing, and body surfing.  There are two small restaurants at the end of the beach you access.  Unless you bring an umbrella or sit in a restaurant, there is no shade.  It\u2019s a 75 peso, 15 minute taxi ride from Chahue.

654492895.name: Surfing
654492895.author: a TripAdvisor user
654492895.reviewBody: Very good for the beginner. Christian was very helpful and did not rush you. Up on the second try for my daughter. Very sunny with no shade. Great beach for walking.

654415864.name: Breathtaking and Peaceful!
654415864.author: a TripAdvisor user
654415864.reviewBody: Playa La Bocana is a little town where surfers come to test their skills.  It has also one of the most beautiful, deserted beaches for miles.  There are two little restaurants in town which offer authentic Mexican food.  Little English is spoken here.  So be prepared.  Also, the restaurant we were ate only took pesos, not sure of the other restaurant.

652976932.name: Gorgeous Beach!
652976932.author: a TripAdvisor user
652976932.reviewBody: A must have fish burger! Surfing beach, but also a long walking beach, quick taxi ride to Copalita Ruins.

652408924.name: Long beach strolls away from the "beach scene"  kind of places.
652408924.author: a TripAdvisor user
652408924.reviewBody: You won\'t find beach chairs or palapas or banging beach club noise...but you will find a long quiet beautiful surf beach to get away to. Enjoy the quiet, enjoy seeing few people around, enjoy bird watching in the river estuary...pelicans, egrets and others. Nearby restaurant and a palapa food bar are great for food and drinks after your walk. You won\'t go just once !

652232945.name: Loved the pelicans
652232945.author: a TripAdvisor user
652232945.reviewBody: So big a beach I felt like it was our own private beach. Sat for an hour watching the birds and pelicans play in the current of the river. A must to visit here.

652079366.name: Beautiful
652079366.author: a TripAdvisor user
652079366.reviewBody: What a beautiful untouched piece of paradise. Very large, quiet beach, great place to enjoy the quiet beauty, watch some surfers and the pelicans fishing. One of our new favourite places

650707636.name: A must do: La Bocana
650707636.author: a TripAdvisor user
650707636.reviewBody: Awesome beach, uncrowded (almost deserted most times). Great fish burger at the restaurant right on the beach, on your left as you face the ocean.

650125411.name: Excellent surf tor boogie bosrd
650125411.author: a TripAdvisor user
650125411.reviewBody: Although the waves are crashing, there is no drastic drop off. You can walk along this beach for quite awhile. But bring your hat for sun shade. Excellent restaurant, La Bocana, where the food is delicious and the drinks ice cold. Good respite from the sun. You can watch fishermen casting their nets. Easy taxi access. You could easily spend the whole day here.

647003993.name: Reminiscent of the beaches of the Oregon Coast or Long Beach, BC
647003993.author: a TripAdvisor user
647003993.reviewBody: A great place to surf or just play in the crashing waves. A MASSIVE beach with lots of space to yourself, however not a lot of shade! Bring an umbrella or build a shelter like the locals do.

646964726.name: Great beach, little shade
646964726.author: a TripAdvisor user
646964726.reviewBody: Isolated, few people, great walking, surf. A couple of restaurants with shaded verandas, but no beach chairs or umbrellas for shade.

646875058.name: Another Favourite Beach
646875058.author: a TripAdvisor user
646875058.reviewBody: We come here when we want to escape the crowds.  The beach is quieter. Great for walking.  This year we walked to the Copalita River - where the River meets the Sea.  We sat in the river and relaxed.  The kids had fun building on to the lean-to that someone else had made.  We enjoyed watching the birds and looking for crabs.  The water is rougher here.  Great for surfing, boogies boards or just jumping in the waves!

646615996.name: Should go!
646615996.author: a TripAdvisor user
646615996.reviewBody: We met someone that highly recommended this beach not too far away but we rant out of time.  Very short cab ride from Barcelo/Dreams/Secrets.\n

645819022.name: Amazing Beach
645819022.author: a TripAdvisor user
645819022.reviewBody: This is a beautiful Beach were you can walk swim or surf. The river meets up with the ocean here. It is not busy here at all. There is more pelicans then people. This was one of my favourite beaches. A must see

645395389.name: Beautiful
645395389.author: a TripAdvisor user
645395389.reviewBody: Beautiful beach, unspoiled. The day we were there, the waves were high and not many swimming. Took a cab there and usually the restaurant will call a cab for you, we lucked out and one was there.

643177448.name: Love this beach
643177448.author: a TripAdvisor user
643177448.reviewBody: Have been to many beaches  and this is one of my all time favorite. If you grow up in southern calif and then come here it reminds me of the beaches down south about 30 years ago, you need to visit this place.

643159241.name: Quiet, relatively pristine beach, two good restaurants
643159241.author: a TripAdvisor user
643159241.reviewBody: This is a really nice beach, about 20 minutes by taxi from La Crucecita. Very few people, two small restaurants on the beach. Lots of pelicans and other birds diving for fish. Moderate wave activity.\n\nNice walk down the beach about 1 mile more or less to the mouth of the river where it comes out of the Sierra Madre Sur mountains and empties into the ocean. Very natural setting.

640011720.name: A beautiful beach!
640011720.author: a TripAdvisor user
640011720.reviewBody: A nice area for a long beach walk.  Very unique scenery as the river runs into the ocean here.  We also had great service when we stopped for a cold cervesa at one of the local restaurants.  Easily found a cab back to Chahue resort area.

638910855.name: My Favorite
638910855.author: a TripAdvisor user
638910855.reviewBody: This beach is a wonderful wild and  interesting beach! The waves can be very high and you can watch surfers on those days! Explore the river area if you are interested in birds!

638072163.name: Great  Beach  No Crowds
638072163.author: a TripAdvisor user
638072163.reviewBody: We love this beach and the great restautant located on the left as you enter.\nThey have the BEST fish tacos I ever ate.I go there every time I visit Huatulco.

638016460.name: Just the beach, no services
638016460.author: a TripAdvisor user
638016460.reviewBody: Nice and somewhat scenic beach, nice for a long walk.  Spotted countless tiny crabs holed up in the sand.  Took a walk and left, as we like to have a beach with food and drink services, along with lounge chairs and umbrellas.  This beach has none of this, so ideal for people looking for peace and quiet, who have their own beach gear.

636061545.name: Incredible Experience
636061545.author: a TripAdvisor user
636061545.reviewBody: Visiting La Bocana is a must when you travel to Huatulco! The beach is gorgeous with big waves crashing against the rocks. There is a little surf shop too. For 100 pesos, you can have the mineral rich mud rubbed all over your body, you wait for it to dry and then you wash it off in the ocean. It makes your skin so soft!

635294272.name: A great beach! Fishermen, birds, a good restaurant, and yet quiet
635294272.author: a TripAdvisor user
635294272.reviewBody: We started off by having tacos and beer at Playa La Bocana Restaurante and then walked down the beach. Fishermen, two with a line and hook, and three with nets, were fishing. The ones with nets were catching sardines. Lots of birds fishing too, gulls, pelicans, frigates, vultures. Cliffs, cacti, sea stacks, a lagoon. And beautiful sand. And yet, not many people. Still cheap and easy to get to from our hotel Villa Blanca - 80 pesos for the taxi.

635244029.name: Unspoiled beach
635244029.author: a TripAdvisor user
635244029.reviewBody: A short taxi ride from our hotel (Villablanca) you get to this beach. There are two restaurant where your cab drops you off. We were there at low tide and made it to rio copalita in about 20min of walking slowly. I tried Fly fishing and casting some poppers without any success. There are no services there except when going back close to the restaurants. As the sun shines and the heat, a hat and some water are a must.

630278263.name: Beautiful beach
630278263.author: a TripAdvisor user
630278263.reviewBody: Another beautiful beach to relax at. Not many come here so it\'s even better . Smaller waves coming in and a relaxing time,

618890766.name: Like a long walk on the beach?
618890766.author: a TripAdvisor user
618890766.reviewBody: This beach was so awesome. It was clean and quiet and strikingly beautiful. There was a spot where a tree had washed up on shore and there were rocks gathered around it. When we were there the waves hit the rocks so that as the wave went back out it sounded almost like the rocks were singing a little clicking song. STRONGLY recommend walking on this beach.

602452572.name: Wild, beautiful beach.   One of my very favorite places on the planet.
602452572.author: a TripAdvisor user
602452572.reviewBody: La Bocana is at the very eastern edge of Huatulco.   A cobblestone street off the main highway (Hwy 200) takes you there.   You\'ll be flanked on either side by beachfront restaurants.   Our favorite is Los Gueros (on the left).   While they\'re famous for their fish burger, you should also try their shrimp cocktail.   The beach itself is the only beach in the Huatulco area with surf.   You\'ll see surfers and boogie-boarders right in front of the restaurants.   The beach is at the bottom of bluffs that are topped by jungle containing a huge variety of birds, reptiles and butterflies, AND the Copalita ruins.   The ruins (see other reviews of this place) date back to 500 BC.   The beach stretches to your left (east) about a mile..   a short distance down the beach is where the Copalita river dumps into the ocean.   Its a good place to fish for Robalo (snook).   The river\'s estuary is beautiful and always filled with a large variety of birds.  One of the reasons I love this beach is that its always changing.   I\'ve been coming here for 26 years and its never the same.   Occasionally all of the sand is gone!   The location of the river mouth differs year to year.   When the tide is in, you may have to clamber over rocks to get to the river\'s mouth.

600454280.name: Large beautiful beach
600454280.author: a TripAdvisor user
600454280.reviewBody: Expect to go for a long walk & take sunscreen.  Fantastic scenery.  Watch (or participate) surfing & people fishing right off the beach.

598308098.name: Secluded, not overcrowded, good surf, beautiful Long Beach
598308098.author: a TripAdvisor user
598308098.reviewBody: This is a beautiful long black sand beach, with nice large rocks and manglar lagoon along the side.  If you stay for a drink or food, we enjoyed very much "Los Gueros" Restaurant, right on the side of the beach.  A restaurant ran and funded by locals (over 40 years living in the area, who have fought to keep the beach as natural as possible).  The food is fresh and delicious! Anything you order is well done and tasty.  We tried sea bass in chipotle sauce (spicy and delicious!), guacamole (with freshly made non-fried tostadas- hard corn tortillas), ceviche with fish, octopus, shrimp... and more... As it is a family ran-restaurant, their son Javier (Xavier) is not only very charismatic and friendly, but knowledgable and speaks English and French... proudly a Oaxacan by birth! Great beach for long walks, not much for swimming, however, if you have half a day in the afternoon, this will be a great place to eat and enjoy an after dinner walk, or surfing...   Huatulco bays are amazing, and this one is a jewel. You need a taxi to get there... you can ask Xavier or the restaurant personal to get you a taxi to go back to your hotel.

576061823.name: Breathtaking Black Sand Beach!
576061823.author: a TripAdvisor user
576061823.reviewBody: Not a great beach to swim but it is a rugged, beautiful beach that is definitely a must see!  La Bocana is loaded with black volcanic sand, millions of volcanic pebbles sound like a rain maker in the surf, loads of driftwood carried from the mountains by the river has its mouth at the beach... simply an amazing place!

575497307.name: Mile long beach
575497307.author: a TripAdvisor user
575497307.reviewBody: Two restaurants and miles of beach to walk, busy time they have the famous mud baths.  Great little restaurant with amazing food. Love to watch the waves and a few surfers .

574812220.name: Peaceful and unique ... highlight of my trip !
574812220.author: a TripAdvisor user
574812220.reviewBody: We visit here every trip and make a day of it, its know for surfing, seafood and mud baths or just  beach time. I just love my traditional mud baths, which are known for their healing properties. To get there its a quick scenic 20 min taxi ride from Santa Cruz for about 50 pesos. Once arriving you are usually greeted by a older Mexican woman with clay pots in hand, its why most come to La Bocana , the  cost is $100 pesos ( which is $7 cdn -- cheap right  who goes to the spa in Canada for that..lol  - I also tip another $20 pesos )  Your traditional mud bath starts by one of the locals slathering you in volcanic mud ,,while standing right next to the ocean  left to dry in the hot sun then rubbed down !! Rinsing off in the Pacific ocean has me feeling both exfoliated and rejuvenated. Afterwards, we walk the beach and then enjoy a fabulous seafood dish and cool beverage before grabbing a taxi home skin glowing and sun kissed.

573603087.name: Mud bath
573603087.author: a TripAdvisor user
573603087.reviewBody: Great mud bath. Loved the beach. Great waves to play in. Had lunch, rented a boogie board and shade umbrella for 25$ at the restaurant for the day.

573538302.name: Expansive Beach
573538302.author: a TripAdvisor user
573538302.reviewBody:
This was our favorite go to beach. Open beach as far as the eye could see. If you like to walk along the beach this is the place for you. Very few people on the beach compared to other beaches. 
This is the surfing beach so there is always a few people out in the surf. There is a surf store that gives lessons . Lifeguards are always on duty. Hold on to your eyewear as the surf has claimed many a pair which I can attest too.
We did have the mud baths which were great and gave us memorable photos.
There are two restaurants on the beach that serve food and drinks.
Taxi service is no problem to and from the beach.
We will definitely be returning here.

569585981.name: Mud bath and yummy lunch
569585981.author: a TripAdvisor user
569585981.reviewBody: This was an amazing day. We took a cab from Barcelo for 65 pesos, had a mud \u201cbath\u201d from Inese 100 pesos and the best Fish burger at La Bocana restaurant which we will talk about for years. Do it!

568735060.name: Worth the short trip
568735060.author: a TripAdvisor user
568735060.reviewBody:
We were recommended to go to the beach from our transfer driver the first morning to the hotel. We also talk to others at our resort that said that it was a beautiful long expense of pristine beach, with some lovely ladies doing clay mud baths on the beach in front of the roundabout. Thanks 

We were able to walk for ages, seeing nothing but a few surfers catching a few waves. We walked back and finally found the Clay bath ladies who spent time applying the mud, letting it dry and then exfoliating my skin before rinsing off in the fantastic beach just a few feet away. We were able to walk for ages, seeing nothing but a few surfers catching a few waves. We watch back and finally found the Clay bath ladies who spent time applying the mud, letting it dry and then exfoliating my skin before rinsing off in the fantastic beach just a few feet away.

Highly recommend the beach for a private walk with beautiful scenery, a chance to shed some dry sun baked skin or grab a beer at one of the restaurants attached to the entrance.

568717344.name: Mud bath
568717344.author: a TripAdvisor user
568717344.reviewBody: Fun way to spend some time bay getting a mud bath,then having coronas and a stuffed pineapple at the restaurant on the beach. A few whales off in the distance.

568165215.name: Not to be missed
568165215.author: a TripAdvisor user
568165215.reviewBody: We were there in march 2018,\nThe water was way out which gave us the ability to walk to the forest water river that comes down from the mountains, well worth the walk - bring water as it is a way out there. We ate at the restaurant on the left when looking out at the beach and it was great with a nice view, the owner was nice and call a cab when we were ready to leave.

567975248.name: Oh Wow!
567975248.author: a TripAdvisor user
567975248.reviewBody: Still good for surfing but the sands that were desposited after the storms have rebuilt the beach. Lovely restaurants to visit also.  A must see for sure!!

567779623.name: What a beach!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Wide , expansive and HOT!!!!!!!!!!..and Whales
567779623.author: a TripAdvisor user
567779623.reviewBody: Best popular surfing beach close to Huatulco. 2 restaurants available after the beach.\nLimited up close parking.

565885394.name: Great long beach for walking
565885394.author: a TripAdvisor user
565885394.reviewBody: We had a nice morning walk on this beach. It\'s a long beach with reasonably tough sand, so it is ok for a long walk. Waves and winds were high making for some good photos. There were quite a few birds at the river mouth with a great backdrop of the mountain range, so another good photo op.

564988721.name: Beautiful untouched beach
564988721.author: a TripAdvisor user
564988721.reviewBody: The mud bath and exfoliation is available at the beach by a local lady - 100 pesos - well worth the experience. Enjoy authentic Mexican food at the 2 beach restaurants and watch the pelicans dive for fish.

564441788.name: Great beach for photos
564441788.author: a TripAdvisor user
564441788.reviewBody: My wife, her photographer and I spent the afternoon on the beach for a photo session. At the time, the tide was low and the surf quite far out and offering lots of space on the sand. The area is gorgeous and unlike any other beach Ive seen. We will definitely visit the area again.

564403004.name: AMAZING BEACH, OUR FAVORITE IN THE AREA!!
564403004.author: a TripAdvisor user
564403004.reviewBody: The beach changes from year to year.  Some years there really is no beach when the water is high.  This year we were very lucky because the beach was vast!!!  And there was no one on it!!  Beautiful for a beach walk, or even better, bring your beach umbrella, and a couple chairs, and a cooler and spend the afternoon.  If you want to eat be sure to go to the restaurant on the left (when looking from the beach) and try the shrimp burger, or whole fried fish....amazing.

563720863.name: Beautiful broad beach
563720863.author: a TripAdvisor user
563720863.reviewBody:
This beach changes with the seasons and tides. The river meanders along the beach and repositions sand.   Some years it is a broad beach, some it is narrow. It is a surf beach which keeps some swimmers out of the water. 

There are two in the sand restaurants each with their following. Bocana Restaurant on the right when facing the sea is partnered with the surf shop. Los Güros on the left seems more active and that is where I had a very excellent fish burger and fries. 

This is a walking beach and very much worth a visit.

563426091.name: Fun for a quick visit.
563426091.author: a TripAdvisor user
563426091.reviewBody: Four of us took a cab here from Santa Cruz to get a mud bath and find the much talked about fish sandwiches. We did both and they did not disappoint. The water is not swimmer friendly but the beach is huge.

563340188.name: Mud bath and surfing
563340188.author: a TripAdvisor user
563340188.reviewBody: Great mud bath.  only 10 dollars.  Watched the surfers there.  They have boogie boards there too.  Pretty good size waves and huge beach

562753308.name: Mexican version of Tofino\'s Long Beach
562753308.author: a TripAdvisor user
562753308.reviewBody: It\'s the Mexican version of Tofino\'s Long Beach ... absolutely stunning.  Highly recommend - worth the time to go for sure.

562561751.name: Favourite Peaceful Place!
562561751.author: a TripAdvisor user
562561751.reviewBody: Great place to go for a walk on a quiet beautiful beach and then stop for a drink or snacks before returning to your hotel

562304218.name: Stunning location
562304218.author: a TripAdvisor user
562304218.reviewBody: We made a short visit to this beautiful beach to enjoy, of all things, a mud bath from a local lady. I understand this beach is known for surfing but it was completely empty the day we were there. Lucky for us! The rock formations and beautiful sand beach make this such a gorgeous location. Beach-side restaurant offers good eats and cold beer. We were however, told that this is not a swimming beach and were advised to keep our feet on the ocean floor if in the water.

561878395.name: Gorgeous Beach!
561878395.author: a TripAdvisor user
561878395.reviewBody: We took a cab to Playa La Bocana for the clay baths.  We went down to the beach where the clay was rubbed all over us and we were exfoliated after we dried.  Our skin felt incredibly soft for days afterward!  Loved those girls!  The beach and scenery is absolutely beautiful.  We enjoyed relaxing hours on the beach and sitting in the restaurant eating guacamole and chips and watching the surfers.  You MUST experience Playa La Bocana!

561591479.name: Picturesque!
561591479.author: a TripAdvisor user
561591479.reviewBody: Enjoyed a long stroll down the beach watching pelicans feed and surfers. It\u2019s a bit too rough to swim but great for boogie boarding. There\u2019s a couple of restaurants here with very good seafood and cold beers. It was only a 10 minute cab ride (75 pesos) I highly recommend visiting this beach.

560695647.name: Best beach
560695647.author: a TripAdvisor user
560695647.reviewBody: This is like Tulum before the tourist invasion. Absolutely a fantastic place to spend some time. Go and feel privileged.

558899264.name: Great beach just really lacking in shade....
558899264.author: a TripAdvisor user
558899264.reviewBody: ...wait until days end when many birds come to the beach to feed on fish and crabs...add a sunset and long shadows and it\'s awesome.  Not sure the name but there are only 2 restaurants on the beach but the one on the left serves really good seafood.

558870706.name: What a bueatiful beach!
558870706.author: a TripAdvisor user
558870706.reviewBody: Spent a good part of the day at this wonderful beach.  Every time we\'re there it presents a different personality!  Good place to stroll, sunbath and relax.  Never too busy.  Bring an umbrella if you are planning to lay on the beach - no palapas, there are huge rocks which provide shade.\nHad lunch at one of the restaurants (both are good) and walked back to the highway to catch a taxi.  What a great day!!!!

558311506.name: Best Beach in the Area and Never Over Crowded!
558311506.author: a TripAdvisor user
558311506.reviewBody: What a nice piece of paradise with two great restaurants right at the beach. A great place to walk,relax  or have a nice lunch.

557382450.name: Lovely morning at the beach and at Los Gueros restaurant (which I can\'t find to give a great review)
557382450.author: a TripAdvisor user
557382450.reviewBody: We took a cab from our all-inclusive early Sunday and arrived by 9:30.  We grabbed a front seat at Los Gueros restaurant (to the left upon entering the beach) and had freshed squeezed OJ  and watched some morning surfers.  We spent time walking the unspoiled beach.  It got busier later in the day but the beach was long enough that it never felt crowded.  We had lunch there.  The fish burgers were outstanding.  The people next to us seemed to be having an orgasmic reaction to the banana bread.  The beach is lovely and the restaurant is a great place to take in  the view.  If you want to hang on the beach, bring an umbrella -there is no shade.  You can walk aways down and hang out at the estuary if you prefer that to the beach.

557002913.name: Mud bath
557002913.author: a TripAdvisor user
557002913.reviewBody: The beach is beautiful and different. The mud bath is a great experience and leaves your skin feeling great the next day\ud83d\ude0a thank you to the ladies who do the mud baths! Little restaurant has nice and cold cervezas. We will be back!

556976251.name: Worth it!
556976251.author: a TripAdvisor user
556976251.reviewBody: Beautiful clean beach with the nicest sand. Unfortunately the day we went the ocean currents were too dangerous so we couldn\u2019t rent surfboards from the local shop so we walked the beach down to where the river meets the ocean. Water and sand shimmer like gold. Had fun wading out in the waves - the price was a pair of black men\u2019s sunglasses lol. It was a great way to spend a few hours and the little massage shop gives a nice massage.

556716259.name: Day trip
556716259.author: a TripAdvisor user
556716259.reviewBody: This beach is breath taking!  It has a couple places to eat and perfect sand to walk in!  Stay for a while, it will be worth it!

556200545.name: clean, beautiful and secluded
556200545.author: a TripAdvisor user
556200545.reviewBody: best beach in area, hands down. You can walk for miles, watch the surf, walk to the river, swim in the fresh mountain water of lay on the beach, but you may only see a couple other people the entire day

555113658.name: Nice place for the afternoon
555113658.author: a TripAdvisor user
555113658.reviewBody: We went here for the afternoon, had a good lunch and nice walk on the beach. We also stopped by the surf shop to discuss surfing on our upcoming return trip in march

553228455.name: Amazing!
553228455.author: a TripAdvisor user
553228455.reviewBody: The scenery is just amazing!!! The Sierra Mountains in the background, empty beach, beautiful waves and rocks in the water, mud bath creek, we didn\u2019t need anything else. There is a little restaurant at the entrance of the beach which seems nice, and a surf rental store, 25$ an hour I was told... Careful with the manta ray, my husband walked on one while going further in the ocean for the bigger waves, and was stinged. Nothing dramatic, just hurt for a couple hours and it apprently never happens... Worth the detour!

552712320.name: Amazing beach!!!
552712320.author: a TripAdvisor user
552712320.reviewBody: La Bocana is a great trip while in Huatulco. It costs 70 pesos by cab and feels like a world away from the busy beaches \u201cdowntown\u201d. There are waves, surfing, and endless beach. When we arrived at 10am we were the second umbrella, by mid day it had gotten busy with 10 umbrellas. Our young children played in the waves and we enjoyed lunch and beers at one (of the two) restaurants. You can rent surf boards here and the surf season is from April through October.

551859584.name: Surfing, strolling, swimming at the most beautiful beach in Oaxaca!
551859584.author: a TripAdvisor user
551859584.reviewBody: Getting to La Bocana is just a short cab ride from Santa Cruz, and prices for cabs are fixed so 100 pesos each way.  There is a surf rental shop and lessons are $750 Mex per person.  La Bocana does not have big surf, we saw swells from 0.5 to about 1.1m on the day we were there, and you can check the surf report for conditions and forecast before you go.  For learning, this has to be one of the best places in the world.  The beaches at Kona, Hawaii were either way to advanced or way too tame. At La Bocana, you can learn to surf without spending 10 minutes waiting for a good wave.  The beach has good waves every few seconds!  Food and drinks are available , but there is not much for shelter from the sun outside of the restaurant. Bring an umbrella if you want to walk along the beach and you will!! It seems to extend for 5 km or more!! We were told to book a taxi for our return trip, and that might have been necessary at another time, but during peak season, we had no trouble flagging down a taxi that had just dropped another party off.

551859165.name: Worth doing
551859165.author: a TripAdvisor user
551859165.reviewBody: We returned for another mud bath when we came back to La Bocanna. It was one hundred peso, 6.50 CAD. Your skin is smooth and soft after. It\u2019s a cooling experience that you wil want to experience. I\u2019m sure we will go back before we leave too! Do wear an older bathing suit,

551832372.name: Definite return on our next trip to Huatulco
551832372.author: a TripAdvisor user
551832372.reviewBody:
Found this beach with some new friends on our last day of vacation.  Our kids loved it as you can walk out a long ways and still only be in waist high water. Our kids are normally a little skittish in the ocean but they LOVED it here.  They body surfed all afternoon!

While we were waiting for a taxi, our son and his new friend joined in a Mexican soccer game on the beach. There were people of all ages playing and welcomed my son and friend with open arms.

The home made fries at the restaurant were delicious as was the pina colada.  You can also get a bucket of beer with ice for the beach!

Fantastic beach, will go back many times in the future!

551478783.name: Lovely in every aspect
551478783.author: a TripAdvisor user
551478783.reviewBody: Sand goes forever along the shoreline and looking around, nature is present in all directions including stingrays beneath the water. Even with the wind, it felt very hot standing on the beach but if you come prepared, the scenery is incredible. No hesitation in wanting to help the businesses located at Playa La Bocana.

551032833.name: Bonita!!!
551032833.author: a TripAdvisor user
551032833.reviewBody: I love any beach ,this place is my heaven. A short walk from secrets and my breath is taken away! This year we did the mud cleansing which I would recommend. Truly amazing

550536227.name: Playa Bocana
550536227.author: a TripAdvisor user
550536227.reviewBody: Nice little surfing beach and a great place to get a mud bath.  Mud bath is 100 pesos and consists of an application of mud, a period to let it dry followed by a quick rub down to get some of the dust off and then into the ocean to wash it off.  Nice sandy bottom and great place to relax.  No shade areas bu there are a couple of restaurants just a the beach that are shaded.  Whe; the tide is out, you can actually walk along the cliffs to the huge beach in front of Rio Copalita.

549366430.name: Beautiful beach
549366430.author: a TripAdvisor user
549366430.reviewBody: This beach and restaurants are located 30 minute walk time from Secrets. Great views and a very quint Mexican area.

548915015.name: Bocana Surf School and Restaraunt
548915015.author: a TripAdvisor user
548915015.reviewBody:
Took a detour of highway 200 on a rented scooter looking for a spot to surf(5 star, 4’ swell had blown in for a couple of days).
It’s a gorgeous little spot with a rocky point break. Cristhian and his family run a little beach side restaurant and surf rental spot. They are great people and speak really good English. I am not a good surfer but was surprised to find I had the waves to myself. Boards that Cristian rents are in great shape and it appears that he has a dozen or more. 
Rentals are reasonable...remember everyone has to make a living, if you try to cut the rate something has to give!!
My wife and I had fish tacos and guacamole at the restaurant with beautiful views across the waves, rocks and down a 3-5km beach.
When tide is low we walked to the Copilita river and watched fishermen do their thing. After watching a couple of fishers swim across the river I did so also, if the river is high I would expect caution especially if there were large breakers.
You can also wade across the crystal clear lagoon.
Remember that as I describe the river/ocean beach/tide today could be completely different on your visit as storms rearranged all sands regularly.
Point is the family that run the surf shop/restaurant on the right side of the (facing the ocean)run a great little spot and deserve your business.

548877060.name: Bird Watching & Surfing
548877060.author: a TripAdvisor user
548877060.reviewBody: This beach was one of the few where I did not swim as it was rough. However did see surfers during the day practicing. As for bird watching it was interesting as one can see a variety of birds in the morning. As the beach is near the archaeological of Copalita a day could be spent touring Copalita and then hitting the surf afterwards.

547936037.name: Stunning natural beach!
547936037.author: a TripAdvisor user
547936037.reviewBody: This is probably the most beautiful natural beach in the whole Huatulco area.  A few years ago this beach entry had been damaged by storms, but it has been cleaned up really nicely and now has easy access to this stunning beach.  You can walk for about a kilometer on soft hard packed sand and play in the surf, with limited undertow (just be cautious not to venture to far into the heavy surf if you are not used to it).  Afterwards, enjoy a cold beer or some freshly prepared food at one of the beachside restaurants. This is a great half-day outing.

546666786.name: scenic spot
546666786.author: a TripAdvisor user
546666786.reviewBody: This beach is a short cab ride away to a quiet little town with a couple of restaurants viewing the waves. The beach is flat and easy to walk on , many rocky outcroppings make for good photos. While sitting on the rocks or in the restaurants you can watch the pelicans diving for fish, most times with success .\nThere is a surf shop, not open when we were here. As to surfing , the waves are not too big, more of a beginner level.\nThere is a small shack acting as the corner store with basics, a massage lady, 10 peso showers, and of course the mud bath at the back of la  Bocana restaurant.. It seems to be a town planned for greater development but forgotten on the way.

543703104.name: This Is What You`re Looking For
543703104.author: a TripAdvisor user
543703104.reviewBody:
This is it. A long unspoiled beach, with mountain scenery and almost nobody on it.
We went twice, on a Monday and Tuesday in November and saw maybe a dozen tourists and a handful of local fisherman, on a beach that has to be 1lm long. It`s not the best for swimming; its shallow for a long way out until the drop off and there are always wave. But that makes it great for wading in the surf and boogie boarding. The waves in November are too small for serious surfing but that changes later in the year.
A taxi from Santa Cruz is 75 pesos (regulated price). If you know how long you`ll be it`s good to arrange a pick up time. Otherwise they can call you a taxi from one of the two restaurants at the entrance to the beach - the drivers will ask for 100 pesos, we were able to dicker them down some. 

East of the small main beach, towards the Copalita River is a rocky outcrop. During high tide (around 3-4PM when we were there) you have to scramble over it (easy with water shoes) or carefully make your way around it in the surf, in order to access the long beach towards the river. It looks daunting but the fisherman stand right in the water near the rocks, working their nets. East of where the river flows into the ocean, there's yet another beach that goes to the rocky point. We were warned against trying to cross at the river mouth because of strong currents. But a ways inland there`s a lagoon where we saw people crossing without problems.

There`s no natural shade so bring beach umbrellas or (at a minimum) wide brimmed hats. In retrospect I`d bring beach chairs of some kind because the price you pay for this beautiful beach is sand flies (AKA no-see-ums). Insect repellant is a must, as is sun screen

542329579.name: Paradise on Earth
542329579.author: a TripAdvisor user
542329579.reviewBody: One of the most Beautiful Beaches I have ever the pleasure walking on . Consult the tide charts to know the optimal time to come when you visit. There is a large formation of rocks that don\'t allow passage to the River but if you go at Low tide and take the time to walk to the River Your life will never be the same. It is the closest to Paradise I have ever seen. Just Breathtaking an Absolute Must for any trip to Huatulco. Try out the Mud ladies if you want they are part of this Beach !

540433468.name: Surfing there but can be a challenge
540433468.author: a TripAdvisor user
540433468.reviewBody:
My wife and I just returned from Huatulco. We rented a scooter to explore the area (recommended if you are confident on a scooter/motorcycle) and we discovered La Bocana. The day we arrived we didn't have time to do much more than explore and admire it. We liked the look of the surf waves though so we made a date to return a few days later.
There is a small surf shop at the end of the road. I don't surf as much as I would like so I stuck to a longboard. My wife used a boogie board without fins. The price for an hour wasn't unreasonable, but a comment by the operator suggested that I might have been able to dicker a bit.
I wasn't bothered though... was there to have fun.
Unfortunately, the second time we returned storms out at sea produced some truly chaotic conditions. There was a very strong rip current to the west and the rocks at that end of the beach. After each run in, it was easier to get out of the water and walk back a bit along the beach.
Separately, there was a strong undertow as well.
I had planned to rent the board for a couple of hours, but after just one hour I was so beat that we came in and went for a beer at the nearby taverna.
Under these conditions I wouldn't recommend getting too far in the water if you have no experience with it.
That all said, we had a great time and would highly recommend it as an outing.

529544471.name: IF YOU THRIVE ON NEW EXPERIENCES, AND ENJOY PARADISE...NEED I SAY MORE?
529544471.author: a TripAdvisor user
529544471.reviewBody: La Bocana is an experience in itself!!  The mud bath is so much fun...and for a very reasonable price!!!!!  That is the first and last thing we do when we are in Huatulco (we go every year).  We\'ve done it so many times, we have had the pleasure of meeting and getting to know the entire family at our favorite spot.  We sit in their restaurant (on the sea wall) watching amazing things.  From time to time, local fishermen (with huge nets) walk out into the ocean and pull in hundreds of sparkling fish and gather them.  When the tide is high, the surfers are from as far away as Australia are at that very spot...it\'s so great to watch.  A cold one, great people, amazing scenery, fresh authentic food and the best weather keep us going back.

501317082.name: Playa La Bocana is closed due to storm
501317082.author: a TripAdvisor user
501317082.reviewBody:
We returned to playa la bocana to check out the surf shop /school and to get another mud treatment.

The first clue that there was a problem was the fact that the more direct road ( through tangolunda) was washed out. We had to turn around and back track via route 200.

When we reached playa la bocana we were surprised to see that the beach was closed. It was covered by logs which had washed up during the big storm about three weeks ago.

There was a man with a chain saw at work but it looks like it will be a while until the beach is operational.

469474193.name: Loved the Mud Bath!
469474193.author: a TripAdvisor user
469474193.reviewBody: We had the mud bath and loved the experience!\nIt made our skin feel so soft and it was so amusing seeing each other covered in mud!

468428826.name: Playa Bocana
468428826.author: a TripAdvisor user
468428826.reviewBody: Small town a few miles past Secrets Resort.  Relatively short cab ride.  Surfing beach but also great for getting a mud bath.  Ladies will rub you down with mud and you then let it dry in the sun.  They then rub off the excess.  Kind of like sanding after you have put the dry wall mud on.  You then jump into the surf to wash the mud off.  Cost is about 100 pesos per person.  Lots of fun.\nAlso a nice bar right on the beach to enjoy.

468183769.name: Great little place
468183769.author: a TripAdvisor user
468183769.reviewBody: A very nice little village with some character.  This is where you go for the "mud bath".  Sadly, the village is getting to have less and less.  The little area where Vendors sold their products is abandoned with not one hut selling anything.

463621048.name: Great day
463621048.author: a TripAdvisor user
463621048.reviewBody: Mud bath was awesome....great view,wish we could of walk the beach but  nature changed the landscape, we will be back though.

463602856.name: Changing
463602856.author: a TripAdvisor user
463602856.reviewBody: Was a beautiful beach years agk. Tides changing and water not thd same. Stored closing. Gresf fish burgers.

460424995.name: Quiet beautiful views.
460424995.author: a TripAdvisor user
460424995.reviewBody: We climbed the rocks over to the long beach. Tide was high so no other way. Quiet only a few kids surfing and local fisherman .Hard walking so make sure you wear water shoes.Sand gets hot and we were there in the morning. Loved the remote part of it. Instead of going back over the rocks again we walked the beach and crossed the river took a path that the locals on the motorcycle used. It was a long way out to the road.  We got to see a flock of green parrots,hummingbirds, lots of butterflies, horses . Seen a local women doing her laundry in the river .Crossed the swift moving  river to a road that took us up to the main highway. Flagged down a cab he turned around after picking up a local family.In total there was 2 kids,6 adults so thankful for the ride back to Playa La Bocana it was getting hot .People are so helpful and friendly in the Huatulco area. Loved the adventure really got to see the real Mexico and it\'s people.

460056945.name: awesome eats here
460056945.author: a TripAdvisor user
460056945.reviewBody: This is a quiet beach with a few boogie board worthy waves. The little places to eat are excellent and super easy on the budget. The kids can play while you watch them with a cold beverage and a great meal.

458351697.name: Isolated beach with nice views
458351697.author: a TripAdvisor user
458351697.reviewBody: A friend and I walked from the Secrets property just to see another area of Huatulco. Famous for their mud baths (we didn\'t partake) and it looks like they\'re about to build a resort here. Right now nothing but a couple of small hotels and restaurants. Known for being a surfing beach (in season) it\'s definitely worth a look.

455923726.name: mud bath
455923726.author: a TripAdvisor user
