455923726.reviewBody: We went to La Bocana for the Mud Bath. Wear an old bathing suit. So much fun. Very reasonable cab ride fro Las Brisas hotel

454972723.name: Playa La Bocana
454972723.author: a TripAdvisor user
454972723.reviewBody: the water has come up to far and you can no longer walk the beach, We did have a\ngreat meal on the beach when we were there,

454080160.name: Wild waves, excellent for watching birds
454080160.author: a TripAdvisor user
454080160.reviewBody: There is a restaurant there, to the left, that makes awesome fish buyers, and home made fries. and you can see the beach where ever you sit there

450828230.name: Bocana Surf
450828230.author: a TripAdvisor user
450828230.reviewBody: Little bit of rocks to climb with the surfboard but a nice adventure.\nIn December nice lefts and rights 4 to 5. Surf shop there for rentals. Just bargain your daily price.Food also there.

444539089.name: Love La Bocana
444539089.author: a TripAdvisor user
444539089.reviewBody: Always a fun time at Bocana beach.  It is a 5-10 minute cab ride from the resort hotels.  The sand here gets super hot so be warned!  You can rent surf boards or boogie boards as the waves are quite rough here - but fun!  You can also rent an umbrella and chairs as well.  The walk along the beach is very beautiful for some great photo ops and the river meets the ocean here.  You can get a mud bathe as well at La Bocana.  \n\nThere are a couple of restaurants/bars here which we have tried and all have been very good.

443247448.name: Perfect calm paradise
443247448.author: a TripAdvisor user
443247448.reviewBody: The place is great, looks like a dream, the beach is not very good for casual swimming as the waves were very strong, perfect for surfing or simply relaxing, no harassing.

428792578.name: LOVE LA BOCANA
428792578.author: a TripAdvisor user
428792578.reviewBody: this is by far my favorite beach of the many beaches in Huatulco.  it has amazing sand, rock walls and rocks in the water.  surfers and fisherman and a few cool little restaurants on the beach.  there is even a lagoon if you walk left along the rock wall.  the water is not for swimming of the beach, therefore the lagoon is a nice place to do so and you can get out of the sun for a bit if you need too, by the rock wall.  amaaaaazing!!!!  about 60 pesos each way.  dog friendly.

427235609.name: Best surf spot
427235609.author: a TripAdvisor user
427235609.reviewBody: Playa La Bocana is nestled in a small fishing village.  I\'m not a surfer; however locals say it is one of the best surfing beaches in the world!

368550817.name: Quiet, peaceful.
368550817.author: a TripAdvisor user
368550817.reviewBody: We went in the morning and nobody was there. Very beautiful place where a small river is coming to the ocean. Quiet, a green jungle on the river, a lot of birds.

368204204.name: Our favourite beach
368204204.author: a TripAdvisor user
368204204.reviewBody: This was such a pleasure to spend time at! Even just the drive in on the cobblestone road to the sight of the beautiful waves crashing. We walked the beach and saw wild horses. Watched body surfers. Ate a gorgeous seafood meal at the little restaurant there (called La Bocana also I think? On the right on your drive in). We went twice on our trip and told others who also were not disappointed. Deserted, relaxing, and what we consider to be a true Mexico experience (away from resorts, etc). Hopefully it stays that way!

366743915.name: Deserted paradise!
366743915.author: a TripAdvisor user
366743915.reviewBody: Cute little surf-type spot with 2 restaurants, a few little rental villas and a surf shop. Waves were not good for surfing when we were there (too rough!) but it was a beautiful spot to grab a drink and go for a walk on the beach

366438534.name: A hidden gem.  Where is everyone?
366438534.author: a TripAdvisor user
366438534.reviewBody: Great place for boogie boarding.  We took a short cab ride from Dreams and had an afternoon of fun on the beach, hitting the waves hard (or did they hit us hard?).  Enjoy a mud bath and the beer.  Please remember to tip the people working.  It\'s a great story on how they started and I was happy to meet some great people.

366083884.name: Like a walk on the beach in the movies
366083884.author: a TripAdvisor user
366083884.reviewBody: This beach is beyond gorgeous, with its constanly crashing waves and beautiful black sand swirled in with the regular sand.  The stones that have washed ashore make a fun thing to collect for kids, or as souveniers.

363472237.name: A Must Visit
363472237.author: a TripAdvisor user
363472237.reviewBody: If you are looking to get away from the crowds and walk down a beautiful, almost deserted beach watching the waves crash in from the Pacific, this is for you! The view is stunning as you walk to the mouth of the Copalita River. Upstream from the mouth, you can lay in its refreshing water as its current running over you feels like a jacuzzi. You can swim in the ocean in front of the restaurants but check with restaurant staff first to ensure there is no rip tide. When you are finished with your walk, have a beer or two soaking in the incredible scenery. If this sounds like travel bochure it\'s because this quiet beach is magical. From Huatulco the taxi is 75 pesos and restaurant staff will call a return taxi for you or you can arrange a pick up with your drop-off driver.

361339141.name: Surfers destination
361339141.author: a TripAdvisor user
361339141.reviewBody:
This beach is very rustic and out of the way.  You would drive right by the road that takes you down the cobblestone road to this beach. 

It is a very long and wide beach and has excellent waves for anyone who likes to surf,SUP and boogie boarding. 

There are 2 places to eat and get drinks a the bottom of the hill. We didn't eat this time, just had lots of cheap beer. 

This beach is so different than any of the other Huatulco beaches and it is a must see.

359159024.name: Beautiful very quiet beach with great waves and surf board rentals!
359159024.author: a TripAdvisor user
359159024.reviewBody: Great beach for wave action for body surfing or you can rent boards from the beach shop. Not for the surf expert but family fun. Restaurants on left (if facing beach) offers fantastic homecut french fries with vinegar or ketchup sides for those missing standard fare. You can use their bathroom with purchase otherwise bathroom available has 10 peso charge. No beach chairs or shade so bring your own. At low tide you can walk the beach around the corner to some fantastic  rock formations and  photo ops. In the other direction in walking distance  is an outlet for a fresh water river with what is said to be mud with healing powers. Just a great authentic spot with out too many touristas!

359067884.name: Mud baths
359067884.author: a TripAdvisor user
359067884.reviewBody: Come to this beach for the experience of a mud bath. There is a river close by that feeds into the ocean. Locals will gather mud from there and will offer to lather you down with it. You may wash off in the ocean or they have a fresh water shower close by. Good for your skin. Also, a fun picture to share.

357910662.name: Nice long beach to walk
357910662.author: a TripAdvisor user
357910662.reviewBody: Dramatic rock formations at the mouth of the Copalita river and high waves pound them into beautiful sculptures.  Beach was clean and nice to walk on.  There are only two restaurants here and a couple shops that were not open when we visited.  restaurants are fair and service was same.

356431562.name: Mudbath
356431562.author: a TripAdvisor user
356431562.reviewBody: Wonderful mud Bath! Highly recommend. We stayed at Secrets, but took a taxi down. After bath, had a few beers at one of the restaurants. When ready to leave, restaurant called a taxi. Not a long wait at all!

354691228.name: Quaint and beautiful
354691228.author: a TripAdvisor user
354691228.reviewBody: This beach had really hot sand when we went but once you get into the water, it\'s a lot of fun. The waves were strong, so my efforts to try out surfing faded pretty quickly because of the undertow. You can rent boards without lessons, but if you do want lessons, I\'m not sure if they offer any. I imagine they do but we didn\'t look in to it. There are a couple of restaurants around, so you can feel free to grab a drink at one of them  and enjoy the view.

353565877.name: Where some bug spray
353565877.author: a TripAdvisor user
353565877.reviewBody: Its a short walk, but recommend it for the morning since the sand gets so hot. Also wear some bug spray since you have to walk a path that has plenty of bugs.

353118559.name: HOT HOT HOT .. Fabulous mud bath
353118559.author: a TripAdvisor user
353118559.reviewBody: very hot here because of the volcanic ash in the sand... makes beach walking difficult ... very rocky and ruff sea... \nthe mud baths are FABULOUS... make sure to tell your cab driver to return to pick you up or you will have a heck of a time getting one ... if you go first thing in the day ...4 hours is usually enuff... IT GETS HOT!!!!!! excellent food and cold drinks at the canteenas on the beach ... deliscious fishburger and fries...

352193926.name: Beautiful beach...
352193926.author: a TripAdvisor user
352193926.reviewBody: ....seemed inhabited by surfers....quite rocky so quite dramatic.  Only 2 restos so pretty laid back....I\'d go back.

351538302.name: Beautiful
351538302.author: a TripAdvisor user
351538302.reviewBody: Beautiful beach. Not much traffic there but what a beach! The little restaurant on the right as you face the beach is great. It is owned by three sisters and their brother. Very friendly and cheap prices. Try a mud bath while your there, you will love it.

350835373.name: Hands Down Favourite Beach
350835373.author: a TripAdvisor user
350835373.reviewBody: We love, love, love this beach.  I hesitate to even review it because we hope it stays quiet...  It\'s a great place to go and watch the surfers, have a cold beer and snacks under the palapas.  The fish burger is amazing - don\'t know the name of the place but it\'s the restaurant right beside Villa Escondida.  It\'s fun to take a walk down to the Copalita River - however beware of tides coming and going...  We got caught at high tide coming back on our first visit here and it was not a pleasant experience trying to scramble over the rocks without getting slammed with waves.  We learned the hard way...  I also had a mud bath - do it! - awesome experience and your skin feels like a baby\'s when finished!  Don\'t miss this beach - great spot - our very favourite beach in Huatulco!

350276860.name: beautiful uncrowded beach with good (but strong) boogie boarding waves
350276860.author: a TripAdvisor user
350276860.reviewBody: beautiful, pristine.  a welcome respite from the developed resorts.  the restaurant right on the beach was terrific.  playing and boogie boarding in the waves was a lot of fun (but only for strong swimmers and experienced boogie boarders as the waves are very strong)

348844053.name: Natural Mexico
348844053.author: a TripAdvisor user
348844053.reviewBody: This is the beach for anyone who wants to escape the commercialism and crowds of the other hotel-lined beaches. For a short taxi ride, you can experience a pristine stretch of coastline.  We paid 50 pesos for a half-day rental of two chairs and an umbrella on the beach. We wondered about security at leaving our stuff behind while we walked along the beach but other people kept an eye on our stuff. We also could have left it at one of the two restaurants where we would later return for lunch. The white sandy beach is hot to walk along and we were glad to have our water shoes. A highlight for us was cooling off in the clean fresh water lake that is behind a sand dune and very close to the shore. You might easily miss it if you stay too close to the water\'s edge. This beach is a destination for surfers but it was not so rough that we felt uncomfortable bobbing in the waves. We finished off with a crispy fresh fish sandwich and cold beer. This had been our second trip to Playa La Bocana during this holiday and I hope we can visit there at least one more time.

348550221.name: Beautiful beach
348550221.author: a TripAdvisor user
348550221.reviewBody: Very quiet beautiful beach. Service at the restaurant was great. Had a mud massage that was awesome. Sand super hot have to wear shoes for sure. It\'s a surf beach so not really for swimming. But a relaxing day.

345280631.name: Love the vibe
345280631.author: a TripAdvisor user
345280631.reviewBody: Took a walk down here from Secrets and I just love the vibe this place gives off. The walk along the beach is very picturesque and any people I came across were so nice. It\'s so relaxing here

344527438.name: simply the best kept secret
344527438.author: a TripAdvisor user
344527438.reviewBody: We have traveled to Huatulco for 4 years now and have made some very good friends at La BoCana  The little restaurant and bar on the right hand side as you enter the village, right next to the beach, is family owned. There food is wonderful and the view is spectacular. A Sting Ray came right up onto the beach so look out! It is primitive and very much a place that locals go, and totally safe! If you stop into this little place, be sure and ask for a mud bath! My friend, Alex, who you will adore, along with his little brother, Diego, are the best. His family owns it and his mother and aunt do the mud baths. The cost for a once in a life time experience that leaves your skin feeling amazing is.... $10. Yes, $10  Go, you wont regret it, any cabby will take you... and tell them Jodi and Randy sent you!

341503195.name: Stunning quiet beach and beautiful bird sanctuary
341503195.author: a TripAdvisor user
341503195.reviewBody: This beach is simply mind blowing. Incredibly beautiful with stunning rock formations. It\'s where the copalita river meets the ocean and is a great place to observe birds. Good waves if you want to surf, and the small restaurant \'\'La Bocana\'\' restaurant is a little hidden gem of flavours and freshness.

336987084.name: Awesome walking beach with big waves.
336987084.author: a TripAdvisor user
336987084.reviewBody: We have now been to Huatulco 4 times and visit here every time. You can actually rent and take surf lessons here. This beach never seems to be crowded as it is a well kept secret. There is no protection from the sun so take your own shade. The Copilita River flows from the Sierra Madres into the ocean here. You have both fresh water and salt water making it a bird sanctuary at the mouth of the river. What a great place to see everything from Egrets to Vultures. A River Raft trip is available from the small local town of Copilita to this beach (bookable at your resort). Its duration is approximately 2 hours and well worth the cost. We had a guide named Manuel Gonzales whose grandfather was a tribal shaman. His knowledge of the flora and fauna was tremendous as was his willingness to share. We had a mud bath applied by the local healer that left the skin unmistakably softer. Rest room facilities are limited so bring your hand sanitizer, wet ones and tissues.

334529835.name: Ocean meets the River
334529835.author: a TripAdvisor user
334529835.reviewBody: This is one beautiful and long beach.  With dark said with gold flex in places.  Be sure to wear your flip flops as the sand get extremely HOT!  Lovely rock formations, great surfing or jumping the waves...and great clay body rubs!  This is a MUST when you go to La Bocana,

331894111.name: Tried our hand at surfing!
331894111.author: a TripAdvisor user
331894111.reviewBody: The waves were too short this day to get up (wink wink) but there is a great little beach restaurant with good food and cold beer and surf and boogie boards to rent,

329364482.name: Nice to watch surfers
329364482.author: a TripAdvisor user
329364482.reviewBody: It was a nice beach to watch surfers. I wouldn\'t swim here. The river was interesting as well. The mud baths looked fabulous.

327609609.name: Surfing in Bocana
327609609.author: a TripAdvisor user
327609609.reviewBody: Amazing experience. The surf instructor at Bocana Surf Shop (on the right hand side) Spoke Great English, Spanish, French and German. Felt extremely safe and well taken care of. They are not pushy for your business, but want you to enjoy your day. \nWaves were great to learn on, and range in difficultly. Cristian, the owner was a pro-surfer so he knows what he is talking about.

320733950.name: Wild beach, huge waves (secret surf spot)
320733950.author: a TripAdvisor user
320733950.reviewBody:
This beach stretches for a long distance.  The little village has a few restaurants and small hotels, but is very undeveloped.  

The beach is gorgeous, but there is little by way of palapas or beach umbrellas - it's a "wild" beach and mostly deserted, save for the few surfers who know about this spot.

There is a freshwater lake that connects to the ocean, where birds congregate.

283116575.name: IDK
283116575.author: a TripAdvisor user
283116575.reviewBody: We walked down there from our hotel. There were no waves so nothing was happening. There was maybe 6 people total at the whole beach. Had a beer and left. It was very pretty, just a bit boring.

282932578.name: Stunning vista!
282932578.author: a TripAdvisor user
282932578.reviewBody:
Wow!

Totally unique.

I loved it so much I went back a second time in a week.

First visit a storm blew in just as I arrived, so I sat and had an AMAZING lunch at La Bocana Restaurant. 
Very cool to sit there and watch the storm while eating a delicious lunch.

I went back on a sunny day and got a mud bath by a local lady, which was also incredibly cool and authentic experience.
After I showered, I  took a walk down the beach until I reached the river.
What stunning views!
Expeience was that much more interesting because there wasnt another soul on the entire beach!
Something about it reminded me of the last scene in the original "Planet of the Apes"

I got a good work out in because I found the sand hard to walk on as it was very  hot or if it was wet, it was like quick sand.
Worth the struggle though because of the unique beauty of the place.
I got to the river and there were some kids and a dog playing. I had a rest before my walk back.
I returned to La Bocana restaurant and enjoyed a second lunch there. Again very enjoyable - great food and service!!

Must visit!

282692259.name: Incredebile sunrise view!
282692259.author: a TripAdvisor user
282692259.reviewBody: Local beach that has about two - four restaurants.  Worth visiting in the morning for the amazing sunrise and for an early morning walk.

278594541.name: Not for swimming
278594541.author: a TripAdvisor user
278594541.reviewBody: But great beach walking.  I don\'t remember the place we sat at, but on the right.  Spectacular guacamole, pick de gallo, black beans and salsa verde.  Watched families fish all day.  Or taxi driver\'s pick when we chose not to pay high price for resort chairs on Tangalunda.  Skip that beach

269151441.name: Morning bird-watching stroll..
269151441.author: a TripAdvisor user
269151441.reviewBody: We walked from Secrets to the village of Playa La Bocana one morning after breakfast to try to get some pictures of interesting birds along the route.  Think took us 20 minutes or so.  We walked on a nice sidewalk along the main roadway out front.  Not much to see along the way.. and didn\'t end up seeing any interesting birds - may have been wrong time of day for though.  Village is very small.  One road leading into and onto beach.  Beach is long and large, and attracts some surfers when waves are good for.  Appears to be 2 small beachside restaurants across from one another. We grabbed a beer and a soda from the 1 on the right side facing the beach. Very nice young gal there speaks fluent english.  There are 2 beachside rental villas. One is called Villa Escondido, I remembered it being featured on an episode of HGTV\'s house hunters.  Doesn\'t seem to be much to see or do here, other than a sleepy little beach village.  Beach itself is interesting and a nice walk if at low tide. Sand is much finer than Conejos Bay and much darker due to what I believe is mud mixed in from nearby rivers which flow into this area.   Was a nice am stroll, but don\'t think I\'d rush back anytime soon.

267757454.name: Nice long beach to take a stroll on!
267757454.author: a TripAdvisor user
267757454.reviewBody: Hubby & I took a cab to Playa La Bocana...he was hoping to surf...Well the waves weren\'t very good for surfing so we took a long stroll down the beach. You can cross the river..but pay attention to the tide heights as some areas are a little deeper. Strolled all the way to the end of the beach & saw lots of different animals tracks along the way. Not too many shells to collect ....but a quite a few rocks...but still ok for walking. The waves are hugh..so not a very safe beach for swimming. Did get to see the rafters coming to the end of their rafting trip ..looked like a nice trip to take. There are also some ladies that will give you a mud massage, but opted not to do that. Did eat at the grill that is at the beginning of town....good food.

262764538.name: MUST DO TRADITIONAL MUD BATH FROM LA BOCANA  WOMENS CO-OP
262764538.author: a TripAdvisor user
262764538.reviewBody: Admit I was a bit skeptical when I heard about the mud bath/wraps offered by the women\'s co-op at La Bocana, 5 min by cab from the Huatulco resort area, or a 15 minute walk.  The beach at La Bocana is truly one of the most beautiful in the world, bar none!  The money spent, a mere $10 US goes directly to the women\'s co-op, with the tip, if you wish, to the service provider. What a wonderful opportunity to have the real deal authentic experience knowing the small amount you have paid goes directly to the service provider, rather than a large conglomerate, while the staff live in basic poverty.  There truly is something in the mud that not only softens your skin but helps increases circulation throughout your body.  I opted for the traditional method of rinsing in the river (actually the overflow from the ocean) which proved to be crystal clear calm waters.  The service is available to men and women and is the choice of the locals in the know!  Go before noon to avoid the mid-day sun (and hot sand) and be sure to bring your towel.  Spring for a light lunch at one of the outdoor cafes lining the beach (delicious and safe) and of course the liquid refreshment of your choice!  After all is said and done, the shopping and restaurants seem to blend into each other, but the mud wrap at La Bocana Beach will remain in your memory as an authentic non-commercialized Mexican experience.  Hola!

262189243.name: Incredibly beautiful
262189243.author: a TripAdvisor user
262189243.reviewBody:
Took a cab from our hotel in Santa Cruz 70 pesos . We asked him to come back at a designated time and he was happy to do so and on time . 
We were awestruck at the beauty of this area. The crashing waves , huge rocks that have been worn away by the surf, mountains in the background beyond the river , no crowds at all . It was one of our best days . We walked ,explored and played in the surf for a couple of hours then we went and a couple of drinks and some lunch. When facing the water the restaurant we went to was on the left. I had the most 

delicious grapefruit margarita , so refreshing ! Then we had the fish burger , so crunchy and tasty with a delicious chipolte mayo . The fries here are the best, you have to order them !! 
The area is just gorgeous , untouched natural beauty . No crowds at all. Would recommend this beach 110% .

262185952.name: Boogey Boarding
262185952.author: a TripAdvisor user
262185952.reviewBody: We went to this beach for boogey boarding and the kids had a good time.  However, we were warned when we got there that you had to stay in the right hand corner of the beach due to eddys and rip-tides, which made me nervous.  Lunch at the local restaurant was reasonable and very good.

261302076.name: great beach
261302076.author: a TripAdvisor user
261302076.reviewBody: This is a great experience if you just want to see an unspoiled beach and swim in a fantastic fresh water lagoon . Take a taxi $6  each way.

261139279.name: Well worth a visit
261139279.author: a TripAdvisor user
261139279.reviewBody: Playa La Bocana is worth a trip - the surf pounds in so swimming isn\'t the best, however, the beach itself is good for walking along - it\'s long and fairly quiet, more so the further you walk.\nLots of birdlife as the Copalita river enters the sea along this beach. Also a couple of good restaurants right on the beach with friendly people serving.

260647329.name: Excellent Inexpensive Excursion
260647329.author: a TripAdvisor user
260647329.reviewBody: We took a taxi here from our resort as an inexpensive excursion and a change of scenery. After a relatively short walk down the beach, for 100 pesos we got a lady to coat our body with mud and once it dried she massaged it off. We then went into the fresh water lake to wash the rest off of us. This was right where the river flows into the ocean and it was fun to float down the river into the ocean waves. Upon walking back up the beach we stopped at an open air cantina for a couple of cold cerveza on the balcony to watch the surfers. It was very enjoyable and a nice way to spend a few hours off of the resort without spending a lot of money.

260332217.name: A quiet deserted beach
260332217.author: a TripAdvisor user
260332217.reviewBody:
This was my favourite beach (15 minute walk from SECRETS RESORT) as it was quiet and away from any crowds. I loved the nature you see when you walk  about 10 minutes down the beach where the ocean flows into the Copalita River. This is where the ocean meets the River. you can swim in the river where it is beautifully warm and is a nature lovers paradise as many type of birds gather here to catch the fish that get washed into the river via the ocean. You can sit right next to the river and watch the birds close up. 
There are no chairs or palapas so you need to bring your own if you want to sit for a while. The ocean breeze is great here.

There are ladies at the beach area that will walk you down the beach and give you a MUD BATH and then you can wash off in the river.
The ocean is very rough here with undertowes so it is not the best place for a family to swim. Many people who want to surf or boogie board come here 
There are two small Mexican restaurants that serve basic Mexican food.
If you come by taxi get the driver to come back at a specified time to pick you up as there are not regular taxis that come out that way.

259885253.name: Great vista, good fries!
259885253.author: a TripAdvisor user
259885253.reviewBody: Hey for a great little diversion for lunch why not grab a cab from anywhere in Huatulco and zip out Bocana way and have lunch? Both places serve up good food but my choice would be the restaurant on your left as you\'re facing the bay. Best homemade french fries bar none! A nice family run place and a great place to enjoy a walk down to the river,(leave your stuff with them) and return an hour or so later and enjoy the surfers grabbing a wave while you have a cold drink and good food all at a reasonable price.

259319855.name: Surf, Swim or Enjoy the walk & view
259319855.author: a TripAdvisor user
259319855.reviewBody: This is a beach with lots of big waves, for strong swimmers only. Beach is great for anyone of any age to walk on. Go see where river meets the ocean. If you surf bring a board or boogie board. Can also take a lesson. Have a drink or something to eat and enjoy the view. People are very friendly so enjoy Mexico!

257922081.name: Massive beach
257922081.author: a TripAdvisor user
257922081.reviewBody: This is a huge beach which changes every year due to its openness to the ocean and the outlet for the Copalita River. This isn\'t a beach for poor swimmers but a fantastic place to experience. Don\'t go on a windy day - you\'ll get sand blasted.

257899883.name: Large sandy beach
257899883.author: a TripAdvisor user
257899883.reviewBody: I liked the beach, good swimming. We walked to the river and swam in the fresh (mixed) water.\nGood food at the restaurants there.

257641434.name: Old world charm
257641434.author: a TripAdvisor user
257641434.reviewBody: Old world charm with warm and friendly people.  Great beach to get pictures of people surfing.  Neat little bar to grab a beer too.

257316623.name: Great vibe at this surfer beach
257316623.author: a TripAdvisor user
257316623.reviewBody: La Bocana is east wards past the all inclusive resorts, but certainly worth a visit. It only has a couple of restaurants, but when the black sand is not washed out it is beautiful and has a great authentic feel!!

256559198.name: Surfing beach
256559198.author: a TripAdvisor user
256559198.reviewBody: We were staying at Secrets just down the road and took a quick taxi into La Bocana.  Beautiful widespread sandy beaches with great surfing waves.  Rented a surfboard for the afternoon and had  some fun on waves bigger than I expected!   Ate at a beachside cafe for lunch and then went for a mud bath right next to the beach.  They coat your entire body with special mud from the adjacent river and you let it dry for a while before showering it off in their "quaint" beachside shower stall.  Roamed the enormous beach while the tide was coming in and enjoyed seeing the swirling tidal pools as the waves swept through filling every square foot.  Had a drink at a small cantina just up from the beach then grabbed a cab back to the resort. There weren\'t very many people around when we were there and that was nice.  Would love to go back and roam the beach just for the views!

255591921.name: Refreshing!
255591921.author: a TripAdvisor user
255591921.reviewBody: Felt safe there as well. I had my 7 year old son with me and wasn\'t worried about the waves.  You could stand for quite a ways out and then boogie board in to the shore.  The sand is very hot getting down to the water so maybe wear shoes out to the water?!

250162231.name: La Bocana
250162231.author: a TripAdvisor user
250162231.reviewBody: Great for surfers, good seafood at the restaurants, and there are two exclusive rentals there for a group. Also, there is an archaeological site overlooking part of the beach that can be toured. The archaeological site is about 1/4 of a mile or less just past the entrance to La Bocana

248367256.name: great restaurant on the beach
248367256.author: a TripAdvisor user
248367256.reviewBody: had the best fish tacos here - and coldest beer on the beach. small and quaint. great day. inexpensive taxi ride ride Santa Cruz.\n

246849595.name: Surfers parDise!
246849595.author: a TripAdvisor user
246849595.reviewBody: I go to Huatulco every year. I had never ventured to Bocana until this past visit. My husband and I rented a dune buggy and drive around Huatulco before hitting Bocana. We went to a great little bar there. Had some fresh coconuts filled with rum and sat down for some lunch. The food was fresh, the atmosphere was amazing. After lunch we took a walk down the beach where there is a fresh water river that meets the ocean! What a neat experience. All of the locals hang out there and we felt like we had stumbled on an Oaxacan gem. What a beautiful place! One thing... Don\'t forget your camera!

246622054.name: cool place
246622054.author: a TripAdvisor user
246622054.reviewBody: great place, no vendors. just 2 reasturants, we went to the one on the right as you come in, the waitress was very helpful and spoke English, food was great to. walk down the beach to the river,sit down or float in the cool water, very beautiful, we saw dolphins maybe 30 yards offshore at the river

245698192.name: Beautiful birds, big waves
245698192.author: a TripAdvisor user
245698192.reviewBody: We only saw a small of handful of people when we went, many were fishing. It was great to watch the crashing waves and all the neat birds. We spent all day wandering the beach and loved every minute.

241791945.name: Scenic Surfer\'s Beach accessible by taxi
241791945.author: a TripAdvisor user
241791945.reviewBody: This beach has a beautiful surroundings and is the main surf beach. When we went it was too rough for beginners and the waves kept us out of the water. There\'s a few restaurants and bars near by the one side, but not much else.  No facilities and no lifeguard. You can get mud baths and massages though!  We walked the beach, enjoyed the scenary but then got bored and hopped the next taxi that came.

241764199.name: Beautiful, unkept, natural beach!
241764199.author: a TripAdvisor user
241764199.reviewBody: We took a cab from Tangalunda for about 60 pesos, and found a wonderful natural beach to wander down with driftwoods and cliffs as a back drop. We also asked the cabbie to come back and get us a few hours later, which he did, and right on time. If you walk south less than a 1/2 mile, the Copalita river runs into the ocean, and rafters from up river get out there to enjoy the special mud baths offered as part of their excursion. I also think you can arrange to have a mud bath at the river from the restaurant on the north of the entry road at the beach. Walking was easy, the beach was flat compared to Tangalunda bay. Locals were netting fish, or a least trying to. It was a great way to enjoy a few hours away from the resorts and hustle of the cities. 2 restaurants were open, right on the beach, and we stopped in for beverages only. Had a few ice cold beer, while waiting for our cab ride back. Certainly worth the trip!

241334282.name: Wild and Unspoiled
241334282.author: a TripAdvisor user
241334282.reviewBody: We stopped by this beautiful beach on a bike ride along the coast. My husband enjoyed a shrimp dinner at the Mexican style eatery there. Nice views and beautiful rock formations on the beach. Swimming is not recommended because of the pounding surf but a stop here is well worth it!

239071488.name: La Bocana Beach a bit of a let down
239071488.author: a TripAdvisor user
239071488.reviewBody: This beach is incredibly beautiful with the wildlife, steep hills, and river coming into the ocean creating a majestic looking, wave crashing spot that attracts local surfers and body boarders. However, a storm about a year ago has collapsed the retaining wall at the foot of the restaurants and makes it very difficult to get down to the beach itself. I believe this has hurt the few local restaurants and businesses as well in the area. I think Fonateur, the local government agency needs to get this fixed as soon as possible so locals and tourists alike can start enjoying this area again.

209277236.name: Cool spot.
209277236.author: a TripAdvisor user
209277236.reviewBody: We took a 15 minute cab ride to check out this beach for something to do. Nothing really to do but check out the view, massive waves, and natural beauty. There were a couple of surfers out but it was quiet when we went. No shops and the restaurant and bar there were closed. No cabs cruising the area so keep one waiting. The crabs on the rocks were a crazy site as well

207736439.name: Amazing beach
207736439.author: a TripAdvisor user
207736439.reviewBody: If you are looking for a quiet beach on the ocean and also be able to swim in fresh water this is your place. A river runs down from the mountains to this beach location with pools of fresh water to swim in. There are a couple of restaurants in the small village next to the beach access. Make sure you arrange for pickup as the taxi service is somewhat sporadic.  You can walk for miles on a sandy beach or just sit and watch the surfers. Nice day trip.

203737613.name: So relaxing! Had a great time swimming in the freshwater pool
203737613.author: a TripAdvisor user
203737613.reviewBody: After being disappointed by the main tourist beaches in Huatulco, we were pleasantly surprised by La Bocana. The waves are very strong and you can\'t swim there, so not many people go. This is great if you want peace and quiet. There are not any palapas or sunbeds, so take a parasol. There are a couple of restaurants at the entrance, but apart from that, there\'s nothing on the beach. It is where the river meets the ocean, which creates a great freshwater pool where you can swim. Not the most picturesque beach, but no one tries to sell you anything and it\'s great to take dogs.

201694011.name: Get the mud bath!
201694011.author: a TripAdvisor user
201694011.reviewBody: Beautiful little town! Cobblestone streets, the river flowing into the ocean, and huge waves where you can watch surfers. Get the mud bath for only $10 per person, great experience!

200949791.name: Beautiful beach
200949791.author: a TripAdvisor user
200949791.reviewBody: Staying at nearby Secrets, we took a walk to La Bocana one morning to discover a very special beach.  Arriving in the village, it looks like a narrow place between hills but as soon as the beach appears, it is huge and beautiful.  This is where you can get the Zapoteca\'s traditional mud ritual. The scenery is very special, with rock formations, a lot of birds, and surfers riding the waves and hardly anyone on the beach. A place worth a visit when visiting the Huatulco region.

200688635.name: Beach completely different than the other bays
200688635.author: a TripAdvisor user
200688635.reviewBody: This area a welcome change to all the other quiet bays.  Crazy surf to watch fisherman and surfers.  Cross the Copalita River against current and walk the length of this beach and see wild life, sea-worn rocks.  Afterwards enjoy a cool beverage and food in one of the little restaurants.

200536368.name: Surfers Beach
200536368.author: a TripAdvisor user
200536368.reviewBody: Great bay to visit for a couple of hours. You can get your mud bath here for $10.00.  You can watch the surfers or take a walk around the beach.

198377304.name: Well worth a visit
198377304.author: a TripAdvisor user
198377304.reviewBody: A $6 cab ride (one way) from the Crown Pacific. Beautiful isolated beach looks like the beach scene from Planet of the Apes. Huge rock  formations, heavy surf  lots of different birdlife. Surfers and fishermen and the odd tourist on the huge beach. Restaurants and bars in the area and of course the famous mud bath. Nice outing.

197958460.name: Boogie Board, surf, Mud Bath
197958460.author: a TripAdvisor user
197958460.reviewBody: Great place to walk a LONG beach and to boogie board or surf. The La Bocana Bar & Restaurant let us borrow their boogie boards for free since we promised to have a few drinks after. Family-run - they were so nice and helpful. The mother does mud baths (same price as the other ladies who sit on the sea wall $10). The brother and sister who work the bar/restaurant are so friendly and polite. They gave us some free snacks - and the food was great. Beers were ice cold. Highly Recommend!!!

197639358.name: Surfing Lessons
197639358.author: a TripAdvisor user
197639358.reviewBody: We stopped at Christian\'s restaurant when you are looking at the ocean, it\'s on the right.  He rented boogie boards and surf boards and arranged for a friend of his to give the kids lessonsl  Very fun!  Beautiful beach!!!

196471330.name: beach at Bocana near Huatulco
196471330.author: a TripAdvisor user
196471330.reviewBody: Beautiful beach to see. Not very swimmable unless you are an expert surfer. This is where the Copitita River flows into the ocean. Lots of sand. Get a \'mud bath\' spa treatment from the local ladies for $10...worth it. Also can buy beer and tacos, local food there. Free showers behind the restaurant to wash off the dried mud. Nice people.

196128375.name: surfing beach
196128375.author: a TripAdvisor user
196128375.reviewBody: This beach is close to the  Secrets resort- bar to enjoy some cheap beers\nParts of the buildings look like they are falling apart\n

196017206.name: Good place to Surf
196017206.author: a TripAdvisor user
196017206.reviewBody:
Bocana beach lies at the mouth of the Copalita river in Huatulco. It's a small town, with a couple of restaurants, shops, and housing. You can rent a surfboard for the day for about 750 pesos, or just enjoy the uncrowded beach. The water is pretty rough, so it's not a great place to swim, unless you take a dip in the river before it enters the ocean.

Bocana is very scenic. The beach seems to stretch for miles, and just listening to the surf crash on the beach is intoxicating. Bocana is also known for their medicinal mud treatments. For a fee, you can be coated head to toe with mud from the river, and it's said it has medicinal effects. When it comes time to wash it off, it can be a very long walk to the water, so wear a hat, or risk heat stroke, as the mud is a pretty good thermal insulator, and you'll notice it!

The beach itself suffered some negative effects from the hurricane last fall. There was significant damage to the sea wall, and a shallow lagoon has replaced the beach directly in front of the seawall, but this won't be an issue as you enjoy your day here.
Will definitely be back in 2015!

195829200.name: Surfing / Body Boarding
195829200.author: a TripAdvisor user
195829200.reviewBody: decent surf and with a couple of restaurants close to the coast. The beach is incredible here with gorgeous views and a long stretch of quiet beach with lots of crabs / birds in the area.

195677396.name: Different
195677396.author: a TripAdvisor user
195677396.reviewBody: This beach is beautiful and bit different . Wide, deserted and very strong waves, undertow - good for surfers. I wouldn\'t try to swim, since your next stop would be probably Hawaii . However - further to east side there is Copalito river going to ocean and you can find a few pocket where you can sit in the water and enjoy. There are different kinds of birds (we saw vultures) and we noticed a few rafts on the river. We also try that mud treatment - local lady mix the clay with water, put on you and after rub it off. You still have to clean it in the water the rest. Well worth it $10 . Transportation by taxi - it was $10 from our hotel (camino real) one way. There is 1-2 local restaurants where you can enjoy corona or some meal. Well worth to check it.

194274273.name: Great, quiet beach for surfing, boarding, or walking.
194274273.author: a TripAdvisor user
194274273.reviewBody: We took a taxi here from our hotel ($6US).  Once we were there, we rented a boogie board for the day (750 pesos).  We enjoyed walking on this large beach and playing in the waves.  We were there for about 2 hours and only saw about 10 people, many of whom were local fisherman.  There is also an area where you can get a therapeutic mudbath. This is a beautiful beach with a decent size surf, you should check it out.

193964960.name: Fabulous
193964960.author: a TripAdvisor user
193964960.reviewBody:
A must to see while you are in Huatulco. Only a 10 minute walk from Secrets. The small hamlet is quaint with cobblestone streets. The beach is fabulous and long. Be sure to have a mud bath, it only cost 100 MXN. You can spend a day there, rent a boogie board and an umbrella for 100 MXN from the los Guapos restaurant. The food at the Santa Clara restaurant is amazing, the coconut shrimp and fish tacos amazing. Come back in the evening for the pollo al Barro, chicken slow cooked for 4 hours in a banana leaf lined Clay pot. You can walk to the mouth of the Riu Copalita and see lots of bird life.

There is a school you will walk by near the beach. After seeing the frayed soccer ball the kids were playing with at recess, we bought a new soccer ball for them at the Super Che. Wow, were the teacher and the children ever thrilled and so thankful. But I think we got more out of it by seeing the expressions on their faces. 

Just go!

192751657.name: Beautiful!
192751657.author: a TripAdvisor user
192751657.reviewBody: Beautiful beach for walking, no shells but lots of interesting rocks.  Lovely ladies do an awesome mud pack right on the beach, so much fun!

192013942.name: Good Fun - Beautiful Views
192013942.author: a TripAdvisor user
192013942.reviewBody:
We always make sure we go to Bocana Beach when we are in Huatulco.  It is a quick 5 minute drive from Dreams/Secrets.  Just tell your cab driver when to come back and pick you up and they will be there on time.  You can rent surf boards or boogie boards - cheap fun.  The beach is beautiful and you can walk along it a long ways.  The rock formations are so interesting - some looking like faces.  The waves are alot of fun and just nice to watch the surfers etc.  There is hardly anyone every there - like having your own private beach.

You can get a mud bath here as well - we have never tried it but it is supposed to be really fun.  Was told you should have this done at the beginning of your trip as it does exfoliate your skin so you will lose a bit of your tan so try it at the beginning if you don't want to lose it!

Warning - the sand here is beyond hot in the afternoon - way hotter than the other beaches in Huatuclo!!!  You can rent an umbrella and chairs at the same place as the boogie boards.  The cost was 150 pesos.  You can also take a bucket of beers up there from the bar.

There are a couple of little bars/restaurants there with cold drinks and great food.  FUN! ! ! !

191286766.name: Amazing mud massage.
191286766.author: a TripAdvisor user
191286766.reviewBody: The beach is a must see, desolate, wild and hot. The mud massage  on the beach is incredible, the mud cools the body temperature immediately and the massage and removal feel great.

189812443.name: Love this beach
189812443.author: a TripAdvisor user
189812443.reviewBody: We visit Playa La Bocana every time we go to Huatulco. The beach is beautiful, but had a lot of damage in a storm that hit the coast in 2013. I had been trying to find information about the damage, but had trouble finding any. So, I\'m posting some pictures of the beach before and after the storm for anyone who\'s interested, The beach has increased in size tremendously...it used to be a short walk from the ocean to the road. The wall that separates the beach from the road is badly damaged and there is a small lake between the wall and the ocean. Trees washed down the river and now are strewn on the beach. Vultures and other water fowl have taken up residence on the trees. The beach looks very different, but the ladies who do the Zapotecas mud baths are still there. That\'s always one of the high points of my Huatulco vacation. Surfers are still on the beach. Such a beautiful place...just looking very different.

189545681.name: Secluded & Unique Beach
189545681.author: a TripAdvisor user
189545681.reviewBody:
Playa La Bocana is a unique little beach located on your way to the Copalita Archeological Ruins site. We visited the Ruins and then walked back to La Bocana, which involves climbing a significant hill, but it is all downhill after that right to the beach. In total less than 1 km from the Ruins entrance. There are a few small businesses there, including two bars where you can get a cerveza (25 pesos), and a small hotel.

It is known for boogie boarding and the black sand which is probably of volcanic origin. However in May 2013 the area was hit by Hurricane Barbara, and as a result has changed significantly. I do not know if this has changed the conditions for boogie boarding, but the day we were there, December 13, 2013, there were a few trying it, but not many actually getting a good ride. I believe you can rent boogie boards and there is a place offering showers for 10 pesos.

Based on older pictures the beach was close to the shore and much of it was very dark to black sand. Now, however, the sand is the normal yellow to slightly orange sand you find in the Huatulco area, but finer. And, there is a huge sandbar with a lagoon behind it, which extends back to the shoreline. The sandbar goes all the way East to the mouth of the Copalita river. In a photo I will include, titled Copalita Delta, you can see the end of the sandbar and a man standing in the middle of it (if you look real close!). There is a trace here than there of the black sand but nothing significant. If you have the time it would be well worth your time to walk from La Bocana to the Copalita delta. It is about 1 km on nice flat relatively hard sand, which is good for walking. There are lots of birds at the delta. Very scenic area, so don't forget your camera!

It is also reported that local women offer mud baths at about 100 pesos each, but there was no evidence of them the day we were there. Apparently if you ask at the bar they will be there...

This is a recommended and well worthwhile stop if you are in the area. It is less than 3 km from Secrets and walkable down the main road if you don't mind the hills and the heat. Probably about 50 peso taxi ride from the main Tangolunda resort strip.

672167695.name: amazing beaches. breeze is just the right amount.
672167695.author: a TripAdvisor user
672167695.reviewBody: We were there for march break with our extended family and children and we all loved it. Saw all kind of birds and creatures. Went for a boat ride with the kids and saw turtles and many fish. The place we stayed at allowed us to be right on the bay. The kids loved the place and all the beaches. We visited 4 beaches on the bay and each one of them was better than the last. The water is so clear that you can see the fish right under your feet. My family will come back to this place next spring to see if we can visit with the dolphis and whales that visit the bay yearly. For our extended family, this was a chance to do things together, when we do not often get to hang out together. The people in the communities nearby were welcoming and helpful and went out of their way to show us the beauty of the place. We went to one of the towns nearby and had fresh coconuts right off the truck that had picked them up. The shopping in the area was a lot of fun. My kids bought souvenirs for their friends and enjoyed that.

667948250.name: Beautiful beaches, warm water!
667948250.author: a TripAdvisor user
667948250.reviewBody: Very pretty area, but watch for the currents, the beaches are very sloped and the water gets deep very very fast!\n

667730125.name: Bay
667730125.author: a TripAdvisor user
667730125.reviewBody: Beautiful beach, as with all the beaches, in the area are beautiful but surrounded by hotel/condos. Recommend a boat tour of the bays.

664274882.name: Dreams in Tangolunda Bay
664274882.author: a TripAdvisor user
664274882.reviewBody: Stayed at Dreams in Tangolunda Bay!  Great beach and fun in the ocean; bogie boarding, banana boating, snorkeling, feeding fish.

662034211.name: Beautiful bay
662034211.author: a TripAdvisor user
662034211.reviewBody: Great beach. Warm water. Great for kayaking, sailing, stand up paddle boards. Great staff at Dreams Resort.

661517449.name: Great ocean
661517449.author: a TripAdvisor user
661517449.reviewBody: We stayed in the bay and altho the beach can get busy we really enjoyed the rolling waves. Not really suitable for kids or those who don\'t swim.

659869023.name: Barcelo resort - enjoyed our stay
659869023.author: a TripAdvisor user
659869023.reviewBody: Excellent value for money 4.5-star resort.  My wife and I stayed one week at the Barcelo Huatulco in March 2019. Nice beach, great bartenders (Venancio, and Herman in the lobby bar, and Saul on the beach). The a\' la cartes were so/so but we always found something good on the buffet.  Pools were great although we didn\'t use them as the beach was what we went for. Rooms were clean and quiet and the staff were all very friendly and attentive.  We will definitely return to the Barcelo Huatulco.

657024839.name: Warm and swimmable!!
657024839.author: a TripAdvisor user
657024839.reviewBody: Great Bay. Clean, walkable, swimmable, skidoo rentals, Banana boat rides, sail boat/catamaran rentals.

656419792.name: crystal-clear water and gorgeous beach
656419792.author: a TripAdvisor user
656419792.reviewBody: This mile-long beach is surrounded by 5-star all inclusive resorts. On this occasion, we did not stay at any of them, regretfully, but next time we visit this area, its got to be Dreams, if only for its best location along this beach, namely at the far left, as you look  out to sea. The reasons this is the best part of the beach: it is safe to swim there, and the surprise of having quite large fish harmlessly surround one\'s legs as one wades into the surf. Go there; its a must.

655262927.name: Beautiful swimmable Bay
655262927.author: a TripAdvisor user
655262927.reviewBody: Swam in the areas in front of Las Brisas Huatulco. Loved the beach and the fact that in addition to swimming you can snorkel, and participate in other water sports.

655251427.name: A beach to walk on
655251427.author: a TripAdvisor user
655251427.reviewBody: We have stayed at Dreams on Tangolunda Bay twice and I think that we walked along the beach every day. There are a several hotels on Tangolunda but because beachfronts are public in Mexico you can walk right in front of them all the way around to the pier which banks a small river. \nThe beach is coarse brown sand and is very clean. You are right on the Pacific so the water may be calm or there may be considerable surf. When it is calm, you can see fish darting around the rocks by the pier and I have also seen fishermen on the pier and in small boats.

654591540.name: Great Area
654591540.author: a TripAdvisor user
654591540.reviewBody: Plenty to see and do in town and around the bay! Toatlly safe to walk..bike..or rent a car and do it yourself!!

654426869.name: Amazing beaches
654426869.author: a TripAdvisor user
654426869.reviewBody: Amazing beaches along Tangolunda Bay. Walk, jog or swim along. The under-tow can be quite strong so be careful.

650397854.name: Beautiful swimming beach
650397854.author: a TripAdvisor user
650397854.reviewBody: Many resorts overlook this picturesque spot. In the morning the water is often calm and often you can see fish near the surface at the far end of the beach. The water is warm with good visibility. By the afternoon there are often big rollers that make entry and exit from the water challenging. Beautiful none the less.

650199490.name: Beautiful Bay.....great views
650199490.author: a TripAdvisor user
650199490.reviewBody: A few resorts on this Bay...Dreams, Barcelo, Las Brisas, Quinta Real and Camino Real. Beautiful views from all

650156571.name: Tantalizing Tangolunda
650156571.author: a TripAdvisor user
650156571.reviewBody: One of the nine bays of Huatulco, Tangolunda is a fine example of why tourists and locals can\'t get enough of this area. Shelter by Whale island and alternating between cliffs and beautiful sandy beaches, its the perfect spot to kayak, sail or paddle board. Outstanding marine life, including whales in season. A must see on any visit to Huatulco. Bonita!

649683133.name: really nice bay, although it falls off quickly to the water
649683133.author: a TripAdvisor user
649683133.reviewBody: snorkeling is ok at the Dreams end, you can also feed the fish there. Some bigger waves at high tide, but not much rip

647789799.name: Barcelo the best spot
647789799.author: a TripAdvisor user
647789799.reviewBody: The beach at the Barcelo is beautiful and very safe to swim did a little bit of snorkeling lots to see. At the end of the day in front of the Dreams Resort are tons of little fish that you can feed also pufferfish were seen. Love Huatulco will  definitely return very safe and beautiful

646146569.name: Great swimming!
646146569.author: a TripAdvisor user
646146569.reviewBody: Water was calm enough for any type of swimmer. \nSand isn\'t a fine as the eastern seaboard but still really nice for long walks.

641849759.name: Beautiful
641849759.author: a TripAdvisor user
641849759.reviewBody: This is such an amazing place, the beach was awesome. The sand is courser than other beaches but still nice.  We played in the waves, the water was so warm!  Temperatures were in the high 30\'s so being in the water was a must! loved it!

639908729.name: Very nice
639908729.author: a TripAdvisor user
639908729.reviewBody: One of 7 bays in huatulco.   Public beach access though mainly hotel tourists and small boardwalk.  Home to a few of the hotels in this area.  Nice mixture of landscape, hillside, tropical, and rock formation.

639269358.name: overrun
639269358.author: a TripAdvisor user
639269358.reviewBody: its a nice enough beach, but it gets busy. No shade, golf course, hotels... distract from the natural setting

638083566.name: So calm
638083566.author: a TripAdvisor user
638083566.reviewBody: With a lot of activities available at our resort, you can go sailing, kayaking, snorkelling, jetskiing, and many other activities in this bay.

638073738.name: High Rent District
638073738.author: a TripAdvisor user
638073738.reviewBody: This is where some of the best hotels in Huatulco are located.\nWonderful beaches that you can get to   by using the public access trails.\nSome of the  hotels have day use and their restaurants are open to the public.

637449081.name: Access for public is disgusting
637449081.author: a TripAdvisor user
637449081.reviewBody: If you are not in a resort you use public entrance, right? Not this one, you will find yourself in a swamp. I guess this insures the rich get the whole beach, not fair to the locals who work hard to make your holiday so good. Who can change this?

637076606.name: 7 Bay Tour Huatulco
637076606.author: a TripAdvisor user
637076606.reviewBody: One of the best day tours I have taken.  Mario, our guide was very knowledgeable about all the bays we visited, all were just beautiful and untouched.  We had the option to fish and snorkel but decided not to do that.  Great restaurant he took us to for shrimp lunch. We got to see Dolphins, turtles, flying stingrays, coral reefs, iguana\'s, beautiful beaches. Daniel was a great driver.  We came came back a later then expected and tide was up, so was hard to get the boat back at our resort, but Daniel was great and very experienced.  Would recommend this tour to everyone

624863462.name: Restricted access beach, uninviting, sad situation
624863462.author: a TripAdvisor user
624863462.reviewBody:
You can go to this beach only if you are staying at the Barcelo or Secrets, they are all inclusive. And they aren’t a very nice staff. 

I was disappointed to see that this hotel group would rather lose money than allow foreigners who want to visit that beach and their bar, pool, and restaurant. 

You can enter the Tangolunda Bay Playa via the trailer park/ public beach access. But it isn’t welcoming, it’s wooden plank pathway that isn’t really cared for, sandbags, then a weird mangrove area and you walk along the fence like you are sneaking in. Not dignified at all. 

Save your money and go to a different part of the area like playa Entrega or Bocana, or take a boat trip. 

Or, just avoid Bahías de Huatulco all together if that’s how they want to welcome the tourists within one of their largest bays. It is a really restricted situation, and the hotels treat you like a criminal. Forget this place.

619012166.name: Beautiful swimming and kayaking..
619012166.author: a TripAdvisor user
619012166.reviewBody: Stayed at Dreams resort on this Bay and loved the safe, quiet, beautiful area. Saw a great variety of bird life plus iguanas. Enjoyed swimming and kayaking.\n \n

587628497.name: Nice!
587628497.author: a TripAdvisor user
587628497.reviewBody: Beach is nice but on a steep incline. Sand is much more coarse here, but still fun. No see weed. Waves were strong couldn\u2019t go very far into the ocean as it was dangerous and the red flag was always out, but it was fun overall.

582733057.name: Must visit
582733057.author: a TripAdvisor user
582733057.reviewBody: You should visit this place if you are around Huatulco, Oaxaca in Mexico. They have very good food and the people is very nice. They, the people working for tourism are very nice persons and offer not expensive services.

580214586.name: Interesting Mexican coast line
580214586.author: a TripAdvisor user
580214586.reviewBody: By far one of our favorite destinations in Mexico, Friendly locals ,Great authentic cuisine.\nMore laid back if your looking for great place to relax

576912339.name: Beautiful Bay
576912339.author: a TripAdvisor user
576912339.reviewBody: We stayed at Dreams which is in the Tongolunda Bay and it\'s breathtaking.  Great seascape, loved the waves but watchout for the undertow.

576563524.name: Beaches
576563524.author: a TripAdvisor user
576563524.reviewBody: Secluded beaches are plentiful, great snorkelling and diving. Swimming  with dolphins, deep sea fishing, delicious food and talented musicians.

576064111.name: Beautiful Beach!
576064111.author: a TripAdvisor user
576064111.reviewBody: Beautiful Beach located in a bay with the perfect mix of tranquil swimming places & rougher places for kayaking, etc.  They have great snorkeling and amazingly fine sand!  Easily the nicest all-around beach in Huatulco!

568469132.name: Great beach
568469132.author: a TripAdvisor user
568469132.reviewBody: A very clean beach with crystal clear water. Not overloaded with tourist! Definitely a place to visit.\n

562189529.name: What a great area!
562189529.author: a TripAdvisor user
562189529.reviewBody: This whole bay is stunning and we felt very welcomed and safe in the Huatulco area! If you can stand day after day of +35 weather, sunny skies, and gorgeous views this might be your place.

560052308.name: Beutiful location
560052308.author: a TripAdvisor user
560052308.reviewBody: One of the larger bays in Hualtuco, this area has beautiful beaches and whales can bee viewed insie the bay area.  Water was reasonably warm for February!

559324544.name: Best of the Bays of Huatulco
559324544.author: a TripAdvisor user
559324544.reviewBody: Staying at the Camino Real Xaashila on Tangolunda Bay is like having your own private beach. \nA rock outcropping separates the beach from the rest of the sand in front of the other major hotels on the bay.\nThis means that the only people in the beach are from the Camino Real. It\'s at the extreme southern end of the bay with interesting rock formations and a cliff making it accessible only from the hotel. Since all Mexican beaches are public, this makes this part of Tangolunda the closest to private it can be. The sand is flat but the drop-off in the water is close to the shore. The ocean is relatively calm here due to the bay formation. The rest of the beach is similar in formation....just more people on it.

558588738.name: December 2017
558588738.author: a TripAdvisor user
558588738.reviewBody: The bay is beautiful. The sun starts reaching the beach at about 7:00am every morning. It lasts until about 6:00 pm it s great. The water is west coast Mexico so sometimes not advisable to swim in it. Other than that it is great.

557827990.name: Sweeping Beach
557827990.author: a TripAdvisor user
557827990.reviewBody: Sweeping swimmable beach.  We got to this beach thru a trail that we read about on Trip Advisor.  Apparently the only other way is to pay thru one of the 5 Star Hotels.  Trail is on the south end down a road that says trailer park.  Trail was sketchy - boards over swamp and sand bags!  But so worth it to get to that bay!

556693607.name: Bay at. Dreams
556693607.author: a TripAdvisor user
556693607.reviewBody: This bay is beautiful and you can snorkel right there at the resort at Dreams. Water is clear and beautiful and you can see all kinds of marine animals right there. Would recommend this spot for all snorkel lovers \n

555892134.name: Peacefull
555892134.author: a TripAdvisor user
555892134.reviewBody: We were empressed with this bay. Water was always quiet enough to swim, paddle-board, and kayak. Observed many fish, and 1 small octopus in this area

554855015.name: Beautiful Beaches and Friendly People
554855015.author: a TripAdvisor user
554855015.reviewBody: The beaches in this area are beautiful and everyday was sunny.  No need to stay in freezing weather when there are lovely places like this to visit.  The hard part is packing to go back home.

553230960.name: Nice beach!
553230960.author: a TripAdvisor user
553230960.reviewBody: The beach is very pretty, with the rocks all around it is beautiful. The waves can get very big but breaks on the beach so not good for boogie or surf. You have to get to other beaches to do so. Otherwise, swimming is great! Snorkeling is nice when the waves are calm, especially on the left side of the beach, in front of the Dream hotel, there is usually more fishes and water is a bit more calm. In the rocks on the left there is Oysters and usually local people sell and prepare them for you.Too many boats and jet skies around, which leave a bad gaz smell around too often, but despite that, this place is very nice!

552678404.name: Beautiful Beach and Snorkeling
552678404.author: a TripAdvisor user
552678404.reviewBody: Tangolunda is a great Bahia with amazing vistas, snorkelling and sunsets.  One of the most relaxing and beautiful vacations.  I have been here twice and will return again.

552601552.name: We were mostly on the beach, amazing sunset there.
552601552.author: a TripAdvisor user
552601552.reviewBody: We spent a whole day from early morning to late evening on the beach. The water was like bath water, The sand was clean. The rock formations were beautiful as we watched the sun going down. Everything was painted with glittering gold...\n

551384715.name: Bay tours with Tony Lopez Lopez!
551384715.author: a TripAdvisor user
551384715.reviewBody: This NEEDS to be your first excursion!  If you\'re only doing one, it needs to be this one, with this guy.  He takes your group with his captain on whatever boat fits your group and guys the seas to see the coast from the other side.  You\'ll fish a little, see dolphins swimming alongside the boat, see some turtles, and much much more!  Then you dock at a private beach and enjoy some absolute soul time. Swim, nap, explore, do whatever you like but it\'s your time.  Then you hit the eaters again and go to a local, very authentic Mexican beach restaurant!  You\'ll return in time to catch the sunset at the hotel. You can\'t miss him. He walks the Barcelo/ Dreams beach lines. Tony Lopez Lopez.  Thank me later.\n

548422219.name: What a beach!!!
548422219.author: a TripAdvisor user
548422219.reviewBody: The beach and water is great. Only warning is a few times a year when currents change there are jellyfish. If they come, 24-36 hours later they are gone.

546069518.name: Tangolunda Bay
546069518.author: a TripAdvisor user
546069518.reviewBody: Stayed at Dreams in this bay.  It was wonderful, beautiful, and great beach.  Lots of fish, so bring some bread as they will swim right into your hands.  All the bays are beautiful and natural.

545764926.name: We stayed at Dreams
545764926.author: a TripAdvisor user
545764926.reviewBody: This an excellent beach & the waters are good for swimming, snorkelling and water sports. Lots of rock outcroppings and fish that swim near you.

542328187.name: Terrible Tangolunda
542328187.author: a TripAdvisor user
542328187.reviewBody: I will definitely come to beautiful Huatulco again and again but I will NEVER go to Tangolunda again.The world\'s worse Public Access route that takes 10 minutes to bring you to a coarse sanded slanted Beach with Nothing but a string of Resorts that Monopolize the Beach. No Bar\'s No Restaurants  No Bathrooms Private or Public Not even a stop to get a drink of Water What an absolute waste of time I threw away my shoes after slogging through the swamp that led to this Beach.  No thank you

539447426.name: Breathtaking and Lush
539447426.author: a TripAdvisor user
539447426.reviewBody: Tangolunda is lush and more rural than the typical Mexican resort area. Be prepared to stay near the resort, but take in lots of the lush greenery.

535415489.name: Beautiful
535415489.author: a TripAdvisor user
535415489.reviewBody: Las Brisas is located here and has the best ocean experience. The bay keeps the waves manageable for swimming

509952209.name: Most beautiful but remote
509952209.author: a TripAdvisor user
509952209.reviewBody: We felt to return in the near future. But stay at La Crucesita. Stay at Mission de los Arches. Our per night would have bern $ 500 USD per day in the Tangolunda All inclusive hotel. We paid $60 and rented a car fir ?27 a day!

485105654.name: Incredible views!
485105654.author: a TripAdvisor user
485105654.reviewBody: We just loved touring the whole region ... especiallly on a CAT cruise! Best way to see the area! Many options to choose from too!

481621404.name: Best hidden treasure in the world.
481621404.author: a TripAdvisor user
481621404.reviewBody: Most amazing place I have ever travelled to.   There is such beauty it is indescribable.  I love huatulco.

479181666.name: Huatulco ... what a nice discovery!
479181666.author: a TripAdvisor user
479181666.reviewBody: First time in Huatulco, stayed in one of the hotels at Tangolunda bay area ... the best decision! Place is privileged, and has so much to offer ... was looking for some quiet day away from the US, and discovered way more than I was looking for ... will return soon!

478691600.name: Beautiful!
478691600.author: a TripAdvisor user
478691600.reviewBody: Beautiful bay. Swim using extreme caution as the currents are strong. The beach is quite steep. Sand is like the texture of demerara sugar.

476947851.name: One of the cleanest beaches I have visited in my life.
476947851.author: a TripAdvisor user
476947851.reviewBody: I am from California, and I am very usted to deal with all kind of algae. But this beach has none of them, only some fish and little crabs joining you swimming. This beach is very safe with no big tidal waves at all.

472221123.name: All big resorts are there
472221123.author: a TripAdvisor user
472221123.reviewBody: Excellent area for beaches and resorts like Las Brisas, Quinta, Barcello, Dreams and more. The combination of ocean, sand, mountains, bays is amazing.

471662846.name: AS THE LOCALS SAY...IT\'S ABSOLUTE PARADISE!!
471662846.author: a TripAdvisor user
471662846.reviewBody: We love Tangolunda Bay.  The beach, the weather, the snorkeling & we keep returning year after year.  It\'s an experience we look forward to every year!!

469978016.name: Ghost town
469978016.author: a TripAdvisor user
469978016.reviewBody: I got a fairly good deal on my hotel so i was very excited when i arrived. To my dismay i realized that the town appeared to be completely abandoned,those who could afford the very expensive all inclusive hotels its great but for those on a budget i recommend dtaying in the center and just getting a 43 peso cab trip to the beach

469877026.name: Nice scenic beach - no services.
469877026.author: a TripAdvisor user
469877026.reviewBody: $2 cab ride and then a short walk thru a park and woods.  Not easy access if you have mobility issues.  Gorgeous, steep, soft beach - fairly heavy surf and undertow.  Use major caution if swimming.  No shade.  No bathrooms.  A couple vendors do sell cold drinks, cocos, local snacks.  All-inclusive resorts at both ends but hardly any people in between.

468690042.name: Tengolunda
468690042.author: a TripAdvisor user
468690042.reviewBody: This is the best month to come to Huatulco because after April May,June are always very humid and rain a lot and it is very humid that sometimes is annoying  come to Huatulco is very nice

468345920.name: LOVED VIEWING THIS BAY ALL DAY LONG
468345920.author: a TripAdvisor user
468345920.reviewBody: Our resort overlooked this bay.  Loved the scenery of the hills and mountains across from our resort.  Loved that we had no seaweed to contend with.  The water had several different colors to it.  A few boats came to this bay area each day so we enjoyed watching the activity there.  Beautiful scenery.

466325328.name: our hotel at this bay
466325328.author: a TripAdvisor user
466325328.reviewBody: our hotel Park Royal sits on this beautiful bay.  we enjoyed  snorkeling in this bay, saw sting rays other colorful fishes when the water was not so rough.

466324911.name: The main resort area of Huatulco with great beach (but some undertow)
466324911.author: a TripAdvisor user
466324911.reviewBody: We stayed in the Park Royal Hotel with great access to this Beach as occurs with several other resorts. The area of Tangolunda is spotlessly clean and designed for tourism The resort staff live elsewhere , either in La Creucita or one of the other close villages or towns.Ther are a few local restaurants and stores but for other attractions it is just a short and cheap taxi to La Creucita or  the Port. The beach isgreat especially close to the Dreams resort , where the beach is less steep. Further west the beach gets a bit steeper which seems to contribute to the slight undertow. With young children  there should be adults close by ! Public beach access at west end of beach.

464176544.name: Resort was on Tangolunda Bay
464176544.author: a TripAdvisor user
464176544.reviewBody: Water was rough 1st 3 days with wicked undertoe but by Tues evened out. Thurs morn at 3 am had a 4.7 earthquake with aftershocks- shook water up again. This was not typical of my earlier visit

462758255.name: Beautiful Beach
462758255.author: a TripAdvisor user
462758255.reviewBody: Tangolunda Bay is the bay that the Dreams resort is in, so very clean and very pretty scenery.  You can walk along the beach, it is not a long walk, and you will want to walk closest to the water as the sand will burn your feet.

460743631.name: Great relaxing holiday swimming and snorkelling
460743631.author: a TripAdvisor user
460743631.reviewBody: Very pretty area - clean and quite safe. Some very nice hotels, good swimming and some nice restaurants

460458404.name: relax and enjoy a nice walk..... anytime
460458404.author: a TripAdvisor user
460458404.reviewBody: Tangolunda is a very clean and safe place to vacation. There are 2 sports bars with a fine dining restaurant and several other little eateries. This little town has the prettiest boulevards that are kept in pristine condition. The golf and country club is excellent with the club house having affordable food for any budget. The local beach is not very busy at all and has excellent places to eat as well.

459758071.name: Beautiful Area
459758071.author: a TripAdvisor user
459758071.reviewBody: Very scenic area, Mountainous with desert like vegetation, cactus\' and similiar plants, go before March as its to hot after that.

459031526.name: Safe for swimming but a little crowded.
459031526.author: a TripAdvisor user
459031526.reviewBody: We spent a day on this beach but with all the large hotels found it a little crowded.  I prefer the beaches you hike to and have to yourself.

458549710.name: Best Silver in Tangolunda
458549710.author: a TripAdvisor user
458549710.reviewBody: Best silver jewellery in Huatulco.Is Sergio " George of the Jungle". 15 yrs ouf buying silver from him and never a problem.\nThe guys on the beach provide the best Bay tours. \nHuatulco is amazing.. Ffrom the people,food to culture.PERFECTION!M

456191677.name: Snorkelling
456191677.author: a TripAdvisor user
456191677.reviewBody: Great area for easy snorkelling.  Just step in and start to swim. Beach easy to get to. Not great sand for walking on

455985395.name: Great bay with many beaches and resorts
455985395.author: a TripAdvisor user
455985395.reviewBody: Stayed on Las Brisas side of this bay which has the best  beaches for swimming. Barcel\u00f3, Dreams and Camino Real have very long beach for walking on but swimming is at times dangerous because of waves and undertow.

455924772.name: Las Brisas Hotel in this Bay
455924772.author: a TripAdvisor user
455924772.reviewBody: We loved this Bay. Our hotel is situated here. Its beautiful, clean and the snorkelling was very nice and safe

455488503.name: Great Sunrises
455488503.author: a TripAdvisor user
455488503.reviewBody: This bay is excellent for morning sunrises and to enjoy the people from different countries enjoying the weather and water

450315058.name: Beautiful little part of town.
450315058.author: a TripAdvisor user
450315058.reviewBody: Here you will see more of the upper scale resorts.  Across the street from Barcelo resort is a little shopping centre with local crafts and a nice area to walk. Very clean!   The views are amazing!  Tangolunda Bay is the nicest bay.

450083470.name: One of our favorite Beaches for snorkeling and relaxing
450083470.author: a TripAdvisor user
450083470.reviewBody: It has an island you can snorkel around. Lots to see and the beach is very long. Only down side is this beach has the all inclusive hotels on it. Dreams and Barcelo. They do not allow you to access the beach through their property. No restaurants to eat or drink. We pack a lunch and bring a cooler. The drop off area for public beach access is next to the golf course in which you have to walk through a wooded area to get to the beach.

447130269.name: Beautiful bay
447130269.author: a TripAdvisor user
447130269.reviewBody: Our resort was in Tangolunda Bay in Huatulco - we walked the entire bay and were able to spot sting rays, and sea turtles swimming near the pier.  Beautiful spot to watch the sunrise.

445437710.name: Tantalizing Tangolunda Bay
445437710.author: a TripAdvisor user
445437710.reviewBody: We really enjoyed the beach as the ocean was much calmer than our last visit.  The ocean was very warm with good water visibility.  The sand is coarse and a little difficult to walk in.  Great water activities with lots of snorkelling.  Large bay with 3 hotels.

444756449.name: Barcelo
444756449.author: a TripAdvisor user
444756449.reviewBody: The water is the warmest I\'ve ever stepped foot in, it gets insanely deep in a hurry which was a little unsettling but the water is calm and the bay itself is a sight to see

443366742.name: Stunning View
443366742.author: a TripAdvisor user
443366742.reviewBody: Stayed at Dreams Resort & Spa located in Tangolunda Bay. This bay has so much to look at as it has a few rock islands and when the tide is high it is wonderful to watch the ocean crash up around these various rock formations.

439817484.name: Beautiful Beach
439817484.author: a TripAdvisor user
439817484.reviewBody: What a awesome area - one of the nicest ocean front beaches ever.  It has pacific sand but the water is clear and beautiful.  The fish are numerous and the area is known for snorkeling.  Only problem we had was with some of the sand fleas in late evening or early morning.

438596358.name: Very nice bay
438596358.author: a TripAdvisor user
438596358.reviewBody: Very nice bay with good hotels and warm transparent water. Fishes come and eat from your hand. They love bananas

437942531.name: The bay and general area where the Dreams Huatulco is situated.
437942531.author: a TripAdvisor user
437942531.reviewBody: A beautiful area in and around the Dream resort. The bay is sheltered to the ocean and is perfect for swimming and snokelling in the warm Pacific water.

437935793.name: Dreams trip
437935793.author: a TripAdvisor user
