437935793.reviewBody: Dreams was a so so.  Beautiful views,  staff was great.  Food left something to be desired.   Restaurants closed a lot of the time,  ran out of Bud Light daily.   Not consistent with other AMResort experiences...

435910898.name: Great beach
435910898.author: a TripAdvisor user
435910898.reviewBody: Wonderful fish to see right off the beach. Walk towards the river to see many species of birds. The beach has a rather steep drop off, so be careful with kids or if you,re a non swimmer.

435755691.name: Pretty Woman
435755691.author: a TripAdvisor user
435755691.reviewBody: The translated version of Tangolunda is Pretty Woman. According to our driver. hahahahaha\nBeautiful views and vantage points.

423680437.name: Mountain view
423680437.author: a TripAdvisor user
423680437.reviewBody: Great bay. Wonderful water. Good walking although steep in some places. Water warm and clear. September brings a change in seasons and waves can be big some days.

408476063.name: Lovely Bay, friendly people
408476063.author: a TripAdvisor user
408476063.reviewBody: Tangolunda has the main hotels of Huatulco. It\'s a lovely place for relaxing, shopping handcrafts and souvenirs and eating. A great place for those who don\'t like too touristic places and appreciate nature, culture and friendly people.

407266857.name: Decent snorkeling and waves good for boogie boarding
407266857.author: a TripAdvisor user
407266857.reviewBody: Nice beach.  The snorkeling was much better than I expected.  Large schools of tropical fish (numerous varieties) whale sharks, whales, etc.

397608965.name: Private beach for resort guests! Love it!
397608965.author: a TripAdvisor user
397608965.reviewBody: Tangolunda Bay is one of many bays that make up Huatulco. While no beach is technically a private beach in Mexico, not all bays are accessible since you would have to be a guest to enjoy the space. We happen to stay at Camino Real Zaashila located in Tangolunda bay and we did not encounter any outside guests entering the beach. It is absolutely stunning. I believe Las Brisas resort is on this bay too. Water can be a bit rough at times, but it is clear and warm. My boys enjoyed the beach here, but we did go to other beaches (La Entrega) for calmer waters. Overall, beautiful!

391178625.name: Excellent hotels
391178625.author: a TripAdvisor user
391178625.reviewBody: This area is where the must famous Hotels and golf area is l, they have a local restaurants, but in these area the bay is open to the ocean and the red flag is 90% of the time.

381284355.name: Turquoise water, white fine sand!
381284355.author: a TripAdvisor user
381284355.reviewBody: This is a fabulous beach, mostly occupied by large hotels and timeshare complexes, it\'s open ocean so not the best for swimming, red flag for heavy currents is typical, clean and safe if you stay in the shallow end!

368509304.name: Beautiful beach!
368509304.author: a TripAdvisor user
368509304.reviewBody: Almost no people here the week we we visited. Good swimming although water a bit wavy.  Quiet and peaceful,  awesome way to spend a week.

366148470.name: Take a boat trip
366148470.author: a TripAdvisor user
366148470.reviewBody: Take a boat trip offered by many on the beach so see the beautiful bays from the ocean side. Quiet, untouched areas, blissful! Walk on the beach, fish come into the bay and love crackers. Thrilling to see them all around you on the waters edge by the rocks

365721849.name: Beautiful place
365721849.author: a TripAdvisor user
365721849.reviewBody: The bay is not that big but really beautiful with clear and calm water. We were able to swim/snorkel really far without any strong current.  Kayaking out in the ocean was fun too!

363488400.name: Paradise
363488400.author: a TripAdvisor user
363488400.reviewBody: Tangolunda Bay...One of many bays. A sun and fun cruise is worth the money. The area is beautiful. The locals are very friendly

363414466.name: Excellent view
363414466.author: a TripAdvisor user
363414466.reviewBody: wonderful bay for swim, practice snorquel an kayac.\nthe sea there is very calm so you can go to the sea. There are few hotels sharing the bay so its a paceful place to rest

360193188.name: Beautiful
360193188.author: a TripAdvisor user
360193188.reviewBody: It\'s got a beach! Beautiful views, warm water, and good snorkeling. What more could one ask for? Highly recommended.

357702784.name: Tangolunda has pretty beaches
357702784.author: a TripAdvisor user
357702784.reviewBody: The beach is nice but can be rough.  The hotels located in Tangolunda are nice and are convenient to Viena and the Italian Coffee Shop.

355730077.name: Controlled Access
355730077.author: a TripAdvisor user
355730077.reviewBody: Took a taxi from Santa Cruz to Tangolunda. Our driver dropped us off in the state park and we made our way through the bush to the beach. Based on this access it became obvious that they want to keep these beaches semi private for all the AI resorts that surround the bay. No restaurants or bars available to non AI guests. Beach is large with coarse loose sand and a strong undertow. Been there done that, shall not return.

354809242.name: Vienna House   AMAZING!!!!!
354809242.author: a TripAdvisor user
354809242.reviewBody: Went to the Vienna House the last night of our holidays and it was just amazing.  The food, service and atmosphere were awesome..   If you are into good schnitzel you won\'t be disappointed!

354672415.name: Ocean was warm, waves were high.
354672415.author: a TripAdvisor user
354672415.reviewBody: Nightly themed dinners were fantastic. Breakfast was awesome.  NO need to venture out of the resort for food.  Grounds were immaculate, nice gym overlooking ocean.

354446304.name: Lovely bay
354446304.author: a TripAdvisor user
354446304.reviewBody: Charming, tropical beach with several beachfront hotels. Waves can be a big at times though. Beautiful view of the ocean, and the hotels. Sand is reddish in colour and fine enough to walk on.

353135513.name: Beautiful Bay
353135513.author: a TripAdvisor user
353135513.reviewBody: This bay consists of the Las Brisas, the Quinta Ria, The Park Royal, The Barcelo, Dreams and Secrets Hotels. Although it is a bay, the waves can get aggressive.\n\nBeautiful scenery with vendors that come by quite often offering clothing, hats, blankets, hammocks, jewelry and toys as well as others selling fishing and bay tours.

352485297.name: Return to a beautiful bay
352485297.author: a TripAdvisor user
352485297.reviewBody: It doesn\'t get any better than this. Waking each morning to view this beautiful bay just makes your day start off on the right foot.

351351699.name: La Bocana Beach
351351699.author: a TripAdvisor user
351351699.reviewBody: Fun beach for big waves and swimming. Best to get the tide schedule before going or you may not be able to walk the miles along the beach.  Probably need water shoes as parts are rocky.

351108950.name: SHELTERED BAY
351108950.author: a TripAdvisor user
351108950.reviewBody: This bay is a small pocket so large waves do not come crashing into shore.  Water is very clear and shallow close to shore.  At times, the ocean is warmer than the pool.  Sand is golden brown and fine.  Water shoes are not needed.  Beach is very clean.  No undertow so its very safe.  Not crowded...ever.  Only people from resorts come here as its not really a public beach.  Absolute paradise.

350020593.name: LARGE, BEAUTIFUL BAHIA
350020593.author: a TripAdvisor user
350020593.reviewBody: In my opinion, this is the biggest Bah\u00eda in Huatulco.  Beautiful!  There are four big hotels (Barcel\u00f3, Camino Real, Quinta Real and  other).  A place to enjoy a peaceful moment.  The water is not so green, because is deep.  Ideal to take a sailboat ride or rent a four-wheel motorcycle.  There aren\u00b4t many waves, so it\u00b4s nice.  At the front, there is a big rock forming a small island, perfect for divers.

349443408.name: Nice place to walk
349443408.author: a TripAdvisor user
349443408.reviewBody: We walked through Tangolunda several times during a recent stay at the Dreams Huatulco.  It\'s pretty and clean and there are a few shops.  Vanilla and coffee are available and extraordinarily good prices.

348688728.name: A quite peaceful small town
348688728.author: a TripAdvisor user
348688728.reviewBody: We took a taxi from downtown near the Huatulco Airport for a day trip. What a beautiful green and clean town. Only about 4 restaurants in town but there are 3 major resorts on the beach, including Dreams Huatulco.

347365463.name: Such beautiful views, enjoyed the area very much.
347365463.author: a TripAdvisor user
347365463.reviewBody: We were very busy everyday.  So much to see and do.  Our daugther was married here.  The wedding planner, was so good, and took care of every dail for them.\n

346124061.name: weather is always fabulous
346124061.author: a TripAdvisor user
346124061.reviewBody: Please please keep children out of the adult pool.\ntreat all guests the same - not just the ones who speak spanish

345087959.name: Not much here...move along folks...
345087959.author: a TripAdvisor user
345087959.reviewBody: Access is weird. Rotting plywood provides the path through the trees. Beach is steep. Quite messy when we were there. Lots of debris that you\'d have to clear before lying down. We beat so hasty retreat and went to San Augustine instead. Very happy with that choice.

344650264.name: Gorgeous public beach but poor access over rotting boards for public not in hotels
344650264.author: a TripAdvisor user
344650264.reviewBody:
1. The Good
This is a long, clean, sandy beach worth visiting for swimming or walking. We walked from one end to the other near sunset (when it is cooler) and it was gorgeous. 

2. The BAD
a) Unfortunately the access path for the "public" starts with about 30 feet of rotting boards.
b) After the boards the path is easier as you walk on flat stones and sandbags over a swampy area. 

3. SHAME ON HUATULCO TOURISM BOARD
It is a real shame that Huatulco Tourism OR whoever is in charge doesn't fix this public access. Huatulco provides plenty of parking and even trailer parking near the access path but the path itself needs fixing. We rented a villa and so we could not access this beach from one of the hotels facing it. The public/tourists not in those hotels facing the beach deserve to be treated better.

344398366.name: Beautiful, warm, and gorgeous--a treat
344398366.author: a TripAdvisor user
344398366.reviewBody: We spent two weeks on the beach of Tangolunda at an all-inclusive resort. I walked the beaches and nearby roads every afternoon and discovered geological and built elements of landscape that explain the strong attraction of the area for North American tourists. Best to experience it by renting a condo and occasionally catching a ride on a sailboat at the main harbour.

341547321.name: Nice beach
341547321.author: a TripAdvisor user
341547321.reviewBody: Shore is lined with hotels for the most part.  Some decent snorkeling around island and along rocks in front of Dreams hotel.  Access to jet skis and fishing boats.  Need to have your own Snorkeling equipment.  Sand is a little course that most other beaches.  Lots of folks from resorts on the beach everyday but still not crowded.

341330770.name: Barcelo and resort area
341330770.author: a TripAdvisor user
341330770.reviewBody: Beautiful bay with dreams, barcelo and las brisas resorts. Swimmable for most but small children should wear life jackets due to the wave action. Bit of an incline into water but fine for most and makes for some fun getting in and out of the water. I could lay in my beach chair or float around in the beautifully warm salty water all day and just gaze at the natural beauty and people watch of course!

341000927.name: Great Beach!
341000927.author: a TripAdvisor user
341000927.reviewBody: Be sure to go by the Dreams Hotel, you can see a lot of fish swimming, great for kids.\nOnly downside, the sand is not so soft and powdery

340761225.name: Hotel zone bay
340761225.author: a TripAdvisor user
340761225.reviewBody: We stayed at dreams which is in this bay. The bay is pretty calm on most days and water so very clean and warm. It has some good snorkelling by the rocks beside dreams and as well as at the bay around las brisas. Lots of guides in the area for tours and fishing if you want as well.

335641530.name: One of the best bays in Huatulco
335641530.author: a TripAdvisor user
335641530.reviewBody: This bay has a few very expensive hotels from which to appreciate its beauty but it is definitely worth it! I stayed at Barcel\u00f3 Hotel and it was really good.

334834196.name: Beautiful bay with wonderful snorkeling
334834196.author: a TripAdvisor user
334834196.reviewBody: We stayed at Dreams Resort on Tangolunda Bay. The bay offers great snorkeling in front of the resort. The beach is clean and the water warm. We found lots of little plastic garbage in the bay and  picked it out of the water. It didn\'t deter us from swimming or snorkeling.

332182969.name: "Nice Bay--Nice Beach"
332182969.author: a TripAdvisor user
332182969.reviewBody: The Bay of Tangolunda is a fairly large bay which has 3 large hotel resorts and 2 smaller resorts located on it. The beach varies between steep to flat areas located closer to the Barcel\u00f3 and Dreams Hotels. The water is very clean and always warm for swimming. The beach is public--but is sort of exclusive to the hotels it seems. We have stayed at resorts on this bay 4 times and always enjoyed our time here. There are 2 nice areas for snorkeling........1 near Dreams and 1 near Las Brisas resorts.

331415681.name: Hated the Beach
331415681.author: a TripAdvisor user
331415681.reviewBody: This beach was the steepest of any we went to.  You had to climb up an embankment to get to the hotel from the water.

330767372.name: Beautiful beach with small surf
330767372.author: a TripAdvisor user
330767372.reviewBody: This beach is lovely with hotels situated around the bay.  The rocks in the centre of the bay break the surf so the water is safe to swim.  There is a bit of undertow and some rolling surf and there is the potential for some big waves.  The water is very fun to play in and is warm so you can stay in for a long time.  The sand is not fine, but coarse and golden but still easy to walk on, although it can get pretty hot!

329445198.name: Overrated
329445198.author: a TripAdvisor user
329445198.reviewBody: All the all inclusive hotels share the Conejo bay...no thanks. Unless you get a day pass to the all inclusives you will not get a palapa or food. Our sitio showed us the mediocre entrance to this beach and told us you need to pack a picnic and shade to go to this beach. Hopefully you are not kicked out by the large hotels.

328680808.name: Apple Dreams
328680808.author: a TripAdvisor user
328680808.reviewBody: Wonderful great facility . Nice staff, very accommodating. Perfect weather in Huatulco!! Downtown great jewelry store & restaurant got lunch

325987076.name: Breath taking
325987076.author: a TripAdvisor user
325987076.reviewBody: Our hotel was on this Bay and it was just Breath taking!!!\nBeach was beautiful and clean.  Definitely recommend.

315875278.name: 9 Bays of Huatulco
315875278.author: a TripAdvisor user
315875278.reviewBody: The bays of Huatulco are magnificent.  There are 9 of them some accessible by land and some by water.  Lots of great snorkling in the bays for free.

297415726.name: Nice Bay ! Enjoyable stay !
297415726.author: a TripAdvisor user
297415726.reviewBody: Great Day spent on this quiet , Extremly clean Bay .  Lots of nice little shops.  Restaurants were very good .  Wish I could have stayed longer.  Extremly helpful and nice people.

278595275.name: Unless you are at a resort
278595275.author: a TripAdvisor user
278595275.reviewBody: No real public beach, ok beach, no palapas. Had to pay resort for a chair, we were escorted out.....went to La Bocana. Is taken over by resorts.  Only beach we didn\'t like.

268835650.name: Beautiful Bay
268835650.author: a TripAdvisor user
268835650.reviewBody: The resort was located in Tangolunda Bay where we stayed.  Very beautiful setting -very safe location with lots of access for walking.

263239148.name: Great coffee shop!
263239148.author: a TripAdvisor user
263239148.reviewBody: Finally we found great wifi and I was able to communicate with my family at home.  The hotel wifi was very iffy.  The coffee was great here.

263168232.name: Clean safe town
263168232.author: a TripAdvisor user
263168232.reviewBody: This place was a lot of fun, it was very safe and very clean. You won\'t see any garbage what so ever and the people are so friendly. Theres a lot of great shops to check out, and restaurants. If you get tired of mexican food theres a little restaurant called La Botanita and it was the best sandwich I have ever tried. a cab ride to the town is only 40 pesos (like 3 dollars or less)

258787643.name: Nice and private bay.
258787643.author: a TripAdvisor user
258787643.reviewBody: The beach is very quiet, the waves are ok. You can practice windsurf, kayak, and different activities.

257892527.name: Fun area
257892527.author: a TripAdvisor user
257892527.reviewBody: Great beach and a cute bunch of stores and restaurants. Nice to walk to if you are staying at Dreams, Camino Real or Barcel\u00f3 hotels.

257824343.name: Beautiful Bay
257824343.author: a TripAdvisor user
257824343.reviewBody: We stayed at the Barcelo on this bay and it was gorgeous with the rocks coming out of the water, sailboats and katamarans sailing, birds flying around, and at the one end you can feed the fish right off the shore. The one side is a little steeper, but it is very walkable. Some parts are very nice and others are slightly more rocky and coarse. The water is very clear in Huatulco and the hues are beautiful.

257574394.name: Nature with safety
257574394.author: a TripAdvisor user
257574394.reviewBody: The area is very safe with lots of nice people. One of the restauranteurs who tried to flag us down for a table ended up helping us get a taxi to a neighbouring town. There is great snorkelling, and the weather was a perfect temperature.

256600075.name: Stayed at Dreams on Tangolunda Bay...
256600075.author: a TripAdvisor user
256600075.reviewBody: Dreams was outstanding, clean, and the every staff member we met was outstanding.....friendly and went out of their way to make vacation as pleasant as they could.... from the manager of the dining rooms to the pool guy, and the cleaning staff..... OUTSTANDING!

256262047.name: Beautiful!
256262047.author: a TripAdvisor user
256262047.reviewBody: My son and I kayaked around Tangolunda Bay during our stay in Huatulco. So nice! Would definately recommend this activity. The bay stays relatively calm inspite of the tides and currents.

255223516.name: Sun and nice people
255223516.author: a TripAdvisor user
255223516.reviewBody: Quiet and friendly. Tangolunda bay is not crowdy, good for fishing, seadoo and mostly  for swimging. Very clean sea shore.

254374369.name: Not what it\'s all hyped up to be!
254374369.author: a TripAdvisor user
254374369.reviewBody: It\'s a nice beach if you\'re staying at one of the all inclusive hotels located on the beach. But as a tourist visiting - it\'s crap! It should be noted that there are NO restaurants, no quaint cantinas therefore no chairs or lounges available unless you pay 90$ US per person for the day and listen to the loud music from each hotel. Totally defeats the purpose of beach going.... I recommend La Entraga to all non inclusive tourists. There are a variety of restaurants and lots of seating for everyone to enjoy without the hefty price!

253236037.name: Tangolunda Bay is swimmable
253236037.author: a TripAdvisor user
253236037.reviewBody: A great beach to catch your tan and swim in the ocean. There is some wave action , but it\'s not like unswimable beach\'s in Cabo. Lots of snorkeling, sailing, paddle boarding, kayaking, seadooing, or just laying out. There is also a local diver who goes out every morning and gets fresh Oysters who will deliver to you what ever amount you\'d like to purchase with some hot sauce and a wedge of lime. Great place.

252273718.name: Barcelo beach
252273718.author: a TripAdvisor user
252273718.reviewBody: Love my beach, warm, clean and you can snorkel and see lots of fish or just feed them from the beach.  The sunrises are beautiful.

248366246.name: barcelo beach...
248366246.author: a TripAdvisor user
248366246.reviewBody: public beach but used by guests of the Barcelo resort. swimming was good. ended up spending most of the day at Barcelo (bought a day pass) so we could eat and drink. took the city bus from Santa Cruz for 5 peso, but the walk from the \'bus stop\' to the beach was VERY long through a small "jungle" and about 3-4km walk along the beach to Barcelo property. had we known this, we would have taxied to Barcelo front door.

242158740.name: UNBELIEVABLE
242158740.author: a TripAdvisor user
242158740.reviewBody: We always stay at the Barcelo on Tangolunda Bay.  The oceanview is absolutely breathtaking.  Look for Eduardo Valle Garcia on this beach.  He is a very charismatic individual who has his own boat and will take you out to tour the bays of Huatulco, go snorkelling or fishing.  We have dealt with him for years and can\'t even begin to tell you all the amazing memories we\'ve shared on his boat.  From the unspoiled beaches (which can only be accessed by water) to seeing an orca and a giant mantaray up close, our time spent out on the ocean has been fascinating and we will be doing it again when we return in February.  (Eddie) is eager to please you and is determined to make sure you have an incredible time.  He can be contacted at eduardovalle300@yahoo.com

241997645.name: Picturesque, sparkling water, slanted shore/beach an effort to walk
241997645.author: a TripAdvisor user
241997645.reviewBody: Beach is maybe 1/2 mile long, shore is quite slanted right at the water, which makes it an effort to walk. The sand is a little coarser than some places, but it is THE beach if your staying in the nearby resorts. There are fish which come right up to the shore on the south end. People feed them daily, and you can just stand there and have them swim around your feet. It is very picturesque, and the water is warm and inviting. We walked it every day, at least once, sometimes more. Jet ski rentals are available, as is fishing trips etc. Our beach club was one of the resorts on the bay, and it was great for laying out in the sun!

238015865.name: A bay with hotels
238015865.author: a TripAdvisor user
238015865.reviewBody: There are several bays in Huatulco and many of them are virgin. This one has some hotels across the bay. On the right side (looking towards the sea) you will find a river that unites with the bay. \nThe sea is calm and you can find some fish if snorkel. You can also do some water sports like canoeing, jet ski, among others.\nI really recomend it if you\u00b4re looking for a hotel to stay in.

233980891.name: beautiful bay
233980891.author: a TripAdvisor user
233980891.reviewBody: Beautiful bay with a clean beach shared by 3 resorts.   Nice to walk,  Morning 7 am to 8 am and evening are best.

233503862.name: Immaculate
233503862.author: a TripAdvisor user
233503862.reviewBody: Tangolunda is incredible I can\'t wait to go back.  Big waves beautiful beach and gorgeous ocean life, just off the beach you can go snorkeling and we saw fish and stingrays and turtles.  Gorgeous Beach

232243461.name: Beautiful Huatulco
232243461.author: a TripAdvisor user
232243461.reviewBody: Had a wonderful week spent here. only one day that it was storming too much to visit the beach. We spent a lot of time just looking out over the Bay.

214367946.name: Tangolunda Bay
214367946.author: a TripAdvisor user
214367946.reviewBody: I have heard this is one of the most beautiful bays in Huatulco, I have not visited any other bays in Huatulco, but I sure would like to come back and see. The ocean was beautiful,it wasn\'t to hard getting in and out of the surf,although I have heard of some having difficulties. The weather is perfect here 340 days a year. Come on down!

213667450.name: Yellow fin -Roberto
213667450.author: a TripAdvisor user
213667450.reviewBody: If you run across Roberto from Yellow Fin tours on the beach, he was wonderful! Trustworthy and safe and very friendly, speaks English. Great snorkeling trip!

212006797.name: pretty but crowded
212006797.author: a TripAdvisor user
212006797.reviewBody: no doubt it is pretty to look at. very crowded because most beach hotels are there. not special for swimming or snorkeling. compared to cancun and tulum beaches there is no reason for going to huatulco.

207968066.name: A crowded beach with rough surf
207968066.author: a TripAdvisor user
207968066.reviewBody: Since 3 of the major all-inclusive resorts are sited on this bay, it is busy with tourists and less secluded.

205824608.name: Very nice beach
205824608.author: a TripAdvisor user
205824608.reviewBody: Onl;y 3 resorts and a golf course on this bay. It gets rough in storms, and the waves crash really high. The sand gets very steep after a storm. There is an underow to watch for, plus the sand ends abruptly which makes you go from waste deep to over your head. Rather unpleasant if your are not ready for it.

200991613.name: Beautiful area
200991613.author: a TripAdvisor user
200991613.reviewBody: We stayed at the Barcelo resort in tangolunda bay. Great beach. Warm water. This beach has the Barcelo, the Dreams resort and the Secrets Resort.  Look for Tony Lopez Lopez on this beach, usually in front of the Barcelo. Tony is an awesome guy that has his own boat and will take you out to tour the bays of Huatulco, view the dolphins (we were lucky enough to see hundreds of them!) go snorkeling, and go swimming on beautiful seclude empty beaches only accessible by boat... We had an awesome day with Tony. We paid 300, left our resort at 8:30 am and returned at around 3pm. They were 8 in our family(adults and kids) and we all had a great time with Tony and his buddy Charlie Brown :)

200825362.name: Absolutely Beautiful
200825362.author: a TripAdvisor user
200825362.reviewBody: Tangolunda is absolutely stunning...there is something bout Tangolunda Bay that takes you breath away and steals you heart.  It makes you want to come back.  So scenic, the beaches are beautiful and is just a stunning place to visit and to vacation.

200388099.name: Best Bay Ever
200388099.author: a TripAdvisor user
200388099.reviewBody: I have never swam in the Pacific ocean as much as I did at Tangonlunda Bay.  Very warm and pleasant small waves

199403064.name: It\'s not the bay, but the overall location
199403064.author: a TripAdvisor user
199403064.reviewBody: Tangolunda Bay is one of the 7 Bahias de Huatulco. The waves and rocks are not great for snorkelling (average clarity, hard to be comfortable along the rocks). I snorkelled along the on the East edge of the Dreams beach and saw rays among many other fish, but make sure you got at low tide for best clarity. I was very tempted to attempt to swim to the big rosk in the center of the bay, but with boats and jetskis traversing the water between the rocks and the beach, plus the waves breaking on the rocks, I decided it may not be safe enough to try. It is also a longer swim than it looks. The water does get deep quickly, so this may be a good spot for SCUBA.

197194850.name: Not appealing
197194850.author: a TripAdvisor user
197194850.reviewBody: We went there to snorkel and were disappointed to find a slanted beach lined with resort beach clubs and a massive amount of people. It would be difficult to sit anywhere or leave your things unattended on the beach, if you were not staying at one of the massive resorts, although there is a nice stretch of beach at the one end.

196821018.name: Beware of rough surf
196821018.author: a TripAdvisor user
196821018.reviewBody: The beach was nice but the surf was rough, it was easy to get dumped, take care with children. Most of the beach was taken over by large hotels but there is a public beach. Catch a colectivo taxi there and back costs about 10 pesos each way.

196472999.name: Beautiful beach Tangolunda
196472999.author: a TripAdvisor user
196472999.reviewBody: Nice beach. So big that you can find places with less resort people although all the big resorts are along this stretch. We visited for a day even though we were staying somewhere else/no charge to get in to look/use their piece of beach and pool. Tangolunda beach has big waves and steep beach so not great for children or poor swimmers.

194577199.name: Repeat visit
194577199.author: a TripAdvisor user
194577199.reviewBody: Love this region. Small picturesque bay - not too noisy.  Waves are rough and ocean floor is soft so be careful if you like to tide the waves.

194178160.name: Dreams hotel
194178160.author: a TripAdvisor user
194178160.reviewBody: Located facing Tangolunda Bay . Water calm. Also good for snorkeling and excellent weather. Will return back

192897074.name: Barcelo resort
192897074.author: a TripAdvisor user
192897074.reviewBody: Is located on Tangalunda Bay\u2026one of the largest bays in the area. Kept very clean\u2026not over  overcrowded\u2026good to walk from end to end

192507804.name: The bays are so nice
192507804.author: a TripAdvisor user
192507804.reviewBody: This area is resorts and nice small shops.You could get beer or ice cream.We tried three restaurants, all were good.The Viena was the best of them,so friendly.

191959022.name: too many people
191959022.author: a TripAdvisor user
191959022.reviewBody: this is party zone - too many big hotels - too many families with kids. if you want quiet - go to Sta Cruz.

191174856.name: Tangolunda Bay- means woman with beautiful face
191174856.author: a TripAdvisor user
191174856.reviewBody: Tangolunda Bay is one of the 9 bays in Huatulco.  It is where Dreams/Barcelo and Las Brisas resorts are located.  Beautiful beaches and ocean views.

187438436.name: Beautiful Bay
187438436.author: a TripAdvisor user
187438436.reviewBody: A wonderfully calm Caribbean blue waters. Warm and inviting right in front of the Dreams and Barcelona AIs.

185345083.name: Bring bug repellent
185345083.author: a TripAdvisor user
185345083.reviewBody: Our hotel is right on this bay. It\'s quite beautiful.  lots of fish swimming around the ocean. The beach is nice but lots of sand flies.

180527696.name: NICE BEACH
180527696.author: a TripAdvisor user
180527696.reviewBody: Wonderful beach, but you must be careful and a very good swimmer.\nThe best way to,access this beach is thru one of the hotels or beach club.\nThere are many men selling boat trips , fisherman selling very fresh sea food.

169347866.name: Beautiful
169347866.author: a TripAdvisor user
169347866.reviewBody: Worth touring this large bay on Wave Runners.  Can be rough at times.  Snorkeling possible on the Las Brisas side of the bay.  Some of the houses on the cliffs are beyond words.  Vendors can be annoying but that\'s how they make a living.

161271431.name: area is beautiful
161271431.author: a TripAdvisor user
161271431.reviewBody: This is the area of the main hotel zone and there are 7 bays of beautiful beaches, and some are accessable only by boat and/or path in woods. Others have some local native people living there offering local food and hand made crafts. In front of the Zasshila Camino Real hotel in the bay, usually in front of room #3, there are some divers that will offer you a plate of freshly caught oysters, and/or abalones for an inexpensive fee. Cannot be any fresher than this.

160982337.name: Snorkling
160982337.author: a TripAdvisor user
160982337.reviewBody: Very Nice bay accessible by Taxi allowing for scenic drive.  A favorite to the families of Huatulco so a little busy.  But has some really nice Coral reef with Plenty of different species of fish to be seen

155906420.name: Safe, not overdeveloped.
155906420.author: a TripAdvisor user
155906420.reviewBody: Tourism zone. clean, and good jumping off point to other locations via cab. Watch for the fast cab drivers tough.

153173055.name: The Only Sailboat in the Bay
153173055.author: a TripAdvisor user
153173055.reviewBody: We arrived on our sailboat from Puerto Madero and anchored in the bay.   The bay is beautiful, defined by to rocky points and off-lying islands limiting somewhat the entry of ocean swells.   Several resorts lining the bay were very attractive and appeared well kept, although one (large white at head of bay) appeared to be closed.   The water was murky and cool for swimming and snorkeling.   One suspects that when the winds blow hard in the Tehauntecpec this bay could be quite rough...  We intend to visit by land soon...

151191861.name: Huatulco YES!!!
151191861.author: a TripAdvisor user
151191861.reviewBody: weather cannot be beat and the natives are FABULOUS people!!!!\nThe hotel Dreams we would certainly recommend.  It is in a great location with a nice stretch of beach

151131274.name: One Big Drawback
151131274.author: a TripAdvisor user
151131274.reviewBody: I agree with all of the previous reviews, this beach is gorgeous, but do want to mention one thing I feel is very important to know. Unless you are staying at one of the resorts ON this beach, the access is questionable at best. You go in through a small trailer park, then have to walk over broken skids and planks, over mud and through trees. There are many low hanging branches, and the footing is sketchy. Then you come to a chain link fence where you turn right and walk along it for another minute. PLEASE BEWARE: there is barbed wire along the top of this fence that tilts in over the path along which you walk. We didn\'t even notice it on the way in. I think in spots it wasn\'t 2 inches above my husband\'s head, and he\'s just 5\'10". This beach does not currently have public access for people in wheelchairs that I know of, and might be difficult with those with limited mobility. And if you have a small child in a pack on your back, please be cautious and watch for the barbed wire.

150950827.name: Excellente!
150950827.author: a TripAdvisor user
150950827.reviewBody: Because you are on the bay, you are protected from crashing waves. The water is clean and inviting. Great walking beach

150855977.name: The Beach
150855977.author: a TripAdvisor user
150855977.reviewBody: The beach is all sand and NO rocks.  Great for taking walks on in the morning.  If you go to the very end by the Dreams Hotel, take some bread with you and you can feed the fish in the water

148642852.name: Great Views
148642852.author: a TripAdvisor user
148642852.reviewBody: Great views! Always HOT in Huatulco! This is by far the most scenic area in Mexico we\'ve traveled to.

131679120.name: Beautiful Bay
131679120.author: a TripAdvisor user
131679120.reviewBody: We took the boat trip out to the 7 bays and it was such a tranquil trip, the water is beautiful and the stops and history lessons were great!

128979637.name: Town
128979637.author: a TripAdvisor user
128979637.reviewBody: We loved this little town ate at |Alegretia? Have the seafood platter it is huge.  Great shops for some local items to purchase.  People seemed very kind and willing to help and happy to please!

127164545.name: Too many hotels
127164545.author: a TripAdvisor user
127164545.reviewBody: Nice place to drive through, but too many hotels.  I prefer a place a little less populated.  With Huatulco having so many options,  finding something to suit your taste is easy.

126612082.name: Great beach
126612082.author: a TripAdvisor user
126612082.reviewBody: stayed at the Dreams Spa Hotel, beautiful beach, feed fish right out of your hand in 1 foot of water. Well kept hobbi cats, great swimming.

125615609.name: Nice place to stay
125615609.author: a TripAdvisor user
125615609.reviewBody: This is a great place to stay, with a variety of hotels on the beach, decent restaurants, safe to walk around even at night, easy inexpensive cab ride into either Sta Cruz or Crucecita from here.

125569437.name: eco friendly
125569437.author: a TripAdvisor user
125569437.reviewBody: went on a boat tour, it is an ecological reserve which i liked but the beach wasn\'t to much different then the hotel beach

125417895.name: Great bay
125417895.author: a TripAdvisor user
125417895.reviewBody: Great bay with some fun waves but easy swimming and lots of snorkeling.

125239251.name: My Favorite
125239251.author: a TripAdvisor user
125239251.reviewBody: This is where the most resorts are located... excellent swimming and water sports.

124075367.name: LIFE IN "FIVE STAR LAND"
124075367.author: a TripAdvisor user
124075367.reviewBody: I didn\'t stay here while in Huatulco but did hang around there amost every day; the beaches are open to everyone, you can have lunch and drinks there, I even used the pools but of course didn\'t ask for towels.aThere are alwsays a lot of taxis handing our thee, and I enjoyed visiting the big hotels.

123763336.name: Cute little place by the golf course
123763336.author: a TripAdvisor user
123763336.reviewBody: Really neat things to see in this little area down the road from our Dreams resort...

122177768.name: Nice beach but.....
122177768.author: a TripAdvisor user
122177768.reviewBody: This is a beautiful stretch of beach but has very little to offer in terms of public access to drinks or dining. The far end where dreams has its outpost is crystal clear and fish swim up to you to be fed.

121208379.name: Tino Snook Boats
121208379.author: a TripAdvisor user
121208379.reviewBody: Make sure you look for Tino on the beach and its called Snook Boats.Went one on one snorkelling.Puff fish caves and seahorses!!!Clean boats too.tried to catch some marlins and tunas and seen huge sea turtles,He was the best and remembered us 4 days later.Make sure you look him up!!

120504241.name: A nice beach, but taken over by two hotels
120504241.author: a TripAdvisor user
120504241.reviewBody: If youre not staying at the Dreams or Barco hotels, theres nothing here to do but swim and sunbathe. There is one place to buy food next to the Barco hotel, and it was expensive as they have a monopoly on the area. The beach is filled with people trying to sell you fishng trips, snorkelling trips and while friendly, they were more peristant here than anywhere else, due to the majority of more well off travellers (or those willing to pay US prices) at the aforementioned hotels which are two of the most expensive hotels in the area (about 800% more expensive than other hotels in the area)\n\nThe beach is beautiful, but unless youre staying at the hotel, give it a miss and go to one of the other bays such as Maguey.

118033648.name: Tangolunda Bay a resort backdrop!
118033648.author: a TripAdvisor user
118033648.reviewBody: Tangolunda bay is home to several resorts including Dreams and Barcelo. There is access to the beach as there are many beach vendors walking up and down the beach getting business from the people in the resort pools that line the beach.\n\nOn the main street going through the Tangolunda area, there are shops and restaurants. It is another just beautiful area to walk and enjoy the scenery. If you get tired of walking there are many taxis driving by that will gladly stop!

662446522.name: Amazing beach
662446522.author: a TripAdvisor user
662446522.reviewBody: This was the most amazing beach I have ever visited.  Arrived by boat.  Water is pristine but there are dangerous undercurrents so it is best to swim in the areas that are protected by the large rocks.

657395119.name: Beautiful Secluded Beach
657395119.author: a TripAdvisor user
657395119.reviewBody: Went here for the first time on a bay tour with Tony. (Tino) We didn\u2019t stop here as there are too many  places to see.

656571161.name: This beach is different, but didn\'t appeal to me.
656571161.author: a TripAdvisor user
656571161.reviewBody: First off, I did a lot of research about my trip and learned that you can walk to Cacaluta Beach.  Sounded good - I had the details.  Let me set this straight: there are TWO trails; one is a sandy offroad vehicle track, and the other is a shaded, jungle path, with birdwatching platform and a couple interpretive signs - the jungle path is about half the distance than the ATV trail. The ATV trail starts at the oft-described gate with guard that closes at 6 pm, at the end of a street opposite the turnoff to Maguey Beach.  The jungle path starts about a block before the gate, on the same street, at a sign, right off the street - no gate,  There is a sign when you come out onto the beach, and I had noted to myself that the way back was at the sign.  Due to the small sand dunes, the brush, etc. I couldn\'t find that sign.  Someone told me the way they had come, which was the ATV trail way, and just took that one back.  One Plus along the ATV trail is a rancho that had a sign offering refreshments and snacks.  Probably a welcome cultural interaction if you desire.  Otherwise, I would definitely choose the shorter, shaded, quiet, jungle path.\nSecond, the beach has a steep dropoff to its shoreline, and once in the water, the water gets deep fast. Trying to traverse the steep angled slope in the sand that your feet sink into was tiring and slow to navigate.  I tried to snorkel on the south side near the rocks, but even the small waves were too strong, and rocks are sharp.  I had read of an "eatery" on the beach, but there was nothing - a few stick shelters that offer a little shade.  A vagrant approached me wanting money, food and drink and wouldn\'t leave until I showed him in my pack that I only had enough water for the day (I actually had only about 7 oz. in a 12 oz bottle), and told him only enough money for the taxi.  I didn\'t feel safe leaving my pack on the beach after that, and since the water is actually too rough to get in the water, I left and went to Maguey beach and had a nice time.  \nOne interesting thing I saw at Cacaluta was an obvious turtle track either to or from a nesting site higher on the beach.  There are also holes dug in the sand with sticks in them, probably denoting the (former) location of turtle eggs.  I dearly hope they\'re from turtle conservation people and not turtle egg poachers.  Glad I did this little jaunt - the walk through the forest was the best part.

652343648.name: Great beach to hike into.
652343648.author: a TripAdvisor user
652343648.reviewBody: This is a great beach to visit! Take a taxi to the main gate, where there is a security guard, then hike the three kilometres through the bush to the beach. Or get the taxi driver to drop you of before the main gate, on the road, where there is a big board with information about the park. That trail is only two kilometres and comes out at the east part of the beach. Both ways are good. Bring an umbrella and water, as there is no shade. The water is calm and great for swimming, the beach itself absolutely fantastic.

649870936.name: Must See!!
649870936.author: a TripAdvisor user
649870936.reviewBody: Huge stunning beach with awesome surf. Easy boat ride to get their or walk through park. Bring water because nothing here but you and Mother Nature!!

646113656.name: Great beach, nothing around, immerse in nature
646113656.author: a TripAdvisor user
646113656.reviewBody: Great beach, a good place to go camping and if you don\'t want noisy tourists to disturb you. The place has no hotels or buildings. Great for feeling lost in nature.

645840877.name: Amazing Beach
645840877.author: a TripAdvisor user
645840877.reviewBody: We stopped at this beach on our 7 bay tour. It is a stunningly beautiful beach. If you have a chance to visit this beach you should.

640897618.name: Beautiful beach but we didn\'t see much snorkeling
640897618.author: a TripAdvisor user
640897618.reviewBody: This beach was beautiful and calm and well worth the 3-kilometer walk through the jungle to get there. When we were there (December 2018), the taxi driver knew right where to drop us at the trail entrance, and there were security people there to give directions (in Spanish only) and a person offering rides for hire (we walked instead). Directions weren\'t too necessary - there\'s just one left turn you need to make on the path, so we were grateful the man had told us about it, but we\'d have probably figured it out. \n\nThere were a couple of little eateries on the beach and a port-a-potty, so some services seem to have been added since prior reviews. It was lovely to sit and swim and watch the water. The only disappointment is that we\'d read this was a beach the boats regularly bring snorkelers to and we didn\'t find any interesting snorkeling. However, visiting La Entrega after made up for it!

638910404.name: Loved This Beach
638910404.author: a TripAdvisor user
638910404.reviewBody: It is a bit of work to get to if you are walking, but well worth it! You can make it a good hike from La Cruz if you want!

632456467.name: BEautiful Beach, no crowds but signs of a need for toilets
632456467.author: a TripAdvisor user
632456467.reviewBody: This is an awesome beach with no crowds.  We biked in with Adventura Mundo guide and there was no one else at the beach.  Although the beach was pristine and clean, in the bushes behind signs of a need to have a toilet put in.

630277946.name: Beautiful beach accessed by land
630277946.author: a TripAdvisor user
630277946.reviewBody: We stopped here by boat and enjoyed the beach and snorkelling. So relaxing and not busy as it I should hard to access by land. A nice afternoon to spend.

605137230.name: out of the way place in an out of the way place
605137230.author: a TripAdvisor user
605137230.reviewBody: Beautiful and unpopulated little visited beach in Huatulco Although accessible by land it might be easier to get there by boat.\nEither way there are no facilities so be prepared to take in and take out all the you need

591878897.name: Incredible beach
591878897.author: a TripAdvisor user
591878897.reviewBody: One of the nicest beaches in the Huatulco area.  We were dropped off as a part of our 7 bay tour.  very nice beach, very quiet, surf can be strong so you must be careful, but well worth the trip.

568106104.name: Very beautful
568106104.author: a TripAdvisor user
568106104.reviewBody: It is a long walk to the beach, but it is gorgeous.  Sometimes the waters are too rough to swim in.  It is a virgin beach with no amenities, but if you are looking for an adventure this is a place to visit.  There is usually a guard to watch your vehicle when you park.

563622079.name: Beautiful beach
563622079.author: a TripAdvisor user
563622079.reviewBody: It is a beautiful beach to visit and swim, long with gorgeous water and fun waves that are not too big. The shoreline and approach coming in from the ocean is spectacular.

552528130.name: Amazing isolated beach
552528130.author: a TripAdvisor user
552528130.reviewBody: This beach is isolated and can be reached via 45-minute hike (assuming you don\'t get lost) or by boat. There is nothing on the beach other than sand. I don\'t want to say too much as I want to keep it hidden for myself to enjoy the next time I am back.

551621939.name: Wonderful beach
551621939.author: a TripAdvisor user
551621939.reviewBody: But I dont recommend trying to hike throughout jungle to get there without someone who knows the path well. Way too easy to get lost !\nIf you do get there, this beach is secluded, clear , clean, no undertow...feels safe. No facilities.

548997495.name: Beautiful!!!
548997495.author: a TripAdvisor user
548997495.reviewBody: We hiked to this beach which was not fun! It was very humid, sticky and a bit muddy and the path initially was quite confusing. It took about 30 mins but it was so worth it! This beach is basically untouched and beautiful...lots of sand, clear blue waters and only a few people. Do take an umbrella and all you need - water and food - as there is nothing there and the sun is quite intense. Highly recommended.

546126078.name: Hiked In
546126078.author: a TripAdvisor user
546126078.reviewBody:
We hiked to this beach from Villa Blanca Hotel. There are lovely,  wide, nicely landscaped sidewalks all along  - almost to the end of the road. Took about an hour & half to get to the gate at the end of the road which closes at 6pm. There is a security guard at the gate who tells you mosquito repellent is advised - we did  not encounter any bugs.
Through the gate you walk along a jungle trail that is also used by a few ATV tours.
Took about another 40 minutes on the Jungle trail. Be sure to take the FIRST LEFT TURN ,when the trail splits....unfortunately we did not and you can walk for miles in a maze of other trails that split off leading no -where deeper into the jungle- not fun!
We got to the beach which is pretty, but quite deserted with hardly any shade except a dilapidated palm shelter. The ocean was a bit rough in this cove, which meant swimming was too dangerous, compared to the other beach coves. There was  a few other people there who had come on an ATV tour.  We did not see many birds or wildlife on the jungle trail or on the beach compared with the other beaches. We hike and swim a lot......so.....I would only recommend this beach if on a boat tour or if you have lots of time and need a new long hike in Huatulco.

480226636.name: Spectacular Beach
480226636.author: a TripAdvisor user
480226636.reviewBody: Our group of 14 arrived by boat - we jumped in and swam the last bit. How do you say WOW - but better. We walked quite a distance on the beach - it is much larger than you realize. Well worth the effort to visit.

469880265.name: WOW!  Remote & beautiful.
469880265.author: a TripAdvisor user
469880265.reviewBody: Easiest to get here by boat... but we made the 30-40 minute hike thru the woods from the end of the paved road.  BRING WATER!  Arriving at the beach is like a mirage -- after sweating thru the jungle brush you come to a magnificent, huge, hilly, powdery sand beach ringed by giant rocks & cliffs.  I\'ve been to many many beaches and this is one of the most stunning... and natural.  We saw a few private boats moored & enjoying the beach - a few other tour boats passed by... but we were the only people from land -- for half-a-day.  Swimming is ok in most areas.  Very limited shade and NO services of any kind.  Felt like Castaway!  Fabulous!

467038586.name: Beautiful and pristine
467038586.author: a TripAdvisor user
467038586.reviewBody: Accessible by boat and we found it gorgeous, almost empty and unfortunately water a bit murky for snorkelling. Worth a trip though. What a gorgeous Mexican paradise Huatulco is.

466323965.name: one of our bay tour visit
466323965.author: a TripAdvisor user
466323965.reviewBody: although we did not get off to visit this beach, we could see that the beach is beautiful.  it was deserted and would have to nice to swim....too many beaches to see...so little time....

460742620.name: You don\'t need a boat to get there
460742620.author: a TripAdvisor user
460742620.reviewBody: We asked around and were told that a boat was the only safe way to get  to Cacaluta however, Google Maps, suggested otherwise.  There is a signed foot path access down the road from the turn off to Maguey Beach.  The trail is 1.5km to the beach along a flat tree covered hard packed path. The beach is beautiful but one the day we were there the ocean was rough and attempting to enter the water would have been dangerous. On the plus side, all the boats that came into the bay could not drop off their passengers so we had beach to ourselves.  To get back to La Crucecita. we walked back to Maguey Beach (approx. 3km beach to beach) and took a taxi from the Maguey Beach taxi stand.  There are several signed walking paths in the park. The park gate is monitored by a ranger and it closes at 6pm. No services so bring your own water, food. There is a shade canopy at the beach

454367466.name: Excellent Place - lots of restaurants
454367466.author: a TripAdvisor user
454367466.reviewBody: Good place to go to eat and party.  Lots of choices for reasonably priced restaurants - mostly gringos, without the gringo prices  :-)

454001427.name: Amazing Beauty
454001427.author: a TripAdvisor user
454001427.reviewBody: We spent some time here as part of an ATV excursion. The only way to see it is by boat or by taking a trail by foot or ATV.  While we were there, a boat cruised past but I don\'t think any of the tours will stop to let you off on the beach, so the ATV option seems like a better one. From the road, the ATV trail was maybe a mile winding through the jungle. There was no one on the beach except for the five members of the tour!  Our guide had snorkeling gear along and some went into the water which was clear, warm and calm. We even saw a stingray riding the waves near the shore. This beach is breathtaking and was a wonderful stop along the tour.

448705390.name: Very beautiful, very hot. Use a hat!
448705390.author: a TripAdvisor user
448705390.reviewBody:
We walked down to Cacaluta Beach with two tour guides through the National Park. They talked about the vegetation, the climate, the animals, the insects, and the history, of the park. They explained the importance of keeping the area sustainable. We enjoyed the walk and the two friendly guides, and the trees provided shade.
They were the only two people with us on this beautiful beach when we arrived.
It was such an amazing place. Just us, the sound of the waves and some birds flying by.
Huge cliffs surrounded us when we walked to the left end of the beach where we went to cool down.
The sand and sun were equally hot, and I was glad I had a hat.
Make sure you have enough water, you will be thirsty.

443187670.name: Just cruised past this beautiful place
443187670.author: a TripAdvisor user
443187670.reviewBody: Our snorkel excursion took us in close past this beach.  It is absolutely gorgeous!  Would love to spend more time, but the water was rough for swimming and there are no facilities.  So I guess that is why it was almost deserted except for a small panga that had landed on the beach.  Going in by boat for a short stop, and with a head on the boat, is the way to go.

437239337.name: Best beach in Huatulco
437239337.author: a TripAdvisor user
437239337.reviewBody: Playa Cacaluta is my favorite beach in Huatulco. We walked in and it was an easy 40-ish minute walk. Beware though, the mosquitos are really bad (and I\'m from Winnipeg, Canada - we have the worst mosquitos on the planet!), so wear bugspray if you have it.\nThe waves are a little rough, but nothing crazy. We swam across the water to around the adjacent island to snorkel. There are tons of fish and nice coral. We also went on the island and there were a lot of crabs - just be careful getting onto the island as the waves can throw you into the rocks.

428561363.name: Beautiful beach
428561363.author: a TripAdvisor user
428561363.reviewBody: We go by boat every year, and this is one of the most beautiful of all the bays in huatulco, it is pristine but please realize there is no vendors, bathrooms, or places to to rest or sit, it is a beach in all its glory but just the beach.  If you go by boat you can use our friend Elias boat name texana and he brought an umbrella for us, with water and beer so we just enjoyed the beach

389603072.name: Spectacular
389603072.author: a TripAdvisor user
389603072.reviewBody: Stunning lost in the middle of nowhere beach with crystal blue waters and fish everywhere. A great day out with the kids.

362551926.name: Resume tu visita
362551926.author: a TripAdvisor user
362551926.reviewBody: This is the best picture ever. I love this thing. The beach looks very beckoning and I wish I could be there right now instead of this stupid school

359809111.name: Perfect beach
359809111.author: a TripAdvisor user
359809111.reviewBody: Our group of 9 rented a private boat to take us to different bays.  I\'m not sure how you would access if not on a boat.  This was by far my favourite beach in Huatulco.  We visited during the busy Easter season, so there was a group of local families enjoying camping on the beach - I really liked this - to know that the beach was favoured by locals.  Other than that the beach was deserted.  There was another group of scuba divers while we were there.  We snorkelled for a good hour off the boat.  Our guide dove and found a blowfish, an octopus and starfish to show us.

357596670.name: Simply beautiful
357596670.author: a TripAdvisor user
357596670.reviewBody: One of the most stunning views. Beautiful untouched beach, areas to scuba dive and just gorgeous. Would love to visit again.

350955943.name: Nice quiet beach
350955943.author: a TripAdvisor user
350955943.reviewBody: in order to get there you have to walk for 45 mins. Beach is really nice with no people (counted 7 when I was there). Note that there are no facilities except a palapa so bring water etc

347453530.name: A long walk
347453530.author: a TripAdvisor user
347453530.reviewBody: Cacaluta bay has long beautiful beaches, but the sea can be too rough for swimming, and snorkelling is minimal. The hike from the car park to the water takes almost an hour, but a lot of the path is shaded. I only saw two other people all day, apart from guards at the gate

347357463.name: NATURE
347357463.author: a TripAdvisor user
347357463.reviewBody: Beautiful beach, with a shape of a shell.   You can only get to this beach walking.  If you have a car, you can park at the end of the street and walk for about an hour through land that is part of the Huatulco National Park.  I recommend to make this visit during the day (not late) take water and something to eat, as there aren\u00b4t any shops inside.  You can travel by boat too from Huatulco and it will take you about 20 minutes.  Once you\u00b4re there is really nice, you can enjoy only what nature offers, beauty.

341042850.name: Quiet and amazing!
341042850.author: a TripAdvisor user
341042850.reviewBody: Only accessible with boat. A long and beautiful beach in the reservate.\n\nWe dived just outside the beach with Huatulco Dive Centre, fantastic experience!

339971635.name: Surf Day off the Resort
339971635.author: a TripAdvisor user
339971635.reviewBody: This was a out 40 minutes ride to the beach.  We were able to rent surf boards as we approached, no boogie boards though.  There was a little restaurant that had beer and food available, and 2 large covered areas set back from the water where you could relax.  The break was not too hard, but a few of us were able to get up on the boards and ride a few waves in.  The rest just played in the waves.  It was definitely a highlight for our trip, as when we got there there was only about 10 people there.  A nice break from a busy hotel resort.  For the day ride there and back including a stop for beer and the driver that waited for us, it was 300 pesos each.  The driver even stopped at a market so we could buy beer and then when we didn\'t have a cooler to keep it he found on for us.  Hell of a deal!

310190822.name: Good beach not in front of a hotel
310190822.author: a TripAdvisor user
310190822.reviewBody: This beach made my trip a lot better because in the hotel I stayed at wasn\'t very good. I drove there but it was worth it. The beach was calm and not a lot of people were there.

306408553.name: Beautiful off the beaten path beach
306408553.author: a TripAdvisor user
306408553.reviewBody: An amazing beach but a bit tricky to find.  We had a friendly young Mexican guy take is to this beach which is probably 4 easy miles round trip.  There are no signs and lots of little roads taking off in all directions.  The wild life s zing and we saw wild monkeys!  We also saw about a million butterflies (not really but it seemed like it).  Check it out but have a guide or good directions.

305814534.name: Go early in the morning: when it is absolutely empty
305814534.author: a TripAdvisor user
305814534.reviewBody: Wonderfull beach in the National Park. To reach it you need to rent a lancha, little boat. There is no commercial activity at all: no ships or kiosks or vendors. Just you. Take at least several litres of water. And relax. At around 11 am other people will start arriving. It will never be crowded, there\'s plenty of space. But if you want exclusivity: do it in the morning: at 08:00 it was all beach just to ourselves.

298103289.name: The walk, the hike, the beach
298103289.author: a TripAdvisor user
298103289.reviewBody:
We always walk from our condo in Santa Cruz to this beach.  I am guessing about five km or so....anyways we start early and head to the trail head, this year marked by a lovely girl cactus, really.
There is an alternate route just a bit farther up the road, but we like like nature trail.
The trail through the jungle, past an amazing lagoon, and finally to the beach is one of my favourite walks.  The beach is huge and we are often the only people there.  It's a great place to hang but does lack shade, beware.  Bring water too, there is nothing there but sand and water..
If you like to get off the beaten track go here.  If you are nervous about the walk there are ATV trips available.

281001426.name: The best beach in Bah\u00edas de Huatulco!
281001426.author: a TripAdvisor user
281001426.reviewBody: Cacaluta beach is my favorite place in Bah\u00edas de Huatulco. The beach is clean and quiet. It is like a private beach. During our honeymoon we rented a boat in Santa Cruz and we spend a half a day there. If you go bring your own food and drinks because there are not restaurants on the beach and don\u00b4t forget an umbrella and sunblock.

267793377.name: Secluded Beach
267793377.author: a TripAdvisor user
267793377.reviewBody: This is an awesome remote beach accessible only by boat or a hike through the jungle. It is a very large, virtually deserted beach fronting on the jungle.

260768947.name: Like something out of a dream
260768947.author: a TripAdvisor user
260768947.reviewBody: We stopped here by boat and were the only people on the beach.   We didn\'t see another boat even pass the bay while we swam and had lunch.  It\'s almost unbelievable that a place like this exists so close to towns and resorts.  Very special.

258287241.name: Nice to visit first thing in the morning.
258287241.author: a TripAdvisor user
258287241.reviewBody: Beautiful beach.  Be sure to watch the sunrise there in the morning and be sure to bring your camera.  stopped to have a beer at one of the local restaurants there one afternoon.

257956107.name: Experience it before it is gone
257956107.author: a TripAdvisor user
257956107.reviewBody:
As you have read, most people think Cacaluta beach is only excessible by boat.  This is incorrect.  This beach boarders the National Park and is accessible by a dirt path that you can bike or walk on. 
We rented bicycles and a guide from Easy Bikes and had an amazing adventure.  

This beach will not be accessibe to the public for long. The Mexican Government has sold this property to a developer.  Yes, a National Park Property!  As you can imagine, this is a controversial issue for the local people.

Cacaluta is an extraordinary beautiful beach, heart shaped and isolated.  The water is good for swimming, body surfing, snorkeling.  Great romatic way to spend the day!

Being isolated, you will need to bring all provisions for your outing.  There is a small thatched hut back from the beach out of the sun.

257328449.name: Fantastic beach
257328449.author: a TripAdvisor user
257328449.reviewBody: Nice and quite. Better to go there with private boat to stay as much as you want. Diving was fantastic as well

249647303.name: beautiful
249647303.author: a TripAdvisor user
249647303.reviewBody: Sweet beach.  Go by boat with Tikko, who gives you all the time in the world to swim, walk and enjoy the lovely bays of Huatulco.  The 8 hour boat trip with him to all these gorgeous, empty beaches was one of the best experiences of my life.

248365828.name: beautiful beach
248365828.author: a TripAdvisor user
248365828.reviewBody: this beach was only accessible by boat, stopped during a boat tour. amazing white sand, beautiful turquoise water. loved it. wished we had time to go back!

247696235.name: "Living the Dream" with Eduardo
247696235.author: a TripAdvisor user
247696235.reviewBody: Visited this heaven on earth via private panga "Mantarraya II".  With corona in hand, we sat on this totally secluded beach watching whales breaching right in front of us.  What an incredible sight.  Our captain Eddy made this trip one we will never forget.  If anyone is interested in living the same dream as us, we highly recommend our amigo.  You won\'t regret it.  He can be reached at eduardovalle300@yahoo.com.  His true love for Huatulco is evident in his infectious smile and his bubbly personality.  You will come off his boat with a new appreciation for his country.

247562441.name: Boat trip with Tony Lopez-Lopez on the Viridiana
247562441.author: a TripAdvisor user
247562441.reviewBody: Nine of us went on a boating excursion with this wonderful man, his son and nephew.  His boat was clean, safe and he spoke very good English.  We saw dolphins, sting rays (jumping) and turtles.  The snorkeling was amazing and the secluded beach was the best.  Recommend Tony for sure.  Picks you up just by the Barcelo

243465564.name: Snorkeling bay
243465564.author: a TripAdvisor user
243465564.reviewBody: This is the bay were you will usually snorkel. A little small so if there are more than three boats it will seem crowded

239329187.name: We loved it because its dessert and because they filmed "Y tu Mam\u00e1 Tambi\u00e9n" there.
239329187.author: a TripAdvisor user
239329187.reviewBody: We didn\'t get to be there for too long since it was only a short stop in our boat tour, but just seeing it and standing there for a bit was a good experience mostly because of the memories I have in my youth with the movie "Y tu Mam\u00e1 Tambi\u00e9n". But its great also that it doesn\'t have humans selling stuff. Great for clear landscape pictures.

233460557.name: Unspoiled Beach
233460557.author: a TripAdvisor user
233460557.reviewBody: This beach is gorgeous... came here through the sea, we jumped off the boat and swam to shore, the waves are huge and roaring.  Really Beautiful.

200616744.name: Don\'t let them develop this beautiful spot!
200616744.author: a TripAdvisor user
200616744.reviewBody: we were here 5 years ago and it was untouched. Beautiful, this time we went by boat and they bay is full of snorkelers destroying the coral reef. although not developed yet the beach had pedlars there! FFS People! Stop the madness. Leave this beautiful river and bay as it is. Do not allow huge hotel development to move in here.

194317449.name: Beautiful, stunning, peaceful.
194317449.author: a TripAdvisor user
194317449.reviewBody: It was the beach of our dreams. Clear blue green water that we could\'ve swam in all day long. We snorkelled by the rocks too and saw a great variety of fish & coral. It is worth taking your time and finding the breaks in the rock. I advise taking food with you so you don\'t have to leave to eat at one of the busier beaches.

191649226.name: best beach ever
191649226.author: a TripAdvisor user
191649226.reviewBody: Just some words, the beach will take your breath away if you like secluded beaches without services.I could not get enough of this beach.Just hire a boat stay there for some houry, great clear water, the vultures are right beside you and you will have a unique beachexperience which will last forever

186434029.name: Tarzan i\'m not!
186434029.author: a TripAdvisor user
186434029.reviewBody: What a great day! Our tour guide (Oscar) was fantastic, and the meal that was prepared for us was the best meal i had on my trip.

152642644.name: What a beautiful beach!
152642644.author: a TripAdvisor user
152642644.reviewBody: This beach is only accessible by boat and has no development, which we loved.  It\'s a large beach and there were only 4 other people on the beach when we were there.  Kids had a blast swimming, even found a little tunnel in the rocks which they thought was pretty cool.  Highly recommend a boat tour and while on the tour be sure to stop at this hidden place of Heaven on Earth.

143691434.name: secluded non developed beach
143691434.author: a TripAdvisor user
143691434.reviewBody: nice un developed beach, reached by boat or a hiking trail(wet/muddy) when I was there.  good snorkelling/diving around the island close by.

127164406.name: very nice beach, but not for a swim
127164406.author: a TripAdvisor user
127164406.reviewBody: great snorkeling off the boat close to Cacaluta.  Lots of waves and undertow, so not great for swimming

125239221.name: Magnificient Beach
125239221.author: a TripAdvisor user
125239221.reviewBody: once again Great for snorkelling and sight seeing.

122543876.name: Breathtaking
122543876.author: a TripAdvisor user
122543876.reviewBody: Cacaluta is a spectacular virgin beach which you can arrive to either by land or water. However be prepared that if you go by land, you are going through a National park which is beautiful & there is about a 30-40 minute hike to get to the beach; if you\u00b4re not familiar with the area & the wildlife & fauna ask for a guide through the National Park. Many of the small boat operators can drop you off & then pick you up from the beach at a set time. Do inform your hotel of your plans ahead of time as sometimes cold currents come in & the waters get choppy for the boats. This is rare but its best to take the precaution. Ensure that this bay is part of your travels, you will enjoy its seclusion & privacy. Don\u2019t forget to pack beverages & food as there is nothing there, but an absolute paradise to be enjoyed. Don\u2019t forget to sign a petition to save the National Park & beach as there are plans to destroy its ecosystem for a golf course. Huatulco already has one which hardly ever gets used. It would be a great shame to lose this breathtaking bay. SAVE CACALUTA

122474424.name: Quite a hike, but worth it
122474424.author: a TripAdvisor user
122474424.reviewBody: The walk to Cacalute is long and hot, but the gorgeous beach on the other end is well worth it.

89577855.name: The best beach in Huatulco
89577855.author: a TripAdvisor user
89577855.reviewBody: Here is where the Academy Award-nominated Mexican film director Alfonso Cuar\u00f3n shot the final of Y tu mam\u00e1 tambi\u00e9n. If you don\'t want to walk 20 minutes across the woods, you have to need a boat to get to this beach. Once you get there, though, you\'ll understand why it\'s called Huatulco\'s best beach. Try to avoid week-ends, during the week it can happen that you are there alone, as it happened to me and my friends: we had the huge beach for us only. It was amazing. It\'s one of the beaches I misses the most. Hope to be back soon!

52206071.name: my favourite bay
52206071.author: a TripAdvisor user
52206071.reviewBody: Okay, we were just there for about an hour but it is absolutely stunning. There are no facilities at the beach (that I could see), so you would need to bring your own shade and snacks and carry out any garbage with you. There is a freshwater lake at the top of the beach. There was a small group from a cruise ship who were picked up about 30 minutes after we landed, leaving us as the only ones on the beach. Wow! We stopped here on our Bays tour - our guide, Tony Lopez Lopez (highly recommended - get him on the Tagolunda Beach) took us to several bays and will design the tour for your interests/needs. The surf is pretty strong here, so not for small kids but we still managed to go in for a dip.  Absolutely beautiful - I doubt I\'ll see another beach like it.  Next time, I would like to stay here for a few hours and then when ready, go to a neighbouring bay for lunch.

675357987.name: A rare Combination
675357987.author: a TripAdvisor user
675357987.reviewBody: A place which has been a church for 1000 years and a mosque for 500 years. Make sure you read about it before going, to be able to relate everything you see. Definitely go with a tour guide to be able to understand everything.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

674374775.name: Highlight of Huatulco
674374775.author: a TripAdvisor user
674374775.reviewBody: We are so thankful to find this gem that was recommended by many on Tripadvisor. We were fortunate to have a private tour with the owner and we got to sample some of the mangostan fruit that was absolutely delicious. The beauty of the exotic flowers here was just breathtaking. We also saw a lot of butterflies, heard a lot of tropical birds, and smelled wonderful smells on this tour. Even though a lot of the walk was shady, I recommend taking a bottle of water. The waterfall visit was still very nice in the dry season.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

673062481.name: Amazing piece of history
673062481.author: a TripAdvisor user
673062481.reviewBody: Amazing architecture, and the history behind the building is so unique! Be sure to have a tour guide with you to explain the significance of this astounding building... I had done research before visiting, but our guide revealed details I hadn\u2019t come across as yet. \n\nYou haven\u2019t visited Istanbul if you haven\u2019t visited Hagia Sofia!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

671733723.name: Do this!
671733723.author: a TripAdvisor user
671733723.reviewBody: We were staying at an airbnb in La Crucecita and were able to arrange pick up and drop off at the apartment- no problem, through email, several days before we wanted to go. The 900 pesos, per person, we paid was well worth the transportation, tour, and meals. The property is gorgeous and the food is simple yet delicious. Armando was able to fill us in on local history and was very patient to give us the time we wanted to explore and ask questions- we never felt rushed to finish a meal or hammock session or swim time. It was one of my best days in Huatulco.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

661448820.name: Beautiful location, magical experience.
661448820.author: a TripAdvisor user
661448820.reviewBody: Such a beautiful location. The food was spectacular and definitely a highlight of the experience. Recommended excursion.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

658834113.name: Biological wonder
658834113.author: a TripAdvisor user
658834113.reviewBody: Had a great time visiting Hagia Sofia. Unfortunately I don/t have his card nor do I remember his name but we were lucky to have a guide that spoke very good English. He was well versed in the history of the area and diversity of the flora and fauna along with the birds and butterflies that we saw and was able to explain them in detail. The two meals served were cooked in an open air kitchen and were worth the price of admission. It was a very warm day when we were there and swimming in the river by a waterfall was a cooling respite. While we were  there they were working on adding a zip line along with some cottages to stay while attending yoga classes. If you are in Huatulco, Hagia Sofia is a place to spend a peaceful day that you will remember for a long time.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

657828157.name: Magical Oasis
657828157.author: a TripAdvisor user
657828157.reviewBody: Don\'t miss this tour. It was inspiring to be immersed for a day in the amazing farm and retreat that Armando is creating. The open air breakfast and lunch, the tropical fruit tasting, the leisurely tour of the amazing flower trail and orchard, relaxing in hammocks by the river, viewing the innovative caba\u00f1as that are under construction, the swim in the Magdalena River and the waterfall--every bit of the tour was so enjoyable. We also enjoyed our driver, Ricardo, and his lively and informative tour of  thebsights along the way to Hagia Sofia. We would love to return for a longer stay when the caba\u00f1as are finished!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

657393206.name: Great experience.
657393206.author: a TripAdvisor user
657393206.reviewBody: Have been meaning to visit for the past few years and finally made it.\nVery nice walking tour of a qnique property.  The owner has gone to great lengths to create a beautiful place filled with plants from all over the world.\nThe owner and the tour guide were both very knoledgeable and friendly.  A very nice experience!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

655479506.name: Beautiful Place
655479506.author: a TripAdvisor user
655479506.reviewBody: For the price of 900 pesos we were picked up from our hotel in an air conditioned van at 8:30 a.m. and made the trip to the beautiful organic gardens which is approximately a 40 minute drive.  Our tour guide Omar and driver Eduardo made the tour very enjoyable as they both were very knowledgeable and entertaining.  Upon our arrival we were served a delicious breakfast of fresh organic fruits and the best bananas I have ever tasted - this coming from someone who does not care for bananas!   We also had a cheese quesadilla served which also was very good along with fresh coffee and delicious juices.  After being sprayed down with organic bug spray we were off on our tour.  The flowers and plants are beautiful here and we absorbed a lot of information about where they came from around the world.  There are many different trees as well of different Mexican fruits which we had never heard of before and got to sample or smell a few different ones.  They are building a few little cabanas here which will be for rent soon as a retreat for yoga, etc \nWe then were driven to a small waterfall which was nice to cool off in but be prepared and wear water shoes as the rocks were hard to walk on for some of us.  It was the perfect place to end our tour and just relax for a bit.  There are change rooms here to put on your bathing suit instead of wearing it all day.  \nWe then were driven back for a lunch of either grilled fish or chicken with rice, black beans and tortillas.  Myself and my friend had the fish which we both found delicious - in fact I ate everything off my plate \ud83d\ude33 the others in our group had chicken and most said it was good but a couple of people had chicken which they found grizzly however so I guess it was the luck of the draw!  We then started our trek home and were asked if we wanted to do a quick stop at a mezcal place which was very interesting to see how they process it.  A gentlemen was sitting and hand painting bottles for the mezcal which was great to watch.  We then were able to try many different mezcal with the cream ones being my favourite.  There were also grasshoppers which you could sample if you\u2019d like (once a long time ago was enough for me!).  You could then purchase anything there as well.  We were dropped off back at our hotel at approximately 4:30 so price wise it was an excellent tour to take considering it included transportation, informative tour guide and both breakfast and lunch!  Glad for the experience.  They do take tips (optional) after the lunch which they share with all 22 employees there including the tour guides, drivers, cooks and grounds keepers which was nice to hear.
