address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

655258324.name: Tour with Yoga Retreat Group
655258324.author: a TripAdvisor user
655258324.reviewBody: Beautiful setting in rain forest.  Amazing plants and trees with knowledgeable and friendly guide. Interesting and tasty breakfast and lunch served.  Delightful swim in river and under waterfall.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

655016097.name: Waterfall! Past and Future Ecology
655016097.author: a TripAdvisor user
655016097.reviewBody: Very accessible and affordable trip. Transport is excellent and guides informative. Very relaxed and lush atmosphere with excellent food and COFFEE.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

654220465.name: A Rare Opportunity
654220465.author: a TripAdvisor user
654220465.reviewBody:
Hagia Sofía is a beautiful agroecological development filled with plants and trees from all over the world. The tour began with a lovely breakfast which included fresh fruits and juices. Our guide Omar was friendly and knowledgeable with a great sense of humour.  We walked along a lush pathway past beautiful flowers and exotic fruit trees, learning about their quirks, various properties and benefits. At the end of our walk we were able to take a dip in the river and, for those who wished, follow it to the waterfall and stand beneath it.  Don’t forget your bathing suit!   It was exhilarating, and something to remember forever.  
Our tour ended with a delicious lunch.  Washroom and changing facilities here are very satisfactory. 
Thanks Omar, Armando and the two lovely young ladies who fed us.  
Don’t miss this tour.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

653700427.name: Country side Gem
653700427.author: a TripAdvisor user
653700427.reviewBody: Botanical garden and so much more!  Our visit at Hagia Sophia was definitely memorable.  Right from pick-up by our most knowledgeable and Friendly guide Omar our country side adventure began.  Omar provided us with a history of the area as we drove through Crucecita, Santa Maria and on to Hagia Sophia.On arrival we were introduced to Armando the visionary and owner of Hagia Sophia, he told about his arrival to the area and how Hagia Sophia came to be.  We had a breakfast of fresh fruits and coffee grown in his own orchards and gardens and then Omar took us through the magical paths of Hagia Sophia explaining the plants, and their uses in everyday life in Mexico, as well as the folklore surrounding some of the trees and other flora.  Being a culinary expert, Omar provided us with additional tips and personal recipes for uses of the many fruits, seeds, and plants found throughout the property. Omar was very engaging and kept our tour lively and fun. After our tour through the magnificent gardens,  we were fed a lovely lunch cooked on a traditional outdoor oven.  Fish and Chicken dishes wrapped in banana leaves, sided with beans and rice flavored with limes and other herbs.  And if this wasn\'t enough to make your day perfect, we ended with a swim in the Magdalena River, that meanders along the property. Even the swim had added surprises with lovely little water falls that you could duck into and a all of this surrounded by the beautiful country side!  A Must do trip as far as we are concerned.  Thankful to have had the opportunity to experience Hagia Sophia!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

652976421.name: Country side Jewel
652976421.author: a TripAdvisor user
652976421.reviewBody: Best tour guide we had during our trip!  Thank you Omar for making it memorable!  Swimming in the river, breakfast & lunch, tour of an amazing garden/orchard!  What a vision you have had  Armando, and thank you for sharing this wonder!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

652339941.name: Fantastic place to visit
652339941.author: a TripAdvisor user
652339941.reviewBody: We had a great time visiting this place. Our tour guide was very informativ, took his time answering all questions. The breakfast and lunch was well worth it. Bring your bathing suit for a dip at the waterfall at the end of the day. And wear good shoes, the tour does involve a bit of walking. There was an elderly gentleman who could not complete the whole tour, so keep in mind that if you are not very mobile, this might not be your thing. For all others, I would highly recommend it!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

651930192.name: The most pleasant surprise!
651930192.author: a TripAdvisor user
651930192.reviewBody: We read all of the wonderful reviews on TripAdvisor about this magical place, but didn\'t realize it was even more special than that!  Probably one of the most peaceful, beautiful and magical places I have ever been!  Everything was better than expected, from our driver Omar who picked us up from our hotel and was our guide, to the food, the place, the river swim!  I can\'t rave enough about this activity!  I have 2 knee replacements and don\'t get enough exercise, and yet I didn\'t find the walk too taxing.  Omar helped me get over a few rocks on the way to the river, and that was all I needed.  We got to meet the owner Armando and hear about his philosophy on plants, fences, recycling, etc.  We were served breakfast and lunch and everything was so good.  We got to taste the fruit they grow, and have some refreshing juices.  Please don\'t miss this activity! Worth every penny! A great value for what you get.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

650756503.name: Beautiful tour!
650756503.author: a TripAdvisor user
650756503.reviewBody: We visited Hagia Sof\u00eda in late January. It was a wonderful experience..so beautiful and serene! Our guide Omar was very informative and interesting! We will definitely do this again if we return to Huatulco! Well worth the $$\u2019s.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

649975732.name: Beautiful Tropical Flowering Plants
649975732.author: a TripAdvisor user
649975732.reviewBody: Our guide advised that May is the best time to visit since due to the rain everything is flush and blooming. Hotel Pick up is offered and includes a home style breakfast and lunch. We were picked up at 8:40 and were back by 5. We didn\'t swim but those that did found it refreshing after our walk. It is a bit of a drive from Huatulco.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

649543125.name: Phenomenal garden of Heliconias (bird of paradise flowers) and more!
649543125.author: a TripAdvisor user
649543125.reviewBody: This place is magical - the heliconia walk has the largest assortment of these plants i\'ve ever seen in one place, ranging from standard red to the dangling and furry She Kong variety and everything in between.  It\'s impressive that this land restoration project is only 14 years old because everything here is healthy and flourishing.  The orchards are a big success too, producing a wide variety of fruits.  If you\'re lucky, your tour with be guided by the highly knowledgeable and gentle founder Armando, and you\'ll end your tour with a delicious healthy lunch prepared and consumed at the outdoor huts.  This place represents the best of Mexico!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

649536278.name: Hagia Sofia
649536278.author: a TripAdvisor user
649536278.reviewBody: Hagia Sofia is interesting and very well presented and maintained. The meals and beverages were excellent.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

648803102.name: Highlight of Oaxaca
648803102.author: a TripAdvisor user
648803102.reviewBody: If you are going to Huatulco, Oaxaca please include a visit to Hagia Sofia. You may make reservations at the Santa Cruz marina; the very kind lady will arrange for your transportation from your Huatulco accommodation. Our guide, Omar, was a true gentleman whose humour and knowledge of the expansive plantation\u2019s flowering and fruit-bearing trees and plants made the day a highlight of our time in Huatulco. We enjoyed a refreshing breakfast, a very interesting guided walk around the expansive property, a swim in the Magdalena River and a delicious lunch. Blanca prepared the meals from fruits and vegetables grown at Hagia Sofia presenting two of the tastiest meals of our trip. Thank-you Omar and Blanca for contributing to a perfect Oaxacan outing!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

647762915.name: Visit to Hagia Sofia
647762915.author: a TripAdvisor user
647762915.reviewBody:
The pickup was perfectly on time which is always nice. 
The guide spoke very good English and seemed very knowledgeable. 
The walk through the garden was beautiful and the dip in the water close to a small waterfall very refreshing. 
The breakfast and luncheon were very tasty. 
Overall a great outing.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

647133561.name: A place of beauty and calm.
647133561.author: a TripAdvisor user
647133561.reviewBody:
This was my second trip to Hagia Sofia.  Our guide Omar picked us up at the appointed hour for the 45 minute-or-so drive to the organic plantation.  The first thing I noticed when we arrived was the wonderful air.  After a breakfast of coffee, quesadillas, fruit and juice we headed out for a 2 hour tour of the property.  Omar was fabulous, pointing out plants and trees, telling us about their origins and properties.  He was engaging, funny, knowledgeable - it was all such fun.  There were only 4 of us on the tour so we were able to take our time and see a few extra things.  After crossing the river we went up to where many fruit trees grow, and where the owner, Armando, is building cabins to accommodate overnight guests.  We sampled fruit from various trees - cacao, limon real, and almonds and picked a few grapefruit.  Then Omar drove us to the river where we swam and played in the waterfall.  Lunch was chicken (also choice of fish or vegetarian) cooked in banana leaves with beans, rice, tortillas and tostadas, salsa, cactus and more juice.  Delicious.  We were home by about 4 p.m.  
Armando was also at the plantation so we were able to visit with him and talk about his vision.  He works closely with people from the nearby villages, hiring workers, helping to introduce new crops, marketing produce, giving workshops.  He's passionate about this place.
It's a tour not to be missed..  
Bring organic bug spray.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

646960981.name: 100% delightful.
646960981.author: a TripAdvisor user
646960981.reviewBody: The tour of Hagia Sofia was one....maybe "the" most enjoyable experiences of this trip. I encourage you to refresh and energize your body, spirit and soul in a day tour of Hagia Sofia.   You will be Immersed in a caring environment that includes flora and fauna and be returned to the "real world" hopeful and alert.  Soothing balm to the world weary.   Worth every peso.  Our guide was Omar.  Fun, funny, knowledgeable authentic.  Love this place!  Maybe not great for toddlers....

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

646655794.name: need improvement
646655794.author: a TripAdvisor user
646655794.reviewBody: some books or gift related to plants would be more attractive, also if the track can be designed to a round circulated track, it would be more wonderful.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

637524302.name: Very interesting experience
637524302.author: a TripAdvisor user
637524302.reviewBody:
Bought it from the agency in Santa Cruz near the cruise terminal, cash only.
Current prices: MXN 650 if no cooked breakfast/lunch, MXN 750 with. Food is pretty basic but for MXN 100 you'd have to fill on your own around one hour and 30 minutes. Transportation (shared) from the hotel is an additional MXN 150 - pretty good price, taxi one way from Huatulco is probably more, and getting a taxi back doesn't seem an easy task.
Overall schedule:
- 8 to 9 AM hotel pickups
- 9 to 10 AM drive to Hagia Sofia, last 2-3 KM on an unpaved and often bumpy road.
- 10 AM to 10:30 AM breakfast, quesadillas with onion and tomato plus fruits. Coffee too - not tasty (for me).
- 10:30 AM to 12:30 PM visit the botanical park, quite fun (many plants are not native species). The walk isn't very demanding but heat and humidity can have a serious impact. Hose yourself with bug repellent before getting there.
- 12:30 PM to 1:30 PM short break, than a 10-15 minutes drive (even bumpier road) to a river waterfall (inside the park) - water shoes highly recommended! - then same drive back to the main entrance/food serving area.
- 1:30 PM to 2:30 PM lunch: cactus with salt/salsa as appetizer, then fish or chicken with rice and beans.
- 2:30 PM heading back, with a 15-20 minutes stop at a Mezcal factory. Getting back to the hotels around 3:30 PM to 4 PM.
Good guide, comfortable van (only 5 visitors though), it's worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

636840187.name: Photographer\'s Paradise
636840187.author: a TripAdvisor user
636840187.reviewBody: Escorted by owner Armando from the hotel to his magical gardens, we experienced an incredible Oaxacan adventure. Exotic butterflies, flowers, fruit trees and more we experienced 6 hours.  One tip: wear walking shoes as some of the terrain may be a challenge for older folks!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

636676465.name: An Adventure of the Mind And Soul.
636676465.author: a TripAdvisor user
636676465.reviewBody:
Hagia Sofia is the life long dream of Armando the owner. Dedicated to the preservation of flora and fauna, Armando also seeks to educate everyone on sustainable organic food sources both indigenous and from around the world. 

The tropical plants display incredible blooms, and a wide variety of fruits are grown which you get to sample on the walk as well as at the TWO prepared meals highlighting Oaxacan cultural mainstays. Two highlights for me were the chance to taste cinnamon bark right off the tree and a fruit hybrid of a lemon and a mandarin.

Armando exudes a sense of peace as he leads you through his paradise. He is content with what he has and is eager to share that philosophy in a gentle manner.

It is all topped off with a chance to swim behind a waterfall in a refreshing end of the tour which is followed by lunch. As Armando said when asked if he enjoyed the swim after the hike, "For me, the plants are lunch, the waterfall is my dessert".

A spiritual delight to the senses, Hagia Sofia beckons you for return trips at different times of the year as the plants go through their annual cycle.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

634946389.name: A beautiful walk and such an interesting excursion!
634946389.author: a TripAdvisor user
634946389.reviewBody: Armando picked us up promptly at 8:30 from our hotel, and on the way to Hagia Sofia he told us interesting facts about the park and other places. We were treated to a tasty traditional breakfast and lunch, and all the natural juice we wanted. The walk was fascinating, with a profusion of blossoms. The swim up to and under the waterfall was refreshing!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

633862107.name: Oaxacan paradise
633862107.author: a TripAdvisor user
633862107.reviewBody: We toured this amazing eco agri property with the owner Armando. We were treated to traditional Oaxacan food, beautiful botanical gardens and biodynamic orchards with a waterfall swim to wash it down with! Many thanks to Armando and his wonderful crew.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

630583744.name: Wonderful!
630583744.author: a TripAdvisor user
630583744.reviewBody: It\u2019s truly a magical place in which you learn about many native and non native plant species of the area. You get to try many of them all while walking through a trail. Armando picked us up and spent the whole day giving us a tour just for two people! The food prepared by Laura was delicious! Recomendadisimo!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

624427570.name: Beautiful and delicious!
624427570.author: a TripAdvisor user
624427570.reviewBody: Hagia Sofia is the most incredible garden you will ever visit. It is a vast property, curated with love by Armando, his wife, and his team. Hundreds of plant species are grown on this property, many of them local tropical fruits that you will get to sample... It is breathtaking and a must-visit if you are in the area.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

602492232.name: The most spectacular botanical gardens you\'ll probably ever visit.
602492232.author: a TripAdvisor user
602492232.reviewBody: Born out of passion.   Armando was a successful businessman in Monterey Mexico, helping to manage a large clothing manufacturing plant.    While doing well financially, it wasn\'t his dream.   Hagia Sophia is.    He has taken several hundred acres of land outside of Santa Maria Huatulco and developed a spectacular organic garden of flowers, and orchards.   You will see flowers you\'ve never seen before, fruits you\'ve maybe heard about but never seen or tasted.    They will drive you there in an air conditioned van, serve you an organic breakfast prepared outside, tour you through the gardens, bring you to a beautiful creek with a small waterfall for a swim, serve you lunch and bring you back to your hotel or condo.    You can buy tickets in advance at their office in Santa Cruz.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

602399822.name: Amazing out of the norm ecological learning trip
602399822.author: a TripAdvisor user
602399822.reviewBody: We truly loved Hagia Sofia. \nWe loved the trip, the tour, the food, the scenery, the fruit trees, flowers, all those birds and butterflies. \nIf you are urban bound I honestly can assure you will love it as you will instantly reconnect with your hidden nature side in this magical project. Go make the effort of visit this glorious place in the middle of the oaxacan tropical forest. VIVA OAXACA.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

589844417.name: Beautiful and a true taste of Mexican hospitality
589844417.author: a TripAdvisor user
589844417.reviewBody: My husband and I visited Hagia Sofia in June. Armando picked us up personally and ran the tour for just the two of us. He told us all about Oaxaca as we drove up the mountains and through small villages/towns. The variety of plants and trees was amazing. The people were so kind and hospitable. Our tour ended with a delicious meal and a dip in the river. This is a trip we will not forget. Thank you to Armando and all of the staff.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

587049397.name: Naturally a WONDER!
587049397.author: a TripAdvisor user
587049397.reviewBody:
Just like their motto this place is naturally a wonder. We enjoyed nature in all his expressions. First enjoying delicious fruits grow there. Then by watching and smelling all kind of plants and flowers, a beautiful path in companion of our amazing guide, through a serene creek, amused and surrounded by 
nature, we learned a lot. We relaxed in hammocks while watching butterflies, then enjoyed a refreshing time under a waterfall. We had breakfast and lunch there, appreciated the way they cooked, the utensils, the whole experience of love, respect and enjoy nature.
A hidden gem during our trip in Huatulco. Don’t miss it, is totally worth the trip.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

576149337.name: An amazing place!
576149337.author: a TripAdvisor user
576149337.reviewBody:
Friends we made at the resort invited to visit Hagia Sofía. We decided to explore it but had no idea what to expect. 
Pick up was right on time and during the drive we were told a lot about the local history and plants we were seeing. 
On our arrival we were served a great breakfast before we toured the botanical gardens. 
Beautiful flowers, birds, butterflies, a sparkling stream to relax by in comfortable hammocks. We got to try many of the fresh fruits that grew here. 
Definitely will visit Hagia Sofía on our next trip to Huatulco

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

570611972.name: Truly paradise
570611972.author: a TripAdvisor user
570611972.reviewBody: Armando (the owner) has truly carved himself out a piece of paradise to share with the world. After spending several days on the beach it was so nice to see the lush natural beauty of the foothills of the Sierra Madre.  Armando has put so much care and love into cultivating a beautiful tropical garden full of gorgeous flowers and delicious fruit trees (even mangosteen!) Whether you\'re interested in local agriculture/flora-fauna, or you just want to relax in a hammock by the Magdalena river and eat authentic Oaxacan quesadillas, this is an amazing place to visit!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

570585669.name: Really wonderful
570585669.author: a TripAdvisor user
570585669.reviewBody: This is a great little beach-relief thing to do. It\'s a kind of experimental mountain plantation with both traditional and exotic plants, and truly amazing and wildly unusual flowers. The hiking is not strenuous, and most of it is in the shade, but it is a bit hot near the end. But then the river swim is a great little cool-off. Armando, whose dream project this is, makes for a charming host and guide and is full of interesting knowledge about Oaxaca and Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

565355921.name: Great Day!  Far from the maddening crowds....
565355921.author: a TripAdvisor user
565355921.reviewBody: We really enjoyed this tour of Armando\'s gardens, fruit trees and tropical plants.  Very peaceful setting alongside the Magdelana River - a work in progress that is most admirable.  Loved the swim in the river at the waterfall - very refreshing.  Good snacks and a lovely day spent with others on the tour.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

564103510.name: Must see
564103510.author: a TripAdvisor user
564103510.reviewBody: Armando (the owner)  the place sparkling in indigenous plantings of flora and fauna.Anyone into nature would be missing out by not visiting

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

563224253.name: A piece of paradise
563224253.author: a TripAdvisor user
563224253.reviewBody:
We had a beautiful and surprising day trip to Hagia Sofia in early February. Armando signed us up for the trip and promised us a day of interesting fruit, flowers, trees and waterfalls. None of it disappointed. Our driver was competent, informative and friendly and although the road was rough in parts we never felt unsafe.
Our breakfast of authentic Oaxacan quesadillas, exotic fruit from the park and coffee was delicious.
We had a great tour and marvelled at the variety of beauty growing wild and cultivated by Armando and his team. He has created a real slice of Eden in the countryside. I learned so much about nature that amazed me.
Swimming in the Magdalena River was refreshing. 
Recommend this day trip to anyone looking for a refreshing change from the sun and sand, great as that is. I hope I can return to hear about the success of the mangosteen crop!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

560879646.name: Lovely day trip
560879646.author: a TripAdvisor user
560879646.reviewBody: Needed a change from the beach scene and I couldn\'t have picked a better way to do that. Lush gardens with many interesting plants. Food served was very good. Everything is organic. Our guide was very knowledgable and personable. I wish I could remember his name. Omar? I especially loved the swim in the river with the little waterfall. So refreshing!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

560750120.name: Amazing journey in the mountains.
560750120.author: a TripAdvisor user
560750120.reviewBody: From the moment we were picked up at our hotel by Oscar, I know we were in for a well guided tour. Oscar knows the road to Hagia Sofia well and pointed out many things along the way. If someone had a question he was more than happy to provide an informed reply. The breakfast and lunch cooked right before your eyes in the Mexican kitchen were hearty and flavorful and featured many of the fruits and plants grown on the property. The tour through the garden was very educational and it was a real treat to see the trees that many of the fruits and spices we take for grated actually come from. The refreshing waterfall swim was a nice way to refresh after the tour. I will return again to experience other seasons and harvest here at Hagia Sofia.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

559300247.name: Great place to visit and great hospitality
559300247.author: a TripAdvisor user
559300247.reviewBody: Had wonderful breakfast and lunch, best local made food and served in lovely little clay dishes. Hagia Sofia is a beautiful place. Lots of variety of flowers, trees, etc. to walk around and see/learn about. Loved the swim in the fresh water stream! The drive up there from Santa Cruz is not so long and bumpy now with more pavement and newer van with Moises driving. This site is a "must do" conservation reserve.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

559074843.name: A good learning experience!
559074843.author: a TripAdvisor user
559074843.reviewBody:
We were picked up at our hotel and it took about a hour to get there. The group was small, maybe a dozen people total.
You get to learn about Mexican plants and flowers, information overload for me but still good to know.
Breakfast and lunch were served and were only above average. Breakfast included fruits I never heard of, which I appreciated. 
At the end we were allowed to swim in a small river with a small waterfall, really refreshing.
There was a place to change into a swim suit.
The only thing they really need to do is upgrade lunch a bit, a few more water stations and maybe printing information of what you are looking at.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

558101213.name: Not to miss experience.
558101213.author: a TripAdvisor user
558101213.reviewBody: What a fabulous day we had at this unique property.  Moises was so informative about the natural health benefits to so many plants.  \nUpon arrival the ladies made us a breakfast of furits, juices and quesadillas, made in the old tradition open stove,  delicious.  After our cooling off in the river and waterfall we returned for a yummy lunch.  Best day!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

557973830.name: Unique Day Trip
557973830.author: a TripAdvisor user
557973830.reviewBody: We\u2019re so glad that we decided to visit the Hagia Sophia property! Moises, our bus driver and tour guide, is fluent in both English and Spanish and very knowledgeable. It was fun to enjoy the delicious breakfast and lunch in a charming outdoor setting, featuring fruits and vegetables grown there. The walk was very doable, although at times hot due to the high humidity, and we learnt so much about the trees and plants and their various medicinal uses. Cooling off in the river and under the waterfalls was the perfect finale to the walk.\n\nIt\u2019s quite a long drive and the roads are not in the best shape, so if you are prone to car sickness, this may not be the trip for you.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

557743201.name: Awesome Day Trip
557743201.author: a TripAdvisor user
557743201.reviewBody: The best trip on our stay in huatulco. Our guide Moses was very good. You spend with travel basically the whole day first breakfast then touring the gardens then a swim to the waterfall and back for lunch.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

556185119.name: Cant get enough of Hagia Sophia
556185119.author: a TripAdvisor user
556185119.reviewBody: Ours second visit to Hagia Sophie and I could easily spend a day each week there. Wonderful stimulating environment, staff who are so keen to share their wealth of knowledge. A wonderful day touring these very special gardens, being fed such great ethnic food, and topped off by a swim under the waterfalls. Superb day tour, would highly recommend and cant wait to return again. They provide very effective organic mosquito repellant, wear sensible walking shoes and take your swimsuit and towel, great for all ages so long as you are mobile.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

552600452.name: The owner is amazing! Knowledgeable and friendly.
552600452.author: a TripAdvisor user
552600452.reviewBody: OMG! You must visit this botanic garden. They have the best coffee, the most authentic food, and the most beautiful bromelias. The owner himself drove us to a waterfall, where he swam with us. He showed us his garden and he took us up to the top of the mountain where he has benches, orange and lemon trees. Many kinds and types. We saw how vanilla grows. Just a perfect atmosphere, I called it a little heaven.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

549955718.name: A slice of Paradise . . . and a river runs through it
549955718.author: a TripAdvisor user
549955718.reviewBody:
There is a saying:” a picture is worth a thousand words”.  But at Hagia Sophia one picture does not do justice to this beautiful oasis.  Let’s start at the beginning: We booked our visit one day prior through reception at our hotel, although you can also book directly at the head office which is located in the Marina at Santa Cruz.  At 8:30 we were picked up by Armando in a very comfortable but dusty white truck!  Then we knew that the adventure begins. After a 45-minute ride through Santa Maria de Huatulco on a very dusty road we arrived. 
Upon our arrival we were served with fruit juices and then a typical oaxacan breakfast: a quesadilla with the wonderful local cheese, tomatoes, onions and avocado along with coffee that had a hint of chocolate.  Everything was served in locally made pottery, another nice touch. Then on to our tour along the riverbank.   This is where you became enveloped in nature’s paradise.  The flora, the fauna – it didn’t matter where you looked, one flower was more exotic than the next and they were all identified. There were also massive trees such as the fern tree, Ceiba and bamboo. As well, there were so many species of butterflies and our host could identify every one. After this sun-filtered walk along the river, we gradually climbed upward – the view was phenomenal with the Huatulco mountains in the background.  Here were the orchards.  Chestnut trees, cinnamon, apple banana, avocado, mango, mangosteen, coffee, cashew. An absolutely stunning setting. I asked Armando if he had a plan on paper when he first started planting at Sophia, and he told me that he had a vision in his mind.  Armando bought this abandoned coffee plantation 14 years ago and began planting hjs “dream” 12 years ago.   Hagia  Sophia is a labour of love and it shows as it grows. 
Back down the hill for a wonderful lunch – roasted prickly pear cactus, chicken, black beans, rice, roasted chestnuts.  There is a vegetarian option if you wish. After a small respite, off to the Magdalena River with its waterfall for a swim.  Clean change rooms and a very innovative shower.  
What a fabulous day.  We were picked up at 8:30 am and returned at 4:30 pm. We would return in a heartbeat to enjoy more of the tranquility and beauty that Armando shared with us because we could not capture it all in just one day.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

549748799.name: A nice place to enjoy nature
549748799.author: a TripAdvisor user
549748799.reviewBody: this was a really nice place to enjoy with my children. It is quiet, clean, magical. The owner is most of the times, your guide. His staff is very welcoming. I highly recommend it to everyone. Family friendly.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

547291557.name: Paradise on earth
547291557.author: a TripAdvisor user
547291557.reviewBody: We enjoyed an absolutely amazing day at this Oaxacan paradise! On arrival at Hagia Sofia, we were immediately served delicious coffee, fresh fruits and quesadillas cooked to order. Our gracious and welcoming host Armando led us on a fascinating stroll through his botanic park describing the flora and fauna along the way. Walking amongst the butterflies was a delight! Pathways are well maintained with restrooms & juice stations at convenient locations. Swimming to the waterfall for a natural massage was a highlight so be sure to bring your swimwear! And our lunch of rice, beans, tortillas and baked fish and chicken was so scrumptious! Try the habanero salsa if you want to add some fire to your meal - loved it :) Highly recommend coming on a tour up here - there is a special magic to this place!!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

546501557.name: Unique......inspiring.
546501557.author: a TripAdvisor user
546501557.reviewBody: Don\'t miss this little gem of organic and sustainable agriculture. Not only the nicest people, but maybe the best informed. Truly a great experience.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

542698385.name: Eden!
542698385.author: a TripAdvisor user
542698385.reviewBody: If you are a plant lover, you will love it here.  We were given a personal tour by the owner and two delicious meals for 700 pesos per person.  It truely was like a Garden paradise.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

507114675.name: Very fun day and interesting tour
507114675.author: a TripAdvisor user
507114675.reviewBody: We thought this tour was a good value for the money. It\'s so convenient that they will pick you up and that the small bus is nice. We were not prepared for how very long the drive would be, and also that it would take some remote or bumpy roads. However, once we arrived at the location, we really enjoyed the breakfast, botanical garden walk, swim at the waterfall and lunch. The hike to the fruit trees is steeper than expected but was very interesting and offered pretty views. Overall, we really enjoyed this day and would recommend it as a good activity to do while in Huatulco.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

485531263.name: Chelsea Flower Show in Huatulco!
485531263.author: a TripAdvisor user
485531263.reviewBody: This time we wanted to see the horticultural wealth of Huatulco and decided to visit Hagia Sofia which is the home to a wide variety of flora and fauna. It is located in the mountains at an altitude between 260-390 metres above sea level. According to the owner, who came mid afternoon, this 130 hectares plantation apply eco friendly practices. I took several photos of exotic plants and flowers. We were treated with exotic fruits and my fauvorite was the rambutan. We were also given the opportunity to try the local specialty "Quesadillas" and the cute, little boy was advertising the dish. This place in spite of the insects did not disappoint!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

482755277.name: You owe it to yourself
482755277.author: a TripAdvisor user
482755277.reviewBody: You owe it to yourself to experience this idyllic locale, while visiting Huatulco, A short ride takes you to a wonderful experience, that will be the highlight of your holiday. From the tasty and unique fruits and juices, that await you on your arrival to the relaxed lunch at the end of the tour is magical.  Armando the owner and visionary of this oasis, conducts a very instructive tour of his botanical paradise, with much enthusiasm and justifiable pride. Bring your camera, as you will be able to catch some wonderful shots, to show off to your friends back home.\n       If you are lucky, you may be able to catch Armando\'s daughter singing with her band at Oceans back in Huatulco, we were fortunate to hear her twice

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

479473270.name: Paradise
479473270.author: a TripAdvisor user
479473270.reviewBody:
This place is just beautiful. The garden path with all those exotic flowers everywhere, the resting point at the creek. Then the orchard. 
Not done after orchard because lunch is just amazing. Great food.
Wait there is more the swimming hole by the creek.
Best way to describe this place. PARADISE

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

475599560.name: Garden of Eden
475599560.author: a TripAdvisor user
475599560.reviewBody: This was an amazing tour!  It started with a number of fresh fruits and juices and honey.  I had never tasted Poma Rosa or Chico Zapote (my new favorite fruit) and they were amazing.  My tour was led by the owner, Armando who cares passionately about the land and the people of the area.  An amazing amount of both flowers and trees, too many to count or name (although Armando did an excellent job)  The walking tour was followed by an amazing quesadilla lunch on an open fire, mexican stove.  It was a wonderful tour!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

475126526.name: BreathTaking
475126526.author: a TripAdvisor user
475126526.reviewBody: It is amazing to see all the different plants, flowers and trees. We toured the gardens, went for a dip  in the river by a falls and had a wonderful meal!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

474087837.name: Where does the fruit come from?
474087837.author: a TripAdvisor user
474087837.reviewBody: We spent half a day eating and touring round the estate. Breakfast and lunch were excellent. The highlight was seeing tropical fruits being grown.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

466942717.name: Eat fruits you never knew existed!
466942717.author: a TripAdvisor user
466942717.reviewBody: Cool experience touring the botanical reserve. Tried some really interesting fruits, some I\'ve never heard of. Great property with very nice facilities- enjoyed the provided snacks and meals on the tour. Will be a nice place to stay once they add accommodation.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

466077752.name: Beautiful and Welcoming!
466077752.author: a TripAdvisor user
466077752.reviewBody:
This past February my Father and I had the opportunity to visit this breathtaking place. Upon arrival we were welcomed warmly and served fresh fruit grown on the property, delicious coffee and a homemade quesadillas. Everything was prepared on a clay and brick outdoor oven fueled by a roaring fire! After our delicious snack we gathered our belongings and enjoyed a relaxing walk through a beautiful garden with all sorts of stunning flora. Our walk brought us to a little creek with hammocks strategically placed along the shore. After a little nap we headed back to the beginning where we were greeted by a spectacular lunch consisting of chicken, rice and black beans cooked in a banana leaf. This meal was absolutely delicious!

After our amazing lunch we headed off to another section of the property to find a pooling section of the creek with a small waterfall draining into it! The swim was refreshing and a great way to wrap up our adventure!

The folks that run this attraction are very kind and welcome you with open arms! I highly recommend visiting this little gem!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

463074350.name: A wonderful way to take a break from the beach!
463074350.author: a TripAdvisor user
463074350.reviewBody: Armando is a wonderful, kind, informative host.  We arrive at 9 am to a fantastic breakfast of homemade quesadillas (the best ever) and a wide variety of fresh fruit from his farm.  We then went on a guided tour with Moises.  Moises was very knowledgeable.   The garden and farm is gorgeous and it is just amazing what Armando has done and his plans for the future.  After the tour we took a short ride for a cool dip in the river.  The setting was perfect.  Then back to the gardens for a delicious lunch made again in the open air kitchen.  We left very full after all the home cooking the ladies did.  Everyone was very welcoming and kind and we highly recommend spending the day at Hagia Sofia.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

463057800.name: Amazing trip with a great guide
463057800.author: a TripAdvisor user
463057800.reviewBody: Finally on our fourth trip to Huatulco we finally went to Hagia Sofia. This beautiful botanical park was one of the highlights of our trip to Huatulco. We went into Santa Cruz and booked at their office. We were picked up at our accommodation right on time in a nice air conditioned van by Moises who made our approximate 1 hour drive through the country very interesting as he pointed out sights and provided lots of good information. He spoke very good English and was very knowledgeable about the gardens and surrounding area. Armando also joined us at times during our tour. We had two authentic Mexican meals included (breakfast and lunch) which were very tasty with lots of food. It was also nice to taste some of the locally grown fruit. The tour itself is over 2 hours long but the walking is quite easy. Organic insect repellent was available to use. Halfway through the tour we stopped for a rest by the peaceful river, where hammocks were available to use if you wanted. After the tour and before our late lunch we were taken to the river on the property where we had a nice swim. There is also a waterfall and cave to explore during your swim. On the way back we stopped at the church in Santa Maria Huatulco for a short visit. This tour is highly recommended and well worth the reasonable cost.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

462790135.name: Awesome trip and Fantastic Guide!
462790135.author: a TripAdvisor user
462790135.reviewBody: Our trip to this beautiful botanical park was one of the highlights of our stay here in Huatulco.  We were picked up at our accomodation in a nice air conditioned van and had an interesting drive through the hills, about a 45 minute drive. Our guide, Omar spoke very good English and was so interesting and knowledgeable about the spectacular flowers and tropical, organic fruit and nut trees. Oh yes, he was very strong too as he carried a 10 pound jackfruit all the way back to camp. You wouldn\'t believe that this fruit could hang from a branch on the tree! We had two authentic Mexican meals included (very tasty and plentiful and great tasting organic coffee, which also is grown in the area. There is a bit of easy walking involved. Halfway through the tour we stopped for a rest alongside the peaceful river, where hammocks were provided to relax and zen out for awhile. We also were taken to small waterhole where we had a refreshing swim. If you want to get away from the beaches and do something a little different this is highly recommended and good value for the price.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

462124939.name: Paradise in the mountains
462124939.author: a TripAdvisor user
462124939.reviewBody: The day was marvelous starting with a lovely Mexican breakfast al fresco. Great  Mexican coffee by the way.  The guide was very informative as we learned about flowers, fruits, trees and the area. Hundreds of trees are in bloom at the moment. His English was great and our group was very lucky to have him with us. The owner was along to add to our knowledge for a part of the day. A rest in hammocks by the water along with a swim i n a lovely natural pool were icing on the cake. All staff are very friendly  and we could not have been happier with our visit.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

461544687.name: Never got picked up!
461544687.author: a TripAdvisor user
461544687.reviewBody: As a gardener with a home-based nursery business I was super excited about going on this tour. I thought it would be a wonderful way to spend our last day in Huatulco. I booked online and confirmed with Cristina. After waiting nearly an hour and sending several emails during that hour, I got our Concierge to phone them. Cristina told her that I hadn\'t confirmed. As she was read all the emails back and forth between us, she still insisted that I hadn\'t confirmed and wouldn\'t pick us up. If you decide to deal with them I suggest a direct phone call and to make alternate plans. We had forgone breakfast and bought and applied organic bug repellant as instructed. What a total waste of time and money! Glad I hadn\'t paid anything in advance for the actual tour!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

461023193.name: Great break from the beach
461023193.author: a TripAdvisor user
461023193.reviewBody: A couple we met in a restaurant, on their last night, recommended that we take the tour to Hagia Sofia. We\'re glad we did. There was a problem with the internet but we managed to make reservations by phone. We were picked up punctually at nine by Omar who was our guide for the day. He was great! After picking up another couple we drove straight up about a forty minute drive. We were met at the outdoor kitchen where a couple of ladies prepared empanadas for us with coffee, fresh juice and fresh fruit. Without going into too much detail we took the tour which was fun and educational with breaks. February may not be the ideal time to visit as a lot of the fruit ripens in April but we wont be there in April nevertheless we had enough.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

458704522.name: Be careful
458704522.author: a TripAdvisor user
458704522.reviewBody: I would love to give a great review here but it\'s not possible. Reservations were made yesterday for us to go today. We waited and waited for our pickup and no one came or called. We called when they opened at 9 and they said they would try send contact the driver. Apparently he said sorry I am too far away. Their trip is cancelled. Sorry guys you lost a customer and now everyone will know how we were treated. We were told you would arrive at 830am and we were at the door and ready by 755.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

457416520.name: Loved it!!
457416520.author: a TripAdvisor user
457416520.reviewBody: I absolutely love plants, fruit, butterflies, birds, nature trails, rivers, and waterfalls of all sizes. If you don\'t care about those things, don\'t make time for Hagia Sofia. It\'s an adventure that takes the bulk of the day. Upon arrival, you\'re treated to a glorious breakfast with fresh fruit (from their own trees), quesadillas, and coffee. Then it\'s a slow walk to tour the tropical plants. The guide was very thorough with information about each plant. If you aren\'t interested in knowing about the plants, I suppose you can walk on and explore on your own. Then it\'s a hike up the hill to the fruit trees, which has amazing views of the surrounding landscape. This is followed by a quick drive to a waterfall and a swim in the crystal clear river. The day ends with an amazing lunch. It\'s a very zen pace. Our guide was bilingual, but my friend who went the following week said her guide was not. Something to consider when booking.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

456167975.name: A breath of fresh air
456167975.author: a TripAdvisor user
456167975.reviewBody: Hagia Sofia is a little corner of paradise in the mexican sierra. We were blessed to have Armando as our guide for the day. Armando is the visionary behind this botanical garden, which began by cutting down the undergrowth of the mountain jungle and introducing, one by one, exotic flowers and local and foreign trees. The day begins with a breakfast of fresh fruits and juices all from his fruit trees, mexican fajitas and coffee, all seasoned with valuable information on how this oasis came to be. Then a walk through the exotic flower gardens, followed by a hike to the fruit plantation and all along, stories of how each plant or tree came to be selected, cared for, and successfully introduced into this ecosystem. At the end of the tour, a refreshing plunge into the falls, followed by a lunch of either fish or chicken, mexican style, completes this wonderful journey.\n\n A must see, and we are looking forward to returning in a few years to experience the evolution of remarquable project.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

456027990.name: This was an inexpensive tour and gave us a good understanding of the vegetation
456027990.author: a TripAdvisor user
456027990.reviewBody: Our guide brought us from the hotel.  We were greeted with a traditional breakfast and a 2 hour walking tour.  We had a swim in the river and then lunch.  Our guide was knowledgeable and pleasant.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

455237078.name: interesting, and active enough for families
455237078.author: a TripAdvisor user
455237078.reviewBody: Wonderful experience.  The man who created this green cathedral provides an informative and inspirational tour of this site.  The waterfall and river swim are a refreshing conclusion and sure to be a hit with youngsters.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

449422968.name: Must do for the nature lover
449422968.author: a TripAdvisor user
449422968.reviewBody: Finally, after ten years travelling to huatulco, we did this tour and it was well worth it!  Armando picked us up right on time and drove us to his little piece of paradise.  We met the other guests, had gorgeous fruit, coffee and fruit water along with fresh made quesadillas that were amazing!  This was followed by a tour of the property, with stories about every planting.....beautiful.  The towering fern trees, orchids, bromeliads, bamboo, palms, and so so much more made us feel like we were in Jurassic park.  The smells and colours, amazing!\nA cool off in the river was nice and the late lunch that followed was tasty!  We had the chicken breast cooked in a banana leaf served with beans, rice and some broccoli with fresh tortillas and tostadas.  Lots more fruit too!\nWell worth the price paid!  A true treat for your soul.  If you care about nature and the world we live in, visit this place!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

449032479.name: Our nicest day was spent here
449032479.author: a TripAdvisor user
449032479.reviewBody:
Don't miss visiting Ermando's paradise.
The temperature is 4-5 C degrees lower here than in the lower level towns and on the beaches of Huatulco.
You will be eating the best quality fruits and the most authentic home made meals.
The botanic garden presents beautiful flowers, amazing trees, and a winding little river, flowing with clear, cold water. 
But the most beautiful thing was to experience Ermando talking about his past, his favourite spot in the garden, his beliefs, his life experience and all his knowledge about each individual tree or plant that he chose to plant.
It was not only an educational, but a spiritual and uplifting visit.
After the walk through the botanical garden, Ermando  took us out to the waterfalls for a swim. 
We loved every minute of this trip! 
I highly recommend it to everyone.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

448591627.name: A THOROUGHLY ENJOYABLE DAY!!
448591627.author: a TripAdvisor user
448591627.reviewBody: We had our grown children visiting us for Christmas & we wanted to do a day trip with them from Huatulco.  The driver picked us up in an air conditioned bus & it took about an hour to get there. Upon arriving, we were served a breakfast of the fresh fruits that were grown on the property. Armando, the very personable owner, came around to chat with us all. We had a nice, leisurely time before heading out for a tour of the grounds. Nothing was rushed, a nice, stroll through the beautiful gardens featuring 200 varieties of exotic flowers and plants. Armando was very informative & a very engaging host. We stopped along the Magdalena River to lie in the hammocks before we carried on to the area where the fruit is grown. The amount of work and effort that went into transforming this run down coffee plantation to what it is today is quite remarkable. After this, we went to the waterfall & had a much needed cool down in the refreshing waters. Upon our return,we were served another meal of either fish, chicken or vegetable quesadillas.  We definitely did not go home hungry!! A beautiful way to spend the day!!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

442720932.name: Nice day to spend away from the beach, yet you still get to swim!
442720932.author: a TripAdvisor user
442720932.reviewBody: We were picked up right at our condo be Armando the owner of Hagia Sofia. Right away we started talking about his life and how he ended up creating the beautiful gardens he has today.  Once we arrived we were treated to coffee and breakfast. Everything tasted good and then we did the walk. We talked about every tree, flower that he had planted on his property. It was very interesting and informative. (note: for the most part the walk is very easy, we were in flip flops). It\'s just when you have to walk to the water falls its a little tricky or you can ride with Armando back to the falls. The highlight at the end of the walk is the water falls, it\'s not big but very refreshing and fun to play in and fight the current. Once we had enough of the that we had lunch which was delousous. Very much worth every peso we paid.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

439620253.name: One of our best days
439620253.author: a TripAdvisor user
439620253.reviewBody: We loved this day trip! It\'s a highlight of our stay in Huatulco. The grounds are beautiful, he food was delicious, and the swim through the falls into the cave was exciting. Armando has created a very special place that you shouldn\'t miss. His tour was informative and fun. Come hungry - you\'ll get 2 delicious meals!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

439312883.name: Beatyful Butterflys
439312883.author: a TripAdvisor user
439312883.reviewBody: we has been at hagia sofia once, but this time what we really enjoy was the beautiful butterflies, there is the amazing place to spend the day.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

431560145.name: very beautiful
431560145.author: a TripAdvisor user
431560145.reviewBody: visited this beautiful place in January 2016, it is a beautiful place , with a trail along a creek with all sorts of tree\'s and plant\'s.  The trail goes across a river, which leads you to all the fruit tree\'s they have planted.On return to the vehicle we had a lunch of fish ,rice, onion, and beans, all wrapped and cooked in a banana leaf.  I hope to go back there again soon.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

398647419.name: Beautiful tour of tropical flower park and eco friendly fruit gardens
398647419.author: a TripAdvisor user
398647419.reviewBody: Highly recommended for day trip from the Huatulco beaches. The tour includes and excellent breakfast and lunch with as much as tou can eat of the local fruits produced such as mangistenes and rambutans, but also local fruits. A swim at the local waterfall is a nice experience of swimming in the jungle. And we didn\'t even be bitten by mosquitos. The owner speaks very well English and is a nice tour guide. \n\nStrange that Tripadvisor links this place also to Istanbul.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

398087639.name: Hagia Sofia
398087639.author: a TripAdvisor user
398087639.reviewBody: Very interesting and beautiful architecture, I absolutely loved it. I think this is an absolute must see for anyone travelling to Istanbul. People are incredibly friendly & the atmosphere is welcoming. The mosaics were astonishing if you take into consideration the size of them & the history.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

379799327.name: Must see
379799327.author: a TripAdvisor user
379799327.reviewBody: Make time...we went in April. Will go back during a different season to see what is blooming or coming to harvest. More than enough to eat, be sure to go to the falls. They are quite small, perhaps overrated, a great way to cool off after your tour though. Bring good hiking sandals or other footwear, eco sunscreen and Eco bug repellant. We didn\'t find bugs an issue at this time of year.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

366190270.name: Flower Garden Tour
366190270.author: a TripAdvisor user
366190270.reviewBody: We we\'re served delicious tacos before the tour. The flowers we\'re beautiful & lush. We cooled off in the Falls  & than  had  an awesome meal of chicken or fish in the out doors.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

363646196.name: Great day
363646196.author: a TripAdvisor user
363646196.reviewBody: My wife kind of talked me into this visit, I am so glad she did, it was a great day! Our guide picked us up on time, was very well spoken and informative, even funny at times. The food was wonderful, the atmosphere was incredible and the swim in the natural pool was outstanding.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

362930777.name: Tropical paradise
362930777.author: a TripAdvisor user
362930777.reviewBody: A botanical garden now 12 years in the making including both local and imported flowers and fruit trees. The amount of work that has been invested is amazing, from the planting of flowers and fruit trees to the extensive irrigation systems. After walking through a representative sampling of this extensive area, a swim below a waterfall helps to cool off. Lunch is also served and was quite good. A very informative experience.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

361348981.name: Amazing Plants, Owner, Swimming, and Food
361348981.author: a TripAdvisor user
361348981.reviewBody: Hagia Sofia is a 130-hectare agro-ecological project located in the mountains of southern Mexico near Huatulco.  We went there as part of a tour down the coast and it was one of the highlights of our trip.  We had a personal tour of the gardens by the owner, enjoyed swimming by a small waterfall, and had an excellent lunch.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

359530829.name: Great Day Trip
359530829.author: a TripAdvisor user
359530829.reviewBody: Huatulco? Day trip? Do this one if you like plants, quiet place in the country, and a swim in a cool little river. We happened upon this trip by luck and throughly enjoyed the day. Pick up at the house, snack upon arrival and a wonderful explanation of the trees and plants and how they\'re used. Back for a swim and a quick bite and poof you\'re on your way back to town. Next time in Huatulco, check it out.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

358592336.name: if you enjoy nature, this is a \'must do\'!!
358592336.author: a TripAdvisor user
358592336.reviewBody: Lovely, lovely day. We were picked up at our condo front door and arrived after an interesting. 40 minute or so drive. Breakfast awaited us--several exotic fruits, lovely \'fruit water\' and coffee, followed by quesadillas with avacado grown there. Off on our walk--so many flowers, shrubs, trees, butterflies, birds.....and a passionate owner/creator of this place, Armando, to tell us all about it as we walked through the property. Peaceful, with only the sounds of the birds and the river for an hour and a half as we walked. Then a refreshing swim in the river with a \'massage\' from the small but powerful waterfall.  THEN! To crown it off, great lunch of chicken, beans, rice, and cactus. A memorable day for sure, and NOTHING like you would find in a beach town. If you enjoy nature--this is the place for you! Worth every peso!!!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

353154988.name: A walk in paradise
353154988.author: a TripAdvisor user
353154988.reviewBody: Spent a very pleasant day at Hagia Sofia. The botanical garden is awesome, the orchards interesting, the waterfall beautiful and refreshing and lunch was excellent. It is also inspiring to see the effort and love that go into developing the gardens and providing green jobs in the area.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

352940537.name: A brilliant day
352940537.author: a TripAdvisor user
352940537.reviewBody: Picked up at our condo and spent a beautiful day at Hagia Sofia. The guide was right up to date with everything we saw, the food was good as is the honey we purchased. Excellent way to spend a day.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

352193651.name: Way too expensive....
352193651.author: a TripAdvisor user
352193651.reviewBody: ....long drive, pretty place but the $30 price tag was way too high.  Not worth the drive or the price.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

351889424.name: Beyond our Expectations
351889424.author: a TripAdvisor user
351889424.reviewBody: When we arrived up at Hagia Sophia from Huatulco, we were met by very friendly staff.  We were directed to the local juice table and were served a great breakfast as well as good local coffee with a touch of homegrown cinnamon.  After breakfast, we were toured around the preserve by very knowledgeable guides.  Especially informative guides were Hattie and Phillie and of course, Armando, the owner.  Got introduced to many trees, plants, flowers and of course fruit trees.  Then went for a dip in the River under the waterfalls. After our swim, we were served a good lunch with option of either chicken or fish. I would highly recommend this excursion for anyone who visits Huatulco who is interested in nature and the outdoors.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

349428865.name: Educational, fun and healthy
349428865.author: a TripAdvisor user
349428865.reviewBody: Hagia Sofia is a leisurely walk through paradise, with an informative guide, a swim in the river and healthy home-made breakfast and lunch. Suitable for all ages and fitness levels. A wonderful way to spend a day in-land while in Huatulco.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

349419079.name: A must see for nature lovers!
349419079.author: a TripAdvisor user
349419079.reviewBody:
We visited Hagia Sofia (HS) in the second week of February while staying at Las Brisas. We booked directly with them and were picked up by van and had 7 other visitors with us. The drive is about an hour and our driver Moises was very knowledgeable on the area and destination plus spoke very good English.

HS is best described as a nature reserve. The location is quite remote, you drive 2.5km down a dirt road once off the main road and arrive at a rustic setting where 2 ladies were preparing breakfast for us over a large wood fired stovetop. We were greeted by the owner Mr. Armando who told us that he created HS because the world is being destroyed and poisoned by development and he wanted to make something healthy and special. Everything is 100% organic. Breakfast was fresh fruit grown on the grounds, juices and handmade quesadilla’s. It was delicious and healthy. There are nice washrooms on the site and you sit outside at wood picnic tables.

We then headed off down the interpretive trail which is filled with more flowering plants than one can imagine. Moises explained it all and after an hour we reached the river where we took a nice break in hammocks and had refreshments. We then proceeded onto higher ground where all of the fruit trees are located. We sampled many of the fruit right off the tree and there are many types that you will have never heard of. We then walked back to the dining area and went in the van to the river/waterfall for a swim which was fantastic. The river is cool and about 7 feet deep in places so you do have to swim a bit. It’s possible to walk around on the rocks if you’re not a swimmer. The waterfall is small with a nice cave behind it that you can stand up in. Very refreshing! Armando joined us here for a swim.

We then headed back in the van for lunch which was fish or chicken, cactus, beans and rice. All fresh made and delicious. After lunch you pay Armando and can also buy some organic bug spray and other products they make on site. Then it was back to town with a stop at the church in Santa Cruz. If you’re a nature lover then don’t miss this tour.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

347658233.name: Second time, even better than the first
347658233.author: a TripAdvisor user
347658233.reviewBody:
We had previously visited Hagia Sofia in February 2011 and we knew then that we would one day return to see how it had matured.

We booked directly through the Hagia Sofia website.  Armondo himself picked us up from Secrets and we stopped and picked up another couple before leaving town.   It’s about a 45minute drive to Hagia Sofia from La Crucecita. 

There is an outdoor kitchen and we were treated to breakfast soon after we arrived.  Breakfast consisted of fresh organic fruit juice/water, fruit and quesadillas.  

Armondo guided us and another couple through the property.  Things have really grown since the last time we had visited and there were a few new interesting additions including a number of varieties of bamboo.  It’s a very leisurely tour with as much time as you want to stop and observe.

After the tour we were again treated to lunch.  Lunch was rice, nopales, vegetables, tortillas, beans, fresh fruit and of course the organic fruit juice/water.

The other couple we were with weren’t interested in going to the waterfall so we skipped it as well.

We were quite pleased to return and see how it has prospered.  This is truly an excellent way to spend the day if you enjoy nature.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

346673696.name: Heliconias  as tall as a house! Beautiful River, Fruit Trees ~ Lunch too!
346673696.author: a TripAdvisor user
346673696.reviewBody: Our Travelian Tour leader, Rodrigo found us the most enchanting place to visit. We left Huatulco early in the am and arrived at Hagia Sofia for breakfast. The outdoor kitchen and surrounding tables are located beneath huge trees surrounded by flowers. We went for the delicious fruit juices prepared from fruit grown on the property and had a rustic hearty breakfast cooked over the fire. Then we toured the fabulous grounds, walking along a small pretty stream surrounded by heliconias from around the world. We bird watched, butterfly watched and admired the plantings. The trail comes to a pristine river where one can swim and then winds up to the orchards of exotic fruit trees. After our walk we returned and had a lunch served on banana leaves, and more of the fabulous juice. If you like plants, don\'t miss this site.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

346429202.name: Didn\'t want to leave
346429202.author: a TripAdvisor user
346429202.reviewBody: We visited Hagia Sofia today and had a wonderful time.  We booked through their website which worked very well.  One can go on their own or  with a taxi driver but its probably best to go with one of the gardens guides.  Armando, the owner picked us up right on time.  The garden is lovely, lush, and quiet except for all the birds.  We enjoyed a breakfast, cooked on a woodfire grill, with a variety of interesting fruits from the farm.  Armando took us on  a tour of the garden and explained what the project was all about.  He pointed out various flowers.  He obviously loved the garden.  We wound along to a river where we lay in hammocks and watched for butterflies.  We then went on up the hill to see the fruit and nut orchard and then down to the river for a swim.  Refreshed we headed back for a delicious lunch, again cooked on the outdoor grill.  This is a garden for plant and nature lovers not those seeking adventure.  We thoroughly enjoyed the laid back day and the lovely people we met.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

344867670.name: If you enjoy learning about nature, seeing new things, water falls this is for you.
344867670.author: a TripAdvisor user
344867670.reviewBody: This was a full day tour. About a one hour drive but if you want to see Mexico its worth it. We took motion sickness pills along in our van but didn\'t  need them. Moses our tour guide was great! At the end we got a refreshing swim in the waterfalls and a nice lunch. All the fruit  you eat is grown on the land .Take your camera

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

343314137.name: Not worth it
343314137.author: a TripAdvisor user
343314137.reviewBody: There are beautiful flowers and trees here, and they are laid out well. However, with our basic Spanish, asking the guide questions was difficult as he spoke no English. \nThere was no trip to the waterfall, and no lunch available at all, despite the claim, just a few fruit samples.\nGiven the length of trip there (1 hour from Crucecita in our car) and the excesive price (400 pesos per person) we found this disappointing.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

340460357.name: Just Beautiful
340460357.author: a TripAdvisor user
340460357.reviewBody: This place is like no other place I\'ve seen before. A true treasure, hidden within the jungle of Oaxaca. I went twice when I visited Huatulco. The plants, the trees, the people are all so beautiful and welcoming, except for the mosquitoes. Thankfully, they provide as much repellent as you want. We walked for like 1 hour and then went into an amazing natural river.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

336690700.name: Beautiful demonstration garden flowers and fruits
336690700.author: a TripAdvisor user
336690700.reviewBody: Tropical flowers of all sorts wander along a stream of water. Watch out for slippery footing. This is followed by a break at a river with hammocks, juice and bug spray. If you haven\'t used it at the meeting area here\'s your chance. Up some stairs to the fruit demonstration where you\'ll be shown a a variety of trees including cinnamon! Very interesting. Sadly this fruit is not harvested and much is laying on the ground. We were warned to stay away from the passion fruit vines as snakes are found there. Beautiful mountain vistas. Lush greenery. Look for the vanilla vines in the flower area. Groups were escorted to a nearby waterfall which we skipped due to having our own car. Surprisingly expensive fee.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

336315435.name: A delight for nature lovers
336315435.author: a TripAdvisor user
336315435.reviewBody: Armando is a very gracious host and made our visit unforgettable. The gardens and plantation are arranged with great respect for both native and imported vegetation. Our swim in the little gorge of the Magdalena river was the highlight of our entire stay in Huatulco, and will be remembered for years to come.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

330601798.name: Agro-ecological project
330601798.author: a TripAdvisor user
330601798.reviewBody: From the Greek meaning \u201cHoly Wisdom\u201d, Hagia Sofia is a 320-acre agro-ecological project located at an altitude between 850-1280 feet above sea level.  Our van ride was a little difficult, taking just over an hour from the cruise port and sprinkled with lots of bumps, ruts and topas (speed bumps).  The last part of the trip was via a dirt road that ends at the \u2018heart\u2019 of Hagia Sofia.  We were graciously greeted with flavored water drinks and light fruit.  My favorite quickly became the hibiscus water. We learned about organic sustainable farming as applied to exotic fruits and flowers from Southeast Asia and Mexico as well as the cultivation of rare timber trees native to Mexico.   Their interpretive trail, called the \u201cPath of Flowers\u201d, is approximately 550 yards long and is home to a wide diversity of flora and fauna. After completing the \u201cPath of Flowers\u201d interpretive trail, we loaded up in the van and drove the short distance to the falls for a quick swim.  Our drive took us across the Magalana River and provided wonderful view of the Sierra Madres.  Once our van stopped we were faced with a short and rocky hike to the base of the falls.  They seemed small to me compared to those I am used to seeing in Oregon, but were impressive non the less.  About half of the group opted to jump into the waters created by the falls.  After spending about 15-20 minutes here we then hiked back to the van and drove back to the main pulse of Hagia Sofia for our pre-arranged lunch.  The traditional lunch included tortillas, chips and salsa, rice, pot beans and cactus, along with a choice of chicken, fish or vegetable stew.  I opted for the fish which proved to be a great choice.  We also had the opportunity to try locally grown and processed coffee.  All of the plates and cups were hand crafted from local area clay and are used exclusively throughout Hagia Sofia.  Everything at Hagia Sofia is \u2018natural\u2019, right down to the organic bug spray we used.  During lunch we met the owner of Hagia Sofia, Victor \u201cArmando\u201d Canavati Nader.  Armando was born in Monterrey, Mexico.  His father is Lebanese and his mother is from Bethlehem.   He truly has a heart for savings our enviornment.  A great adventure and I could highly recommend it.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

326379018.name: Great day
326379018.author: a TripAdvisor user
326379018.reviewBody: Great walk through the forest and the many  flowering plants.The information was outstanding and the motivation in the development of the site is admirable .Fun swim in the river and good food.Even if you have been in tropical gardens before this is worth a visit.Very fairly priced for Huatulco.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

320982100.name: Tour paradise with its creator!
320982100.author: a TripAdvisor user
320982100.reviewBody:
We had the privilege of spending the day touring this beautiful paradise with Armando, the man who conceived, designed, and built his garden along a cascading river in the mountains above Huatulco. He has planted hundreds of varieties of heliconias and a variety of other flowering plants, and loves them all like his children. Armando is a self-trained botanist, and his enthusiasm for his plants is contagious. While we've visited other botanical gardens with a wider variety of plants and more Latin names on the labels, touring the garden with Armando is a unique experience. He has also planted a huge variety of fruit trees, including many tropical ones never grown in Oaxaca. He gives away seedlings to his neighbor's. He's the Johnny Appleseed of Oaxaca (but with rambutan)! 

The food, cooked by Blanquita over wood fire in an open pavilion, was among the best meals we've had in Oaxaca, including refreshing sweetened fruit-flavored water, delicious quesadillas with avocado, cooked over a comal, and, best of all, fish cooked in a banana leaf with Yerba Santa, a local wild herb, and rice flavored with tiny flowers from his garden. A variety of fruits from his garden are also offered.

A highlight of the tour was a swim (aided by a rope) to the waterfalls on his property, with a massage from the powerful cascade and a small cave with room for two to sit behind the falls.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

305385247.name: Hidden paradise
305385247.author: a TripAdvisor user
305385247.reviewBody: Without a doubt one of the finest jewels on the Oaxacan coast. An easy half day activity that will leave you breathless. From the slow walking tour of the hundreds of different flora and fauna to the gourmet meals and fresh fruit to the  mesmerizing dip in the water this is a trip I would recommend for everyone!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

290528582.name: A day in paradise!
290528582.author: a TripAdvisor user
290528582.reviewBody: We had a marvelous time at Hagia Sofia! We were picked up at our hotel and thoroughly enjoyed the ride to Hagia Sofia. The owner was so personable and shared his love of the plants and the area with us. The lunch that was provided was  top-notch, and the hammocks by the river were a welcome addition :-)

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

286992294.name: Nature\'s bounty
286992294.author: a TripAdvisor user
286992294.reviewBody: We bought tickets the day before we went at their office in Santa Cruz.  Make sure you add the breakfast and lunch on to your ticket.  It is worth the price and delicious. All meals are made on site with ingredients grown organically there.  The owner Armundo gave us the tour and we felt very welcomed. He is enthusiastic and very proud of all he has accomplished in making Hagia Sofia so beautiful and prolific. We were offered fruit right off the tree, yum. The tour was great and we saw many different plants, the river and the waterfall. A shaded area with hammocks by the river \nand water or juice supplied was a nice place to relax and cool off.  Bring your camera, a hat , and if you want to go into the waterfall your bathing suit.  Organic mosquito spray is supplied and worked as we did not receive any bites.  Well worth going!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

279848108.name: Incredible outdoor activity
279848108.author: a TripAdvisor user
279848108.reviewBody: This botanical garden was so breath taking beautiful! The owner was the sweetest and kindest man! He treated us like family and gave us the tour of the whole place himself. The food was to die for! All made fresh from everything that their land had to offer. It was clean and well taken care of! Bring your bug spray!!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

272804734.name: Paradise
272804734.author: a TripAdvisor user
272804734.reviewBody: Great place to be....if a paradise exists I am sure it looks like Hagia Sofia. Thanks for the warm welcome and all the beautiful things you showed us.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

271313025.name: Total immersion into Mexican culture!
271313025.author: a TripAdvisor user
