271313025.reviewBody: A day tour to Haiga Sofia starts with a great all organic breakfast made in a traditional native open air kitchen... just that is fantastic! The entry fee seemed rather steep at first glance, but it was more than worth it!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

264964077.name: Mountain Delight
264964077.author: a TripAdvisor user
264964077.reviewBody: The food, plants, river and waterfalls were wonderful.  The long-range plans of the owner, Armando, will benefit the whole area including the workers.  An organic farm that encourages visitors to take home ideas and products is a great idea.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

262453835.name: Beautiful!!!
262453835.author: a TripAdvisor user
262453835.reviewBody: We chose this trip and were not disappointed!!  Armando has invested alot of time, energy, knowledge and passion into this beautiful, serene place.  So many beautiful flowers, plants, fruit trees...who knew there were so many varieties of mangoes and limes!!!  The day started with us being picked up by Armando at our hotel, very interesting drive through the Old Huatulco.  When we arrived, Blanca was busy preparing our delicious breakfast in her outdoor kitchen, then off on the tour of the property!  A relaxing rest by the river in hammocks, with fresh and cold tamarind juice to cool off!!  A swim in the river and a natural massage in the waterfalls, followed by Blancas delicious lunch waiting for us when we were done!  We thoroughly enjoyed this tour, very informative, very reasonably priced and great people!!!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

261687935.name: Do not miss!
261687935.author: a TripAdvisor user
261687935.reviewBody: Absolutely the high point of our trip. A tropical paradise with home cooked native foods. Just a note to bring a good bug repellent as they have sand fleas know as Noseeim. They are invisible to the naked eye and attack in swarms leaving you with hundreds of bugs in minutes.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

261443734.name: too far too little
261443734.author: a TripAdvisor user
261443734.reviewBody: You need to be a passionate botanist to make this worthwhile. Went because guide book said "beautiful, gorgeous, and special with butterflies, birds, and flowers galore. Almost no birds, a few glimpses of butterflies moving at fast pace, and 50% of flowers seem to be genetic variations on same flower. Can only get so much from looking at fruit trees. I would not bring children under any circumstances. For myself who enjoys almost anything, I would not have gone

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

260972638.name: Making the world a better place
260972638.author: a TripAdvisor user
260972638.reviewBody: Love the organic food and how it is grown without and pesticides or fertilizers. The ride to Sofia showed us what the real life was like in the mountains. When you stay at resorts, you really don\'t get the real picture of the people and culture

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

259299059.name: Beautiful area
259299059.author: a TripAdvisor user
259299059.reviewBody: Lots of beautiful flowers and trees. Awsome food for breakfast and lunch. Nice trip. At the end of our visit we had a swim in a waterfall to cool off! Facilities were very clean and spacious. Staff were very pleasant. The owner has done an amazing job to create this organic plantation.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

257574110.name: Canyoneering
257574110.author: a TripAdvisor user
257574110.reviewBody: We did the Basic Canyoneering with Christian from Oaxaca Expeditions. We all had various comfort levels. It was great to climb around, cliff jump, rappel, and drift down the river.The hydo massage pools were hilarious! Beautiful rock and warm water.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

254322856.name: Beautiful but.....
254322856.author: a TripAdvisor user
254322856.reviewBody: This is a very nice place to visit and you get a good package, but Armando the owner harms the experience because, in his enthusiasm for the place, he spends endless amounts of time describing every stop when people really just want to see the place with minimal commentary.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

253206970.name: Beautiful and rugid
253206970.author: a TripAdvisor user
253206970.reviewBody: Hagia Sofia is a beautiful 300 acres ecoreserve that the owner, Armando, is developing to help the local people grow a variety of different fruits.  The tour was very informal but very enjoyable with breakfast and lunch being provided plus a wonderful swim in the river and a "shower" under the lovely waterfall.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

251351367.name: Felt like we were at a friends farm
251351367.author: a TripAdvisor user
251351367.reviewBody: We liked the whole experience, the food was excellent and the grounds/gardens offered insight to the eco system in that area. The owner was very patient with our many questions and offered us a unique view into the world of organic, sustainable farming in Mexico, tourism, government and local culture. We learned a lot, enjoyed our long creek side walk through the gardens, the waterfalls and the FOOD! The afternoon was well spent and highly recommend it to travelers that are interested in food, culture, gardens/crops, business and learning new things. Victor Armando has an interesting story to tell, go and listen, you will be glad you did.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

250915980.name: Organic farm and botanical garden with local foods and an amazing waterfall swim.
250915980.author: a TripAdvisor user
250915980.reviewBody: We went on recommendation from our hotel. Most people go as a tour but we had a car so we drove and it was great to see the "upcountry" life away from the beach. You will have a local breakfast sourced from the farm, tour the gardens, and then get taken to the river for a cooling dip in their private waterfall. Not to be missed. Then back to the farm for lunch, once again sourced from the farm. The owner lead our tour and is a great man with lots of local knowledge.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

249941797.name: Interesting Rainforest Visit
249941797.author: a TripAdvisor user
249941797.reviewBody: Our hotel was near the home of the owner Armando, so he gave us a 50-minute ride to Hagia Sophia.  The owner is a very interesting and personable man who cares for nature, resources, and his workers.  Our visit started with a delicious organic breakfast and ended with an even more delicious lunch, prepared by friendly staff onsite from mostly products grown here.  The tropical fruit had just been picked and the best in flavor.  There is a fairly easy walk through the forest and across a river, with many trees and plants labeled.  The expert guides pointed out and told stories about the various exotic plants and animals. Effective organic insect repellent was provided.  My husband didn\'t use it and he had a number of bites.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

245974181.name: Awesome sights, lots of fun!
245974181.author: a TripAdvisor user
245974181.reviewBody:
This place was magical, a beautiful acreage owned by a very friendly fellow named Armando who gave us a tour of his grounds. It's a kind of farm/plantation where many types of fruits and flowers and other vegetation are grown and displayed and taken care of.

It was about a 45min-1hr ride from Downtown Huatulco. The drive there was nice, we rode through some nearby towns and had a little bit of local info fed to our group of eight by the driver who accompanied us the whole time. 

Once arrived we hung around the entrance facilities where they had fruits (Try the bananas and star fruit, they were the best I've ever had), and juices, and coffee. Armando gave us a tour describing the different things they grow there.

They then provided a nice simple meal of fish or chicken alongside beans and rice. They also had cactus you could eat with the ripest lemons you've ever tried.

Then we went for a swim in and around a waterfall!

Gorgeous! 10/10

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

245168536.name: Wonderful botanical property
245168536.author: a TripAdvisor user
245168536.reviewBody: An interesting drive into the mountains and a great tour.  The owner. Armando, is a very gracious host and passionate about this development.  The range of plants is incredible and his goal of furthering organic development among local farmers a very worthwhile endeavour.  We highly recommend this tour - be sure to use the insect repellent supplied, we did get a number of bites but this in no way detracted from our tour.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

245007346.name: tour of Hagia Sophia with Armando
245007346.author: a TripAdvisor user
245007346.reviewBody:
We were so fortunate to have Armando give us a tour of his amazing garden.  there was much work done to make it what it is and it's beautifully organized and cared for.  we learned a lot about the plants and vegetables, and saw the pride taken in creating this.

Blanca prepared a lovely breakfast and lunch for us.  Lovely lady.  I think the food has to be arranged ahead of time, when you book.

the waterfall is refreshing!  we appreciated the organic bug repellent available for us.  everything was well done.       Pat H.   canada

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

244579150.name: Lunch and botanical Walk
244579150.author: a TripAdvisor user
244579150.reviewBody: Very pleasant to spend the afternoon off of our cruise ship. Nice variety of plants to see after lunch and work off some calories.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

244016477.name: excellent
244016477.author: a TripAdvisor user
244016477.reviewBody: This is a wonderful experience for nature lovers and food lovers. There is unlimited knowledge to be gain Ed about flowers and food sources on the finca. Samples of food from the trees is delightful. The river swimming was Devine. The meals were artfully prepared and of very fine quality. Thank you to all the staff and driver. It was a perfect day!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

242721650.name: Lovely Day in the Mountains
242721650.author: a TripAdvisor user
242721650.reviewBody: We had a fantastic day at Hagia Sofia. Lovely Oaxacan breakfst and lunch and a stroll through the gardens is best topped off with a swim in the waterfall.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

241033885.name: Fabulous Day in Mexico
241033885.author: a TripAdvisor user
241033885.reviewBody: Our cruise docked in Huatulco. We found this spot on the Internet. This was a great value, given how expensive the ships tours were. The office is one block from the port.For $60.00 pp we got a great ride in a comfortable air-conditioned van, to the facility (the last 15 minutes are not recommended for people with back or neck issues) We had a lovely breakfast and fabulous lunch. A guided 2 to 2 1/2 walk through lovely gardens.The guide spoke excellent English. there is an opportunity to get wet in a river that runs through the gardens, we chose to enjoy the hammocks instead. Highly recommended if you are in this part of Mexico or your cruise ship stops here.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

234335148.name: Paradise on earth-take insect repellent
234335148.author: a TripAdvisor user
234335148.reviewBody: Loved being able to be in the environment of Huatulco and see the richness of the land as well as Armando\'s creativeness and investment in the plantation he has built from scratch. He has made a beautiful paradise and is a host of unparalleled hospitality

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

228901968.name: A Magical Place
228901968.author: a TripAdvisor user
228901968.reviewBody: My husband and I spent the day with Armando on our recent trip to Huatulco. We had a wonderful time and enjoyed the entire day. We had breakfast and lunch that was delicious! The tour was educational and interesting. the swim at the waterfall was  fun! Can\'t wait to go back!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

224372016.name: A Unique and Wonderful Experience !
224372016.author: a TripAdvisor user
224372016.reviewBody: We emailed Hagia Sofia to arrange a day-long shore excursion (Huatulco) for our upcoming cruise.   The day we arrived in Huatulco, Armando (owner and creator of Hagia Sofia) picked us up and drove us to the property.  They had prepared a beautiful \'welcome meal\' for all of us.  Armando personally escorted us through the entire lush property, educating us on all the plants, trees, flowers, etc.  Halfway through the excursion, we used a footbridge to cross a stream where we were met with hammocks, shade, fruit, and delicious cashew water.  We thoroughly enjoyed Armando, his absolute passion for this lovely tribute to Nature, and his willingness to ensure we enjoyed ourselves.  At the end of our tour, we enjoyed another wonderful meal and chatted with some local people before having to head back to Huatulco\'s port and our ship.  Armando drove us back to the port.  We had a lovely time!!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

217062912.name: Too expensive
217062912.author: a TripAdvisor user
217062912.reviewBody: I went to Haga Sofia it is a very nice place but the entrance was too expensive for what we expected everyone in my family agreed to this I went due to the reviews but I will not return

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

207751296.name: Amazing place, once you get there...
207751296.author: a TripAdvisor user
207751296.reviewBody:
We ready about this place raving reviews, so we decided to visit during our stay in Huatulco.
We had a car, so we drove there ourselves, and that was a challenge.  The locals do not know the place by it's cvommercial name, and there are no signs leading to the location.  Even the locals at Santa Maria de Huatulco, which is just ~ 3 kilometers from the park, did not know what I was talking about, and I speak fluent Spanish.  The fist sign is ~ 1 km from the torn off the main road, and then you go onto a rough dirt road.
Once you get there, the place is nicely developed as an Eco tourism site.  The owner, Armando, bough the place ~ 10 years ago, and he planted most of the tropical plants by himself.  They greet you with fruits that grow on the property, fruit juice, coffee, water, and an explanation about the place.
The guided tour goes through nicely done trails, with sign of the various plants and trees.  Along the way you get to taste fruit cut from the trees on site.
See pictures of flowers, and believe me it is hard to capture the total beauty of this place in pictures.
The tour ends at the cascade, small but refreshing and there is a cave with an entrance under the waterfall.
Highly recommended.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

205788709.name: A must see when in Huatulco
205788709.author: a TripAdvisor user
205788709.reviewBody: We recently visited Huatulco as a port stop on our cruise on the Norwegian Sun.  We visited during this port stop.  We were picked up at the Hagia Sofia office in Huatulco.  We had a personal guided tour by the founder.  We enjoyed a native Mexican breakfast at the start of our tour, we tasted a banana that tastes like an apple and one that tastes like vanilla.  Wish we could get these at home as they were delicious. Before we started to the garden path we applied some natural insect repellent that was provided by our tour and it was very effective.   We started on our tour, a breathtaking walk through some of the most beautiful tropical flowers.  We took a short break to enjoy the hammocks under trees and listen to the gentle sounds of the river.  We finished our tour with a walk through the orchards, lots of different birds to see as well.  A dip in the river and under the waterfall was a refreshing stop on our tour.  A native lunch prepared over a log fire was enjoyed.  A place you will not want to miss when visiting Hautulco, Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

203753300.name: Nature and man\'s work of art in progress
203753300.author: a TripAdvisor user
203753300.reviewBody: We had the good fortune to go spend the entire day at the Hagia Sofia nature preserve for flowers, fruit trees, birds, general fauna. We were picked up at our hotel by the owner, Armando, a descendant of a Lebanese businessman in Monterrey and his best buddy, a local, whom we ran into later into our travels, also charming. The day consisted of breakfast at the al fresco kitchen, eating the best quesadilla I have ever had, all organic and wonderful organic coffee to wash down all the fruit produced at the farm, exotic and otherwise. Then the tour began for just the two of us, of all their flowers, taking most of the morning. We were bedazzled by the color and the range of varieties of the species they were specializing in. Then we were allowed a siesta on a hammock by a river, which was a welcome cool respite from the heat of the day. And we certainly took advantage of it. Then it was a tour of all the fruit trees on top of the hill, which was really hot but entertaining, seguing into lunch, a wonderful lunch prepared by their resident cook on the wood fire stove, banana leaf wrapped chicken and fish in a wonderful spicy sauce and other items as well. Then after a long discussion about conservation, the world politics, world warming, yoga, the owner and his wife Lorena, another resident manager, Juan, and both of us retired to the water falls to go swimming in the cool river and bathed underneath the most wet and cooling "cascadas." The water massage the falls provided crowned the day. We were delighted by the entire project and as Armando said, "I am planting to leave a little something behind." We were driven back home by the lovely Lorena and arrived safely at about 4:30 in the afternoon. Not bad for a day starting at 8 AM! Thank you for the best time we had in Huatulco. We thought the price was very fair for the attention and time we received. We\'d visit again.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

203353946.name: Most eco-friendly place in Mexico
203353946.author: a TripAdvisor user
203353946.reviewBody: So refreshing to see a project directed at sustainability also directed at improving the welfare of the local population. Learned a lot about medicinal plants, ecology of the area, native foods and more. Saw wild parrots!. The food was great too. Especially enjoyed the dip in the river and the water fall with the small cave behind it.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

199826660.name: Beautiful Place - Recommended Visit
199826660.author: a TripAdvisor user
199826660.reviewBody: We booked through the Hagia Sofia website - received a prompt reply, and they provided prompt pick-up in the morning.  We really enjoyed the breakfast provided there - very different fresh fruits including cashew fruit.  The coffee was delicious with a light chocolate flavour.  Organic bug spray is available for you to use when you get there (recommended).  The owner has accomplished so much in the ten years he has been working on the site - it is really a labour of love and he is passionate about telling you about it.  There were 8 people on our tour - which he said was average when there are no cruise ships in - so it is very personalized.  The flowers are beautiful - who knew there were about 20 different types of Bird of Paradise?  We had a break by the river where several hammocks are set up - and promptly fell asleep.  Then it was time to vamoose up to see the variety of fruit trees.  Then to the waterfall - the water is really warm and we were able to swim behind the falls and experience the jacuzzi feel - my husband really enjoyed it as well - and he is not a water person.  Lunch was good - cooked over a wooden fire.  My favorite day during our week in Huatulco!  Don\'t miss it.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

199818622.name: Hagia Sofia - a wonderful spot near Huatulco
199818622.author: a TripAdvisor user
199818622.reviewBody:
Hagia Sofia
(pronounced "Ahia Sophia" and meaning "spiritual wisdom") is a beautiful labour of love founded and built by Armando Canavati Nader. He calls it "a paradise to return to nature and spiritual peace." It was formerly a coffee plantation of about 320 Acres. is just north of Santa Maria Huatulco on the road to Pluma Hidalgo.

You can buy the basic tour, but we really enjoyed the "full meal deal," in which you have a yummy breakfast on arrival, and a lovely lunch after the tour, before returning home. Total cost online was $500 peso's per person - extremely good value for money!

The tour is a guided walk of about 500 metres, Armando, the owner showed us around.  We saw hundreds of beautiful plants, and hundreds of types of fruits and butterflies, including the rare blue morph. This is also a great spot for bird watching.

The meals were excellent, cooked to perfection on a wood stove. Various fruits and juices, all from Hagia Sofia are available for you all day long. You are encouraged to have seconds!

You can either drive there yourself, or set up a guided tour online. Google "www.hagiasofia.mx" for all information and reservations can be made on email via "reservaciones@hagiasofia.mx"

You will be picked up at your hotel. The drive is about 45 minutes, on asphalt, gravel and dirt roads. En route just before you enter the town of Santa Maria Huatulco you should look for a farm on the right side of the road where the owner took a liking to a Lear Jet and had it shipped to his yard as a lawn ornament sitting beside his pool!

After the tour you can walk or be driven to a beautiful waterfall on the Magdalena River, which is on the property. There are changing rooms so you don't have to wear your bathing suit all day. The water is cool and refreshing. After drying off you are driven back to the site where you have a lovely home-cooked Mexican lunch of fish, chicken or vegetarian fare. 

After the delicious lunch you will be returned to your hotel at around 5:00 PM.

Recommendations: • 

Wear comfortable clothes and shoes. 
Wear cap or hat.
Carry insect repellent (organic only).
Bring towel and swimsuit to enjoy Magdalena River waterfall.
Do not bring your own foods and beverages.
 
Note:  Infants from 1 to 4 years of age enter free of charge. Children from 5 to 10 years age pay only 50%. From 11 up pay as adult.

This was a most enjoyable tour. Armando was very friendly and told us about the plants, animals, birds and butterflies on the property. He ate with us and was very proud of his life's work and happy to answer any questions we had. Speaking with him was like visiting with an old friend. Everyone on the tour was amazed with what they saw and felt that this was the best tour they had been on, an excellent value! We will be going back next time, for sure.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

199625145.name: Get Close to Nature
199625145.author: a TripAdvisor user
199625145.reviewBody: Inspiring and educational. Beautiful landscape, lovely breakfast and lunch, very interesting tour and wonderful swim in waterfall and cave.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

197229133.name: A place of tranquility, beauty, and sustainability
197229133.author: a TripAdvisor user
197229133.reviewBody: Armando, the creator and curator of Hagia Sofia Botanical Park, was our guide.   The park is about 1000 acres filled with indigenous plants, flowers and fruit trees.  It once was part of a huge coffee plantation.  There are many beautiful birds and varieties of butterflies.  The water in the river was crystal clear and contained trout, fresh water shrimp.  Armando and his wife want to make the park a retreat refuge for people to come and stay and interact with nature.  We were treated to a unique breakfast and lunch prepared over open stove.  This was a most wonderful experience.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

196470316.name: Wonderful place and people at Hagia Sofia
196470316.author: a TripAdvisor user
196470316.reviewBody: January 2014 we visited the Botanical garden. We took a van that seats 8 people plus driver up from our hotel in Huatulco, Mexico. The drive took over an hour and was bumpy over mostly rough pavement and then through a village (don\'t remember the name) and then on gravel up in the hills. The dry forest was previously cut down and is now a conservation area with beautiful flowers, vines, trees planted along a creek and then a lot of fruit trees up in the hilly area. The guide/owner, Armando, is a wonderful man, dedicated to showing what can be grown in the areas with a little irrigation from the creek and nearby river. He has local ladies cook you a fabulous lunch and after hiking the trails and viewing the plants we got to swim with Armando in his piece of the river. It was beautiful fresh, clear water with a small waterfall that you can go behind (with help). There are changerooms and toilets. Everything is very clean and well taken care of. The people are hardworking and friendly. Paid about $50 each and well worth it. I suggest you also leave a donation for the project too. A must see !!! A mini Bouchard Garden.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

196059418.name: Lush gardens, orchards, and oh, that waterfall!
196059418.author: a TripAdvisor user
196059418.reviewBody: From the moment you arrive at Haggis Sophia, you are made to feel like part of a very special family.  Breakfast, cooked over an open air grill, is served on the patio.  The day we  went, breakfast consisted of many types of fruit and juices, fabulous quesadillas and coffee.   A walking tour of the tropical gardens which follows a trail along the river was just beautiful.  Our guide, and the Haggia Sophia creator, was Armando, who brought much knowledge and contagious enthusiasm for this project.   He clearly cares deeply about creating a very special place and about being able to share it with his guests.   As others have mentioned, the swim into the cave and waterfall is unforgettable as are those fabulous hammocks along the river.   Lunch, also grilled open air, was delicious.   We had a choice of chicken or tuna, which was served with nopales (yum), black beans, and rice.   An added benefit to a visit to Haggia Sophis, is being able to see a part of Mexico that is usually hidden from tourists.   The drive through the villages into the mountains was both beautiful and informative.   If you find yourself in Huatulco, don\'t miss Haggia Sophia.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

195737847.name: Beautiful gardens
195737847.author: a TripAdvisor user
195737847.reviewBody: Lots of beautiful varities of tropical flowers, fruit trees, lovely grounds, the owner was hands on and very informative and passionate about his work. Really enjoyed our tour and the location was remote, relaxing and just beautiful. We loved it.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

195615521.name: Natural and Educational
195615521.author: a TripAdvisor user
195615521.reviewBody: Armando is very proud of the work he is doing here to re-generate the natural beauty of this scenic area. He has planted thousands of fruit, nut and native trees and plants on his land and knows every plant by name. The breakfast and lunch cooked over the wood fired stove was some of the best food we ate all week. Hagia Sofia deserves to be supported by people who love our planet - if there were more places like this the earth would be better for it!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

195438852.name: Delightful! Great breakfast & lunch, too!
195438852.author: a TripAdvisor user
195438852.reviewBody: Armando\'s knowledge and care for Hagia Sofia was evident as he explained about the multitude of fruit and nut trees that abound on the property. Gorgeous blooms throughout, and the dip in the river before lunch refreshed us. Sign up at the Hagia Sofia agency in Santa Cruz near the beach. The cost is reasonable, too.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

195275468.name: Garden Oasis
195275468.author: a TripAdvisor user
195275468.reviewBody: Beautiful! Thank you Armando for sharing your dream with us. The escorted tour gave meaning to what we saw. \nWe enjoyed swimming in the river and the breakfast and lunch provided.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

195140858.name: Hagia Sofia
195140858.author: a TripAdvisor user
195140858.reviewBody: Hagia Sofia Botanical Park is a wonderful place to visit.  The flowers and plants are beautiful.  I booked a private tour with them as our port excursion for Huatulco.  We were greeted at the dock by someone with a sign and brought to a van which took us to Hagia Sofia.  The visit included breakfast and lunch and a tour by the owner.  The food was delicious and the tour very interesting.  The owner is very enthusiastic about his place which also includes some unusual plants which are grown for their valuable nutritional properties.  Everything is grown organically.  A delightful day.  The cruise ship also chose this as one of their tours.  However their tour didn\'t include breakfast and lunch and the tour was much shorter and not by the owner.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

195021707.name: Hagia Sophia...hidden treasure
195021707.author: a TripAdvisor user
195021707.reviewBody: This is truly a must see if in huatulco. You start with a delicious breakfast then off through some great trails. You can see and feel his passion for this place. Beautiful flowers.... Orchards....a rest on one of the many hammocks by a babbling brook. Then it\'s cool off time in cascading waterfalls. To top off day you are fed once again and there\'s seconds and thirds if you want. It\'s a very relaxing and unrushed day. So happy we did it

194757679.reviewBody: I thoroughly enjoyed this experience. i loved seeing the butterflies and the vast variety of exotic flowers and plants. I an an avid organic farming follower so i appreciated their organic methods

194298317.author: a TripAdvisor user
194298317.reviewBody: Great informative and beautiful way to spend a day.  The day starts with a breakfast of fresh fruit grown on the property, then a very detailed walk  throughout the exquisite gardens, followed by a dip in the warm lake followed with a small waterfall that you can get under then capped off by an organic meal cooked right in front of you.  The day was informative and well worth the 500 pesos/person that included the transportation.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

194007297.name: Great visit
194007297.author: a TripAdvisor user
194007297.reviewBody: We had a lovely day at Hagia Sofia, and were so lucky to Have Armando as our guide. He shows a real devotion to his property and his plans for the future are inspiring. The breakfast and lunch were delicious, especially the fresh fruits and coffee grown on the property, and served in a delightful shaded area, with charming staff. Make sure to book through the office or website and get the full tour. We loved swimming in the pool and it was exciting going behind the waterfall.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

193545299.name: very nice day outing
193545299.author: a TripAdvisor user
193545299.reviewBody: This is a must do while in Huatolco. Nice relaxing day.parrots fluttering in the trees. great tour of the gardens and a great dip in the river.

193214729.name: Paradise

193214729.reviewBody: About a week ago we had the fortune to take a trip to Hagia Sofia.  We very much enjoyed the local breakfast, friendly staff, tour of the gardens complete with hundreds of butterflies, swim in the river and lunch.  Armando\'s passion for his project is very evident and he is a wealth of knowledge. Highly recommended!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

192751387.name: The Garden of Eden!
192751387.author: a TripAdvisor user
192751387.reviewBody: We spent a wonderful day touring Hagia Sofia and loved every minute of it!  From the fresh fruit and drinks that greet you to the waterfalls and the delightful lunch, we could not have asked for a better day!  If you want to see the beautiful mountain country, then this is the place for you!  Book directly through their website for best rates, go with the full meal deal.  Pick up and drop off timely and efficient...I hope to visit again soon!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

192669959.name: Really interesting and fun
192669959.author: a TripAdvisor user
192669959.reviewBody: We are keen gardeners and being given a guided tour through the gardens and orchards of Hagia Sofia was a total treat for us.  The staff were friendly and informative, the swim in the river was gorgeous and the lunch was yummy.  We felt it was well worth doing.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

191909348.name: Lovely Day!
191909348.author: a TripAdvisor user
191909348.reviewBody: Truly a gem, make sure to go to the waterfall for a swim after your tour of the gardens! traditional Oaxacan lunch was excellent and Armando is a wonderful host. Try the honey and mezcal!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

190440707.name: Giving back to the Earth
190440707.author: a TripAdvisor user
190440707.reviewBody:
This was our third visit to this agri-ecological site. Our first visit to this charming location, situated in the foothills behind Huatulco, about an hours drive from Tangolunda Bay, was a couple of years ago. At that time, we met Armando, the charming owner. He acquired this 130 hectare property, with a river running through it, some 10 years ago. The first two years were spent in clearing some of the land, planting trees to replace some of the original ones which had previously been cut and putting in irrigation lines for his intended paradise. For the past seven or eight years, with the aid of his staff, he has been planting hundreds of varieties of beautiful flowers and fruit trees, both indigenous and brought in from other tropical regions of the world, This is a labour of love for Armando and he does not look upon it as a business venture. Having worked in industry for 34 years, he decided it was time to give something back to nature. Apart from creating a beautiful, peaceful, ecological paradise with flowers, fruit trees, flowers, butterflies and birds he wants to help the poor farmers in the surrounding area to improve their lot in life by growing a variety of fruits for sale, instead of just growing maize for their own consumption.

There is a small waterfall on his property and it is a delight to swim in the river below the cataract. Armando encourages visitors to swim upstream and enter a small cave behind the waterfall. The first time we visited, it was in early spring and I had no difficulty in doing so. Our second visit was last November, when I swam strongly upstream but remained in the same spot. I found it impossible to swim against the current to enter the cave. On this occasion, in early January, with the force of the cascading water being somewhat less (and with the help of a rope tied above the rocks) I was able to achieve this objective together with my 11 year old grand-daughter and my son-in-law. My 9 year old grand-daughter made it to the base of the waterfall, but was too intimidated by the force of the water to try to enter the cave. My 6 year old grand-son and my daughter decided to swim in calmer waters lower down-stream.

Armando provides a wonderful opportunity for visitors to visit this exceptional site for a full day at a very reasonable price which includes transport to and from the site, a guided tour as well as an excellent freshly cooked breakfast and lunch.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

189789598.name: wonderfull day
189789598.author: a TripAdvisor user
189789598.reviewBody: Hagia Sofia is a must see an hours ride into the mountains you are picked up and dropped off at your hotel. Armando the owner will walk you through the hills and jungle and show some incredible plants and fruit trees take a swim in the river at the end then eat a meal cooked outside. thanks for a great day Armando ralph and linda boschman.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

189233963.name: Wonderful way to spend a day!
189233963.author: a TripAdvisor user
189233963.reviewBody: Don\'t miss a wonderful day in the mountains enjoying the flowers, fruit trees and butterflies.   Cool off in the refreshing stream at the waterfall and enjoy the delicious breakfast and lunch included.  L poking forward to our next trip down when I can share this experience with my family!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

186100055.name: Delightful visit
186100055.author: a TripAdvisor user
186100055.reviewBody: My wife and I purchased an excursion from the Huatulco office of Hagia Sofia. The owner, Armando picked us up from our hotel. On arrival, we were offered a tasty breakfast  fruit,juices,quesadillas. We walked for most of the morning through the property and Armando pointed out many interesting flowering plants, trees and fruits as well as lots of butterflies. A tasty lunch was followed by a visit to the river and waterfall where one can bathe in the clear water. \nIt was good to see land being used with such care and attention to the environment offering a glimpse of tropical flora to visitors from northern latitudes.\nJohn and Beatriz, Calgary Canada

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

185252702.name: Garden of Eden, awesome!
185252702.author: a TripAdvisor user
185252702.reviewBody: We were in Huatulco the first week of November, we chose this as our only excursion for a very chilled week.  WOW, were we glad we did!  Hagia Sofia exceeded our expectations!  We arrived and were warmly welcomed with a delicious Mexican breakfast.  Armando then escorted us through the gardens, we have never seen such stunning flowers and butterflies in our lives. Every time we turned around, there was something new and beautiful.  Armando was so cool, he explained the origins of everything, let us really explore and take our time.  We have decided to return to Hagia Sofia each time we visit Huatulco to see how the gardens evolve over the years.  The different species of flowers and butterflies were mesmerizing.  This was SO relaxing and rejuvenating.  After seeing the flowers, rivers and butterflies, we had a delicious lunch.  We cannot recommend Hagia Sofia enough, it is a treasure worth seeing!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

175778213.name: Peaceful Oasis
175778213.author: a TripAdvisor user
175778213.reviewBody: Don\'t miss a visit to Hagia Sofia.  We did a tour there during a cruise.  It was the best.  A very peaceful visit to a wonderful site, with flowers, plants, trees, etc.  The owner is there himself, a retired business man from the north of Mexico, who has followed his dream and is building an eco park.  He plans to have rooms available soon, I think.  The atmosphere is so peaceful.  They make lunch and provide a snack, fresh juices, everything cooked outdoors and lovely vistas while you eat.  The tour picks you up quite near the ship docks, and the ride is not too long and very lovely.  There were only a few others along with us, and it was a wonderful change for the usual crowded tour.  Mountains all around, a lovely and fruitful valley, a wonderful host.  Highly recommended.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

161836973.name: Great place to visit
161836973.author: a TripAdvisor user
161836973.reviewBody: We really enjoyed the personalized tour by Armando.  This place is quite a special labour of love and very educational for visitors.  The food and beverages were a special treat.  A very worthwhile visit, highly recommended.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

161650589.name: paradise found
161650589.author: a TripAdvisor user
161650589.reviewBody: Booked Hagia Sofia directly after reading reviews on Trip Advisor.  Once again, the reviews were correct and we had the best day in the gardens.  Armando picked us up from the cruise ship terminal and drove us to his paradise.  After a delicious breakfast of quesadillas and fresh fruit, we started on the tour with Armando explaining all the amazing flowers and drew our eye to the butterflies and birds in their natural habitat.  Saw cinnamon trees and medicinal plants.  Lunch cooked outside by some wonderful ladies was thoroughly enjoyed, watching the meal being made in a banana leaf was such a cultural experience.  A hot day, a cool swim in the river and amazing surroundings guided by a very kind and knowledgeable man made this day perfect.  This is not for the 5 star crowd but for those who want a real Mexican experience with food and gardens which are unforgettable.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

158246891.name: A little corner of Paradise
158246891.author: a TripAdvisor user
158246891.reviewBody:
We spent a day at the Hagia Sophia in Huatulco. The drive from our hotel took us through La Crucecita, on to the highway and past the charming town of Santa Maria. This beautiful garden is located on a picturesque hillside through which a river winds its way downhill. It was fascinating to see all of the exotic flora from all over the world. Helconias, bromeliads, several varieties of birds of paradise, orchids, ginger flower are only a few examples. We even saw two Blue Morpho butterflies, a little owl, parrots and parakeets in the trees. 

Upon arrival at the Hagia Sophia, we were served a light snack of fresh mangoes, star fruit, jackfruit, papaya, bananas and fruit infused water. Our host Armando, then took us on a stroll throught the extensive gardens, pointing out the more exotic specimens and regaling us with stories of where and how each plant was sourced. 

Armando's passion for what he does is evident and very engaging. We had a bit of a rest beside a little stream where we had glasses of cold lime juice and honey to drink. There were several hammocks where a few of s stretched out for a little rest before proceeding further up the mountain to the fruit trees. 

As we headed down the mountain, we had a chance to take a refreshing dip beside a small waterfall to cool down. The excursion was capped with a delicious lunch under the trees. The Hagia Sophia is a great place to visit and we were very impressed with Armando's vision for the community around the property. Meticulous attention was paid to each detail of our visit, and they had the cleanest washrooms in the middle of nowhere!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

155476039.name: GREAT EXPERIENCE
155476039.author: a TripAdvisor user
155476039.reviewBody: well worth the experience. we have been at hagia sofia with armando quite a few time.\nif you want a walk trough paradise this is as close as it gets in huatulco.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

155296685.name: Awesome Experience
155296685.author: a TripAdvisor user
155296685.reviewBody: I was looking forward to this tour from the time I had read about it.  I am a florist and I was eager to see the tropical Heliconias.  I was not disappointed.  It was absolutely fascinating to walk through and view all the varieties of flowers and fruit trees.  I was captivated by the beauty,  This is definitely worth your time.  The meals that were prepared for us were also fabulous.  I ate very well! I am so happy I went on this tour.  I enjoyed this experience   immensely.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

154334924.name: Breathtaking Attraction
154334924.author: a TripAdvisor user
154334924.reviewBody: Well worth the 25tl to enter this amazing place. Best to get there early and be prepared to queue but it does move quickly. This is the best attraction I have seen and in my own personal opinion better than the Blue Mosque\nIt really does take your breath away

154184559.name: It\'s another world
154184559.author: a TripAdvisor user
154184559.reviewBody: Exe lent place to rest and enjoy don\'t take to long time from the city just find some Mosquitos but all is magnifique\nPique

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

153234254.name: A Must Visit
153234254.author: a TripAdvisor user
153234254.reviewBody: Went to Hagia Sofia a couple of weeks ago and it was absolutely beautiful.  We arranged direct with them and they picked us up from the hotel, had a excellent and informative guide with Armando the founder of Hagia Sofia.  He was able to answer all our questions and truly had a wonderful time.  Prior to tour we were offered a breakfast prepared on site, did the tour, was driven a short distance for a swim and then back for a delicious meal and back to our hotel.  It was a beautiful tour and would highly recommend it.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

152345253.name: A Living Heart of Nature
152345253.author: a TripAdvisor user
152345253.reviewBody:
Four times, I have visited Hagia Sofia, and every time I find it more beautiful...   The first time I visited I was introduced to the place by the owner or should I say gardian of the place and his wife, I could see all the vision in the creation of the place, planting fruit trees, flowers, building bridges and placing every thing in the right place with all their love  and hard work....
 Now coming back,  a great santuary of nature, everything has grown so it is like walking the path of a tropical sight in some places and openes in some others.
 I feel and see the strenght of a huge "ceiba tree" surrounded by the redest soil I have ever seen it gives me a sense that it is the breathing heart of the valley surrounded by mountains.   And then a swim in the river with a massage from the water fall...    I am delighted with the place.  Did I say that the fruit freshly cut from their trees and quezadillas was a gourme meal straight from nature.
If you are in Huatulco, it is a MUST.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

147008336.name: Paraiso Found!
147008336.author: a TripAdvisor user
147008336.reviewBody: I visited Hagia Sofia with my parents in December 2012, and it was a perfect day off the beach.  Armando picked us up in Huatulco and drove up to the preserve.  This whole place is his vision, extending to economic opportunities to people in the surrounding villages.  As we drove into the mountains, stripped of the hardwood trees years ago, we entered the preserve, which has been restocked by Armando with many of the local hardwood trees, as well as fruit trees from Mexico and Asia.  There is an outdoor kitchen at which we were served an outstanding breakfast of quesadillas, fruit, and juices, and, later, lunch of chicken and veggies cooked in a banana leaf with excellent rice and beans.  Armando took us on a tour of his preserve.  The trail is not long, but it is meant to be meandered down vs hiked vigorously.  At the end of this trail was an idyllic rest stop near the river with hammocks in which one or more of us fell asleep, swaying in the breeze.  Have I painted a vision of paradise for you yet?  After the nap, we surveyed his orchard, now starting to bear fruit, and checked out some buena vistas of the surrounding mountains.  Then on to river to swim like otters and bask on the sun-heated rocks.  My only regret of this visit was that we could not stay longer.  It was utterly perfecto.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

146341187.name: A special paradise
146341187.author: a TripAdvisor user
146341187.reviewBody: Hagia Sofia is a place that visitors to Huatulco should not miss.  Anyone who appreciates nature and respect for our environment will be impressed by Armando\'s vision.  Not only has he created a unique ecological setting for visitors to embrace, but he is making a significant impact on the surrounding community.  Armando is a role model for others in how to respect and enhance the beauty that surrounds the Huatulco area.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

142929353.name: Great Natural Gardens, Lots of Birds and A Nice Swim
142929353.author: a TripAdvisor user
142929353.reviewBody: My wife and I took a trip to Hagia Sofia and it lives up to its advertisement as a natural paradise. Exotic plants and flowers from all over the world are planted amid a babbling brook running through the expansive property. Tropical birds and butterflies are everywhere. We were served a wonderful breakfast with all the fruit grown on the property as well as coffee from the adjacent plantations. To top things off we went for a swim in the refreshing cool waters of a river that also runs through the property. A visit here is well worth it.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

141606583.name: Flowers everywhere!
141606583.author: a TripAdvisor user
141606583.reviewBody: If you are into flowers, you will love this place!  It\'s beautiful, calming and the waterfall is amazing.  The owner is a fascinating man who explained a lot of what he is trying to accomplish.  He gave us fresh juices grown on this very site. Very educational!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

129387470.name: Garden/eco lover\'s haven!
129387470.author: a TripAdvisor user
129387470.reviewBody:
Wanted to experience different from the usual tourist offerings so did research before our trip. Husband wasn't sure about this BUT he really enjoyed this!

Booked day before and the manager Quan/John picked us up from our hotel. Make sure you mention if you only speak English.

Interesting to see the change in surroundings from city to old town Santa Maria, through the scenic countryside to deep into the forest where this 130 hectares natural garden reserve sanctuary is located. Ride is about 1hr.

John mentioned he could show us more of Santa Maria but we had seen the area few yrs ago already.

Greeted with a refreshing fruit & quesadilla breakfast. Amazed to see bright orange fruit of cashews! Sweet sweet papayas! Mangoes dropped out of the nearby trees as we ate.

Washrooms are very clean.

Note to bring repellant for the bug magnets as this is definitely out in the wild.You can use their organic repellant. I used lavender oil and only had 3 bites. Wore long sleeve zip up just incase.

After breakfast, we were taken on a walking tour to see all these beautiful tropical flowers.There was even the cashew trees! We also saw colorful butterflies, irridescent turquoise wasp like flies, hummingbirds & we were accompanied by this dog during the whole walk.

We crossed a river on stepping stones to rest and then went higher up steps to an open area where we saw many fruit trees like cocao, papaya, mangoes, noni & rambutan. Some fruit were not in season or in bloom like the mangosteen. Amazing to see the surrounding mountains & the  greenery.

Note, wear a hat & sunscreen as it gets pretty hot.

Chef Blanca prepared our lunch as we were driven to nearby river for a refreshing soak.
Note, bring own towels & there are chging rooms before the dip.
Mention to Blanca if you are not a big eater. Felt bad that i couldn't finish the traditional lunch of grilled fish, beans & rice.

We were the only visitors so we had a private tour & meal made just for us.

Visiting this paradise is definitely one of the most memorable & relaxing highlights of our visit! Thank you John! Thank you Hagia Sofia!

50USD ea was well worth it.

This would be an awesome field trip for students & a treat for nature lovers!

Hope to come back on our next visit to see how this big eco haven develops!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

127612820.name: Magical Experience
127612820.author: a TripAdvisor user
127612820.reviewBody: What a place!    There is so much to do in Hautulco and I would rate this right up there for a unique, unforgettable experience.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

126610697.name: A beautiful garden in the mountains above Huatulco
126610697.author: a TripAdvisor user
126610697.reviewBody: The trees are wonderful.  The food good.  And the swim in the river refreshing.  Beware of insect bites.  The organic repellent offered is really not effective.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

125510479.name: This is a not-to-be-missed opportunity
125510479.author: a TripAdvisor user
125510479.reviewBody: All six of us on this tour were delighted with our decision to visit Hagia Sophia.  Three of us are avid gardeners, one an organic gardener with a particular interest in the healing power of plants, and others are  amateur photography buffs.  We spent several wonderful hours with Armando whose passion and vision are matched by his knowledge.  The breakfast and lunch are excellent - prepared in a traditional Oaxaca style.  The cooling swim in the Magdalena River was welcome. \nTwo tips - (1)  If you are travelling to the site in your own vehicle, get specific instructions about the turn-off in Santa Maria de Huatulco or you could miss the Pluma Hidalgo road.\n(2) The walking tour of the gardens and fruit trees, though not long in length, can take a long time if you are walking slowly to absorb the beauty and all the info Armanda gives, so it can be tiring for folks with any back or mobility problems.   If it is too tiring, you can  return part way through to the outdoor kitchen to watch the ladies prepare lunch.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

124926586.name: A lovely shade break
124926586.author: a TripAdvisor user
124926586.reviewBody: we booked a trip to Hagia Sofia based on fellow Trip Advisees advice and were not disappointed.  If you are sunburned and need a break from the beack this is a nice place to do it.  We were picked up at our hotel and taken by SUV (fully packed with 8 guests) to Santa Maria where we had a brief tour of the town. then on to Hagia Sofia where we were met by the owner and had delicous quesadilla\'s and lots of fresh fruit for breakfast. (about 10;30 by the time we got there so you might want to eat a little something before you leave your hotel).  then we went on a leisurely walk through the tropical gardens- mostly Asian plants but very beautiful.  The test orchard was very hot and sunny on top of the hill but was interesting to see the different tropical fruits.  We were then driven to the highlight of the day- swimming in the waterfall!  Awesome.  Then back to the main area for a delicous lunch of stir fry veggies with a little chicken or fish mixed in with plantains & honey for dessert.  Beer available but not included in the price.  I bought a bottle of the delicous honey from the plantation to take home- fortunately the bottles are leakproof! \nAny gardener would love this trip and anyone who just wants to see the countryside will enjoy it!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

124515875.name: Visit to a eco paradise
124515875.author: a TripAdvisor user
124515875.reviewBody: The is only just opening up as it obviously takes time to establish trees and plants. If you are in Huatulco please give this place your support; what they are doing is magnificent - and the food is good.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

122369620.name: Hagia Sofia is a beautiful place to visit!
122369620.author: a TripAdvisor user
122369620.reviewBody: A must see excursion especially if you like plants and tress. The tour was amazing! The food included with the tour was delicious! Highly recommend!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

122178977.name: Wonderful experience with Armando and his dream-come-true!
122178977.author: a TripAdvisor user
122178977.reviewBody: My husband, a friend and I were met by Armando\'s wife at the ship\'s pier and drove out to the park.  We enjoyed a delicious snack of fresh fruit, fruit juice and a quesadilla cooked right in front of us in the interesting outdoor kitchen.  After walking through the blooming garden along the running stream with Armando and Lorena as our guides we went to the waterfalls for a swim and to enjoy the beautiful gray rock formations.  Our generous and delicious lunch was fish or chicken cooked with vegetables grown at Hagia Sofia.  Even grilled prickly pear "ears"!  It\'s a unique agro-ecological developement that improves the local jungle and introduces the public to many beautiful and interesting plants.  I highly recommend the experience!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

121905230.name: Maybe something to visit in the future- but not now
121905230.author: a TripAdvisor user
121905230.reviewBody: Though there is vision and a "dream" of having a botanical garden at this site it is still im embryo stage. We were picked up early in the morning by the owner/guide and driven to Hagia Sofia. We found the place listed in a guide book and thought it would be nice. My husband is a gardener. The "600" species eluded me. Its like looking at the same plant over and over but calling it a different "spcies". It took an hour to get there by truck but the last 2 km was worthy of a 4WD. VERY rough. The food supplied there is awesome but LATE> We arrive at  8 15 am and had to wait forever for the included breakfast. After being guided thru the garden , which took all of 45 minute we went exploring. Lunch was also included in our trip but at 1:30 I was asking where it was. The girl fed us. (she was very hospitable)   the ad said the trip was 6 hours. After 7 hours we still were waiting for our guide to come back to drive us to our hotel. He was showing someone else around. I can see he has a vision for the future. But right now.......its not worth the trip. I will say the washrooms are VERY clean and the food was good. Would I go back there? Probably not. Would I recommend it...........not yet.....it needs to grow.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

121834212.name: Heaven on Earth
121834212.author: a TripAdvisor user
121834212.reviewBody: Armando is clearly a man with a beautiful vision.  Sustainable eco-tourism with a mix of culture and real world mexico smile and charm had us in awe from the start of the day to its end.  My camera was clicking happily from the start.  Finding someone passionate about what they do these days is rare.  Not just out for the tourist dollar, Armando was genuinely enthusiastic about his cause and even went to town with us to help me haggle over a couple of silly figurines i wanted and took us for ice cream as well.  It was like visiting family that you had not seen in a while.  We cannot wait until he has his cabins up and running so we can come back and relax from our busy lives.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

121417873.name: a walk in paradise
121417873.author: a TripAdvisor user
121417873.reviewBody:
Don't miss this unique experience in Huatulco.  You will be amazed at the sustainable eco-tourism that Armando has developed here.  

Enjoy an excellent local meal cooked in a pre-Hispanic oven, fresh fruits and juices, tour the gardens with a huge variety of tropical plants and finish your day with a swim in their natural pool and cascades.

If you love nature, you will not regret visiting Hagia Sofia.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

117474044.name: A true gem of an adventure
117474044.author: a TripAdvisor user
117474044.reviewBody: We visited Hagia Sophia on the only rainy day of our vacation. One might think that would have been a not so good thing, to the contrary, the day brought the flowers to life for the camera and humid conditions allowed us to capture the butterflies stationary that they would make good subjects for observation. Our host Armondo, made sure to allow us ample time to absorb all the beauty around us and the care that him and his staff have placed into this that the location of plantlife is not only correct for the region but accentuates the attraction for birds and butterflies as well. Hagia Sophia contributed to making this vacation one of the best ever for us, we would return and reccomend this day trip to any one that is not afraid to get out of the city, or the pool, come to the mountains and see what the real Hualtulco region is about. We were escorted by our guide, Adelino Olea. He is worth looking up, as he can show you many other exciting inland adventures as well, but that is for another review.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

112783412.name: Nature in all its splendor!
112783412.author: a TripAdvisor user
112783412.reviewBody:
We visited Hagia Sofia the first week of June and were lucky in being the only two being given the tour due to the lack of tourists during the off season.  We were picked up by Armando, the host from our hotel and were driven to Hagia Sofia, a beautiful ecological retreat located about 45 minutes away from the downtown area of Huatulco.

Armando as a host was very informative, friendly, and passionate about the nature in the park (And after the tour, so were we).  Arriving at Hagia Sofia we were treated to fresh fruits and naturally flavored waters, as well as some delicious Quesidillas prepared in an open air wood burning oven.  The whole of the walking tour lasted about 3-4 hours and concluded with going to the natural waterfall and cove, with the water being cool and refreshing after seeing all the natural beauty.

It can't be overstated the sheer amount of flower and plant life, as well as variety of fruit flowers and ongoing work that is going into making Hagia Sofia that much more beautiful.  With indigenous and imported Asiatic trees (found at the same latitude and climate as Mexico and thus set to thrive in the environment), the site is truly a wonder to behold, with hummingbirds zipping around you and beauty all around.  Armando provides you with organic repellant which did a good job of keeping (most) of the bugs at bay.  

Overall, a must see if you are in the area and a fan of the outdoors, it truly is wonderful to take a break from the cities and return to nature in its simple and exquisite beauty.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

103191395.name: Paradise in the mountains!!!
103191395.author: a TripAdvisor user
103191395.reviewBody: My sister and I visited Hagia Sofia on March 27, 2011. It is an ecological park up in the mountains, about 45 minutes from the tourist area of Tangolunda Bay. We had a wonderful experience!!!!! Transportation to the park was excellent - we rode in an air condition van that was not over crowded. On the way to the park the driver was generous and took us to take pictures of the church and the town hall in Santa Maria Huatulco. The church was lovely!! When we arrived at Hagia Sofia we were served breakfast (An abundance of fresh fruit, fresh fruit juice, and corn tortillas). The kitchen is open air and you can watch breakfast being made. During breakfast we were introduced to Armando, the owner of Hagia Sofia. After eating we went on a tour of the tropical flowers section and the fruit sections of the park - Armando was our tour guide. The amount and types of plants, flowers and fruits we saw was amazing!!!!!! It was also neat talking to people from different parts of Mexico. Once the tour was complete, those who wanted to go to the river and waterfall got back into the van for the short (maybe 5 min) drive to the waterfall. This was my personal highlight of the trip! You enter the river in very shallow water and then swim a short distance to the falls. The waterfall is quite small but it is very powerful and gives a great back massage! There is also a small cave beside the waterfall which is neat. The water is fresh and cool and the rock formations around the waterfall are lovely. After swimming at the waterfall we headed back to the main area for a delicious lunch (Edible cactus, chicken, rice, black beans, corn tortillas, and again more fresh fruit and juice.) We got to socialize and relax until we informed the driver we ready to leave.\n\nAll in all this tour was wonderful!!! It was amazing to have the personal tour done by the owner of the park and learning about his dream to help future generations of Mexicans was very humbling. Also, Betty, who we booked with was extremely friendly and prompt in helping us book this tour. We learned about Hagia Sofia on the internet and it seemed you could not book this tour through the hotel. We corresponded with Betty a few times and she met us at our hotel so that we could pay for the tour. I have to add that the price for the tour was great - Approximately $37 US dollars. (Our only word of caution would be that you cannot bring your own bug spray on site - you must use the eco friendly bug spray that they provide. It didnt work that great and my sister and I ended up with loads of sand fly bites - soooooooooooo itchy! They are not harmful though and it would not deter us from going back)

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

101653371.name: A botanical marvel high in the Sierra Madres
101653371.author: a TripAdvisor user
101653371.reviewBody:
Hagia Sofia, “sacred wisdom”
What a delightful place!  We’re avid gardeners so were especially enthralled and enchanted by this botanical marvel hidden in the Sierra Madre Mountains of Santa Maria de Huatulco, a mountain top pueblo  just 10-12 k or so NW of Huatulco airport and a reasonably short drive from La Crucecita and Santa Cruz. 
The owner and principal tour guide, Armando Canavati Nader is the English speaking inspiration for this unique shangrila that embodies spiritual and environmental harmony and serves as a kind of Mexican tribute to the original Hagia Sofia in Turkey.
Typically your tour will begin at 9 am and will end at 2 or so depending on your interests and includes a breakfast with many exotic property grown fruits like the “cashew fruit” which is a must try for everyone and tamarind water.
The walking tour is informative and slow paced with plenty of time to soak in the quietness and sights and fragrances of the tropical surroundings, all from manicured stone lined pathways that weave and wind their way to the clean and clear river for a mid tour rest and refreshment stop.  Hammocks are provided for a short siesta in the cool shade.
After a brief rest in the cool shade at the center, you will be escorted deeper into the estate to the Magdalena river waterfall for a very much appreciated swim and waterfall massage surrounded by huge boulders smooth and shaped by thousands of years of water rushing over them.  This is a Zapoteca site so has been in use pretty much since BC.
When you return to the garden’s central facility lunch will be provided, and, as with breakfast prepared in an outdoor kitchen on wood burning stoves and more cool refreshments are generously provided.
You will feel refreshed and strangely at peace after this enchanting experience, much in keeping with the spirit and intent of the creator,  El Senor, Armando.
Total cost for this wonderful experience is $25 us.per person!
Take a camera!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

100353566.name: A wonderful daytrip
100353566.author: a TripAdvisor user
100353566.reviewBody: Welcome to paradise. Rent a car, hire a taxi, whatever. Just go for a day visit if you\'re in the Huatulco area. You\'ll see acres and acres of tropical flowers and plants, swim in a refreshing creek complete with a small waterfall, and enjoy fresh fruit and juice.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

97746384.name: Hagia Sophia Splendor
97746384.author: a TripAdvisor user
97746384.reviewBody: A low key pastorale peaceful setting where one can enjoy a meandering walk along the river framed by beautiful flowers. Explore the exotic varieties of fruits from South East Asia, Central and South America. During your visit one can swim in the Madalena River under the cascade of the La Campana waterfall. (Facilities provided for changing clothes) Favorite local foods are provided during your stay at no extra costs. A wonderful excursion  away from the beach. Also a great example how a noble man with a dream can make a difference for the future generation of Mexico. Don and Johanna Maryland U.S.A. Feb. 2011

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

96158550.name: Agro-ecological Wonderland
96158550.author: a TripAdvisor user
96158550.reviewBody:
This is truly an excellent way to spend the day if you enjoy nature.

Booking:  We had a little difficulty in determining how to book a tour.  We tried to book through Sunwing and another local tour operator to no avail. They indicated that you needed a large group to book through them, but that wasn't our experience.  We used the reservation link on the website and after a couple of e-mails Betty from Hagia Sofia made all the arrangements for us.  Thanks so much to Betty. (Aside: It was 450 pesos for each of us.)

Transportation:  Juan picked us and another couple up at our resort and took us the 45minute drive to Hagia Sofia.  Juan also gave us a brief driving tour of Santa Maria on our way.  Santa Maria is a wonderful old village that I recommend others check out if they get the opportunity.

Breakfast:  We were greeted with some breakfast.  We had a quesidilla made over a wood fire with Oaxacan cheese, red onion and fresh avocado.  In addition there was fresh organic fruit and some fruit juices.  It was amazing.  

Walking tour:  We went on a walking tour with Juan as our initial guide and then Armondo (the owner).  The flowers and fauna were amazing.  I'm not sure words or even photos can do the scene justice.  Make sure you bring your camera.

Waterfall:  If you wanted you could change into a swimsuit (in the very nice change rooms right at the waterfall site) and take a refreshing swim in the river.  The small waterfall gave an excellent back massage.

Lunch:  Believe it or nor, after the tour we were then served lunch. There was rice, beans, grilled prickly pear cactus (nopales), and a vegetable chicken mix, served with fresh tortillas.  And again fresh fruit and juices.  Make sure you go hungry, the food is incredible.  

Washroom facilities:  Modern (the M is for mujer or woman and the H is for hombre or man:  this may be obvious to everyone else but it was confusing for us).  

Armondo told us that the goal of the site is to promote knowledge and  sustainability for the people of Oaxaca. 

We have every intention of taking this tour again when we return to Huatulco so that we can see how Hagia Sofia has grown.  This isn't your typical tour where you are on a strict proscribed timetable and someone is always trying to sell you something.  This tour was about sharing their knowledge and dream for the future.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

95500578.name: Slice of heaven
95500578.author: a TripAdvisor user
95500578.reviewBody: Wonderful place! Greeted by the manager and instantly refreshed with copious amounts of delicious fruit, juice, honey etc... most welcome after a 2 hour trip in the back of a pick-up from San Agustinillo. We were then treated to an excellent tour, guided by the manager himself, whose knowledge and passion for the place was obvious. Following that a quick dip in the glorious "cascada" and we were all set for the trip home. If you\'re in the vicinity... GO!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

95496535.name: God Sleeps Here
95496535.author: a TripAdvisor user
95496535.reviewBody: Absolutely amazing........ the people and all the work being put into this wonderful place.  Anyone going to the Huatulco area, this is a must see.  Bring a bathing suit, you don\'t want to miss the swim and the hidden cave.  The food is fantastic. A special thank you to Armando and Betty, everything you have done is appreciated by all, keep up the good work.  \nCan\'t wait to be there again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

89538791.name: Amazing
89538791.author: a TripAdvisor user
89538791.reviewBody:
When you come to Huatulco and do not visit Hagia Sophia, you have not been to Huatulco. This agro ecological development is the vision of Armando Canavati Nader and what a vision! His natural paradise overflows with gorgeous flowering plants, many, many varieties of trees, numerous fruit trees, and the smells from all of this permeates the air. One could sit forever and listen to the gently flowing river, watch the multi- hued butteries, or listen to the birds, especially the parrots, from the trees.

This heaven is only 30 minutes from Huatulco and an interesting drive through the "real" town of Huatulco. Armando serves his visitors delicious fruit juices, fruit, and quesadillas, made over a traditional wood burning oven, upon arrival, and then after the tour, a wonderful lunch of either fish or chicken and more quesadillas. This meal is also after an incredible swim in the clean river and a visit to the waterfalls which includes a cave behind the falls and another fall which acts as a soothing jacuzzi. The accommodations are first rate (bathrooms and the changing rooms at the waterfalls).

Armando has developed a paradise with such love and with utmost respect for nature. He truly knows the meaning of organic from his composting to his bees and honey. He proudly shared his fruit with us and his dream. What a fabulous day!

Reservations must be made a day in advance. Hagia Sofia has an office in Santa Cruz on Mitla 402, or contact them  at [--].

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

89258187.name: Wonderful Display of Tropical Flowers and Plants
89258187.author: a TripAdvisor user
89258187.reviewBody: While the website emphasizes the ecological and agriculture demonstrations projects, which are impressive, it\'s the tropical flowers and plants (and yes, butterflies) that are truly wonderful.  Throw in very nice people and generous food, fruit waters to drink, and fruit to eat plus their own waterfall and swimming hole and it is hard to imagine a better day.  If you are lucky and get Armando whose money and vision made this all happen (Sofia is his daughter\'s name), he will tell you how he spent 30 years in the family shirt business in Monterrey before doing what "I wanted to do with my life."  Charming in many, many ways.  And the drive to the site is easy and not too long.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

66451390.name: Nature exhalation of color and beauty
66451390.author: a TripAdvisor user
66451390.reviewBody: I have visited two times.  People are very friendly, because it is a family project that you can see its progress every time you go...                    you breath the love and devotion of the owner as you walk on a nature path iwith ncredible flowers, trees and of course, butterflies of many colors...       or bathe in the river water fall. ..     It  takes you away from the heat of the beach  into nature...

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

63149044.name: A day in paradise
63149044.author: a TripAdvisor user
63149044.reviewBody: A must see tropical paradise for the nature lover.\nSpend a relaxing day in an breathtaking environment and let your senses enjoy the colors and smells of beautiful flowers and fruit trees. Plan to have lunch and taste the local foods. Very friendly and knowledgeable people will invite you to  a tour and answer your questions. Hospitablity is a given - so go visit and be welcomed.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

53050184.name: Incredible
53050184.author: a TripAdvisor user
53050184.reviewBody:
This is an amazing place for nature lovers. About a 30 minute drive from Huatulco you find this nature paradise with lots of tropical flowers and about 60 varieties of fruits. They also have waterfalls you can swim under.

You should probably consider spending 2-3 hours there, but you can also spend much more time there; there are so many birds and butterflies to see.

Definitely worth a trip.

You need to make advance reservation. See there website for telephone number/email address.

address.streetAddress: Mitla 402, Local 7 Km2. 5 Entrada a Magdalena

656088873.name: Refreshing Day Trip
656088873.author: a TripAdvisor user
656088873.reviewBody: Fun trip up into the mountains, took about 1.5 hours each way, but the cool, refreshing water in the river and the beautiful waterfalls were well worth the trip. Was great for our whole family. There were shallow areas where my 5 year old could play, and ropes to swing on from the rocks by the waterfalls for my 10 and 11 year olds. A nice local lunch was included in the package and there were a couple of cool little stops along the way,

655907512.name: Back Country Tour
655907512.author: a TripAdvisor user
655907512.reviewBody: We ended up on a Mexican National tour so not much help with English.  Kind of experience that makes a trip for me. Falls are lovely, water a bit cool after the warm Pacific. Lunch was included and a real local experience too.  Apperently there are three different falls experience so be good to ask around for what suits you. Rough ride up there,  Don\'t sit in the back of the van!

649938772.name: with Live & Explore Huatulco Tours
649938772.author: a TripAdvisor user
649938772.reviewBody: Enrique Edgar Rosario Rodriguez is an excellent tour guide.  Excellent English.  Very personable and knowledgable.  Once you leave the highway you enter another place and another time.  The road gets narrower and narrower.  When you think they won\'t get any narrower they do.  But completely worth it.  There are a series of waterfalls with pools to swim in.  We were treated to a consultation with a shaman and an amazing authentic Oxacan meal.

638614718.name: Awesome
638614718.author: a TripAdvisor user
