638614718.reviewBody: We traveled up here in our rental car.\nGoogle maps took us almost all the way there( local help with directions once) Worth the drive, be prepared to pay 50 pesos each to get through the gate though. Still way cheaper then the excursion price

618058769.name: Great Time
618058769.author: a TripAdvisor user
618058769.reviewBody: Lots of walking, but well worth the journey.  You have to be able to pull yourself along the vines.  Waterfalls are fabulous and my wife had ahoy one vines swinging in the water.  Rough ride getting there but worth doing once

594983288.name: Finca La Gloria/Cascadas de Llano Grande
594983288.author: a TripAdvisor user
594983288.reviewBody: Family fun to Cascadas de Llano Grande.  This is a great trip to some amazing cascading water into a refreshing river pools located next to a coffee plantation. We booked our trip with an amazing tour guide, Adelino Olea (mrhuatulcotours.com). We  a family of 5, so he specializes with smaller groups of 5 or 6 maybe more. Adelino speaks English very well and is extremely knowledgable about the entire Oaxaca region . He arranged to pick us up at 830am for this trip. We weren\'t sure why so early but we\'re so happy we trusted him because we basically had the whole place to ourselves for about an hour before the bigger groups started to arrive. Anyways, this trip takes a bit to get there due to steep dirt mountain roads that take you deep into the jungle. Please be patient these are not roads you can go fast on. Once you arrive on the coffee plantation there is food in the form of Tamales, Fresh coffee, Agua de Jamaica (if you arrive in AM) then it\'s a short hike along the river to the cascades where you can rope swing into the river and have fun. Then it\'s a hike back to the coffee plantation where an amazing buffet of Coffee,Jamaica, Carnitas, Chicken with Mole, Rice, Black Beans, Nopales (Cactus) and homemade corn tortillas await you.Soooo good. Maybe even a little Mezcal too! Then it\'s on back. Definitely take swim gear, camera/gopro  , towel and extra money if you want to buy some of the homegrown coffee beans or Mezcal.

575945561.name: Amazing tour
575945561.author: a TripAdvisor user
575945561.reviewBody: Well organized, good price, maximum enjoyment , recommend to take trip with Jesus, who visits beaches on Huatulco

566972941.name: My happy place #1
566972941.author: a TripAdvisor user
566972941.reviewBody: Okay, i was actually there in February 2015, it was awesome.  Check with guides, because you want to go when there\'s enough water to enjoy them.

566582905.name: Beautiful & Breathe Taking
566582905.author: a TripAdvisor user
566582905.reviewBody: Takes a bit to find but once you find it they are easily accessible and so very refreshing. A very enjoyable adventure!!!

558828711.name: Beautiful scenery and amazing water falls.
558828711.author: a TripAdvisor user
558828711.reviewBody: We did a van tour with our Los Brisas hotel. Great tour guides. They gave us a lot of info and Huatulco history along the way. We did a nice hike along water falls. We got to swim behind the falls and jump off a large rock into the water. Then had a good lunch afterwords that was included. The tour guide and driver went out of their way to make this excursion a great experience. If you take this excursion, please show your appreciation for these guys with a worthwhile tip at the end. They deserve it!!

549694867.name: Rope swing, hiking, and climbing through a cave??? Great fun!
549694867.author: a TripAdvisor user
549694867.reviewBody: We would never have found this on our own, you will want a tour guide for this sort of thing.  The falls are really spectacular! It starts as small rapids, and every step takes you closer to the main event!  These falls seemed to be well over 120 m!  Go for the cave experience!  Our guide Enrique Pinacho took us over the rocks to the steps leading up to the cave which is visible from a lookout.  It seemed easy enough until we had to stand under the spray, on the rocks, on our way to the steps!  The water is on the cooler side temperature wise, just so you know!  The steps lead to a cave, the cave is very short, only about 3 m and then you are in a pool under the falls!  Beautiful!  \nOur guide, Enrique knows the area well, speaks very good English and provided everything we needed!  See "Huatulco tours Enrique", he delivered exactly what he said he would and for the same price he quoted at the outset!

545553313.name: Only for the faint of heart
545553313.author: a TripAdvisor user
545553313.reviewBody: Ten minutes of highway driving and then 2 hours of mountain roads. We experienced "back country" extraordinaire. Roads flooded with water, corners washed away, narrow and steep hills and continuous bumps, pot holes etc. The October rains were contributing factors to our November trip, however they are not in a hurry to fix these roads. Once we arrived, a refreshing swim and lunch before returned. Travelling by 15 passenger van, we were the only English speaking guests and did not understand the driver\'s comments. The operators are very friendly, but safety standards and road maintenance left lots to be desired.

534701304.name: Cascadas de llano grande
534701304.author: a TripAdvisor user
534701304.reviewBody: Beautiful Place. Freshwater, The Food is excellent and the Area is nice.\nRain tropical forests. It\'s about One hour 40 minutes to get there, the Road is dirt. A small parts are payment. You want to go There is a take a One Day for trip

526561329.name: Adventurous tour for active people only
526561329.author: a TripAdvisor user
526561329.reviewBody: This trip is for adventurous and health people onnly because it is 3 hours ride with half on\nmountainous road with lots of potholes. The waterfall and its surroundings are beautiful. Be warned: if you are sick or having a medical problem, you are out of luck because this is a rural village with no medical help.

486538876.name: Great Experience
486538876.author: a TripAdvisor user
486538876.reviewBody: Ever dream of jumping Tarzan style off a waterfall and dropping into the water?  This is the tour for you but you will need to ensure that you have water shoes.  This is a hiking tour so be prepared with bug spray and footwear not sandals.  You end this tour eating delicious beans, pork and hot sauce tacos.  You will also get to enjoy a mud mask that leaves your skin feeling amazing.  The road going in and coming out is NOT for the faint of heart so if you a chicken a window seat should not be your choice.

477582333.name: Be like Tarzan at the waterfalls.
477582333.author: a TripAdvisor user
477582333.reviewBody: The Las Brisas waterfalls are like an oasis and we certainly enjoyed the experience.  Our family of 4 (19 to 55 yrs) went April 13th.  What made our experience great though was Edgar Escobar, our guide, who I booked prior to leaving for Huatulco.  I found his name through another review and contacted him on his Facebook Page at Huatulco\'s Edgar Escobar. Cell is 958-118-2465. His first language is English so communicating with him was exceptional and he is very accommodating.  Yes it is a lengthy drive but the whole time he taught us many things about the area and the horticulture and folklore and his fascinating life. We felt perfectly safe with him and would never have ventured into the cave without his guidance.  He knows exactly where to step and what to hang onto in order to be safe. He let us set our own pace with no time limits on anything. We spent a fair amount of time at the rope swing and had we gone with a larger tour we would have missed out on that enjoyment.    \nEdgar also organized a boat for us to do the bay tour (April 17th) which was fabulous as we ended up seeing hundreds of dolphins in a rare show of spectacular jumping, two whales and a number of turtles. He actually let us use his pesos rather than our U.S. money in order to save us the exchange at the restaurant we stopped at on the beach during the bay tour. And because it was my husband\'s birthday he and the boat driver arranged to have some Mexican singers surprise my husband at the beach. At this stop we were very glad to have him along again to explain some numerous things to us. So if you wish to ensure that you have safe and enjoyable excursions get in touch with Edgar!

475611184.name: Beautiful Area, Long Ride
475611184.author: a TripAdvisor user
475611184.reviewBody:
We booked this excursion and was told by the Apple Rep. that it was 1 to 1 1/4 hour drive.  The drive is 2 hours from Secrets Hualtulco.  If you need the restroom, be prepared to hang off a 45 degree angle of the mountain.  One person in our group did.
Our driver was great and was very informative.  The falls are great but the water is not deep.  They have a rope swing that you can swing off the falls.  There is also a cave route behind the falls.  Again the water is maybe 4 foot deep in a small area, so you need to let go of the rope at the right spot.  The Driver did have a local collage student with us at the falls.  The young man helped us with the cave and rope swing.  Also he applied mud to the faces of the women.  The hike out is demanding but steps have been cut out in the steepest parts of the trail.  The average person should have no trouble with this trail.  We had the lunch provided by the tour which was typical local 
food.  The Hibiscus ice tea was a hit along with their coffee.  The Coffee Plantation tour was OK, but nothing special.  We did buy 2 kg of  plantation coffee, bottle of mescal  and package of Hibiscus Tea.  Bring Pesos as products are cheaper with Pesos.
Then the long bumpy ride home.  If you have not been to a waterfall before this would be a nice excursion.  If for example you have been to Dunn River Falls in Jamaica, this would be a disappointment.

472964520.name: Nice hike, majestic waterfalls, and watch your step ;)
472964520.author: a TripAdvisor user
472964520.reviewBody: Approximately 2 mile hike, water and nature beautiful, the food was delicious.  The mole was amazing with homemade tortillas, rice & beans.  They also had some yummy bean tamales.

470391829.name: Don\'t miss this!
470391829.author: a TripAdvisor user
470391829.reviewBody: We arranged a tour with Enrique Pinacho for our family of 6. Our kids ages range from 7-19. It was the best day we had in Huatulco! I had fairly low expectations but this experience far exceeded them. The drive wasn\'t that bad, based upon other reviews I was prepared for worse. We went to Las Brisas and Llano Grande and stopped at the coffee plantation for a delicious oaxacan lunch. We bought a bag of coffee to bring home and it is wonderful. I have high coffee standards too! We paid a bit more for a private tour, but it was well worth the extra money. Do not miss!

466496373.name: Ivan (tour guide and friend)
466496373.author: a TripAdvisor user
466496373.reviewBody: We met with a man named Ivan who took us where ever we visited,His phone number is 9581086193. He charged us $100 for us and anyone who came with us. Left at 8am and stopped for beer and water for the trip. Stopped for free food at a roadside vendor. Seems Ivan knows a lot of local people. Then wished to stop at the Shaman stop(where we donated for local schools cause we stopped last trip) Then we continued on at a reasonable speed cause  going too fast over bumpy roads fast require gravol. The trip was worth it. Beautiful. Amazing. We were fed at the site by the lovely local people at the site. please tip!

439376131.name: Learn about Rural Mexico on Trip to Amazing Falls
439376131.author: a TripAdvisor user
439376131.reviewBody:
We went to see these falls while on a shore excursion from Hualtuco Mexico. It is about a 2 hour drive to get to the falls on very bumpy mud roads. These roads become very muddy when rained on.  

The  area is very rural and it gives you good insight into just how basic the living is in these hills.  

It is about a 500 meter walk through a rain forest so make sure you wear bug spray.  The walk is mainly on relatively level ground

  However,  there are also many steps down to where the falls are located. These steps are uneven and are mostly made of earth and stones with a primitive wood railing.

The falls are amazing with very clear water that is cool and refreshing.  There are changing facilities there with no toilets, and benches so that you can sit by the shore.  I would recommend wearing water shoes here as it is rocky getting into the water and do bring your bathing suit
as this is a once in your lifetime chance to swim in a rain forest river with falls.

427562746.name: The Cascades at Llano Grande
427562746.author: a TripAdvisor user
427562746.reviewBody: We didn\'t take one of the tours, we drove up by ourselves.  It is a drive that we have taken many times, so I\'m use to it.  If you do it, be prepared for rutted dirt roads and depending on the season, mud.  Be prepared for at least an hour drive if you do it yourself, but it is a beautiful trip and worth it.  We stopped at La Gloria, a coffee finca, and picked up a "guide" to the Cascades.  I knew the original owners of La Gloria, Gustavo & Izabella Scherenburg, now run by their son, Max Scherenberg Noyola.   A short ride down another dirt road, bought us to a parking area.  You then walk down a path adjacent to the stream past many pools and small water falls.  At the end of the walk is the largest pool and falls.  A lot depends on the season.  This trip was in the beginning of October so the water was high.  You can go behind the falls and even swing on a rope off the falls,  and refreshing, cool water!  A wonderful afternoon.  After, you can go back to La Gloria for a meal.  Well worth the trip.  But be prepared for a long walk if you go all the way to the last pool.  Enjoy!!!

399340935.name: Nice Place to Cool Off from the Heat in Huatulco
399340935.author: a TripAdvisor user
399340935.reviewBody: The waterfalls here are a nice place to visit as the river here offers many wading pool areas to swim in. It\'s about a two hour drive from Huatulco on the coast to reach this place in the mountains. Bring a picnic and enjoy the beautiful surroundings.

369796659.name: Fresh waterfalls
369796659.author: a TripAdvisor user
369796659.reviewBody: Paid $1200 pesos for an all day trip with free transportation, drinks (mezcal and juice), 2 hours at 2 waterfalls, food and coffee at La Gloria. Cool experience!! Bumpy ride to get to the waterfalls (might get dizzy).

366455981.name: Waterfalls and coffee plantation
366455981.author: a TripAdvisor user
366455981.reviewBody: Easy 45 minute hike..some stairs beautiful beautiful area.  Lunch was great and the coffe is incredible. The falls are outstanding and the rope jump was blast.  \n\nVery nice day.

341041154.name: Fantastic! Definitely worth the trip!
341041154.author: a TripAdvisor user
341041154.reviewBody: Had a rental car that we took up here. It\'s a good 1h+ ride up into the mountains to the waterfall, through a lot of small villages. Several persons wrote reg. 4x4-wheelers and SUVs etc. We had a small regular car and had no problems.\n\nThe falls are beautiful. 50pesos per person to enter. The water is clear and a bit fresh, but absolutely stunning! Definitely worth the trip up here!

339220000.name: Excellant Experience - definitely worth the trek!
339220000.author: a TripAdvisor user
339220000.reviewBody: We booked this through Air Transat once we arrived in Huatulco - Carlos did a fantastic job from start to finish- the ride was very rocky but he stopped numerous times to show us key areas and explain the Mexican way of living and about the local towns. He went beyond his expectations and stopped at scenic points to take pictures with the various couples (8 of us altogether). He also gave us a quick coffee plantation tour which was definitely not part of the itinerary and we loved it! The Oaxaca lunch is not to be missed! It was delicious with the mole sauce! The waterfall was breathtaking and my husband did his first jump into a waterfall as it wasnt too steep and he loved it! Although the water was cold as it was freshwater, it was so clean and not many tourists!

279849849.name: BEAUTIFUL WOULD VISIT AGAIN
279849849.author: a TripAdvisor user
279849849.reviewBody: It\'s a sight you must see to believe. It is a very long drive up the jungle but the further in the greener. The water is a bit cold but crisp clean. We loved this tour it was our favorite!

257516293.name: Go with a tour for a fun day exploring, learning and eating!
257516293.author: a TripAdvisor user
257516293.reviewBody:
We visited the falls, along with the coffee plantation, through a tour set up by Paraiso Huatulco.  It was 1 1/2 hours to get there and the trip was all day, but the tour was 1200 pesos for 2 people, with lunch, snacks, mezcal and tour guide.  The taxi ride alone would have been 900 pesos each way from the hotel.  Talk about a great deal!  

We also enjoyed being the only Americans/primary English speakers on the trip.  The other couples in the group were Mexican as was the guide.  He had excellent English to provide a fun commentary during the trip and was an incredibly safe driver.

For those who do not recommend visiting this location, I would wonder if they visited Huatulco with no interest in learning more about Mexico, the villages, the Huatulco way of life, etc.  We learned a lot from our tour guide about what people eat, how they grow and harvest coffee, various information about villages we drove through - we learned a lot! The lunch was plentiful and the falls were beautiful.  It was also fun to get away from the beach and into the mountains, where the air was cooler and you could get insight on how Oaxaca residents live.  

I would recommend a tour here for anyone who enjoys light hiking, getting to know the city/country to which you're traveling, and learning more from the other Mexican residents on vacation.

249779522.name: Truly Stunning!
249779522.author: a TripAdvisor user
249779522.reviewBody: We hired a cab from Puerto Angel for the 2+ hour trip up through the mountains to the waterfalls.  What a truly wonderful experience.  The road up is rough and vehicle with ground clearance is advisable but a vehicle with decent shocks would do just fine. On the way, you travel through Santa Maria (you can stock up on snacks/water here) and other smaller villages.  The road takes you up to areas where the coffee plantations are.  There is a fee to enter the natural area (fee is paid at the entrance to the park, about 1 hr from main hwy) which is 10 pesos/person.  There is also a fee to enter the waterfall area of 40 pesos/person.  \nThe waterfalls are specatular!  There is a trail to follow along the river.  Be sure to go all the way to the top, to the first one, and then work your way down.  There are ropes to guide you across the slippery areas and ropes to swing from.  All of the pools are crystal clear and the water is quite chilly but very refreshing. We are so glad we made the trek!

193595550.name: Magical!!!
193595550.author: a TripAdvisor user
193595550.reviewBody:
I visited the falls/coffee plantation/butterfly sanctuary on Feb 6, 2014. It was the highlight of our trip! 
8 of us packed in a van and made the 1.5 hour trek through the mountains. The views were fantastic, but the roads were a bit scary. It was worth it! 
I cannot properly describe how beautiful the river and waterfalls are. There's a 500m trail along the river to get to the main falls. The butterflies combined with the sounds of the river and the birds, and the jungle canopy made for a dream-like hike. Seriously, I never thought I would see anything like that in my life!
We did the rope swings from the falls and walked down a couple more levels (there are several falls). The water is quite cool and there are a lot of tadpoles in the shallow areas. 
After the falls, we ate a delicious traditional lunch at the coffee plantation. I highly recommend it!
On the ride back, we saw many small mountain villages. The locals had nice clothes hanging on their clotheslines and decent vehicles and motorcycles. I get the idea that the standard of living is higher than in other areas I've traveled in Mexico.

192867979.name: Fabulous water falls, butterflies,medicine
192867979.author: a TripAdvisor user
192867979.reviewBody: This was a long drive from puerto escondido and worth it! Our driver organized oaxacan food, coffee plantation tour and showed us how to reach the falls for a leisure playtime. Lovely day. I will contact valfred tours again for their professional and knowledgable driver/guide.

185220019.name: Unforgettable Experience
185220019.author: a TripAdvisor user
185220019.reviewBody:
This place was like a dream. I've never been in a jungle with a large waterfall where you could not only swim in the prestine cold water that was so clear you could see the bottom, but you could jump off the waterfall as well! We were brought here from Huatulco during our honeymoon and were lucky to have our guide to ourselves as well as a local, Erik, who was so sweet in helping us with our things and helping our clumsy selves wade through the water and showed us some aspects only the locals would know about (as well as applying a mud mask - which I ended up buying because I loved it!) We thoroughly enjoyed the hike and the beautiful surroundings. This is the real deal - you see and feel nature as it should be all around you. 

We also got the meal that they offer after the trek (I would HIGHLY recommend it) and the authentic mexican food (cucumber salad, rice, tortillas, jalapeno mole with chicken, pork marinated in tamarind, and black beans) along with their hibiscus tea (Agua de Jamaica) and Oaxacan coffee. I purchased the dried flowers and coffee beans because I don't know the next time I'll be back.

Also, we went to the butterfly center where they had native butterflies (HUNDREDS of them) and a nursery where they were growing and hatching butterflies to help conservation. There was small fee to get in. 

Helpful tips: It'd be great if you spoke Spanish as they can speak English, but they are able to tell you more about the place if you speak the language. Make sure to bring extra cash to tip your guides, grab some food, check out other things around the area, and get coffee, tea, and other souvenirs! Out of everything we did on our trip, this was my favorite activity.

664555713.name: Nice experience for travelers
664555713.author: a TripAdvisor user
664555713.reviewBody: Visit this beach when in Huatulco. Why not? That\'s why you are there. It\'s a 20 minute walk from Santa Cruz or a 30 peso taxi ride. The beach is on the open ocean and is steep making ingress and egress a little tricky for some, especially if there is swell. Probably not a good spot for kids to swim. I read someone\'s suggestion that this beach is good for sunsets....? Why???  I was there in Feb. The sun sets over land to the west over your right shoulder when facing the water. This whole section of coast more or less faces south,

654014965.name: Be here at sunset
654014965.author: a TripAdvisor user
654014965.reviewBody: According to our concierge, Chaue is the beach to be on to watch the sun go down. Haven\u2019t done that yet! But I can tell you that Chahue is a lovely sandy beach, deep but somewhat steep, with a moderate tide. It is a 10 to fifteen minute walk from the surrounding hotels and condos that are not on the water. It is also lined with \u201cbeach clubs\u201d where you can spend the day sitting in deck chairs, eating and drinking, swimming in a pool, getting a massage etc. In short, Chahue is a spot where you can pamper yourself, or not.

652967980.name: Quaint
652967980.author: a TripAdvisor user
652967980.reviewBody: Nice area to stay. Clean and the people are very friendly.  Definitely a place to enjoy yourself. There are restaurants and shopping close by.

651260518.name: Nice sand...not crowded
651260518.author: a TripAdvisor user
651260518.reviewBody: A quiet beach ... sand is not coarse however not as fine as Entrega. Water can be a bit rough but have been there on calm days and it was great. Lifeguards present and vigilant.

651136080.name: Beautiful Sunrise in the Morning.
651136080.author: a TripAdvisor user
651136080.reviewBody: We stayed 4 nights at a local hotel by the Chahue Bay. The sunrise in the morning was just gorgeous. The ocean waves were mightily strong, so don\'t even try to swim in the bay if you are not a strong swimmer. We saw a turtle trying to swim back to sea, very unique experience to behold.

645401872.name: physically stunning
645401872.author: a TripAdvisor user
645401872.reviewBody: Went there for a walk. Mostly private beach clubs but there is at least one where you can rent a chair/bed with cover. Swimming seems to be a afterthought as it was blacked flag due to undertow.

642508686.name: Beautiful
642508686.author: a TripAdvisor user
642508686.reviewBody: This beach is the best we found in Huatulco.  Large beach, fun waves, not busy, and no vendors bothering you to buy stuff.  Hopefully it stays that way because it would be unfortunate if it turns into Santa Cruz or Entrega beach (those places are a nightmare).  \n\nIf you want, there are a couple beach clubs where you can rent chairs/umbrellas for 150 pesos (which can then be used towards food); however, this is not necessary and you can very easily find a free spot on the beach to lay down a towel and relax.

641166630.name: Chahue Beach
641166630.author: a TripAdvisor user
641166630.reviewBody: Great beach with fantastic waves to play in most days.  Public can access the beach at the east end of the beach.  Nice breakwater at the far eastern end of the beach that you can walk out on. Large beach with private beach clubs along much of it.  Most allow you to purchase a day pass.  Some snorkelling along the edges of the bay but can be quite rough.  Sandy bottom so no need for water shoes.

638075054.name: Nice Beach with Easy Access.
638075054.author: a TripAdvisor user
638075054.reviewBody: This beach is not crowded. The water can be a challenge for small children,\nGood food near-by at Latitude 15 .

637450695.name: Nice area, what happened
637450695.author: a TripAdvisor user
637450695.reviewBody: This area needs some revitalization and it will be beautiful. Easy access, no vendors, lots of locals. I heard undertow being said, but didn\'t swim here.

636684388.name: Beach
636684388.author: a TripAdvisor user
636684388.reviewBody: A beautiful beach were the Hotel Castillo has its beach club. It has an amazing restaurant/bar right on the beach which serves complete meals and delicious cocktails.

635060451.name: Calm beach
635060451.author: a TripAdvisor user
635060451.reviewBody:
It is calm beach with several hotels.
It is not easy to swim in this place so not recommended for children. 
You can watch sunrise in this place.
Great place to do sports, yoga. 
You also have breakfast, lunch or dinner in hotels with a great view!
Prices much better than in Santa Cruz beach!

634948301.name: A beautiful sunrise!
634948301.author: a TripAdvisor user
634948301.reviewBody: A great place to go at dawn. A hub of activity, with pescadores, walkers, joggers, and exercisers. My wife and I also went later in the day, and it was much nicer earlier on.

602454067.name: Spectacular, clean, centrally located
602454067.author: a TripAdvisor user
602454067.reviewBody: Chahue is one of the few "Blue Flag" beaches in the world, certified as ecologically pristine.    Its centrally located, and an easy walk to the large marina in Santa Cruz and the central village of La Crucecita.   There a some great restaurants and the adjacent Chahue marina.   The beach itself is fronted by beautiful condos and beach clubs.   The eastern side of the beach has a long breakwater topped by a walkway.   You\'ll find fishermen there early every morning.   There is a lifeguard on duty during the day.   Swimming can be a little rough (there are sometimes rip tides) but there is a roped off swimming area in front of the lifeguard\'s stand.    Chahue is a wonderful place to watch sunrise.

576064411.name: Great Beach But the Surf is Rough
576064411.author: a TripAdvisor user
576064411.reviewBody: Chahue is a great beach with several beach clubs but be careful with the surf... it is very rough and not a great place for kids or inexperienced swimmers

570779371.name: lovely
570779371.author: a TripAdvisor user
570779371.reviewBody: What we loved about this place, in addition to the spectacular view, when we went here as the sun was setting, is that it was populated tranquilly by locals, with few loud and obnoxious Americans on hand to ruin it.  We loved that the locals who were fishing off the pier in the traditional way, only with fishing line without a rod, took the time to show our daughters their catch. Very warm and friendly people and delightful sights = unbeatable place to spend some hours walking along the beach and elsewhere.

569719707.name: Lovely beach but need to buy a day pass
569719707.author: a TripAdvisor user
569719707.reviewBody: Too rough for snorkeling but a nice little beach for a change of pace.  The beach bars are all pretty good but if you are not staying with one of the hotels there you will need to buy a day pass.  Not a big deal just be aware of that.  Then you can have a nice chair under a palapa order a drink or lunch.

566930949.name: Beautiful Beach
566930949.author: a TripAdvisor user
566930949.reviewBody: The beach is incredible.  Best sand.  Not good for swimming but beautiful to sit on.  There is a restaurant you can go to for food and drinks.  A must see.

564671716.name: Chahue Beach
564671716.author: a TripAdvisor user
564671716.reviewBody: We spent many days swimming and snorkeling here. The waves can be a challenge, however, for some, but was a great experience for us.

557829363.name: Lovely to look at
557829363.author: a TripAdvisor user
557829363.reviewBody: This beach is lovely to look at, but not very swimmable.  It usually has a red flag.  Quite an undertow.  We swam there once.  I wouldn\u2019t recommend if you are looking for a swimming beach.\n

556686389.name: 18 relaxing days at Sueno Del Mar
556686389.author: a TripAdvisor user
556686389.reviewBody:
Top notch service at this luxury condo complex.
Everything was five star from the airport pickup to the transfer back. 
The men that maintain the property work non stop to keep it clean and beautiful.
Your every want is fulfilled here.  All you have to do is ask. 
The views from the terrace are incredible. 
Kudos to Maria and her staff for making this a fabulous, fuss free destination for visitors.

555980723.name: Clean, Tranquil Beach
555980723.author: a TripAdvisor user
555980723.reviewBody:
As previous reviews note, Playa Chahue is a beautiful beach. It is very clean (as designated by its blue flag award for cleanliness) and is sparsely populated. The reason for the lack of beach goers most likely has to do with the red flag that inevitably seems to be up.

We visited Playa Chahue four times over the course of our stay. The red flag was up all four times we visited--whether the waves were less or more than a foot high. I point this out to suggest that perhaps whether one goes in the water or not should depend on one's comfort level upon seeing the waves. We went into the water on every visit and saw many other people in the water as well. We are also snorkelers, so we snorkeled as well. We found a variety of fish near the rocks on the west side of the bay as well as near the rocks just west of the lifeguard tower in front of Isla Huatulco Beach Club. The visibility wasn't great (which is why I'm removing one star), but it was good enough to see some sea life. 

We had read about the undertow, but we didn't experience it during our visits. Having said that, I would recommend snorkeling in Playa Chahue only for those who know how to navigate waves and who know how to swim out of a possible undertow. Since there is a pretty steep drop off upon entry, swimming here also requires being comfortable treading water. When we were there in mid-January, the water temperature was about 78 degrees.

555668993.name: Nice place to spend the day
555668993.author: a TripAdvisor user
555668993.reviewBody: We enjoyed our visit to this beach on a very hot day. Usually a red flag beach but that means a cooling breeze. Half the beach is open to public and the other half is reserved for beach clubs or all inclusive guests. When you try to cross the center line (where the rock outcroppings are, the lifeguards chase after you with a whistle. We had no idea why this was happening until a nice Canadian woman explained it to us. There is a pretty jetty with walkway where you can walk out over the water. To the left of this jetty is the entrance to the marina. Back in the marina are some of the best restaurants in the area. Cafe Juanita being our favorite- so if you are buying food at a beach club to have a chair- try to save room for a nice sunset view dinner by the marina!

551998213.name: Great quiet Beach
551998213.author: a TripAdvisor user
551998213.reviewBody: There are some days where there is a strong tide and if you are not a strong swimmer you should be careful. We came here daily and the first two days were true red flag days, while the last 5 were much calmer and definately not red flag. However the flags posted remained the same everyday so they are not a true judge of situations. I can see how if you swim one day and be scared another.

551352778.name: Pretty but can\u2019t swim
551352778.author: a TripAdvisor user
551352778.reviewBody: Beautiful beach, very clean, but you really can\u2019t swim in the water. There were some people, even young kids, frolicking near the shore, but abolutely no snorkelling. Go for a look see, but we ended up walking to Santa Cruz beach.

550536661.name: Playa Chahue
550536661.author: a TripAdvisor user
550536661.reviewBody: Large beach by the Chahue marina.  Stone walking pier at one end and lots of folks fish off the pier.  Beach is very large with lots of parking behind it.  Private beach clubs block entrance except at the left end of the beach.  Water can be very rough and the sand is a little courser than most of the beaches in the area.  \nTahere is a small calm beach on the other side of the stone pier.  Most folks ignore this but it is a great place to swim.

540248986.name: Chahue Beach and Bay is Beautiful
540248986.author: a TripAdvisor user
540248986.reviewBody: We happened upon Chahue accidentally and I\u2019m glad we did. The beaches and bay are breathtaking and there are hardly any people there.

474715645.name: Beautiful, clean beach
474715645.author: a TripAdvisor user
474715645.reviewBody: I was really surprised by the beauty and cleanliness of this beach. I would visit again. I would not recommend eating at the beach club restaurant, but the beach is wonderful. Quiet and clean.

473053763.name: Gorgeous!!
473053763.author: a TripAdvisor user
473053763.reviewBody:
Lovely beach, clear stunning water, centrally located, and not chaotic with people like santa Cruz. It is also one of the blue flag beaches in our world ( eco-conscious & clean!!) . 

We loved coming here. If you need shade bring an umbrella or pay to stay at one of the beach clubs. 

To swim here, experience of ocean swimming is recommended.  You need to understand the power of the ocean and respect her. Someone just died recently- which we could see how easy that would be as the drop off is steep (!!!!) and the pull is moderate with crashing waves. We had a blast swimming, but we grew up by the ocean, (i would not bring my Ontario friends here to swim... Lifeguard skills and all). Children?- to play on the sand only.

Enjoy her beauty!!!

472222355.name: Cozy area with Canadian presence
472222355.author: a TripAdvisor user
472222355.reviewBody: This is the area were lots of Canadians live in hotels or in huge houses on the street called LaCanada. Nice area to enjoy the local living opposed to the resort, clean, good for shopping, safe.

471532285.name: Chahue
471532285.author: a TripAdvisor user
471532285.reviewBody: Great little area on the edge of La Crucecita.  Beautiful large beach beside the marina and lovely park just behinfd the beach.  Some nice beach clubs as well.  Nice stone breakwater that you can fish from as well.  Liked it so much we rented a condo there for 4 months next winter.  Can walk to La Crucecita in about 15 minutes and to the Chadeau (grocery store) in about 5 minutes.   Alos about a 15 minute walk to Santa Cruz.  Kind of inthe middle of everything.

469878633.name: Stunningly beautiful - hardly any people.
469878633.author: a TripAdvisor user
469878633.reviewBody: Very easy access by cab, bus or foot.  A incredibly nice, wide, long, clean, fluffy beach -- no trees or shade or food/drink available tho.  (Tie as a few minutes walk back by the road).  There is a beach club for $10 per day - chairs, umbrellas, pool, cash restaurant - that shares the beach.  We didn\'t go there, but took a look-- seemed reasonable for the amenities.  Swimming is possible in sea.  Waves can be rough but adults should be ok.  Lifeguard & police on duty.  Designated a \'Blue Flag\' beach.

468555033.name: Beautiful uncrowded beach
468555033.author: a TripAdvisor user
468555033.reviewBody: I was at this picturesque beach with my mother. Very clean with beautiful white sand. It is less known than the other beaches in Huatulco and therefore less crowded. It\'s classified as a Blue Flag beach, so very well maintained and no pollution. A good choices of beach clubs available for lunch or supper right on the beach. We had a delicious seafood lunch at the Castillo Beach Club. A beautiful swimming pool is available at that club. The entry  fees to this club gives you access to the swimming pool and the loungers on the beach. However, be careful at the undertow if you decide to swim.

467946884.name: no shade
467946884.author: a TripAdvisor user
467946884.reviewBody:
Unless you pay to go to beach club there is no where to get away from the sun
The beach is raked by macine in the morning so very clean, there are publis bathrooms( 5 pesos ) and showers for 10 pesos available
Parking is free across the street
The sand is white and scenery beautiful

465430102.name: Quiet beach to watch the waves roll in...
465430102.author: a TripAdvisor user
465430102.reviewBody: We spent the afternoon at Chahue yesterday on our second trip to Huatulco. The beach is relatively long compared to others in the area, sheltered by rock faces on either side. An extreme drop off and strong undertow can make the waves a dangerous place to swim. We visited late in the afternoon and the red flag was raised on the beach to alert swimmers to dangerous conditions. This warning didn\'t stop too many eager swimmers, but lifeguards manning the beach were diligent about ensuring those braving the waves stayed within the roped off area. My boyfriend and I stayed near shore to play in the surf and still got our fair share of of ocean spray. The beach at Chahue is wide and hilly, and walking through the hot & deep sand was a workout! We took to a bali bed at one of the beach clubs to rest and seek shade. We chose lattitude 15 as the others were quite full. At 100 pesos per person for admission, I would venture to guess this was one of the more expensive beach clubs in chahue, but the beer was cold & kept flowing and only set us back 35 pesos a glass. Other than at the clubs, not too many other beach goers were around! Definitely a quieter location compared to Santa Cruz or Entrega. You could easily bring your beach towels and a cooler of your own drinks, but don\'t forget an umbrella. Shade is one thing you won\'t find at Chahue and the temperature today is going up to 34\u00b0C!

461538342.name: Quick visit with friends
461538342.author: a TripAdvisor user
461538342.reviewBody: Stopped by one evening for some quiet times with friends , the beach is spectacular and was uncrowded, nice to just sit have a cold drink and watch the waves and wildlife.

459275626.name: Nice
459275626.author: a TripAdvisor user
459275626.reviewBody: This is the town around the harbor for private boats.  There is also a great dive shop but not much else in the harbor. Adjacent to the harbor are a few hotels and restaurants set back from another great beach.

457958241.name: Nice first day beach
457958241.author: a TripAdvisor user
457958241.reviewBody: We spent only one night in Huatulco as we were traveling on to Oaxaca the next day, but still managed to get in a couple of swims at this excellent beach. It is fairly big, and there were not many people there ( in early January). There were mostly Mexican nationals there so it felt like a place away from the usual gringo tourist spots. Many of the folks were visiting from Mexico city and other places in the interior, so everyone was quite happy to be on the beach. The water was calm and the beach drops off quickly so it was a nice swim without going out too far. Some of the other reviews mention the water having an undertow or being fairly wild, but that would be weather-dependent I suppose. During our visit it was very calm.

453495755.name: Not Great for swimming
453495755.author: a TripAdvisor user
453495755.reviewBody: There is a very strong undertow here so it\'s not a great place to swim. They did have some turtle eggs fenced off which was kinda neat.

452904859.name: Perfect day
452904859.author: a TripAdvisor user
452904859.reviewBody: Great beach - did not feel like Mexico more like the Caribbean.  The beach is deep and steep as the sand is swept in high - water gets deep quickly.  The breeze off the ocean does provide a nice cooling effect but it can be quite hot.  Wonderful deep sand that is quite fine and provides a nice leg work out.  Several palapas are available to provide great shade.  Food and drinks were good including palapa table service.

452815314.name: You better be a good swimmer!
452815314.author: a TripAdvisor user
452815314.reviewBody: Nice beach but man do the waves roll in.  I\'m a good swimmer and one day i got tossed around like a rag doll in a washing machine.

451706634.name: pretty beach but not for swimming
451706634.author: a TripAdvisor user
451706634.reviewBody: While the beach at Chahue is pretty it, is not good for swimming.  There is an undertow and lots of jellyfish!

442727696.name: Big beach area
442727696.author: a TripAdvisor user
442727696.reviewBody: Nice enough place but the daily tides tend to make for some " very " large climbs down to the ocean.  You have to bring your own shade and your own goodies for the day.\nThe tide here is also very strong so you should be aware at all times of the conditions.

429452962.name: Don\'t bother
429452962.author: a TripAdvisor user
429452962.reviewBody: The beach is very rough here and there is really nothing around for local fare.  We walked over and just simply walked back to our hotel.

379215047.name: a little bit of everything
379215047.author: a TripAdvisor user
379215047.reviewBody: We visited this beach a few times during our one week stay  in the area. \nQuiet, great service if  you needed it. and great central location.\n

363662202.name: Beautiful beach, golden sand, relaxing and vast space.
363662202.author: a TripAdvisor user
363662202.reviewBody: Chahue is one of my favorites. Unspoiled, golden sands, only 2 beach clubs well away from each other. Privacy and a relaxed atmosphere. Pity you cannot swim there very often due to the undercurrents. Well guarded and watched by security and life guards.

363602777.name: Quiet Beach, Popular with the Locals
363602777.author: a TripAdvisor user
363602777.reviewBody: This is a pretty beach, just off the main road to the resorts. There is always a surf so the swimming is a bit rough for the Little Ones. It is however, perfect for that morning or afternoon walk as there is a breakwater pier with a nice view.

356878488.name: Beautiful quiet beach, great for walking!
356878488.author: a TripAdvisor user
356878488.reviewBody: We walked to this beach from LaCrucecita and hung out at a beach club for a little while one day and then the next night our hotel was right on this beach!  It\'s really a gorgeous view and while it\'s not the best beach for swimming there is a roped off area that is fine for swimming.  There was hardly anyone on the beach!

354899607.name: Nice Quaint Town
354899607.author: a TripAdvisor user
354899607.reviewBody: This is a nice town which is walking distance to beaches! Great views nice and quiet. It has a supermarket which you can get anything at "super Che" it has many spectacular birds and great for taking a nice walk or riding a scooter! Friendly and helpful locals!

352682319.name: Nice Quiet Beach
352682319.author: a TripAdvisor user
352682319.reviewBody: Not a great beach for swimming but it\'s very quiet with few people.  There are a couple of beach clubs that you can use.  We just set up our stuff at a chair with an umbrella and no one questioned us at all.  We understood that you would normally have to purchase a day pass but no one seemed to care...  We sure enjoyed our day here - very peaceful and a nice beach to walk along...

352194510.name: A marina and....
352194510.author: a TripAdvisor user
352194510.reviewBody: ...a lovely but constantly wavy beach.\nOnly a private beach club here for services.  No resto\'s/stalls like most the other beaches.

350875813.name: Great Marina!
350875813.author: a TripAdvisor user
350875813.reviewBody: This was our first visit to Chahue. This marina has really developed quickly. Very clean, and quiet. There are several local restaurant/bars, and it\'s not far off the main boulevard through the area if you had to walk to or from a taxi.

348258204.name: Crazy beach
348258204.author: a TripAdvisor user
348258204.reviewBody: Playa Chahue is a great beach to watch the waves.  Generally, it\'s a pretty beach with very inconsistent waves and under tows.  Many experienced swimmers think twice before entering.  There is a life guard who patrols the beach and warns swimmers. We stayed at Quinta Bella which is on the Chahue beach so we saw many different changes in the waves. Sometimes calm depending on the time of day and sometimes crazy rough. Either way it was beautiful to watch.

341776107.name: Afternoon out of the resort.
341776107.author: a TripAdvisor user
341776107.reviewBody: Great beach not a lot of people.  Strong waves okay for experienced swimmers.  There is a shelf right off of shore but water was perfect and wonderful to swim in.  No shade so bring an umbrella \n\n

340281756.name: Beautiful beach
340281756.author: a TripAdvisor user
340281756.reviewBody: Crystal clear water, wide expanse of beach area, and very few people. Enjoyed a lovely morning here and couldn\'t believe that there were only 6 people around.

336540551.name: Fun in the surf !
336540551.author: a TripAdvisor user
336540551.reviewBody: Like other people have said, the tow is strong but we had fun playing in the waves and even just sitting at the edge of the waves as they were string enough to move us around ! There are lifeguards. The beach is beautiful and clean.

282693279.name: Quiet beach
282693279.author: a TripAdvisor user
282693279.reviewBody: Very quiet beach that is suitable for sunbathing, but not for swimming.  Small beach area surrounded by only a handful of hotels.

272604704.name: Take Care
272604704.author: a TripAdvisor user
272604704.reviewBody: Chahue has a beautiful bay and beach, but swimming in the ocean is very dangerous because of the shelf and undertow. Enjoy the ocean view from one of two beach clubs.

261728346.name: took a tour to the Turtle Santuary
261728346.author: a TripAdvisor user
261728346.reviewBody: Awesome Day seeing the Turtle Santuary and the crocodiles in the lagoon. We were lucky to be able to free baby turtles on the day we were there.

259133894.name: Harmony with nature
259133894.author: a TripAdvisor user
259133894.reviewBody: This is a must site if you visit Huatulco. A virgin beach where local people make a great effort to preserve it and to keep tourists in harmony with nature, a respectful relationship.\n\nYou must have a trip to the crocodile sanctuary where people shows you the iimpact of natural disasters and human activity in local species.

257316782.name: Rough beach, but nice sand
257316782.author: a TripAdvisor user
257316782.reviewBody: Chahue is a great walking beach and the water is nice, but rough so be careful on certain days. Close to the marina, you can see some amazing yachts come and go!

255107226.name: Cafeful, strong waves
255107226.author: a TripAdvisor user
255107226.reviewBody:
Cafeful, strong waves can be dangerous.
Cafeful, strong waves
Cafeful, strong waves
Cafeful, strong waves
Tides!

252823288.name: Beautiful beach- lots of waves
252823288.author: a TripAdvisor user
252823288.reviewBody: Our beach club was located on Chahue Bay. The beach is beautiful and not overly busy. There are always some waves in the water in that bay, but generally one can go into the water and play in the waves. As the tide comes in later in the day it gets a but rougher but not too terrible. You can also head to the left towards the pier where the water is less rough or even on the other side of the pier where it is protected and has a small beach that is virtually calm for the most part. The last 3 days of our 2 weeks, there were amazing waves on the bay, far to big and rough to swim in, for me anyway although there were a few individuals that  enjoyed the challenge . The rest of us spent 1-2 hours sitting and watching the beauty of nature .

252637863.name: It is a beach---nothing more
252637863.author: a TripAdvisor user
252637863.reviewBody: Why bother going to it? Too rough for the elderly Canadians who frequent Huatalco. As a European tourist said---it is MORE boring than Belgium!

251369753.name: Wonderful beach!
251369753.author: a TripAdvisor user
251369753.reviewBody: I love Chahue beach - the water is wonderful, surf usually safe enough to,play in, not too many people, great for walking. The snorkelling is not great, and you need to take a beach umbrella for shade if you\'re not at one of the little beach clubs.

250644031.name: quiet local beach
250644031.author: a TripAdvisor user
250644031.reviewBody: This beach is quiet and pretty.  There are a couple of beach clubs there where you can get a drink and lunch etc...\nThe ocean is not safe for children and you need to be a strong swimmer as there are currents and under tow at this beach.  \n

244723257.name: Such a beautiful beach
244723257.author: a TripAdvisor user
244723257.reviewBody: We had so much fun tumbling in the waves on this beach!  We also chose this beach as the backdrop for our pictures and they were just beautiful.  The people doing exercises on the beach also serenaded us with Spanish love songs while we took our photos!  Is the romantic spot for couples in the evenings!

243378477.name: rough but clear water!!
243378477.author: a TripAdvisor user
243378477.reviewBody: ok for good swimmers when the chop isn\'t so high, sand is nice and the water is clear.  Daniel offers reasonable fishing excursions.

241791836.name: Great little underdeveloped beach
241791836.author: a TripAdvisor user
241791836.reviewBody: We discovered Chahue since our hotel was on it.  It\'s a nice long and wide beach for walking / jogging.  When we were hear, the waves were pretty rough to get in, but there was a designated swimming zone that had easier access. There\'s several hotels with restaurants and a beach club on the beach.  Several of the hotels have beach chairs that you can use.  Our hotel even had showers too (which seemed uncommon in Huatulco.There\'s a life guard on the beach too.

239328018.name: I got married here and we liekd it. Not for swimmers!
239328018.author: a TripAdvisor user
239328018.reviewBody: It\'s nice to have a beer by the beach club, but it\'s not so nice to take a swim (its allowed only under your own risk) because there are strong currents that make it dangerous to swim (two of our wedding guests almost drown there the day after our wedding, but luckily there were lifeguards on duty at that time).

236521892.name: Chahue public beach club closed
236521892.author: a TripAdvisor user
236521892.reviewBody: The public beach club at Chahue is closed. I asked a few locals why but nobody had an answer.\nI love the Castillo Beach Club, a day pass is 100 pesos. Yesterday was a great day for swimming in the ocean. The water was calm and no undertow.

209213104.name: Beach
209213104.author: a TripAdvisor user
209213104.reviewBody: A very wavy beach with a strong undertow.  No or very little swimming here unless you are experienced.  The beach club to our resort was here and it was decent with a pool and food and drink.  Coarse sand beach.  We walked it didnt spend much time here.  Better areas to see and hang out at

207963532.name: Under tow and major waves discourage swimming there
207963532.author: a TripAdvisor user
207963532.reviewBody: This beach is closest to town and an easy walk from hotels at that end. There is a public beach club that is a bit rundown and a ropey then several private clubs; some of which you can pay an entry fee and buy drinks and food. All the clubs have pools, but just not the same as swimming in the \nocean!

198528997.name: Great beach experience.
198528997.author: a TripAdvisor user
198528997.reviewBody: Went to Chahue Beach Club yesterday.  Things are a little worse for wear but the location is great.  Service a bit slow, but hey who needs to hurry?  We paid the $35p each and had that taken off our bill of drinks and snacks. A couple at a table next to us who were staying at the same condo didn\'t pay anything.  Brought our beach umbrella (super cheap @ Super Che) and parked right on the shore.  Trick to swimming on this beach is to go a little later in the day when the current seems to slow down.  We were there from about 11ish until 3pm.  I used water shoes to swim.  Take your time moving out into the water and you should be fine.  If you\'re not an experienced or strong swimmer you can do like some of the locals and just lay like a beached whale on the sand and let the waves come up and roll over you.  Lots of fun!

197197094.name: Nice, quiet beach!
197197094.author: a TripAdvisor user
197197094.reviewBody: We stayed at Hotel Castillo which has a beach club at Chahue. We had a couple of great snorkelling days there and saw a wide variety of fish along the rocky coasts. The water was murky at times and the undertow can take you by surprise but the beach is nice, clean and not crowded. There are even recycling containers there.  If you are not a guest at any of the hotels that have beach clubs and would like to enjoy an all-inclusive package, day passes are available at the clubs for about $100 pesos a person.

197168280.name: Expensive and crappy
197168280.author: a TripAdvisor user
197168280.reviewBody: Cannot actually swim in the ocean here because the surf is too strong. Have to pay to use beach club. One is only about $3.50, but it\'s swimming pool was murky and they had no chairs on the actual beach. The other beach club had a nicer pool, but it was not overlooking the beach and they wanted a cover charge of $10, with food and beverage extra. We left right after we got there.

196474261.name: Chahue beach
196474261.author: a TripAdvisor user
196474261.reviewBody: We went to Chahue beach and it has waves and undertow so be careful swimming. Not for kids or poor swimmers. The hotel you walk through to get to the beach has a pool and taps to wash the sand off from the beach. You can get a beer there or other drinks and use the pool. They didn\'t charge us to use the beach or pool but I guess cause we bought drinks that is probably expected that you buy something while there. The pool seems OK but we watched the guy dump a whole lot of powdered bleach ? in so decided we would stay out of the pool water after that. I recommend other beaches in the area, not this one.

196070781.name: easy to like
196070781.author: a TripAdvisor user
196070781.reviewBody: We spent 3 afternoons at the Chahue Beach Club where we ate, drank, swam in the pool and enjoyed the bay. It\'s a great deal because the 35 pesos admission fee goes toward your food/drink bill. Very friendly people working there.

188063851.name: A quieter cove
188063851.author: a TripAdvisor user
188063851.reviewBody: Line by private beach clubs and up and coming condos, Chahue Beach is long and wide with strong breaking waves and undertow. Not a swimming beach for those weak or drunken swimmers that may frequent it. It\'s also home to a public beach club that includes food and drink for sale and pool for safer swimming. the beach merchants are laid back, but available for the purchasing of trinkets and glittery bling.

184940482.name: Beautiful beach, but...
184940482.author: a TripAdvisor user
184940482.reviewBody: I guess there is almost always an undertow, so you might not want to swim there.  Some food and facilities at one end, but basically, a lovely beach for walking, reading, feeling kissed by nature.

172096317.name: Beautiful Stretch of resorts and beach
172096317.author: a TripAdvisor user
172096317.reviewBody: Don\'t miss out on strolling down this beach , beautiful clean and clear water . A few hotels and resorts on it as well . \nStop by the Chahue club for some cold drinks . \nBeautiful area and clean beach .

161273457.name: home of Chahue beach club and Xquenda HuatulcoSpa
161273457.author: a TripAdvisor user
161273457.reviewBody: The area is quiet and great to walk around with a marina, beach club, public beach, and the home of the Xquenda Hutulco Spa. The beach club has excellent local food including swimming pools and bar.

160452163.name: A great golden beach
160452163.author: a TripAdvisor user
160452163.reviewBody: They say swimming is dangerous - and it could be for those who are not strong swimmers or who know how to get through a dumping wave - but we have rarely seen it so. It is a lovely beach, popular with locals in the afternoon who come to fly kites, play with the kids, or frolic in the shallows, while the tourists hang out by the pool in one of the beach clubs. A pity for them! The water is usually very clear and once beyond the two wave breaks, you can float, swim or peer at the fish swimming below you. It is one of my favourite afternoon beaches and when the wind comes from the south east (as opposed to the north) the waves flatten out and it is a great place to swim.

158182258.name: Morning Walks Taken Here!
158182258.author: a TripAdvisor user
158182258.reviewBody: Beautiful beach!  Many of the locals walk or run here in the morning before it gets hot.  Very safe.  I also fished here several times a week off the point by the light...fishing was OK.\nCheck it out!

154746258.name: Beautiful beach but...
154746258.author: a TripAdvisor user
154746258.reviewBody: This beach was closest to our Hotel Villa Blanca. The first time there we used the beach club since we were entitled to use it because of our hotel Villa Blanca. The wait staff her was average at best. There was not enough shade unless you stayed in the restaurant area. The bathrooms were clean but had no seats. I think this would be a problem for little kids. The beach itself is beautiful but not a good beach for children or people who are not strong swimmers. A strong undertow.\nThe next time we used the Hotel Castillos facilities. What a difference! Our waiter Cerelino (I hope I remembered this correctly) was attentive and proffessional. The food was good off the menu. The palapas were great providing shade all day and lounge chairs. Would definitely use these facilities again.

149698848.name: Closest to town
149698848.author: a TripAdvisor user
149698848.reviewBody: We chose to visit the 2 beach clubs on multiple occasions.  \nThe Castillo Beach Club officially belongs to the Castillo hotel and is open to the public at a cost of 100 pesos for the day; guests of the castillo have open bar (limited) and buffet provided for them free, non guests of the hotel are not entitled to this.  There is a food menu, good clubhouses and good cocktail menu.  The pool here is the cleanest of the beach clubs.  They have little parasols/palapas for shade in the sand on beach, but get there before 11 to secure one.

148797145.name: Beach
148797145.author: a TripAdvisor user
148797145.reviewBody: Great beach club, busy, pool on the ocean. We loved swimming in the waves, but watch out for the strong undertow.

148199155.name: Small beach a little run down
148199155.author: a TripAdvisor user
148199155.reviewBody: Went to beach since five minute walk from our hotel (Villa Blanca). Probably not best beach in Huatulco. Swimming in Water is rather risky, pool by beach in free club (advertised as hotel club in Villa Blanca literature) a little shoddy or run down, and you get a little claustrophobic in the area. If hell bent on ocean swimming probably should go to another beach nearby such as La Entrega (10 minute drive) or St. Augustine (hour drive) or settle to stay at poolside at hotel separated from beach which is fine too.

143324341.name: Best. Beach. Ever.
143324341.author: a TripAdvisor user
143324341.reviewBody: Large beach, fine sand, never crowded, amazing surf, nice beach clubs for a beer or margarita - I could spend months here as long as I had a palapa to keep the sun from burning me to a crisp!

141606428.name: I like the beach club called Castillo
141606428.author: a TripAdvisor user
141606428.reviewBody: Very safe when you are travelling by yourself.  There weren\'t many kids by the pool which makes it easy to relax.  It costs $100 pesos to get in but I think that it\'s worth it.  There are big waves on this beach so I didn\'t swim, but it\'s pretty to look at.

129387802.name: Visit XQUENDA DAY SPA when in Huatulco!!!
129387802.author: a TripAdvisor user
129387802.reviewBody:
About 5min taxi ride from Tangolunda area to Chahue where the spa is located. Close to marina.

You have the option to arrive earlier or stay after your services to use the gym, tennis courts or swimming pool. There is even access right behind the building to Chahue beach!

We had relaxing mud baths & massages. Definitely be back on our future visits. Very reasonable prices. $60usd ea for the massages.

Fidel was very hospitable and showed us around the spa. 

They offer Temazcal which is like a steam/sauna with 7 herbs & is conducted by a shaman during certain times of the year.

There were also 4 private suites above the building for rent. would definitely consider this on our next trip. Fidel explained that there were usually 3 restaurants opened during the busy season. Good location, easy to get to Cruceita & Santa Cruz.

Thank you Fidel & Xquenda Spa!

127096461.name: Dangerous undertow
127096461.author: a TripAdvisor user
127096461.reviewBody: Beautiful to look at or sit beside enjoying the view, but dangerous most of the time for swimming. Dramatic crashing waves make excellent drinking companions though at the beach club!

125779478.name: ...swimming in a pool and in the ocean..
125779478.author: a TripAdvisor user
125779478.reviewBody: We spent time sitting poolside having some food and drinks.  When things got too hot, we either swam in the pool or hit up the waves.  So wonderful to have the choice.

125456100.name: Nice
125456100.author: a TripAdvisor user
125456100.reviewBody: Just wanted to send our a Cheer to the Pub at Chahue \nSenior Pucks is a great place for the Hockey people in the area.\nThe beer is cold and the food is great. Gotta love hockey games in Mexico.

125444919.name: Good beach
125444919.author: a TripAdvisor user
125444919.reviewBody: We enjoyed a few days on Chahue Beach, large beach, water was very warm and clean, it was calm the days we were there but I understand it can get very rough with a undertow so be careful. Drinks at the beach club were reasonable $25 peso a beer.

125239411.name: Excellent  beach
125239411.author: a TripAdvisor user
125239411.reviewBody: perfect beach if you want a break from the resort crowd... can take a cab for $3.00 and spend the day

124449285.name: strong curentsbut great beach
124449285.author: a TripAdvisor user
124449285.reviewBody: If going in just make sure you are a strong swimmer...have been here many times over last 4 years in different months and water/waves always vary...I\'m a strong swimmer so I love it, can also snorkel in a couple of areas. the restaurant is a great place to relax also has a pool for those who don\'t like the waves...food is very good and cheap

124263534.name: Location,location,location.
124263534.author: a TripAdvisor user
124263534.reviewBody: This being one of the 9 bays of Huatulco, it is so centrally located to shops,beaches and a host of B&Bs that  you might wonder why you\'d stay anywhere else. The B&B\'s just to the East of the bay offer up some of the best there is to offer. The marina is just a stone\'s throw away from some fine retaurants with the town of La Crucecita not far away.

123461243.name: rough water
123461243.author: a TripAdvisor user
123461243.reviewBody: The water here is rough but the sand is clean.  Better off going to San Agustin or stay over closer to Puerto Angel.

122714364.name: Loved this bay
122714364.author: a TripAdvisor user
122714364.reviewBody: Lifeguard on duty, pretty rough but fun waves-just be careful! Beach club is great and condos at Sueno Del Mar are beautiful!

120504386.name: A beautiful bay to relax on, but not swim
120504386.author: a TripAdvisor user
120504386.reviewBody:
Contrary to another review, we were advised by more than one person (and flags on the beach) not to swim here, due to the strong waves and undercurrent. This might only be at certain times of the year and we were there in October.

The sand is fine, the water is nice and warm (for walking along the shore) and while there are many private clubs and bars here, theres a couple of them open to the public and are reasonably priced for drinks but a little expensive for food.

Its not the most obvious route to the bay, and we did see a couple of dubious characters on our walk down there, mainly a guy with a scarf around his face and a flick knife protruding from a cast on his arm, but while on the beach there was no problem other than the sunburn I got!

119441958.name: Safe swimming!
119441958.author: a TripAdvisor user
119441958.reviewBody: Great spot to take the kids for a swim, clean & safe.  Nice places to eat by the beach. Enjoy!

27534424.name: Beautiful beach, but parts are private
27534424.author: a TripAdvisor user
27534424.reviewBody: We walked to this beach from Las Crucitas.  It was a little hard to find, behind shops and a private club, but it was beautiful.  We didn\'t want to pay to see it, by going into a club, so we skirted around the club, down a dirt path, near an abandoned hotel construction site.\nNo one bothered us and we got to see this nice little gem of a beach.  It was steep and not real good for swimming, as the waves broke right on the sand, but it was great for a nice photo and a walk in the surf.

666725196.name: Interesting park
666725196.author: a TripAdvisor user
666725196.reviewBody: We went on a Sunday morning, so there were no crowds.  Try to arrive early as there is much walking and it becomes very hot by early afternoon.  Towards the end of the trails there is a very steep path with many steps.  However, it is worth climbing at the view is amazing.  We went without a guide and were able to decipher most of what we saw.

665535974.name: Copalita Ecological Park & Ruins
665535974.author: a TripAdvisor user
665535974.reviewBody: Bus tour to the park and ruins. We got to see coast line and community. It can be very warm. They give you a bottle of water for the trail. Realize there is a high hill to climb. You can decline if not in shape. I enjoyed the tour as love archeology and seeing it up close.

664326170.name: Enjoyable, but a bit underwhelming
664326170.author: a TripAdvisor user
664326170.reviewBody: This site was relatively recently discovered.  They have a nice, albeit small, visitors center.  There is a trail among the ruins.  We were a bit disappointed at what there was, as compared to other mesoamerican sites.  However, archaeological activity continues there.

663182318.name: Small historical site in beautiful surroundings
663182318.author: a TripAdvisor user
663182318.reviewBody:
This small site is on the coast, close by the Copalita river. There are a handful of significant historical buildings, including  the ball court and a main temple set in a wooded area. The restored areas are well laid out and are roped off with a path round each one so they can be fully appreciated. 

A small museum at the entrance displays finds at the site with lots of information sadly only in Spanish.

The trail through the site leads to a pond with terrapins, and iguanas along the banks. In the branches of trees are lots of boat billed herons. Allow at least an extra 30 minutes if you want to stop here to watch the wildlife. The trail eventually leads up to give views of both the Copalita river estuary teeming with birds and the coastline. It's a short, steep 5 minute walk to the viewpoints.

At a leisurely pace you need 2 hours to walk all the well maintained paths. If you just want to see the archaelogical sites and the museum probably 1 hour 30 is sufficient. Binoculars are a must if you want to see the wildlife at the pond and the birds in the estuary.

We took a taxi from the cruise ship pier which is about a 20 minutes ride away. We asked the taxi driver to pick us up 2 and a half hours later. We paid $20 for the taxi.

659683878.name: Fascinating
659683878.author: a TripAdvisor user
659683878.reviewBody: Really interesting place.  Lots of history and all well explained with posters.  There is a large indoor museum area as well as the paths among the ruins and also an iguana breeding facility.

655487060.name: A must for families interested in ancient ruins and walks in the jungle.
655487060.author: a TripAdvisor user
655487060.reviewBody: Wow! It\'s only 6kms from the Bay of Tangolunda(Hotels). $5CAN for entrance fee. Has ruins, museum with artifacts, walk in the jungle, wetland birds, iguanas and lizzards and a breath-taking lookout(mirador). Take your kids and you\'ll be a hero. Richard.

655065677.name: A fabulous place
655065677.author: a TripAdvisor user
655065677.reviewBody: Went for my second visit today. This place is just as wonderful as it was the last year. Adults 80 pesos. If you know no Spanish and don\u2019t have a Spanish dictionary, you might want to hire a tour guide.  Only Spanish in the museum.  The trails have English and Spanish information signs. This year I saw an iguana beside the marsh with many kinds of birds in the trees. The view of bocana beach and where the copalita river flows into the Pacific Ocean is still stunning. Allow at least three hours. Bring lots of water and maybe a snack.

652138186.name: Beautiful grounds and artifacts. Guide was very helpful and fun.
652138186.author: a TripAdvisor user
652138186.reviewBody: A very worthwhile outing. 5 of us engaged Eduardo to be our guide.  He\'s highly educated in the history and culture of the area and added tremendously to our enjoyment and understanding. Beautiful flora and fauna and stunning views of the ocean from high up.

650771878.name: Incredible
650771878.author: a TripAdvisor user
650771878.reviewBody: Put this on your must visit list.  The museum itself is small, but the artifacts are amazing.   Signs in the museum itself are Spanish only, so unless you are proficient at reading the language,  a guide is more than helpful.   The unearthed digs need to be seen in person to be fully appreciated.   If you\'re in reasonable shape,  the climb to the viewpoints is well worth it.   Just stunning views.  All in all a fabulous way to get a glimpse of the areas history.

650708902.name: beautiful updated park and museum
650708902.author: a TripAdvisor user
650708902.reviewBody: It was lovely strolling in this park and it was not crowded even on a Sunday.  There was shade!  We saw at least ten species of birds, a turtle and a huge iguana besides the ruins.  I highly recommend this park as a refreshing change from the beach.

649940489.name: A step in to the past
649940489.author: a TripAdvisor user
649940489.reviewBody: We just took a cab and explored on our our.  The paths are well marked and we took our time.   The natural vegetation is remarkable and we would just imagine the struggles of the ancient people surviving in the environment.  It was fun to climb the steps as high up as where the vultures perch and look down on the beautiful beach.  Absolutely a must do.

649409501.name: Great Birding Location
649409501.author: a TripAdvisor user
649409501.reviewBody: Our bird guide took us to this location to see the ruins and also see several bird species.  Guide is definitely beneficial if you don\'t read or speak Spanish.  Nice little museum with a lot of artifacts.  Nice paths to take in the entire area.

646964116.name: Pre-Columbian ruins
646964116.author: a TripAdvisor user
646964116.reviewBody: Interesting site. I think having a guide was critical to having any understanding of what we were looking at. Guide, Edwardo, was $580 pesos and worth it. 1-2 hours -small museum, clean banos, easy walking. Includes short walk  to great vista of coastline and Bocana Beach. We walked <1 mile, or you could taxi, to Playa Bocana to make a nice day.

645399587.name: Interesting place
645399587.author: a TripAdvisor user
645399587.reviewBody: Took a cab from hotel. Hired a guide and we learned a lot. I would recommend getting one as most everything is posted in Spanish. It gets hot, so go early, take water and apply sunscreen. Bugs were not a issue the day we went. \nThis is a interesting and beautiful area but not the same as a ruin on the east coast.

644407848.name: Supotec Ruins
644407848.author: a TripAdvisor user
644407848.reviewBody: Love this place.  Although, it is certainly not like some of the other well known sites in Mexico, it is certainly worth a visit. Still lots more to be excavated here but there is a nice ball court and other structures.  Nice little museum as well with a variety of artifacts from various sites in Mexico.  Great walking paths including one that ends up on the cliffs over looking Bah\u00eda Bocana and the Copalita River.  What a great view.

642209130.name: Interesting place to visit
642209130.author: a TripAdvisor user
642209130.reviewBody: We took the tour as part of a cruise excursion.  It was indeed interesting but in many ways disappointing.  The area is actually more a museum than an archeological site (which was how the tour was billed).  I\'m not really sure how "Ecological" it is but it is an educational place to visit.  The climb to the top of the overlook is a bit long - especially when it is hot!  But it is worth it for the view.  Along the way we found some interesting wildlife and the view from the peak is wonderful.  I did prefer the visit to Huatulco over that of more popular ports.  The area is growing and gives you a much more authentic insight into life in non-urban Mexico.

639022791.name: to see
639022791.author: a TripAdvisor user
639022791.reviewBody: beautiful not too expensive a site located in the jungle and on the side of the sea really clean place and interesting too

638987478.name: Great vistas. Amazing structures. Easy hiking.
638987478.author: a TripAdvisor user
638987478.reviewBody: The Park is a great place to spend a few hours absorbing the deep history of the Native peoples. Easy to find with great access, it\'s a bargain for visitors. We visited in late Fall before the rainy season and had no issues with bugs. The trails are clean and well marked. There are observation points along the trails to view the scenery. Highly recommended.

638084142.name: Intriguing park
638084142.author: a TripAdvisor user
638084142.reviewBody: Kudos go to our guide Mario who made this adventure so worthwhile.  It was a very short drive from our resort, and he greeted us at the gate.  Immensely knowledgeable and kept peaking our interest.  He is a great asset to this location.  Be advised that at the end of the tour there is quite an uphill climb before you turn around and go back.

638072977.name: Small Gem  Worth a Stop.
638072977.author: a TripAdvisor user
638072977.reviewBody:
Great little museum  but all the little descriptions are in Spanish.
So get a guide to take you through. It will be worth it. The cost is very low
to park your car and to enter. or take a taxi from town. There are two nice ruins .
A temple and a ball court.
I have been there twice !

635923431.name: Well worth the money
635923431.author: a TripAdvisor user
635923431.reviewBody: very interesting history. great walking paths and beautiful views. Easy excursion to do on your own as it will save you money.

618892422.name: Ask for Eduardo
618892422.author: a TripAdvisor user
618892422.reviewBody:
We loved this site. They are about 50% through the excavation but the visitor's center was a beautiful, modern structure with fantastic historical discoveries beautifully displayed. 

It was really worth it to have Eduardo as our guide. His English is fantastic and he seemed to really enjoy what he does. He will point out the historical sites as well as the natural flora and fauna of the area.

One thing to be aware of, it was well worth it, but be aware that they don't use pesticides in this park and the mosquitoes there are very hungry and numerous. 

As others have said, one of the best things about the park are the vistas. There are very well made paths and stairs that lead up to breathtaking overviews of the beach and the ocean and the vultures.

Take lots of pictures because they don't have a souvenir shop!

602404949.name: Incredibly amazing archaeological and natural site
602404949.author: a TripAdvisor user
602404949.reviewBody: This place was an absolute thrill for my wife and I. Even to us as we have also visited other archaeological sites near coast this is a really cool way to learn about mixtecan and zapotecan history. Aso there is a trully rewarding 1 mile trail walk covered under the shade of hundreds or thousands of mexican tropical forest trees which make it a natural habitat to owls, green paraquees, urracas, quetzals, salamanders, iguanas, ducks (there is a pond that makes the habitat of a local crane family).\nThere\u2019s also a trail to a 200yd height hill in the very beach where the Copalita River meets the ocean so as you might imagine there are lots of animals and really cool plants, such as ceibas which are magical in the prehispanic legend.

599957848.name: Cool place to visit!!
599957848.author: a TripAdvisor user
599957848.reviewBody: I visited this park while birding with ornitholgist guide Cornelio Ramos Gabriel.  The ruins are fascinating, and you can see dozens of HUGE iguanas, Northern Pootoo birds, as well as Boat-billed Herons and Ringed Kingfishers.  Really worth the visit!!

594150364.name: Small but very interesting spot!
594150364.author: a TripAdvisor user
