594150364.reviewBody: Actually, the ruins is nothing special. But the wildlife is! During a one-hour daytime walk we have seen a lot of birds, lizards and four young armadillos! My wife was unable to resist touching two of them!

591879584.name: very nice national park
591879584.author: a TripAdvisor user
591879584.reviewBody: very interesting to review the ecological ruins in the park.  Great opportunity to see some area birds and other wildlife.  bring water as it is can be very warm with some shade.  easy access to the park from the main roads.

577269916.name: An excellent way to spend the morning
577269916.author: a TripAdvisor user
577269916.reviewBody: We took a cab from Secrets to the park, although it is within walking distance of the resort. When paying the park entry fee we were asked if we would like to hire a guide and we decided that it would be a good idea. This turned out to be a very fortuitous for us, as Miguel was an exceptional guide. He was well worth the fee and did an outstanding job of explaining the details of the displays within the museum, as well as the archaeological remains that are found scattered throughout the park. In addition, he was also very knowledgeable about the flora and fauna found within the park. Miguel pointed out a number of bird species, bats and reptiles that we would not have otherwise spotted on our own. As it was hot at this time of year, make sure to bring plenty of water, wear a hat and comfortable shoes. We had a very enjoyable time and would highly recommend\na visit to Copalita Park.

573806224.name: wonderful journey back in time
573806224.author: a TripAdvisor user
573806224.reviewBody: We walked 30 minutes from our resort and spent the morning wandering the park. We enjoyed seeing the artifacts in the museum and the uncovered sites. It in\'t as grand as the more well known ruins but it is still fascinating to see this work in progress and who knows what else will be uncovered in the near future. Lots of plants and wildlife to see- would be nice to see signs saying what kind of trees you were looking at. You can hire a guide in which you would learn a lot more but we skipped this because we didn\'t have enough money with us. We took 4 bottles of water with us to stay hydrated and used them all. Beautiful scenery and views.

572762810.name: Book with a reputable company
572762810.author: a TripAdvisor user
572762810.reviewBody: We booked with Parisio and would NOT recommend especially if you don\'t speak Spanish.\nGreat place to visit.

571143820.name: A great way to spend a few hours
571143820.author: a TripAdvisor user
571143820.reviewBody:
We had such a great day checking this place out.
As many have said, the ruins won't compare to others, but still pretty amazing to enjoy a day trip.
The museum has some very cool artifacts.
The paths are largely shaded for the most part, until the last trek up to a stunning viewpoint.  
The day we went was incredibly hot, so the final stretch definitely made me feel like I'd shed a few pounds!
But the views are absolutely amazing!
Definitely bring some sunscreen and water.  We didn't experience any kind of bugs.  
We saw some amazing birds and an ant eater throughout our walk.
After you're done, you can take a short walk to the town below.  Simply walk out the front gates of the ruins and turn left up the road (about a 10-15 min walk).
You'll end up at a tiny beachfront community (Bocana) set on the most majestic beach (that you'll. view from above).
There you'll find a couple of restaurants.
We stopped in few a quick lunch and a few beers and it really added to our day trip, definitely worth the walk.  Our server called us a cab back to our resort, to close out a great day!

570146837.name: Enjoyed the park and the view from the top
570146837.author: a TripAdvisor user
570146837.reviewBody: This was a fun thing to do, although we went on a VERY hot day. Bring water, be prepared for the heat.

566866650.name: Interesting and Worth the Visit
566866650.author: a TripAdvisor user
566866650.reviewBody: Our guide, Huatulco Bird Guide Cornelio Ramos Gabriel, took us here on Feb 9, 2018.  We spent about an hour walking around and viewing the ruins. Cornelio knew all the structures and was more informative than the literature.  Flush toilets are free.  You have to pay to use a locker.  We enjoyed our visit.

561106411.name: Beautiful and Worth the Trip
561106411.author: a TripAdvisor user
561106411.reviewBody:
Its true this isn’t as grand or dramatic as Tulum or Chichen Itza or even Ek Balam but Copalia is just as beautiful, in a different way. 

We took ourselves through the park and it took us about 2 hours. The climb to the highest part is worth it! That said, I wouldn’t recommend it if one has any mobility or even breathing issues. 

The grounds are well-pathed, and well-marked. 

The museum is also totally worth wandering through. 

Well worth taking a few hours to visit. Cheap admission and cheap cab ride from the resorts.

559607055.name: Interesting Site Close to Resorts
559607055.author: a TripAdvisor user
559607055.reviewBody: My wife left her phone in the taxi on the way over, but the lady at the front desk was very helpful and called the cab company and found out that the driver had already turned it in to our hotel. That made our experience much more relaxed and enjoyable. The site is very large, but the trails are very well maintained and the coastal views are beautiful. The ruins are not nearly as impressive as Tulum or Chichen Itza, but are worth checking out if you\'re in the Huatulco area. There\'s a museum on site with relics they found. If you\'re staying at a local resort, I recommend doing this trip on your own; our hotel charged $50 per person but we did it for less than $10 including transportation and entry fee.

556715994.name: Day trip
556715994.author: a TripAdvisor user
556715994.reviewBody: Such a beautiful place to see and experience the history that is in this area.  For the best experience get a guide to walk you through the area.  Be ready to see many different birds, plant life, and iguanas!  The ocean view is incredible!

554074138.name: Worth the visit
554074138.author: a TripAdvisor user
554074138.reviewBody: We took a taxi here from Barcelo, 70 pesos each way. It cost 80 pesos each to get in, we walked the entire sight and we were very happy we visited. The hike up to the view point is challenging so I do not recommend that portion of the sight to people with mobility or health issues. I recommend going the museum is informative and very beautiful. Well displayed.

552602286.name: We loved it!
552602286.author: a TripAdvisor user
552602286.reviewBody:
Not only educational, but beautiful and fun.
The guide was very friendly and was excited to tell us about his personal experience finding the ruins. 
The natural pond was surrounded with trees that was full of large water birds {egrets, and herons} and the most interesting animals, iguanas. They were playful and beautiful.
There was a small museum with air conditioning that felt good after a long walk through the park. The vegetation was interesting throughout the park.

552601513.name: Lovely little park
552601513.author: a TripAdvisor user
552601513.reviewBody: We had a great day exploring the flora and fauna of Copalita. The view from the lookout is spectacular. The little museum was interesting, and the artifacts are in great condition, although all of the information is in Spanish. There weren\'t any English guides available on the day we visited. There were several paths that were closed while we were there, and not many ruins excavated, but it was still worth the visit. Msny of the walking paths are shaded, which was lovely on a hot day.

551362888.name: A great place to spend a few hours.
551362888.author: a TripAdvisor user
551362888.reviewBody: This is a great place to spend a few hours learning about the local history and early peoples. The museum building and receptions buildings are, in the own right, worth a visit from an architectural perspective. The grounds are easy to access and interpretive signage is available in both Spanish and English. We would visit again.

550522587.name: Work in process
550522587.author: a TripAdvisor user
550522587.reviewBody:
This is a work in process, excavation only began about 12 years ago. You will not be awe inspired by the ruins, but if you have an interest in Meso-American prehistory you will be able to appreciate the significance of this site. 
We hired a guide, Saul, who was very pleasant and enthusiastic about the view from the lighthouse (well worth the short grind up unless you have mobility challenges) but I am pretty sure I know more about the history than he did. (And that's not tons)  Oddly we were asked to pay his admission (60 pesos) in addition to his guide fee (480) as the guides are independent of the park itself. At least we helped support the local economy. 

A lot of the information signs are in disrepair and hard to read, and all the signage in the small museum is in Spanish, which is odd considering the number of Nordamericanos who visit.

Besides the ruins, it is a very pleasant place to walk in and of itself, particularly if you want to have a glimpse of the jungle if you are spending most of your holiday in the resort area. We walked to the end of one pathway by the river and just sat for ten minutes and listened to the sounds and watched birds and butterflies go by.

549724789.name: Copalita \u2013 a step back in time
549724789.author: a TripAdvisor user
549724789.reviewBody: We booked our visit to Copalita with Arturo Martinez before we left Canada since we knew that he only gives private tours and is in great demand. We received a response within a day and were all set to go.  Copalita was the first ecological park with ruins in Mexico when the site first opened.  Although the site is not as massive or dramatic as the other and more well-known archeological sites in Mexico it was an extremely interesting and informative tour stepping back in time to 2400 BC.  Archeologists have only scratched the surface of this archeological treasure  where one can envision the grandeur that once existed along with the building techniques that have endured to this day.  The climb \u2013 not a hard one \u2013 to the mirador gives you a spectacular view of where the Copalita River meets the ocean and where once a lighthouse existed. The museum is light and airy and has some beautiful artifacts that were discovered on site.  You definitely need a knowledgeable guide for this half day tour \u2013 otherwise you will miss out on the rich history of Copalita. We also visited La Bocana, a small and tranquil little community with a beautiful stretch of beach and dramatic rock formations. We didn\u2019t need insect repellant during our visit but it is recommended as well as water. A definite to do.

549062801.name: Self-guided walk through small ruins
549062801.author: a TripAdvisor user
549062801.reviewBody: There are 3 "temples" to look at on this site. They are small and mostly rock and adobe. A guide is available but you can walk around yourself and read the signs.  There is a nice walk up to a magnificent cliff overlooking the ocean which was apparently used in the past as both a look-out and a guide for the fishermen to come home.  It was very hot at the top of the walk and open to the sun.  We were so hot that when we came down we elected not to do the walk to the estuary to look at the mouth of the river so probably missed some of the birds, etc.  We hadn\'t brought mosquito repellent so we probably missed the mosquitoes too!

548877548.name: Fascinating and a good walk
548877548.author: a TripAdvisor user
548877548.reviewBody: This site had a lot of information (mainly in Spanish) on the people before the Spaniards arrived in this region. Cultures and peoples that spanned close to a 1000 years in this area and the museum displays captured the art and insight into their lives. Very close to La Bocana, it is an excellent place to visit!!

547430556.name: Eco Park
547430556.author: a TripAdvisor user
547430556.reviewBody: It is a beautiful area,  but I went because my travel companion wanted to go.  It is extremely hot in this environment so bringing water is a good idea.

544846228.name: Wonderful way to experience the backgound
544846228.author: a TripAdvisor user
544846228.reviewBody:
We took a taxi to the ruins and set off with another couple to discover what treasures were hidden here a short ride from town.
With the help of our companions we walked the pathways viewing endless butterflies, bird species, shrubs and trees.
The ruins were much more impressive than expected, as this is not one of the major sites showing the earlier civilizations of Mexico.
Overhanging branches keep the heat of the sun off but humidity is high. Pathways are wide and even with no elevation changes. We never did get to the viewpoint as our taxi was returning in two hours. The climb to the view may have been too much for my elderly knees.
Signs in the museum are in Spanish only so if you speak only English a guide could come in handy.
We were fortunate our companions knew about flora and fauna to enhance our enjoyment.
Entrance to the park is 80pesos/person. Taxi from Villablanca was 100pesos each way.
There are washrooms but no food or drink. Bring water and repellant for bugs.
I highly recommend taking a morning to visit the park and ruins

543706270.name: Small But Interesting Site
543706270.author: a TripAdvisor user
543706270.reviewBody: We visited the Copalita ruins as part of a birding tour with Cornelio (highly recommended). We spent maybe an hour and a half looking at the ruins and the small museum and I think that was about right. The site has been occupied, on and off, for about 2500 years. It was always a small outpost, lastly of the Zapotecs. At one time it`s said to have had over two thousand residents. The outdoor display signs are in English and Spanish (when legible). the signage at the museum is in Spanish. There are three small excavated structures, two temples and a ball court. The temples are of the `truncated pyramid` type and while interesting are just not on a par with the major Aztec and Mayan sites. There`s no climbing on the structures; visitors are kept well back. There`s a path through the forests to an uphill (mildly challenging) trail that takes you to an overlook of La Bocana beach and the mouth of the Copalita River where it meets the ocean. Well worth the view and a good place for birding. There`s a small entry fee. If you have a vehicle I`d say this is a good place to visit on your own, especially if you have some Spanish. Insect repellent and sunscreen are needed.

543020533.name: Hidden history
543020533.author: a TripAdvisor user
543020533.reviewBody: If you like history, dont miss this small but important part of Southern MX , sure it is not the size of places like Tulum or Chichen Itza,but none the last a great little area for say 2 hr hike and see.

542537095.name: A window back in time
542537095.author: a TripAdvisor user
542537095.reviewBody: We walked from our resort to the park and really enjoyed our walk/explore around the museum. It took us around about 30 minutes to and from the resort and we took about 2.5hrs at the park. Make sure to take water and use some buy spray.

539206028.name: Tremendously interesting - and not your large-scale ruin visit
539206028.author: a TripAdvisor user
539206028.reviewBody:
The copalita ruins were recently discovered - and at the time of my visit, only 7 percent excavated (how can they know that?)....  

What was interesting about these ruins (I have been to many other sites around Mexico) is that they are much older than the most popular Aztec and Mayan ruins.

Not much about these ruins are known - and there is on-going work to slowly discover more information and finds at this site.

Although these ruins are very old and not as tall or impressive from a jaw-dropping sense - they are a national treasure - and they show you how very advanced these people were at the time of their heyday.  In fact, they traded with Incan traders from far to the south - and it appears they were in full swing long before the Mayans and Aztecs put together their vast empires.  

What finds are coming in the future?  Who knows?  But your visit to the site will help fund the continuing discoveries.  You will see wildlife, a pristine natural coastal forest, and some pretty impressive archeology....

Bring walking shoes - there is an amazing coastal vista - but you need to take a moderate uphill trail to enjoy it.  We saw Flamingos, rare birds and an incredible coast line we will never forget...

494396730.name: Great Ruins With New Discoveries To Come In The Future
494396730.author: a TripAdvisor user
494396730.reviewBody: We did a half day tour here with XP Travel. Don Pepe was our tour guide and he was great. He answered all of our questions and was very engaging. The site is small compared to Coba and Tulum, but is interesting nonetheless. If you want to know more about the history of Oaxaca and its people, come here. Like many other ruins in Mexico, they have only scratched the surface of what\'s here. There is a ball court and the larger of the pyramids is still covered (and they think a good amount of it is still buried underground). We couldn\'t see part of the site as they were actually excavating graves and what they think was a living area with homes. \nThe journey up to the top was hot and hard but worth the climb. The stairs are good but the heat makes it challenging. Bring water, sunscreen, bugspray, a hat and a camera. This is also a great spot for bird watching. Pepe pointed out many birds including a boat billed heron, a snowy egret, a green heron, pelicans and orole nests. Worth the visit and an affordable tour.

476082283.name: Awesome
476082283.author: a TripAdvisor user
476082283.reviewBody: Great area with museum and birding, views. We walked from Secrets and taxi back to hotel. Enjoyed historical sites, birds, iguanas..bring insect repellant.

475951485.name: History next to the Beach!
475951485.author: a TripAdvisor user
475951485.reviewBody: This place is really magical. We were lucky to have a yoga class in our tour & the teacher Lorena choose the spot and Wow! we stay instead of going to the Cascadas (long trip) we saw birds, amazing nature & fun facts regarding on the culture in this area of Oaxaca.

472966861.name: Interesting artifacts
472966861.author: a TripAdvisor user
472966861.reviewBody: Nice walk.  Beautiful ocean and river viewpoints.  You can spot a sort of ant eater and gorgeous butterflies.  Tiny museum with regional artifacts.

469697085.name: Worth a visit
469697085.author: a TripAdvisor user
469697085.reviewBody: This archeological site is still an active dig.  Many of the ruins have only been partially excavated.  There is a very good path around the site, and it leads you eventually to a spectacular lookout over the Pacific Ocean, and a beautiful beach. There is a small museum with some very interesting artifacts of the ancient cultures that inhabited the site.

469274874.name: Great place for a short, hisotrical trip
469274874.author: a TripAdvisor user
469274874.reviewBody: Enjoyed a three hour guided tour with a tour guide.  Fantastic little park, with a great museum.  Not too much walking, but much to enjoy and learn.  The view of the ocean is awesome.  Take good walking shoes, and definitely sunscreen!

468429565.name: Copalita Ruins
468429565.author: a TripAdvisor user
468429565.reviewBody: Although not nearly as impressive as the ruins on the Carribbean coast (Tulum or Chiza Nitza), it is still a great place to visit.  Nice walk around and a great view if you take the path up the side of the hill.  You end up looking out over the ocean where the Copalita River runs into the bay.. quite a vista.  \nRuins are small and many have not yet been excavated but a nice little museum with Mayan artifacts.  Can be very warm when you walking around the site or climbing the hill.  Beautiful breeze at the top.

467712229.name: Great History......Hot!
467712229.author: a TripAdvisor user
467712229.reviewBody: Since we enjoy the History of this area we walked down to this site from the Secrets (about 20 minutes).  It was $80 peso per person to get in and we hired a guide which cost $480 peso.  We were very surprise to get Mario who we have had on other excursions on other visits to the Huatulco area.  He was very knowledgeable and spoke very good english (much better than our Spanish).  Excellent!

467095345.name: Worth the visit
467095345.author: a TripAdvisor user
467095345.reviewBody: Great experience!  Took cab from Villa Blanca for $100 pesos. Cab driver offered to come back for us. Apparently site was formerly without telephones but they now have phones and can call cab. Inside, admission was 80 pesos. We started out in the museum and a private guide, Mario, approached us and asked if we would like a tour for $480 pesos/group. There were only two of us but we signed on. So glad we did!!! Got much more out of the tour then we would have otherwise. Mario was not only knowledgeable regarding the site but he took along his telescope and showed us birds and iguanas we would never have been able to spot. Paths are excellent, very nice walk, view from the lookout well worth the climb. Hat and water a must.

466091891.name: Very nice hike!
466091891.author: a TripAdvisor user
466091891.reviewBody: We took a cab on our own to the ruins and Museum.  It was only 80 pesos each to get in.  The hike was great\u2026.a wee bit of a climb in certain spot and hot!  But the reward at the top was spectacular.  The view is unbelievable.  So worth the morning adventure !

464347785.name: Interesting excursion
464347785.author: a TripAdvisor user
464347785.reviewBody: The Copalita ruins are an active archaeological site as very little of it has been excavated. We hired a guide and without him we wouldn\'t have gotten much out of the tour. I\'m sorry I don\'t remember his name but he was very well informed about the ecology and human history of the site. I warn you it was very hot so dress for the heat and be prepared to walk on uneven surfaces. The taxi to the site, the admission and the cost of the guide (split between 5 couple) was only about $25 CND so just go on your own, no need to pay hotel excursion fees.

463277213.name: Interesting small ruins, and diverse ecology.
463277213.author: a TripAdvisor user
463277213.reviewBody: Have a seat for a while at the wetland overlook. We saw several of some kind of toucan hanging out in the trees, some kind of egret, iguanas, and more!  Stroll up to the estuary/coast overlook  for stunning views. It was hot, so we were glad to have water, sun hats, and comfortable shoes.

462668667.name: Interesting ruins
462668667.author: a TripAdvisor user
462668667.reviewBody: This was a spur of the moment decision to go but I\'m so glad we did. The museum was lovely, lots of interesting artifacts (not sure if they came from the site) and as others said, all in spanish. All you need is Google Translate and you can get an instant translation (offline, no need for wifi).  The walk through the park was easy, just hot (very hot, bring water). All paths are paved which makes it easy to do in sandals. The ruins are impressive and the views incredible. Just a short cab ride and our driver offered to come pick us up and didn\'t want payment until he did. And he was back at the park at the agreed upon time. A good couple hours and something educational to do in the area.

461227522.name: Exploring new excavations
461227522.author: a TripAdvisor user
461227522.reviewBody: We were fortunate to have a knowledgeable guide to lead us through some relatively new excavations. These ruins do not begin to compare with Monte Alban, also in Oaxaca, but they are an important piece of history of the area.

459501962.name: Well worthwhile
459501962.author: a TripAdvisor user
459501962.reviewBody: Other reviews cover the museum, the ruins, and the walks. They\'re all great and well worthwhile. The staff is courteous and well informed - and distributed around the ruins and walks to try and ensure that people don\'t go off the paths. By the way the paths are fantastic - cemented stone really well done.\n\nBefore we went I tried to find out when the park was open, but couldn\'t find it anywhere - so here it is! The park is open Tuesday to Sunday from 8am to 4pm. Closed on Mondays.

458107979.name: Best view around
458107979.author: a TripAdvisor user
458107979.reviewBody: Beautiful place to visit and learn about some of the hidden ruins. Make sure you do the hike up to the lookout. It\'s well worth the short climb. The view is breathtaking. Bring water...it\'s hot

457206063.name: Visit for birds and history
457206063.author: a TripAdvisor user
457206063.reviewBody: This is not a Mayan temple.  It is fairly new and still being explored.  There is a nice museum, restrooms and the trails are paved with stone which is very easy to walk.

456742190.name: Interesting ruins and museum
456742190.author: a TripAdvisor user
456742190.reviewBody: The ruins are a short drive from the downtown area.  Our guide told us about the history of Huatulco (how the government converted it into a resort area) and his experiences growing up there.  The (new) buildings on the grounds are very modern, clean and beautiful.  The museum is small and many of the placards are in Spanish only.  The walkways they\'ve installed make it very easy for you to get around the complex.  There are three ruins that have been partially/fully uncovered.  The walking is all flat and fairly level until you get to the pathway to the bluff (optional) which provides outstanding views.  It was very warm even in January although there is lots of shade (bring water).

455372787.name: Nice park and mini museum
455372787.author: a TripAdvisor user
455372787.reviewBody: A great place to visit in the morning.  The ruins are well preserved and the mini museum is well done.

455209974.name: A hidden jem!
455209974.author: a TripAdvisor user
455209974.reviewBody:
We took a cab from our resort to the Copalita Ecological Park and Ruins.  It was just a short ride and we headed out early in the day to avoid the afternoon heat.  The museum contained a multitude of artifacts excavated at the sight, but the descriptions were in Spanish, so I had many questions, but there were no guides available, since a cruise ship was in town, and the guides were all busy.

The site is currently being excavated, and there were signs around the ruins in Spanish and English, so we had a clear understanding of the area.  The paths through out were clear, shady, and easy to navigate.  

We especially enjoyed seeing the wide variety of colorful birds flying throughout the area.  Just stand still and look up to see birds of all sizes flying from tree to tree!

There is a pond in the wetlands area where we saw iguanas, lizards, and birds.  

Our favorite part was the path leading up to a spectacular overlook of where the Copalita River feeds into the Pacific.  The view was amazing!

454366823.name: Great Spot - spectacular views of Copalita River meeting Pacific (Estuary)
454366823.author: a TripAdvisor user
454366823.reviewBody: Cost MXN 80 pesos - well worth it!  Relatively small ruins by some standards, but they are still digging  :-)\nWell worth a visit - takes at least 2 hours.

453097814.name: Beautiful Break from Beach Days
453097814.author: a TripAdvisor user
453097814.reviewBody: This eco park has been beautifully developed from the entry to the museum to the flagstone paths that wind through the area. It is mostly in the shade and provides a nice break from hot, sunny beach days. Nice to learn about the history and culture of the area. Fantastic view from the lookout and well worth the short uphill hike.

451951638.name: Quiet Mostly Shaded Walk, Relaxing
451951638.author: a TripAdvisor user
451951638.reviewBody: We arrived when no guides were available, though the walk signs offer bilingual explanations, which ended up just right.  The one part that is uphill and sunnier is worth the walk to the top for the view.  Friendly staff.

451319233.name: Amazing walk with some great history
451319233.author: a TripAdvisor user
451319233.reviewBody: A great walk through the jungle/canopy on the Pacific Coast of Mexico. Interesting archeology finds but the view from the top of the hill is worth the price of admission alone. We were lucky enough to have a fantastic tour guide (Erim) from a local company. Don\'t miss this gem.

450845596.name: Great Place to Visit
450845596.author: a TripAdvisor user
450845596.reviewBody: We explored the park, ruins and museum in conjunction with a bird walk.  The hike to the lookout was amazing and what a view from up there.

449978125.name: Go Back in Time to 500 BC
449978125.author: a TripAdvisor user
449978125.reviewBody: This park provides an excellent perspective on cultures who inhabited the area around 500 BC. The site was abandoned in the 1520\'s. The modern air-conditioned museum is a must see with beautiful artifacts and information about the groups who lived here. Trails lead to excavations of a plaza, ceremonial center, ball court, and temple.

445703671.name: A surprise
445703671.author: a TripAdvisor user
445703671.reviewBody: It was very interesting to see these local ruins that are much older than those seen near Mexico City or in the Yucatan.  This small park also has a nice little museum that displays some very elegant artifacts from other areas of Mexico.

442621924.name: Interesting if you like history
442621924.author: a TripAdvisor user
442621924.reviewBody: Very interesting to see. Do it on your own though. A tour guide is not necessary at all. We took a taxi there and just walked through ourselves. Signs except in museum section are in English too.

441432175.name: Groomed Park and Revealed Ruins
441432175.author: a TripAdvisor user
441432175.reviewBody: We went here to see birds, but also were very impressed by the park, the ruins, and the wonderful, wide, level stone walkways.  Bathrooms were among the nicest we have seen in Mexico.

438783076.name: Definitely a place to visit
438783076.author: a TripAdvisor user
438783076.reviewBody: I ended up visiting the park 3 times on birding outings and was impressed with how beautiful this place is with paths, buildings and restrooms.  The archaeological aspects are limited compared to other sites but informative.  Walking the paths thru the dense semi-tropical jungle is beautiful and offers opportunities to see wildlife.  The highlights for me was the pond with a dozen or more Broad-billed Herons and other birds along with walking to the cliff overlook where you can see the beach and Copalita lagoon from about 200\' above sea  level.

427582852.name: Copalita Ruins & Eco Park
427582852.author: a TripAdvisor user
427582852.reviewBody: This was the first time a visited the park.  The last time I was in Huatulco, about 8 years ago, it didn\'t exist.  Many times we swam and ate at the beach at the end of the Copalita River and no one knew the ruins existed in the hill above us.  There is now a wonderful reception area an a museum.  Wide trails lead through the park and around the ruins.  There are sections that are still not open but it is well worth the trip.  a Walk to the south brings you to an wonderful view over the Pacific.  Most of the site is flat and easy to walk and takes you through and around the natural habitats found in the area, with its associate wildlife.  You can see why these ruins were unknown for so long, as thick as the vegetation is.  To get to the view over the ocean there is a bit of a climb up well designed stairs. The Temple of the Mayor is huge, I never expected to see anything like it at the site.  All of the signs and descriptions are in Spanish & English along the trail... Unfortunately they are only in Spanish in the museum.  The architect who designed the building and park won an award for it... I can see why!  Hope you enjoy it, we did!!!

384706361.name: Great History with a Scenic View
384706361.author: a TripAdvisor user
384706361.reviewBody: This is a great place to learn about Oaxacan history and at the end of the stone paved trail you can hike up to the top and see gorgeous views of the coast. The walk through the park is absolutely beautiful with crabs and birds along the trail. The trees are so interesting with the hundreds of vines hanging everywhere. The grounds are very well kept and there are clean restrooms. There is also a vending machine for cold drinks at the front desk once you get back. I would recommend doing this first thing in the morning because the hike up to the viewpoints get really hot in the heat of the day!

379224797.name: A walking tour!
379224797.author: a TripAdvisor user
379224797.reviewBody: Anyone who loves to walk And see beautiful history from ancient ruins this is for you. It is amazing\ud83d\udc4c

374923476.name: Good museum, trails
374923476.author: a TripAdvisor user
374923476.reviewBody: This was a nice break from beaches during our week in Huatulco.  Having visited lots of ruins in Mexico, I\'m comfortable saying that this one is not very interesting.  But the site museum has some great pieces and the trail that takes you to the cliff overlooking the ocean is well worth the visit.

368285352.name: Beautiful Park!
368285352.author: a TripAdvisor user
368285352.reviewBody: We walked the park on our own. So beautiful. The ruins, the vegetation, the birds and scenery at the top of the trail!. Stunning

366451871.name: Local historical tour
366451871.author: a TripAdvisor user
366451871.reviewBody: Very informative and hisrtorical tour.  The guide spoke fluent English and made the day very enjoyable.  Would highly recommend.

358216685.name: Exploring the ruins and pyramids
358216685.author: a TripAdvisor user
358216685.reviewBody: This is a very interesting and educational tour led by a biologist who is passionate about his country and it\'s history.  It is fascinating to hear about the pyramids and the people who lived in the area so many years ago.

356885818.name: Nice park with ruins and jungle paths
356885818.author: a TripAdvisor user
356885818.reviewBody: This park has a really nice little museum and ruins among beautiful and well-maintained grounds.  We spent a couple hours here exploring the ruins and enjoying the flora and fauna.  There were a lot of really interesting birds along the trails.  We een saw a Coati!  Make sure you walk to the overlook so you can see where the Rio Copalita runs into the Pacific ocean at Playa Bocana.   Bring water !

352194214.name: Nice, but.....
352194214.author: a TripAdvisor user
352194214.reviewBody: the guide costs are too high.  Cool ruins just discovered, and a small museum.  Problem is without a guide you wouldn\'t have a clue about 1/2 of what you are looking at.

348900911.name: very interesting and beautiful views
348900911.author: a TripAdvisor user
348900911.reviewBody: Climbing to the top of the park, overlooking the place "where the ocean meets the river" was beautiful. Not too often people get to be in places like that. The ruins were interesting and the Guide was great and knowledgeable.

348332825.name: Cool place
348332825.author: a TripAdvisor user
348332825.reviewBody:
Bill and I taxied out to the site and walked it oursevles.
The museum was laid out really well so much info easy to understand even if it wasnt in english.
The hike up to the cliffs looking over the pacific was hot and hard bring water take lots of breaks and enjoy the stunning views.
Thè site was petty basic and has not been completely dug out yet still pretty cool 
Go by taxi from Hualtolco less than 60 peso and 80 peso to get pretty cheap afternòon fantastic hike

347721390.name: Interesting and informative.
347721390.author: a TripAdvisor user
347721390.reviewBody: Although these ruins weren\'t as spectacular as some others in Mexico they were interesting.Our guide Pepe was great and fun.The walk up to the "lighthouse" was strenuous but the breathtaking views were worth it.The museum was good and had some neat artifacts.Unfortunately all the info was in Spanish only so I missed out a little there.

347651839.name: A walk through the trees with a few ruins
347651839.author: a TripAdvisor user
347651839.reviewBody:
We took a taxi from the Secrets to the Ruins.  Taxi was 60 pesos and entry into the ruins was 80 pesos each (for non nationals).

I think this site will become more interesting over time.  Currently there isn't a lot that has been excavated - just the Great Temple and a bit of the Ball Court. When we were there, two areas were blocked off - the River viewpoint and the Plazeto Ceibas.

We quite looked forward to seeing the Archaeological Doorway Plaza after climbing for a long time.  Currently it's just a turnaround point - you may not want to continue upwards after the Copalita River Delta viewpoint.

There is sufficient signage in English to do a self guided tour.   However, there is no English (nor breeze) in the small museum at the entrance.

It's worth the trip.

346729844.name: Copalita Museum
346729844.author: a TripAdvisor user
346729844.reviewBody: This was a very interesting spot just a quick drive around the corner from Secrets.  Quite a few artifacts to see in the air conditioned museum and then about one and a half hours to walk around the grounds, although the path to a ground level lookout had nothing to lookout to! The most beautiful was a bit of a hike uphill, there are stairs, to see where the river meets the bay. You could see people at the beach and others enjoying a lazy river type of ride.

346663178.name: Ruins, Views, and Birds Birds Birds
346663178.author: a TripAdvisor user
346663178.reviewBody: We recently traveled to Huatluco with an amazing tour company called Travelian out of San Miguel de Allende. They took us to Copalita Eco-Arqeologico Parque. It is very beautiful, the ruins and ball court which date back 1500 years are presented along wide graveled trails and instead of climbing them, you gaze on them. The park has extensive groups, over 200 acres and has various eco-systems; wet lands, tropical dry forest, coast, and fantastic views. There is an on site small museum with excellent pieces from all over Oaxaca State. We went with a local bird guide, Cornelio Ramos of Zibiilu Guides and saw boat-billed herons and many birds we could not have identified without him. Wonderful big trees too! Worth going.

346353581.name: very interesting area
346353581.author: a TripAdvisor user
346353581.reviewBody: This was a very natural area with an excavation of an Aztec temple that is still being found. A beautiful walk through a natural area with birds and wildlife. The climb to the lookout is worth the spectacular view of the pacific ocean and surfing beach. The museum is very interesting but you should get a guide for translation purposes. Very interesting.

345566065.name: Well Worth a Visit
345566065.author: a TripAdvisor user
345566065.reviewBody:
The park is easy to get to and well worth the 80 peso entrance that foreigners pay.  The museum and facilities are new (built in 2010).  While the collection in the museum is small, there are some amazing pieces like the skull covered in turquoise.  Unfortunately for those who don't read Spanish, there are no translations for the explanation signs - maybe in the future.  Guides for the site are available but not required. 
There is a small pyramid, a ball court, and a main square.  The paths are mostly flat except to the Mirador and are well-signed.  Even on a hot day, the numerous shade trees make walking easy.  Bird sightings are frequent and if you stop and stay still for a few moments you will likely see butterflies and small lizards.
There are a pair of Ceiba trees on a separate trail that are very impressive.
There are nice bathrooms and a vending machine for drinks (you will need water or soda).  After visiting the park, it is a short walk to La Bocana beach.  If there are no taxis when you are ready to leave, just walk out to the main road and a taxi or collective will be along shortly.

345274197.name: Intriguing
345274197.author: a TripAdvisor user
345274197.reviewBody: Great guide, incredible scenery, incredible history and artifacts, look forward to seeing what the future brings.

344607270.name: Go early it gets hot fast
344607270.author: a TripAdvisor user
344607270.reviewBody: Not big ruins to see, but worth seeing to understand the area, Mexico and the Aztecs .  Bring bug spray, no seeums. , and bring lots of water to drink .

342232024.name: Much Better Than Expected
342232024.author: a TripAdvisor user
342232024.reviewBody: After reading the reviews of this place I had pretty low expectations. Fortunately it wildly exceeded what I expected. The actual ruins are pretty small, except for one very impressive ruin that is dug into the side of the hill.\nWe were thrown off a bit because the first thing you see when entering is a sign warning about snakes in front of the temple of the serpent.Fortunately we didn\'t see any snakes, but it definitely puts you on guard.\nIf you walk the entire trail area you have to go through a swampy area that can be a little unsettling and then up a steep path that allows you to look over the area where the Rio Copalita flows into the Pacific at Playa La Bocana. The views are pretty amazing.

341541084.name: Copalita Delight
341541084.author: a TripAdvisor user
341541084.reviewBody: Great area to visit.  Limited amount of excavation work but nice small museum.  Lots of walking but good concrete walkways.  Recommend you visit via cab as entry fee was less then 100 pesos.  Taking a tour is way more expensive.  Quite hot there and quite a climb to the heights viewpoint.  Great view from there over the ocean and Copalita river.  Not for persons with limited mobility.    Hiring a guide a good idea but not required.

333899193.name: Nice little museum and pleasant park
333899193.author: a TripAdvisor user
333899193.reviewBody: We rode our bicycles from the port of Huatulco to Copalita.  It is about 11.5 km with three or four short hills on a pleasant road that does not have too much traffic.  The Eco-Archeological Park has a small museum that is well air-conditioned, a pleasure on a hot day.  Care has been taken in the new construction on the site and it is quite pleasant.  The museum is small and has on display a variety of artifacts from cultures of the area.    The legend on the displays is in Spanish only but not difficult to understand with rudimentary language skills.  The park itself has paved trails though a forest that go to the various temples dating back as much as 2,000 years and a ball court.  While the temples are not spectacular, they are interesting, and here the legends are in Spanish and English.  The staff while not bilingual is very helpful.

333402895.name: Interesting Ruins
333402895.author: a TripAdvisor user
333402895.reviewBody: It was interesting to see the ruins.  We had an excellent guide who informed us about the history of the place and pointed out several local birds.  It is very hot, therefore we recommend that you go in the morning before the heat of the day sets in.

332163983.name: A very worthwhile place to visit
332163983.author: a TripAdvisor user
332163983.reviewBody: 4 of us went there to birdwatch more than anything else. We left too late however, and did not see many birds except at the promontory overlooking the river\'s mouth and the ocean, which was a very lovely place. The pathways are large flat stones and easy to negotiate. Unfortunately, when we were there, the main path up the mountain and around the lake were closed (or so we were told; never sure if was so or simply the attendant didn\'t feel like having to make sure tourists returned safely as we were told something different at the gate). The small museum is very well done. The park is open at 8am (we were told 9) and would have arrived earlier if we knew that. We had a taxi driver from our hotel area drive us there and meet us when  we wanted to return and he was very prompt to do so. We were there 3 hours and had the uphill path been open I would have wanted 4 hours). It was a Sunday and we were the only visitors in the park as far as I could tell. A hidden gem.

324424386.name: Very cool hidden gem
324424386.author: a TripAdvisor user
324424386.reviewBody: I cant believe this place is not as popular as other ruins in Mexico.  Its a great place to visit and do some hiking.

313893184.name: Great with a good guide
313893184.author: a TripAdvisor user
313893184.reviewBody: Cornelio, birding guide extraordinaire, took us there and elevated a good vist to a great one.  The museum is well set up and quite interesting, but even better with interpretation of the symbology by our guide.  The forest trails are good with a lot of endemic birds, and the ruins are quite interesting without being overly restored.  A very good day.

307541381.name: A great place to visit in Huatulco
307541381.author: a TripAdvisor user
307541381.reviewBody: This is a hidden gem in Huatulco. The forest is impressive I have never walked under such a thick canopy. The cliff viewpoint is worth the uphill walk.

294221146.name: great education part of a family vacatoin
294221146.author: a TripAdvisor user
294221146.reviewBody: My whole family learned a lot and went back to school to report on what they learned here.  There is some walking involved but it takes you up to a very scenic overview.

282760471.name: excellent ruins...worth a visit
282760471.author: a TripAdvisor user
282760471.reviewBody: This is an excellent ruins full of history and culture.  A lot of the ruins have been well restored including an ancient ball court.  There are very well maintained trails throughout the park.  The visitors center has a small but well presented museum.  We had an excellent guide who told us about the ruins, the wildlife and history.  Bug spray and  sunscreen is highly recommended.  Most of the area is easily accessible by anyone with mobility issues.

279848884.name: Long and difficult to finish on a hot day
279848884.author: a TripAdvisor user
279848884.reviewBody: We have been to many ecological parks and this was by far the worst. They have indoor buildings with lots of artifacts with no ac and it is burning hot out so it makes it difficult to view! In addition would not recommend going on a HOT day with small children or older folks the routes are long. Do buy the the copalita scent  rocks.

261136436.name: Worth the visit - with a local guide
261136436.author: a TripAdvisor user
261136436.reviewBody: Quiet when we went, interesting history and bird life. The museum was OK, but too hot inside and not enough of the local artifacts on display

260594746.name: Copalita Ruins and Eco Park
260594746.author: a TripAdvisor user
260594746.reviewBody: Excellent hike through the park to the top of the cliffs. We were self guided. Beautiful landscape. Interesting historical museum with exceptional artifacts. (English translation would have been a bonus for us)

259865581.name: Only excellent if you hire bird Guide Cornelio
259865581.author: a TripAdvisor user
259865581.reviewBody: My friend and I stumbled upon a genius of a bird guide when in Huatulco, Mexico in February 2015.  First we joined him in Copalita Ecological Park and then hired him a second time to see the Huatulco National Park birds.  Both are just short drives from Huatulco itself.  Our guide\'s name was Cornelio Ramos Gabriel.  This man has a genius for calling in some birds and/or hearing them then spotting them with his naked eye.  Before you know it , he says, "I\'ve got it!" and that means he has the bird in his spotting scope for his tour members to step up and see fully magnified.  He twice  called in Pygmy owls for us.  He spotted a group of Boat Billed Herons, a Doulbeday\'s Hummingbird, and dozens of tropical birds we NEVER would had seen had he not been with us like a an Social Flycatcher.  Once all have looked, if there is time, he will then take your camera and shoot pictures of the bird through his scope while he tells you about that bird and its habits .  He also spotted a porcupine sleeping up  high in a tree.  He speaks and understands English very well and is a pleasure to be with.  I highly recommend him.  He can be reached by email at birdguidecornel@gmail.com or birdguidecornelio@hotmail.com or by going to his website at http://www.coug.net/cornelio/\n\nAt Copilita you will find a mixture of marsh, dry land and estuary birds.  The view where the river meets the ocean is magnificent and there you will see many varieties of shore birds.  This park also has a small museum housing artifacts of the area and there are some ruins along the walking tour with Cornelio.  There is a small refreshment stand near the entrance to buy drinks and tasty ices.

254773734.name: A Walk In the Park
254773734.author: a TripAdvisor user
254773734.reviewBody: This was a very interesting, educational, and refreshing experience. In several areas there are a good number of stairs that you will have to climb that overlooks the river and beach. However, the scenic view is well worth it. Also, there is a museum with beautiful artifacts.

253503131.name: Don\'t miss this. Wonderful
253503131.author: a TripAdvisor user
253503131.reviewBody: We paid for a guide and it\'s well worth it. We even learned how to read a bit of the codex. We had the place almost to ourselves. Impressive ruins and beautiful display of archeological treasures.

252871070.name: Well worth the effort
252871070.author: a TripAdvisor user
252871070.reviewBody:
Took a cruise ship excursion to this site.  Very interesting and well kept - still fairly new.
Our guide was not that good but the walking through the forest and then up to the viewpoint was enjoyed. Spectacular views down to the sea and across a river estuary with birds galore - well worth the short, steep, hot climb.  Footpaths good. 
The museum is small but everything well displayed although nothing yet in English. 
Facilities and staff excellent.  
Insect repellent is a must here and our guide even had extra for those folk that had forgotten!
Not that many ruins but we enjoyed the trip a lot.

248834629.name: Zapotec Mistex Adventure
248834629.author: a TripAdvisor user
248834629.reviewBody: The ruins here are still being uncovered but none the less impressive in size. they date back 2600 years. It is well worth hiring a guide to take you through the museum and ruins.

248115698.name: Need work
248115698.author: a TripAdvisor user
248115698.reviewBody: We did not do a guided tour as we read other reviews saying it wasn\'t needed. The map is misleading as it states there are many ruins or things to see when in fact there are not. There are paths that lead to a dead end that should be clearly marked. The signs in the museum are only in Spanish and the description signs for the ruins are in both Spanish and English. Even though this park is fairly new, one of the signs for a huge ruin is already weathered away. It would have been nice to know what we were looking at!\nThe cost is 80 pesos/person but if you are a group of 4 the cost is 420 pesos. We wanted to pay per couple but were not allowed. \nThe view of the river meeting the ocean is pretty good but I would have rather saved my money and time and went to La Bocana beach to see the view first-hand.

247081137.name: Historical Experience
247081137.author: a TripAdvisor user
247081137.reviewBody: They take you to a museum to see all the artifacts they dug up from different time periods. The ruins are still being excavated, but very interesting to see. They took us to the top of a mountain to see the National Park layout. Gorgeous!

244977027.name: Worth a visit.
244977027.author: a TripAdvisor user
244977027.reviewBody: This is quite different than the large sites like Mont Alban and Chichen Itza or even Tulum. Copalita was a small town and there are only a few structures uncovered. But the museum has some spectacular pieces and the walk to the viewpoint was pleasant. Sites are labeled so no guide required.

243225171.name: Spectacular Views
243225171.author: a TripAdvisor user
243225171.reviewBody: I took a Bird Watching Tour from our cruise ship to this area.  It was spectacular.  The sights and sounds were amazing and the birds were everywhere.  Our guide knew just where to take us to see the birds.  It was a four hour tour and I wish it could have been longer.  What a beautiful area.

234335742.name: Cherished part of pre-hisory
234335742.author: a TripAdvisor user
234335742.reviewBody: This tiny area is well run and presented. The opportunity to hike on a well maintained trail to overlook the meeting of 2 rivers and the sea, the beautiful little museaum and the mysterous ancient ruins make this very worth while. Recommend a guide if you want to know the whole story, but much is also gained by an independent tour and is also possible. Admission fee is very reasonable and goes to a good cause.

234214866.name: Great hiking day
234214866.author: a TripAdvisor user
234214866.reviewBody: Was a great day of hiking and exploring in this park that is under development.  We walked from Secrets it is just past La Bocana.  Great scenery through the forest and then up overlooking La Bocana and the river valley.  Next time we would hire one of the guides to take us around as we would want to know more of the history of the buildings.  After we stopped at La bocana Restaurant and had some beers with Christian the owner of the restaurant.

223509185.name: Ruins
223509185.author: a TripAdvisor user
223509185.reviewBody: This historical spot was so close to our hotel that i had to go (12 minutes) It was not expensive i think $10 usd a person. The ruins were not as grand as in Cancun but interesting just the same.  They did an amazing job with this site. The museum and the grounds are beautiful.  It is not well advertized so not many people

216875383.name: Good start, but a few tweaks needed...
216875383.author: a TripAdvisor user
216875383.reviewBody: Well, the place is small but very nicely done.  They seem to be trying to do it right, and upscale, from the start.  Interesting pieces and a  bit of ruins that are roped off so only seen and not touched, but not much to match the entrance fee which makes it hard to recommend.  But, being a history guy, I recommend. Hmmm....

212856173.name: Nice break from the beach
212856173.author: a TripAdvisor user
212856173.reviewBody: Short taxi drive away.  Bring sunscreen and water.  Nominal extrance fee, worth the price for a guide, if you\'re inclined.  Interesting to see ruins in different stages of excavation and restoration.  Spotted a few interesting birds, nice nature walk.  Worth the time.  Would be nice to visit again to see what else was "unearthed".

207875660.name: Great excursion away from the beach
207875660.author: a TripAdvisor user
207875660.reviewBody: Take a taxi here and ask driver to return in just over 2 hours.  The walk around the site is most worthwhile as an educational experience as well as some stunning views of the coast and river delta.  Paying a guide is good value but you can walk about the ruins independently but you may end up on dead-end paths or closed areas due to flooding.  Exploring the trails makes for great birdwatching and photo ops.  The site could have better signage and maybe some more information boards about historical aspect of the place.  Definitely a must-see location on any visit to Huatulco.

203032271.name: Great day excursion!
203032271.author: a TripAdvisor user
203032271.reviewBody: The museum and grounds are amazing.  Make sure to pay a little extra to have a guided tour!  The tour was excellent and the views...breathtaking....overlooking Copalita.  Wear good walking shoes and pack water!  It is worth the taxi ride!

200388647.name: Beach fun - Mud spa
200388647.author: a TripAdvisor user
200388647.reviewBody: 6 of us went to Copalita beach for a mud spa treatment(yes the guys too) it was great fun and then we washed off in the river. The ladies that did the service were lovely and we bought some mud to bring home!

199877163.name: Really cool ruins
199877163.author: a TripAdvisor user
199877163.reviewBody:
My husband and I went to this place on our trip last month. There isn't a bus that comes and picks you up (like other excursions) - you have to take a taxi there. It's about a 10-15 minute drive and we paid our driver 150 pesos.

You have to pay a small fee to enter the park first. Then there is a small museum showcasing many of the artifacts that were found in the ruins. It's really interesting. You can also pay a little more to have a guide walk you through the ruins but we preferred to do it ourselves.

Then you start your walk. A lot of it is walking on a flat surface under tree shade, but there is a fair amount of uphill walking once you get to the Copalita river. But the view is just amazing!

Sunscreen is a MUST as well as brining a bottle of water for each person. There wasn't a breeze so it was just sweltering. Visiting the ruins takes about 2 hours depending on how far you want to go.

They do have a cafeteria there but it wasn't open when we went.

The ruins are really cool though, really interesting to see. They are still excavating right now so there wasn't a lot of ruins to see, but the ones that were there were really neat.

199829122.name: Ruins, small museum, beautiful walking path
199829122.author: a TripAdvisor user
199829122.reviewBody: The ruins are interesting and the museum has some treasures, but all the signs and descriptions are in Spanish and at a higher reading level than I could understand.   We spent an interesting hour and a half listening to and walking with Cornelio, a tour guide and bird lover who was so excited about showing us the native species that he got my 11 year old son excited.  His knowledge is vast including the site\'s archeology, Mexican history, languages and local botanical and bird populations.  He also loves butterflies and found several lizards for my son to observe along the path.  If you go to Copalita it is worth asking for t his guide.  Good English, typical accent.

199335639.name: Very peaceful
199335639.author: a TripAdvisor user
199335639.reviewBody: A beautiful place,  very peaceful and not super touristy yet. Ruins still being uncovered. A hidden gem

195810159.name: Great discovery
195810159.author: a TripAdvisor user
195810159.reviewBody: We learned tons about the Zapotec culture, and the site is very pleasant. The trek up to the Marker is a bit of a hike, but the view is well worth it.

195738201.name: Needs some tourism work
195738201.author: a TripAdvisor user
195738201.reviewBody: The paths are very well kept but the place is a bunch of rubble and rocks. Good place to pay 8 bucks and go jogging otherwise it was a walk and that\'s about it. No one speaks English, none of the signage is in English and you can\'t buy a bottle of water. It\'s too bad because they have spent a lot of time and money on the area that a few guided tours and a bit more than bush to walk around would really be a benefit. It means nothing if you can\'t read Spanish and the walk along the grounds gets hot, long and boring. But it wasn\'t expensive to get in so like I said for 8 bucks you could have a great jog around a few times.

194612445.name: Ruins in beautiful park
194612445.author: a TripAdvisor user
194612445.reviewBody: If you have visited major ruins anywhere else in the world, these will not awe you. The descriptions are sparse and I didn\'t learn much. But the park they are in is beautiful and the look off has an incredible view. I recommend going just for the peaceful surroundings.

194257890.name: Very informative about Culture
194257890.author: a TripAdvisor user
194257890.reviewBody: Spent an hour or so going through museum and walking around the ruins. Our guide Marco is a encyclopedia of knowledge. Very thorough in his history of the Mixteca and Zapoteca cultures. The area is still being excavated but they have uncovered at three sites. Very interesting tour. Well worth the expense to hire the guide.

193900631.name: A Work in Progress
193900631.author: a TripAdvisor user
193900631.reviewBody: A lot of distance between sites.   They are still working on unearthing the ruins. The most enjoyable part of this visit was the trail to the cliff lookout - it was breathtaking once we reached there.  Like a vision of paradise. Our taxi driver returned for us 2 hours after drop-off which was great as there aren\'t any other taxis waiting.  Cheaper to take taxi and pay admission than to do the hotel excursion package! Wouldn\'t go back unless more ruins are unearthed.

191697692.name: surprisingly good
191697692.author: a TripAdvisor user
191697692.reviewBody: We went there early in the morning and we did not know what we could expect after we have seen other ruins. Sure, you cannot compare these ruins with the large ruins in other areas, but the area is very charming and the ruins a good for a nice stroll to get some ideas about the history. They are still developing these areas and we saw some excavations and most likely in some years there will be much more to see. We enjoyed our 2 hour walk through the area and you will be awarded with fantastic views of the La Bocana Beach

190994287.name: Interesting to visit, take a cab!
190994287.author: a TripAdvisor user
190994287.reviewBody: We enjoyed the visit of the ruins. Worth visiting; however, not as spectacular as the Mayan ruins, also from a different age (e.g. Much older). Still archeological work ongoing and one cannot get very close to the ruins. The site is well maintained and the small museum has interesting objects, not to be missed. Although we had a good guide, the site is just. 5-10 minutes ride from the resorts and the best and most cost effective option is to take a taxi.

190509212.name: A good alternative to the beach
190509212.author: a TripAdvisor user
190509212.reviewBody: This may not be the most impressive pyramid & ruin site, however it provides a good alternative to any other activities available in the area. The most unexpected part was the ecological path that carries on beyond the ruins and the views you get when arrived at the top, towards the old "light house". Tremendous view of the beach and the river and the wildlife of the area.

190081764.name: Worth a visit!
190081764.author: a TripAdvisor user
190081764.reviewBody: If you are in the Huatulco area, this park definitely deserves a visit.  We spent around 2.5 hours at the park, and it was plenty of time to see everything.  Go in the morning when it\'s not crowded or too hot. There are plenty of companies that sell guided tours of the ruins, but I would suggest doing it on your own.  Just grab a taxi from your hotel and have the driver come back to pick you up a few hours later. You could also easily catch a taxi out on the main road.  They are not expensive at all. I would recommend arriving around 8:30am, if you\'re just walking around on your own.  If you\'re interested in hiring a guide, they typically arrive around 9am. There is a lovely museum in the park which features many of the artifacts that have been discovered at the excavation sites in Copalita.  The ruins are nice, but much, much smaller than Chichen Itza or Palenque.  There are also some wonderful (paved) trails to explore and beautiful look out points that are not to be missed.  This was a wonderful way to spend a morning!

188951063.name: Very Interesting and Extremely Scenic
188951063.author: a TripAdvisor user
188951063.reviewBody:
This is a relatively new park with archeological reconstruction still in active progress. We took a taxi from Secrets to the park at a cost of 50 pesos and arrived about 9:00 AM. The park opens at 8:00 but there were not a lot of people there even at 9:00. We saw three other groups in our walk. Admission for non national adults was 80 pesos each.

Having toured the Mayan ruins at Tulum and Coba, we were interested in seeing the differences at this Zapotec site.  The first thing you notice is how new and upscale the reception and artifact display area is. The only unfortunate part is that almost all the exhibits are under glass and hard to photograph. No flash photography is allowed, but the hard part is avoiding reflections on the glass even without a flash. I included a couple of photos below that were reasonably clear. There are many more interesting exhibits. I understand they are from Oaxaca, but not necessarily from this particular Copalita site.

The structures themselves are no where near as sophisticated as those at Tulum, or as large as those at Coba. Construction was more similar to Coba with a lot of the material appearing to be round water washed rock from the nearby Copalita river. Like Coba there is a ball court similarly constructed but not nearly as elaborate. Almost all of the reasonably uncovered and restored structures are very close to the reception area. If you were not into taking a long walk or were in a wheelchair, I believe you could see most of it, without a huge effort. The paths like the reception area were very new and well made.

We did not take the long path to the marshlands which forks off to the North (left) just past the main central plaza structure. But, we did go to the end of the path which eventually takes you up some stairs and to a couple of excellent lookouts to see the Copalita river delta area, and also a picturesque view of La Bocana beach.  See photos. As a result of the tropical storm which hit this area in the last rainy season in 2013, the delta has been significantly altered, and there is now a huge sandbar which extends from the mouth of the river to La Bocana. You can get out onto this sandbar at La Bocana and walk right to the mouth of the river – about 1 km. In the one photo you can see a person standing out on the sandbar. Near the top of this trail there were workers restoring the only other visible structure. It is believed to be the location where sacrifices were made. One marker stone remains intact and they are currently uncovering more of the original rock. See the photo. The significant marker is being used as shade for their lunch! Not much to see on the trail past the second lookout, and it just goes to a dead end in the jungle. If you are tired by this point don't bother going further. 

We did not see many birds, flowers, or wild life other than the pelicans and buzzard like birds which you find on the coast. From the Copalita entrance we walked the 1 km or so back down the highway and into La Bocana beach area. It is certainly worth a stop for a cerveza or two while enjoying the view. From there we took a taxi for another 50 pesos back to Secrets. The distance to Secrets is walkable, BUT, there are significant hills and it is HOT! The taxi ride was appreciated.

Hope that helps some. I would go early in the day, and make sure you take some insect repellent and a bottle of water. As it is a park with butterflies etc., they do not fog for mosquitoes and black flies. 

It is a very worthwhile and modestly priced ½ day excursion to make. Highly recommended.

188610344.name: Great place to visit
188610344.author: a TripAdvisor user
188610344.reviewBody: Our whole family toured the site and found it to be very interesting. They were still excavating parts of the site, We stopped to talk to a few of the workers and they were very friendly and knowledgeable.

185545061.name: As Reviewed
185545061.author: a TripAdvisor user
185545061.reviewBody: The other reviews cover it well. It\'s worth a visit of a couple of hours. I saw little of the wildlife that others have seen, but the lookout at the end of the trail is really nice. There was a small crew working on the central pyramid, so perhaps there will be more development of the park.

173383198.name: Beyond our expectations!
173383198.author: a TripAdvisor user
173383198.reviewBody:
This park was about a 10 minute walk from where we stayed in Huatulco and we thoroughly enjoyed having the park to ourselves with amazing views for great photo opportunities, and we did not expect to see so much wildlife (deer, iguanas, butterflies, snakes, lizards, armadillos, flamingos!) living naturally within the area. The paths were very well kept and the entire park was beautiful, but be warned, do NOT go to #9 unless you want to be thoroughly disappointed that there is nothing to see at the end of a very long walk, but we did see the deer on this path and enjoyed the beauty of our surroundings anyway.

We also enjoyed the museum they offer at the beginning with the history of the culture of the surrounding areas and found it very interesting.

One complaint though two of the ruins were closed off and did not allow passage through and we were looking forward to seeing the older archeological aspects of the park, but managed to only see the Serpent Temple, Ball Field, and the Mayor temple?

Other than that, I would definitely recommend coming here and bring LOTS of water, sunscreen, and your camera!!

166450445.name: Build the path and they will come!
166450445.author: a TripAdvisor user
166450445.reviewBody: Copalita is about 10 mins. from the Secrets resort.  I was fortunate to get a glimpse of this  up and coming ruin.  Unfortunately, the unearthing of the ruin has come to halt due to lack of funding.  Presently, the path through the jungle is quite elaborate, hence it does make the tour worth the while if one keeps an open mind to the possibilities.  Sergio was the tour guide, and although he struggled with his English, he did an amazing job of capturing ones attention.  The path leads up a cliff side,where a view of the mouth of the Copalita River and into the Ocean.  Spectacular view!  Following the path down the cliff side, back into the jungle, and leading out to an amazing museum.  Simply fabulous if you are interested in the Mexican 500 A.D. culture.  This excursion is well worth every peso that will inevitably go to the funding of Copalita  p.s.  take mosquito spray!

162826893.name: Fantastic jungle walk and spectacular ocean views
162826893.author: a TripAdvisor user
162826893.reviewBody: As far as Zapotec ruins go, this is definitely not the best. The walk through the jungle, however, is fantastic. We saw colourful birds, massive Iquanas in the trees, Land Crabs, Flamingos, Brown Pelicans and a Parrot Snake. There is one trail that goes by a small swamp that is full of Iquanas. The other trail goes to ocean lookouts where wildlife viewing is plentiful. This visit was a pleasant surprise and well worth a return visit.

161272637.name: wild white flamigos in river
161272637.author: a TripAdvisor user
161272637.reviewBody: My wife and I have never seen so many white flamigos in the mouth of a river before. There had to be thousands of them and you could hear them a half mile away while walking on path to river as it empties into the Pacific ocean. The wildlife and exotic birds was truly amazing.

160450323.name: A small bite of ancient history
160450323.author: a TripAdvisor user
160450323.reviewBody: This is a great morning excursion - worth every peso. A small, modern museum exhibits local archaeological artifacts and puts them in the greater scheme of things in the state of Oaxaca. Small enough to get around in a few minutes if archaeology isn\'t your thing, and extensive enough to spend a good half hour mugging up on the Mixtecs. Then there are the ruins of various pyramids in the dry bush. Great well kept paths lead you through the trees, alive with birds, lizards and - on my trip - a very dozy snake. You come out at the cliffs overlooking Bocana and have a spectacular view of the coast, the Copalita river and the women coming or going to collect salt - a time honoured chore. It\'s well worth going. But head off there by taxi early in the morning as it is cool. Ask the taxi man to wait for 90 minutes or so. It won\'t cost too much.

157123132.name: Beautiful Park!
157123132.author: a TripAdvisor user
157123132.reviewBody: Our tour guide, Mario, was very knowledgeable about the flora & fauna of the area.  The museum is small but well done.  All info in the museum is in Spanish so it was imperative to have Mario to explain things in English.  Signage at the ruins is in Spanish & English.  Wide flagstone paths & shade trees make this a pleasant place to spend a few hours.

156903760.name: Go early and hire a guide!
156903760.author: a TripAdvisor user
156903760.reviewBody: We went to the ruins with on a recent trip to Huatulco. We hired a guide, Mario. He\'s an expert on the history of Oxaca, the ruins, the flora and fauna of the area. Such a wealth of information. After exploring the ruins we walked to a high point overlooking the Rio Copalita & Playa La Bocana. Such a beautiful view. If you go make sure you hire a guide, go early and bring lots of water!

154191602.name: Inexpensive Tour to do
154191602.author: a TripAdvisor user
154191602.reviewBody: We hired a cab from the hotel and went there first thing in the morning.  It was 80 pesos to get in.  We also hired a guide when we got there.  The price of the guide depends on the number of people doing the tour.  The guide was very informative and would recommend one for people visiting the ruins for the first time.

152819541.name: Interesting, but needs time to develop.
152819541.author: a TripAdvisor user
152819541.reviewBody: Spent a morning here. A couple of ruins have been uncovered. Path to the ocean is well worth taking. View is spectacular. The path heading the other way though is misleading. A 15 minute hike gets you to the end of it, and there is nothing there. I would suggest taking a tour as the museum has no english.

151846020.name: Beautiful views and spectacular artifacts
151846020.author: a TripAdvisor user
151846020.reviewBody:
On a whim, we decided to grab a cab from our hotel and head up to the ruins. It was later in the day, 2pm, so when we arrived there was unfortunately no English guides to take us through. However, we were able to figure out a good portion of the descriptions in the museum portion, and the signage throughout the rest of the park was bilingual. They do give you a map as well. Entry was 100pesos. Cab from Santa Cruz was 75pesos. The small museum houses an amazing collection of artifacts in pristine condition. From what we could read and understand, I was under the impression a good portion of these were unearthed at Monte Alban/Mitla region near Oaxaca City. 
The park closes at 5pm, so we didn't have a lot of time to linger, but we made the trek to the lookout over the Rio Copalita and Playa Bocanas. It was well worth it! Just take your time and bring water. According to people we spoke with at our hotel, the best time to go is when they first open at 8am, the birds are apparently something to see. Next time! We did see geckos galore, and butterflies everywhere. 
The ruins aren't as spectacular as Tulum or Coba, etc, but due to the size, you do get a very close look at the architecture. Also, it's a recent discovery- 1999...and only was opened to the public in 2012, so I'm sure they'll find more as they keep digging. 
Another suggestion, bug repellent! It's a swampy location and when you pause in a shady spot, the mosquitoes are waiting...
I enjoyed the short time I was able to wander around, and will definitely go back again next time I'm in Huatulco, but earlier in the day. I would also love to see the area in summer, when everything is green from the rain.

151620185.name: New Archeological Site (2012)
151620185.author: a TripAdvisor user
151620185.reviewBody: Welcome center has great architecture.  The site is new, and not overly developed.  The Mexican government is spending a great deal of money to open things up and continue exploring and digging.  Has the potential to become a great park.

150435661.name: YOU MUST VISIT!!!
150435661.author: a TripAdvisor user
150435661.reviewBody:
We got an English speaking guide to help us through the park...highly reccomend.
Ruins are awesome.
I went at the end of rainy season and everything was lush and green...beautiful

150386474.name: Amazing View from top of cliff
150386474.author: a TripAdvisor user
150386474.reviewBody: Be prepared for a good walk, make sure you get a guide, Mario or Oscar are good. Small Mayan type ball court, a number of temples including a very large one. This site is still being excavated, they have many more buildings to uncover.

150181456.name: Great new park
150181456.author: a TripAdvisor user
150181456.reviewBody: Open only since 2012 this is a beautiful park with a nice partially excavated ruins.  It is no Chitzen Itza but it beats Coba by a mile.  The neat paved paths through the jungle provide many birding and wildlife opportunities and the view from the cliff of the Copalita River delta and beaches is spectacular.  Have your hotel arrange an English speaking guide.  We like Cornelio and Alberto.

149208876.name: I love ruins...
149208876.author: a TripAdvisor user
149208876.reviewBody: What a surprise to find Copalita. The place was beautiful with stone pathways that led to ruins and a beautiful overlook which you could see the ocean and the river coming together. The park was immaculate with beautiful trees. The "visitor center" had a very informative collection and history of that part of mexico. Go there....

148196322.name: Pleasant mostly shady walk and interesting ruins
148196322.author: a TripAdvisor user
148196322.reviewBody: This was relatively close to hotel area and very well maintained. Nice museum and shady walk in swampy area with rock path. Scenic views of ocean and where sweet water river meets ocean. We recommend doing it with tour guide. They speak English. Our guide was extremely nervous at first but did fine once he warmed up. Entrance fee is $70 pesos per person and tour guide lowered fee to $300 pesos. Take camera if possible.

665375660.name: Excelent art!
665375660.author: a TripAdvisor user
665375660.reviewBody: Just passing by and saw the vivid colors through the window. There are many Mexican artists modern work displayed - large selection, all beautiful, many outstanding! Search no more, there is something that will fit in each room!

address.streetAddress: Blvd Benito Juarez Zona Comercial Tangolunda,

664601817.name: Beautiful Galeria with high-quality and diverse art pieces - something for everyone!
664601817.author: a TripAdvisor user
664601817.reviewBody: Europa Galeria De Arte in Tangolunda is well worth a visit - make sure you give yourself enough time to peruse the whole collection, as it is truly fabulous but also has quite a lot of diversity in the styles and subjects of the art pieces.  Owner Sam Cade is extremely knowledgeable and "in it for the art."  There\'s no sales pressure, just a lot of very good information about the pieces.  The price range is great, so there\'s something for everyone\'s taste and budget.  I highly recommend Europa Galeria for gifts of art to take back with you or to help you furnish your Huatulco home.  Thanks for everything, Sam!

address.streetAddress: Blvd Benito Juarez Zona Comercial Tangolunda,

664187304.name: Fine Mexican Art in Tangolunda
664187304.author: a TripAdvisor user
