664187304.reviewBody: This is a must visit place when you come to Huatulco. Fine art and Mexican art is well represented in Huatulco by Europa Galeria.

address.streetAddress: Blvd Benito Juarez Zona Comercial Tangolunda,

663869029.name: I\'d buy everything if I could!
663869029.author: a TripAdvisor user
663869029.reviewBody: Spent some quality time today visiting this gallery. We have been meaning to come for a while and it was so worth the visit. Friendly, informative information about the art at the Gallery, the styles of art, mediums used, and meaning behind the pieces. \nJust beautiful works. We are no art experts at all but just loved this place and would thoroughly recommended a visit...

address.streetAddress: Blvd Benito Juarez Zona Comercial Tangolunda,

663309875.name: Great find in Tangolunda
663309875.author: a TripAdvisor user
663309875.reviewBody: The Euripa Galer\u00eda De Arte was truly an amazing find in Tangolunda. The small gallery is located in a modern strip mall. Two floors of eye pleasing art from around Mexico. Worth the visit.

address.streetAddress: Blvd Benito Juarez Zona Comercial Tangolunda,

661217269.name: Unique repertoire of fine Mexican art
661217269.author: a TripAdvisor user
661217269.reviewBody: As we searched for a nice local cafe we were introduced to the friendly owner of Europa.  Very friendly and knowledgeable about the rate fine art in Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Blvd Benito Juarez Zona Comercial Tangolunda,

659039833.name: Art Gallery Near Secrets & Dreams Resorts
659039833.author: a TripAdvisor user
659039833.reviewBody:
My husband and I travelled to Huatulco this past week for our annual March Break trip. 
We saw this gallery in a local magazine and wanted to take a look.  One day, we took a cab from our hotel (Secrets) for $5.00 USD to the gallery and we were pleasantly surprised. Alternatively, the gallery is a short walk (1minute) from the Dreams property which is just up the road. 

Upon speaking with the owner, we learned that this is a one of a kind art gallery and the only one the immediate area.  The owner has extremely unique and beautiful pieces that showcase artists from in and around the Huatulco area.  He hand-selects the art he sells and he is very particular about having enough variety for his patrons.  We also learned at this time that he hosts school children for art education/appreciation classes which he runs regularly in the art gallery as a non-profit addition.

We were very impressed with the owner's experience and friendly demeanour as well as his ability to give back to the community that he has called home for years.  We will definitely return again next year when we are back visiting.

address.streetAddress: Blvd Benito Juarez Zona Comercial Tangolunda,

657912303.name: My Sophia
657912303.author: a TripAdvisor user
657912303.reviewBody: I am perhaps a bit late in posting this but I met Sam and visited his amazing gallery in December. My partner surprised me with a beautiful piece from the gallery as a Christmas gift. We couldn\u2019t be more pleased with our Sophia. Sam\u2019s knowledge and patience with is us as we had the difficult choice of picking one piece was most appreciated.. There are so many amazing artists represted here it was most difficult to choose. \nI highly recommend you stop by this gem in Tangolunda and see for yourself! Thanks Sam!

address.streetAddress: Blvd Benito Juarez Zona Comercial Tangolunda,

657870942.name: Huatulco Gallery....
657870942.author: a TripAdvisor user
657870942.reviewBody:
Sam  has done an amazing job scouring Mexico for first the finest  art...at very affordable pricing.
Drop in and enjoy.

Bravo Sam!

Thermal Regards

Brian Jastrow
Principal

IRIS INC.

address.streetAddress: Blvd Benito Juarez Zona Comercial Tangolunda,

657830716.name: Unique Mexican Art
657830716.author: a TripAdvisor user
657830716.reviewBody: We have visited the Europa Galeria on a couple of occasions during our trips to Huatulco. Sam is very knowledgeable and informative about the history of Mexican art. There are many beautiful pieces in the gallery and in particular the unique masks that are \u201cone of a kind moulds\u201d and will not be duplicated. Well worth a visit if you are in the area and if you are in the market for an interesting piece of art to add to your collection

address.streetAddress: Blvd Benito Juarez Zona Comercial Tangolunda,

657371724.name: Wow!!
657371724.author: a TripAdvisor user
657371724.reviewBody: The Europa Art Gallery was recommended by friends for us to visit. We were pleasantly surprised by the amount of stunning art pieces. Sam Cade, the owner was extremely knowledgeable and very helpful in guiding us in our first purchase of Mexican Fine Art. Please take the time to visit and enjoy the Mexican culture.

address.streetAddress: Blvd Benito Juarez Zona Comercial Tangolunda,

656449282.name: Interesting Mexican Art
656449282.author: a TripAdvisor user
656449282.reviewBody: We have had the pleasure of visiting the gallery several times and now are the proud owners of two beautiful paintings.  Sam is extremely knowledgeable about Mexican art and art history and the community of Huatulco.  He is very welcoming and eager to take the time to get to know visitors to the gallery.  Take a break from the beach and pop in to see the wonderful collection.

address.streetAddress: Blvd Benito Juarez Zona Comercial Tangolunda,

655528078.name: Art Galeri
655528078.author: a TripAdvisor user
655528078.reviewBody: We unexpectedly came across the gallery while on vacation and were pleasantly surprised by what we found. The gallery was filled with beautiful art and the environment was very inviting. The gallery owner Samuel Cade was very knowledgeable and supportive through the whole process of buying a piece. Although we were not planning to buy any art originally, the circumstances made it impossible not to. I would highly recommend going there!

address.streetAddress: Blvd Benito Juarez Zona Comercial Tangolunda,

654374958.name: Mexican Contempory Art
654374958.author: a TripAdvisor user
654374958.reviewBody: This gallery has a large diverse and interesting  collection of Mexican art so that anyone should be able to find something that appeals. Sam was very willing to discuss the pieces for any length of time and at a level that would suit the client. I expect to return and check out these beautiful works another time.

address.streetAddress: Blvd Benito Juarez Zona Comercial Tangolunda,

649834613.name: Cultural and inspirational artists
649834613.author: a TripAdvisor user
649834613.reviewBody: During your visit to the beaches of Huatulco, stop by the Europa Galeria De Arte featuring Mexican artists. This art gallery is intimate and full of inspirational pieces of artists which have had no formal training. The owner searches across Mexico for those who create out of passion. He shares his tales of how he came to discover the featured artist. Truly a beautiful gallery experience in paradise. \n\nAlso, he has an amazing companion named Loki, a Xoloitzcuintli (Mexican hairless dog) who\u2019s is full of curiosity and love for the ladies.

address.streetAddress: Blvd Benito Juarez Zona Comercial Tangolunda,

648425756.name: Finest Mexican art un Huatulco
648425756.author: a TripAdvisor user
648425756.reviewBody: Today was a day of living colours and images that feed our souls through our senses: a visit to a great gallery with more than 200 hundred works of varied artists around this country. Europa Galler\u00eda de arte is located in one of the most beautiful bays in Huatulco, named Tangolunda. The great curator Samuel Cade hosts this Unique kind  of place not only in town but in the whole area of the state. The walls display in each work the silent voices of the light of this country and far beyond. Europa gallery of art is a must in Huatulco for those who enrich their lives by the hand of genuine Masterpieces.

address.streetAddress: Blvd Benito Juarez Zona Comercial Tangolunda,

647640788.name: Worth a Visit for Beautiful Art
647640788.author: a TripAdvisor user
647640788.reviewBody: This hidden gem is just a short block away from the Barcelo The beautiful bright colours of these supremely talented artists was a pleasure to view.  It was also a nice refreshing stop after a heated walk outside of the resort.  I would definitely recommend a visit, if not to purchase but to at least enjoy the beautiful art he has hanging on his walls.

address.streetAddress: Blvd Benito Juarez Zona Comercial Tangolunda,

644793566.name: Must see gallery !
644793566.author: a TripAdvisor user
644793566.reviewBody: Being from Europe on vacation in Huatulco, we have been struck by the name of the gallery ! This is an authentic Mexican art at affordable prices presented in a very professional setting by a very knowledgeable gentleman by the name Sam and his assistant .who is a work of art in and of herself . Stop and see the Gallery and than enjoy a glass of wine at the next door bar and keep talking about art and local artists !

address.streetAddress: Blvd Benito Juarez Zona Comercial Tangolunda,

643162317.name: At last!! Beautiful, unique and refine Mexican Art in Huatulco!!! The Best Spot for art seekers.
643162317.author: a TripAdvisor user
643162317.reviewBody: If you are lucky enough to visit Huatulco. Its a MUST to show up at Galeria Europa. This well-located, charming art spot has unique pieces of the best local art. The charms of the place in addition to the greatest attentions from its owner \u00a8Sam\u00a8 is and excellent alternative to spend a nice afternoon looking at great art and doing something different. Its owner is determined to stand out the excllente local talent of some up and coming artists that will once more demonstrate that Mexico\u00b4s has a lot to offer in culture and arts.

address.streetAddress: Blvd Benito Juarez Zona Comercial Tangolunda,

639269030.name: and a dog too!
639269030.author: a TripAdvisor user
639269030.reviewBody: The proprietor has gone to great efforts to fill his gallery with a variety of artists and styles. We especially liked his works by Blanco - what a talented artist. For me, it was a special treat to meet Loki - an authentic Mexican Hairless! Great dog and a rare breed.

address.streetAddress: Blvd Benito Juarez Zona Comercial Tangolunda,

630371773.name: Great knowledgeable people
630371773.author: a TripAdvisor user
630371773.reviewBody: Found not just beautiful art, but people who know the art, and usually the artist.  Well worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Blvd Benito Juarez Zona Comercial Tangolunda,

628255003.name: great authentic Mexican Art
628255003.author: a TripAdvisor user
628255003.reviewBody: A treasure trove of high quality authentic Mexican art at affordable prices presented in a very professional setting by a very knowledgeable gentleman and his capable assistant who is a work of art in and of herself . Stop and see

address.streetAddress: Blvd Benito Juarez Zona Comercial Tangolunda,

599387491.name: Wonderful Mexican Art
599387491.author: a TripAdvisor user
599387491.reviewBody: Love the gallery\'s displays of Mexican artists and hearing about the artists from the owner Sam New pieces come in so even if you have been before it is worth stopping in again to see what\'s new

address.streetAddress: Blvd Benito Juarez Zona Comercial Tangolunda,

589499170.name: Worthwhile visting Sam at Europa Galeria de Arte
589499170.author: a TripAdvisor user
589499170.reviewBody: Excelent art in a beautiful small and adhoc gallery in the best Location of Huatulco. Don\'t miss a visit !! Sam is the best owner and host !

address.streetAddress: Blvd Benito Juarez Zona Comercial Tangolunda,

589354028.name: Diversidad de arte
589354028.author: a TripAdvisor user
589354028.reviewBody: Beautiful Mexican art. I loved  the colorful paintings, the sculptures and the regional art. Thank you Sam for a lovely visit. Thank you for sharing your knowledge with us. Hope to visit you soon.

address.streetAddress: Blvd Benito Juarez Zona Comercial Tangolunda,

582517918.name: Fantastic art
582517918.author: a TripAdvisor user
582517918.reviewBody: excellent place to find unique art, where the reception is wonderful and without counting the tour they gave me and know about the artist, I am delighted to visit it

address.streetAddress: Blvd Benito Juarez Zona Comercial Tangolunda,

581106032.name: My experience at Europa Galeria!
581106032.author: a TripAdvisor user
581106032.reviewBody: Beautiful gallery, has an exceeding variety of different genres of Mexican art, definitely recommend taking a trip to Europa Galeria for anyone who is looking for original and unique Mexican art to go in there homes! Love the fog Loki. Gallery was very clean and pristine, the outside murals are very eye catching and the owner has made a superb use of the space!

address.streetAddress: Blvd Benito Juarez Zona Comercial Tangolunda,

667948570.name: The cleanest beach I\'ve seen lately!
667948570.author: a TripAdvisor user
667948570.reviewBody: We were on a sun and sea tour and we stopped at a big beach in the park by a lagoon. Everything was so clean, and the water dropped off so fast the boat backed up to it so we could jump off.

650199583.name: Beach accessible by water only
650199583.author: a TripAdvisor user
650199583.reviewBody: an amazing beach here that is accessible by boat only. Many turtle nests to see. great snorkeling in the area

641852606.name: Such Beauty!
641852606.author: a TripAdvisor user
641852606.reviewBody: We hired a boat to take us on a tour of the bays and we were so impressed with them!  It is wonderful to see the pristine beaches in the Park Reserve and so awesome to see that people respect that.  We were able to go in to a couple of spots for a swim and it was like being on a deserted island! No hawkers, no washrooms, restaurants etc. just beach, trees, rocks and water. Heaven on earth!  A must see

638087919.name: Rugged and Natural
638087919.author: a TripAdvisor user
638087919.reviewBody: This is not a tourist attraction.  It is the real thing -  a preserve.  It is best visited by boat.\nThere are foot pathes and not many roads. Great beaches and a lot of wildlife.

631676327.name: To see the beautiful beaches
631676327.author: a TripAdvisor user
631676327.reviewBody: Meet people from many parts of the world but all we met friendly happy and staff never bothered any of us till we asked for help at the bars . We all around was a wonderful time

616787554.name: Beautiful National Park
616787554.author: a TripAdvisor user
616787554.reviewBody: Loved this National Park.  The Waters are pristine with a beautiful emerald color.  There are several bays and beaches to enjoy

571333083.name: beautiful
571333083.author: a TripAdvisor user
571333083.reviewBody: Very nice place to visit!  we enjoyed going on bahias de huatulco.  we were able to see a few sea turtles and dolphins.

570584705.name: Fantastic snorkeling
570584705.author: a TripAdvisor user
570584705.reviewBody: On the advice of a local, we skipped the tour boats and hired a panga out of the Santa Cruz marina who took us out at 7am (vs. the 10am-ish normal starting time for the managed tours). The captain stopped at Playa Entrega on the way out, and we rented snorkel gear from a guy who ran out to us, checked our shoe sizes, then ran back with what we needed. Then we boated on out to the national park and snorkeled three secluded beaches before noon. There was NO ONE on the reefs or beaches but the three of us this early in the morning! I\'m sure the more structured tours are great and informative and more luxurious, but if you want seclusion do what we did. Yes, it cost more to do it our way, and we had to pack our own food and drinks, but having these amazing beaches and reefs all to ourselves was thoroughly worth it. Just walk the dock area and make your own arrangements with a skipper.

560674199.name: India Beach
560674199.author: a TripAdvisor user
560674199.reviewBody: We visited this beach with a 7 bay tour.  It is accessible by boat, so it is not quite as crowded. Having said that, there were quite a few boats and tours and it was easy to get mixed up with which tour you were on. We recommended our tour guide wear colourful clothing or a hat to identify himself while in the water. the beach is lovely and the snorkeling was easy and lots of fish to see.  He brought up a puffer fish for us to touch and look at.  Very cool

552603137.name: We liked it, but may not be suitable for young kids. Very hot!
552603137.author: a TripAdvisor user
552603137.reviewBody: We had 2 tour guides who were enthusiastic  about the national park. They talked about the trees, the bugs, ants, humming birds and other types of birds.Expect desert like temperatures at the end of your walk, when you are getting close to the ocean. There were cacti growing and only dessert plants at the end. The most amazing view of a sandy beach awaited us. It looked like we walked into a huge basin filled with turquoise water.... . The sand was burning hot!\nIt was worth every minute of it, when we cooled down our boiling bodies in the refreshing waves.\nCaution! Waves are strong and the undertow can be dangerous.

543212325.name: Lots of dive sites but visibility is very poor
543212325.author: a TripAdvisor user
543212325.reviewBody: We did several dives in the national park boundaries.  There were very few other divers which made it more enjoyable.  There are often strong currents which dictate the most appropriate dive sites for the conditions.  Further, the water visibility was very poor and we understand this is normal - luck of the draw.

482077011.name: Beautiful!
482077011.author: a TripAdvisor user
482077011.reviewBody: Just beautiful.  Everything about this beach is beautiful.  You have to be there to experience the beauty.

477982472.name: we did the seven bay boat trip.
477982472.author: a TripAdvisor user
477982472.reviewBody: very pleasant day experiencing the natural side of mexico. We then stopped off at a public beach for lunch. The service and food were excellent

475132939.name: Snorkeling
475132939.author: a TripAdvisor user
475132939.reviewBody: The Huatulco National Park has an area  to snorkel. Excellent snorkelling. Volunteers were cleaning the National Park beach when we were there in April.

467565232.name: Boating
467565232.author: a TripAdvisor user
467565232.reviewBody: Boat trip all day with Tony Lopez Lopez was great we seen all seven bays went snorkeling stopped to eat. They went out of there way to make sure we had a good time

459459960.name: Beautiful beaches and pristine country side make this a must see part  of your Huatulo
459459960.author: a TripAdvisor user
459459960.reviewBody: There are several beches in the park that offer  a great entry into the park with snorkeling and swimming sites.

457094359.name: Tico\'s boat tour trip through the 7 bays
457094359.author: a TripAdvisor user
457094359.reviewBody: Part of our day with Tico on his boat. We stopped and snorkeled here. Good selection of fish and reef. This is one of the 5 bays you can get by only by boat. A must to do!!

455635541.name: Boat / Snorkel tour of 7 Bays
455635541.author: a TripAdvisor user
455635541.reviewBody: Enjoyed the boat ride to the national park & was great to see the shoreline from the water!  Snorkelled at the National Park (group size was about 70 people?) - there were about another 4 or 5 boats there at the same time (we prefer smaller groups & less "commercialized) - snorkeling was OK (San Augustine is better). Then went to another Maguey Bay for lunch - which group took us to their specified restaurant - we thought we were going to get to snorkel here too - however that never happened! A lot of our group was just waiting for our tour crew to get going again - lots of waiting at 2nd stop!

453496270.name: Fantastic snorkelling
453496270.author: a TripAdvisor user
453496270.reviewBody: So quiet when you pull into the bay and magic under the water.  Even beginners can snorkel here, it\'s very calm and safe water the beach itself has nothing but sand and rocks to explore.  It\'s a wonderful treat.

451553090.name: Best boat excursion ever!
451553090.author: a TripAdvisor user
451553090.reviewBody: This was the 4th time I went out on a boat excursion of the 7 bay National Park with Roberto from Yellow Fin Catching.\n\nRoberto is a great tour guide, and makes you feel very safe and takes time for you. This last trip, we ran into a pod of 300 dolphins. We stayed for an hour and got amazing photos of dolphins jumping and playing in the wild. We then snorkeled two amazing reefs and did some body surfing. What a totally amazing day. Would highly recommend!

438785531.name: Great Birding!
438785531.author: a TripAdvisor user
438785531.reviewBody: I visited the National Park twice and had a great birding experience with using Cornelio Ramos, a professional guide.  I got great photos of the Red-breasted Chat, Gray Hawk, Crane Hawk, Doubleday\'s Hummingbird, and many other species that I\'d never seen before.

390862221.name: The best for snorkeling
390862221.author: a TripAdvisor user
390862221.reviewBody: This is a virgin area and the best for snorkeling, the India bay had a beautiful sea for all the people that enjoy this activity, I visit it with 3 kids one 6 years old and he been able to snorkel. The water is the the best of the area in my opinion

379524071.name: Surprise Adventure
379524071.author: a TripAdvisor user
379524071.reviewBody: Leaving Huatulco Harbor we turned North.  I expected the beautiful clear blue water, but I was surprised at the stone seashore.  The blue waves crashing into gray and black craggy wall, with white spray was for me jaw dropping.  Having lived in Hawaii and the South Pacific, I was accustomed to the sea slamming into large lava flows.  I believe I was looking at metamorphic rock vice volcanic.  I am not a geologist, but the stone was quite striking.  I was told I was looking at the southern extension of the St. Andreas Fault.   As we proceeded up the coast we saw isolated coves with white sands and no waves, each gorgeous.  We learned that we were not the explorers we thought we were.  These coves with their exquisite beaches had hosted movies, commercials, nature documentaries, and photo shoots.  There was no doubt why.  We went ashore for lunch before we turned back at a cove with two restaurants and bars (both without names) and all the amenities you would find on any beach on the Pacific side of Mexico.  I say this because you can see a paved road high beyond the beach, but there is no access from the road to the beach coves or beach to the road. Our boat was comfortable with ten passengers, all family.  There are what is known as "seas".  There is some rough water, but  will always be able to see around the boat. The boat was safe and the captain took caution, with no risk.  If you have or think you have motion sickness, take Dramamine or ginger to be on the safe side before you get to the dock.  Be sure to have a camera at the ready.  I did not and it was a big mistake.

363488016.name: Snorkeling was amazing
363488016.author: a TripAdvisor user
363488016.reviewBody: Snorkeling in the coral reef was fun. We spent an hour having lunch under a canvas top. Food was good.

360143515.name: MAJESTIC
360143515.author: a TripAdvisor user
360143515.reviewBody: If you\'ve seen planet of the apes with the barren beach this is the feeling you get here.  Nature prevails in all it\'s magnifacance.

357598415.name: Little gem
357598415.author: a TripAdvisor user
357598415.reviewBody: We travelled here by boat and were so lucky to visit. Beautiful beach with just us on it, trails to ride bikes or walk nearby. The water was so clear and beautiful we didn\'t want to leave.

357075348.name: Great Birds and Beaches
357075348.author: a TripAdvisor user
357075348.reviewBody: We went on a 7 bay tour of the Huatulco area and stopped at several beaches within the national park.  This is a beautiful park with pristine beaches that are crystal clear.  The snorkeling is great.  At the time we were there the forest was grey but a heavy rain storm that happened a few days earlier started the trees blooming and sprouting leaves.  Also, we went into the park from behind Santa Cruz and watched birds on the old road donkey to Santa Maria.  All and all it was quite delightful.

356680856.name: must see when you are in area
356680856.author: a TripAdvisor user
356680856.reviewBody: Great wildlife,  colorful birds ,views are spectacular, and unmolested natural areas.  Take a good camera and binoculars and sun screen and bug repellent.

350278478.name: great multi bay boat tour
350278478.author: a TripAdvisor user
350278478.reviewBody: the huatulco national park is visually stunning.  seeing it from a boat is the best way.  Our tour was about 5 hours of Santa\nCruz, Organo, Maguey, Cacaluta, Chachacual and Chachacual. Stoped at one of the bays to go snorkelling. Stopped at Maguey bay for lunch (which wasn\'t included in the price and was too long of a stop). The tour was $27 per person and we booked it with Barcel\u00f3 when we made our hotel reservation, which made it a much better deal than buying it separately.

346665751.name: Lots of Great Birds!
346665751.author: a TripAdvisor user
346665751.reviewBody: This beautiful natural protected park, over 1100 hectares had great trails. We were there bird watching with local birding expert and guide Cornelio Ramos of Zibiilu Guides. On the way and while were there we saw over 65 species of birds! This park has beaches too, and views, but we principally enjoyed our time in the tropical dry forest where the birds are. People bike there too.

346172851.name: Huatulco National Park Jetski/Snorkel Tour thru Apple Vacations
346172851.author: a TripAdvisor user
346172851.reviewBody: We bought the Jetski/Snorkel Tour thru our Apple Vacations rep at Secrets. The area is gorgeous and we had a ton of fun. The shuttle bus ride dropped us of on a beach area where a cruise ship was docked so that was an unexpected bonus sight. (We later saw the same cruise ship headed south from the beach at Secrets.) We were on the Jetski for about 30-45 min touring the first few of the 7 Bays and coastline before we stopped and tied the Jetskis to a buoy and jumped in to snorkel. The water is clear and coral very colorful but we saw didn\'t see many fish as expected. Our guide was able to point out a couple blow fish and other species. After about 45 minutes of snorkeling we got back on the Jetskis and finished touring the remaining 7 Bays and headed back. No turtles, no whales, no dolphins, and not much fish, but we still enjoyed the outing. Our guide was an exceptional swimmer but communication wasn\'t that good due to our limited Spanish and his much better but not quite fluent English. I recommend this excursion for the beautiful sights and Jetski fun.

342429669.name: snorkelled
342429669.author: a TripAdvisor user
342429669.reviewBody: took a boat trip to see and snorkel in the park, very nice .the beaches are prestine and the waves were not too bad in the bays

334663093.name: this place is beautiful
334663093.author: a TripAdvisor user
334663093.reviewBody: We took the bay tour and were pleasantly surprised with how pristine the entire area is.  Our tour guide (a young man) was willing to take us anywhere we wanted to go.  He took us to all of the bays and right up to the beaches.  He stopped at one beach that was completely deserted and allowed us to walk all around the park.  Then he took us to his favorite snorkeling area and jumped in an gave us the guided tour.

269341658.name: Beautiful Beach
269341658.author: a TripAdvisor user
269341658.reviewBody: If you get a chance to go on the 7 Bay tour and go snorkeling at this beach - do it!  The water was clear and refreshing and the sand was amazing.  Snorkeling was great - lots to see!

267765197.name: Some many beautiful bays & beaches within the park.
267765197.author: a TripAdvisor user
267765197.reviewBody: Hubby & I did a bay tour by Panga boat & we saw all the beautiful beaches within the park. We stopped at Playa La Blanca beach ...so quiet...so peaceful & so many coral shells on the beach. We snorkeled here & the waters were so clear with lots of fish to see. There are no kind of facilities here so come prepared...you are on your own.  We spent about an hour here snorkeling and walking along the beach with is in the National Park.

261727594.name: Did a Bay and Snorkel Tour
261727594.author: a TripAdvisor user
261727594.reviewBody: They have alot of interesting things they are trying to do at the park regarding conserving and protecting.

260991543.name: Excellent scuba spots
260991543.author: a TripAdvisor user
260991543.reviewBody: I was taken into the Huatulco National park by Huatulco dive center what a wonderful place to swim. Plenty to see under water. The beaches from what I could see from our boat looked very clean. I hope to spend more time here in the future.

260945758.name: pretty, huge hill!
260945758.author: a TripAdvisor user
260945758.reviewBody:
Tranquil but you can't get that close to the ruins.  The view from the top of the hill is spectacular! Wish they had beach access though.  If you don't like to hike the forgo the sacrificial stone trek.

It's a quiet tour and fairly cheap, if you decide to go on your own tell your taxi driver to come back in an hour or so as we found it hard to get a taxi back.

259849531.name: Bird watching Extaordinary with Cornelio Gabriel in Huatulco National Park, MX
259849531.author: a TripAdvisor user
259849531.reviewBody: My friend and I stumbled upon a genius of a bird guide when in Huatulco, Mexico in February 2015.  First we joined him in Copalita Ecological Park and then hired him a second time to see the Huatulco National Park birds.  Both are just short drives from Huatulco itself.  Our guide\'s name was Cornelio Ramos Gabriel.  This man has a genius for calling in some birds and/or hearing them then spotting them with his naked eye.  Before you know it , he says, "I\'ve got it!" and that means he has the bird in his spotting scope for his tour members to step up and see fully magnified.  He twice  called in Pygmy owls for us.  He spotted a pair of Gold Crowned  baby hummingbirds in the nest and dozens of tropical birds we never would had seen had he not been with us like a an Orange Breasted Bunting.  Once all have looked, if there is time, he will then take your camera and shoot pictures of the bird through his scope while he tells you about that bird and its habits .    He charges approximately $50 for a 3  hour very gentle walking tour that includes some fruit and water and transportation to and from your lodging.  He speaks and understands English very well and is a pleasure to be with.  I highly recommend him.  He can be reached by email at birdguidecornel@gmail.com or birdguidecornelio@hotmail.com or by going to his website at http://www.coug.net/cornelio/\n\nThe park itself  was in it\'s dry season while we were there so did not have the feeling of the tropics, but the roadside to the entrance and the lagoon inside it to which we walked were teaming with bird life.  At the time we went the bridge that once could take all the way to the ocean was down so we were not able to complete that part of the walk.

258374763.name: So happy this is preserved!
258374763.author: a TripAdvisor user
258374763.reviewBody: Beautiful shoreline and so happy that the Mexican government has protected this area.  It is beautiful. Boat tours in can get you to remote beaches - beautiful views.

244722453.name: Beautiful from the sea
244722453.author: a TripAdvisor user
244722453.reviewBody: Seeing the park through its beautiful virgin beaches is wonderful!  Cant wit to go back and get into the park!

244331423.name: A must!!!
244331423.author: a TripAdvisor user
244331423.reviewBody: WOW. This park was breathtaking. The colors were so vibrant they looked fake. We saw dolphins and many different fish. If you go to hualtulco you can not miss this. Don\'t waste away at the hotel go see something that is beyond beautiful!!

238067483.name: Snorkling, boat ride and seafood
238067483.author: a TripAdvisor user
238067483.reviewBody: We took a boat to visit different bays of Huatulco that are part of the national park. Here you can do some snorkling to see the a buautiful reef and sea life, this was the first thing we did and took around one hour to get there. This was also the farthest place we went.\nAfter that we started to go back and got off the boat in this little bay where you can eat delicious seafood. Then we went back.\nThis trip took around 4 hours and it was totaly woth it.

214713851.name: Unspoiled!
214713851.author: a TripAdvisor user
214713851.reviewBody: Took a cruise excursion and it is so beautiful and unspoiled!!!! The water is pristine and the shoreline beaches were like powder!

198098351.name: Gorgeous Beaches
198098351.author: a TripAdvisor user
198098351.reviewBody: Took a catamaran snorkelling trip through the national park and was very impressed with how clean the water and beaches were.  Pretty good snorkelling too; lunchtime stop on one beach had rustic restaurants with even more rustic bathrooms, which you had to pay to use.

194907374.name: Back to Nature
194907374.author: a TripAdvisor user
194907374.reviewBody: Beautiful, unruined , great snorkeling or diving.... seen by boat trip. very secluded.. clear clean water.....deserted beaches.. very fun trip.

192510013.name: Virgin beaches,private
192510013.author: a TripAdvisor user
192510013.reviewBody: On our fishing trip with Yellow Fin,Roberto Hernandez V,he took us to the national park.It was so private and natural.Got to snorkel here,was amazing.Lots of hemet crabs,and different birds.Awesome spot, glad its a park.

191699139.name: very scenic boat tour with a lot of beaches
191699139.author: a TripAdvisor user
191699139.reviewBody: If you really want to discover the beauty of the Huatulco area you need to visit this park via boat. We hired a guide who brought us with a small boat into the area and I have seen the most beautiful deserted beaches I can imagine. I thought our vacation is Los Cabos was already not to beat, but after I have seen this, I would come back here in a heartbeat. Our guide dropped us off on several beaches which we had for us, just turtles and  vultures around, the most of the beaches are good swimmable and the water is clear

189239436.name: Excellent bird watching!
189239436.author: a TripAdvisor user
189239436.reviewBody: Spent a morning in the park looking for birds. With the great guiding we found all of our targets and more including the Colima Pygmy owl and the red-breasted chat. Nice trail system.  We had a great experience.

188698671.name: Pretty cool!
188698671.author: a TripAdvisor user
188698671.reviewBody: We took an ATV tour of portions of the park, stopping in a small village to buy snacks sold by the locals and driving through a banana plantation.  We drove to several beaches stopping at one to relax and eat at an open air right on the beach and for snorkelling. The park is extremely clean and appears to be well maintained. It was great to be able to see some of the natural beauty of the area as well as seeing how the locals live.

662984128.name: High Prices
662984128.author: a TripAdvisor user
662984128.reviewBody: This year I found all prices high at the beaches that were out of town.  Service was really lacking at the beach restaurant that I was at.  I hate to say it, but have to be honest.  I know Mexico is more laid back, but I had to look around for someone every time I wanted a refill.  Dirty plate from food was never picked up and several staff walked by it.  Not the fault of the bay and didn\'t get the name of the restaurant

661517011.name: Snorkeling
661517011.author: a TripAdvisor user
661517011.reviewBody: Amazing snorkeling. Small bay with many restaurants just minutes from town. Only down side is the large number of "guides" who approach you on arrival. Paying for a guide is seriously crazy. The best snorkeling is to the left of the bay and very apparent by the number of people already in the water.

659685211.name: Sad, sad, sad . . .
659685211.author: a TripAdvisor user
659685211.reviewBody: Absolutely beautiful beach in a sheltered cove.  First time I went there, there were 3 restaurants and a dive shack.\nThis year it\'s wall-to-wall restaurants from one end of the beach right down to the area the boats pull into.\nFood and service at the restaurant I always have gone to has deteriorated badly.

657830856.name: Bring sunscreen
657830856.author: a TripAdvisor user
657830856.reviewBody: Spend the day in and out of the surf, very protected and always warm and sunny. Pack a lunch or eat there either one is a great option

655809239.name: EXCELLENT SERVICE
655809239.author: a TripAdvisor user
655809239.reviewBody: The food is yummy. The service(by Pepi) is outstanding. Go there, ask for him, he speaks good English, and you will be impressed! We left our beach towel behind and they found it and kept it until we returned a couple of hours later!

655085567.name: Jam packed
655085567.author: a TripAdvisor user
655085567.reviewBody: This is a gentle sloping beach a couple of hundred meters long.  It is lined with restaurants that offer food, drink, and shade.  It is very crowded...people stacked like cordwood in the ocean.  It is reported to be one of the best places to snorkel in the area.  Snorkeling boats bring in quite a few folks for that reason. If you are an experienced snorkeler, you will not find the snorkeling here to be compelling.  You\u2019ll see some fish and a little bit of living coral.  The water is calm.  But, only a real beginner would call the snorkeling here good.  Definitely not a must-see location.

654492324.name: Snorkeling
654492324.author: a TripAdvisor user
654492324.reviewBody: Pepe was lovely and gave us a table right on the beach front with shade. I am fair so this was wonderful. We had chips salsa with guacamole costing 100 pesos or $5.45. US.  Seen a sea turtle while snorkeling which was a highlight for me. Lots of space and fish. The beach did become busy in the afternoon so we had left. Stayed at Las Brisas so the taxi was $150 pesos.

654213984.name: Fantastic visit!
654213984.author: a TripAdvisor user
654213984.reviewBody: We took a taxi from our hotel and had a wonderful day of snorkeling and having a snack and beers at the beach restaurant.  Staff took care of our belongings while we were in the water.  Highly recommended.

653962341.name: A day of Snorkeling
653962341.author: a TripAdvisor user
653962341.reviewBody: Got here earlier and not too many people (yet)...\nSat at Las Flores Restaurant. Half way on. Great service, close to the beach. Staff friendly, food hot and seasoned well! Truly a great day on the beach! It was a Thursday and not too crowded. Also got some oysters from a vendoron the beach. Soooo fresh and tasty, Great hot sauce!

651568656.name: Ask for Pepe
651568656.author: a TripAdvisor user
651568656.reviewBody: Tell your cab driver to take you to La Entrega to meet Pepe. He will take you through the back entrance to la entrega restaurant and by pass all the guys trying to sell stuff. \n\nYou can get a table and safely leave your belongings. Order a few beers and enjoy the day. The snorkeling is great. Clear water, calm and lots to see.

650203293.name: Great beach and snorkeling
650203293.author: a TripAdvisor user
650203293.reviewBody: This beach area was impressive. To sum it up, it is a well kept up beach where litter in our stay was non existent. The waters were clear, with soft sandy white beach and plenty of restaurants. The area is geared towards families and there\u2019s no lack of locals trying to sell you something on the beach. If you bought a couple of beers you could sit at a table and be shaded by an umbrella. The waters were full of many different types of fish and even without snorkeling gear you could see from above the water swimming a lot of fish. The beach has easy entry into the waters. The air is full of food on the grills cooking. You can rent a jet ski, take a ride on a banana boat, tour other beaches or rent snorkeling gear. We came back many times as this was a favorite

649994034.name: Great beach, the first restaurant Judith ???
649994034.author: a TripAdvisor user
649994034.reviewBody: Watch out for restaurant Judith and the waiter, it is the first one you come to. 250 for a brolly and 2 chairs the rest are 200. The waiter tried to pad the bill but got caught and wanted to talk his way out of it, this did not happen. Spoke to 2 other couples in the parking lot who had the same thing happen to them and the same waiter, this casts a bad name on the paradise of Huatulco. I am lead to believe that they and some unscrupulous others are under investigation because of complaints. Be careful out there, keep yours wits about you.

647789413.name: Amazing snorkling
647789413.author: a TripAdvisor user
647789413.reviewBody: We went by taxi from the Barcelo Hotel spent the entire day there amazing amazing snorkeling water is blue and very clean. Tons of restaurants to choose from and everybody bends over backwards to make you feel at home extremely friendly people and very safe. Loved it

641851879.name: Disappointing Snorkel
641851879.author: a TripAdvisor user
641851879.reviewBody: We took a taxi to this beach from our resort - the Barcelo - about 15-20  minutes and 100 pesos for 4.  We got to the beach and were immediately bothered by the resaurant people wanting you to go to their place and they would give you umbrellas etc.  We just kept walking so we could see the whole beach before sitting down.  We picked a spot that had a bit of shade under a tree and went out to snorkel.  This beach is highly recommended for snorkeling but this day it was not good.  The waves were pretty high especially on the left side closer to the rocks, the waves were actually curling over at about 6 feet high so I stayed away from that part but that is the spot that is the best there is to see.  I went down closer to the middle where you could see lots of coral formations out farther. There were lots of boats coming and going taking out snorkelers and divers.  I had to go out quite far to get to the coral but it was getting too deep and the water was stirred up from the waves so I did not get to see much unfortunately.  I could see some bigger fish but just too murky.  Disappointing but the beach was beautiful and we enjoyed swimming and playing for awhile before heading back to the resort.  The spot we had picked to sit at was under the edge of a tree so we had a little bit of shade but then we had to move because the marine patrol? beach patrol ? guys had a tent to set up and wanted it where we were.  was a little ridiculous imo\nOverall I would go back and try again to snorkel on a calmer day.

641153904.name: Gret Beach
641153904.author: a TripAdvisor user
641153904.reviewBody: Great beach for snorkelling and relaxing.  Lots of restaurants line the shore and there is a nice coral reef in the bay just a few meters offshore.  Have seen a seahorse and turtles in the bay.  Lots of shade in the restaurants and under umbrellas.  Great place for swimming with gentle waves and sandy bottom.  It is a 60 peso cab ride from most areas to the beach.

637449529.name: Yes you could walk but dont
637449529.author: a TripAdvisor user
637449529.reviewBody: Catch a quick cab to this delightful beach. No palapas on any beach so be prepared to spend money so you can sit in one of the many restaurants. At least you get shade. Snorkel here.

637441446.name: Beautiful Bay with amazing food!
637441446.author: a TripAdvisor user
637441446.reviewBody: What a great spot to spend the day.  We took a boat tour on the Brenda Adriana with Capitan Gilberto.  He has a wonderful boat and will take you fishing and sightseeing.  Very trustworthy and reliable!  He is on Facebook @Gilberto Lopez Alegria and his cell is 958 107 1693,  Anyway, back to the restaurant!  The portions are huge compared to the resort ones, so don\'t over order.  The fish in the 1/2 pineapple is amazing but very rich!  The margaritas and nachos are the best.  Enjoy this hidden little gem!

635923579.name: Great Snorkeling
635923579.author: a TripAdvisor user
635923579.reviewBody: Great bay for snorkeling. Can get busy so hit it up in the morning. Some of the people in the parking/drop off area can be pushy trying to get you to the restaurants.

635278998.name: Snorkeling and nice beach
635278998.author: a TripAdvisor user
635278998.reviewBody: Plenty of beach-side restaurants with good food and service here.  You can rent snorkel gear.  I would not recommend paying for a tour - it\'s only $60 MXN by taxi from Santa Cruz hotel area - quite a bargain and much less for the same experience.  Coral is close to shore with a good variety of fish species to see.  Coral is about 10\' or 3m down at most in the main areas.  Not a marine ecologist, but the coral appeared to be not at its best health - though I can only compare to Hawaii and Great Barrier Reef.  All in all a good place in the Huatulco area for snorkeling.

634205942.name: Great Family Beach
634205942.author: a TripAdvisor user
634205942.reviewBody: This is a perfect place to spend the day    .  The beach is perfect for swimming\nand you can sit on the beach all day  and  have all the food and drinks\nbrought to you . Fresh oysters , Lobster ,  fish tacos,  Life is Ruff  !

632151727.name: A good place to start
632151727.author: a TripAdvisor user
632151727.reviewBody: One of the more popular (and busy) beaches in the area, this is a good place to relax and try out snorkelling in the extremely calm waters. Child friendly, easy to rent equipment if you need, and a decent variety of fish close to the shore. Not as spectacular as other beaches along the coastline to San Agustin - but easy to access and with all amenities at hand, it\u2019s a good starting point for exploring what the Huatulco has have to offer

630273002.name: Food was good but overpriced for tourists!
630273002.author: a TripAdvisor user
630273002.reviewBody: Stopped on our tour of the bays and disappointed in the outrageous prices and having to pay to use the toilet. I normally would not complain about prices but this time I will as they were highly escalated. Beach was not overly busy so that was a plus,

624558600.name: Lovely beach for families (calm waters and clean) with lots of eating options
624558600.author: a TripAdvisor user
624558600.reviewBody: I\'ve frequented this beach many times. It is always clean, the water is calm, the snorkeling is excellent (on the right day), and there are many options for eating. A great outing for the family.

613536083.name: Great food
613536083.author: a TripAdvisor user
613536083.reviewBody: After spending some time on the beautiful beach there, we had lunch before we went back to our resort.  Great home cooked food.  One of the best meals we had in Huatulco.  Hand made tortilla chips for the nachos and the fish tacos were great.

596499556.name: Great Beach and Good Place for Snorkeling
596499556.author: a TripAdvisor user
596499556.reviewBody: La Entrega is the most popular place in Huatulco and that is for a reason. The under-tow here is very minimal and you can snorkel very close to the shore. The waters are very calm so a lot of tourist and locals alike hang out here. There are some great restaurants on the beach as well.

591007830.name: Lots of fun for the family
591007830.author: a TripAdvisor user
591007830.reviewBody: We had a great timr. Great food and drinks for the whole family. We went on a jet ride with Ati and a boat ride with Pioquinto. They were awesome. Our waiter Juan at Juquileta was excellent.

588995510.name: Great Snorkeling
588995510.author: a TripAdvisor user
588995510.reviewBody: This place is fantastic for snorkeling. First time we had a chance to swim with turtles and also saw many beautiful fish to include puffer and spiky fish as well as star fish. Very clean and clear water with beautiful coral reef. Highly recommended.

576059513.name: Our Go-To Beach Day Restaurant!
576059513.author: a TripAdvisor user
576059513.reviewBody: La Entrega is a wonderful restaurant located on a beach of the same name.  The food is great & the staff is so friendly!  They have umbrella seating right on the beach and they will take great care of your personal items while you are snorkeling in the bay.  Great place for kids with no waves!

575413592.name: Great swimming beach
575413592.author: a TripAdvisor user
575413592.reviewBody: We spent the day there. Taxi rides are cheap.  Lots of restaurants here and gets busy on the weekends with lots of tour buses.  Great swimming beach as many of the others beaches are rough and have strong undertow. You can rent snorkeling gear or paddle boards and paddle boats. The snorkeling is really good here also. Very safe.

572771450.name: Look at all those fishes!!
572771450.author: a TripAdvisor user
572771450.reviewBody:
We went here twice in one week. 
Both times were amazing. 
Ask around for Mario, he will hook you up with the best gear for snorkelling. Super cheap. Head to the far left of the beach. Put your stuff in a locker and get geared up then head for the reefs. Be careful the tide and waves will push and pull you, so don’t get to close to the rocks. Don’t be afraid to go in the cave it’s pretty cool inside.
After an hour or two, you’ll be hungry. There are many places to eat.

571373153.name: Nice view but lots of people
571373153.author: a TripAdvisor user
571373153.reviewBody: Nice view, but in a place where almost 1000 people are you can imagine. Tourism do not take care of place. Came because everyone told is about this place. But please avoid it unless you Like trash everywhere and not so good food

569718867.name: Lovely place to snorkel
569718867.author: a TripAdvisor user
569718867.reviewBody: Sheltered from big waves, nice clear water and of course we saw a fair bit of sea life.  The beach bars are all friendly and good service.  Prices are fair.

568105897.name: Great  beach.
568105897.author: a TripAdvisor user
568105897.reviewBody: This is an excellent family beach. The calm waters offer amazing snorkeling. There are "pedalos" and snorkeling equipment to rent as well as Banana Boat trips round the greater bay and sight seeing boat trips right from the beach. At the end of the day, ask one of the boat operators to "taxi" you back to where your hotel is. To Santa Cruz it is 100 pesos per couple. Well worth the trip.

565661673.name: Great Dining on The Beach!
565661673.author: a TripAdvisor user
565661673.reviewBody: We spend the day at La Entraga last week.  The service was outstanding and the food was amazing!  The pricing is also very reasonable.

564160481.name: Trip to the Beach
564160481.author: a TripAdvisor user
564160481.reviewBody: On this visit to Huatulco, decided on a trip to Entrega.  The Beach is beautiful, but very crowded.  We went to the first beach restaurant coming in from the parking lot.  Very disappointed, with the fact they charged us double.  BE WISE ask for the bill and see exactly what you\'re paying for.  The waiter brought us a piece of paper with the amount on it, stupid me paid it and after watching him put the money in his pocket, and I realized I\'d been scammed....When I went over what we had and added up was exactly 1/2 of the amount he had showed me....

563422624.name: Great snorkel beach, but beware the restaurants.
563422624.author: a TripAdvisor user
563422624.reviewBody: Of the 4 beaches within a short ride from Santa Cruz I would definitely call this the best snorkeling location. It gets very busy on the weekends but there is lots of room during the week. There are several options for restaurants to leave your things at while you enjoy the beach, just avoid Las Flores. They over charged us and another couple I spoke with. This was the only place that this happened in two weeks.

560675132.name: Busy Beach
560675132.author: a TripAdvisor user
560675132.reviewBody: We were on a 7 bay tour with westjet vacations, so this was one of the bays.  We snorkeled from the boat and then made our way onto shore for a lunch.  There were quite a few beachside restaurants there.  Our meal was fine, watch the prices, you can have a nice meal for under $15.   The snorkeling was fine, but the beach was very busy.  Might be fun to take  a cab there on  a day when it was not so crowded.

559674657.name: Busy local beach with good snorkeling
559674657.author: a TripAdvisor user
559674657.reviewBody: Worth going to, lots of restaurants, nice beach, pay bathrooms, and lots of boats to take out for banana rides, fishing, or tours

558932562.name: La Entrega
558932562.author: a TripAdvisor user
558932562.reviewBody: An easy ride to this beach. Nice sand and lots of fish so take a mask and fins. Restaurant owners are Wilk g to dedicate tables and umbrellas for free and don\u2019t mind if you brought your own cooler with a few treats.

554987007.name: GOOD SNORKELLING BEACH
554987007.author: a TripAdvisor user
554987007.reviewBody: This beach is a short cab ride from town.  There are multiple restaurants to choose from, a little expensive for what you get.  you can rent snorkel equip, floaties, life jackets etc.  beach massage available, 400 pesos for 1 hour!

551354602.name: Snorkelling
551354602.author: a TripAdvisor user
551354602.reviewBody: Entrega is a great place to snorkel if that\u2019s what you are into.  Very busy place but if you are confident enough to go left around the corner, there is another small beach area that is a little quieter.  We rented a locker so we were able to stay in the water without worrying about leaving our stuff on the beach or feeling bad about leaving it at a table in a restaurant. We liked the snorkeling so much that we visited a total of 3 times.

548876521.name: Peaceful & Beautiful.
548876521.author: a TripAdvisor user
548876521.reviewBody: Went snorkeling and saw quite a few fish near the coral! Lucky that the water was great, clear and not too cold. Unfortunately coral around the world is not as healthy as it once was. Still this beach offered numerous restaurants, a beautiful beach and services one could access if one wanted to do a variety of ocean activities. Not to be missed if in Huatulco

545094781.name: Good snorkelling beach
545094781.author: a TripAdvisor user
545094781.reviewBody: Nice clean beach, good for snorkelling and swimming. There are several good restaurants for lunch or drinks.

543211961.name: Beautiful beach, great snorkelling but...lots of jellyfish!
543211961.author: a TripAdvisor user
543211961.reviewBody: This is a beautiful beach situated in a calm bay.  I\'ve heard it is highly recommended for children because there is no undertow and the slope is very gradual.  It is also a great beach for snorkelling - go straight out for about 200 metres and then go to your left - there is a secluded second beach where the coral is amazing with lots of fish.  However, beware - there were millions of juvenile jellyfish in the water.  I\'ve never been diving or snorkelling and heard the water crackle from jellyfish.  They were stinging but fortunately they were only pin pricks because they were so young.

532618490.name: Best snorkeling ever
532618490.author: a TripAdvisor user
532618490.reviewBody: We went to La Entrega beach several times. The beach was clear and friendly. If you are a first time snorkeller or an experienced one, this is the place to come. Just 60p taxi ride from La Crusecita or Santa Cruz and you are at this beach. The fish are close so you don\'t even need to head the short distance from the beach to the reef to see them. Forgot your gear, no worries, there is a shop at the far end of the beach where you can rent it any much more.\nWe frequented Restaurant Judith, again very friendly and great Mexican fare & perfect service. Activate Google Translater if you don\'t speak Spanish. You can use it even if you don\'t have wifi or data. Have fun and experience it all.\ud83d\udc95

515539737.name: Favorite beach
515539737.author: a TripAdvisor user
515539737.reviewBody: Lots of locals. One of  the vendors brought us umbrellas, and pails with waters, beers, and sodas. We opted not to sit in one of the restaurants. We rented snorkels and had a great time exploring. We saw lots of different fish and were glad we decided to try it.

498218318.name: One of our favourite places
498218318.author: a TripAdvisor user
498218318.reviewBody:
We love this place!  This was our second year in Huatulco and we are getting quite comfortable here. The beach is amazing good for swimming, floating, cooling down and snorkelling.  We snorkel at least 2/3 times a day.  

We hang out at our favourite restaurant La Entrega- Eat and drink all day, meet new people.  relax and read, and overall enjoy ourselves.

This year we took a cool tour with Jeremy's in his clear kayak.  He is set up right on the beach. We actually left the Entrega Bay and went to another Bay to snorklel.  This was a lot of fun.  Jeremy was right beside us in his own kayak.  He will also take you to the cool spots in Entrega as well.

Can't wait to come back next year!

493344111.name: Beautiful beach with good snorkeling. restaurants on the beach
493344111.author: a TripAdvisor user
493344111.reviewBody: This is one of our favorite beaches. Short taxi ride. Good food and snorkeling here. Water is clear.

490341105.name: Best lobster in town
490341105.author: a TripAdvisor user
490341105.reviewBody: Best lobster in town. A bit pricey, but well worth the view and taste. Friendly service, not the fastest in the world, but friendly non the less.

489683947.name: Good food just be careful with your bill!
489683947.author: a TripAdvisor user
489683947.reviewBody: Good food. We enjoyed the service and the idea. Just be careful that the bill you ate receiving is accurate. We were given a bill for 1800 pesos (about 90 dollars us) but when we opted to pay with a credit card the price changed to 900 pesos!. We can only assume that the waiter has been doubling the prices for cash customers and pocketing the difference.

472949344.name: A wall of people!
472949344.author: a TripAdvisor user
472949344.reviewBody: If you make your way to this beach any time near a Mexican national holiday you will experience a crowd, the likes of which, may stun you! We had a great time just people watching...because that is all you can see, people. There was no room at the restaurants, no room in the many boats that come and go, and almost no room to walk. \nThere were probably twenty buses in the parking lot. Hundreds of people (non-swimmers) don life jackets, sit in the surf and allow the incoming waves to wash them in and out like so much human flotsam. It is a hoot! But it ain\'t holistic. We did feel useful when one woman cut her ankle quite badly after rolling out of a boat and we were able to help her with our little first aid kit This drew a big crowd. Check the national calendar and take your chances...but for sheer entertainment (and la vida loca) it is kinda hard to beat this!

472525322.name: Amazing beach and snorkelling
472525322.author: a TripAdvisor user
472525322.reviewBody: Very calm bay with some great marine life. Snorkelling is $75 pesos per person. Many restaurants on the beach to chose from. Try La Entrega restaurant. Pepe will cater to your every need.

471423841.name: Snorkeling Beach
471423841.author: a TripAdvisor user
471423841.reviewBody: Short cab ride away from our hotel, calm warm waters makes for a nice afternoon of fish and skate ray watching!

471383714.name: A beach for part of a day
471383714.author: a TripAdvisor user
471383714.reviewBody:
This beach is one of the close ones to 
Venture to. Like the sand here and to only stay part of the day.
It can get very crowded ! !  Loads of restaurants, toooooo many,
You get hustled here, but you need shade so be prepared to buy something to drink or eat in order to use the shade, if u don't bring your own.
The water is calme here most of the time.

469955519.name: crowded beach
469955519.author: a TripAdvisor user
469955519.reviewBody:
Very hot in the sun with only a few trees for shade
There are plenty of beach restaurants with umbrellas where you can enjoy the scenery and Watch the action.
Lots of beach vendors selling everything right in the restaurants. Souvenirs, clothes, musicians to entertain you, fresh oysters, fried bananas.
The restaurants are higher priced for such casual places but it is your spot on the beach you are paying for

469833057.name: Nice local beach
469833057.author: a TripAdvisor user
469833057.reviewBody: This place is amazing you can snorkel right there, they have all the equipment for rent you can also make a deal with one of the locals to take you on their boat and see the sunrise in the morning it is a little noisy but if you like that this is the place to be

467705434.name: Warm water, great snorkelling
467705434.author: a TripAdvisor user
467705434.reviewBody: Great beach, with protected beach that isn\'t too choppy, unlike some of the beaches along this coast. The snorkelling is spectacular.

467038006.name: Great beach reached by taxi
467038006.author: a TripAdvisor user
467038006.reviewBody: We went here more than once and found the snorkelling was better than some of the higher rated beaches we could only reach by boat. Friendly, safe and gorgeous for swimming with an easy surf and clear warm water.

467025570.name: Ate here a few times in Feb 2017
467025570.author: a TripAdvisor user
467025570.reviewBody: Loved this restaurant on beautiful La Entrega beach. Very good service and food with friendly staff. A wonderful experience. Washrooms good here too.

466990331.name: great beach for kids
466990331.author: a TripAdvisor user
466990331.reviewBody: Out of the way but a quiet, friendly beach. I didn\'t swim here but just drove down to see the cove and the beach. Calm water, great for swimming and the kids.

466324593.name: one of our boat tour stops
466324593.author: a TripAdvisor user
466324593.reviewBody: our captain  took us here for snorkeling; we stayed for an hour and were the only people snorkeling.  I would take a cab to spend a day snorkeling.  there are some restaurants there but i am guessing that they get busy on w/e when the locals come.  beautiful beach & excellent snorkeling from beach.

465924558.name: great snorkeling and a nice calm bay
465924558.author: a TripAdvisor user
465924558.reviewBody: We went snorkeling for a day at this beach just outside of the town of Huatulco. It was a little busy with locals but for me it just added to the fun. Also I felt safe snorkeling there with so many others. The water was warm and calm and lots of fish to see. Not as great as Maui but still a nice day trip. If you go with a guide they take you into a cave too.  Equipment is there to rent too.

465771810.name: Beach fun
465771810.author: a TripAdvisor user
465771810.reviewBody: Very calm beach , enjoyed just relaxing in water  and spending time under the palapa with a cold cerveza and a Mexican lunch.

465662115.name: Paradise (except for one small glitch)
465662115.author: a TripAdvisor user
465662115.reviewBody:
Of all the wonderful beaches in the Huatulco area, this one is our favourite to spend a day at.  We love the snorkelling here and the food in the restaurants is great. We had one less than perfect restaurant experience here where they added a 15% tip to our bill after providing us with terrible service and mediocre food. In a month of visiting many restaurants here, this was the first time a tip was directly added to our bill? 
However the rest of our visits to La Entrega's restaurants were great so I'm just choking this off as an unusual experience. I am still mad at myself for paying it, but after having such a nice day here, I didn't want to make a scene or argue over30 pesos. ($2.00). 
I don't remember the name of the restaurant but it was the 2 or possibly third one in (of numerous restaurants) and its name started with the letter "B". The ones located at the far end are where most of the locals eat and the ones I'd recommend. 
The snorkelling here is great, especially if you venture far around  the rock point.  
Great place to spend the day.

462753060.name: Great snorkeling
462753060.author: a TripAdvisor user
462753060.reviewBody: Get to this beach early as it gets very busy after lunch.  We hired a guy on the beach for 150 pesos to take us out snorkeling for 45 minutes.  He was great with my kids and showed us a really neat cave we could swim in to.

462692904.name: Very busy i
462692904.author: a TripAdvisor user
462692904.reviewBody: Went snorkeling for the first time with a couple we met at our resort. The water was wonderful it was so warm. Nice to see the locals that come for the day.

462485712.name: Very nice beach
462485712.author: a TripAdvisor user
462485712.reviewBody: Good snorkeling!  Make sure you fine the small cave right before the little private beach along the left hand side facing the water.  Good food and a great outing!  Try to go during the week.  It is very busy there on the weekends.

459683067.name: Great guacamole
459683067.author: a TripAdvisor user
459683067.reviewBody: I\'m not a guacamole conisseur but theirs was unbelievable. The beer was cold, the service great, and the beach and atmosphere perfect!

458135101.name: A great beach
458135101.author: a TripAdvisor user
458135101.reviewBody: Super fine sands, cooling breezes and calm clear waters.  This is a great beach for swimming, snorkelling and relaxing.  A must visit when in Huatulco.

457856893.name: Great Place but get there early!!!!
457856893.author: a TripAdvisor user
457856893.reviewBody: Went one morning and decided to eat here.  Was not crowded until the busses started pulling in.   Easy beach access.   The food was very creative and good!!!   Service was great.  Prices very reasonable.

456194339.name: Snorkelling go enjoy
456194339.author: a TripAdvisor user
456194339.reviewBody: Put on your fins & be ready to go. Lots to see with easy snorkelling. Not the best beach sand yet still nice beach.

453200616.name: This Is Where Locals Go
453200616.author: a TripAdvisor user
453200616.reviewBody: We went on Saturday and the beach was full of locals.  Foreign tourists stay in their all-inclusive lodgings I guess.  It was noisy and busy and full of life.  Buskers singing/playing badly, bands performing off key, singing for the hell of it.  Kids were running around and people sitting on the water\'s edge.  It was truly a Mexican experience.  All the restaurants serve about the same menu so one can sit anywhere really.  The water was clear and clean.  This is the beach to go to if you want a Mexican experience!

445191606.name: Great snorkel beach
445191606.author: a TripAdvisor user
445191606.reviewBody: swim over to the snorkel beach.  We kayaked here and spent a few hours.  Really pretty and good snorkeling.  Worth a taxi ride for a day trip.  Restaurants on the beach, but we did not go to them.  Brought our own snacks and spent the day on the snorkel beach.

438892463.name: Beautiful but busy
438892463.author: a TripAdvisor user
438892463.reviewBody: 2 weeks ago we went to this beach. We were there early enough to beat the crowds of Mexican tourists, and it is a gorgeous beach! Snorkelling was very good and the water was clearer than either Santa Cruz or Maguey. Unfortunately the tourist hordes arrived by bus and boat and things got too crowded. Still, we very much enjoyed it. Early is the key!

436249244.name: Crazy
436249244.author: a TripAdvisor user
436249244.reviewBody: Playa Entrega is a strange experience.  First, you go through a planned development of expensive, gated homes, which feels more like something you\'d find in Southern California. When you get to the beach, which is lovely with its incredibly clear water, it\'s lined with palapa restaurants and touts all vying for your tourist dollar.  It\'s relentless!  We couldn\'t get out of there fast enough.  Although I plan to return to the area, I will skip this beach altogether.

399740827.name: Local Beach
399740827.author: a TripAdvisor user
399740827.reviewBody: We took taxi to beach twice and sat there a few hours and ate and drank. Really cheap. Food was really good. Beach has lots of gravel and shells. Also when we were there in December there were jelly fish I was stung twice.

387584179.name: Loved this place for snorkelling,
387584179.author: a TripAdvisor user
387584179.reviewBody: Snorkelling was excellent, lunch was very relaxing, people are so friendly. The beach was nice to walk on, they also sold gifts, we took a taxi from Huatulco, it was cheaper than a tour, the taxi driver came back and picked us up\n

386815112.name: beautiful beach
386815112.author: a TripAdvisor user
386815112.reviewBody: this is one of the nicest places to do snorkel, and the beach is like a big pool really nice and the food was very good

379214533.name: Great beach!
379214533.author: a TripAdvisor user
379214533.reviewBody: Spent the day , Had great service at one of the beach side restaurants. Calm waters for swimming and Snorkeling. Made a point to go there and we were not  disappointed !

360234292.name: Beautiful Beach
360234292.author: a TripAdvisor user
360234292.reviewBody: The beach was beautiful, water was crystal clear and we could see fish swimming, Quaint little places to eat.

359519093.name: Protected place to swim
359519093.author: a TripAdvisor user
359519093.reviewBody: Great beach to go to on a wavy day. Nice places to grab a drink and lunch! You can easily get there via taxi too!

359319337.name: Too busy
359319337.author: a TripAdvisor user
359319337.reviewBody: This beach was ok, too busy with vendors trying to get you to there restaurant,constant, water was not very clean

356806536.name: Good snorkeling, great place for day getaway
356806536.author: a TripAdvisor user
356806536.reviewBody: We did a self guided tour and the snorkeling was acceptable it was a good day, there was bar service and food available. It was safe to leave your belongings while in the water, overall a great experience.\n

356438065.name: Nice beach with simple restaurants
356438065.author: a TripAdvisor user
356438065.reviewBody: Great beach with no waves and great food. Easy access by a taxi, excellent snorkeling experience, easy access by boat. \nI will definitely return.

353148827.name: Great snorkeling beach
353148827.author: a TripAdvisor user
353148827.reviewBody: We went to La Entrega several times during our stay to snorkel.  Even though the water was rough and stirred up the sand making the water a bit murky, we still saw lots of fish and coral.  On the left side (facing the water), if you go around the point, there is a tiny little beach where we sat on the sand in the waves and enjoyed the water and rested before heading back around the point.  There is supposed to be a cave along the left side of the bay but were not able to find it but considering the water was a bit rough, I don\'t know whether we would have been able to get into it.  There are lots of restaurants and lots of people trying to entice you to their restaurant but none are really bothersome.  One trip, weekends are very busy on the public beaches as that is when the locals, from not only Huatulco from the surrounding areas as well, head to the beach with their families. Not a bad thing but it can get crowded.  We really enjoyed this beach.

352748719.name: Great for families and snorkeling.
352748719.author: a TripAdvisor user
352748719.reviewBody: There are literally no waves at this beach, tranquil waters and very very clear. As soon as toy step in the water you can see fishes wimming around your feet and they don\'t seem to be afraid of humans! If you swim a little further out there is a coral reef and multicolored fish are easily visible. The locals will rent snorkeling equipment, speed bote rides, aqua scooters and other stuff for enjoying the day. Well worth a visit.

352681601.name: Great Local Beach for Swimming!
352681601.author: a TripAdvisor user
352681601.reviewBody: We always love our time at this beach.  It\'s a beautiful spot to swim - no strong tides and some decent snorkeling available.  You can rent right at the beach if you want...  The restaurants are all good - they all want your business and will provide chairs and a table as long as you buy a beer or two and some snacks!

349977614.name: Best day in Huatulco
349977614.author: a TripAdvisor user
349977614.reviewBody: Took a cab from Tangolunda with 4 friends . Spent several hours there drinking , eating swimming and enjoying the musicians . Kick your feet up and have some mescal

347618862.name: Great snorkle beach
347618862.author: a TripAdvisor user
347618862.reviewBody: Sit and stare at the beautiful water while enjoying a cerveza while hanging with locals, family\'s and vacationers. The snorkeling is some of the best in the area. Very relaxed setting.

342454147.name: Great day trip
342454147.author: a TripAdvisor user
342454147.reviewBody: Took a taxi to this beautiful bay and enjoyed the snorkelling, view , cervezas and tacos and guacamole.  Was only 50 p from the Castillo and lots of taxis waiting in the parking lot when we were ready to leave.

341539839.name: Great snorkeling
341539839.author: a TripAdvisor user
341539839.reviewBody: Great place to snorkel.  Recommend you take a cab.  Restaurant staff are quite aggressive and having walked behind the restaurants I would not eat there but should be ok to get a cold bottled drink.  Equipment available on site.  Snorkle to the left side of the bay along the rocks and reef.  Nice beach with soft sand.  Go early to avoid crowds and avoid Sunday\'s when many locals crowd the beach.

341495803.name: Great food and atmosphere but can be busy!
341495803.author: a TripAdvisor user
341495803.reviewBody: The locals love this bay as it is road accessible so gets busy at certain times like holidays and weekends.  However the food and drinks are great served in one of the many palata or roof covered venues and you can snorkel right off the beach.  Sand is full of large pieces of shell so make sure to bring shoes for the walk to the beach.  Saw many types of fish and shell species while snorkeling. Many guides bring groups here so go early if it is a busy holiday time.

334529627.name: Great way to spend a day....
334529627.author: a TripAdvisor user
334529627.reviewBody: Each time we go to Huatulco we spend a good chunk of a day at La Entrega.  Mid way down the restaurant row we pick a table out in the sun....order a beer and some nachos and then go snorkelling for hours.  The owners of the Establishment will mind your belonging while you snorkel as long as you are eating and drinking their food and beer!  Great People, Great Fun...  You can rent snorkel gear there as well as tubes, etc.

330767931.name: good snorkelling
330767931.author: a TripAdvisor user
330767931.reviewBody: We took an excursion to this beach for snorkelling.  It is a local beach and there are a few little local cafes with tables under umbrellas for shade where you can buy food and drinks.  The bay gets quite hot as it is protected from the wind.  This means the water is calm and good for snorkelling.  There is a coral reef and we saw lots of fish.  There was one spot where there were hundreds of fish.

307307110.name: Very Nice Beachside Restaurant
307307110.author: a TripAdvisor user
307307110.reviewBody: Our friends who spend a month in Huatulco in the winter recommended La Entrega as their favourite restaurant to spend time at while visiting Playa Entrega.  Our group enjoyed a table under a sun umbrella here while snorkeling.  Inexpensive cold beer.  Very good 4x4 Shrimp dish (shrimp done 4 different ways, all good) - it was huge and easily fed 2 of us. Delicious guacamole.  Staff was pleasant.  Rest rooms were clean.

294731458.name: Cool beach with good snorkeling
294731458.author: a TripAdvisor user
294731458.reviewBody: We snorkelled and saw tons of fish.  The locals are a bit pushy for your business but it was the off season so they needed customers.  I bet the winter season has loads of folks on this beach.  Check it out.

286150902.name: A wonderful place to spend the day
286150902.author: a TripAdvisor user
286150902.reviewBody: Lovely beach a cab ride away from where we were staying. It is the perfect place to swim, snorkel and people watch.  Nice white sand, warm water and a great restaurant called La Entrega. We would sit there all day, under the palms or an umbrella provided ,eating good food, cold beer and delicious lemonade in huge glasses.  Clean bathrooms too. Beach sellers are a little persistent but they have to make a living too. Life jackets for snorkeling were available for a nominal fee further down the beach. Make sure you get a chance to go there!

281157962.name: My Favorite Restaurant at La Entrega Beach
281157962.author: a TripAdvisor user
281157962.reviewBody: This is the restaurant I always visit because of the food is always good, our favorite waiter always takes care of us, and I like their location on the beach. I\'m sure the other restaurants are good too, but this is our favorite.

267792563.name: Great Beach
267792563.author: a TripAdvisor user
267792563.reviewBody: This beach is a very popular beach. It has some very nice snorkeling. Equipment can be rented. It is very scenic and great for swimming. The beach is lined with restaurants serving very good food at reasonable prices. There are boat tours, jet skis and banana boat rides available.

259299629.name: Nice spot
259299629.author: a TripAdvisor user
259299629.reviewBody: Great for snorkling, nice beach. Lots of Restaurants our favourite was Restaurant La Entrega. You can stay at  your table and chairs the whole time whle using the water if you buy some drinks and food.

257921888.name: Great snorkeling
257921888.author: a TripAdvisor user
257921888.reviewBody: Make sure you check out the cave/tunnel just past the left point but before the next beach. Swim around all the colourful corals and you\'ll find it.

255515341.name: I love this little beach. Great snorkelling and swimming.
255515341.author: a TripAdvisor user
255515341.reviewBody: We enjoyed coconut natural and guacamole under the umbrellas on the beach. This beach is easy to get to and wonderful for snorkelling right off shore

253725993.name: Check your bill!!
253725993.author: a TripAdvisor user
253725993.reviewBody: Just got back from La Entrega...Victoria beer on the menu is 25 pesos each ...bill came and we were charged 30 pesos!!  I questioned the Mexican waiter and he quickly said I was correct.  Beware... Keep track of what you ordered and also check the bill.  They will try to overcharge you.  When talking to other travellers the same thing has happened to them at La Entrega.

252760253.name: Great Restaurant
252760253.author: a TripAdvisor user
252760253.reviewBody: This place was a little difficult for the taxi to find....but worth the effort.  Very nice atmosphere and the food was terrific.  Not to be missed.

250643199.name: good snorkeling
250643199.author: a TripAdvisor user
