250643199.reviewBody: so clean and pretty and the snorkeling was so good! We had shrimp and fish tacos and cold cervesa for lunch at one of the beach restaurants. we spent about 4 hours there and it was awesome

249704900.name: Beautiful beach
249704900.author: a TripAdvisor user
249704900.reviewBody: Quiet and wonderful to swim, but totally full of locals, so we were unable to swim.   Lots of restaurants, vendors and taxi cabs tot ake you there and back.

249647111.name: What fresh hell is this?
249647111.author: a TripAdvisor user
249647111.reviewBody: Way too crowded, no hammocks.  Too many vendors.  No comfort.  Pina Coladas at 15 dollars.  No reason to return.

248790448.name: The most crowded beach
248790448.author: a TripAdvisor user
248790448.reviewBody: This beach is very nice for snorkeling and with no waves.  The restaurants on that beach are very bad and expensive. Its a very popular beach and its always crowded.

248358443.name: A+ Snorkeling at La Entrega
248358443.author: a TripAdvisor user
248358443.reviewBody: Great White Sand Beach with decent restaurants. The main attraction here is the snorkeling. The entire cove is Black Coral and Rock Reef lined. Many different species can be spotted. I saw 3 Eagle Rays and a variety of tropical fish. Super clear warm water.\nHighly recommend for a leisurely simple dive.

248271549.name: Even a "chicken" can snorkel!
248271549.author: a TripAdvisor user
248271549.reviewBody:
Have no shame in admitting that when it comes to snorkelling I'm a chicken, so when we arrived here I was delighted to see they have the floaters with the viewing window which allowed me to accompany my husband and daughter as they snorkelled. 

We were dropped off by Arturo at this restaurant, introduced to the owner, shown to a table, and were given instructions what to do with our stuff and how to contact him when we ready to leave. We really were able to leave our stuff (towels and sandals) at our table and left our camera and other valuables with the restaurant owner, and it really was waiting for us when we were done. Really!! (The bathroom was pretty nice too.)

We rented our gear ($7.50ea), got the best guide, Willie ($25) and had a great time. Since my husband and I are relative newcomers to this activity, Willie very patiently explained every detail we needed to know and was very helpful explaining and showing us the different fish we saw. He took our safety seriously and for that we're very thankful and most appreciative. 

To celebrate this great morning we had drinks and snacks, portions are huge, very tasty and the service was good. Yes, they did add the tip to the bill, though we tipped what we felt was right. Yes, there are vendors but they were friendly and polite. 

We went on a Sunday morning, a good time for us to go as it wasn't that busy. As we left it got considerably busier with more tourists, Mexican families and boaters. What a great morning!

246621633.name: snorkel
246621633.author: a TripAdvisor user
246621633.reviewBody: decent place, just annoyed, with all the vendors. don\'t go to the restaurants that are straight ahead as you get there, venture to the right or left a ways and you wont be bothered as much

245988095.name: Spot for skorkeling, and that\u00b4s it
245988095.author: a TripAdvisor user
245988095.reviewBody:
I been here so many times,since 1994, but now I think is quite different, so if you are new aboard in Huatulco as a foreign turist this may help you:
-Really good place to stay couple of hours and have some snorkeling
-It is a public beach, but it is "controlled" by the restaurant owners, and other "service guys"
--they will insist you to rent a spot for your stuff or have a place to have some beer of food, 
it is not cheap, not expensive, if you bring USD o punds or euros will be cheap place,
--double check the bill, they will try to  you something else for your order or include a sustantive tip.
--If you bring your car , try to arrive early or parking lot will be packed.
--Do not take any valuables over there, it is "safe" but I saw a pickpocket running with some lady properties (camera and purse).
--They will try to rent from snorkeling mask, boards, velts, and more (around 75 MXN)

-From Santa Cruz to la Entrega a driver cab will charge you 54 MXN one way,
-still there is some colorfull fish diving few meters away from you
-Exchange rate is pretty bad, so try to go first to the ATM and get MXN instead pay in USD , (you will lost 1/10 in every buck)
-It is prettty crowded in weekend , and big average of people dump in the beach so (not educated people, mostly Mexican tourism) , not really funny , the local restaurant owners  try to keep it clean, but it is little dirty anyway.
-The not good point is, if you want to go just trying to get some sun tan and quiet day, this is not the place, from restaurant owners insisting you to buy a lot of things to acuatic sport rent boys ...will encourage to leave... for another paceful place
-Be aware of  fares for "banana" , acuatic motorcycle, arrange it in advance in MXN, otherwise this guys will try to charge a lot more instead after you run the ride, and they will sorrund you to "intimidate", there is no police nearby, and sometimes it is worst ... navy guards are the only safe security people, check your money back when you pay, they tend to make bad accounting , always in theirs benefit.
So sorry to see this change...

So as I mentioned used to be a very nice spot, not anymore, is almost as Acapulco : crowded, quite contaminated  and a lot of people trying to sell something.

If you are in later January of early Febraury will be ok.

245873034.name: Snorkelling
245873034.author: a TripAdvisor user
245873034.reviewBody: Great snorkelling!  Take a taxi and go early before cruise ships arrive.  Pay small fee for a guide (well worth it). He will take you where you wouldn\'t venture on your own.  We got to hold starfish and puffer fish.  Feed small fish using clams.  Did not like aggressive restaurant owners vying for your business as soon as you get there.  Don\'t take any valuables as this is a public beach.  \n

243378801.name: Fun snorkeling!!
243378801.author: a TripAdvisor user
243378801.reviewBody: lots of aquatic life to see, bring your own snorkel gear to huatulco to save you the cost of renting a set and also to eliminate the risk of using any potentially contaminated snorkles, flippers or masks.\nJust a heads up.

242799082.name: Beautiful bay in Huatulco
242799082.author: a TripAdvisor user
242799082.reviewBody: I wrote about this bay earlier in regards to Huatulco. It was a delightfully restful haven for us on a hot day in November when we were there. Be sure to make this a stop if you get to Huatulco!

214858695.name: Beautiful!
214858695.author: a TripAdvisor user
214858695.reviewBody: Loved the beach, so calm!  The not so rough waves allowed my son to enjoy the beach, almost felt like a pool.

212007198.name: better beach in huatulco
212007198.author: a TripAdvisor user
212007198.reviewBody: less tourists, more locals better for snorkeling\nnevertheless lacking the infrastructure of cancun which is my favorite beach

210787791.name: Swim and Snorkel in the beautiful Ocean
210787791.author: a TripAdvisor user
210787791.reviewBody:
Had the opportunity to enjoy this beach thru the Cruise line I was on.  This was a Snorkel/Ocean Discovery, Cave tour.
When we arrived at the beach we received our snorkeling gear and went in the ocean.  This was my 2nd time in my life snorkeling, I am so glad I overcame this fear because there is SO SO much to see.  You wear a life jacket so you are safe.  Our guides took us out for over an hour (the tour was 3 hours and I didn't wear a watch swimming, so it was hard to tell how much time we actually snorkeled but it was enough)   The guide would keep diving down deep stirring up the fish and sometimes brought up something unique to show us, like a sponge.  The colors of the fish in this area are breath taking.  We went to the cave which is not really an enclosed cave,  you swim thru a narrow gap and then it opens up so you are in an opening with real high walls, but you can see the sky.  I guess that is where the bats go in the evening.
Well after a GREAT snorkel, we went up the beach and there are restaurants, or tables to sit at and enjoy a meal and beer.  There are souvenir shops and people walking around trying to sell stuff.  
After a much needed rest we headed back to the pier.  The views while driving to and from the beach are AWESOME.  The guides parked and let us take pictures.  I have some nice pictures of our cruise ship from way up high in Huatulco.
I would love to visit this city and beach again on my own, when I can do more exploring.  My only other regret, is that I didn't have an underwater camera.  Next time !!!

205735086.name: Cool beach
205735086.author: a TripAdvisor user
205735086.reviewBody: Nice beach full of locals hanging out!  Beach bars line the beach at average or above average price due to the fact they can charge you for the eats and drinks close to Crucecita  and Santa Cruz.  Weekends are crazy busy with locals on vacation.  Water was clean and warm....great for snorkel and swimming! So hot you had to run to the water as the sand was soooo hot.  Only went here once during the week.....just too busy for our liking.  Vendors were present in good numbers here as well.  Must see once.

205374471.name: Good Snorkeling
205374471.author: a TripAdvisor user
205374471.reviewBody: We were on a HAL cruise and Huatulco was one of our ports.  We decided to go snorkeling on our own instead of taking an expensive excursion.  It was great!  Took a taxi there.  Cheap.  We got there early and there was hardly anyone else there.  We snorkeled a couple hours before the snorkel excursion people arrived.  There were tons of places to eat and drink.  It was a great inexpensive day.  SO if you like to snorkel don\'t waste your money on an excursion when you can do it on your own for next to nothing.

203387915.name: Loved the snorkelling!
203387915.author: a TripAdvisor user
203387915.reviewBody: I loved snorkelling here. Crystal, clear blue water and sea-doos and boats to rent as well. Lots of restaurants to choose from.

200991931.name: Great beach
200991931.author: a TripAdvisor user
200991931.reviewBody: Great beach for snorkeling and swimming. But beware the vendors if you are trying to eat. They come up to your tables constantly, even if you say no gracias many times, they keep,coming back. We enjoyed the beach but the vendors are annoying.

197438793.name: Great beach for young families
197438793.author: a TripAdvisor user
197438793.reviewBody: This was the third beach we\'ve tried in Hualtuco and our favorite so far as a young family.  The water is shallow and the waves aren\'t very big so our almost 3 year old was very comfortable in the water.  Most of the families at the beach were Mexican families.  Unlike the other beaches we\'ve visited so far in the area, these were the first to have a few trees on the beach where we were able to pitch our beach tent and get a bit of shade which meant we could spend longer at the beach in the heat.

195547407.name: Good snorkeling...
195547407.author: a TripAdvisor user
195547407.reviewBody: There is a live coral reef in a protected swimming area with decent visability and fair sample of fish. There are several beach side snack shops with protection from the sun and food. Inexpensive taxi ride from the area resorts - the negative is there is no sun protection except in the snack shops so be prepared for hot beach without palappas or umbrellas.

195256714.name: Off the beaten path
195256714.author: a TripAdvisor user
195256714.reviewBody: We rode scooters to this area and found it delightful. Mostly local enjoying their day.Very nice beach with choices of food and drink.Good snorkeling.

194318129.name: Mental - an attack on your senses but amazing to see local families enjoying the beach
194318129.author: a TripAdvisor user
194318129.reviewBody: We went to Play La Entrega on our first day in Huatulco. I wanted to eat but I also wanted to just jump straight into the sea so we went to one of the few beaches that could be accessed by road & that had services. When we arrived we were hounded by numerous restaurant touts & it was totally overwhelming. But we found a nice quiet place to eat and had delicious grilled fish, and the hassle died down. It was still the xmas holiday period and the beach was full of Mexican families. I was really endeared by the family groups with their picnics and the mixture of children and grandchildren frollicking in the shore (with the obligatory life jackets on). Despite it being ram packed it was totally charming, They also serve fresh oysters along the beach.

191391413.name: Fantastic Snorkelling!
191391413.author: a TripAdvisor user
191391413.reviewBody: Fish were many and varied.  Colorful coral reef.  Warm, calm waters. After snorkelling the Great Barrier Reef last year, we weren\'t expecting much, and were pleasantly surprised!\n\nHave our own equipment, so took a cab from our resort (Las Brisas). $10US for the cab ride each way total, for the 4 of us.

190888277.name: Snorkeling was fabulous!
190888277.author: a TripAdvisor user
190888277.reviewBody: This is the perfect place for the beginner.  The water was incredibly clear and calm.  The abundance and variety of fish was amazing!\n

188898890.name: Snorkeling just ok
188898890.author: a TripAdvisor user
188898890.reviewBody: sorry folks, having snorkeled in lots of places around the world, this one ranks as just ok...the corral is being depleted rapidly and the authorities need to do something to stop its erosion. The fish were plentiful and colorful, we saw a couple of nicely large schools that were simply beautiful in the very clean and clear waters...also given the nature of this bay, the water is typically calm so safe for many levels of swimmers...a very fun experience but I am just trying to manage expectations for those who read other\'s writings using superlatives...if in area, well worth a visit...

188612528.name: The best snorkeling on earth
188612528.author: a TripAdvisor user
188612528.reviewBody: This could be one the earths most beautiful places to dive and snorkel. The views were amazing!!! Great fish and sea life. The reef is spectacular. The people were so friendly and helpful making our day perfect.

187980050.name: For fans of snorkeling
187980050.author: a TripAdvisor user
187980050.reviewBody: You\'ll find a lot of folks snorkeling here. The beach is lined with restaurants serving local foods and drinks. Fishing tours can also be chartered directly at lower prices than from the hotels. The beach is wide and the water is calm. Also a favourite for the locals if you like to experience the real deal.

187930188.name: Fishing village
187930188.author: a TripAdvisor user
187930188.reviewBody: We took a boat to get here.  Very nice protected bay.  The snorkelling is suppose to be the best . Very calm waters n fish in the reef.  If you go remember to barter for food n drink.  If we had more time , we would have gone for a swim.

185589101.name: Fun Afternoon at the Beach
185589101.author: a TripAdvisor user
185589101.reviewBody: Our family look a small boat from the harbour in Santa Cruz to La Entrega. We sat under an umbrella on the beach and went snorkelling. The children played in the sand with their pail and shovells. The beach had a nice atmosphere. Lovely views from the beach as well. We look a taxi back to our hotel.

180164012.name: excellent beach for swimming and snorkeling
180164012.author: a TripAdvisor user
180164012.reviewBody: Beautiful bay, excellent for swimming and snorkeling, it is wonderful for small kids\n\nit is goregeous in low season, otherwise it could be very crowded, too many vendors.

173170984.name: Beautiful Bay , good snorkeling but too many opportunists !!
173170984.author: a TripAdvisor user
173170984.reviewBody:
Was recommended as something to see and enjoy but upon arrival there was little pleasant .
First there was a few people with a chair and rop across the road wanting a "donation od 20 pesos" , really ?  Was a nice scam that probably works on some . 
When we arrived to the parking lot same thing happening , people trying to sell you something and the squeeze for  more pesos ..Crowded as well ... stayed only a very short time as this is so not relaxing .. If this was Hawaii they would remove these people so quickly so travelers could enjoy this place minus the hassles .
Too bad  as the area and water is very nice ..

169348983.name: Too Crowded
169348983.author: a TripAdvisor user
169348983.reviewBody: Trying to get from the car is more work than going to work because of the number of vendors who are trying to sell you something.  The beach is gorgeous when empty, and the snorkeling is good for this area.  The vendors ruined it for me.

163394825.name: The restaurants are a bit pushy but the beach is fun
163394825.author: a TripAdvisor user
163394825.reviewBody: There are a number of restaurants here and they are all trying to get you into their seating so arrival is a bit hectic and pushy. They are polite, though and once you\'re seated somewhere, it\'s fine. The beach is clean with reasonable snorkeling. There are also Banada Boat rides and snorkeling guides for hire. You can also rent snorkeling gear and life jackets at the beach. There is no undertow so swimming is safe. Take in the miradors (viewpoints) on the way there as the views are spectacular.

160205853.name: Good to see
160205853.author: a TripAdvisor user
160205853.reviewBody: Crowded,busy, and unfortunately the day we arrived, TONS of jellyfish! The vendors compete for your business which can be annoying but understandable.  You should visit it just to see it.  The ride tot he beach is beautiful and a great look out point!

160125673.name: Calm beach with restaurants and some coral reefs
160125673.author: a TripAdvisor user
160125673.reviewBody: Can be crowded by locals during the weekend, and sadly much of the coral reefs are destroyed, but about 100 meters out on the left side there are some ok reefs with a lot of fish.

159379263.name: Always depends what you\'ve been looking for
159379263.author: a TripAdvisor user
159379263.reviewBody:
This beach is probably the most crowded one in Huatulco.... with everythings that comes with: people,vendors, restaurants, tour operators, snorkelling offers, jet ski rentals, boat rides etc etc....

For snorkeling it's one of the nicest ones in the Huatulco beaches. for relaxing.... probably the worst.

It's all a about perception and what people are looking for.

Yep I would go again for 2 reasons #1 snorkelling #2 fresh oysters directelly from the fisherman

158068915.name: Beautiful coral reefs!
158068915.author: a TripAdvisor user
158068915.reviewBody:
This beach is beautiful. Snorkelling would be my first choice in terms of what to do here. Equipment rental s $Mexican 50 plus anther 50 for a locker to stash your stuff. We hired a guide to take us out to the reefs and he was worth the m$150 for the hour. He took us to the areas of the reef where the aquatic life was simply teeming! He even dove into some of the coves to coax out the more timid creatures - 3 different coloured blowfish, starfish, huge oysters, clown fines and a few more I didn't know names of. 
He also pointed out different birds that were on siting on the rocks.

Food and drinks are a bit pricey, and the vendors are very pushy.

157436731.name: Hypothermia in Huatulco!
157436731.author: a TripAdvisor user
157436731.reviewBody: Arrived in Huatulco by sea, a pretty resort with nine bays, popular by virtue of its close proximity to Mexico City.  We got a taxi (USD5) from the jetty to La Entrega Beach where one can leave one\'s belonging with one of the beach bars for the price of a beer.  Being Sunday the beach was packed.  We had taken our snorkel gear because this beach has a small offshore reef and is popular with divers and snorkellers for this reason, but we found the water to be very cold and didn\'t in fact snorkel at all.

155297545.name: Another great beach in Huatulco
155297545.author: a TripAdvisor user
155297545.reviewBody: Another great beach for snorkeling and swimming. You can get a massage at the end of the beach for $25.00 or eat at one of the many restaurants along the beach. A short $2.50 cab ride.

155204007.name: Packed!
155204007.author: a TripAdvisor user
155204007.reviewBody: Too many people, no waves and basically it was people soup! yucky. There was alot of vendors if you like that, which I do, but I just couldn\'t stand all the people

155008297.name: Snorkeling Bay
155008297.author: a TripAdvisor user
155008297.reviewBody: When we went there were a lot of jellyfish, got stung numerous times! Have snorkeled before and never experienced this!  Wasn\'t impressed.

154745523.name: Ok Beach
154745523.author: a TripAdvisor user
154745523.reviewBody: Our biggest problem overall in Huatulco was the lack of shade. That being said we went her because of the restaurants palapas to have shade. We ended up at La Entrega restaurant. Waiter was very nice and attentive. The bathrooms were super clean and had seats. The food was good but expensive even by American standards. The beach was nice and very calm the day we were there. Worth going for snorkling. Many vendors but not pushy. Good beach for children since there was no undertow.

154191394.name: Fantastic
154191394.author: a TripAdvisor user
154191394.reviewBody: The water here is so beautiful and warm.  We went here twice during our stay and had a fantastic time both times.  The fish were very pretty.

154122199.name: Underwhelming and overpriced
154122199.author: a TripAdvisor user
154122199.reviewBody: Spent a few hours here for snorkelling and snacks because it was close. Didn\'t so much mind how busy it was, but the day we were there the waves were strong and there wasn\'t much for fish. My mother-in-law scraped up her knee coming in. And we were overcharged on our snacks. I\'d try somewhere else next time for a day trip.

153482745.name: Good snorkelling, easy access by cab
153482745.author: a TripAdvisor user
153482745.reviewBody: Second only to San Augustin imo. Reefs at far end from where the taxi drops you off, and taxis usually available to go back at end of day.

153153010.name: On our "must do" list
153153010.author: a TripAdvisor user
153153010.reviewBody: We are returning to Huatulco for the third year running and wouldn\'t dream of missing a trip or two to La Entrega. We love the snorkeling and have seen a huge variety of fish and live coral. What I really appreciate now, after having snorkeled in many other places, is that we always see lots of fish, we don\'t need to go on an expensive boat trip ($5 taxi ride and a short swim) and the water is calm, clean and warm.  The beachside service is friendly and laid back, the food is great (we share the shrimp 4x4) and the beer is ice cold. As others have said, go early to avoid the busier afternoons.  We have had the beach to ourselves by doing so. My favourite restaurant there is the simply named La Entrega. Buy some nuts or plantains from the hard working vendors.

152346916.name: Great Beach for Swimming
152346916.author: a TripAdvisor user
152346916.reviewBody: No undertow, and lots of activities. According to our cabbie, this is the beach the locals attend on their days off. Lots of small restaurants to get food and drinks. Snorkling, banana boats, and boat trips. Tip: you have to pay to use the public washroom, but all the little restaurants have their own bathrooms.

151762186.name: Great snorkelling!
151762186.author: a TripAdvisor user
151762186.reviewBody: Lovely cove near Santa Cruz, Huatulco.  Snorkelling right from the beach, clear water and lots of fish.  Snorkel gear available to rent for 50 pesos.  Restaurants on beach, enjoyed the guacamole, pescadillos.  Shower available for 10 pesos.

151352827.name: Good Snorkelling, Honest People
151352827.author: a TripAdvisor user
151352827.reviewBody: We went to this beach in early February 2013. It was some kind of Mexican holiday and we expected the beach to be busy. We went pretty early in the morning (around 9). It was a 54 peso ($4.50 or so CDN) cab ride from Chahue (same from Santa Cruz). Guys at Bogarts stopped us and said, hey drop your stuff here, go diving and come back if you like. They were great. We dove for about an hour and a half. All our stuff was there when we came back. We had to look for our guy to order our beers. Beers were 30 pesos. Snorkelling was pretty good, we were early so visibility was really good. lots of fish, alll in all a great inexpensive morning. Current is not a factor, and any ability of swimmer can dive here.\nI would recommend this for families or couples, pretty much anyone. We had our own snorkel stuff so cannot comment on whether or not there is stuff there to rent. Beach at  end by concrete pier is really suitable for small kids. Sand bottom and gradual slope. Rest of beach has sudden drop off, so you go from standing to over your head very quickly.

149396220.name: The beach
149396220.author: a TripAdvisor user
149396220.reviewBody: Great beach. The locals go there which is nice to mingle with them. Great snorkeling for sure and would go again

148739239.name: Good snorkling
148739239.author: a TripAdvisor user
148739239.reviewBody: The main beach was very crowded but if you swam to the small beach opposite the main it was great.  Lots of coral and many good sized fish-more than we saw on 4 scuba dives.  Good place to spend an afternoon

148287525.name: Always enjoyable
148287525.author: a TripAdvisor user
148287525.reviewBody:
We always enjoy going to La Entrega. 
The snorkeling is generally great. Pretty coral colors. Great variety of fish.
This time, they have roped off some areas to protect the environment now.
Doesn't seem to matter what restaurant we chose to sit in. The staff bring beer or food when we want. In fact, we often have to look for them as they do not push you to order. 
We're always surprised how few visitors make their way to this beach.  Cab ride is reasonable from hotels and there are always cabs waiting to take you back.
We always enjoy stopping at a couple of view points on the way up too. Great views!

145037612.name: Very pretty place a must do.
145037612.author: a TripAdvisor user
145037612.reviewBody:
I rented snorkle gear for under 4$ saw lots of fish corals and swam into a very cool cave relaxed on beach. 

We also ate at Bogarts cheap great food service.
You can also rent Sea doos, banana boats fishing boats, so much to do. 
There are some vendors selling things yummy home made snacks etc.
Never got sick water in hotel great and all over i drank water i was fine my hubby too.

143927205.name: Great snorkeling
143927205.author: a TripAdvisor user
143927205.reviewBody: Great snorkeling and cheap rentals.  You should pay no more than 50 pesos at the stand at the end of the beach and the rent lockers.  The restaurants are very expensive but the people are very pushy with tourists, but is is a close 10 minute drive from Huatulco.

141886011.name: Best beach for snorkeling and swimming
141886011.author: a TripAdvisor user
141886011.reviewBody: Nice little restaurant and bar area -- accessible by local taxi from area hotels.  Sandy beach, great coral and lots of fish.

136103557.name: Crowded but decent snorkeling from the beach
136103557.author: a TripAdvisor user
136103557.reviewBody: Nice schools of fish, a little coral. You can rent equipment and lockers for a few dollars. So crowded -- I don\'t think I\'ve ever seen so many people on one beach. A nice option if you want to go snorkeling on your own, though the snorkeling at San Augustin was better (they stop there for lunch on the bay tour).

136045964.name: Scuba diving
136045964.author: a TripAdvisor user
136045964.reviewBody: Find a guy name Richard, went scuba diving here. great place. First time scuba diving at this place. Safe and beautiful.

134623161.name: Great place to spend a morning
134623161.author: a TripAdvisor user
134623161.reviewBody: This was the perfect place for us inexperienced snorklers.  Upon arrival by taxi the restaurant owners will greet you and lead you to their establishment, where they will serve you good snacks and cold drinks and watch your belongings.  We like to go early in the morning before the tours start, it is way less busy in the morning.  Great beach as well.

133174913.name: Nothing special despite reputation
133174913.author: a TripAdvisor user
133174913.reviewBody: La Entrega Beach was nothing special despite its reputation as a secluded beach and having good snorkeling. The truth is it takes about 25 minutes by taxi with no traffic to get there from La Crucecita, but it is just on the other side of Santa Cruz beach (in fact, you can see Santa Cruz\'s cruise ship pier from La Entrega). This, by my standards, is not secluded. Also, there is quite a bit of infrastructure in place: a palapa and paved parking lot at the entrance, a strip of restaurants and boats for tours and water sports. In terms of snorkeling, it\'s good because the water is clean, clear and calm, but the coral is dead (they\'re all white) and the variety of fish is small. Still, if all you want to do is cool off in the water and hang out with family, it\'s not a bad place for that.

132728631.name: A great beach to go to if you have children.
132728631.author: a TripAdvisor user
132728631.reviewBody: Many of the beaches in Bah\u00edas de Huatulco are not very kid friendly: there are strong undercurrents in some, the ground is very steep in most. We were told La Entrega was perfect for us as we had an 8 year old with us, so we went. It really was perfect.\n\nLa Entrega is a very closed bay so the water is truly calm. It was like a huge pool.  The water is very clear, it\'s rather transparent. There are no hotels, just a bunch of palapa restaurants, you can sit at one and keep your stuff there all day long, they don\'t care if you take half the day without ordering anything (you always end up having at least a drink though).  You can also rent scuba diving equipment and go for a dive to watch the fish. I didn\'t do it, but I did see a couple of fish swimming past us, very beautiful.  We had a lovely day! Got there around 8, ate there, left around 1 pm when the crowds were coming.  There is no way to avoid the endless parade of people wanting to sell you crafts, temp. tattoos, braids, etc. that we have in every beach in Mexico, but here they were fewer than in most.

131678942.name: Beautiful Bay
131678942.author: a TripAdvisor user
131678942.reviewBody: The pineapple meal is AMAZING, the water is crystal clear and the different vendors and restaurants are awesome!

128600344.name: Fun and easy to get to
128600344.author: a TripAdvisor user
128600344.reviewBody: We spent an afternoon sipping beers and snorkeling at La Entrega.  We grabbed a cab for roughly $12 from Secrets and tood advantage of a beach bar which will give you a place to sit in the shade in exchange for buying a couple of beers.  A fun place full of locals

127164450.name: Great spot for a swim!
127164450.author: a TripAdvisor user
127164450.reviewBody: Nice spot for a swim and good restaurants.  Keep your eye on the bill, to avoid an over charge.  Would definitely go back.

126814420.name: Worth a trip for the novice
126814420.author: a TripAdvisor user
126814420.reviewBody: I enjoyed seeing the reef.  I am told it is a bit plain for avid divers but I loved it and the sites.

126464807.name: Great Snorkelling
126464807.author: a TripAdvisor user
126464807.reviewBody: Great reefs, loads of colourful fish and we had fun watching the cormorants diving to tray and catch the fish. Cheap equipment rentals and good food and drink all along teh beach - nothing to dislike really

126142846.name: Favourite day trip spot for a snorkel and lunch
126142846.author: a TripAdvisor user
126142846.reviewBody: This is by far our favourite place to snorkel and grab lunch in Huatulco.  We set up for the day at Los Flores and they watch your stuff for you for "free".  You re-pay them by buying some cervesa or some lunch.  We love the shrimp here!  This way you can have a table in the shade for the day and if you want sun you can take their chairs out to the beach.  This time our waiter even set us up with a snorkel guide who works for tips.  He took us out for about 45 min.  He brought us a blow fish to touch, dove down with us to check out lobster and showed us the cave.  We paid him $200 each for 2 of us which is about $33 CDN.  The snorkel area here is larger than Maguey and the waves are much calmer.  Great place for families or couples.  You can also just settle in on a peice of beach by yourself and not spend a dime. \nFor taxi\'s the prices are set.  Each hotel has it\'s own rate but the local taxi\'s are almost 50% cheaper so grab a \'radio taxi\' if possible.  From Las Brisas we just walked up the hill to the highway and grabbed one of the many taxi\'s that drive by.  You can make arrangements for that driver to come back and get you at your price or pay for the La Entrega taxi to make your way back to your resort.  The La Entrega taxi\'s are cheaper than the hotel taxi\'s but more expensive than the \'radio taxi\'.\nNo trip to Huatulco is complete without a trip to La Entrega!  Enjoy!

126105313.name: Cool place to check out.
126105313.author: a TripAdvisor user
126105313.reviewBody: We jumped in a cab from our resort and for 100 pesos we were at the beach.  We went on a Saturday to ckeck out the snorkelling at the beach.  This is very much a hangout for the locals to cool off on a hot weekend day.  They have rental equipment available if you don\'t have your own.  I can be truthfull that we were the only 12 non-Mexican people there for most of the day.  They have 16 little restaurants on site for a drink or something to eat.  We weren\'t sure where to leave our belonging while we were out in the water but we were assured by the staff that we could leave them on a table and that they would watch it for us.  When we returned from snorkelling they actually had a staff member watching over our table.  Fantastic service!!  I would recommend going here anyday and enjoy some time with the local area residents.  It was one of our coolest experiences to get off the resort and spend the day with the locals.

125779449.name: ...great beach...
125779449.author: a TripAdvisor user
125779449.reviewBody: We had a great time snorkeling here.  We were guided the first two times and then we were on our own.  We had several meals in a couple of the cabanas that lined the beach.  Truly enjoyable.

125615475.name: Great for families
125615475.author: a TripAdvisor user
125615475.reviewBody: Especially good for families with kids who want to snorkel as the snorkeling area is marked off with buoys so the kids won\'t go too far astray.  Good food at a variety of restaurants, can rent snorkelling gear for a reasonable price.

125342717.name: best fresh fish I\'ve ever had
125342717.author: a TripAdvisor user
125342717.reviewBody: This is a great place to people watch and enjoy the ocean. The fish we had was the best ever. It was so wonderful to see the Mexican people who were also on holiday enjoy the ocean like it was a rare and beautiful thing. It made me feel such joy.

125239149.name: EXCELLENT  Beach
125239149.author: a TripAdvisor user
125239149.reviewBody: Great food and restaurants .. fabulous snorkelling ..equipment can be rented here for use at other beaches on the  Bays tour

124925158.name: Good snorkeling
124925158.author: a TripAdvisor user
124925158.reviewBody:
We snorkelled at 3 different areas on our trip and of the areas accessible by taxi La Entrega was the best.  There is a large patch of live coral off to the left (just in front of the little beach you will see on the left) and the water was pretty clear.  We were taken to La Entrega restaurant by our taxi driver - the owner got us snorkel gear for half the price of anywhere else, the food was good and we were not charged a "sitting" fee and they have thier own bathroom.  I highly recomend this beach restaurant. 

We also snorkled at Maguey Bay- pea soup conditions and only one little patch of live coral.  Plus the snorkel gear was the usual 100 pesos AND the restaurant we parked ourselves at (and bought food we didn't really want) charge us 100 pesos "umbrella charge" which he most certainly didn't mention when he dragged us in from the parking lot. I don't remember the name of the place but it was in the middle.  There is lots of beach to park your stuff on if you are not in need of shade.  And have 5 pesos for the bathroom. 

We did take a 9 bay boat tour that took us to San Augustin and the bay next to it for snorkelling-  if you are mainly going for the snorkelling make sure you get a boat that is going to San Augustin! It was clear and beautiful out there. AND we saw whales, dolphins and turtles on the trip back to Santa Cruz.

124833589.name: Great Beach to Visit
124833589.author: a TripAdvisor user
124833589.reviewBody:
We visited this beach frequently during our recent stay.   Our personal choice is to visit places where the visitors are diverse (both tourists and locals).  We enjoyed people watching, snorkeling and swimming.   The surf is calm and the water is warm.  We met many nice people from the US, Canada and Mexico during our visits here.

There are numerous restaraunts on the beach but our personal favorite was La Entrega Restaraunt.   Great food!  Great service.  

You never know what you will encounter when you visit this beach.   Some days it was quite crowded and a few days there were very few visitors.  

It is a short ($54 peso) taxi ride to the beach.  The sand is soft and the water was generally clear.

If you are looking for a calm beach close to both Santa Cruz and La Cruicetia I recommend you visit this beach.

124673165.name: GREAT SNORKLING
124673165.author: a TripAdvisor user
124673165.reviewBody: Avery busy but beautiful beach. Lots of snorking to do and places to eat.Try out the resturant langosto gordo or fat lobster. Very good red snapper

124447372.name: swim and enjoy
124447372.author: a TripAdvisor user
124447372.reviewBody: been snorkeling here for almost 5 years...very safe waters and always see new types of fish...have some food and drink and enjoy the beach

123013745.name: nice beach, way too much boats
123013745.author: a TripAdvisor user
123013745.reviewBody: La entrega is a really cool beach, calm with no waves, just perfect if you have small children. However when I went it was full of boats, fishers and tourist boats. It was really unconfortable to swim between the boats and we just went to another beach cos I didn\'t like this situation. another thing I didn\'t like was the restaunrants near the beach, they are really expensive and not so hygienically correct, I got sick of eating there some fish (which was really expensive)

122039341.name: Okay beach.
122039341.author: a TripAdvisor user
122039341.reviewBody: We went to La Entrega on our first day in Huatulco and while it\'s a very pretty beach with calm waters and a rocky shore to snorkel and explore, the day we went had MANY jellyfish eggs floating in the water making it an unpleasant experience. The eggs did not hurt or sting us in any way, they were just there floating in the water. It was impossible to swim without bumping them as there were so many. This may have been a temporary situation, but worth noting if that kind of thing bothers you. We enjoyed the seafood in the restaurant and decided to swim anyway, eggs and all.

121989029.name: Busy beach
121989029.author: a TripAdvisor user
121989029.reviewBody: we went to this beach on the weekend at the start of the Holiday season. Don\'t go at that time of year unless you like a very busy beach. It is good for swimming and snorkeling with lots of places to eat and have a few. Not a tanning beach

121283452.name: Good snorkelling
121283452.author: a TripAdvisor user
121283452.reviewBody: Playa Entrega is a good spot for snorkelling. But the water visibilty varies considerably - sometimes great, sometimes poor. The water is cold, esp. if you are out there for a couple of hours- so you may find you need to layer. There are places to rent gear and some vendors have lockers if you want to store your wallet etc. Lots of restaurants and - up on the hill you can get a massage after a long swim. Watch for the area where the boats and jet skis moor, don\'t set up near there.

120348604.name: Good Beach for Snorkelilng
120348604.author: a TripAdvisor user
120348604.reviewBody: This was the most populated beach we visited in Huatulco.  As you walk up locals run up to you wanting you to go to their beachfront restaurants, etc.  But if you wish to rent flippers, mask etc and snorkel in calm water, this is the beach to go to.  A mask, snorkel, flippers, boogie board and life vest rents for about $7 American (total).

115657675.name: Quite an Experience
115657675.author: a TripAdvisor user
115657675.reviewBody:
On our visit to Huatulco in March 2011 we had an opportunity to make a trip to La Entegra beach for a snorkel outing.   We took a cab from the hotel zone -- it was rougly 75 pesos.  On arrival we found there was quite a crowd of locals who were more than willing to help with the experience, offering everything from a guide for the day to pack mule.   We politely declined these offers, but one fellow would not part our sides, following us down the beach.   When he made an offer of "shade" we finally relented and agreed to his offer.   Our mistake was not confirming the price (*newbie error*).  Anyhow, we stayed for a little over 2 hours.   The snorkelling was great -- lots of fish, coral, rays, etc.    We really enjoyed it.  

As we were packing up to leave, our "host" approached us for payment.   We were astounded when he asked for 1000 pesos!   An attempt to negotiate was not successful.   This fellow was a crook.   Rather than risk a confrontation, we paid him and left.   A learning experience on our part!

Oh, one more thing.   There are bathrooms and showers -- but you have to PAY for this as well!

102941599.name: Good snorkeling, relaxing afternoon at the beach
102941599.author: a TripAdvisor user
102941599.reviewBody: Have been to Playa La Entrega several times; as other reviewers have mentioned, it can get pretty crowded.  This time we happened to luck out, and it was pretty deserted all day.  The snorkeling is pretty good -- you can rent equipment for 50 pesos for the day and also a guide if you wish.  The day we were there, tho, the water was a little cold.  They like to hustle you the minute you get out of the cab to take you to their restaurant; we just act like we know where we\'re going and pick whichever one has the nicest beach area in front of it.  Most of the restaurants serve pretty much the same thing and prices are usually the same.  Water is very calm, which makes it very popular for little kids and the non-swimmer.

94520437.name: great snorkeling but go early
94520437.author: a TripAdvisor user
94520437.reviewBody: This snorkeling beach has some beautiful views of islands and some little restaurants to eat at, with good, easy snorkeling and amazingly clear water. It is a common stop for many tours, however, so gets quite crowded by noon, and all the boats and groups of people really detract from the pleasure. Check out other, less-used beaches, or get here early.

641853429.name: Stunning
641853429.author: a TripAdvisor user
641853429.reviewBody: Another stop while on our hired boat.  Incredible!  Pristine beach, garbage cans and recycle cans located far up from the beach and other than that, just nothing but beach and beautiful ocean.  Did not want to get out of the water it was so warm and clear!  We saw turtle tracks going up from the beach but left alone in case there was a turtle laying eggs and didn\'t want to disturb.  Such a worthwhile stop, you will be amazed!

632055916.name: Beautiful Beach
632055916.author: a TripAdvisor user
632055916.reviewBody: Beautiful beach and a nice swim snorkel location. If you do the 7 bay tour you will stop here. Wish there was more shade to hide from the sun when you need a break. Got busier as more tour boats arrive but worth the trip.

604293488.name: Dream of a beach
604293488.author: a TripAdvisor user
604293488.reviewBody: Gorgeous swimming, snorkeling, and unspoiled beach.  Did  not want to come out of the water.  Best swim of my life.

550497769.name: Stunning private bay
550497769.author: a TripAdvisor user
550497769.reviewBody: This natural beach is pristine - even untended, there is virtually no garbage brought by the tide.  Safe swimming; sign of turtles on the beach.

548762756.name: Like a Heavenly Dream
548762756.author: a TripAdvisor user
548762756.reviewBody: We booked a Bahias tour with Para\u00edso Huatulco offered at our Hotel Villablanca.  This company caters mostly to Spanish-speaking tourists, though our guide Lamberto ("they call me \'Lambie\' " ) is also English-speaking, and made us (the only non-Mexicans on the boat) feel particularly welcome, being an expert host.\n\nThis Bay was our first stop, and it was truly paradise.  Snorkeler\'s delight.  Water was perfect for swimming during our stop.  Drinks on the beach.  Unforgettable.

492559046.name: Not what I expected
492559046.author: a TripAdvisor user
492559046.reviewBody: This bay was part of the 7 bay tour run through Amstar.  The water was warm and beautiful (a little choppy due to recent storm) but there is no shade and you are virtually attacked by people who want to sell you shade, water, jewelry etc no matter how many times you say no thank you.

463279066.name: one week holiday
463279066.author: a TripAdvisor user
463279066.reviewBody: Arrived by boat. I thought the beach was beautiful with its white clean sandy beach. Its surrounded by undeveloped natural habitat.

445991713.name: Amazing beach
445991713.author: a TripAdvisor user
445991713.reviewBody: Beautiful beach only can be reached by boat or long walk, there are not services, but I absolutely recommend to visit

360543671.name: Wow, beautiful!
360543671.author: a TripAdvisor user
360543671.reviewBody: One of the nicest beaches we\'ve ever seen. Sure hope someone in government never caves and allows a resort to be developed here. This is pure eye candy.

341001353.name: Amazing, beautiful little secluded beach
341001353.author: a TripAdvisor user
341001353.reviewBody: Great stop on the bay tour! You can rent an umbrella for shade under the sun and some locals sell coconuts and beers. If you rent snorkeling gear before you get on the boat to this beach, you won\'t regret it, lots of ocean life!

325984945.name: Snorkel
325984945.author: a TripAdvisor user
325984945.reviewBody: Very nice beach and sand.  Only a couple of vendors here.  Went on a tour and did snorkeling which was very nice.

257956543.name: Not my favorite
257956543.author: a TripAdvisor user
257956543.reviewBody: The sand is very soft. It is hard to walk on. The currents are very strong so I didn\'t like this beach.  You are fighting the whole time in the water. The view is stunning. The least favorite of the seven bays

195342771.name: Good snorkelling, but strong current
195342771.author: a TripAdvisor user
195342771.reviewBody: This was a great beach to snorkel at.  There is a very strong current that takes you out though, so be prepared for a long tiring swim back to the beach.  There is nothing here on this beach except for a few vendors that set up tents for the day.  No bathroom.

162956737.name: Great snorkeling
162956737.author: a TripAdvisor user
162956737.reviewBody: Although there is very little coral here, the rock faces are alive with a wide variety of fish so the snorkeling is very good. The water is warm and the beach pristine. The fish community is very active and a delight to watch. We even had a Manta Ray swim underneath us.

158248681.name: Another beautiful beach in Huatulco!
158248681.author: a TripAdvisor user
158248681.reviewBody: We visited chachacual as part of a boat tour of the Huatulco Bays. We had planned to do some snorkelling but unfortunately, water conditions weren\'t great on the day we were there. The water was cloudy, and we ended up just swimming to the beach. It\'s a beautiful beach, the sand s very fine and soft. The waves are quite strong and the ocean floor drops off quite suddenly. You need to be a strong swimmer to swim here. But if you just want to experience a nice long beach that doesn\'t have any palapas obstructing the view, this is the place.\n\nWe accessed this beach by boat, and I\'m not sure if it is accessible by land.

156540951.name: Amazingly gorgeous!
156540951.author: a TripAdvisor user
156540951.reviewBody: Snorkelled here with Pat and Javier from Hurricane Divers.  I HIGHLY recommend you get them for a fun tour of the bays!

130525929.name: veri nice place
130525929.author: a TripAdvisor user
130525929.reviewBody: chacahua is so nice about the all natural area and ecoturism

661113456.name: Combination of ecology and history
661113456.author: a TripAdvisor user
661113456.reviewBody: I went to this park with my sister and brother-in-law and spent an enjoyable morning touring the site and walking the trails. The historical aspect was very interesting, reminding me of Herculaneum in Italy, and the evological park, which surrounds the historical site was beautiful. It is a short taxi ride from thevresort where we stayed on Tangolundo bay.  Getting back turned out to be trickier, as our taxi did not turn up for the return journey, but the nice security guard helped us flag one down.

652978523.name: Beautiful Nature!
652978523.author: a TripAdvisor user
652978523.reviewBody: Interesting to see where the rivers meet the sea!  Love the views, walk, and flora and fauna that you can discover here!

635476881.name: Gain a Deeper Understanding of the Early Cultures of Copalita
635476881.author: a TripAdvisor user
635476881.reviewBody: An amazingly peaceful area with pre historic constructions; many of which are gradually being excavated. The setting is majical with the Copal trees and diverse ecosystems attracting butterflies and birds.  The museum is a modern, airy building containing many of the artifacts discovered during excavations.

635431839.name: A beautiful site with great views
635431839.author: a TripAdvisor user
635431839.reviewBody: This place is amazing - so clean and well laid-out. The sand had even been raked! Some great views, and bi-lingual signs around the trails. A nice museum, albeit with signs in Spanish only. I would give it a 5 if you could climb up onto the ruins.

631548859.name: \ud83c\udf34Place where Copal trees grow\ud83c\udf34
631548859.author: a TripAdvisor user
631548859.reviewBody:
If you are interested in nature, birds, Mexican culture and history this is the place to go. The Eco-Archaeological Park Copaita is huge 200.50 acres park. We took a taxi from our secret resort. You can also walk about 25-30 minutes to get there. 
but we recommend to use taxi because of the heat. There are English & Spanish tour guide. We wanted to go own pace so we didn’t hire them.  
The view from Del Rio is breathtaking!  Depends on your pace but you will get good 1:30-2hours beautiful nature walk. 
You will find many interesting tree and flowers. Even though mostly shade it, it’s very hot so you need a bottle of water. I wish I could read Spanish because there is no English translation in the museum. 
I highly recommend this beautiful  and educational place🦋

566149205.name: A great visit
566149205.author: a TripAdvisor user
566149205.reviewBody: Mario was our guide, and hiring him was well worth the money. We have since been to other larger archeological sites in Oaxaca but we learned and appreciated far more with him.

558305247.name: This should be #1 in Huatulco
558305247.author: a TripAdvisor user
558305247.reviewBody: This is a great two-hour activity involving hiking, archeology, botany and bird watching. Wonderful park site with newly discovered Aztec ruins.  The cost is 40 pesos per person and a guide is about 500 pesos. It is worth every peso. Our guide Mario took us on a two hour journey exploring the Aztec civilization. There is a great museum with artefacts as well. \n\nYou will not see this park in any of the tour guide operators\u2019 binders because the park has no budget for commissions or kickbacks.  However it was a 50 peso taxi ride from Secrets each way.

548878548.name: Great part of La Bocana
548878548.author: a TripAdvisor user
548878548.reviewBody: This park was excellent for Bird Watching. A variety of species inhabit this little area and it was fascinating being there close to sunrise. One thing though there are tiny flies that bite and unless you have some hydro-cortisone with lidacaine, it could leave you itchy for days afterwards.

524380680.name: A Growing Archaeological Gem
524380680.author: a TripAdvisor user
524380680.reviewBody:
This Park is trying to accomplish two things at the same time-

1) Archaeological site- The different uncovered structures are well marked in both English and Spanish and signs discuss the details about them.  You can see that they're continuing to uncover more and more of the ruins but even at my time of visit there was enough to see and look at.  
I don't think the $55 USD tour guide is worth it as you can get most all of the archaeological information in English from the signs.

2) Ecological park- The trails wind around and take you across multiple ecosystems where you can uncover different birds and animals and views.

482758104.name: Great Place If You Love Archeology
482758104.author: a TripAdvisor user
482758104.reviewBody: Very interesting Zapotec ruins and artifacts. The jaded skull found here was absolutely fascinating. I felt we got so much more out of this due to our guide as opposed to doing it on our own.

474377107.name: The Winners Were Killed
474377107.author: a TripAdvisor user
474377107.reviewBody: The winners of the ball games at this ancient site were the ones that were killed.  That\'s what our spot-on guide Mario told us.  He told us (family group of 6) lots of other interesting (if slightly less gruesome) things as well.  He was also a real pro at spotting local critters to stop and take a look at.  Tour took about two hours.  Beautiful grounds, superbly kept, gorgeous buildings and a very interesting place to spend some time.  After we left we all felt like we had learned something about the local culture and history.  Put down the margarita for an few hours (just a few hours...) and go check this place out.

473775650.name: Interesting Park
473775650.author: a TripAdvisor user
473775650.reviewBody: When looking to find a different experience, we chose the Archaeology & Ecology Park. The guide was excellent & had a vast knowledge of the history & the ecology of the area. She took us to many sites to tell us the ancient historical stories of the people who settled there. She was also able to find many different species of wildlife and discuss their habits. The steep walk to the top of the cliff is worth the effort as the view is spectacular. But this is not for the feint hearted as it is steep and be sure to take plenty of drinking water as there is nowhere to buy or obtain any. There is lots of walking involved in this trip and the ground is uneven in places so wear good walking shoes. But this is a great tour if you are interested in history & biology.

467862741.name: Don\'t miss when you are in Huatulco
467862741.author: a TripAdvisor user
467862741.reviewBody: Great archeological park just minutes from the resorts near Copalita. 80pesos entrance fee is very reasonable. Had planned on muddling through all the spanish information signs on our own, but once we entered the park we were approached by a man offering his guiding services. 540 pesos for 8 of us - we decided to go for it and we weren\'t disappointed. Our guide (I have forgotten his name, older gentleman with a beard) was fantastic! He not only explained about the the artifacts in the museum, but was very knowledgable about the background history. He had an answer for every question we thought to ask about the local culture, the balance of power between indigenous and Spanish, economy, mythology, etc. \n\nThe park isn\'t very large, 3 sites that are uncovered at this point. Our guide also brought along a telescope and found birds and animals for us to look at. As well, he had a lot of informtion about the local flora and lots of examples to show us. The hike to the lookout was brutally hot, but we survived. Would be nice if there was still the walk down to the beach, but natural erosion has ended that part of the tour. The paths are smooth and mostly shaded, the park is clean, the sites are interesting. It wasn\'t busy while we were there, most people were finishing up their tours as we were just starting ours. They knew to get there earlier in the day to avoid the heat! A very worthwhile excursion!

466993690.name: Nice park with good museum and archaeological sites
466993690.author: a TripAdvisor user
466993690.reviewBody: Interesting walk through the site---lots of walking---many park helpers to explain the temple and ball courts. About four sites in the park to see--then take path up to the high point and overlook the ocean

465847269.name: Amazing Site to visit
465847269.author: a TripAdvisor user
465847269.reviewBody: We were me my housband my parents of more than 70years my brother and his girlfrend of 30years. We arrive at 10,30 and the water was no so hot in febraruy, we didn\'t make any reservation but we come inside easly with a payment of 80pesos each, we didn\'t thake a guide. We start the visit from the ruins and walking trough the site easly, come up to the panoramic view easly almost was little hot, I sugest going earlyer or leter in the eavening ( the tour need tow hour not more). The panoramic view of the river coming in the ocean is amazing and sugestiv. We aprciate the walking trough this arequelogical site who sims becoming biger in the future.

460058142.name: very educational
460058142.author: a TripAdvisor user
460058142.reviewBody: this site has been presented as a recent discovery of "very old history". a very cool place to go and easy for all family members to participate. Beautiful view also

459845680.name: more to come!
459845680.author: a TripAdvisor user
459845680.reviewBody: There has been a lot of excavation of this parc, but there looks to be so much more to come. Look forward to seeing the new reveals in the years to come.

452720295.name: Small archeological ruins.
452720295.author: a TripAdvisor user
452720295.reviewBody: There is a nice museum and small archeological ruins.  There are also trails to an impressive view of the ocean and mouth of the river.  This is a good way to spend a couple of hours learning about the local history..

450845979.name: Wonderful park
450845979.author: a TripAdvisor user
450845979.reviewBody: Cornelio (a knowledgable local bird guide) was very informative while we were on a bird walk throughout the park and up to the lookout where we could see the estuary and the copalita river.  What an amazing variety of birds.

446690460.name: Nature Walk
446690460.author: a TripAdvisor user
446690460.reviewBody: We had a chance to tour the park with Cornelius, Nature Guide from little town Copalita. He pointed us a bat in the tree trunk; herons, verity of iguanas; gray pelicans; woodpecker and some other native birds. His knowledge and his powerful telescope added great level to our tour in the park. Park is well planned and easy to navigate. Great activity for everyone.

442489702.name: With Our Birding Guide Extraordinaire!
442489702.author: a TripAdvisor user
442489702.reviewBody: Amazing archeological site with easy-to-negotiate wide level walkways.  Well signed and interesting spot with the bonus feature of numerous birds present, especially if you are able to make the climb (stairs) up to look over the Bocana River below.

330403847.name: Well worth a visit
330403847.author: a TripAdvisor user
330403847.reviewBody: Love this park and the museum.  It is beautifully constructed.  The walk up to the mirador to see the mouth of the Copalita River combining with the ocean is spectacular.  Love the swamp area and spotting the iguanas.

323274280.name: We enjoyed our visit; the museum is excellent
323274280.author: a TripAdvisor user
323274280.reviewBody: Our walk through the parque was pleasant and seeing the ruins was fun. The design of the museum was beautiful and sleek and the exhibits were very good.

264066138.name: Great vistas from the jungle walk
264066138.author: a TripAdvisor user
264066138.reviewBody: A mix of nice history and pleasant walking. Some interesting artifacts in the well kept museum. Some very big trees, and interesting birds along the walk. Lots of lizards and a big black snake too! It was very quiet when we were there.

261130417.name: Impressive and Intriguing Park and Museum
261130417.author: a TripAdvisor user
261130417.reviewBody: I would definitely recommend this to people who are interested in history of indigenous cultures and also the history of Mexico in general. I was fascinated that the park wasn\'t quite finished because they are still in the process of excavating. Even so, we had a day full of hiking around the beautiful paths that lead to cliff overlooking a gorgeous view of the ocean. The paths were well-labeled and the staff was really kind and helpful. We can\'t wait to come back and experience more of the mysterious ruins!

256825351.name: A work in progress
256825351.author: a TripAdvisor user
256825351.reviewBody: This park is just a few minutes down the road from Secrets Resort. I suggest going in the morning before it gets too hot and as someone else mentioned, bring water. The site is nicely laid out with clean washrooms. You may want to bring bug spray as there are mosquitoes here. We hired a guide for 2 hours which cost $30 US. He was very well informed and interesting. The archaeological site is still being excavated and is quite large. The location is beautiful, overlooking La Bocana Beach. The guide also helps to point out some of the many animals and birds that inhabit the park. There is lots of walking involved so wear comfy shoes.

253847339.name: Best View in AREA
253847339.author: a TripAdvisor user
253847339.reviewBody: First - take water or you can buy some at the entrance. This park is very well done with clean bathrooms, ticket office and a good museum. You can also hire a guide to take you through. The park is really wonderful. They are still restoring the ruins but there are very nice and wide walkways that weave around the ruins and take you literally into the jungle. Butterflies everywhere and if you take the path to the mirador you will find (after climbing up, there is a ruin at the top--Tulum is not the only ruins that is on the ocean). It is hot so wear a hat. You won\'t believe the view. The Copalita river comes into the Pacific. The climb with lookouts is hard but well worth it.

204966248.name: Too much talk...not much info
204966248.author: a TripAdvisor user
204966248.reviewBody: I took this tour as a ship excursion rated activity level two. Much more walking than most level 2s. No seating at two of the archeological sites. Seniors with walking or standing difficulties should skip this one. \nNice museum...all info only in Spanish. No flash photos allowed, and far too dark for non flash photos. \nMuch less archeological interest than other Mexican ruins.

196070678.name: so nicely done
196070678.author: a TripAdvisor user
196070678.reviewBody: Much investment in this park makes it a first class attraction. We had an English speaking guide that made it a great experience for understanding the cultures and history of the area. Unparalleled view of the bay from the top.

190848750.name: Remarkable art museum
190848750.author: a TripAdvisor user
190848750.reviewBody: The museum building is a very nice piece of architecture, crowded with Zapotec treasures.  The grounds include a restored ballgame court and a trail to a high cliff overlooking Bocana.

151476609.name: Museum and archeological site
151476609.author: a TripAdvisor user
151476609.reviewBody: This lovely site is a little south of huatulco and is a nice change from laying on the beach.  There is a wonderful new modern building that gives you a nice perspective on ancient times in the area.  Unfortunately everything written is in Spanish.  Next walk through the woods to the various archeological sites which are still in development.  The good news is the plaques are in Spanish and English.  Next walk further to the viewpoint over the gorgeous beach.  It\'s a nice walk and fabulous view.\n\nThe entrance price is a bit high compared to other more developed sites. Approximately $10

455410466.name: Good snorkeling with Chilo
455410466.author: a TripAdvisor user
455410466.reviewBody: We had an awesome time snorkeling with Chilo, he showed us around 4 reefs and even found an octopus for us!, highly recommended experience and company. They are very serious and respectful about nature.\nWil definitely go back again with them.

441450156.name: EXCELLENT RESOURCE FOR ACTIVITIES
441450156.author: a TripAdvisor user
441450156.reviewBody: I live in Santa Cruz part time. I have fished with The Maestro Hector y El Capatain at least 14 times. They are on time, boat excellent, always go home with food. Highly recomended. Also bikes and tours.

359811277.name: CHILO is AWESOME
359811277.author: a TripAdvisor user
359811277.reviewBody: My kids and grandkids went on an excursion in January 2016  on the 10 passenger boat, I went with friends in February and once again yesterday for an all girls boating day.  Our Captain on all three occasions was CHILO.  The boat is comfortable however I would recommend no more than eight adults if planning on spending a lot of time in the boat. CHILO made sure that all of our boat trips were huge successes. I know there are no guarantees but he has found us all the Dolphins, turtles and whales our hearts desire and allows you all the time you wish for picture taking,  you can pretty much map out your day, pick a beach you want to spend time on, snorkel where you wish.  He put out fishing lines yesterday and we caught two yellow fin tuna!!!  He controls his boat very well and you feel safe. Very personable young man. When you rent your boat it is pretty much for the whole day. We left the marina at 830 and returned at 4 pm.  Don\'t forget the spirit of generosity and tip your boatman. They ensure your safety and work very hard to ensure you are happy when they return you to the marina!

667729551.name: Beach
667729551.author: a TripAdvisor user
667729551.reviewBody: Beautiful beach clear water perfect for swimming and playing in the water on a hot day. Access by boat.

658252270.name: Beautiful beach
658252270.author: a TripAdvisor user
658252270.reviewBody: Lovely isolated beach. Can only get to by boat but you can rent a covered boat with a driver for $100 to see this and a couple of other beaches. \n\nSnorkeling is distinctly mediocre if you are used to the Caribbean.  Lots of lovely fish and small sponges and urchins but the coral is unattractive and only a couple of species.

641854005.name: Stunning!
641854005.author: a TripAdvisor user
641854005.reviewBody: Had a stop on this beach while on a boat tour and totally enjoyed it. Did some snorkeling on the left side and then just enjoyed the beach. The water was amazing, so warm and crystal clear!  There were a total of 5 other people on the beach and they left not long after we got there.  Like being a castaway! Definitely recommend!  There are no facilities whatsoever so keep that in mind, take water to drink!

632154244.name: Get there early to have the beach to yourself!
632154244.author: a TripAdvisor user
632154244.reviewBody: A lovely little beach for relaxing and snorkelling. The snorkelling was better further along the coast (La India, Jiracal, San Agustin) but nonetheless for somewhere close to town this is a great little slice of paradise for a couple of hours.

565356346.name: Beautiful!
565356346.author: a TripAdvisor user
565356346.reviewBody: Twice we walked from Santa Cruz early in the morning and were the only people on the beach  - so lovely.

558602232.name: Beautiful beach covered in rubbish
558602232.author: a TripAdvisor user
558602232.reviewBody: This little beach is sensational with most access via boat, however there is a little trail down to the beach around 15 minutes long but quite a nice walk. We got down to the beach and straight away saw how much rubbish was on the beach. It was seriously sad, and our guesses were the currents dragging the rubbish in as there was only 2 others there. Bot sure if it was just that day there was rubbish however Besides the rubbish it is very nice

557829035.name: Great
557829035.author: a TripAdvisor user
557829035.reviewBody: Great snorkeling beach.  Enjoyed the time we had there.  I believe it can only be reached by boat.  Enjoyed a quiet morning here.  Hardly any people.

555739237.name: One of the best!
555739237.author: a TripAdvisor user
555739237.reviewBody: My family and I really enjoyed this beach. Great for kids and the water is amazing. Make sure you bring your snorkeling equipment.

551776013.name: Paradise
551776013.author: a TripAdvisor user
551776013.reviewBody: The best beach for snorkeling. Reef is on the side of the bay and you will see all types of fishes. Boat access only, you should bring your own food and drinks. Its a paradise and you have to swim to shore as the boat only can approach it.

475952503.name: Quiet Real Huatulco
475952503.author: a TripAdvisor user
475952503.reviewBody: This beach is a jewelry. You need to walk 10 minutes to the beach, it is pretty safe. It is not full as the other playas around, most people sees this beach in the boat tours, the rocks in the right has the image of a big Piano.Organo. The sea is strong, so go only if you really like pure nature & you have the strength to enjoy the water. The entrance seems funny because it is in the middle of the route and the trees. There is a path, not for cars really for walking in the middle of the nature to find this paradise. Go before the night come to have a nice experience.

469425172.name: My ideas of Paradise
469425172.author: a TripAdvisor user
469425172.reviewBody: This beach is quite hide and you have to walk 15min into the selva but it is a magic moment when you arrive at this paradise. Clear water few person or nobody. The place is safe but has every isolate place the best is do not go solo woman best is going in a litle grup. The entrance is etwen Entrega and Maguey on the road you can see the sign. Besos

465171255.name: Nice beach
465171255.author: a TripAdvisor user
465171255.reviewBody: The boat takes you to this beach, you can swim in the sea but it is a little deep, it is very clean, there are very nice rocks, you can take\nLots of photos, you\'re going to need a lot of sunscreen because there are no restaurants, there are no umbrellas but the experience in pretty,\nTo spend more time in the sea there are other more calm as the bay of santa cruz,

443187158.name: stopped here on snorkel excursion - very nice
443187158.author: a TripAdvisor user
443187158.reviewBody: This was our snorkeling stop on our bay excursion.  It\'s very pretty.  We swam from the boat into a roped off area, and stayed with our guide and 4 other couples to snorkel for an hour.  It was great.... clear water and lots to see, although it consists of rocks and not coral like at Las Brisas were we stayed, so it wasn\'t as good snorkeling as there.

353122162.name: beautiful day of snorkeling and swimming ,
353122162.author: a TripAdvisor user
353122162.reviewBody: gorgeous beach .. but make sure you go with a local ... it is a private beach .. locals families spend time here.. be respectful.. remember where you are .

347428968.name: CRIMINALS RULE !!!!!
347428968.author: a TripAdvisor user
347428968.reviewBody: Today, Saturday February 13, 2015, we were a group of 7 strong young athletic men and women, we were robbed at gunpoint by 3 masked banditos as we were exiting the beach at 2 PM. We feared for our lives, they were scared and desperate, they had 2 large caliber guns and a machete, we were powerless to do anything. After they had taken what they wanted, they fled on foot into the jungle.  The State Police were summoned, but they were pretty well useless in communicating with us, (and we could not effectively communicate with them in Spanish) as none of the 18 male & female police officers spoke English. DO NOT WALK IN TO ORGANO BEACH, EVER!

344738454.name: Great Beach
344738454.author: a TripAdvisor user
344738454.reviewBody: Another one of Hualtulco\'s hidden gems and there are a number of them. We arrived by boat, and the beach was empty. It is a beautiful spot

334834315.name: Lovely bay for snorkeling and golden sand beach
334834315.author: a TripAdvisor user
334834315.reviewBody: We took a trip to the Federal Park and stopped at Playa Organo. This bay offers great snorkeling along the sides. The water is turquoise and clean and the beach golden/white and clean.

334223101.name: Truly secluded beach
334223101.author: a TripAdvisor user
334223101.reviewBody: This was the most beautiful small beach of the ones in Huatulco, IF you are interested in nature and willing to walk about 20 minutes through the jungle along an ATV trail. The cab driver dropped us of at the trailhead. On the trail we found the shed skin of a very large snake (the snake himself was nowhere to be seen), a small tarantula, and grouse-like birds. There is plenty of shade in the cliffs and under the trees. A coatimundi came to examine what we had brought, and took a banana we offered him. The beach has no infrastructure at all, so make sure to bring plenty of water and food. There are park attendants who pick up garbage, but they leave at about 3 pm and after that the beach and trail are totally deserted. The one drawback of that is a possibility of an unpleasant encounter with a mugger on the trail, so either leave just before the attendants and ask them to ride behind you (or in front of you, if you don\'t mind the exhaust fumes), or travel in a larger group. Or, hire a little boat to come to this beach.

665161134.name: A great place to visit!
665161134.author: a TripAdvisor user
665161134.reviewBody: We enjoyed several hours here - in the museum, wandering the interesting ruins and, particularly, sitting by the lake and watching the birds and iguanas in the trees. It is mainly good for wheelchairs, tho\' there are some areas I could not access and it was a little bumpy under foot (or wheels!). This place is certainly worth a visit.

itemReviewed.name: Bocana del Rio Copalita Archaeological Zone

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Benito Juarez, near Playa La Bocana and the Copalita River

655274489.name: Archeology and biology
655274489.author: a TripAdvisor user
655274489.reviewBody: Copalita is a small archeological site with four structures partly excavated. My favourite, that is seen in almost all meso American ruins, is the ball court. It is also the most intact.\nBut the real treat, and I am not a bird watcher, is on a small offshoot trail that takes you to a pond and then the river. If you stand quietly on the pond\u2019s edge you will see all kinds of wildlife and especially birds, from hummingbirds to egrets to hawks. It seems to be a spot where they rest. And the iguanas hang out high in the trees there.\nThe other treat is at the end of the trail. You are on a high cliff, where the sacrifices were made to the gods of the sun and the sea. You have a wonderful view of the ocean, the beach below and the river with its riparian forest. You can understand why the sun and sea gods were acknowledged in this place.

itemReviewed.name: Bocana del Rio Copalita Archaeological Zone

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Benito Juarez, near Playa La Bocana and the Copalita River

652978218.name: Back in Time!
652978218.author: a TripAdvisor user
652978218.reviewBody: We did a self guided tour and found that the outside signage was all translated into English and easy to follow.  However, the signage in the museum itself is Spanish only!  Take your translator.  The walk through the site was interesting and takes you back in time.  Work in Progress.

itemReviewed.name: Bocana del Rio Copalita Archaeological Zone

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Benito Juarez, near Playa La Bocana and the Copalita River

584326318.name: amazing views, hot hike
584326318.author: a TripAdvisor user
584326318.reviewBody: We arrived mid day and paid 80 pesos each for entrance. It was a beautiful park with both english and spanish placards (except for in the museum which is only spanish) and the hike was moderately difficult (made much more difficult by going in the heat of the day) We saw a LOT of cool animals and plants since we did both legs of the route, and the historical sites are neat- but a small part of the trip. the historical sites are shaded, but the hike is mostly sun.  the hike is really where you\'re going to spend the most time. Wear cool clothing, get some bug spray or a bug wrist band (that worked well for us), slap on some suntan lotion and get to walking. Tip- go early in the morning before it gets crazy hot, wear walking or hiking shoes, a hat and sunglasses, remember to hydrate (bring your own BIG water) and take lots of pictures.

itemReviewed.name: Bocana del Rio Copalita Archaeological Zone

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Benito Juarez, near Playa La Bocana and the Copalita River

560138954.name: Not many ruins, but nice natural views
560138954.author: a TripAdvisor user
560138954.reviewBody:
Took a taxi here from La Crucecita (approx. 100 pesos each way) and toured the site on my own. In all, I was there about 2 hours. In hindsight, I could have benefitted from a tour guide, but I enjoyed the place nonetheless. 

The ruins themselves were not extraordinary — don’t expect to see Chichen Itza here — but I understand the site is still being worked on and other ruins could be uncovered in the future. There is a museum containing a number of artefacts — this is where the tour would have come in handy, as all the signage was in Spanish. 

Copalita is also an ecological park, and that part was pretty neat. Walked through forests, saw the river and took in a nice view of the ocean.

itemReviewed.name: Bocana del Rio Copalita Archaeological Zone

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Benito Juarez, near Playa La Bocana and the Copalita River

555894072.name: Small Site, Beautiful setting
555894072.author: a TripAdvisor user
555894072.reviewBody:
For those who have seen such impressive precolumbian sites such as Monte Alban, Teotihuacan, Chichen Itza, Palenque etc, the excavations at Cobalita will be rather anti climactic.  It is a very small site with very few of of the structures excavated and restored.  It is well worth visiting however.

One of the few cities located on the coast, some archeologists believe Cobalita was an important stop for trading vessels heading along the coast.  It is believed that it was inhabited by the Chantal people who may have been linguistically related to the Maya.
